677220828.name: Amazing!
677220828.author: a TripAdvisor user
677220828.reviewBody: Holy pants! This might have been the best zoo I\'ve ever been to. We didn\'t come to Mexico for the zoo, but we\'re glad we checked this out. We got tickets from the office in the NW corner of the Zocalo (one weird issue: they only take cash at this ticket office; they\'re happy to take your tarjeta de credito at the park), and ended up having the van to ourselves. The driver was nervous that we didn\'t speak much Spanish, but was friendly and spoke slowly and I was able to understand 90% of it with my rudimentary language skills. The van took us through the safari park, driving us so close to the animals that we could almost touch them. All the animals seemed well cared for. Then we had a few hours to get lunch (decent pizza) and do a walking part of the zoo, which was also well done, followed by a fun bird show. Highly recommended.

673336280.name: The Safari was awesome and our Ilya guide was great!
673336280.author: a TripAdvisor user
673336280.reviewBody: We were picked up in Puebla and got to ride on the cutest but that was fully decorated for the tour. During the tour our guide, Ilya, was so knowledgeable and we had so much fun learning about the animals.  The animals were so active and you could see them all interacting with each other not just laying around like is usually seen at zoos.  They seemed happy to be in their environment.  It was also awesome to see how they set up different regions of the park based on the locations the animals can be found within the world.  I highly recommend this adventure and our awesome guide Ilya!

669164209.name: Amazing place
669164209.author: a TripAdvisor user
669164209.reviewBody: I love it, it\u2019s all that you need to know, the guide, the weather, the place... all was excellent...

665815573.name: It was good
665815573.author: a TripAdvisor user
665815573.reviewBody: It was the best calls  it had the best animals\nIt was great the bus was clean the dude who gav use the info was the best i forgot his name

665388044.name: Kids love it
665388044.author: a TripAdvisor user
665388044.reviewBody: This place is always a highlight when coming to Puebla. Especially my 6 year old son loves the animals and the setting. Also I must admit that the landscape can actually do for a proper safari in Southern Africa.

665135729.name: Superb Zoo Excursion in Puebla
665135729.author: a TripAdvisor user
665135729.reviewBody:
My husband & I visited the city of Puebla back in March.

Right in the center of the town (El Zocalo) you can find the buses that take you on a day filled eye pooping excursion to the Africam Safari zoo.  About a 25-30 minute drive to zoo.

Pending on company you choose with (TIP tours & DMC) admission and transportation is about $375 pesos per adult. 

Our tour guide from the Africam Zoo was Chema a true gem.  He was friendly, and of course knowledgeable.  The tour with Chema on the bus throughout the zoo lasted about 1 hour.

You finally arrive to the last point where your allowed a few hours to yourself.  This is a great spot to eat, shop for souvenirs, check out more lovely animals.  Such as the kangaroos, butterfly exhibit, and astonishing avian show.

Highly recommend a visit to Africam Zoo in Puebla, you won’t be disappointed.  Cost effective, entire trip spans about 6 hours , and it’s an experience of a lifetime.

664074977.name: loved the place
664074977.author: a TripAdvisor user
664074977.reviewBody: one of the best maintained zoos we have ever visited. the animals seem well treated and in a way it feels like a real safari\n

663336527.name: Safari in Mexico
663336527.author: a TripAdvisor user
663336527.reviewBody: This safari is in a very large park, 30 minutes from the historical center of Puebla. There are many several to around walk to, as well as a guided bus tour. There are many opportunities to get near to the animals, as well as photo-ops. Having never been to Africa for a safari, I imagine this being as close to a "real" safari as you can get, in an enclosed area. Marco was an enthusiastic and friendly tour guide, and graciously provided English translation for the 3 Americans on the bus full of Spanish-speaking tourists.

660588930.name: Africam Safari
660588930.author: a TripAdvisor user
660588930.reviewBody: Amazing tour, excelent guide, great place to go. The animals are in perfect conditions and the facilities are good.

657944684.name: Love it!!
657944684.author: a TripAdvisor user
657944684.reviewBody: We have an amazing time last week we have the opportunity to visit African Safari. Friendly staff clean bathroom. We love it

657898561.name: In Puebla learning Espanol
657898561.author: a TripAdvisor user
657898561.reviewBody: This is an environmentally mindful safari experience. Must see when in Puebla ... best on a weekday as no crowds!

653535416.name: Una experiencia inolvidable - an unforgettable experience
653535416.author: a TripAdvisor user
653535416.reviewBody:
If you are in Puebla, you HAVE to take a day to visit Africam Safari. It was one of the best experiences I’ve ever had. First, take an Uber from Puebla for less than 10 US dollars. Once you arrive, say you’re interested in an experience. (I called ahead because of my ability to speak Spanish fluently, but it’s up to you!) An experience is 1,500 pesos (75 USD) per person but includes a private guide, safari hat & water bottle, entrance to the park, ANDDDDD feeding giraffes. You can do the experience in English or Spanish, and there are options such as feeding lemurs or rhinos too. We did it in English, and our guide Checo was incredible. He took about 50 pictures of us feeding the giraffes so we have incredible photos forever. We fed the giraffe for about 20-30 minutes on a private Jeep, where we could ask questions and just enjoy the awesome experience. Then we did a mini tour with elephants, zebras, and more with Checo. We went into this tunnel and were a couple FEET away from elephants. Checo was incredible. 

After that, the safari is in two parts: walking & safari bus. We walked around and saw birds, Jaguars, kangaroos, and more. Then, we did the bus safari tour with Cristian, who was excellent. 

However, we missed the 3pm tour and one of the park workers drove us in a separate Jeep to catch up with them. 

Overall, an incredible experience!!!

653387209.name: Great Experience for everyone....
653387209.author: a TripAdvisor user
653387209.reviewBody: This is an open air zoo with some interesting extras, a must see if you are in Puebla! By car or by bus it is a in your face experience, some of these animals are so impresive. Highly recommend the tour,....\n

651141814.name: Great
651141814.author: a TripAdvisor user
651141814.reviewBody: I really enjoyed my day here, it is a fantastic experience that I recommend. The animals appeared well fed and in good conditions I took the bus tour on Thursday and we saw a bunch of them I really recommend it \nPlus the tunnel for the tigers blowed my mind!\n

649704186.name: Amazing!
649704186.author: a TripAdvisor user
649704186.reviewBody: Amazing trip, amazing guide named Renato, incredible animals to see! You could see animals that are close to extinction. It an incredible experience!

649007030.name: Checo & Dianna zoo guides were AMAZING!
649007030.author: a TripAdvisor user
649007030.reviewBody: Rhino & Giraffe private excursion. Checo & Dianna were FANTASTIC. They truly took their time, allowing us an hour or so at each excursion. Complimentary gifts and water, they were so knowledgeable about all the animals. I can\'t say enough about how great of an experience this was for our family. Well worth the cost.\nWe arrived at 10, and hired a taxi to drive us through the park (all day, $50). This allowed us to take our time with each stop but missed the informative talks. If I could do it again, I would hire Checo to give us a private tour of the entire park for the day. Such a professional and kindness, paying attention to every detail. Thank you again!! Till next time. Don\'s miss the bird show--times at park are different than website. Most taxi\'s in Puebla and happy to drive you there and have you hire them out for the day. Private car is def. the way to go. The best? Private tour by Checo. Ask for him by name! Thank you, CHECO!!

646872822.name: AfriCam - A wonderful day of discovery
646872822.author: a TripAdvisor user
646872822.reviewBody: On the outskirts of the quaint city of Puebla is an outdoor safari. We spent the better part of the day with guides throughout the park. Checo did a great job taking us to see the animals up close. All of our guides, including Noemi and Joe were very knowledgeable and easy to understand in English and of course Spanish. The place has so many facets and is not just a ride in the park. Wish I was a child again to enjoy the Adventure Zone. The bird show was fun with audience participation. The wide range of animals are well cared for and seem at peace, with habitats specific for their species with plenty of room to roam free. Well worth the drive down from Mexico City but plan on a day in Puebla as well. Enjoy!

645869684.name: What a place on Earth!
645869684.author: a TripAdvisor user
645869684.reviewBody: The best conservation center in Latin America.. by far! A day well spent surrounded by nature and at a great and affordable rate.

643843445.name: Gu\u00eda Miranda is the best
643843445.author: a TripAdvisor user
643843445.reviewBody: Not your standard zoo! This is as close to a Safari experience as you can get outside of Africa. Better to come with your own vehicle, especially with little kids. The park busses are not very nice, and dont have A/C. Also there\'s a couple stops to see lions and hippos and the bus doesn\'t give you time to enjoy. Overall super worthwhile if you\'re in Puebla. Def build it into your itinerary. Ask for Miranda!

642276868.name: Safari
642276868.author: a TripAdvisor user
642276868.reviewBody:
Oh yea
Bisons
Lions
Giraffes
Elephants
Monkeys
Bats
Ducks
Zebras
Wolves
Bears
You will see all of noah's ark
Except the kangooroos as their area is under renovation right now (dec 18).
This is well organized, quite safe. We had a great time. Spent only 4 hours in there but you can easily spend the day.

637542604.name: Vacations
637542604.author: a TripAdvisor user
637542604.reviewBody: Wonderful place I recommend this beautiful place!!!!! I came with my wife my mother and my brother if is excellent!!!!!

637041189.name: One of the best things to do in Puebla
637041189.author: a TripAdvisor user
637041189.reviewBody: With more than 45 years of existing, the Africam Safari is one of the best things to do in Puebla in any visit, is amazing to see all of those animals living happily in the safari (they look more thank well taken care of) and be able to be so close with nature. The birds show is also a must, with many trained birds and excellent trainers like Carlos, who make the experience really fun and give a lot of insight about the species.

635933162.name: Africam Safari, best experience ever!
635933162.author: a TripAdvisor user
635933162.reviewBody: Great warm attention by our tour guide Cristey. She surely knows how to make you feel welcome. The park is really wonderful and the animals are very well taken care of. It was so exciting to be able to see them that close and safely for both the animals and ourselves. My niece and I had a wonderful time.

635370197.name: Great experience - experiencia inolvidable
635370197.author: a TripAdvisor user
635370197.reviewBody:
Excelente, vale la pena ir totalmente. El precio por el boleto sencillo es excelente, los animales están súper bien cuidados y andan libres en cada sección. Recomiendo ir en coche propio si se tiene la oportunidad. Y el costo por una experiencia es alto, pero definitivamente vale la pena, es algo único. 
Nosotros fuimos con experiencia de jirafas y lémures.

- simply amazing, totally worth it. This is a must-go if you are visiting Puebla, you’ll not find here in Mexico another with this quality and care for the animals. They’re free to walk, cross and do whatever they want in the section you are crossing and always is personal around for your safety. If you can pay an upgraded experience it’s totally worth it, we choose two packages and we’re able to feed and pet giraffes and lemurs.

635101760.name: Highly Recommend Turibus Tour
635101760.author: a TripAdvisor user
635101760.reviewBody: The tour bus leaves from El Z\u00f3calo in the historic center for Puebla. The guide we were lucky enough to have as our driver, has been working the tour for 10 years. He knew all the details about the safari and the animals that inhabit it. It is the largest animal safari/sanctuary in Latin America. You can really notice the love and care all the staff and the founder have for this place. The bird show was lit and hilarious. Maybe learn some Spanish so it can be a bit mote appreciated

632923432.name: Bird Show
632923432.author: a TripAdvisor user
632923432.reviewBody: The African safari it\u2019s a MUST at ciudad puebla it is amazing the animals are  the bird show is great you learn a lot and the show members are awesome and entertaining ALL shows are beyond awesome I recommend this place.\n\nDiana

621060323.name: Least expected
621060323.author: a TripAdvisor user
621060323.reviewBody: The area of the Safari is so huge, however not many wild animals can be spotted during the tour. With the area as huge as the one in Puebla, it can be far better than the one in South Africa. A great place for kids and also babies. Take a chance to feed the animals, but you have to pay an extra 5000pesos.

620874106.name: Really nice way to spend half a day
620874106.author: a TripAdvisor user
620874106.reviewBody: Some friends and I are visiting Puebla for a wedding, and heard about the nearby safari. We decided to give it a go and had a really great time. We splurged (almost $100) for a private jeep ride with an English-speaking tour guide, and it was well worth it! Robert was awesome... friendly, funny, and very knowledgeable about the park and animals in general. We had some great experiences along the way including feeding parakeets, posing with parrots, seeing baby elephants, and being chased by a horny kangaroo! (Poor guy is the only male around!) We were there for about 4 hours, plus one for lunch. I highly recommend a visit here if your travels bring you to this part of Mexico.

616241975.name: Amazing, animals well kept, all the family will enjoy it
616241975.author: a TripAdvisor user
616241975.reviewBody: Very close to Mexico city, in Puebla you can find this amazing zoo, where you can see the animals roam free from your car. There are special attractions in which you can feed lemurs, rhinos or giraffes (at an additional cost). It is a beautiful place and the animals are very well kept. If you go with children you will enjoy it very much. All the family will enjoy it.

611736866.name: Perfect day at the Africam Safari
611736866.author: a TripAdvisor user
611736866.reviewBody:
Great experience, definitely a must do with family while visiting Puebla. 

We are a family with 3 children, 7Yr, 5Yr and a baby 1yr. 

We did the Rhino experience, and it’s was just so magical for all of us, specially the kids, they got to be so close to giraffes, and the most impressive was that we fed the Rhino, touched him, it’s a first time for all of us, so for sure a life experience. 

Thanks to Checo and Paloma who made this experience amazing.

607514985.name: Someone who takes care of our animals
607514985.author: a TripAdvisor user
607514985.reviewBody:
Visiting zoos in Mexico is sometimes a sad picture, but this park really shows that it is also possible to make it good.

We have been very much impressed about the animals and how they live.
Viviana (Viví) explained us everything about the animals. Additional question were answered in a very good way, even for children.

Animals who need special care after rescued is perfect.

Keep it up!

Muchos saludos desde Pekín

606854152.name: Nature at your hand
606854152.author: a TripAdvisor user
606854152.reviewBody: Great environmental attraction, including a lot of exotic animals, very interesting and enjoyable, \nOne of the best in Mexico and certainly my favorite one.

600861135.name: Excellent zoo.
600861135.author: a TripAdvisor user
600861135.reviewBody:
We really enjoyed this zoo. 
You can go in your own car or you can rent a special car for the tour.
We spend like 4 ours inside the zoo watching the animals, the stores, restaurants and the birds show. Last one is not that good.
45 min. From Puebla Centro. 
Water price is the double, so it's better you bring youre own.

598649919.name: Africam Safari 2018
598649919.author: a TripAdvisor user
598649919.reviewBody: Great experience !!Thanks to our tour guide RENATO \ud83d\udc4cVery informative for our kids.  Gives you a better understanding of nature & motivates you to take care of our environment

596782362.name: Safari in Mexico
596782362.author: a TripAdvisor user
596782362.reviewBody: We had visitors and we decided to take them to the Mexican Safari. We all were positively surprised. To be so near to all the animals and what a surprise there were rhinos and even a white one. But not only African animals can be seen, also animals from other continents. It was a great outing.

592240873.name: On safari in Puebla MX
592240873.author: a TripAdvisor user
592240873.reviewBody: We weren\'t sure what to expect. Caught an Uber to the park and paid extra to have a personal guided tour.\nOur guide Roberto did an amazing job driving us through the park in a Landrover that looked like it was right out of Jurassic Park. Roberto personalized the experience and made for an amazing day. Worth every penny. Excellent Enhlish guide - ask for him by name.

590029105.name: Excellent place for a family visit.
590029105.author: a TripAdvisor user
590029105.reviewBody: I loved my visit to African Safari.  Very clean and an excellent guide named Cris. The animals are kept in good condition.

589234633.name: The best!!
589234633.author: a TripAdvisor user
589234633.reviewBody: By far the best zoo we have visited in years! Our guide Robert was the greatest he had a very detailed explanation for everything surrounding us we had the greatest tour on the 4x4 truck everything was just beyond amazing he made sure we had the best time and I am glad we got to have this amazing experience with this fun and knowledgeable guide 5 stars to him and this amazing place! Will for sure be visiting again

581824397.name: Don\'t go by bus!
581824397.author: a TripAdvisor user
581824397.reviewBody: Although I never thought I would see wild animals in Mexico instead of Africa, the experience was OK, but not terrific. First of all, I took a "tourist bus" and it was absolutely awful. I am not 100% sure, but it appears that the Puebla Bureau of Tourism contracts out these buses. The driver of my bus refused to use the air-conditioning and the windows did not open. Thus the trip there and back was in sweltering heat. Also, whichever side of the bus you sit on, it is a guarantee that the people on the other side will thoughtlessly stand, effectively blocking your view. I am not even positive that the animals are truly wild since the staff walked among them, seemingly unworried about being trampled or mauled by "wild" animals. So, in my opinion if you go, do so in a private vehicle where you can see from both sides of the car or van. Otherwise, save your money and watch the animals on the Discovery Channel!

576599398.name: Fun for the kids
576599398.author: a TripAdvisor user
576599398.reviewBody: The africam safari is a great place if your kids love animals. You stay in your own car and drive the safari route and see the animals. They don\u2019t come close to the car or anything and you can\u2019t feed them, but you can take good pictures. After the drive, you get out of the car and there are more animals to see (like a regular zoo) and there are a few activities for kids. Take hats and sunscreen if it\u2019s sunny because the part where you walk is pretty long. In general a good activity for our young kids.

575688337.name: Animal lovers paradise
575688337.author: a TripAdvisor user
575688337.reviewBody: This is really well laid out and managed and provides up close access to a fascinating array of species. Me and my family loved every minute of it. I saw a tapir in the flesh for the first time in my life and highlights were many, giraffes, bear, white tigers and so it goes on. The so called "Mombassa" area provides a good range of drinks and snacks to take a break before resuming your adventure. We also took the ride on a launch around the extensive lakes within the complex. We\'ll certainly be going again, we didn\'t have time to check out the adventure area.

573470399.name: Well organized and great fun for kids
573470399.author: a TripAdvisor user
573470399.reviewBody: I have heard about this place but it was loads better than we expected. They have Elephants with little babies, zebras, lions panthers leopards zangaroos and a great bat enclosure. Its set up really well so you can see the cats very close up. You can sit on a jeep with a glass wall built around it and the lionesses are 30 cms away from you. Its extraordinary to see them so close. Kids can climb through a reinforced glass tunnel in the panther and leopards enclosure which my kids loved. We took a spin on a boat around the reservoir which was refreshing and we enjoyed the big slide. Good wood fired pizza restaurant too. We will take my family when they visit next from Canada.

572191146.name: Feeding a Rhino Once in A Life Time
572191146.author: a TripAdvisor user
572191146.reviewBody:
My kids will never forget this experience. We paid for an experience you get three choices- To feed Lemurs, To feed Giraffes, or To feed a Rhino. We picked the rhino and were not disappointed. First, you get to hop on a VIP jeep that can hold 9-12 adults. You are taken to a special area where you are asked to wash hands but then we were given silk bandanas. After that, you are taken to the enclosure and you get to feed the rhino. The entire time you are given so much information from the guides and they take pictures the whole time. In the end, you are brought back to the VIP area, asked to wash your hands again, and given a water bottle with USB of the best photos and videos taken. 

The safari was amazing and all the animals were so close. We took my 5 and 3-year-old and they were entertained the whole time. Two nights later my 3 years old facetime his uncle and told him all about it. After my 3-year-old went to the other room my brother remarked: "that is the most he has ever talked to me." To say my son loved it would be an understatement. 

Some Tips:
1.) Don't pre-purchase your tickets buying them there makes for a lot less confusion. 
2.) The experiences are pricey but worth it!
3.) Bring a Cooler full of drinks, snacks, and even lunch if you want. You are in the car almost 90% of the time and a cooler fool of goodies would have been amazing. There are plenty of stops to grab some snacks and drinks just would be nice to have the cooler
4.) Take your time. You get to go at your pace and almost everywhere is two lanes so if some people are impatient to let them pass enjoy yourself. 
5.) At the end, there is an adventure park budget 100-200 pesos for. There are zip lines, bouncy slides, pictures with pythons or llamas. Each little station cost 15-100 pesos but are a lot of fun.

572040040.name: Guarantee of Adventure
572040040.author: a TripAdvisor user
572040040.reviewBody:
Africam Safari can be as fun as you want!

There are lot of choices to visit this place: You can use your own (or rent a) car, book a bus tour over the internet (which was the option we chose) or what I think is the best option... 

Find a way to arrive Africam Safari and take the bus the park offers. This bus offers a really cool and experienced guide that helps you enjoy even more the safari.

During the walking-section be sure to visit the Bird Show (arrive early to get the best seat, at the middle to appreciate the birds even more) an take a look to the last sections of the park.

569401872.name: Nice attraction
569401872.author: a TripAdvisor user
569401872.reviewBody: I think this is a must visit attraction, it\u2019s only in its kind in mexico, but it has a lot of potential to make it better so I think the prices must increase in order to make it better.

566374915.name: Very nice and kid friendly
566374915.author: a TripAdvisor user
566374915.reviewBody:
Pros
1. Very nice experience. 
2. Kids loved it. 
3. lot of good species of animals.

Cons
1. The entry line was very huge. Not sure what they can do for that. But they seriously will have to do some thing about that. 

Tips:
1. Go Early

565810127.name: Nice experience - skip the restaurant
565810127.author: a TripAdvisor user
565810127.reviewBody: It\'s worth visiting with young children.\nThe animals are well kept, though sometimes some looked over fed. It\'s a day visit, better to start in the morning, take some sandwiches with you, leave for a late lunch outside.

563437440.name: Very nice zoo!
563437440.author: a TripAdvisor user
563437440.reviewBody: This is one of those obligated places to take your kids. It is very enjoyable and it\'s whole experience by itself. Just watching the wild life in front of you it\'s priceless.

562832832.name: Wonderful Zoo
562832832.author: a TripAdvisor user
562832832.reviewBody: One of the best Zoos in Latin America \nDrive along an open area surrounded by giraffes, ostriches, lions, rhinoceros, and more!\nWalk through the marsupials area and learn about this cute animals

555883839.name: Nice place to kniw but expensive
555883839.author: a TripAdvisor user
555883839.reviewBody: This is a place that I like very much but I consider it expensive. Inside food and drinks are also expensive so you have to consider it when going there.\nAlso take into consideration that this is one of the best zoos in Mexico and offers summer camps for kids although those are also expensive.

554831596.name: Children will enjoy!
554831596.author: a TripAdvisor user
554831596.reviewBody: It is nice.An open Zoo, where you see lot of wild animal in the open.It is better if you go on your own car.As the tours may spend almost half day in there.And if you don\'t want to spend a lot of time inside, you can leave early, if you have own transportation.

551775148.name: Fun Adventure
551775148.author: a TripAdvisor user
551775148.reviewBody: Extraordinary place. This zoo in Puebla was two \ud83d\udc4d\ud83c\udffd\ud83d\udc4d\ud83c\udffdup. Highly recommended, your kids will thank you \ud83d\ude0a and best of all, they will enjoy it the most!

550741798.name: Beautiful
550741798.author: a TripAdvisor user
550741798.reviewBody: This is a beautiful place with tons of amazing animals. I saw baby elephant and they help to preserve species from all around the world.

546449313.name: Amazing Day - You must try to the Lemur Exclusive Experience!
546449313.author: a TripAdvisor user
546449313.reviewBody:
While researching Puebla, I kept reading about Africam Safari.  As someone who loves wildlife, I knew that I wanted to visit here.  What an incredible place!  Huge habitats - the largest that I have ever seen at any zoo or animal sanctuary anywhere in the world.  Every staff member that we met seemed happy and genuinely invested in the mission of Africam Safari.   

As part of our visit, we chose to participate in the Lemur Exclusive Experience.  Prior to our arrival, I spoke with Daniela and she assisted me in arranging this request.  Daniela was excellent and gave me a great first impression of Africam Safari - even before I arrived. 

The Lemur Exclusive Experience was incredible!  Cecco, our guide for the exclusive experience, was phenomenal.  Cecco was professional, friendly, knowledgeable, and seemed genuinely invested in ensuring that we had a great visit to Africam Safari.  I really cannot say enough good things about Cecco and the Lemur Exclusive Experience at Africam Safari.  Highly recommended!

539853178.name: Fantastic place
539853178.author: a TripAdvisor user
539853178.reviewBody: I love this place, the largest open zoo in Latin America, with animals running freen in large dignifying spaces.

539678660.name: Must go with children
539678660.author: a TripAdvisor user
539678660.reviewBody: Very good organized safari park. We enjoyed it the whole family. Very close to animals. Children just love it

536976422.name: A wonderful memorable experience
536976422.author: a TripAdvisor user
536976422.reviewBody: This is an amazing attraction. The first part of the park is seen either in car or park bus. It felt like the animals were loose, and we were confined. For example, cars stopped as animals crossed the road to get where they wanted to be. The animals sometimes approached your car, so you could take pictures, if you so desired. For us, the vehicle part of the tour lasted a good two hours. There is a huge variety of animals in the park. I especially liked the anteaters and cappaberra, things I have rarely seen. Many animals had babies, for example, elephants, rhinos, and all sorts of hoofed stock. Then, you park and walk to see other creatures. That is when I saw the little rhino. Afterwards, we stopped at the park\u2019s delicious reasonable Mexican restaurant. Later, we did the walking tour. We were able to feed parakeets, and a small kangaroo!  He was free to be with people or walk over to where the other kangaroos were. \nBy that time, I was getting tired so we didn\u2019t go to see the bats, aviary or butterfly exhibit. \nThe Park is immaculate, although not artificial. The animals all looked very healthy. The staff was there to help you, but, most importantly to protect the animals. You could easily spend six hours there. If you love animals, do not miss this. It is way better than any animal park I have visited, except in Africa, of course.

531795887.name: One of its kind!
531795887.author: a TripAdvisor user
531795887.reviewBody: This is a "must" visit while in Puebla if you have kids.\nClose encounter with cage free animals. Very nice setting with a great animal collection.\n

530057996.name: A zoo where the audience is on cages instead of the animas! so awesome!
530057996.author: a TripAdvisor user
530057996.reviewBody: It\u00b4s been a while , since I went to this place, but I remember perfectly the singular and great idea where the animals are totally FREE, and the persons that visit them go, either on own car, or on a bus provided by this Zoo, it\u00b4s amazing watching tigers, lions, monkeys stepping up in the window or front of the car.. and so many beautiful animals, this is a totally respect to this animals, that is why I simply loved it!! #zazshares

522697369.name: A different view on how animals are treated.
522697369.author: a TripAdvisor user
522697369.reviewBody: Animals here per se are more "free" to roam in their made up habitat . It tends to be hot so wear sunscreen and a good hat. Unless you plan to take a souvenir home with the park logo hat take one from home. Good walking shoes as part of the trail is done walking/driving.

514874101.name: Mixed feelings about this tour
514874101.author: a TripAdvisor user
514874101.reviewBody: Well this tour is very well organized and set up! The kids loved it as they could be very close to e animals and it\'s basically impossible not to see the various species of animals. We went with a rented car and that I think is the best way to go as you go at your own peace and can stop as much and often as you won\'t as long as you leave the park by 5 pm.\nOn the other hand I have the feeling that the space provided to the animals is way too small, this is more like a big drive through zoo! They have no where to escape, meaning if they are not in the mood to be around tourists they cannot escape, I guess that must add a lot of stress to the animals. So it\'s called a safari and we were excited about it, but we left by feeling sorry for the animals, a true nature lover understands that in a real safari you may or may not make the encounter of a life time and that is the kick I\'m looking for...here the thrill is taken away by the fact that the encounter is guaranteed as it is in a zoo!

511156973.name: A real African Safari experience in Mexico!
511156973.author: a TripAdvisor user
511156973.reviewBody: This place is not a traditional zoo!  It is a conservation park where the animals roam free! It is absolutely a must see when visiting Puebla.  The exhibits resemble their natural habitats, the collection of animals is amazing!  During the drive through you see giraffes, antelopes, monkeys, llamas, white tigers, lions,  Asian elephants as well as a large group of African elephants, including a brand new baby born at Africam Safari this year!  \nTheir main focus is animal conservation as well as education and environmental protection.  They lead numerous research projects and programs to protect endangered species and reintroduce them to their habitat.  \nThis is a place worth visiting and spending all day!!

506615551.name: Great safari and zoo
506615551.author: a TripAdvisor user
506615551.reviewBody: We took the tour bus on the safari and were able to see many animals. There were some rare ones such as tapirs and white tigers that you could see easily. There was no a.c. on the bus so it was a little warm at times but never unbearable. At the end of the safari, you stop in front of a zoo you can walk around. There are also a couple of restaurants and kid attractions you can pay extra for. I really enjoyed the Amazon section. It had some Pudus walking around freely and an awesome cave.

504881727.name: Great Zoo
504881727.author: a TripAdvisor user
504881727.reviewBody: I never like to see an animal in cages, thats why I love this great Zoo because the try to create their own habitat, and you can see the animals freely, you only have to be careful with horn of the car I really recommend this zoo

504274207.name: So FUN and amazing grounds - Well cared for animals - Not just for kids!
504274207.author: a TripAdvisor user
504274207.reviewBody:
We took this trip just prior to leaving Puebla. It was a little interesting drive to get there but with GPS all is easy. We had read that the park could take about 3.5 hours. We were there almost 5 hours and enjoyed every moment. I suggest going a little earlier in the day and being rested. Even though you drive through in your car, there are 3 different places in which you get out of your car to either use a restroom, get a snack, or wander around a little. The park is laid out really well and well taken care of. Lots of wildlife to see. At the end of the park is an "Adventure Park". We almost didn't go but we are sure glad we did. We thought it was just more food and zip lining but there were also animals to see. Lots of walking and some better eating restaurants in this location. 
Just a suggestion, because we thought it was a 3.5 hour day trip and all in the car  we had gone to the Mexican Revolution Museum and walked around the Zocolo earlier in the day. To do all the walking necessary to explore this amazing place was challenging because we were already a little tired.

Well worth the trip!

502551852.name: Come and meet the new baby elephant!
502551852.author: a TripAdvisor user
502551852.reviewBody: We came to visit the new born elephant, it was quite exciting and it is nice to be in a place where the wild life is taken care of.   Definitively perfect for youngsters from 6-15 year old. I strongly recommend to leave your car in the parking lot and take the bus. Same price but here you have a nice guide that explains everything (most of it in Spanish but you can ask for an English-speaking guide). Not bad for a powder-full safari experience. Environmentally friendly and nice time. My only minor complaint was the price of food, quite expensive may I say.

501589304.name: Unlike any zoo you\'ve been too!
501589304.author: a TripAdvisor user
501589304.reviewBody:
Africam Safari is very unique. I've never been to Africa, but they did a gear job making me feel like I was there! 

You drive through the park in your own vehicle looking at animals as you go. The animals roam free, so at times you have to stop for giraffes and zebras as they cross the road!

They even have an area with tigers that roam free that you can enter! You have to pass through two gates to enter and two gates to leave. It now feels like Jurassic Park! Keep your windows rolled up!

There is also an area with you park your vehicle and can walk around and look at animals. (Like a normal zoo) There are tons of different species of animals. There's a bird sanctuary. 

It was a lot of fun for the whole and we will definitely be going back!

498693142.name: I wish I had known.....
498693142.author: a TripAdvisor user
498693142.reviewBody: This zoo park really exceed my expectations.  The biggest part of the park is to drive through.  If I had known I would have rented a car for the day.  We took the bus through the park which I now believe is more fun and informative.  We took an Uber to the park ($7.35).  The park was not able to get us a taxi to go back to the city so we requested an Uber but the park would not let the Uber into the park pick us up.  They only let taxis into the park????  We walked 15 minutes to the road and there our family was standing at sunset, rain starting soon, a bit worried about be stranded but luckily we got another Uber to come.  Not sure what the management is thinking about Uber.

497921805.name: Excellent Zoo
497921805.author: a TripAdvisor user
497921805.reviewBody: They have a great place here, lots of animals and quite well planned. great place to go with the family. do not miss.\n

490266040.name: Very nice Safari, great experience.
490266040.author: a TripAdvisor user
490266040.reviewBody:
The staff: staff are multi-lingual, they are friendly and caring. They look after their animals very well and really care about the park's conservation mission and vision. I did not have any concerns about the safety of the animals or feared for my safety during the Safari. During the Safari you will find signs on the path with  very clear indications as to what can you do and where, ie. "do not stop" or " keep your windows up". 

The price: very reasonable price for the great experience. 

The park: has clear signs, very well planned, and has very clean toilets. There are clear recycling and rubbish disposal strategies inside the park  in-line with their vision of world conservation. The only downside would be the food and restaurants inside the park, the snack stations don't have many options, and only offer unhealthy soft-drinks. The park had what we thought were small bars, which we thought it was a bit odd and out of place for the experience. The restaurant felt very cheap, with little vegetarian options, and very outdated menu. Somebody needs to re-think their catering strategy. To bring your own food and drinks (as per your requirements and taste) would be recommended. 

The location: located a few miles away from Puebla. Accessible by special bus departing from Puebla city centre, or by private car. If you are driving there, the route and roads can be terrible. Your Satnav may not be accurate or up to date, as roads are terribly messed up. Otherwise very accessible and within reach from the city.

488292145.name: Nice
488292145.author: a TripAdvisor user
488292145.reviewBody: Nice to take a look around and hang out with animals. Great choice to come with family and friends. Would love that the staff took more care of the animals.

479351509.name: The best general zoo in mexico
479351509.author: a TripAdvisor user
479351509.reviewBody: San Diego, Houston New York, Washington, Dallas, LA zoo are nothing this a real and beautiful experience

478887102.name: Excellent to know
478887102.author: a TripAdvisor user
478887102.reviewBody: you must visit this place, they have a wide variety of animals, and is very affordable, special for kids and family.

478022985.name: Awesome place
478022985.author: a TripAdvisor user
478022985.reviewBody: My family and i are not great fans of zoos, we dont like the way animals are trapped, however the setup here is really nice and the animals seem to be free, you get to see upclose many of them and then a great boat ride. It is a must when you go to Puebla

477797083.name: Great for kids
477797083.author: a TripAdvisor user
477797083.reviewBody: If you have kids that want to see animals and your in the puebla area this is a good spot. Note that if you choose not to take your vehicle you will be riding in a bus not safari truck (this is extra).

476155049.name: If you do not speak Spanish, do not come here
476155049.author: a TripAdvisor user
476155049.reviewBody: I was very disappointed, because all tour and basically everything is in Spanish (also a "tour guide book" what you get in entrance). I luckily little bit understand, but I cant imagine I would take here my parents, who doesnt speak Spanish.\nIt was super-crowded, it is very small and half of the animals we even didnt see (they are on the map but on the road, you do not see them). \nIf you are foreigner, I would not recommend you to come here. You will find much better Safari in other countries.

474958742.name: Great for family
474958742.author: a TripAdvisor user
474958742.reviewBody: This place is fantastic for the family.  You get right up close to the animals and you would not be able to do a lot of the things you can do here in the United States.  I felt like I was in Jurassic Park at points of time.

471696433.name: AMAZING experience in Puebla
471696433.author: a TripAdvisor user
471696433.reviewBody: This is an absolute must-do on any trip to Puebla. The best time is on a weekday, as soon as the park opens.

469521008.name: Great place to spend a day with the wildlife
469521008.author: a TripAdvisor user
469521008.reviewBody: We went with a group of friends in a mini van.We went into the safari in our own vehicle,there were so many animals roaming freely in the area.It felt wonderful to see them out of the cage.At the end of the day, there was a bird show which was organised by the people there in the evening .It was fun.And there are many activities to do there.\nIt is a great place to take your kids and to have a fun day.

463350478.name: It remains as my favorite zoo in Mexico
463350478.author: a TripAdvisor user
463350478.reviewBody: I been to this zoo ever since I was a kid. Few things have remained so well preserved as Africam. My kids go nuts with the chance to get so close to the animals, who run freely in their assigned areas (no cages, even for lions and tigers). This last time we had friends with their kids, some of them visiting for the first time. They has a blast. Prices are competitive for such a place (many other zoos have opened around Mexico City with similar concepts, but none reach the same standard). Besides the regular day time visit they also offer night time which should be exciting as well. The place is so big (zoo and playground) that you need to plan for almost the whole day tonmake the most of your visit, otherwise you may only visit the zoo section and then move on to Puebla for lunch or dinner.

460123643.name: extraordinary
460123643.author: a TripAdvisor user
460123643.reviewBody: beautiful place great animals great spectacles and explanations nice to meet very great amount of animals

456168771.name: Palafoxiana library.
456168771.author: a TripAdvisor user
456168771.reviewBody: Breathtaking for book lovers.  I believe it is the oldest library still in existence in all of North America.  And it I spectacular.  Look around the entrance for a guide, at least one speaks English and give them a decent tip as that is all they get.  It is located just half a block from the zocalo, the main plaza.

451794556.name: Africam Safari is great - but don\'t take Estrella Roja
451794556.author: a TripAdvisor user
451794556.reviewBody: The Africam Safari is a great way to see elephants, zebras, giraffes, lions, and many other animals in natural habitat.  In addition to the drive-through feature, they also have a walk-through section where you can see the tamer animals even closer.  My kids especially enjoyed the  bird house where colorful birds will land on your hands, shoulders, or head.  Of course they have several gift shops and the prices are quite reasonable (for example, I got a nice t-shirt for 149 mxn where a similar t-shirt at Six Flags might cost 500 or more.  However, I can NOT recommend the tour by Estrella Roja.  We booked it for the convenience of departing from and returning from the Zocalo but the vans were totally unsuitable for a tour of this sort.  Over half of the seats (those in the rear) were elevated, yet the windows were low, forcing one to bend over in order to see out the window.  I was lucky and got to ride shotgun but I felt bad for the other passengers (not bad enough to offer to change seats, but still, I felt bad).  So DO plan a visit to the Africam Safari but do NOT book with Estrella Roja.

445941015.name: No matter what... you should visit one this wonderfull place
445941015.author: a TripAdvisor user
445941015.reviewBody: The real  African Safari, you can see any animal in their natural habitat, this is not only for children, as an adult you really have a very good time in the zoo

443636026.name: Nice but some animals don\'t have enough space
443636026.author: a TripAdvisor user
443636026.reviewBody: We were astonished by the space the giraffes and monkeys had when we entered the park. Unfortunately, entering the parque of adventure; we saw how the more dangerous animals like lions and other types of monkeys had a very very limited place comparable to any zoo. Was a nice day but I ended up sad about the way we look at animals...

439647876.name: Out for an Adventure
439647876.author: a TripAdvisor user
439647876.reviewBody: Beautiful day to visit, the place is nice , clean and the animals are really taken care off. In some parts we felt like Jurassic park because of the doors \ud83d\ude0a, they have a lot of animals and some parts you can get out of your car \ud83d\ude97 and walk around to see them even to take pictures with some of them, we arrived a little late so we didn\'t get to take pictures with them but it was still well worth it. It look like it was going to rain so we were not sure if it was a good time to go but I really wanted to go so we just drove there and I don\'t regret it at all. We went to the store inside of the park and got sting by a bee \ud83d\udc1d the girl there offer help right away she was really nice going above and beyond. Nothing happened to me everything was ok but I appreciate that she worry about me and she offer help. We have a good time. My high light of the day was the Kangaroo that you can see them so close and walk next to them \u263a\ufe0f. You can feed the birds as well, they fly right on your arms they are so cute. A place you most go if you visit Puebla it is very nice.

439283647.name: Arrive as early as possible!!!
439283647.author: a TripAdvisor user
439283647.reviewBody: Well maintained and many animals.  Loved the huge white Rhino and African elephants.  Plan to arrive very early so you can watch the animals feed.

435940365.name: THE best wildlife experience you can share with your kids
435940365.author: a TripAdvisor user
435940365.reviewBody: I knew very little about Africam Safari, so I never thought my family and I would have such a great time at this place. This a place where cages are a thing of the past, make sure you bring that telephoto lens with you if you enjoy photography because you will never EVER get to take better animal pictures yourself unless you go on a trip to Africa with weeks to spare. I took so many beautiful pictures, enjoyed it so much with my little girl and my wife, that I have memories to last a lifetime. Come here in your vehicle (rent a comfortable SUV if you come from overseas), bring plenty of drinks and snacks, and make sure your kids know how amazing our animal kingdom is and why we need so desperately to protect it!

435586106.name: Excellent experience at Africam Safari
435586106.author: a TripAdvisor user
435586106.reviewBody:
I visited Africam Safari as part of my Annual Conference of World Association of Zoos and Aquariums from 6 to 14 October 2016. 
I was really impressed with the vast undulating expanse in which the animals were roaming freely in natural environment. The happiness and satisfaction on the face of visitors, particularly children, was really great. The experience of feeding birds and kangaroos with own hand was thrilling. The rain forests was breathtaking. The hide to see leopards was really magnificent. it gave great experience.
The bird show was marvellous. The narration during the bird show was very informative and of highest order.
In brief, I had excellent time at the Africam Safari.

434561957.name: Africam Safari-A unique drive thru zoo experience.
434561957.author: a TripAdvisor user
434561957.reviewBody: With the main focus of this zoo being Africa, you drive through the incredibly large park that winds through the different types of habitats that make up Africa. Though the animals that you see appear to be able to walk into other animals\' areas, the barriers disappear giving you the feeling that they are all in one big space. There are many species of animals that do co-habitat the different areas, rhinos, ostrich, and other hoof stock were all together in one area. I was on a bus driving through, and it wasn\'t quite as easy to see things on both sides of the bus, but I think if you are in a car the experience might be a little better. Once through the drive thru area, you then visit the core area where you can walk around and see the stationary exhibits. The bird show was quite good with some birds that you don\'t see in traditional  shows. This facility is accredited by the Association of Zoos and Aquariums which requires members to follow a very high set of standards and follow the professional code of ethics, and it shows. The ONLY thing that I was disappointed with was the gift shops. Being in Mexico I expected some amazing Fair Trade items, but there was nothing at all like that in there. Just the usual T-shirts, stuffed animals, and pieces of jewelry that were like anything that we could get here in the states. So don\'t expect to find anything unique in any of the many gift shops. I still give this facility an excellent rating as it was a very pleasant surprise!

431202377.name: Tou should book a trip to Mexico just to visit Africam Safari
431202377.author: a TripAdvisor user
431202377.reviewBody: we visited the safari and were amazed.  The space was vast & beautiful; the animals were happy &healthy;  the staff were professional, knowledgeable and always smiling.  Make sure you watch the \'bird show\',  feed the parrots and kangaroos and just enjoy all the animals. This is a big place, with around  500 staff, so make sure you plan enough time to do it justice.

419995756.name: Everyone enjoyed
419995756.author: a TripAdvisor user
419995756.reviewBody:
This is our third time to the Africam Safari! We were a large crew of six adults, 7 children and a baby! 
We all had fun!
You can see all the animals from a near distance!
I really recommend this zoo! It is very nice!
Try to have a big breakfast (Mexican style) so you don't eat inside, the food is regular.

414689230.name: My children loved it!
414689230.author: a TripAdvisor user
414689230.reviewBody: We were there very early, so we could enjoyed our visit. My children and I were excited to see the animals. You also can take pictures with the macaws, and the lion cubs. My children enjoyed feeding the birds for $10 pesos you can buy seeds. If you have time it is worth it!

412070496.name: Great for families
412070496.author: a TripAdvisor user
412070496.reviewBody: I was visiting Puebla with my teenage kids for a few days after visiting Mexico City. Although they liked the historical attractions of Puebla, they still wanted to do typical kid activities.  This fit the bill.  For a modest 20 dolllars or so per person, we got van transport from the Zocalo, admission, a bus tour of the park, and 2 hours to explore the pedestrian zoo section.  The setting of the park in lush hill area is very beautiful.  The assortment of animals is impressive. For the most part, the conditions for the animals seemed good.  This facility seemed to be run to a fairly high standard.

409062588.name: Nice for the weekend
409062588.author: a TripAdvisor user
409062588.reviewBody: It you have kids they\'ll love it . For adults it is also a different type of zoo I was a little bit disappointed because they only had one bear and it didn\'t look in the best condition. Apart of that you can find many animals free and they have a special place for birds, kangaroos and monkeys. It is not as close to Mexico City, it is about 2 and a half hours so is better if you stay for the night in Puebla.

405579155.name: a place to visit more than once
405579155.author: a TripAdvisor user
405579155.reviewBody: this is our third visit to the animal preserve and with each visit the place is more amazing. The variety of wildlife expands constantly, one of the newest additions is 9 elephants rescued from being sacrificed in Africa due to overpopulation. The knowledge of the guides is impressive, specially in talking to children about each animal, their habitat and habits. \nthey also now have camps for children of most ages where they can participate in the care of the animals, learn about the environment and nature while learning to work as teams. A nice option in this era of egocentric individualism \na great surprise was the gift shops! almost all the items are MADE IN MEXICO, not in China. Management has made a point of creating high quality souvenirs promoting local jobs and industry. One more reason to visit and patronize Africam.

404651692.name: Nice Zoo
404651692.author: a TripAdvisor user
404651692.reviewBody: Really good zoo with plenty of animals and things to do. It\'s a nice place to arrive early in the morning and spend most of the day there. They sell different food types from fast food to traditional one.

402991055.name: Sometimes they have coupons on their fb page
402991055.author: a TripAdvisor user
402991055.reviewBody: Excellent! I went here when I was a little kid and the lions had an area but now you can only see them through a glass. I expected to see a bit more tigers, lions and bears but I didn\'t see much. It wasn\'t disappointing, I still loved it and so did my children.

402219829.name: Beat my expectations
402219829.author: a TripAdvisor user
402219829.reviewBody: Really nice experience, a very big variety of animals that are so free and used to visitors that really get close to you to improve even more the experience.\nIt takes almost an entire afternoon if you take/want to take your time and is totally worth it.

387299503.name: A lot of animals in a nice park!
387299503.author: a TripAdvisor user
387299503.reviewBody:
The Africam Safari in Puebla is definitely worth a visit!

In a relly big area you can visit the park in your own vehicle or book a tour. You will find a lot of animals, for example: elefants, lions, tigers, rhinos, hippos, antelopes, warthogs, zebras and many more. Every animal you'd like to see it's there.

After the car tour before the exit you have another big area which you can expierience walking. There you will find reptiles, amphibians and insects. Also you can get really close to birds and cangaroos. Next to that you have to possibility so watch the show with birds, which starts at 3pm. Worth it!

During the tour you'll find several souvenir and food shops, where you can spend some money.

If you have a half a day free you should definitely make a tour to the Safari, you will not regret it!

387247596.name: A drive-thru Africam Safari, one of a kind experience
387247596.author: a TripAdvisor user
387247596.reviewBody: If you have a chance to visit Africam Safari, you will be amaze to be almostin contact with\nthe REAL AFRICA

385586313.name: Great place to visit
385586313.author: a TripAdvisor user
385586313.reviewBody: I went to AfriCam safari in november, it was a very cool place to visit the anymal are roaming free and it was a very nice experience, make sure if you take a taxi get a pick up service as well, I recommend this place is very nice.

383010116.name: Aventuras
383010116.author: a TripAdvisor user
383010116.reviewBody: I been in the African Safari with my family and everyone was impressed, we saw a lot of animals variety and the most happy to be there was my little princess she loves the animals, everybody loved it.

378225066.name: A lot of different animals in a nice park!
378225066.author: a TripAdvisor user
378225066.reviewBody:
I've visited the Africam Safari twice now. Both visits were awesome!

You'll find a lot of animals in the park: elefants, tigers, lions, hippos, rhinos, giraffes, monkeys, camels, antilopes etc. etc. Awesome, how many different types you will see! It's not only to see the animals. Wether with the car of walking you are really close to the residents. For example we couldn't drive for 5 minutes because an ostrich decided to stand in front of our car. Later you have the possibility to get really close to birds and cangaroos. 

Additionally to the animals the park is really nice. You have a car-tour and also some parts walking. You can enjoy the nature in both ways. Also you will find some nice activities for kids plus different shops for souvenirs and snacks & drinks.

In the end in the walking park you have a nice area where you can get to know the jungle. 
Extra tipp: at 3pm starts the bird show in the end of the safari. The show was also very nice!

374540504.name: Amazing animal park
374540504.author: a TripAdvisor user
374540504.reviewBody: An amazing day out. Best if in own car, bit also very good in bus. You get to drive around between rare animals, Living in their natural habitat. There is also a Big area for walking where you get to see a lot of animals in Big flocks. The entire park has been built in African style and it is really a great Experience for Young and old.

374318289.name: Adventure Time
374318289.author: a TripAdvisor user
374318289.reviewBody: I came to Africam Safari for the first time when i was 3 years old and as an adult I knew I had to go back. I loved it! We took a bus there and the whole experience was amazing! My husband and I saw so many active animals up and running and moving around. We even got to see two elephants mating (crazy I know!) Awesome experience, I def recommend it, it is an all day thing so pack waters, lunch and snacks!

372198683.name: Be Sure to Go by Car
372198683.author: a TripAdvisor user
372198683.reviewBody: Africam Safari is just as remarkable as everyone says. You won\'t want to miss it, especially if you can avoid weekend crowds. But don\'t rely on the bus once you get there. If you have a car at your disposal, you\'ll be fine. If not, take a taxi with a driver who offers to go through the park and not just to it. I suspect most drivers will make the offer (for more money, of course). Ours stopped whenever we wanted, backed up to allow for better photos, knew what animals would show up next, and acted as an escort through the "zoo part" of the park. He greatly added to our experience and was well worth the 40 percent tip we added to his regular rate.

370375097.name: wow dont miss this
370375097.author: a TripAdvisor user
370375097.reviewBody: if you have been to zoos before...this is nothing like it.  the animals roam wild and free in what is just like a wild African landscape.  you ride your car thru the facility, pull up right beside elephants, zebras, antelope, tigers....right...don\'t be getting out.  it took us 3 hours to do take your time and observe the animals.  truly amazing.  its expensive but worth every dime.  the male lion roared and you could hear him all over the park.  chimpanzees rolling around wrestling, kangaroos walk right up to you.  the only thing not worth seeing was the butterfly exhibit but the rest was first rate.  its not fancy, its dusty, dirty but its natural. they sell water beer ice cream etc here so you can make an morning or afternoon of it.  mornings are best it gets very hot.

367559797.name: Beautifull Park, its a zoo with all\u00e1 the animales leasing free its very nace to see the animals Walking free
367559797.author: a TripAdvisor user
367559797.reviewBody: Its a ubique zoo and a very nivel place to enjoy with the family dont miss these atraction While you are in Puebls

361672679.name: Zoo
361672679.author: a TripAdvisor user
361672679.reviewBody: it\'s a whole day activity, the zoo is big, you can go a drive or take a bus to see the animals, and then a birds show, after this you should walk and visit the other exhibitions, like kangaroos or love birds.\nit\'s a great experience.

360764246.name: If you remember old Africam from old days, forget it now, plus watch for your money
360764246.author: a TripAdvisor user
360764246.reviewBody: Some years ago, there were more animals in wild, now it is 50% outdoors and 50% a zoo; this is not good or bad, it is just different.\nAlso watch for what you are paying, at the entrance they charged us a higher amount of the credit card than the real total; in the park another 2 times they tried to give less "product" when purchasing beer and a crepe.

358308816.name: Best zoo experience we\'ve been to in the world
358308816.author: a TripAdvisor user
358308816.reviewBody: This experience beats all the others. You can drive through without fear of monkeys eating your wipers. The animals are super healthy, lots of young animals, large groups of animals and they work hard for conservation. You can hold a young lion! Feed a giraffe! And feed 1000 finches and parakeets! Kids loved it. We have been to zoos all over the world and this one is the most humane with a great, caring staff. The staff use an innovation system to come up with improvements including growing healthy food on the property. Impressive and highly recommend.

357469803.name: Perfect side trip while visiting Mexico City
357469803.author: a TripAdvisor user
357469803.reviewBody:
I have to warn fellow travellers that Africam Safari is at least 2.30hrs drive each way (with heavy traffic double that!)

I would suggest if you visit to spend a night either in puebla historic zocalo or cholula.

The park area is perfect i gotta say. You cross the main gate (cover is about $23 USD) ad you get welcomed by giraffes after that it all gets better: tigers lions deers hogs hippo rhino lamas zebras etc etc. The most amazing thing i think for my family and i was to see the animals strolling around freely.

I recommend this for everyone travelling with children.

We did this a single day trip from mex city we left the hotel 8am came back 9pm. Brital i know but well worth it.

355126577.name: Excellent Zoo!
355126577.author: a TripAdvisor user
355126577.reviewBody: I went here some years ago when I was a child. It was an amazing experience. The animals come quite close to you. It\'s a must see! Absolutely recommend it.

348590184.name: GREAT side trip.
348590184.author: a TripAdvisor user
348590184.reviewBody: Our kids loved this attraction and had a great time. It was neat to see the animals up close and personal from the comfort of our own car. The highlight was the tiger sanctuary; they came up close to the car and it was the closest we had ever been to such a "wild" animal.

345076842.name: Amazing
345076842.author: a TripAdvisor user
345076842.reviewBody: I didn\'t had this one on my mind while in Puebla but it\'s totally worth it. You can see the animals running free and it\'s a great experience for children and adults , My guide Abril was absolutely the best , Don\'t miss this place , This is not the typical zoo it\'s a conservation safari. All the animals look healthy and they all live almost in their natural habitat.

342822404.name: Amazing
342822404.author: a TripAdvisor user
342822404.reviewBody: I love zoos and this one is one of the best I\'d ever visited. You can feed the budgies, pet cangaroos and watch animals for a very low price. Only one aspect was not good. You can take pics with a baby lion, which is from a animal protection perspective awful.

339739044.name: Drive your own car
339739044.author: a TripAdvisor user
339739044.reviewBody: Maybe a little pricy, but a fun drive by free roaming animals. The more dangerous animals (tiger, lion, hippo) are caged. The actual drive is not very long, with a \'pit-stop\' to buy souveniers/ food/ice in the middle of the safari. At the end, a little zoo like area is added. There is also kids entertainment (gigantic slide etc) area, which is nice for family with kids.

339614755.name: exeptional atraction
339614755.author: a TripAdvisor user
339614755.reviewBody: an excellent zoo near puebla, you may take the valsequillo road an d arrive this place in 15 minutes

338568418.name: Fun for the kids!
338568418.author: a TripAdvisor user
338568418.reviewBody: The place is nice for the kids but they let so many people inside at the same time that you stay stuck in the car for at least an hour and move very few . I Think it\'s really bad for the animals cause of the pollution of all the cars so much time without moving . They should have a limit.

338313007.name: If you want to see animals from all over...
338313007.author: a TripAdvisor user
338313007.reviewBody: Africam has a lot of wild animals from all over the world that you will probably not get to see in their own habitat. I think they could make the space of some of the animals a little bigger, that is if they make the spaces for food and bevarages a lot smaller.

332783866.name: Great place to look at animals from your car
332783866.author: a TripAdvisor user
332783866.reviewBody: The safari is very well organized, you enter different sections with your car and get to observe animals , giraffes, zebras ostriches, tigers.... you name it. the animals look well cared for , and the layout is well planned. Theres also a proper zoo-like section wiyth lots of other interesting animals, also a bird show tahts fun to watch. I just thought the big feline parts where a bit undelwhelming. I remember lots of active tigers and lions from my childhood, now there are just a few tigers that can be seen by car, lions have a section wehr you barely get to see them on foot. Great place for the whole family.

330033823.name: Animals are loose and you\u00b4re amongs them, what else?
330033823.author: a TripAdvisor user
330033823.reviewBody: Nice place to visit, especially the night safari, its definetly worth it, not only as a family trip but couples or friends

328830892.name: Great Safari
328830892.author: a TripAdvisor user
328830892.reviewBody: African Safari Puebla is a great experienc, you use your own car to follow to safari tracks. Everything is in good conditions and animals seems to be well-care. Great experience for all.

322139515.name: Estupendo Zool\u00f3gico sin jaulas. (Nice zoo without cages)
322139515.author: a TripAdvisor user
322139515.reviewBody: He visitado este zool\u00f3gico en muchas ocasiones a lo largo de los \u00faltimos a\u00f1os y sin lugar a dudas es el mejor en su clase en M\u00e9xico. Los animales est\u00e1n en buenas condiciones. Es un recorrido de varias horas. El \u00e1rea de descanso podr\u00eda mejorarse especialmente los alimentos. Si tienes tiempo puedes ir a un recorrido en lancha por la presa de Balsequillo.\n\nI have been at this zoo many times during the last few years, and without any doubt this is the best of its kind in Mexico. All animals are in good shape. This is at least a 4 hour visit. The rest area can be improved specially with better food and cleaning. If you have time you can go in a small engine boat through the Balsequillo lake.

319393654.name: Great place to spend a half day with the kids!
319393654.author: a TripAdvisor user
319393654.reviewBody: This "drive-through" zoo is very exciting for kids and adults alike.  You can also park your car and enjoy the restaurants and activities on-site.  There is a good variety of animals and the grounds are very well kept.  It\'s a nice activity to do with the kids if visiting Puebla for the day.

317101114.name: Great safari
317101114.author: a TripAdvisor user
317101114.reviewBody: Great African Safari experience near Mexico City, you use your own car to follow to safari tracks. Everything is in good conditions and animals seems to be well-care. Great experience for child\'s.

313559350.name: Nice safari adventure ... a wide variety of animals in open space ... the nocturnal version is amazing!
313559350.author: a TripAdvisor user
313559350.reviewBody: Nice safari adventure ... a wide variety of animals in open space ... the nocturnal version is amazing!

309586697.name: Please, don\'t miss it!
309586697.author: a TripAdvisor user
309586697.reviewBody: It\'s such a great experience, everything is well organized, animals are \'free\' and traveling on your car is a must. When you see the status of the park and animals, don\'t think is expensive: $232 mxp per adult. Established areas for landing and wc are good, they sell different kind of souvenir according to the park and animals and food and drinks, great idea to accept credit cards all over the park! Every section is controlled and it\'s similar to enter the Jurassic world movie! My favorite was driving the car and of course, don\'t miss the birds show, is incredible! Two suggests: to the park management, is a good idea to include English language in the description ads, and for the travelers, don\'t forget product to avoid mosquito, it can be annoying.

295923107.name: Excellent Day of Animal Adventures!
295923107.author: a TripAdvisor user
295923107.reviewBody: We LOVED the African Safari! It is such a large park with so many activities for people of all ages. It reminded me of Animal Kingdom at about a quarter the price:) My friend and I spend five hours exploring the park. We drove through the open range and saw hundreds of animals out and about-eating, frolicking and napping on the shade. Watch out for the roaming animals-stay alert and drive carefully. The zookeepers were always close by to keep everyone safe. The park is in excellent condition. We took the boat ride on the lake and spent time walking around the exhibits. There are areas for picnicking ( we found delicious homemade quesadillas) and lots of outdoor activities including animal rides and a zip line. Fun for everyone!!!!

295052375.name: A Surprise -- and Lots of Fun
295052375.author: a TripAdvisor user
295052375.reviewBody: I was really hesitant about going here -- I mean, really, a zoo?  I could get that back home.  But the friends we were visiting insisted, so we went.\nReally, this place is pretty amazing: from the car ride through the open areas to the huge walk around area including faux Amazon rain forest and fake Mayan temples.  Reminded me of Disney\'s California Adventure -- where you can see California without leaving Anaheim. We could visit Mayan ruins or the Amazon without leaving Puebla.\nIt was fun!

294846651.name: Africam Safari, The best Zoo of Mexico
294846651.author: a TripAdvisor user
294846651.reviewBody:
This is an excellent option for take a trip in family, 
You can see zebras, elephants, giraffas, llamas, white tigers, tapirus, black bears, birds, etc.The best is you can see all the animals in their habitat, and they look very friendly with people.
Don´t forget down of your car in every stop signed in the map, because you can loss the oportunity to do some activity not indicate in the same map that you recieve with tickets, some of these activities have extra cost, but in many case is a good experience.
Remember use sunscreen, a cap and drink water, its too hot inside and the "cold drinks" that you can buy in the fast food or restaurant are not very cold.
I think that the price for tickets is chip according to the quality of the park, for adults you have to pay 232 mexican pesos (15 dlls), for child 3 to 12 ages 225 mexican pesos (14 dlls) and I recommend you check the Park web page before of your visit, is common that you can find some promotions that will help you to pay less for your tickets.
Another option is to visit this park for the night, you can check the schedule in the web page.
For my family was vvery fun this visit, during all the day we had the oportunity to see wild aninals and we can do activities like zip-line. 
Finally I can say that is not a crowded park like usually Chapultepec Zoo in Mexico City.

294565960.name: A great experience
294565960.author: a TripAdvisor user
294565960.reviewBody: Animals are well maintained.  Grounds are nice.    Wish we would have allowed for more time.   If you go, go early.   This is fun for any age.

294533790.name: Super Zoo
294533790.author: a TripAdvisor user
294533790.reviewBody:
We had a wonderful day in Africam Safari. The idea is to come with your own car to drive through the park but there are just as well tours by bus. You get the chance to see all the exotic animals from close by including white tigers and white rhinoceros (almost extinct!).
There is plenty of spaces where to park and have a break (visit the restrooms or enjoy some of the snacks they offer you). We highly recommend to do the boat tour as well, cause the view and the fresh air on the water are more then relaxing:-)

In the end there is the adventure zone where you walk through and see more animals:-)  There is even a rainforest  thunder with a little rain! Go and enjoy!!!!

293796115.name: Beautiful Zoo and Wild Animal Park
293796115.author: a TripAdvisor user
293796115.reviewBody: Wonderful time had by our entire party.  Incredible exhibits, gift shop and shows.  We split our time both on the safari (in a car), and walking around the zoo portion of the park. Lemur island was my favorite.

293047308.name: Cool but crowded
293047308.author: a TripAdvisor user
293047308.reviewBody: Great experience where you get REALLY close to all animals (tigers, rhinos, giraffes, lamas, etc.). It gets really crowded on the weekends so the drive is quite slow and warm. Expect at least 5 hours for the entire visit. The zoo-part is also great and you are allowed to pet the kangaroos!

291808740.name: A different type of zoo
291808740.author: a TripAdvisor user
291808740.reviewBody: I\'m not a zoo lover at all but I joined friends to Africam. You drive there with your own car. First you pass an open area with e.g. apes and giraffes. Nice to see them walking by. Later you can park your car and walk into other areas with butterflies, birds and more. This is really nice as you can eat and drink something, sitting in the shadow,\nKids can play there. All in all you can spend a relaxing day there.

290764218.name: Worth your time!
290764218.author: a TripAdvisor user
290764218.reviewBody: This was a great time.  The animals were freely roaming.  A few of the highly predatory animals were in more enclosed environments but, generally, all seemed relaxed and content.\nThe only tough part was the first stop once you are already in the park (with food and bathrooms).  The hard part was leaving the parking area.  It is uphill and many who had manual shifts were finding it difficult not to put some wear and tear on their auto clutches.  Other than that, just a wonderful place to experience.

289376027.name: Did not want to go, but did.
289376027.author: a TripAdvisor user
289376027.reviewBody: I was a reluctant visitor, so afraid that the animals would be mistreated and cramped into small enclosures.  I was then amazed that it was more like the Wild Animal Park in San Diego, CA; animals able to roam free and well tended, but within eyesight.  A very good attraction for children especially.

286934138.name: very intteresting zoo
286934138.author: a TripAdvisor user
286934138.reviewBody: here you can enjoy the visit looking at the animals in a enviroment well design for them , its one of the most nice atractions to visit in town

282025673.name: A nice day trip from Puebla
282025673.author: a TripAdvisor user
282025673.reviewBody: This park was really nice, and not really what I expected. The animals are free to roam within the separate areas of the park. Unlike a zoo, which was really what I expected, very few of these animals are in cages. The large variety of animals also surprised me, and this was the first time I had seen a kangaroo (cangaro) up close. In the walking area, many of the animals were quite close to the tourists, and you could almost touch them. Although the whole tour was in Spanish and I am not fluent, I was able to follow most of what was said.\nThis park also cares about the environment and the protection of endangered species, which is something I value. Overall, this was a great day trip from Puebla and something I would highly recommend.

281903155.name: Classical
281903155.author: a TripAdvisor user
281903155.reviewBody: The animals seems well treated, we drive there, entered with our own car and I don\'t know if there is another way to do it. Make sure you take you own drinks and snack since the prices there are prohibitive for mexican standards. If you are an american or european you will be ok, is not that expensive (still you can bring your own thou!)

278893458.name: My best animal experience outside of a true safari in Africa
278893458.author: a TripAdvisor user
278893458.reviewBody:
I'm an animal watcher and an animal lover.    I am in that conundrum of wanting to see and experience animals but don't want them to be unhappy and mistreated.   I'm also a big fan of Mexico but I know that the developing state of the country is frequently problematic in dealing with humans, heaven forbid how animals are treated in captivity.   In general I will not visit a "zoo" in Mexico for having read too many reports of how the animals are treated.

Accordingly I read about Africam Safari before going.   I was actually 'stuck' in Puebla for a while from a vehicle breakdown and I kept seeing the advertising.  I visited all of the museums, cathedrals, etc  so finally I decided it sounded like it would be an OK day.

As it turned out this place is my favorite animal experience outside of an actual safari that I was lucky enough to take in Africa.   That's a big statement from someone who resides in San Diego - home of one of the most famous modern conservation style zoo and animal parks in the world.

Africam very much reminded me of a smaller version of San Diego's Safari park, however, you are able to drive through on your own.   

BTW - important part - I would HIGHLY recommend renting your own car - even for just a day - to go.   With your own car you can go at your own pace.   I sat and let the tours and buses drive past and it was just me in my car with the animals.  It was a really great experience.

I really can't say enough good things about this place.  They are conservation oriented and the animals all have large areas to roam.   Sure, it's a zoo, it's enclosures but I felt really comfortable with everything there and the staff all clearly care about their wards.
