I would consider it a 'must do' in Puebla - even though it's probably not at the top of the radar, if you love animals, put it there.

274531217.name: Outstanding Animal Park - Worth the Drive from D.F.
274531217.author: a TripAdvisor user
274531217.reviewBody: I did not know what to expect from this place, but friends wanted to visit. I was quite surprised and impressed by the quality and quantity of exhibits at this park. the majority of the park is a drive-through where you drive through different habitats seeing animals in a more natural state. I was impressed by how up close and personal you get to the animals! I was most impressed by the Rhino, a mere 50 yards from my car! I was also impressed by the thought that had obviously gone into the habitat to make them look more natural. In the middle of the park, you can park and walk through various exhibits. There are also restaurants there. Some people had brough picnic lunch and were enjoying at this point. Overall I was very impressed. Well worth the price.

273058869.name: Fun with kids
273058869.author: a TripAdvisor user
273058869.reviewBody: Kids had a great time in this place viewing lots of animals, unfortunately we could not see the bears.\nHad a good time.

267438081.name: A visit is a must
267438081.author: a TripAdvisor user
267438081.reviewBody: I was overwhelmed seeing animals in the wild as we drove slowly through.  There was also a bird show, exhibits,restaurants, and souvenir shops.. There are daily trips there in autobus from Puebla.  Tickets can be purchased at the Turismo office on the Zocalo.  It is an absolute must for any traveler in the area.

260687967.name: Entertaining
260687967.author: a TripAdvisor user
260687967.reviewBody: wonderful, all kinds of animals up close and personal, a must see. There are places to stop along the way to stretch your legs,  eat and more attractions. A must see!

259477047.name: A must visit while in Puebla!!!
259477047.author: a TripAdvisor user
259477047.reviewBody: This is s great place to see. So big, beautiful and amazing. Fun for all ages!!!!we loved it!!!!definitely must see place while in Puebla!!!!

258878294.name: Top notch facility
258878294.author: a TripAdvisor user
258878294.reviewBody: AS a 35 year zoo professional, I have seen most of what North America\'s zoological parks have to offer. I recently visited Africam Safari while lecturing in Mexico. It is a marvelous facility. The animals healthy and comfortable, nice exhibits, lots of educational opportunities and the show in the amphitheater was beyond compare. The entire facility was clean and well kept and a sense of self pride was evident in everyone I met. I look forward to returning again soon.

257850329.name: The best Safari Trip ever!!!
257850329.author: a TripAdvisor user
257850329.reviewBody: Wonderful place where you can have great time :-) Very, very nice, helpful and supportive staff. They will do everything what is only possible to make your sta\u0142y better and to make you happy. It is very customer oriented place. Thank you again for everything. Special greetings for Jose, our lovely safari guide and their Boss :-) Ania and Basia form Poland

255030810.name: Ok but there are better things to do in Puebla
255030810.author: a TripAdvisor user
255030810.reviewBody: I went there with my whole family, even my grandmother in a wherlchair. This place is like a giant zoo without cages. The animals looked a bit drugged. Honestly, I didn\'t think it was anything special. You drive around and there are no sugns or more detailed information about what you are looking at. Honestly, its a cool place if you have already seen all the other sites in Puebla or if you have very little kids who will enjoy watching the animals.

254778075.name: Better in Personal Vehicle
254778075.author: a TripAdvisor user
254778075.reviewBody: Africam safari is really near from puebla, it\'s just half an hour to go there. I recommend to visit it in a personal vehicle and beign out of vacations, you can enjoy the park without pressure. There are care paths that you take in a vehicle, ans in this zones the animals are free, very well trained, so there\'s no problem with security. I would give 5 stars but I couldn\'t enjoy it to far as long as I went on a guided trip. There are busses that take you there from the central zone (zocalo) just look for the tourism local to the right of the cathedral.

252012672.name: bad organization
252012672.author: a TripAdvisor user
252012672.reviewBody:
The Safari is great. the problem would be the poor management. The day I  visited  it was over book. too many cars and the lines were horrible. it took one hour to get to the middle of the safari and the staff didn't allow to stop they  send us to the  exit. 
they should know how many automobiles are allow at once and if the are on top capacity ask the people to use the bus. 
only here I was in traffic in the safari.

250252502.name: Great Place FUN !!!
250252502.author: a TripAdvisor user
250252502.reviewBody: Search for coupons on internet... you can get great deals, The place is awesome, the hosts are great and friendly and helpful, lots of animals, A little monkey jumped into my car, and didn`t pay extra for that, just got lucky, now he lives w/me, ha ha just kidding, but he did jump in. the night safari rules !! and don`t miss the Jaguar.

246430528.name: Entretenido viaje / Great for kids
246430528.author: a TripAdvisor user
246430528.reviewBody:
Africam Safari is a great place in Valsequillo very near Puebla downtown (40 minutes drive). 

This is a great park especially for kids as they love to see animals in very good conditions, most of them free" as no cages exist. 

There is a boat ride (200 pesos as of Dec 2014) in the Valsqueillo lake (An artificial lake with a Dam).

Little ones can ride a Llama for 20 pesos.

Food sold inside is bad, no healthy options available. (Burguers, hot dogs, nuggets)

Park is open from 10;00 - 18;00, you really need 6:00 to 8:00 hours to fully enjoy  the park.

246047809.name: Very good place to see, if you like wildlife animals.
246047809.author: a TripAdvisor user
246047809.reviewBody: It is a really good to visit, if you go to Puebla, Mexico. You spend a very good time over there. I recommended.

245937150.name: Excellent side trip while in Puebla
245937150.author: a TripAdvisor user
245937150.reviewBody: This place is really neat... Young and old will enjoy visiting Africam. It is only 30 minutes from the downtown area and there are tours that leave right from downtown. Don\u00b4t miss the bird area... you will be able to take some great pictures.

243767427.name: so much better than any zoo i\'ve seen
243767427.author: a TripAdvisor user
243767427.reviewBody: I was amazed.  We drove through the park  in a taxi during a weekday and took our time.  A rhino crossed the street in front of us, driving off the zebras.  A giraffe passed right next to our window.  The animals were rearing their offspring contentedly In beautiful surroundings.  There is an area to eat and walk through exhibits.  I was so delighted to feed parakeets out of my hand in the aviary that I did not want to leave.  Definitely going back.

240205113.name: Cool
240205113.author: a TripAdvisor user
240205113.reviewBody:
Really enjoyed the safari adventure. 
Guide was enthusiastic and quite informed about the species (LOL)!
We went a group of 5 friends and really liked the place. I find the break stops are too short, but you do get the feel of seeing all animals. 
An ideal place for families with kids.
The restaurant had really nice food!

239869146.name: Eh...
239869146.author: a TripAdvisor user
239869146.reviewBody: I went for dinner with my company, and so didn\'t get the full effect. However, it didn\'t seem like a place I\'d head back to...

238982541.name: Great Park and Bird Show
238982541.author: a TripAdvisor user
238982541.reviewBody: Although the Bird Show, the aviary and many of their new additions are great... I missed the booklet you could buy for 10 pesos years ago in which you could really learn about the park as you visit.

238846282.name: Fantastic!
238846282.author: a TripAdvisor user
238846282.reviewBody: It\'s been years since I heard about this place and this is the first time I visit it. The place is amazing, wonderful landscape. It was foundedin the 80\'s by the family who still own it. You are right in front of wild animals like rinos, tigers, giraffs, from the safety of your own car or the zoo buses. You can spend there the whole day, they have a lot of activities. We even had the chance to carry a three months old lion! Not only my child, but all of us where beyond excited. It will be fun for the entire family, I guarantee. They really take care of the animals and they preserve species in danger. As they are free all the time, you can\'t get out of the car, and they can get very close to you. There are other areas where you can walk and see the birds and other kind of animals.\nMake sure you wear something for hot wheather and sun block. It gets very hot during the day and chilly during the night.

238296810.name: Awesome Zoo
238296810.author: a TripAdvisor user
238296810.reviewBody: This zoo is quite amazing because you can interact with the animals.\nIf you are visiting Puebla and have time (is quite far from the city) and you like animals, you should visit this place, you can go by car or there are excursions tours.

237854796.name: Reminded me of African safaris I had taken
237854796.author: a TripAdvisor user
237854796.reviewBody: You go to a zoo and see animals in a cage or tightly confined spaces.  Here you are in the cage, your car and you see the animals roaming freely in large open spaces, just like in Africa.  It is truly a different experience.  The variety of animals and birds is like no other place on earth.  There are 4000 animals of 500 species on these grounds roaming freely within controlled areas but without noticeable fences or barred enclosures.  It is about as close as nature intended it to be.  The park provides the viewer an experience that is equal to a trip to Africa.  It is a place parents should bring their children to see how animals live in a natural environment and not as prisoners behind bars in a zoo.

235099934.name: New animals!
235099934.author: a TripAdvisor user
235099934.reviewBody: I love this zoo! I love that it has a safari area and they have new animals including the Australian birds which you can feed, it\'s an amazing experience

233116857.name: Best Zoo in Mexico!
233116857.author: a TripAdvisor user
233116857.reviewBody: A zoo where animals are in Optimus conditions, great variety of species and the majority of the ride is in the car! So animal are free. If you visit Puebla with children Africam Safari is a must do.

223532307.name: New experience in a Zoo
223532307.author: a TripAdvisor user
223532307.reviewBody:
It´s a drive-trough zoo where you get to see all kinds of animals you regularly see in any zoo. You get to make a pit stop where you can eat, shop and walk down to a lake where you can take a boat ride where there´s not a lot to see but I but I recomend it.
Then you continue driving and watching animals until you get to a walking zoo. There you can see a bird show and some more animals.
Even though I think it´s expensive, my son likes it a lot, so we´ve been there around 4 or 5 times.
I would recommend it only if you´ve never been to a drive through zoo, otherwise it´s like any other zoo.

223302564.name: we just loved it!!
223302564.author: a TripAdvisor user
223302564.reviewBody: I went with my sister, my two sons and my two nephews... we just has an amazing time, it\'s the best version of a zoo,  at least animals look freer and in better conditions than any normal zoo (I haven\'t gone to the San diego zoo yet). we had a monkey on top of our car that made us laugh, we coukd feed the birds, we had a nice boat ride, a picture with the cutest three month old lion.... just the perfect family day

220304985.name: Funds needed for renovations
220304985.author: a TripAdvisor user
220304985.reviewBody: The first time I was here I was 5 years old, I\'m 33 now and decided to go back since I was in the Puebla area, unfortunately it seems that funds have not been sufficient lately because the place looks old and forgotten and that must be hard for the animals as well. So please if you have memories about this place as I do, donate whatever amount you can to revive this awesome attraction.

217764726.name: Amazing park
217764726.author: a TripAdvisor user
217764726.reviewBody: I was a very young little boy the very first time I went with my family. I could hardly remember anything, but it had been a great experience.\nThis time I went with my family and my children were amazed. Even my almost 3 year-old daughter was impressed. She loved the giraffes.\nWe spent 5 hours in the park and visited almost everything (except for the little ride on the lake). My children could handle it without any problems. There\'s a third section in the park that you do by foot. Don\'t miss it. It\'s worth it!

217312269.name: Befriend monkeys and wallabies!
217312269.author: a TripAdvisor user
217312269.reviewBody:
I went with a family while teaching English in Puebla. I was skeptical at first, but quickly changed my mind. When you do the drive-through part, the animals are SO close! At some points, we were just feet away from zebra, camels, antelope, and even some rhinos. 

The best, craziest part was the monkeys. We were in a mini van, and someone had the not-so-wise idea to open the sliding door, and a monkey came right into our car! While probably not sanitary, it was awesome. He climbed up on the head rest of a seat and even tried climbing up some of us. We were all dying of laughter and shock. Great memories.

Then there's a more normal zoo part where you can see other exhibits, birds of prey presentations (all in Spanish), and even walk into a wallaby area. You can stand right beside them, and hopefully even see some babies peeking out from their pouches.

This was an amazing experience, the best zoo I've ever been to. Definitely not something to miss while in Mexico.

216841136.name: A Definite Must While In Puebl
216841136.author: a TripAdvisor user
216841136.reviewBody: What a great experience.  Where else\'s can you drive your car in the midst of wild animals that are found in various regions throughout the world?  My three children were captivated by the journey through the park. There are animals that cone up to the car and you can see them closer than any zoo I\'ve been to. The white tigers will leave you speechless and in awe. Their size and beauty is indescribable.  There an actual zoo at the end of the drive where you will see lions, various monkeys, kangaroos as well as many other animals. Make sure to spray on the mosquito repellent as they can get pretty annoying after a while. The kids loved it, the adults loved it, so make sure you make this one of your must-dos when visiting Puebla.

212910434.name: Pleasant surprise
212910434.author: a TripAdvisor user
212910434.reviewBody: To be honest, we got in the Park on a two for one. Being extremely reasonable, I can\'t be too critical. The boat ride was lame, but little kids would like it.... The animals seemed well cared for and I could see all the animals clearly and close up. It was fun and the  "zoo" part was comprehensive and informative. Depressing since everything is endangered or close to extinction! The white tigers were awesome and the setting reminded me a bit of parts of Africa. Bring a picnic lunch.

203120228.name: A Must While in Puebla
203120228.author: a TripAdvisor user
203120228.reviewBody: You\'ll be entertained even without kids in tow.  I went with another adult and a teenager, and we were all enthralled for three hours, the first two in the car, and the third walking around an area with smaller animals and plants ... reptiles, insects, butterfies, orchids, etc.  It\'s really on par to US and Canada similar animal attractions (such as African Lion Safari near Niagara Falls).  Someone wrote that the cost was high, but I disagree.  Less than $20 per person for an afternoon of entertainment is reasonable to my thinking.  You do not have a car, once you are there I believe that there are buses available to take you around, by check for details by calling or online.  Have to return for a night visit!

196006906.name: THE BEST NEXT THING AFTER KENYA SAFARIS!!!!
196006906.author: a TripAdvisor user
196006906.reviewBody:
I've been to a real safari in Kenya and while visiting Puebla wanted my child to get excited to our upcoming "real Africa Safari" so decided to take her and OH, WHAT A SURPRISE!!!! This place is absolutely UNBELIEVABLE!!! I was truly amazed!!! the variety of animals is astonishing! The proximity to which you can approach with the car is really MAGICAL! We saw FIVE bears within just a few feet from our car! it was such a glorious treat!!! But like the bears we saw so many others.  My favorites were probably the giraffes with a new little one posing for the pictures, or so I thought! After we thought it was all done, we discovered a WHOLE new area by foot with hundreds of other animals these more in like a zoo like setting but quite espectacular as well.  

the attraction is so well set up and as I passed by one amazing animal after the other I kept wondering how they were able to keep the place so nice when the attraction itself was so cheap - less than $20 US dollars per head. (you pay per head and not per car 232 pesos per adults and 225 for kids)  We even got to ride on a canoe as they have a water reservoir adjacent to the park which is the largest in puebla.  This ride too was very cheap at less than 20 dollars PER CANOE!!! (200 pesos per canoe which fits 6).  

This was an amazing adventure and I can't wait to take other friends there!  if you are considering going, consider no more and rush there as the weather now is absolutely great but I am told it gets hot in the summer and very crowded.  Regardless of when you go you will be amazed!!! 

And yes this was so much better than I could have ever imagined!!!

193076640.name: Incredibibly close animal experience
193076640.author: a TripAdvisor user
193076640.reviewBody: Two white tigers walked in front of our car! They were literally three feet away from us. Amazing experience. My four year old son loved it and so did we.

192612929.name: Great afternoon
192612929.author: a TripAdvisor user
192612929.reviewBody: Really enjoyed our afternoon in the middle the "wild animals".  Even for us grownups it was thrilling to see the animals from so close and ride through the park. As far as I can judge it, animals looked well-treated and the park very well organized and clean. Scenic landscape - a great city escape, we will definitely return to the the animals we missed.

191957993.name: try the night safari
191957993.author: a TripAdvisor user
191957993.reviewBody: I tried the night safari that only runs through every weekend in January, be sure you come well dressed it will be COLD, there is good food on site so don\'t worry about the hunger

191942001.name: Good ride
191942001.author: a TripAdvisor user
191942001.reviewBody: It is expensive but is really a good value, you can see the animals in their "environment" no cages. The tigers are the most beautiful attraction.

190215380.name: Gorgeous
190215380.author: a TripAdvisor user
190215380.reviewBody: The place is beautiful. There are many places to visit in Puebla, but if you travel there you must, must, must visit Africam.

189551859.name: Close Encounters with Wild Life
189551859.author: a TripAdvisor user
189551859.reviewBody: This is a Wild Animal Park. It is family friendly. You have the choice of taking the tour on one of the buses or drive through on your own car. There are signs that indicate if you can have the windows open or not. It is a small park if you compare with other parks, but we arrived at 9 am and it took 6 hours to drive through the entire park, rent a small boat for 6 ($200 pesos) for a ride to visit the dam and surrounding areas, the children\'s section and gift shop. \nWe didn\'t eat at the restaurant, but I don\'t recommend taking food in. It would be a temptation to feed the animals (just an observation). I totally recommend going to visit this park.

171988347.name: Amazing
171988347.author: a TripAdvisor user
171988347.reviewBody: Very cool experience.  So many animals and so close.  Bathrooms a bit dirty and I would advise bringing lunch with you.  I was very impressed when we went last year, but now that I have gone to Zoofari in Morelos.  I like that one more.  You interact more with the animals at Zoofari.  We fed the giraffes from the car.  Amazing!!!

168056264.name: Fun family activity
168056264.author: a TripAdvisor user
168056264.reviewBody: We\u2019ve been to Puebla before and this is our first time going to the Safari since the price always seemed so high. We got a price reduction on the cost because we bought at the office of tourism at the palacio municipal in Puebla which made it slightly more affordable. Be sure to keep watch for promotions on their website for cheaper tickers. It was a great experience. There were so many animals and they were all so close to the road that I could take great pictures and my 2 year old was so excited to see the animals up close. Be sure to go slowly through the park since there is no going back to animals that you want to see again. Also be sure to stop at the rest stop areas because there is usually more animals habitats to walk around that the signs don\u2019t clearly point out. I wish the animals would have been a little more lively but it was mid-afternoon and the weather was really hot so they were all trying to relax in the shade

165786312.name: "animals outdoors experience in a family place"
165786312.author: a TripAdvisor user
165786312.reviewBody:
is really greatfull place with a lots activities during the long day
all the family had a experiences with animals
is has a river inside trhe place,many  stations for take a break,
the best families places.
angeles saloma

165426676.name: Well Worth the High Price
165426676.author: a TripAdvisor user
165426676.reviewBody:
When first arriving, I was shocked to see how expensive it is: MXN 232 per adult and MXN 225 per child!

However, it was well worth it. We went there on a Tuesday morning and the circuit was basically empty. There were maybe five other cars doing the round. We saw the most important animals you would see on a safari: lions, rhinos, elephants (although Asian and not African), water buffalos. But also giraffes, zebras, hippos, crocodiles, tigers, bears, and much, much more.

The most amazing thing was how close to the animals we got, something you cannot get in a zoo. At one point we were face to face with a rhinoceros which was a bit intimidating, but a caretaker walked this huge animal out of the road and we continued our amazing adventure.

I found the park to be extremely well kept, the scenery breathtaking, and the animals to be very well taken care of. They are not in caged and just roam around the property in their own section. The tigers were in a smaller space but had plenty of place to move around. Nearly all animals are in groups.

After the "drive-thru" you can park the car and explore more in a zoo type setting. The kids had a lot of fun with the kangaroos. There is just so much to do and you should plan at least 3-4 hours if you include a lunch break. 

We ate at the Kilimanjaro café for lunch. Food was average, portions were rather on the small side but pricing was okay, they even have Wi-Fi. There are public bathrooms throughout the property and these are pretty clean.

Visiting during the week meant that there were barely people on the circuit but also that some attractions or snack bars were closed. However, these attractions were not animal related but rather items like toboggans and the like (which were also at additional cost) so not a big deal.

If was a fantastic experience for the kids (9 and 11) who liked this outing the best. We have been in the Mexico City/Puebla region for 10 days and Africam Safari was their favorite thing to do followed by the pyramids of Teotihuacan, the city of Puebla, the site of Cholula, and finally the town of Tecali with their onyx and marble shops. 

So even if Africam Safari is not the first thing that comes to mind when visiting Mexican heritage and this amazing region, it is a good change for young children who might appreciate a break from ancient ruins and old churches regardless of how much they are in awe of this culture.

160475332.name: Unique experience with the Family
160475332.author: a TripAdvisor user
160475332.reviewBody: Hello, we have been visiting Africam Safari for a long time. Our Parents took us there when kids and since them have enjoyed it. If you are staying with the Family for a few days in Puebla, it is worth while to take the 30 min drive to Valsequillo and have a different Zoo experience. You drive or take the bus through the different regions of the world with the its unique animals. Believe you get very close to them. A Ostrich was not happy with us been so close to her and almost bite my uncle! Then there is the walking area with a Awesome butterfly exhibit, a most see.\nIf you are in Mexico City it is a 2:30 hr. drive to the spot, if you go early you can make the visit, eat in the City at Puebla and come back in one day. A little tiering but can be done!\nCiao.

157847187.name: Entertainment for Everyone in "Litle Africa"
157847187.author: a TripAdvisor user
157847187.reviewBody: Great place to visit, full tour, takes about 6 hours, so be ready for it and dont rush, you\u00b4ll see a variety of animals in a simil habitat from theirs, you can either take your own car or a Safari Bus.\n\nIf you have extra cash, make a line to take the picture with the lions!

156898649.name: Fun Outing with Kids
156898649.author: a TripAdvisor user
156898649.reviewBody: The Safari is outside of Puebla.  You drive through and see African animals, much like you would a safari in the US.  It was enjoyable and the kids liked it.

156267341.name: Great place to visit
156267341.author: a TripAdvisor user
156267341.reviewBody:
This place is an old farm with a lot of new attractions.
The store gift is a recommendation if you want to support the conservation of wild life.
Friendly staff is common around this place.

You should consider this place if you want to:
Get some dust in your car or in your eyes.
Get a mini safari adventure
Get involved (Very near) into the wild animal environment

The company AFRICAM "must" consider 
Clean ladies restroom
Put signals around the last stop to know where the exit is.
Increase food quality, the food is poor quality.
Provide an audio device to hear and understand around the places what animals, history, fun facts, etc

154976981.name: Great place
154976981.author: a TripAdvisor user
154976981.reviewBody: It is awesome, animals on the loose... No, really, it is a great place, great for kids, great for adults. The only thing that i recommend is going in a car bigger than a small compact, because inside de zoo you have to drive on a dirt road, and even small cars can get there without problems, but it is easier in bigger cars. Buy the CD, it is cheap and really informative. Also, they have an app for iphone, you can download it before and it is also a good guide. When you finish the tour, go to the place where they have the kangaroos, it is great, you can touch them and be literally inside their cage!!.

153812723.name: Fun Place to Spend the Day
153812723.author: a TripAdvisor user
153812723.reviewBody: This is not San Diego Wild Animal Park - don\'t expect that level of attention to the habitat. It is a very nice place to view animals that are not in cages. I took a tour bus and had a very nice day. I took my own lunch but did purchase a cold drink while I was there and it was reasonably priced.

152231928.name: Very disappointing and sad. :-(
152231928.author: a TripAdvisor user
152231928.reviewBody:
I was really excited to see this place, having never been to a safari park before.  I had LOVED the sound of it - it sounded huge, like the animals had so much space to roam in natural habitats, with other animals.  The reality of it is, it is a drive-thru zoo, and not a good one either.  There are a few different climates themed, but they were missing much-needed vegetation.  They were only 1 or 2 or 3 of each different type of large african animal, not nearly enough for social herd animals to live happily or behave naturally.  There were few or no small animals, which are just as important to ecosystems, and just as interesting.  Information about the animals was limited to "African Elephant", "Zebra", "Giraffe".  Nothing about their native range size, migration habits, behaviours.  All the animals looked SO SAD!  I felt horrible knowing I had given money to a business which was clearly neglecting and exploiting these poor creatures!

Please, please don't come here, and don't bring children here.  If you want a good zoo experience, I highly recommend Belize Zoo.  I also recommend snorkelling tours in Belize and Playa del Carmen, for up-close contact with animals.

I went in 2010.

150617702.name: Not quite to U.S. standards but worth a visit, especially with kids
150617702.author: a TripAdvisor user
150617702.reviewBody:
It's not San Diego's Wild Animal Park, but Africam Safari does pretty well.  We enjoyed a 2-hour guided bus ride through the facility's vast grounds, and saw diverse creatures, from elephants to squirrel monkeys.  If your Spanish isn't up to snuff, you may not be able to follow the guide's explanations, but if you enjoy watching animals, that probably doesn't matter.  Giraffes, warthogs, zebras, and other creatures come very close to the bus.  After the bus ride, there's an opportunity to walk around and see more animals.

An inexpensive bus runs between Puebla and Africam, or you can arrange a taxi.

There are a lot of really unique things to do in Puebla, so I wouldn't put this on the top of your list unless you really love animals or your kids do.  We went because we needed something to do on Christmas Day, when most other activities were closed.

150453033.name: An enjoyable family outing!
150453033.author: a TripAdvisor user
150453033.reviewBody: Spend the day!  There\'s lots to do!  The entrance fee, at almost $200 pesos per person is very expensive by Mexican standards.  You can imagine that all those animals eat a lot!  You drive through and view the animals.  At the first stop, kids can ride a llama or families can (pay extra) to take a boat ride on Lake Valsequillo.  There\'s also snacks and a gift shop.  Then you drive through some more, and there\'s a stop where you can see tigers, monkeys, hippos and hyenas in "habitats".  Snacks for sale here too.  The following stop is the zoo and there\'s a picnic area where you can have a picnic.  Highly recommended.  At the zoo area, there\'s a butterfly sanctuary, bats and a great kangaroo area.  Lots of different animals in cages or "habitats".   There\'s also a few shows.  A bird show.  Another gift shop that you have to walk through (cover the kids\' eyes) to get in or out of the zoo area.  (Insider scoop: The founder of Africam Safari was mauled by a tiger and died of his injuries in the \'80s, I believe.)

149028621.name: Don\'t miss
149028621.author: a TripAdvisor user
149028621.reviewBody:
Place has been renovated from years ago.
It has two parts: the safari which is done by car or bus with rooaming animals on their habitat and the adventure zone wher you walk on a zoo and adventure games.
It has a cangaroo zone wero you walk by the animals, also a walk in butterfly garden, and more things.
It has 19 baby african elephant saved from culling.
It is a 3 hour visit.
If you don't have a car you can take a tour from tiptours that leave from the teatro de la ciudad, it only 100 pesos extra per person, on the same bus you take the tour with africam guides.

148564511.name: Fun!
148564511.author: a TripAdvisor user
148564511.reviewBody: Friendly ostriches stick their heads right in your window and the animals all seem well cared for and content in their habitat. The tigers were kind of a disappointment, but overall it was worth the money to experience this "safari."

147976048.name: From an adult standpoint .... Just ok
147976048.author: a TripAdvisor user
147976048.reviewBody: If you have no other opportunities to see wild animals In something approximating their natural habitat, this is worth doing. The price is certainly right (about $20 including transportation from the Zocalo). You definitely do get quite close to many of the animals.  Once at the park our bus filled up with children understandably excited to see the animals. This made it somewhat difficult  for us to enjoy it, since the kids of course wanted to be right at the windows. The tour is reasonably well curated with interesting detail about the animals and their habitats.  There are several opportunities to overspend on cheap souvenirs, including about 1.5 hors between end of the trip through the park and return to the city. Food and drink is available at reasonable prices by US standards but mediocre to poor quality.  Skip the nachos entirely.

146577356.name: Great for Kids
146577356.author: a TripAdvisor user
146577356.reviewBody: There were a ton of people here... but for a drive thru safari, it was really cool... Our kids absolutely loved it.  We printed off some coupons from their website and it was cheaper that way...

146346882.name: For what you get, its TOTALLY worth the money
146346882.author: a TripAdvisor user
146346882.reviewBody: Most safari sites are at least double what you pay, this one was soo worth the money! It was really so different than other zoos/safaris because you get to drive your own car in and be right up to the animals.  I love the fact that the animals are not separated but live close together with others that would normally live together.  THAT you don\'t see at other zoos!  It was awesome.  After all the driving part there is also a lot that you can walk around to see!  Make sure you are prepared for that ! I just thought there would be a little walking .  Overall it was a great place to visit!

145595426.name: AWESOME!!!
145595426.author: a TripAdvisor user
145595426.reviewBody: Have not been there in years, however one of the coolest places I\'ve ever been!!  Nothing like what you will find in the US,  some of the best animal photos I\'ve ever taken.  Again I haven\'t been there in years however it was not at all expensive.  A MUST!!!

144503336.name: Pleasantly surprised
144503336.author: a TripAdvisor user
144503336.reviewBody: I had not been to Africam Safari in over 30 years, and from what memory served me, I was expecting something quite basic and austere.  I must say I was truly surprised from the great signage to find it (not necessarily a strength in Mexico) to the organized and neat entryway and process through the overall tour to see the animals.  Much has improved over those thirty some odd years...including the size and organization of the park.  The drive-thru section of the park had an incredible number and variety of animals that appeared very healthy and well taken care of.  The adventure park at the end of the tour, where you get to walk through a more typical zoo like installation, was also very well organized and fun.  My wife and kids even took advantage of the holiday to try the fun and challenging extreme tour with bridges and ziplines going around the park.  It was great to be able to share this wonderful place with my kids after having visited it with my parents those 30 odd years ago.

143234789.name: VERY NICE PLACE
143234789.author: a TripAdvisor user
143234789.reviewBody: ENCREDIBLE we love it,feel like to be in africa realy nice place to enjoy a full day out of the city.the staff is very kind too

141142208.name: 100% recommended
141142208.author: a TripAdvisor user
141142208.reviewBody: It is great, you drive in your car and there are giraffes, lions, hippos, elephants, etc. etc...it takes about 2-3 hours.  You can buy a CD for less than 2 dollars that explains the different areas and animals. Great and totallz recommended

134750427.name: Fun for kids if you need something non-cultural
134750427.author: a TripAdvisor user
134750427.reviewBody: Not worth a visit unless you just need something for kids to do if they are tired of museums and archeological sites.  Basically about what you would expect from a drive-through safari.

131984203.name: have to go!
131984203.author: a TripAdvisor user
131984203.reviewBody: very unique place! can recommend to anyone wonderful!

129894710.name: expensive but nice
129894710.author: a TripAdvisor user
129894710.reviewBody: for kids spectacular. You come really close to many animals. The park is nicely created and in good shape. But quite expensive.

128343617.name: Great version of a Zoo!
128343617.author: a TripAdvisor user
128343617.reviewBody: You feel like you\'re on a real Safari, because you go inside of a van and the animals are free, be cautious when you visit the feline section...

672989985.name: Great view at night
672989985.author: a TripAdvisor user
672989985.reviewBody: We went at night and got a VIP car it has a glass bottom as well and it was just out family in the car. Well worth the money

668770063.name: Visit at night!
668770063.author: a TripAdvisor user
668770063.reviewBody: We visited at night and could see the lights of the entire city. It was beautiful! We paid a bit extra for the VIP ride and it was nice since we had 5 people (2 of them being tall guys).

666193055.name: Mainly a Night Time Attraction
666193055.author: a TripAdvisor user
666193055.reviewBody: Make sure to check the open hours since they tend to run late.  You can also get great views of the city from the park NE of town.  The surrounding trails make an enjoyable stroll.

666013419.name: Two thirds the size of the London Eye
666013419.author: a TripAdvisor user
666013419.reviewBody: This large wheel provides excellent views of the city of Puebla and if the day is clear, of the Popocatepetl and Iztaccihuatl volcanoes. It is certainly worth the price, which is not expensive.

665388331.name: Not bad, just nothing special
665388331.author: a TripAdvisor user
665388331.reviewBody: While it\'s OK to take a spin there\'s not really much to see or otherwise make this special.\nA joke even is that from the London Eye you see Buckingham Palace, from Estrella de Puebla you see Palicio de Hierro and all the way to Liverpool - those who know Mexican malls will get the joke

654543176.name: Boring
654543176.author: a TripAdvisor user
654543176.reviewBody: The guy at the ticket didn\u2019t even have enough money to give me in change, and asked if I could just give him the peso, I didn\u2019t care so I said yes. The girl tells us that they might cancel our ride with no refund should the weather be too windy...ok that\u2019s not really fair but whatever, I got on. There was my family and a couple. I asked the person since there\u2019s only 2 groups waiting (literally 2 groups, no one else) could they give us them a casket and us another one, they said no that\u2019s for VIP only for 400pesos. Fine, be that way- we all get on one casket on the slowest ride ever. I guess after you go on the telef\u00e9rico, this ride turns out to be obsolete. Overall, if you don\u2019t have time to ride this, your not missing out.

649838298.name: Excelent!
649838298.author: a TripAdvisor user
649838298.reviewBody:
Worth the price! Super fun! 
It has easy access, great view! 
You should plan to stay here at least an hour.

649007236.name: Worth the VIP
649007236.author: a TripAdvisor user
649007236.reviewBody: Hardly any waiting in line. Clear bottom plastic floors (thick) Similiar to Eye of Orlando here in Florida. Nice 20 minute ride...very slow. I heard night time is the best...it was nice.

640156114.name: Beautiful!!
640156114.author: a TripAdvisor user
640156114.reviewBody: Breath taking views!! Went during the night and a definite must see!! Regular tickets are more than enough to catch the views and the surrounding park is beautiful.

639312292.name: THE VIEW!
639312292.author: a TripAdvisor user
639312292.reviewBody:
Can’t miss it if you are visiting Puebla. You can either ride alone with your partner or group up to six, or pay much less and ride with others. 

The view from the Estrella de Puebla is spectacular. From the older colonial buildings and churches to the modern highrises that make up the city of Puebla, overshadowed by the Popocatepetl volcano and Iztaccihuatl mountain.  

Worth the ride!

638531862.name: Nothing special
638531862.author: a TripAdvisor user
638531862.reviewBody: If you want to do something diffenrent in Puebla...It s located in Angelopolis. IN front of the Palacio de Hierro. You can see Puebla panorama.Moslty visited by ocal people.

634042665.name: Silly but so worth it
634042665.author: a TripAdvisor user
634042665.reviewBody: The view is spectacular. It\u2019s worth it just to get your bearing on this amazing city.  I hadn\u2019t even know there was a financial district and so much more than the historical centro!  It\u2019s a quick stop and really worth it!

606874884.name: Fancy ferris wheel
606874884.author: a TripAdvisor user
606874884.reviewBody: We were a group of six and took the VIP private carriage for six at $400 MN.   General admission is $40 MN per person.  Great views, you go around just once but it is 90 meters high and takes 20 minutes.  You see Centro, Cholula and all of the area.  A fun half hour.

600858876.name: Great time.
600858876.author: a TripAdvisor user
600858876.reviewBody: We really enjoyed the trip in this wheel of Fortune in Puebla. Duration of 20 min approximately and super cheap. \nRegular cabin: $40 Mexican pesos.\nVIP: $400+- Mexican pesos.

596085567.name: Fun experience at the noria
596085567.author: a TripAdvisor user
596085567.reviewBody: I did not expect to find this venue in Puebla but I was surprised to visit it and I highly recommend this place to couples and families. It is located close to Angelopolis which is the business and high end district. I recommend parking your car in the assigned parking lots and not leave it in the street as some people mentioned car break-ins around that area. You can select two ways to board the cabin. They have the general entrance where they pick up to 12 people in a cabin or you pay the VIP price and for $400 pesos or roughly $20 USD you can have the cabin all for yourself in a nicer sofa style seating to give you more privacy to enjoy the 20 minute ride and to enjoy the view from the top. It moves very slowly so there is nothing to be afraid of, unless you are afraid of heights then this is not the ride for you. There are a few coffee places around where you can wait for your friends while tasting delicious local hot Mexican chocolate or Cafe de Olla. I highly recommend this place.

586947249.name: Up High!
586947249.author: a TripAdvisor user
586947249.reviewBody: This was a great end of day activity. Very reasonably priced and a lovely way to get aerial snaps of the city.

584838377.name: Weekend break
584838377.author: a TripAdvisor user
584838377.reviewBody: Fun thing to do if you\'re staying in Puebla for a weekend (or more). Didn\'t have to queue for very long even though it was Sunday afternoon. Great views!

573087258.name: A fun ride
573087258.author: a TripAdvisor user
573087258.reviewBody: It was a 40-minute stop on out day tour to Cholula, and we were not sure if we had enough time for the ride because there was a line. We went for it and more than enough time. The ride takes 20 minutes and is very slow. It was a hazy day so the views were a bit disappointing. We were surprised how inexpensive it was --- only 40 pesos.

568176727.name: I\'m afraid of Ferris wheels - this one was better
568176727.author: a TripAdvisor user
568176727.reviewBody: Heights bother me but this one caused less anxiety because the cars don\'t rock as the wheel turns.  Yes, it is very high but it seems sturdy and moves very slowly.  You ride inside closed cars (glass windows) that each hold 8 people.  You can probably see more detail during the daytime but going at night the lights of the city are interesting and beautiful.

557139646.name: Amazing view
557139646.author: a TripAdvisor user
557139646.reviewBody: Great experience! Sharing the cabin it\'s $40 pesos per person (upto 6 people) or VIP (Private cabin) it\'s $400 pesos (6 people party).

553749570.name: World class experience
553749570.author: a TripAdvisor user
553749570.reviewBody: I have ridden a few of these over the years, this one is truly world class. The views of the volcanoes on a clear day are spectacular. If you are brave try the glass bottom cabin (and you can skip ahead in line). Prices are accessible for this half-hour experience.

546120595.name: If you got nothing else to do
546120595.author: a TripAdvisor user
546120595.reviewBody: It was fine. You can see far, but there is nothing else around it except a new shopping mall. You really have to go out of your way. The price is cheap, but I think you could better spend your time elsewhere.

545650646.name: Beautiful view of Puebla
545650646.author: a TripAdvisor user
545650646.reviewBody: We rode this at night as part of an inexpensive Turibus tour. It was a lot of fun. It goes really slow and never stops, somewhat like a ski lift, and gives you a great view of surrounding area. It was very decked out for the holidays. We shared our ride with 6 other very friendly people. A great time.

545186203.name: Great view
545186203.author: a TripAdvisor user
545186203.reviewBody:
This wheel gives a great view of Puebla, we went on in the evening and really enjoyed it. The wheel goes relatively slowly, enough to see everything. 

My only issue would be that the capsules are a little small, you can't get up and move around or take photographs. 

Having said this, the trip is very cheap and worth doing if you can.

543379982.name: Great view of the city!!
543379982.author: a TripAdvisor user
543379982.reviewBody: it offers an excellent view of the city, but is highly recommended to go at night.  it\'s located at the side of Angelopolis shopping mall where you can also find a lot stores and restaurants to have a great dinner. It\'s better if you make groups of 6 persons and buy the Vip tickets, if not you may have to share the cabin with other people. \n\nDepending on the time you may find waiting line

533243593.name: Nice view!
533243593.author: a TripAdvisor user
533243593.reviewBody: We were there in July (rainy season In Puebla) we were advised that in case of a big storm, we will have to wait, and they won\'t refund our money. We agreed. The good thing about that; we didn\'t have to wait that long. The wheel is very height, but you can see different parts of the city. My children enjoyed the ride, and the best part was that only cost $30 pesos per person. It was very clean, and since it was raining  they had a person drying the steps, every time someone came out of the ride.

533109858.name: a sight
533109858.author: a TripAdvisor user
533109858.reviewBody: We viewed this attraction from our 19th floor hotel. Time was a problem in an actual visit to jump into the ride, but will return to experience this wonder. At night the wheel is lite and spectacular. If you find weather good the volcano is visable behind the wheel in the distance.

532329381.name: Ride it at sunset!
532329381.author: a TripAdvisor user
532329381.reviewBody: Its a nice little escape you can do in 1 hour even taking a coffee in the nearby coffe shop. At sunset it gets magic. even if the weather is not the nicest the clouds over the Pop and Ixta and Malinche while getting really an impression of how Puebla has grown quickly in the last years makes it unforgettable.

523005998.name: Good view of Puebla
523005998.author: a TripAdvisor user
523005998.reviewBody: The wait is slow even if there is no people. Expect to wait at least 10 mins. Unless you pay VIP for a party of six which gets you to ride in a more comfortable bungalow. The seats can be very stiff and the table in the center gets uncomfortable. Not too much freedom to look all round since your sitting down. Probably the most affordable "Ferris wheel in the world" quote unquote.30 pesos. Compare that to a taco.

522450831.name: Awesome view of the city!
522450831.author: a TripAdvisor user
522450831.reviewBody: Beautiful view of the city, it takes 8 minutes to ride it. and go when is sunset. you will enjoy the lights of the city.

522114417.name: Puebla\'s landscape
522114417.author: a TripAdvisor user
522114417.reviewBody: It\'s so nice place to sightseeing and get a beautiful landscape of Puebla city during night is incredible to see the lights ocean and also the cathedral illuminations and other representative churches :) excellent experience , you have to wait in order to get free coach however is priceless when you get the full view standing at the top

512379172.name: Going high
512379172.author: a TripAdvisor user
512379172.reviewBody: A ride in the high to go with the\nFamily friends or a love one if you\'re in Puebla it\'s a must do you can relax and watch the beautiful view

510621319.name: Nice view
510621319.author: a TripAdvisor user
510621319.reviewBody: Nowadays is a must to see if you are in Puebla, the view is nice you\'ll get to see the city and the volcanoes around it, in my opinion is better to go around 6 pm and then you have an amazing sunset view, by night is also cool but you don\'t get to see much but a bunch of lights, not bad either. The entrance fee is just 30 pesos or you have the possibility to pay for a VIP cabinet for 300 pesos, fair price if you ask me, during the week the line is fine just keep in mind during weekends probably you have to wait a little while.  Safe travels!

510226927.name: Cool spot to see the city from Above
510226927.author: a TripAdvisor user
510226927.reviewBody: It was a neat experience. You can get a VIP car for just your group or a shared ride. The Ferris wheel itself moves very slowly and the view is great. You can even see the volcanoes and a vast part of the city.

504498794.name: Good
504498794.author: a TripAdvisor user
504498794.reviewBody: We went at night and we were really expecting more.  It is cheap and maybe we will give another try with daylight.  In the other hand, everything is well operated and coordinated.  Clean and nice.

503723935.name: Beautiful views
503723935.author: a TripAdvisor user
503723935.reviewBody: We arrived to the Star of Puebla and was surprised to find a water fountain where u could get wet and enjoy even as adults and with children. My son spent an hour getting wet in the fountain then changed and went into the tram.  The cost was 30 pesos per person and each car holds 6 people.. you could choose the vip which cost ALOT more because of the glass bottom. I dont know how much of a difference that would be versus the regular 30 pesos car.. The view either way is phenomenal.. We had went on a beautiful clear evening and even our kids enjoyed it.. There is also a coffee shop that has a bathroom in the rear which you pay 5 pesos and its very clean. Across from the Tram is also Puebla Artesania for those like me  who love and appreciate handmade items..

501346449.name: Good view of the city
501346449.author: a TripAdvisor user
501346449.reviewBody: I like the Estrella better than the telef\u00e9rico. They offer similar experiences, and this one lasts longer. It is like the London Eye, a slow moving ferris wheel that gives you a bird\'a eye view of the city. You need to drive from the historic center, but if you are out in angelopolis, I recommend it! It is worth the 30 pesos it costs!

489641549.name: Worth the VIP
489641549.author: a TripAdvisor user
489641549.reviewBody: 300 pesos for VIP was worth it, seats were so comfortable and no sharing with other couples, it was very romantic. Normal booth sits 6 back to back, VIP sits in a circle with an exposed floor.

488663904.name: A well preserved old library
488663904.author: a TripAdvisor user
488663904.reviewBody: We visited this as part of a walking tour. Our guide in the tour explained the history, but I think there are interactive electronic guides and signs in English. Obviously you can\'t touch the books!

487831134.name: Views
487831134.author: a TripAdvisor user
487831134.reviewBody: Nice viewpoint of the city. Recommend to go with family and friends where you can have a nice chat with and a great view of Puebla

482213426.name: Beautiful at sunset
482213426.author: a TripAdvisor user
482213426.reviewBody: This is a great attraction for seeing the whole city.  The cabins were being cleaned as we watched and the one we were in smelled a little funny but not strongly. \n\nThere are VIP cabins that cost 300 pesos (about $16) and have a glass floor. However, someone recommend not to pay for this if that\'s your selling point solely on the account of the glass being extremely scratched from people walking on it. The regular cost is 30 pesos/person.

472966191.name: Nice city view
472966191.author: a TripAdvisor user
472966191.reviewBody: I have to say this atracction opens around 4:00 pm local time and closes at 10:30 pm. the waiting time is about 30 min just to get in. Staff cleans the cabin before the next people go in. Duration of the ride is about 20 min, and it seems like an eternity once the ride starts moving. They have two tipes of  cabins, one they call Vip and the price is about 300 pesos for up to 6 people and the only good part is you wont be sharing it with a stranger. They also have a regular cabin and the price is 30 p\u00e8sos and this one you have to share it with six other people. in resume not much to see here personally i thing its a wast of time.

467342432.name: It is ok just for one time visit
467342432.author: a TripAdvisor user
467342432.reviewBody: It was a wast of money from the government building this and also a waste of money to pay for it, it is ok for just one time experience

462911730.name: Family weekend
462911730.author: a TripAdvisor user
462911730.reviewBody: Very silmilar setup as the London Eye, but with a much smaller cabin and you need to sit down. \nGood option to do something different in Puebla, it only takes 20 minutes to go up and down. The line to get up moves quickly so no issues there!

460896325.name: For the money it is worth it.
460896325.author: a TripAdvisor user
460896325.reviewBody: This is a big Farris Wheel in the modern area of town. I think it would have been better close to the Historic Center so you could see all the Church steeples from the top. That said it is neat to take the 25 minute ride in the Wheel.

453149181.name: Interesting but the views are average
453149181.author: a TripAdvisor user
453149181.reviewBody: This opens at 4PM and there was already 40 min queue there. It is about 20 mins taxi from centre (cheap enough). The views are nice but nothing to fancy. You will see Cholula hill if you look closely but its nothing like London Eye or Singapore Flyer. Worth it if you have run out of things to do.

451794917.name: Ride high for a low price
451794917.author: a TripAdvisor user
451794917.reviewBody: OK, it\'s not the London Eye but it\'s a pretty neat farris wheel.  It was not at all crowded when we went and we were able to get right on.  Very nice views of the city and Popocatepetl.  Cost is only 30.00 mxn which makes it a bargain.

451373281.name: must visit
451373281.author: a TripAdvisor user
451373281.reviewBody: it is the largest Ferris wheel in Latin America and it is a must see if you visit Puebla.  The whole structure is Swiss made and the cleanliness is impressive. It gives your a birds eye view of Puebla

449851028.name: A nice way to  view the City of Puebla
449851028.author: a TripAdvisor user
449851028.reviewBody: We went to the Estrella to get a birds eye view and enjoyed the ride and view. It was our.  2nd time in Puebla so we were exploring beyond the Zocalo. It was easy to get to and fun.

447183837.name: Estrella !!!  great view from up high !!!!
447183837.author: a TripAdvisor user
447183837.reviewBody: The children  enjoyed the experience for 20 min. ... Great view of the city but I recommend to do the ride during the day . Everyone enjoyed the ride!\n\n

444662206.name: Comfortable ride, nice panoramic view
444662206.author: a TripAdvisor user
444662206.reviewBody: Ride takes about 15 minutes. Wait can vary upon the lenght of the line. Very modest Price of 30 pesos. If you want to get your own g\u00f3ndola get the VIP package 300pesos per 6 people.  If it is not crowded you can get your family / group gondola. If there is a big line you will share the ride.  The vip gondola has glass floor and leather seats.

443493165.name: Nice
443493165.author: a TripAdvisor user
443493165.reviewBody: It\'s a nice attraction, however you will depend on nice weather to see the vulcans. More than that, I\'m not sure if Puebla is the setting for these kinds of attractions. \n\nPrices are 30 pesos per person or you can take the VIP cabin for 300 pesos per cabin. The difference is individual seats for the VIP and a glass floor.

440320614.name: High and higher
440320614.author: a TripAdvisor user
440320614.reviewBody: 30 pesos for the normal one.  And VIP costs 300 per person.  Really isn\'t a difference only that it is private for you and it has leather seats and glass floor  We went at sunset and it was beautiful. You can see the volcano and is quite chilly.  It lasts about 20 min.

437509640.name: Spectacular birds eye view of city of Puebla.
437509640.author: a TripAdvisor user
437509640.reviewBody:
I visited the Ferris Wheel in the afternoon of 6th October 2016 and again in the evening next day since it was located just near my hotel.
The entrance itself is excellent greenery to relax and have a leisurely walk in the beautiful garden with fountain.
The 260 foot high, 54 gondolas wheel rotates very slowly and gives excellent views of whole of Puebla including volcanoes during daylight whereas in the darkness it gives colourful, scintillating and well spread city.
I carried can of beers to enjoy the ride. It is for relaxed and enjoyable time pass.

430555631.name: A must visit- for kind of people
430555631.author: a TripAdvisor user
430555631.reviewBody: We arrived at night (8:00) and the line was very long. we decided to arrive again in the morning (opens at 11:00). in the morning we were almost alone. \nthe view is breathtaking (in agood day of course). from in Volcanos all over the city of Puebla and the great pyramid of Chulola\nfull round of the whell is 20 minutes.

423130196.name: Nice attraction
423130196.author: a TripAdvisor user
423130196.reviewBody: The lineup to this attraction moved quite quickly and the ride itself gave you the best nighttime view of Puebla - what beauty and serenity!\n\nYou most likely will have to share a cabin with other riders if you are riding solo or in a smaller group but the lifts are large enough to accommodate 6-8 people comfortably, given the length of ride.

421873166.name: Nothing expectacular
421873166.author: a TripAdvisor user
421873166.reviewBody: Really nothing espectacular, wish it will be in another place. Not very accesible and not place to park

421480950.name: Perfect for an evening walk w/Family & your Dog
421480950.author: a TripAdvisor user
421480950.reviewBody: Take an evening stroll w/your family and pup. You won\'t be disappointed. It is beautiful in the evening. Very clean and modern all around. The cafe that is located close to the Estrella is pet friendly. The 20 minute ride on the Estrella is breath taking!! Spectacular views of the city. Something for the whole entire family to enjoy.

419994102.name: Fun for the kids
419994102.author: a TripAdvisor user
419994102.reviewBody: The kids enjoyed the experience... If they are happy everyone is!\nThere is a parking lot for $20pesos very near the Estrella.\nEveryone enjoyed the ride!

416952515.name: A nice walk around the star
416952515.author: a TripAdvisor user
416952515.reviewBody: I visited Puebla and didnt know about the estrella, it is a must. It is located in a very nice place. A walk during the night is a relaxing time. There are good restaurants and bars around. Good place to be with the family.

412069118.name: Kids love it, costs very little
412069118.author: a TripAdvisor user
412069118.reviewBody: I was with my teenage kids in Puebla for a few days. Sometimes, they forget about the great historical attractions in that city and want to pretend that they are at a theme park.  This is a great solution. It has  fantastic views, an American-style shopping mall close by, and best of all, costs less than two dollars.

408079917.name: Neat. Scary but really neat.
408079917.author: a TripAdvisor user
408079917.reviewBody: We did the VIP car and it was really neat. The times I could open my eyes it was gorgeous. It\'s high, I won\'t lie. But it moves smoothly and you can close your eyes if you get scared. A friend told me. :) it\'s worth doing and we liked the VIP option.

397147806.name: Estrella de Puebla
397147806.author: a TripAdvisor user
397147806.reviewBody: Main attraction to see the whole city and enjoy the view, the price per person is less than $2 dollars. Children and teenagers will enjoy the 29 minutes ride, it goes very slow. Puebla is a fantastic city with many cultural and tourism attractions.

394959319.name: Worth a visit
394959319.author: a TripAdvisor user
394959319.reviewBody: The wheel gives a overview of Puebla and Cholula. Must visit when one goes to Puebla or Cholula.....

387027503.name: Beautiful view of Puebla
387027503.author: a TripAdvisor user
387027503.reviewBody: If you want to see Puebla from another point of view. Nice and comfortable cabins with air conditioning.

382749622.name: Beautiful at night
382749622.author: a TripAdvisor user
382749622.reviewBody: The Ferris wheel is a time honoured attraction - and no, they are not all the same for obvious reasons.\n\nThe Ferris wheel in Puebla is a government sponsored mammoth of a project and riding it by night, I can say that this is just amazing. The ride is long enough and he movement is smooth and relaxing. Recommended!

360764532.name: Nice!
360764532.author: a TripAdvisor user
360764532.reviewBody: There are two rates: regular and VIP. Regular is $30 pesos and VIP $300 pesos, each person.\nFor VIP you get fast access, can get some drinks and seats are more comfortable, but that\'s it. I did not pay $270 pesos difference, from my point of view, not worthy.

360526051.name: a normal ferris wheel
360526051.author: a TripAdvisor user
360526051.reviewBody: if you realy have nothing to do and you already have seen everything in puebla and also some towns that surround the city like atlixco and cholula, then you can visit this attraction. it seems to be a good spot for watching sunset

358609702.name: Very good view!
358609702.author: a TripAdvisor user
358609702.reviewBody: We have no lines to see it.. the sistem is very modern, and the local price very good!, the view is fantastic, if you get a clear day.. I would not bother with the VIP room..

347648097.name: Great affordable attraction
347648097.author: a TripAdvisor user
347648097.reviewBody: The expensive taxi (\u00dcber is really difficult to get in Puebla) was worth. It takes around 15 minutes to be up and down at a very slow pace you don\'t even notice the thing is moving. I paid around $4USD for two tickets. Later I discovered the VIP ticket is around $15USD for up to six people includes exclusive cabin with glass floor.

345999005.name: Biggest ferris wheel ever
345999005.author: a TripAdvisor user
345999005.reviewBody: We went during the holiday, so the line was sooooo long, so purchasing the VIP ticket was the best decision. We had 6 people, 3 really did not like ferris wheels. Everyone had a great time and never really felt too scared. It is tall but being totally enclosed, even with the VIP see-through bottom, things went very well. The night time was very nice but I plan to ride it during the day to see the difference in views. Highly recommend it!

342672570.name: Get a VIP cabin and have great views at night
342672570.author: a TripAdvisor user
342672570.reviewBody:
We were a party of five and we reserved a VIP cabin for 7:30 in the evening.

The VIP cabins offers a better seating that the standard ones and also offers a clear floor,

The organization is impeccable and the staff is very courteous, also the ride is so smooth that you will hardly notice that you are moving all the way up.

The city looks great from the top, next time I visit I will at dusk to enjoy the mountains on the horizon.

339830086.name: It\'s a big ferris wheel
339830086.author: a TripAdvisor user
339830086.reviewBody: We went at night with a lot of family and friends. The line moved quickly. The gondolas are very modern and comfortable. We had great views of the city and Christmas lights. One of the best parts was the lighted fountains in the park near the ferris wheel. I\'d go again in the daytime to see the mountains. It was fun, but it\'s still just a ferris wheel.

339614333.name: very good atraction
339614333.author: a TripAdvisor user
339614333.reviewBody: this is one of the new developments in puebla, you can buy 2 kind of tickets, one of them have a 360 view of the city

333752592.name: Poor Management
333752592.author: a TripAdvisor user
333752592.reviewBody: Estrella de Puebla, The Star of Puebla, is listed as one of the 10 must see places in the City of the same name. Too bad the planning and management of such attraction, no other thing that a big Ferris Wheel, has a lot to improve. On three different times I have attempted to ride the wheel.  The first year, over 2 years ago, upon our arrival we were told the wheel was not functioning because of maintenance issues, the second year the same.  This month, a friend drove all the way from Veracruz to meet with me in Puebla, I live in North East USA.  My friend took her granddaughter for the only purpose she could ride the wheel.  In the Tourist Information Office, Downtown Puebla,  we verified that the wheel was in operation, as it is advertised in the Travel brochure issued by Secretaria de Turismo,  we were assured it was, Saturdays and Sundays 11 am till 9.30 PM.  The following day, December 13,  after 11 AM,  we took a cab to ride the F-Wheel.  Several workers, over 10  were there, we asked at what time would they wheel be functioning,  were informed that the F-Wheel was not in operation because of maintenance.  We asked how long the maintenance issue would take place, we were told it could be an hour or more. We waited an hour, were back to the same group of workers, who were doing nothing but chatting, we asked whether they knew when the issue would be resolved or whether the following day SUNDAY, would be in operation, they did not know, they could not give us a website or a phone number to check out whether the wheel would function . From my observation and talking to other people around,  I think there were not mechanical issues with the F-Wheel,  only POOR Management. It would be better to inform the public the Star of Puebla only shines week-ends at night ( maybe), or at least have a phone number or website where you can verify, before you go,  whether it is operation or not.  The workers told us....IF YOU SEE THE WHEEL MOVING, THEN IT IS WORKING...it is hard from Downtown Puebla to see whether the F-Wheel is moving or not. Unless you can verify it is working before you go I would not recommend to go unless you want to visit the Shopping Mall, and for me a Shopping Mall is another Shopping Mall as many others around the world.

328593881.name: Fantastic view of the complete City
328593881.author: a TripAdvisor user
328593881.reviewBody: This place is a nice opportunity to see the complete City view and to realize how large is Puebla, the access is very quick and the fare is very affordable. The facilities are always clean and the service is very friendly.

322040601.name: Great fun way to see the city
322040601.author: a TripAdvisor user
322040601.reviewBody: We were a little surprised that we felt a little scared as rose to the top.  I don\'t normally get vertigo, but this made me a little wobbly.  It takes about 20 minutes for a full revolution, you can have up to 8 people in a pod with you, but we were on our own as it was a quiet weekday evening.  Great views across the city and on a clear day over to the volcanoes.

298500894.name: good place to excercise and to visit
298500894.author: a TripAdvisor user
298500894.reviewBody: very modern \u00e1rea of the city where you can jog, walk or do some cycling there are many places to visti in the arround like angelopolis shopping center , parque del ni\u00f1o poblano , jard\u00edn del arte, etc

298313126.name: Awesome Views!!!
298313126.author: a TripAdvisor user
298313126.reviewBody: We took a VIP ride in the early afternoon.  The VIP cabin was not that much more expensive given that we had a party of 6, it made the most sense.  It has a glass floor and comfortable seats.  The ride is so smooth you barely realize you are moving.  We had excellent views of the volcanos, the churches, and plazas.  It was a great experience.  Out front is a splash pad too!!!  The kids had a great time.  Bring extra clothes, they will get wet!!!!

275089461.name: Mexican Eye of London
275089461.author: a TripAdvisor user
275089461.reviewBody: Great view, good price. Good speed and not too long. Right next to a shopping center and food hall. Nice corridor to walk and shop in vecinity.

263087382.name: Puebla\'s version of the London Eye
263087382.author: a TripAdvisor user
263087382.reviewBody: Great view of the area and not nearly as expensive as the Eye.  Don\'t exactly recall, but I think it was around 40 pesos.  It is located in the upscale shopping area of Liverpool and there is even a Costco there (just like home - if you\'re dying for a hot dog!)  Nice area to take a walk too - lots of elevated sidewalks so you don\'t need to deal with the traffic.

257577347.name: Wow
257577347.author: a TripAdvisor user
257577347.reviewBody: I was in Puebla area for a week.    I enjoyed the city so much.  Enjoyed everything about the city and all it had to offer.

247011429.name: I just love it
247011429.author: a TripAdvisor user
247011429.reviewBody: First of all the price, way way cheaper than any (that size) ferrys weel i have ever visitied, great view of the city, secure area, family friendly and close to the mall, what else can you possible ask. Great experience. The parking is a bit tricky cause your are not supposed to park in front of the attraction but if you park in the mall is about 25 MXN, yes Nothing! tickets are around 40MXN \nClean facility and there is also a coffee/restaurant right there, its a most in my book, you can spend easily 3 hours there and if you have kids there are some water games to get your little ones entertained

243642269.name: Excellent Service
243642269.author: a TripAdvisor user
243642269.reviewBody:
There´s an employ name Juan Carlos, it's the best.
They know everything, the size, tall, speed. 
He made our visit so special, and unique.
No like others than only screamming you to move and be faster in stead of enjoying your visit.

240278698.name: Overview over Puebla and surrounding
240278698.author: a TripAdvisor user
240278698.reviewBody: Located on one of Puebla\u00b4s highest points you have a wonderful view over city and the landscape. On a clear and sunny day you can see from above the snow covered top of Pico de Orizaba - Mexico highest mountain - more than hundred kilometers far south. Go there at Sunset and when the sun sinks in the west behind the two famous vulcanos - Popo and Itza - It\u00b4s a magic moment that you will never forget.

235106246.name: Nice ride over Puebla
235106246.author: a TripAdvisor user
235106246.reviewBody: It is a very nice ride which lasts around 20 minutes. The view is not spectacular, but it is quite pretty. The price is fair and if you are a group of 6, I recommend paying for the VIP, it\'s a better cabin and you end up paying almost the same price per person. The staff is very kind. Maybe not the must important attraction in town, but I recommend going if you already been to Puebla and its surroundings.

230691039.name: An okay ride.
230691039.author: a TripAdvisor user
230691039.reviewBody: We went at night, couldn\'t really see a while lot, wasn\'t to exciting and we all just ended up talking and joking around while on the ride. It was okay, it was pretty as it was lit up at night, but that was looking at it and not being on it. I would say try during the day time, might be a little more exciting.

205011428.name: Definitively Worth a Visit
205011428.author: a TripAdvisor user
205011428.reviewBody: I was surprised to read negative reviews of this sight.  Long wait to see it?  We waited in line on a Saturday afternoon in May, at about noon, for less than a minute.  Depending on the weather, you can see all the major sights including Cholula, downtown including the cathedral, the planetarium, etc, etc, etc. Mornings are apparently the best time with less cloud cover, or at night we were told. I recommend early in the day. I suppose it depends on how familiar you are with Puebla.  Take advantage of the knowledge of others in the glass box with you.  Ask questions.  The ride takes about 20 minutes.  For 30 pesos, it is one of the best bargains around.

203389472.name: there\'s nothing interesting to observe
203389472.author: a TripAdvisor user
203389472.reviewBody: Come on! It\'s called and Observation wheel! But there\'s nothing to observe!! The wheel is very nice, new, working good, cheap ticket, but at the end you get to see a huge shopping mall and a parking lot....Downtown Puebla is too far away as well as Cholula\'s piramid and church.

190990767.name: Nice view but it is just a wheel.
190990767.author: a TripAdvisor user
190990767.reviewBody: Honestly its just a wheel but if you go at the time the sun sets you can have a very nice view and a nice experience overall. You should be aware that the wheel only goes around once but very slow (20 mins approx). Another plus is the VIP wagon which has see through glass on the bottom but is more pricey, if you just go on the regular ones the price is ok.

184902193.name: great view
184902193.author: a TripAdvisor user
184902193.reviewBody: It has a great view and it worth the effort to go there it is on the outskirts of the city. The ride goes slow so dont expect a thrill ride. The cabins are comfortable espicially the vip ones. Would do again

178339759.name: Nothing to brag about
178339759.author: a TripAdvisor user
178339759.reviewBody: If Puebla\'s Governor Rafael Moreno Valle wanted to compete with the London Eye in his desperate career towards the presidency of M\u00e9xico, this is not the best he could do. This is a wheel, just a wheel, like any big wheel in any amusement park, except that this one has been on and off for a while, it doesn\'t seem to work all the time. People in Puebla call it "the wheel of fortune", who knows why. In any case, if on top of the wheel you may have a good sight on the volcanoes in clear days, the site is nothing compared to the London Wheel just over River Thames and so near the Big Ben.

172431299.name: Nice place
172431299.author: a TripAdvisor user
172431299.reviewBody: This wheel is a good new place to go in Puebla. It is a great alternative to the very popular city center and other over-visted sites. The ride lasts ~25 mins but expect to be in line at least an hour . They have 2 different types of cabins the regular and the VIP cabins. We took the VIP and it is definitely worth it. It has a clear floor to see the shrinking ground below you. Sadly there are only 4 VIP cabins so you will have to wait even more of one of those. Another bad thing is that the staff favors the nearby business owners and allow them to cut everybody in line to the first available VIP cabin. If you do not speak spanish you will probably be at the mercy of a kind visitor to translate because there are no signs in English...

675038423.name: Overrated
675038423.author: a TripAdvisor user
675038423.reviewBody:
The building is great, but it seems as if the collection does not match - it would make a lot more sense in a more “barroque” setting downtown. 

The museum is hugely over staffed so you can’t breathe without anyone looking over your shoulder. Finally, my wife could not come in with her standard size purse, and we could not carry our baby’s water bottle. In trying to imitate world renowned museums, people confuse enforcing absurd rules with creating a civil space in which to learn.

666191422.name: Magnificent Building, Garden, and Collection
666191422.author: a TripAdvisor user
666191422.reviewBody: This is a must see in Puebla.  Truly a world class museum.  I have never encountered a staff this courteous at a museum.  They open the doors for you when you enter and when you appear lost they approach and politely ask if they can help.

662593824.name: Do not miss this museum-  magnificent edifice as well as installation on the Baroque.
662593824.author: a TripAdvisor user
662593824.reviewBody: Well worth the 15 minute Uber ride to see this extraordinary place. I have visited museums all over the world and this ranks in the top. Just extraordinary by a Pritzker winner architect. ell designed, inside and out. I understand there is a great place to eat as well. The outside is fabulous and wonderful area to wonder.  Please visit!

659698733.name: Amazing!
659698733.author: a TripAdvisor user
659698733.reviewBody: This new museum is a 20 minute cab ride from central Puebla but should not be missed. The architecture is stunning and the exhibition amazing. Newest technology makes the art come alive..\nAlso, the main restaurant is among the best in all of Mexico. Our lunch was outstanding and we were sorry that we did not return in the evening.

659374191.name: Glorious building, collection at present not so glorious.
659374191.author: a TripAdvisor user
659374191.reviewBody: This is a new museum in a newer area of the city.  The building which is by the Japanese architect, Toyo Ito, is spectacular.  Worth visiting the Museum for that alone.  The installation of the exhibits is also done with enormous elan, you feel you are going through a number of staged sets, which in a way you are.  This compensates for the fact that the actual collection that the Museum has is rather sparse, most of the things of view have been loaned.  I imagine in time this paucity will be dealt with, so go and enjoy the building and the installation both of which are well worth the trip out to the Zaragoza area of Puebla.

655919873.name: Puebla from a whole new perspective!
655919873.author: a TripAdvisor user
655919873.reviewBody:
I would rate this Museum as one of the top three museums we have seen in the world - and we have seen many!
The building itself is a marvel, the exhibitions are extremely  creative, rich in detail and broad in concept with many interactive displays and state of the art presentations.
