It shed a whole new light  for me on  Baroque and its impact worldwide as well as its specific impact on Puebla and Mexico.
Since it is well outside the historic centre, it would have been easy to decide to give it a pass but I would rate it as one of the top attractions to see in Puebla.
Two hours flew by and was crowned with a beautiful meal in the restaurant upstairs.

653799331.name: One of the world\u2019s best designed museums
653799331.author: a TripAdvisor user
653799331.reviewBody: One of the best designed museums in the world. The exhibits cover music, art, books, and architecture from the baroque period. Don\u2019t miss the \u201cForbidden Books\u201d book, which is easy to miss. Give yourself about 2 hours to see everything. (February 2019)

653574984.name: A must see !
653574984.author: a TripAdvisor user
653574984.reviewBody: Make the time, at least 4-6 hours to read and enjoy all that it has to offer. Eat in the restaurant on the patio and enjoy this beautiful building with seven stages of displays. I had no idea the Baroque period was so rich with discoveries and art, weaving, painting. And ethnocentric as well, historically.

649231977.name: Free on Wednesday
649231977.author: a TripAdvisor user
649231977.reviewBody: We came mainly to see an interesting architecture of the building,  but enjoyed the collection as well.  Staff is supper friendly,  we were thanked for visiting multiple times.  \n\nAs we walked around the museum building on Sunday, additional pleasure for us was seeing a huge off-leash dog park just behind the museum, a true dog haven.

648761004.name: Worth a trip to Puebla!
648761004.author: a TripAdvisor user
648761004.reviewBody: This museum is fantastic - the architecture, the displays, the use of technology as a learning tool, the restaurant.  We spent over 4 hours here and could still have enjoyed more time. I learned so much about an era that was relatively unknown to me.  We used a Museum guide, Damien, and it was well worth the ten dollars for a comprehensive look into the world of everything baroque.  \nVisiting here was the highlight of my recent trip to Mexico.

647423152.name: A must see
647423152.author: a TripAdvisor user
647423152.reviewBody: I personally don\u2019t actually love the Baroque as a style but had already been warned by friends to \u2018ignore the art and enjoy the museum\u2019 which is indeed incredibly beautiful modern architecture with fantastic interactive exhibits. We spent a happy morning and would go back for more.

646053010.name: The Batrroque Museum a must in Puebla
646053010.author: a TripAdvisor user
646053010.reviewBody: One of the most complete collection of baroque art in the world is presented in a magnificent contemporary architecture. A must see in Puebla!

645849811.name: Cool Place
645849811.author: a TripAdvisor user
645849811.reviewBody: Not expecting such a nice museum, tottaly worth it, you must try their restaurant  is amazing, but a bit expensive,

639982588.name: Unexpected modern museum on an often misunderstood concept: Baroque culture.
639982588.author: a TripAdvisor user
639982588.reviewBody: I was expecting displays of merely an architectural style.  Instead, I discovered that the term Baroque permeates other areas of expression including painting and way of thinking that refuses to pass down historically.  The term was adopted as an adjective  in dictionaries to mean extravagantly ornate, florid, and convoluted in character or style. ( Dictionary.com).

639940249.name: see it after seeing Puebla
639940249.author: a TripAdvisor user
639940249.reviewBody: This impressive building is a little far from the Historic Center. The only way to get there is by car. It contains everything you need to know about the Baroque, including music and literature. It is great to have that one period of art history so well separated from the others. The modern technology in the museum, if you like technology, is very impressive. The building is spacious and, what\'s rare, it is not tiring at all. They have a wonderful miniature town of Puebla, great fun to see, and a miniature theater where a baroque opera is shown on screen. The art on display is mostly (very high quality) Mexican, but they do have temporary exhibits. The way the building is constructed you are never far away from daylight and you never feel boxed in. Of course, Puebla as a city has attractions that should be seen first, but I do recommend visiting this place, which is, in many ways, unique.

635910035.name: Outstanding museum!
635910035.author: a TripAdvisor user
635910035.reviewBody: We thought this museum, located in a spacious, gorgeous new building, was really interesting and absolutely worth visiting.  The history of the Baroque period, and it\'s impact on the world was really well curated.  We learned so much through the interactive exhibits and displays.  We\'ve been to museums all over the world and this one was just really well done. The investment in the building, the collection and the way things were displayed and organized was impressive.  I didn\'t realize how many beautiful baroque cities there are around the world, and how important the style was in it\'s day, despite visiting many of the cities featured on the global map in the museum.  It was really quiet on a weekday.  A must visit!  Our favorite museum of the trip.  Note there is a very good restaurant on site.

634262403.name: Amazing arquitechture
634262403.author: a TripAdvisor user
634262403.reviewBody: Since you arrive to this place you will see an extraordinary building. \nThis place is a must if you are visiting Puebla.\nInside you will see a really nice exposition of the Barroc. Since literature, textile and of course paintings.

634042415.name: Unbelievable museum
634042415.author: a TripAdvisor user
634042415.reviewBody: New and interactive this museum is amazing!  I have no interest in Catholicism and didn\u2019t think I\u2019d care for representation of this time period. However.... I was blown away. Helps that the museum is so modern and interactive. Bring a jacket. It\u2019s very cool. And the seating is all steel benches!   But there\u2019s lots of it. And lots of reason to go slowly!

633681977.name: Long drive for something we didn\'t expect
633681977.author: a TripAdvisor user
633681977.reviewBody: Questionable why these baroque outfits and artifacts are in a totally modern museum.  The building doesn\'t match the collection.  It\'s hard to look at the exhibits knowing what these clergymen and rulers did to the indigenous peoples.  The one high point is the great exhibit of historic Puebla and the vieos of people in period clothing.

633379566.name: Stunning!
633379566.author: a TripAdvisor user
633379566.reviewBody: The building, interior space and layout and flow between galleries and spaces is striking. Original pieces are surprisingly few for large museum, but as such you\u2019re not overwhelmed and we never tired during 4 hour visit. Video, audio and digital interactive installations are very smart and additive to the experience, which is quite an accomplishment. The second floor restaurant is superb and reasonably priced for such luxury. We had a great time here and I would visit again.

633183859.name: Brand new!
633183859.author: a TripAdvisor user
633183859.reviewBody: Visited as part of a family trip to Puebla, after a recommendation from a good friend. We enjoyed it so much. The place is an architectural wonder! Exhibitions are very well set, and the combination of traditional settings with multi-media is just great. Also, the museum is large enough for a solid 3-hr visit, which makes it enjoyable without saturation. The interactive room in the second floor is great for adults and kids. And! There is a great restaurant in the premises that we promised to visit next time around. Stay tuned!

632939060.name: One of the best museums I have ever visited
632939060.author: a TripAdvisor user
632939060.reviewBody: There are no words to describe this marvelous museum. From the breathtaking modern architecture to the stunning interactive exhibits. Every aspect of the baroque period with emphasis in Puebla is covered. It was an unexpected and stunning surprise. Definitely a must for every visitor to this charming city.

631398918.name: Extraordinary
631398918.author: a TripAdvisor user
631398918.reviewBody: Beautiful museum. The building is very modern and the expositions are extraordinary. Resaturant is great as well.

631256503.name: Amazing museum!
631256503.author: a TripAdvisor user
631256503.reviewBody:
This is a beautifully curated museum, it does everything the Museo Soumaya wants to be and just cant. 

The architecture is stunning and the collection is impressive and with not as much pieces as you would expect achive a sense of significance and educational purpose like few museums can achieve (and I just went to the MET last week). 

The museum restaurant "Barroco" is delicious. It is a forced stop too. 

Also the public pack in the back of the museum is gorgeously well preserved. This is a beautiful stop to make in Puebla. Highly reccomended.

616243643.name: Amazing, modern building with lots of treasures inside.
616243643.author: a TripAdvisor user
616243643.reviewBody: This is a relatively new museum in  Puebla, within a very modern building built and designed by a japanese architect, the forms and light enhance all the art inside this museum. It is the first museum I have seen that is specialized in baroque art and it is AMAZING. Covering different aspects of the baroque (painting, sculpture, music, clothing, etc). We hired a private guide within the museum that made the experience even better, since she gave us additional information to that exposed in the museum. It also has a very nice coffee shop, a lake that separates the museum from a public garden, so you can make pauses within your visit that will help you enjoy even more. We went with our 2 kids (3 and 6 years old) and they enjoyed it very much as well. There is a room designed for kids, in which they can play with toys and artifacts that resemble some of the art exposed in the museum, they can dress up, make puzzles, and other activities that help them learn and get involved with the baroque art. Congratulations for this museum! It is a MUST-SEE in Puebla, don\'t miss it!

613781920.name: Impressive architecture!
613781920.author: a TripAdvisor user
613781920.reviewBody: The International Museum of the is a museum of Baroque art designed by Japanese architect Toyoo Ito. The combination of cutting edge audio/visual and well curated objects really explains the Baroque period. The museum itself is another work of art that envelops the visitor. We had dinner at their great restaurant( separate review)\nDefinitely a must while in Puebla.\n

613547965.name: Wonderful and amazing
613547965.author: a TripAdvisor user
613547965.reviewBody: This museum should be your first--or maybe your last--stop in Puebla. The combination of cutting edge audio/visual and carefully chosen objects really explains the Baroque period. The museum itself is another work of art that envelops the visitor (check out the architectural exhibit in the Library).  The restaurant has the most beautiful presentation of food that I\'ve ever experienced and I wish I could have afforded (or been able to pack) the Mexican folk art on sale at the gift shop. Along with the Amparo, this was the highlight museum of my visit.

612650406.name: beautiful building
612650406.author: a TripAdvisor user
612650406.reviewBody: the exhibition set aside. The Barroque musueum building is beautiful. Inspired by a Japanese architect, It has beautiful lines and textures. Rolled rug seats and a great restaurant with a wonderful terrace to have a dink and watch the sunset . This new side of Puebla is worth exploring

612354007.name: Beautifull museum, aggresive security, unwelcoming atmosphere
612354007.author: a TripAdvisor user
612354007.reviewBody: The Museum has some excellent videos on Baroque origins and influences in art, music, theater and architecture. There is a mysterious order to the labyrinth of exhibit rooms. There are scads of uniformed monitors to make sure you dare not view out of order. Tne attitude overshadowed the rest of the experience and I left wanting to curse.\nThe exhibits were great, and I enjoyed the projected scenes on the domed ceiling.  Having enjoyed visits to museums in Mexico for over 40 years, I was suprised and offended by the staff and overall pretentious atmosphere of tbis place. I went alone, that may be why it bugged me so much. I would like to spend some more time in some of the exhibits but not sure I can stand the BS again.

607387536.name: Great museum in Puebla
607387536.author: a TripAdvisor user
607387536.reviewBody: This place is absolutely great!! Since arquitecture to its collections. Located in Angelopolis (new part of the city, 20 minutes away from downtown), taxi charges about $90-$100 MXP from downtown.\n\nThe visit is really woth it!!

603699426.name: The best museum ever
603699426.author: a TripAdvisor user
603699426.reviewBody: Is a great place to learn about the baroque un all the world, the collections are very good organized. The staff are friendly and gente, the kid room is very educative and didactic.

601456595.name: A Must See in Puebla
601456595.author: a TripAdvisor user
601456595.reviewBody:
We knew very little about the Baroque when we went to this museum.  We left feeling like we had learned a ton in an engaging format.  This museum is a must see for the architecture of the museum, the quality of the displays, the helpfulness of staff and the fascinating way you are taken through the information on the Baroque.  
We didn't have our kids with us, but there is a nice kids area on the upper floor. 
We had a meal at the cafe restaurant and it was delicious!
Behind the museum there is a nice outdoor green space with art-it was a nice compliment to all the inside viewing that you do in the museum.

599826756.name: Visit Mexico, visit Puebla, visit the museum
599826756.author: a TripAdvisor user
599826756.reviewBody: Once I saw in the news that the museum was open, I wonder to visit the city. Finally my dream came true this month. The avant-garde building structure contrasts with its insides, a historic legacy and a description of the content. You can walk thru it in about 1:15 hours and enjoy a well curated exhibition distributed thematically by different aspects of the normal life. The pieces belong to private collections or are part of the Baroque International Museum. By visiting this place, I learned  things still unknown for me.

597065745.name: Wacky
597065745.author: a TripAdvisor user
597065745.reviewBody: Great building (really interesting); the collection not so great, but the garden is fabulous and a must see.

596207794.name: Go here first in Puebla
596207794.author: a TripAdvisor user
596207794.reviewBody: I saved this for almost last during my Puebla visit and that was a mistake. It gives an incredible explanation of baroque art, architecture, fashion, music and culture that would have been excellent background for just about every other place that I visited here. Be sure to make time for the wonderful restaurant on the top floor.

582940608.name: Don\'t Miss the Ecoparque Backing the Museum
582940608.author: a TripAdvisor user
582940608.reviewBody: The sidewalk at the front of the museum goes to the right around the museum and leads to the stunning new ecoparque. In addition to plants and lawns, there are stone tunnels, water features and sculptures. All of contemporary/ indigenous design that works very well with the museum.

582066747.name: A surprisingly pleasant museum - more whys than whats
582066747.author: a TripAdvisor user
582066747.reviewBody: An excellent experience.  it is not about the art works as to why and how and more.  deals with baroque painting, architecture, music, dance, singing, and more. the local exhibition was ok but the permanent part is very well done.  hats off to the staff who are quickly and knowledgably available.  nice restaurant also.  a class operation.  congrats to the leaders

581322931.name: A great window to baroque art
581322931.author: a TripAdvisor user
581322931.reviewBody: This museum is an absolute must, and if you can afford at lest four hours, can be a great teach in in the art of baroque.Baroque architecture is not everybody\u00b4s cup of tea, and I remember many years ago an Italian priest in the Church Santa Maria del Popolo in Rome telling that his church was one in which baroque did "least damage" to classical art of renaissance. This museum gives many definitions of baroque including a derogatory one offered by the French. The museum is incredibly well laid out full of interactive video vehicles, and documentary movies. It showcases baroque (giving contemporary comparisons with Europe) in architecture, painting, sculpture, music, literature, theatre ... If you can find a guide get one, it is somewhat overwhelming to try to absorb it all ....\nThe museum shop is beautiful and offer many interesting replicas.

579997916.name: Beautiful new museum
579997916.author: a TripAdvisor user
579997916.reviewBody: Interest in Baroque civilization is a specialization, granted, but if you have any interest in it at all, this is the place to go.  Remember that Baroque was the predominate style during the early colonial period in Mexico and hence its importance.  The museum is in a dramatic new building about a fifteen minute ride from the center of Puebla.  Beautiful exhibits in large spaces cover philosophy, religion, art, architecture, drama, crafts of the Baroque period.  :You can listen to music, watch a play (a tape) in a facsimile theater, etc.  Restaurant and gift shop (both expensive).

579034186.name: unique museum
579034186.author: a TripAdvisor user
579034186.reviewBody: About 10 large chambers with music light and - great art,  Unusual contemporary multimedia fabulous presentation

577241920.name: Fabulouso!!!!
577241920.author: a TripAdvisor user
577241920.reviewBody: This was an unexpected delight to visit this Museo and exhibition. Recommended to us by an Uber driver!!! What a complete, jaw dropping, wonderful exhibit,. Every period of Barroque was depicted, well labeled and both in English and Spanish. I was in awe of this museum, one of the best hands down I have visited in my extensive travels. It\u2019s large so allow adequate time to stroll through and absorb it all. Entrance fee was nominal and free forMexican residents.

573103554.name: Not to be missed
573103554.author: a TripAdvisor user
573103554.reviewBody: This is a very interesting museum. The juxtaposition of Ito\'s very modern, stunning architecture and the technology used to present information with the ornate art of the baroque make it particularly striking. I also really liked the thematic organization of the museum.  Don\'t miss the beautiful Ecopark behind the museum.

568350716.name: Not To Be Missed!
568350716.author: a TripAdvisor user
568350716.reviewBody: What a wonderful museum experience. From the modern exterior to the internal courtyard to the exhibits, this is a great museum. The temporary exhibits are amazing - at least when I went in December - I was treated to marvelous works of contemporary art. The Baroque exhibit is informative and comprehensive, taking into consideration the many aspects of life in the Baroque period. Also, wonderful to see were the commissioned pieces by Dali for Dante\'s Inferno.

567121050.name: Amazing building. Less moved by ths contents
567121050.author: a TripAdvisor user
567121050.reviewBody: This museum is worth visiting for the building alone. It is stunning. It is located on the very edge of the city so it is a bit of a trek if you are staying in the historic centre. We arrived in the middle of a free baroque recital which was nice. There was also an interesting temporary exhibition on following the theme of the sun and moon. The permanent exposition didn\'t much call our attention, neither did the cafe. However, there is a lovely ecopark right behind the museum which is worth visiting on a day when it isn\'t too hot.

564463513.name: The best museum you  can visit in Puebla
564463513.author: a TripAdvisor user
564463513.reviewBody: This place starts with a very nice building from Toyo Ito and a complete sort of practical and religious instruments from Mexico in the 16th, 17th, 18h and 19th century, worth to visit

561817906.name: Interesting
561817906.author: a TripAdvisor user
561817906.reviewBody: Great museum to learn about baroque, not a big collection of pieces though, but worth the visit. The architecture is just stunning!\nTickets: $80 per person\n

560835450.name: Roast beef
560835450.author: a TripAdvisor user
560835450.reviewBody: This museum is worth the visit. The exhibits are professionally displayed. The visit actually was memorable thanks to the roast beef sandwich served in the museum. Sorry to be so shallow, but baroque is not my first choice.

559082029.name: Well worth it
559082029.author: a TripAdvisor user
559082029.reviewBody: Not so much a collection of baroque stuff, but rather an observation of the meaning of \u2018baroque, as it applies to our culture in general. Generously supplied with information in English, housed in a truly spectacular modern, very photogenic building. Their restaurant is also very good.

556773668.name: Very interesting
556773668.author: a TripAdvisor user
556773668.reviewBody: A beautiful building with masses of well explained exhibits. Lovely terrace with imaginative food and drink. Overall it was a fabulous experience and quite overwhelming. The staff were knowledgeable and very helpful.

556563316.name: Not a good use of time
556563316.author: a TripAdvisor user
556563316.reviewBody: There is not much to see here at all. Even the building is just ok. And it is so far from the other Puebla attractions in the center of the city that it\'s a long trip there and back, assuming you can get back since Uber requires the pick up point at the hotel across a busy 8 lane highway that you must cross (pray first).  The museum also closes at a whim. They promote being open till 7 but I wouldn\'t count on it. Overall, life is short, use your time wisely.

553825656.name: Lots to see and a nice restaurant
553825656.author: a TripAdvisor user
553825656.reviewBody: This museum is a bit outside Puebla, so there is a taxi involved, but only about 80-90 pesos.  I spent several hours looking at the temporary exhibits (contemporary arts) then went upstairs for lunch in the restaurant which was quite upscale, and good.  Then I returned to go through the permanent exhibits which were about the Barouque (barroco) period in various parts of the world...and many aspects (arts, decoration, fashion, science, theater, music)...including a very large scale model of Puebla.  Definitely worth a visit for me.

553803799.name: The building and collection exceed expectations
553803799.author: a TripAdvisor user
553803799.reviewBody: This newly open museum brings together the former collections of up to three different museums. In a magnificent setting, it captures a special area in Mexico history

550102525.name: Great museum to appreciate Baroque
550102525.author: a TripAdvisor user
550102525.reviewBody: The new Museo Internacional del Barroco is already impressive with its new architecture from the outside. The museum is located at the Boulevard Atlixcayotl  - a new development zone in the southwest of Puebla. Around 20-30 min. from the Zocalo.\nThe museum is great to appreciate the history of baroque, it is devided into several sections like architecture, paintings, music, theatre, science etc. Each section explains the topic and showcases various examples from Puebla and other cities around the world. Also in each section there are videos and interactive screens to explain the topic.\nThe museum is really worth a visit.

549521330.name: Opulent but beautiful
549521330.author: a TripAdvisor user
549521330.reviewBody: The architecture of the museum is a sight to be seen, feels a bit opulent for Puebla. It takes a couple of hours to see the whole place. I recommend taking a 70 peso Uber from downtown Puebla as it\u2019s not within walking distance from the Centro.

547920832.name: Very strange new museum
547920832.author: a TripAdvisor user
547920832.reviewBody: The first thing: If you take a local bus to this museum, it passes it on the highway, then does a u turn and stops at the CCU a few blocke away.\nThis museum is rather large and has a range of displays all having to do with every aspect of Baroque art. It is worth visiting, but the bus ride is rather long to get there.

546130678.name: A big surprise
546130678.author: a TripAdvisor user
546130678.reviewBody: We weren\'t sure what to expect. There was a Salvador Dali exhibit depicting Dante\'s epic work The Divine Comedy. The permanent collection features period pieces from France and Italy, the history of music and how it developed over the ages, the influence countries had on one another. Our favourite exhibit was a scale model of Puebla. As various building light up, a slide show features visual highlights with musical accompaniment. The architecture of the building is stunning. Well worth a visit. There is a small admission fee - discount for seniors.

545861349.name: Beautiful Place, Too Bad the People Are Ugly
545861349.author: a TripAdvisor user
545861349.reviewBody:
This is a beautiful building, and no expense has been spared in creating technologically interesting information about the baroque period, and the baroque buildings in Puebla.
Unfortunately, we met with one catastrophic encounter after another with staff. 
First, we wandered into room "7" in part because the layout and suggested route is not clearly marked. We were literally accosted by a museum employee who insisted very aggressively and rudely that we leave immediately, and go through the museum in order. He told us we couldn't come back until we understood a little about the baroque period. As a university professor I found this assumption offensive, but it was his demeanor that was the most offensive. Nonetheless, in an effort to be agreeable, we began to walk out of that section to try to go through rooms 1-6. The nasty employee then called ahead to a colleague on his walkie-talkie to make sure we left his section. This man accosted us and literally escorted us out. 
After that terrible experience we should have left, but we wanted to give the place a chance and dutifully completed rooms 1-8. We then decided to try the highly reviewed restaurant. Then things went from bad to worse. The restaurant, like the museum, was beautiful but empty. We ordered two meals and a bottle of wine. As is customary in fine restaurants in Mexico, the waiter poured the wine and we did not have access to the bottle. When we were finished and asked for the check we were charged for a bottle of wine and three glasses. We politely asked why and reminded the waiter that we had ordered a bottle. In fact, the wine we were drinking was not even on the menu by the glass. That was when the trouble began. Not only did the waiter try to fight with us over this, his captain did as well. Their rudeness was part and parcel of the whole nasty experience at this museum. I wish I had never gone, and it is very clear why this beautiful spot and restaurant are so terribly empty.

544628847.name: Worthwhile
544628847.author: a TripAdvisor user
544628847.reviewBody: We took a $4 uber ride to the museum and spent about one hour touring.   There are some english explanations, which really helped add to our experience.    We thought it was a very worthwhile visit.

544456295.name: Allow plenty time...and stay for lunch!
544456295.author: a TripAdvisor user
544456295.reviewBody: Whether or not you are a knowledgeable art enthusiast, your visit to this impressive New museum will be memorable.  You will leave feeling that your knowledge of the baroque period and its world view has been vastly expanded.  The building itself is a visual treat, and you will be impressed with the state-of-the-art interactive educational options at your fingertips.  Consider topping off your visit with a unique and lovely dining experience.

539847236.name: Great fixed and temproary exhibits
539847236.author: a TripAdvisor user
539847236.reviewBody: We spent four hours in this museum, as it takes that long to see and appreciate everything, assuming you take the time to read the exhibit write ups, etc. At the time, they also had an exhibit of old and late-model Volkswagen vehicles.

539839490.name: well worth it
539839490.author: a TripAdvisor user
539839490.reviewBody: Designed by top of the line Architect Toyo Ito, 2013 Pritzker Prize (the Nobel in Architecture), this Museum is becoming a great spot to visit in Puebla

539504528.name: World class museum you can\'t miss if you are in Puebla.
539504528.author: a TripAdvisor user
539504528.reviewBody: It touches all aspects/areas of Baroque (music, painting, etc), so it helps you understand it in a comprehensive way.\nGreat museum. Please do not miss it.

537003760.name: Interesting museum
537003760.author: a TripAdvisor user
537003760.reviewBody: This museum addresses an interesting topic. The architecture of the building is quite impressive and it has some beautiful pieces of art. In my opinion, there is a bit too many interactive exhibits but is definitely worth visiting.

536667467.name: Good introduction to the Baroque era
536667467.author: a TripAdvisor user
536667467.reviewBody: Museum is very used friendly and uses audio visual media well.  Don\'t expect anything world class as the exhibits are copies of things you go to Europe to see.  Very nice explanations of Puebla\'s Baroque buildings and churches you can visit in the centro historico.\n\n

536036572.name: A great experience inside and out!
536036572.author: a TripAdvisor user
536036572.reviewBody: This is really a destination museum. Japanese architect Toyo Ito has delivered a delightfully spare but surprisingly intricate design to complement the Baroque subject matter. It seems far from the Centro but it fact is only 24 minutes and about a $4 Uber ride away. The restaurant Barroco was by far the most exciting and interesting dining experience we had in Puebla. A great experience inside and out!

532215298.name: Great Museum!
532215298.author: a TripAdvisor user
532215298.reviewBody: A gem in Puebla. This museum has the level to be anywhere in Europe. Great architectural design, very interesting setup, really impressive. It\u2019s Restaurant is also very good.

524695877.name: Amazing
524695877.author: a TripAdvisor user
524695877.reviewBody: This Baroque museum is beautiful.  Having opened a couple of years ago it clearly instructs you on the important aspects of Baroque design and culture.

518008257.name: An amazing acheivement - Guaranteed to SURPRISE you
518008257.author: a TripAdvisor user
518008257.reviewBody: The building is a gorgeous architectural achievement.  What\'s inside will surprise you.  It\'s not just a collection of baroque art as you might expect.  It\'s a celebration of the period:  It\'s art, science, music, costume and literature.  The interactive exhibits are well designed and state-of-the-art.  THIS IS A "MUST SEE" for your trip to Puebla.  Taxis are extremely inexpensive.

504608324.name: Extraordinary
504608324.author: a TripAdvisor user
504608324.reviewBody: First class facilities with an outstanding design!  Beautifully executed, very well curated.  A must if you visit Puebla!

489441764.name: By far, one of the most beautiful museums in Mexico
489441764.author: a TripAdvisor user
489441764.reviewBody:
After finding about the museum via a random "like2 on Facebook y an acquaintance, we dediced to take a trip to this museum.

Roughly a couple of hours from Mexico city, we arrived at the museum and were amazed by its architecture Even before we entered the place, we already knew we were going to love the place.

After parking the car (be sure to use the lower level, as the sun in Puebla can make the car unbearably hot), we proceeded to make our way into the museum.

The collection of the museum (at least in May 2017) was relatively sparse (ironic, since this museum is about the baroque period), but very well selected.

There's an auditorium that shows a 360 degree movie about he baroque, that is very high quality and shouldn't be missed.

Also, be sure to spend some time at the fountain (?) that is situated in the middle of the building, it is ver relaxing.

488291604.name: Interesting
488291604.author: a TripAdvisor user
488291604.reviewBody: Good museum. Cool content but it needs MORE art. Like paintings and sculptures. It could be better if you museum had different exhibitions occasionally.

485132041.name: A new "must go" in Puebla
485132041.author: a TripAdvisor user
485132041.reviewBody: The museum is brand-new, just a few months old. Modern architecture, very easy hall-flow, interactive, modern, with seating places. Extremely careful maintenance. If in the city you have to go. Located in the modern area of Puebla, Angelopolis.

483271549.name: Great modern museum
483271549.author: a TripAdvisor user
483271549.reviewBody: One if the greatest museums I have been.  Jus opened recently, has several great videos and monitors where you can chech on the rest of things to do in Puebla, look at pictures y read about it in categories like templos, monumentos, edificios gubernamentales etc. Has a good restaurant and also a cafeteria.  Plan to visit at least a couple of hours to see its nine sections.

482190128.name: Great building & exhibits
482190128.author: a TripAdvisor user
482190128.reviewBody: The collections may still be small but the way they exhibited them was really unparalleled and made the visit first rate.   One of my favorite museums.

479640430.name: Must see
479640430.author: a TripAdvisor user
479640430.reviewBody: The building and the collection are all fantastic! They have assembled a great collection of art, really helps understand the architecture of the city

479351824.name: Beautiful architecture, poor collection
479351824.author: a TripAdvisor user
479351824.reviewBody: The building is amazing, the museography perfect, but they took pieces from other museums, there is no a new one o a rescue ones, there is not a laboratory, or conservation center, there is only show, nothing scientific.

476592850.name: A SUPER MUST
476592850.author: a TripAdvisor user
476592850.reviewBody: This new Puebla museum is something everyone who is interested in the arts should see. Designed by Japanese architect Toyoo It\u014d it is located in the new Puebla: an area called Angelopolis. The impressive museum has two areas, the first one dedicated to one of Puebla\'s greatest heritage, Talavera, which is a beautiful kind of pottery that can only be made in this city. The other area, which is magnificent, is dedicated to Baroque Art and has unique masterpieces. This is a museum that can be compared to the great ones found in Europe or any other part of the world.

474311191.name: Accessible and very interesting
474311191.author: a TripAdvisor user
474311191.reviewBody: This new museum, open only 14 months, is a major new attraction in Puebla.  The building itself is gorgeous and the permanent collection is well organized and very interesting. Be sure to check out the Cabinet of Curiosities. We were very pleased with the excellent recordings of Baroque music playing throughout the galleries. The museum is well off the beaten track, but it is easily accessible by taxi. Admission is free on Sundays.

473962105.name: Outstanding Presentation of the Baroque Experience
473962105.author: a TripAdvisor user
473962105.reviewBody: If you only can go to one museum in Puebla, go to the Barroco. It is about a 20 minute cab ride from Centro . Allow at least two-three hours to see it all.  The presentations of the Baroque Experience, music, art, decoration, fashion, culture was impressive. I can\'t recommend it highly enough .

472963303.name: State of the Art Museum with WOW Factor
472963303.author: a TripAdvisor user
472963303.reviewBody: This sleek museum of the future brings the baroque past vividly to life.  Multi media elements complement the building\'s unique architecture, bringing home how truly "modern" the Baroque movement was and how it relates to our contemporary world. The displays encompass fine and decorative arts, architecture, philosophy, science, music and theater.  I think there is something for everyone here.  I also highly recommend the sit down restaurant that presents each dish like a work of art.  I dare you to order the composed salad and not take out your camera.

472433426.name: it is  hard to find a musuem like this
472433426.author: a TripAdvisor user
472433426.reviewBody: i have travelled all over the world, and never imagine to find a museum like this one in Puebla, the building is so modern, and the treasures and explanation are interactive so it is very easy to find the explanation of what you are seeing, it is worthy to visit it

468606869.name: Best art museum in Puebla
468606869.author: a TripAdvisor user
468606869.reviewBody: The museum recently opened. The collection is impeccably cured and the distribution of the works of art is very adequate. At the beginning of the tour they exhibit a short film that places the visitor very well in the context of Baroque style. I think there are few museums in Mexico so well organized, clean and dignified.

465636890.name: fabulosos
465636890.author: a TripAdvisor user
465636890.reviewBody: Magnificant display of art in a beautiful setting.  Very easy to access all of the exhibitions with many people to guide you. \nGreat gift shop also

464822753.name: Very modern building with spacious exhibition hall
464822753.author: a TripAdvisor user
464822753.reviewBody: What a contrast! Super modern building housing very barroco art including temporary exhibition of paintings loaned from other museums.

461434410.name: Fantastic Museum
461434410.author: a TripAdvisor user
461434410.reviewBody: Best museum experience every! Everything is done to enhance the learning experience.\nLighting, music, maps, titles and explanations in English, the perfect combination.\nA must see in Mexico.

460892799.name: World Class Museum
460892799.author: a TripAdvisor user
460892799.reviewBody: I have read in the Dallas Morning News that it was the best museums in North America (which includes the US) and I did not believe it. Now that I have visited the museums I can say that everything from the modern building to the museums is awesome. It is worth visiting if you are close to Puebla.

456570044.name: A bit of a drive in this traffic ridden city, but well worth it!
456570044.author: a TripAdvisor user
456570044.reviewBody: Lots of parking, beautiful building and exhibits. They said it should take 2-3 hours to go through. We arrived 4 hours before closing and it was not enough time. Something to see again and devote more time to on our next trip.

456217463.name: Should be on everyone\'s bucket list
456217463.author: a TripAdvisor user
456217463.reviewBody: Stunning Museum design and layout so well thought out anyone considering modernizing a Museum should see this. Architect Toyo Ito has done an incredible job using light and shape to produce a wonderful space. The permanent collection is terrific it is informative and interactive combining old with the new. All this is aided by a very enthusiastic helpful staff a rare finding in the Museums in Europe, U.S. or Canada.\nThe temporary exhibit is fantastic including pieces from The Prada.  After four hours of stimulation we fell into the rooftop restaurant another wonderful space with great staff and excellent chef. Puebla has a lot to offer but this Museum makes it worth the journey

454345806.name: Anew must when in Puebla
454345806.author: a TripAdvisor user
454345806.reviewBody: This new museum  has become a must when visiting Puebla. The building is magnificent and the collection are very good. It is becoming one of the icons of the city

453132646.name: New Museum
453132646.author: a TripAdvisor user
453132646.reviewBody: A beautiful new museum in a very modern part of Puebla.  A big collection of Baroque art.  Well worth the visit.

450559646.name: Probably one of the best museums in the world. Don\'t miss it
450559646.author: a TripAdvisor user
450559646.reviewBody: The permanent collection is limited but the way it is displayed and explained will leave you wishing all museums were be the same. The building it is housed in is also a jewel of modern architecture.

449427240.name: Weird rules makes this museum not family friendly
449427240.author: a TripAdvisor user
449427240.reviewBody: Very disappointing experience at this museum if you have kids, especially since it is a  recommended kids friendly place by the Puebla tourist office. Here is an example: you can not go in with your stroller, you have to use the provided stroller (not logical) but they only give it to you if your kid is under 12 months, so If you go with a 14 months old kid, the kid as too walk/run the entire museum (no stroller allow), imagine this situation when the kid is near nap time (which you planned to facilitate your visit). This makes a really un-logical rule that kill the experience of this museum. The management need too listen to visitors.

446601717.name: A must-see in Puebla
446601717.author: a TripAdvisor user
446601717.reviewBody: This is the newest museum in Puebla. It is an awesome building. Just the building itself is worth the visit. It has a most amazing central fountain which is a vortex. The exhibits are very interesting, presenting a well documented view of the baroque period across the world and from architecture to music. Easy to navigate.\nThere is a bit scale rendition of the downtown that shows all relevant buildings. \nThe restaurant is also very good. It features high-end new Mexican food, very imaginative dishes and service is simply outstanding.

445256196.name: Comprehensive but stop nagging the kids
445256196.author: a TripAdvisor user
445256196.reviewBody: This is a great place to come learn about baroque. It is very well set up and everyone in the family (5, 11 and two adults in our case) found interesting stuff. Plenty of touch screens to dig deeper in the different arts, a good maquette of the city in the 18th century, a life size naturalist office complete with fossils and instruments, short films, listening stations, just wonderful. Alas, the staff is overbearing and will nag your kids (and you) relentlessly.

445094508.name: great collection
445094508.author: a TripAdvisor user
445094508.reviewBody: This museum has a lovely ambiance and great architecture. It houses interesting examples of the Barroco period: music, art, theatre, politics, and religion, with exhibits laid out using the latest in museum style and design, to invite you to take it all in. The restaurant is wonderful too, with exotic and delicious food, and attentive service.

442759553.name: Astounding achievement.
442759553.author: a TripAdvisor user
442759553.reviewBody: This building is itself a work of art. It was completed in record time and is a joy to behold. A terrific collection of baroque art and sculpture with expositions on music and theatre of the baroque period as well. Be prepared for wonderful pieces by Bernini, Caravaggio, Van Dyke, Vermeer as well as lesser known artists from widely dispersed locations. We spent a whole afternoon here and still needed more time. A "must see" in Puebla

439515450.name: /the most beautiful building and collection of Barroco art.
439515450.author: a TripAdvisor user
439515450.reviewBody: This museum is stunning.  It presents the most complete examples of the Barroco period: music, art, theatre, politics, religion in a most accessible way using the latest museum design.  The restaurant is exquisite with a beautiful setting, delicious food and good service.

437477172.name: Great architecture
437477172.author: a TripAdvisor user
437477172.reviewBody: The architecture of the museum is one of the great things about the museum. The fountain in the back is also great as the restaurant. Speaking about the art in the museum I think it would be a much better museum if it was a modern art museum rather than a baroque art museum. \nCongrats to Architect and the people who were involved in the construction. \nIt\'s a must place to vist

431840956.name: Brand new
431840956.author: a TripAdvisor user
431840956.reviewBody: Great new world class museum of the Baroque, which is very popular in Mexico.  Designed in super modern minimal looking architecture by a Japanese architect it stands in contrast with the baroque collections inside.

427643202.name: Stunning
427643202.author: a TripAdvisor user
427643202.reviewBody: I loved visiting this beautiful museum. It was very inexpensive to get in.  Amazing art, and the staff is extremely attentive and available. We also had a late lunch in the fabulous restaurant located upstairs. The whole experience was delightful.

424810111.name: Absolutely do no miss!
424810111.author: a TripAdvisor user
424810111.reviewBody: The top museum in Puebla if you asked me. A modern building that was a 20 minute drive from our hotel. The quality of the audiovisuals, presentation and the quality of the collection was at or above that of any museum I have visited in Europe. The contrast of the building and the stuff inside is amazing. Spend some time at the model mock-up of the city that is spread over about 2000 square feet at the beginning of the walk around. Pueblans should be very proud of this museum.

421393783.name: well worth a visit, for both building and contents
421393783.author: a TripAdvisor user
421393783.reviewBody: My visit had to be fitted into a busy schedule so was a bit rushed. New building, worth a look/visit in itself; baroque theme is interesting and generally well presented (though, of course, baroque music cannot be adequately represented); plenty of arresting exhibits (most on long-loan, it seems; the museum does not have large holdings of its own), arranged in a visitor-friendly way, useful signage; not, therefore, an endurance test like the Louvre or BM; indeed, one detects, here and there, a bit of padding. Rather off-putting to behold, on entering, an exhibition of Audis (cars): nothing baroque about them; Audi happen to have just opened a new factory in Puebla - which perhaps tells us something about the politico-financial origins of the whole project. That aside, it\'s well worth a visit, for both building and contents; and it may yet grow into something bigger (collection-wise) and better.

418828767.name: Modern, interesting most visit museum
418828767.author: a TripAdvisor user
418828767.reviewBody: It recently opened to the public, the buildings architecture is spectacular.  This museum takes you into a journey of discovery of the Baroque, in all it\'s manifestations, architecture, sculpture, painting, music, etc.  It has 8 very well designed and presented rooms that walk you into experiencing and understanding the "baroque" style,  Some original pieces and great multimedia display... most visit.  Note the restaurant on the second floor is expensive and not outstanding

417901076.name: Worth a visit
417901076.author: a TripAdvisor user
417901076.reviewBody: The museum has an amazing collection if you are looking to understand the art of this time. The modern architecture makes quite a contrast

417283327.name: Stunning New Museum
417283327.author: a TripAdvisor user
417283327.reviewBody: Designed by the Japanese architect Toyo Ito, his first project in Mexico. The opening temporary exhibition was one of the best I have ever seen. It was titled "Return Voyage" The China Galleon and the Baroque in Mexico 1565-1815. This is a state of the art museum exhibit with amazing pieces drawn from various collections. Parts are interactive featuring the latest video technology. We enlisted a bilingual guide who suggested that the tour might take 1 1/2 hours. We finally finished about 5 hours later as the guide was excellent and we wanted to understand everything in detail. Already looking forward to our next visit.

416607887.name: The cafeteria was excellent
416607887.author: a TripAdvisor user
416607887.reviewBody: The museum has some very interesting facts . The building is very moder making a great contrast with the baroque  art.  One nice surprise was the food at the cafeteria it was excellent and a very affordable price.

416057784.name: World quality museum
416057784.author: a TripAdvisor user
416057784.reviewBody: After some recommendations i had time to visit this museum. I was not really expecting a lot knowing other mexican museums. The building is beautiful designed, really unique. The exhibition is unique, beautiful and really focused in Puebla and its story. The way the museum is made is really as a world level museum, interactive and really interesting. My favorite: the domes exhibition. Worth it to visit!!! Amazing!

409753871.name: interactive and entertaining
409753871.author: a TripAdvisor user
409753871.reviewBody: Beautiful inside and out, well designed and displayied. A must if you are in Puebla, visit this first as it gives hints to visit the city.\nThe best restaurant in town is in this museum!

408665883.name: Great design, dull exhibits.
408665883.author: a TripAdvisor user
408665883.reviewBody:
I went to the museum with my girlfriend (never been there before) on a Sunday afternoon, it was warm outside (28-29ºC) and they don't seem to have the AC on... only in a few rooms, so we were very hot inside, that's not very comfortable when you're wearing jeans, sneakers and a long sleeve shirt.

Toyo Ito did a wonderful job. I've heard that this museum is one of the best (in design) around the world and you can see it the second you're standing in front of it. I mean, that's the kind of museum you'd expect in some European cities. 

The exhibition rooms are big enough, but I'm not sure if the exhibits are the right for the kind of place. Of course, baroque is very unique and exquisite, but this exhibition in particular lacks of paintings, music and more important information. It's like they thought of it as an introduction to baroque to people who is not familiar with it and that's fine, but my personal opinion is that if you're giving an "introduction" to baroque you should dedicate just one room to do that and the other rooms should be more specific and rich.

The whole museum experience is nice, it's like an oasis in the city. When in Puebla you should definitely visit the museum, it's totally worth it.

408078317.name: Loved this museum!
408078317.author: a TripAdvisor user
408078317.reviewBody: The entrance fee was extremely reasonable and the museum was very well done. The exhibits were interesting and many were very interactive. Most had English translations. We went with our daughters ages 10 and 14 and spent about 3 hours. It was excellent. Highly recommend it.

407622825.name: Worth a visit
407622825.author: a TripAdvisor user
407622825.reviewBody:
It is a must stop if you go to beautiful Puebla.  It is not near the city center though.  (About 20minutes away)
The architecture and space is similar to that of frank Ghery.  
What I loved most is the restaurant!!
Elegant, excellent service and truly extraordinary food.  Well done chef Alejandro Cuatepotzo!

407619212.name: New Museum in Puebla, Mexico
407619212.author: a TripAdvisor user
407619212.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful museums in Mexico. The amazing modern architecture is juxtaposed with a collection of Baroque Art, with the latest technology to explain every corner of the colonial city of Puebla. Worth the 2 hour drive south from Mexico City. Bus transportation is also available.

401894303.name: Interesting expo and cool design
401894303.author: a TripAdvisor user
401894303.reviewBody: The exposition is all about baroque but it is divided in different sections such as music, theatre, paintings etc which makes it easier to follow and not boring. There are a lot of interactive screens which most kids enjoy. Do not miss the 5 minute screening.\n\nHowever, even if you are not an art guy, the architecture and design of the museum is worth the trip. Really unique.

400554138.name: Baroque and only baroque
400554138.author: a TripAdvisor user
400554138.reviewBody: I really liked this fabulous new museum because it is so well laid out and explains baroque music, architecture, paintings etc a(and only baroque) under one roof so it is very manageable for one outing - especially for children and teens. There are interactive touch screen exhibits which appeals to the younger generation who learn best in this way. It is easy to understand the era as everything is linked to the o e theme and maps help show how much of a worldwide movement it was. Plenty of parking in a very modern part of Puebla. Recommended.

397076890.name: not good for kids
397076890.author: a TripAdvisor user
397076890.reviewBody: great art display, fascinating architecture, NOT kid friendly.... u cant take pictures with cel phone or any other camera... seems a little strange now with all the social networks making lots of free publicity but well thats their policy... if you are 18+ then I think its a must see...

394820792.name: Excellent museum for a days visit
394820792.author: a TripAdvisor user
394820792.reviewBody: Museo del Barroco is a new museum, filled with exhibits from the baroque period.  Paintings, sculptures, music, clothing.  It is big and spacious and totally worth it.

391609624.name: INCREDIBLE
391609624.author: a TripAdvisor user
391609624.reviewBody: Its amazing, the construction is overwellming! And the exhibitions are great,\nits a Top Ten Museum, the must beatiful in Mexico. I could say.

389537367.name: For art lovers
389537367.author: a TripAdvisor user
389537367.reviewBody: The museum is a gem for Puebla. When visiting this city, I hardly recommend this as an activity to try in your fist day because you will appreciate the magnificent city of Puebla. You will find a incredible scale model of downtown with a visual of the most representative buildings than will let you decide where to go after.

380960669.name: Great Museum!  Don\'t miss!
380960669.author: a TripAdvisor user
380960669.reviewBody:
Can't understand the negative reviews.  It is not an 'Art Museum', per se, but rather a museum of the Baroque period from many perspectives.

Visited this museum with another couple and a group of school children.  Explains the Baroque period very well, using interesting exhibits, drama and projection. 

The music section has demonstrations of musical techniques of the time that incorporate both audio and video.

Have a scale model of Puebla in one section that is very nice.  

Staff was very helpful.  I had two questions about architecture of the period, which were answered by the staff.

It is also inexpensive, at about $6.00 in US dollars.  

Don't miss if you are in Puebla!

377752838.name: Our newest museum
377752838.author: a TripAdvisor user
377752838.reviewBody:
Minimalism arquitechure for Barroc expositions. Brilliant!.
The museum by itself is a beauty, and the expositions are so well explained through videos, interactive games, and lovely pieces, that each step you take its pure satisfaction.
Go, go, go.
Its an easy and world class museum

374267169.name: Nice Museum
374267169.author: a TripAdvisor user
374267169.reviewBody:
It seems like the government in Puebla is making an effort to expand their museum offer and this one is a terrific one. 

Good if you have enough time to spare while in Puebla and you are done with the rest of Puebla's attractions. 

Very well kept museum, nice collection and wonderful architecture. 

Only bad experience  I had is one of the guards was so rude when I tried to exit towards the central patio. There was no sign stating it was forbidden and the door was open and the guy  treated me like I was not behaving properly.

373922675.name: Great collection!
373922675.author: a TripAdvisor user
373922675.reviewBody: This museums provides great context to understand traditional arts and to better appreciate the architecture and style of the entire city!\n\nThe new location shows the city commitment to investing in culture and tourism.

369611292.name: A must see for lovers of Baroque Art and History
369611292.author: a TripAdvisor user
369611292.reviewBody: This museum has a beautiful exhibition of baroque art with multiple interactive stations which enhances the experience. Highly recommended.

359428351.name: Dissappointing...
359428351.author: a TripAdvisor user
359428351.reviewBody:
This is the perfect definition of a white elephant...

My visit to Puebla was planned for visiting this place, I had big expectations about but it was so disappointing.

Great architecture by Toyo Ito but no one should spend such an expensive budget in an "international" museum if you have nothing to show inside!

You will find only pictures of baroque masterpieces and some reproductions.

It's good only for kids with a guide that explain them about baroque but definitely this is not an "international" nor a "baroque" museum.

The price of this museum was 400 million USD while Abu Dhabi's Louvre cost will be 500 million USD!

Definitely a museum of Baroque Government Corruption!

353948857.name: Museo Internacional del Barroco is a jewel
353948857.author: a TripAdvisor user
353948857.reviewBody: My wife and I love Puebla, both the city and the state, and we have been there many times.  We recently went with a friend to visit the new Museo Internacional del Barroco that has opened on the outskirts of this wonderful colonial city.  My wife is a professor who has studied colonial art and literature, and she sets a high standard for anything having to do with the Baroque period.  She was not disappointed in this new museum.  They have correctly hired an outstanding Japanese architect, Toyo Ito, who has designed  stunning post-modern building that evokes but does not imitate the curves of Baroque art and architecture.  The museography is outstanding.  The permanent collection is well displayed, and very instructive, and the opening temporary exhibit that opens the museum, which will close June 15, is on the "Nao de China", entitled Return Voyage -- The China Galleon and the Baroque in Mexico, 1565-1815, dealing with the fascinating exchange of trade in art, objects, ideas, etc., that took place during the Spanish colonial period.  If this exhibit is emblematic of what the Museo Internacional del Barroco will produce in the future, I am sure we will return many times.  The Museum, supported by the state government, is very well staffed.  There is a lovely restaurant, though we only had coffee there, and hope to dine sometime.  We noticed some student groups, young children as well as teenagers, and they seemed very taken with the museum.  They make excellent use of new technologies to teach about art, architecture, ideas, etc. We think the MIB is a huge contribution, not only to Puebla, but to an understanding of where Baroque art and ideas fits into the modern world.  Don\'t miss it, if you go anywhere near Puebla.  And Puebla is an easy side trip from Mexico City.

676927191.name: A must see
676927191.author: a TripAdvisor user
676927191.reviewBody: A beautiful experience and close to centro - part of the larger church - make sure to visit this side chapel - there is a guide to give you some background

670225242.name: Amazing even if you are not catholic, should visit it
670225242.author: a TripAdvisor user
670225242.reviewBody: This is categorized one of the most beautiful chapels in the world, and indeed, eve if you are not catholic you have to visit it is amazing full of gold, is pretty close to the main square

664875456.name: Important to Visit
664875456.author: a TripAdvisor user
664875456.reviewBody: I visited Puebla for the food. I didn\'t even know about this chapel before we came. We took a little food walking tour of the city with a couple of cultural stops on it, and this was one of them. I was very surprised, because I was not expecting to see such a beautiful church without knowing anything about it beforehand. The chapel makes this one of the prettiest churches I have been to in Mexico.

663993055.name: A beautiful church
663993055.author: a TripAdvisor user
663993055.reviewBody: This is one of the must visit churches in Mexico. The beauty of the art is exquisite. It is in the city center and easily accessible. It is suitable for all ages and for families.

659374306.name: A must for visitors to Puebla.
659374306.author: a TripAdvisor user
659374306.reviewBody: This is in the Church of San Domingo.  It is sumptuously decorated, a riot of gold, carvings, tiles, statuary, so you need some time to take it all in.  It is not open in the early afternoon, and when open is now often crowded with tour groups, so at times the commentary can be a bit distracting.  I think it is a wonderful place and love going there each time to go to Puebla.  Like the Cathedral and the Biblioteca it is very high on my list of \u201cmust do\u201d sites in the city.  The main Church of San Domingo is also wonderful, so don\u2019t just go to the chapel, take more time and enjoy the main part of the church as well.

658901897.name: Must visit cathedral in Puebla
658901897.author: a TripAdvisor user
658901897.reviewBody: You can see the photos and go and this will still stun you. The churches and cathedrals in Mexico rival any you have seen anywhere. If you have time for one, make it this one.

654787317.name: Absolutely Amazing
654787317.author: a TripAdvisor user
654787317.reviewBody: One of the most glorious examples of Baroque architecture I have ever seen. Hours are tricky, however; you may need to stop by a couple of times to actually succeed in seeing it.

654011846.name: Outstanding Interior!!!!!!
654011846.author: a TripAdvisor user
654011846.reviewBody: We have seen churches all over the world, and this interior fits in the top ten.\n\nBe SURE TO GO ALL YHE WAY IN. The best part is to the left of the front.

653716419.name: A dream come true
653716419.author: a TripAdvisor user
653716419.reviewBody: A must when you visit Puebla. A magical place that you will love. I suggest read before going if you are not Spanish speaker because thera are not many tourist guides

653574306.name: Overwhelming in the Baroque details
653574306.author: a TripAdvisor user
653574306.reviewBody: Unbelievable, also sobering to realize that local residents were pressed into building these churches for Rome, and paid for this themselves - gold foils and beautiful carvings, paintings - while the general Indigenous population continued to be poor. Colonization, now exposed for what it was almost 500 years ago - and still is active around the world.

652847122.name: Stunning
652847122.author: a TripAdvisor user
652847122.reviewBody: Wonderful and hard to imagine how it could be more over the top.  Lost a star as we couldn\u2019t get right up to and around the altar as there was a rope across..

651866381.name: Barroco style
651866381.author: a TripAdvisor user
651866381.reviewBody: Once of the most representative of Barroco Style rich in details all, in gold. \nIs a most to visit in Puebla.

651272325.name: Stunning!
651272325.author: a TripAdvisor user
651272325.reviewBody: This chapel is just stunning! A must see if you find yourself in Puebla! It\u2019s a very short walk from the z\u00f3calo and well worth the stop?

650244142.name: Beautiful chapel
650244142.author: a TripAdvisor user
650244142.reviewBody: Was amazing all details inside the chapel the way how they build and the years such a beautiful experience \n

649953845.name: Stunning, a quick visit not to be missed.
649953845.author: a TripAdvisor user
649953845.reviewBody: Only takes 5-10 minutes to pop in and be stunned by this spectacular chapel in Santo Domingo Church.  NB: It\'s closed from 1-4pm but was still open at 6pm - don\'t know how long it stays open in the evening.

646059411.name: Spectacular even if you only have a few minutes
646059411.author: a TripAdvisor user
646059411.reviewBody: If you\'ve made it to Puebla than chances are you have some interest in churches or history or just beautiful historic things. If that\'s the case, do not miss Capilla del Rosario. This is truly a treasure of Mexican Baroque architecture and you will be absolutely blown off your feet when you round the corner from the church into this chapel. Top to bottom gold, gold and more gold. Even if you\'re not a history buff or fan of churches, this is just something you\'ve got to see. You could spend an hour here and pay one of the guides to give you the history, or you could spend three minutes to just have your jaw drop. Either way, totally worth it.

646043269.name: Quick look
646043269.author: a TripAdvisor user
646043269.reviewBody: We had a quick look at the chapel and the surrounding areas of Santo Domingo Church. A tour guide blocked the view doing a private tour making it a bit annoying to view so we lingered to the other parts of the church. With all the ornateness, the seasonal creche was less dramatic in comparison.

645822734.name: Gilded Chapel
645822734.author: a TripAdvisor user
645822734.reviewBody: I stopped by Santo Domingo Church when the sign outside said it would be open, twice.  Both times there was still a Mass going on inside, so the Chapel itself was roped off.  However, I was able to see inside, and it was beautiful.  I would recommend seeing it.

643560388.name: The most beautiful in Puebla
643560388.author: a TripAdvisor user
643560388.reviewBody: Inside the Santo Domingo church, this is perhaps the most beautiful chapel in Puebla.  It\'s up front and to the left of the mail altar.  If you don\'t go all the way to the front of church you\'ll miss it.  The gold leaf, ceiling work, paintings are all not to be missed.

640930066.name: Most amazing cathedral ever!!
640930066.author: a TripAdvisor user
640930066.reviewBody: This is an absolute must when you visit Puebla! It\u2019s not much from the outside compared to other cathedrals, however the inside is just breathtaking- I was in absolute awe. The most amazing cathedral I\u2019ve ever seen. Photos don\u2019t do it justice- go see it for yourself!!

638238638.name: The most beautiful sight in Puebla
638238638.author: a TripAdvisor user
638238638.reviewBody: The Capilla del Rosario is undoubtedly one of the most beautiful and resplendent Cathedrals I have ever witnessed. The intricate architecture evokes wonder in one upon arrival. It is a must see in all its glory if visiting this great town.

636093298.name: Amazing barroque chapel in Puebla Mexico
636093298.author: a TripAdvisor user
636093298.reviewBody: We visited Puebla Mexico two weeks ago. We went to the most amazing chapel I have seen! It was built in the 18th century and it is a piece of art! The ceiling and walls are all decorated with figures made of stucco and 24k gold\nI have never seen anything like that in the world! It is a must if you visit Puebla de los Angeles in Mexico

634879933.name: Overwhelming Gold
634879933.author: a TripAdvisor user
634879933.reviewBody: You will need a good minute to take it all in. Its definitely worth a stop to check it out. Interesting history, as it took 50 years to decorate and was primarily decorated by indigenous artisans.

634285605.name: The treasure of Puebla
634285605.author: a TripAdvisor user
634285605.reviewBody: This chapel in the Santo Domingo Church in Puebla is beautiful--so much tile work and gold.  You can see the brilliance of the 23.5 carat gold in the "cypress" over the altar vs the painted gilding on the walls, but all of it is tremendous.

633681550.name: Special
633681550.author: a TripAdvisor user
633681550.reviewBody: We\'ve seen a lot of churches and cathedrals over the years, and there\'s a cathedral in my small home town, but this church is special.  The amount of gold is astounding.

632755377.name: Overwhelming
632755377.author: a TripAdvisor user
632755377.reviewBody: It is worth it to go a bit out of your way to see this chapel, especially if you enjoy religious architecture.  It is over-the-top gold and white gorgeous.

631306648.name: Small but stunning
631306648.author: a TripAdvisor user
631306648.reviewBody: The inside is narrow but the ceilings and artwork are spectacular.  There was a mass taking place in the side chapel of gold so we could not enter.  Beautiful short stop on a tour of Puebla\'s lovely historic buildings and places.

631296304.name: Genuine barroco style cladded in gold
631296304.author: a TripAdvisor user
631296304.reviewBody: this chapel, located within the church of Santo Domingo, is all clad in gold, baroque style with talavera (a typical Mexican porcelain) and is considered one of the eight wonders of the world.

629949927.name: Beautiful!
629949927.author: a TripAdvisor user
629949927.reviewBody: From the outside you can\u2019t really tell, but once you step inside, it\u2019s a great surprise!\nThe main attraction is the chapel, which is sall but really stunning.

629475972.name: You MUST visit this wonder
629475972.author: a TripAdvisor user
629475972.reviewBody: No words to describe this magnificent chapel. Wow! You can compare it to the most beautiful chapels in the Vatican, Paris, etc.

628265210.name: Beautiful
628265210.author: a TripAdvisor user
628265210.reviewBody: Belongs to the church of Santo Domingo. Free entrance. All covered with gold, amazing. When I visited there wasn\'t anyone else so it was very quiet and peaceful.

627606006.name: Amazing
627606006.author: a TripAdvisor user
627606006.reviewBody: The detail in this chapel is stunning. So many years to create and you have to appreciate the Marvel. So beautiful. A must see in Puebla.

618214775.name: Amazing
618214775.author: a TripAdvisor user
618214775.reviewBody: It was quite a suprise to see the inside  as the outside is rather plain. The gold  inside is breath taking . Isat down a looked around  in awe  beautiful

618071844.name: So much gold
618071844.author: a TripAdvisor user
618071844.reviewBody: This is an amazing an ornate Chapel licated inside the Santo Domingo church. Massive amounts of gold and ornamentation.

616115437.name: Worth sitting through mass
616115437.author: a TripAdvisor user
616115437.reviewBody: Went there on a Sunday. Sat through mass on a pew right next to the to it get be the first to get into the Capilla. It was so worth it. It\u2019s extraordinarily beautiful. Bring money to tip the guy giving the history of the church talk.

615207118.name: Over The Edge Chapel!
615207118.author: a TripAdvisor user
615207118.reviewBody: an exquisite chapel inside Santa Domingo Church - don\'t miss it!  Gold foil, gorgeous, haunting, words fail me.

613954871.name: Amazing work
613954871.author: a TripAdvisor user
613954871.reviewBody: This chapel is an amazing work, baroque style polished with gold with plenty of details and little symbols.

606871507.name: It will take your breath away!
606871507.author: a TripAdvisor user
606871507.reviewBody: Wow! The interior splendor will take your breath away. Another reviewer said it right, this is a jewel box. The detail and scope are magnificent. A small note of courtesy, if you are wearing a hat, please be sure to take off your hat to show respect. The churches are active places of worship.

603308094.name: a local treasure
603308094.author: a TripAdvisor user
603308094.reviewBody: this is an amazing chapel all filled with gold and talavera pottery. The architecture and artwork is phenomenal.  Definitely a must see!

601765549.name: AMAZING MUST SEE!!! 23caret gold architecture at it\'s best!
601765549.author: a TripAdvisor user
601765549.reviewBody: I have seen many chapels in my lifetime, all over the world, BUT THIS CHAPEL is something very special. It\'s a small chapel to the top left of the main church and it\'s breath taking. There was a tour guide in the small chapel giving about a 20-30 minute informational speech and he was excellent. However, it is just in Spanish, but perhaps he speaks some English and he could answer questions afterwards. No fee was asked for, but we gave a tip at the end, as he was so good. In my opinion, out of all the chapels, churches etc. in Puebla (and there is a lot) this is a must see and the most special.

601172591.name: Amazing.  Must see.
601172591.author: a TripAdvisor user
601172591.reviewBody: This chapel is a baroque jewel box.  Anyone visiting Puebla for any reason must take the time to see this.

600227345.name: A must if you visit Puebla
600227345.author: a TripAdvisor user
600227345.reviewBody: If you are visit Puebla or just pass by you need to visit this place.\nThe Church has a nice atrio the the small kids can run so you can leave the kids there with you partner while you visit the church.\n"El retablo" is beautiful but is even nicer the small chapel.

600032867.name: Eighth Wonder of the New World
600032867.author: a TripAdvisor user
600032867.reviewBody:
5*p La Capella del Rosario
Off the nave of the Santo Domingo Church; baroque
Often described as the eighth wonder of the new world (see book at Biblioteca Palofoxiana)
N.B. Saint Dominic introduced the rosary to the Church
Excellent volunteer guide who gave a great explanation in Spanish
Has large rosary design hidden in the chapel
Talavera type tiles on bottom of side walls

599276182.name: Beautiful for the wedding!
599276182.author: a TripAdvisor user
599276182.reviewBody: My cousin\'s wedding was held here...absolutely beautiful chapel/church...lovely front altar with many of the saints statues there.  Back chapel is lovely with many large frescoes on the walls(which are dark so pictures do not do them justice).  Chapel walls are gold plated and beautiful!  Very busy street outside with vendors, etc.  Great experience!

595702612.name: Pure Gold
595702612.author: a TripAdvisor user
595702612.reviewBody: This is a side chapel of the large and impressive Santo Domingo Church. It is all gold--gold leaf on the walls and ceilings, and solid gold in the magnificent central statuary.  A guide provides a detailed history and answers to questions, but all in Spanish. (My guide\'s Spanish was clear and audible.) This golden establishment tells you all you need to know about the wealth of Puebla in the early days, and of the importance of the Church in society.

591786710.name: No words
591786710.author: a TripAdvisor user
591786710.reviewBody: What can I say about this beautiful church. I was overwhelmed with it. Stayed for a while just to watch everything. Imagine I do not believe in God, but gotta love the church.

591697660.name: Worth a stop!
591697660.author: a TripAdvisor user
591697660.reviewBody: We arrived just as a Spanish speaking guide was explaining how all the gold in this place got there. Most comes from a mine near Guanajuato that I had visited so that fascinated me. Even if you don\'t speak Spanish it\'s worth coming in for a look!

590962322.name: The definition of over the top
590962322.author: a TripAdvisor user
590962322.reviewBody: The Rosary Chapel is perhaps the most highly decorated religious space in the world. At the front of Santo Domingo, it is beyond discription. You just got to see it. Occasionally it is closed for a special service, so you will need to be flexible and come back at another time if needed to see inside.

590915622.name: Amazing place with an impressive architecture + decoration
590915622.author: a TripAdvisor user
590915622.reviewBody: The Rosary Chapel inside Santo Domingo\u00b4s Church is a remarkable place where you can appreciate the architectural design and a decoration of its own.  You may visit some other beautiful churches in Puebla but, this one in the downtown area is simply great to admire and of course if you happen to be there and a wedding is taking place in it, stay and enjoy the event. The natural light that goes in let you see every detail with a special glow to more vividly enjoy every detail!

588104817.name: Nice church and building
588104817.author: a TripAdvisor user
588104817.reviewBody:
Nice church and building.
One of the places you have to visit in Puebla.
In historical downtown.
Nice church and building.
One of the places you have to visit in Puebla.
In historical downtown.

586192739.name: Most beautiful church on our Puebla tour
586192739.author: a TripAdvisor user
586192739.reviewBody: The ornate interiors of this church are truly outstanding with a lot of gold plated altars. From outside the chapel looks ordinary but after entering one is completely speechless. Don\'t miss this most beautiful church on your tour of Puebla

583769983.name: Eye popping golden chapel
583769983.author: a TripAdvisor user
583769983.reviewBody: The church doesn\'t look like much from the outside and even the main nave, although beautiful and intricately decorated, is not particularly impressive.  But as you approach the altar and look to the left side the almost 100% golden chapel is a sight to behold. Even with a little sunlight coming in windows the whole room glows bright - illuminated by the rays bouncing off the shiny gold everywhere you turn.

583461229.name: A must see
583461229.author: a TripAdvisor user
583461229.reviewBody: Gorgeous chapel - a must see. Take the time to listen to the 10 minute talk by the guides in the church (in Spanish, if you can understand). They point out a lot of interesting facts.

582904771.name: Simply incredible
582904771.author: a TripAdvisor user
582904771.reviewBody: Wow. What a church. It\u2019s not much from the outside but jaw dropping inside. Be forewarned they don\u2019t like pictures being taken. Help them keep up with the maintenance and donate a few pesos.

582508363.name: hard to believe what you are seeing
582508363.author: a TripAdvisor user
582508363.reviewBody: The Sto Domingo church was amazing and then we went into the chapel.  Speechless.  What a riot of gold carving, detail, totally jaw dropping.

581451555.name: Wealth of the City displayed here
581451555.author: a TripAdvisor user
581451555.reviewBody: This chapel is covered in gold more so than most in /Europe. Displayed the artistry available in this beautiful city and support  for the craftsmanship as well as devotion to display.

579996797.name: Spectacular!
579996797.author: a TripAdvisor user
579996797.reviewBody: The Capilla del Rosario, a side chapel in the Santo Domingo Church, is amazing for its floor-to-ceiling decoration.  Go when you can take the  time to sit down and really take it all in and search out some of the details Think about the people who did it; their artistry and their faith.  It appears to be open anytime but sometimes a guide will come in and talk about the chapel, which adds to the experience.  .

576073692.name: Simply Wow!
576073692.author: a TripAdvisor user
576073692.reviewBody: I have never see such ornate decoration in my life! The humbling beauty of the Rosary Chapel will simply bring you to your knees.

574578723.name: Must see
574578723.author: a TripAdvisor user
574578723.reviewBody: This is a lovely church that you won\'t want to miss. All covered in gold, such a piece of art. There are free tours on it, where you can learn a little bit about the history, just don\'t forget to tip the guide.

571937414.name: Ah inspiring!
