571937414.author: a TripAdvisor user
571937414.reviewBody: Gorgeous chapel with a deep-rooted historical foundation. I loved the inspirational Arabic Style design. Lovely gold tones and elaborate decor. A beautiful eclectic combination of possible Rococo and Islamic style. Soothingly light permeated through the stained glass windows.

570677395.name: I attended a high mass on Easter Day in Santo Domingo when I saw the stunningly beautiful Rosary Chapel.
570677395.author: a TripAdvisor user
570677395.reviewBody: I was the only American attending the mass but well included in the service. It was a beautiful experience. This was the best way to experience a real colonial church. You don\'t have to be a Catholic to attend a mass but should be respectful of the ritual.

567906160.name: way over the top
567906160.author: a TripAdvisor user
567906160.reviewBody: It seems that the Dominican churches in Mexico are tributes to Spanish Baroque and gold leaf. Way over the top, but well worth seeing.

567503622.name: Impressive church
567503622.author: a TripAdvisor user
567503622.reviewBody: Wish I could understand more Spanish. Really nice chapel,it\'s not huge but so much details and all golden decoration in it is stunning

566892288.name: Beautiful Church in a city of beautiful churches
566892288.author: a TripAdvisor user
566892288.reviewBody: Stumbled across this little gem while heading back to the hotel.  Big courtyard and chuch with a chapel off to the side.  Here get ready to be impressed with the baroque interior!

565094245.name: The most stunning place in the Americas!
565094245.author: a TripAdvisor user
565094245.reviewBody: Capilla del Rosario is one of the Worl Heritage place, protected by UNESCO. It is so stunning, that words really fail to describe the beauty. You have to see it to believe it. One of the wonders of the world.

563598328.name: Try to catch a guided tour (in Spanish)
563598328.author: a TripAdvisor user
563598328.reviewBody: When I was there on a Sunday, every 30 minutes, there was a donation-based guided tour inside the chapel telling you its history and details of its construction.

563040678.name: Its really hard to describe how beautiful this chapel really is
563040678.author: a TripAdvisor user
563040678.reviewBody: The interior decoration of Rosary Chapel (Capilla del Rosario) is not like anything I have seen anywhere else in a church recently. I certainly have seen quite a few really beautiful churches on our tour of Mexico but this church is jaw dropping in its superior detail, Just Beautiful.

562832646.name: Beautiful chapwl
562832646.author: a TripAdvisor user
562832646.reviewBody: One of the most amazing and must to visit in Puebla\nNot far from the City Hall, 5 min walking distance \n

562342919.name: Stunning
562342919.author: a TripAdvisor user
562342919.reviewBody: Stopped by on a walk around hiatoric Puebla.  Free admission, and the chapel is , in a word, Stu ning with its gold decoration.

561366096.name: Glories of Mexican Baroque ... don\'t miss this.
561366096.author: a TripAdvisor user
561366096.reviewBody: Even if you\'re not into Mexican Baroque, this chapel is worth the detour and well illustrates the dramatic and theatrical intensity of Mexican Baroque.  We also happened to be there during the Feb. 16 earthquake.  while Mass was taking place  The priest stopped the service and ushered the faithful out (the chandeliers were still swaying).

560736289.name: Golden
560736289.author: a TripAdvisor user
560736289.reviewBody: You just have to see it to believe it.  The detail, the hours of work involved, the history.  Every single thing in this church has a story behind it.

559614590.name: This is one of the best!
559614590.author: a TripAdvisor user
559614590.reviewBody: We have visited a lot of churches in Mexico, and this chapel is about the best.  It is a reasonable size and is an amazing gold extravaganza.  The bonus is finding and walking the Calle Cinco de Mayo pedestrian street.

559431058.name: Stunning
559431058.author: a TripAdvisor user
559431058.reviewBody: Simply over the top GOLD.  This should be the very first place you visit in Puebla if you only have a short period of time in the city

558655471.name: Pure gold
558655471.author: a TripAdvisor user
558655471.reviewBody: I recently attended a wedding and I remembered my childhood since my parents used to visit this church. I don\'t know much about art but you don\'t need to know to admire the artistry in this chapel. There is no admission charge but I recommend to donate in order to help the earthquake damage.

557786191.name: Very attractive
557786191.author: a TripAdvisor user
557786191.reviewBody: Decorative chapel. It was very easy to find and there was no charge to enter. It was one of many highlights of my visit to Puebla

557593106.name: Awesome
557593106.author: a TripAdvisor user
557593106.reviewBody: The inside of this church is really something to behold. Incredible artistry, with loads of gold and colour. No admission charge, but there is a place for donations to help repair earthquake damage.

557158892.name: Different
557158892.author: a TripAdvisor user
557158892.reviewBody: If you are a bit "Churched Out"...pay a visit! This is definitely worth-while and not the kind of stuff you normally see in religious temples. Won\'t take too long, it is free and you\'ll be amazed by its beauty and detail.

555883032.name: You have to visit it
555883032.author: a TripAdvisor user
555883032.reviewBody: I am not Catholic but something that I appreciate is the architecture of the churches and know about the history of it. This is something you would like to know.

555066590.name: Chapel "must visit"
555066590.author: a TripAdvisor user
555066590.reviewBody:
From outside, probably you cannot see how beautiful this chapel is.
But once you go into this building, everything will be changed.

Catedral of Puebla is of course a great church. But this chapel is great in the different meaning.
I expect you'll take breath once you get into.

554831919.name: Very beautiful Chapel
554831919.author: a TripAdvisor user
554831919.reviewBody: Very nice and gorgeous interiors!! Must visit.It is near the Puebla Centro Bus station.You can also walk around and see the streets.

553625799.name: Ornate
553625799.author: a TripAdvisor user
553625799.reviewBody: The Rosary Chapel makes the rest of the church look plain.\n\nA wedding was in progress in the chapel when we visited. It was nice to see it being used for something other than tourist gawking.

550741479.name: Gold everywhere
550741479.author: a TripAdvisor user
550741479.reviewBody: This is a beautiful chapel, it is all covered with gold.\nIs one of the nicest places to visit in Puebla\'s downtown.\n

550684518.name: Stunning church
550684518.author: a TripAdvisor user
550684518.reviewBody: A must see if you are in town.  We\'ve seen many church\'s and the design and decoration of this is a bit mind blowing to be honest. It\'s hard to know exactly where to look to take the detail in! Very similar to one of the Santo Domingo church in Oaxaca if you can\'t make this one.

548235629.name: Out of this world
548235629.author: a TripAdvisor user
548235629.reviewBody: Damaged by the earthquake but you still can see it. It is a must, just incredible! Inside the church you find guides who can explain the details of the church, and you just give them a tip. It is worthy. It is probably one of the most amazing churches I have seen, and I traveled a lot and churches are one of my specialties.

547917656.name: Beautiful interior design
547917656.author: a TripAdvisor user
547917656.reviewBody: This chapel is probably the most highly decorated in Puebla. It is well worth a visit just to see the stunning wall and ceiling artwork.

545650158.name: An exquisite baroque chapel, the most gold I\'ve even seen in one place!
545650158.author: a TripAdvisor user
545650158.reviewBody: Wow! This place blew my mind! I\'ve been in lots of churches in Mexico, but I\'ve never seen something this ornate or gilded! Amazing and wonderful. You could spend hours appreciating the artistry here! Don\'t miss this beautiful place!

545549684.name: Takes your breath away
545549684.author: a TripAdvisor user
545549684.reviewBody: This chapel is absolutely breathtaking, so much detail and history, it is free to go inside and cannot be missed if you are visiting Puebla!

544628077.name: Exquisite!
544628077.author: a TripAdvisor user
544628077.reviewBody: The chapel is overwhelmingly beautiful!   A definite must go when in Puebla.  The detail in the Baroque design is jaw dropping.   We had a private guide who was able to add lots of interesting facts.

544129404.name: A must see
544129404.author: a TripAdvisor user
544129404.reviewBody: If there is one church to see in Puebla it is this one. It\u2019s baroque altarpiece is just outstanding.

543707065.name: Wonder of the wotld
543707065.author: a TripAdvisor user
543707065.reviewBody: You don\'t have to be religious to appreciate how spectacular this chapel is. You can sit for some time and marvel at the beauty.

542743995.name: worth a visit
542743995.author: a TripAdvisor user
542743995.reviewBody: Puebla is a unique city on the whole. this chapel certainly worths a visit...I would go again for its calmness

541470712.name: An absolute MUST when in Puebla
541470712.author: a TripAdvisor user
541470712.reviewBody: This is most beautiful chapel I have ever seen!  When you walk into Santo Domingo Church you are struck by a beautiful alter and you are in awe...until you turn the corner and set eyes on the Rosary Chapel. Be prepared to have your jaw drop.  It is truly magnificent in every way and an absolute must when visiting Puebla.  Entry is free.

532407511.name: One of the Most Visually Stunning Chapels in Mexico.
532407511.author: a TripAdvisor user
532407511.reviewBody:
The chapel may not look like much from the outside, within it's 300 year old walls are most impressive examples of baroque design. It's like stepping into a fairytale, with gorgeous painting lining the walls, the most magnificent gold trimmings lining from floor to ceiling and amazing ornamental detail. 

Most of the ornaments you see are a blend of the old native peoples beliefs crossed with catholicism. 

A Spanish speaking guide will have a small explanation on the church every half an hour.

Defiantly a do not miss while in Puebla.

532171407.name: Breathtaking ... A must do in Puebla
532171407.author: a TripAdvisor user
532171407.reviewBody: A business trip and a few days in Puebla allowed us time to visit this incredible Church ... And I can tell you we\'ve seen plenty ... this is breathtaking and we were lucky enough to be there during an early  evening Mass ... that was nice but the work that has gone into this is unbelievable  ... Just Go ... you won\'t be disappointed .. Pick up a local guide outside .. we found a lovely guy who had some english  ...Puebla is a gem .. so much to see ..!

524694810.name: Mindblowing chapel
524694810.author: a TripAdvisor user
524694810.reviewBody: The people of this village have painstakingly renovated this amazing Baroque era chapel.  It is worth seeing.  It is near the shopping district in Puebla.

518327702.name: Without breath
518327702.author: a TripAdvisor user
518327702.reviewBody: I had a shock when I enter to this place. This chapel is just out of this world. \nThe incredible thing is that it\'s inside a wonderful church, but after you cross the church and turn left to the left to la capilla del rosario, it is like such a surprise, the thing is that it\'s so much gold that you can imagine.

514750249.name: A gem on top of a hidden pyramid!
514750249.author: a TripAdvisor user
514750249.reviewBody: The church demonstrated the way how many great pyramids of Central America have been hidden from view even of spaniards.  They built it on the top of the hill which hid the great stone structure under dirt and rocks, as if some one on purpose buried the pyramid.  It is small, cute as a button and can be seen from miles away.  Climbing the steps is a physical challenge.  Wheelchair accessible but you will need a team of strong helpers to wheel you up!  The view of the two active volcanoes is perfect as is the surrounding towns and country side.

514039305.name: Worth visiting - Check timings
514039305.author: a TripAdvisor user
514039305.reviewBody: This small section of the church is not always open so check before going. It is really impressive and worth taking the time to visit.

510350385.name: Unofficial 8th wonder of the world its a mist see!
510350385.author: a TripAdvisor user
510350385.reviewBody: We visited the church on which this chapel sits (Santo Domingo)and we were very impressed with the altar and all the art in general ( baroque, XVIII century) but when we faced the entrance to the chapel, we felt like we had landed in a totally different place! It was afternoon so the night lights were still not on, but that did not diminish the beauty that 23.6 karat gold can project on you!\nThere is all sorts of fine art in humongous size, plus the detailing/moulding (sort of) below the frames and all around the chapel is the original and it is made of a paste that has sea shells and mud among other materials. This is definitely a must see regardless of your religion!\nI am catholic myself so this was a highly recommended visit from friends and family. The beauty that radiates in this place is hard to explain, believe me. By all means feel free to visit this chapel when in Puebla, you will be glad you did!

509471148.name: Spectacular!!!
509471148.author: a TripAdvisor user
509471148.reviewBody: This chapel is a must if you are in Puebla... gold all over, this is a place you need to see... you won\'t regret taking the time to see it!!!

507264096.name: Beautiful Church Worth Visiting
507264096.author: a TripAdvisor user
507264096.reviewBody: I have visited many churches in many countries but this church stands out to me.  The details and artistic design are intricate and well thought out.  Simply amazing.

507248935.name: A gold trimmed chapel which sparkles
507248935.author: a TripAdvisor user
507248935.reviewBody: The Capilla del Rosario is located inside the Santo Domingo Church, which was built by a Dominican priest.  The church was classified as the Eighth wonder of the world upon it\'s completion in 1690..  There are several mini tours in Spanish each hour.

504608907.name: Real masterpiece!
504608907.author: a TripAdvisor user
504608907.reviewBody: Gorgeous!!! Plain and simple.  Beautifully executed, very well curated.  A must if you visit Puebla.  Don\'t miss it, you won\'t regret!

504017906.name: Wow!!
504017906.author: a TripAdvisor user
504017906.reviewBody: The most sumptuous place of worship I have ever seen. The amount of gold used is incredible. This is Mexican Baroque splendor at its finest. \n\nCapilla del Rosario should be on your list to see when you are in Puebla.

502341483.name: Absolutely stunning! do not miss this.
502341483.author: a TripAdvisor user
502341483.reviewBody: The Rosary Chapel took my breath away. Definitely make it a stop on your walk through the historic centre - it doesn\'t take long to pop in and have a look.

491115205.name: Extraordinary gilded chapel in historic church
491115205.author: a TripAdvisor user
491115205.reviewBody: Visited the chapel with a tour guide--very helpful in understanding the Catholic iconography. Given the more austere exterior, the interior seems even more dramatic.

488737656.name: Lots of gold!
488737656.author: a TripAdvisor user
488737656.reviewBody: This chapel is quite spectacular and well worth seeing.  The amount of gold is amazing, and this historical church makes an unforgettable impression.

488663065.name: A really ornate chapel
488663065.author: a TripAdvisor user
488663065.reviewBody: There are many churches / chapels/ cathedrals in Puebla and we went into quite a few! We visited this whilst on a walking tour of the town. It is extremely ornate and our guide explained the history and meaning of all the decorations.

487832613.name: All that glitters... is gold!
487832613.author: a TripAdvisor user
487832613.reviewBody: Our tour guide brought us here after a short walk. From the outside, you\'ll see an old church, nothing fancy. But inside, the place is amazing.\nThe main church altar has life-sized statues of saints, and in the Rosary chapel the design is so magnificent. We were in awe when we walked in. The architecture is stunning our tour guide says that it should be the 8th wonder of the world. You just have to sit there and admire... and pray too. A must-see for travelers!

487831284.name: Beautiful
487831284.author: a TripAdvisor user
487831284.reviewBody: Beautiful chapel full of gold. You can take pictures. Definitely a hidden gem and must see attraction.

487814388.name: Excelent place to know
487814388.author: a TripAdvisor user
487814388.reviewBody: This is a church with gold on the walls and in the paintings, very impressive, in the city center of Puebla.

487435712.name: Amazing
487435712.author: a TripAdvisor user
487435712.reviewBody: Amazing. That is the only word that I can think of.   Enter to the church and go straight to the altar. This incredible capilla is at your left hand.  Nothing like it.

487112225.name: impresionante
487112225.author: a TripAdvisor user
487112225.reviewBody: the most beautiful thing i have ever seen, you don\'t want to miss it, check out the hours that the church is open cause you can not get at anytime of the day.

485796733.name: one of the iglesias
485796733.author: a TripAdvisor user
485796733.reviewBody: we visited too many iglesias so not that special for me. of course it was beautiful but similar to others for me. \n

485132858.name: So beautiful place
485132858.author: a TripAdvisor user
485132858.reviewBody: If you are lucky you can catch a guided tour, the guides are very inviting and the explanations worth the tip. The chapel has intricate decorative details, if you have some time available, pay attention to them.

484856441.name: Stunning
484856441.author: a TripAdvisor user
484856441.reviewBody: Nothing can really prepare you for the opulence of this chapel it is really magnificent and the detail incredible.  However, a small part of me couldn\'t help thinking the money would have been better spent elsewhere.

484458125.name: Hermosa capilla del rosario
484458125.author: a TripAdvisor user
484458125.reviewBody: It was a beautiful experience, it worth the one day trip from Mexico city to Puebla .The gold art around the altar was impressive and the Chapel is well maintain. It is a must see place

479407347.name: A-MA-ZING
479407347.author: a TripAdvisor user
479407347.reviewBody: The guide insisted to bring us visiting this church before leaving Puebla, and.... we understood why when entering this 8th World Marvel. DON\'T MISS IT.

477791617.name: Amazing chapel
477791617.author: a TripAdvisor user
477791617.reviewBody: This chapel is amazing, completely decorated in gold. A classic example of the rich Baroque style. One of the most beautiful in the whole country.

476243069.name: The glitter of gold!
476243069.author: a TripAdvisor user
476243069.reviewBody: The Rosary Chapel, inside Santo Domingo in Puebla, is very well worth visiting!  Just the pleasure of admiring the inlaid gold work is worth it.  You can spend hours admiring all the art work, while wondering if doing it today would be possible or even allowed by law.

475342302.name: Beautiful
475342302.author: a TripAdvisor user
475342302.reviewBody: This is one of the "don\'t miss" sites in Puebla, near the center of town, of course, as the church is extremely old. Pretty rococo, bring a camera. I always enjoy viewing these rather gaudy churches, although I\'m not Catholic so some of the meaning is lost on me. BTW, the outside gives no indication of what awaits you inside! You must go to the Rosary Chapel!

474297111.name: Almost overwhelming
474297111.author: a TripAdvisor user
474297111.reviewBody: This is a very ornate church that is almost overwhelming. I suggest spending some time just sitting and looking. There is quite a bit of gold adding to the sense of awe. It\'s one of those places you have to experience to understand.

474149837.name: Hotel Casona de China, visit to La rayna workshop in
474149837.author: a TripAdvisor user
474149837.reviewBody: Staying at Hotel Casona de China Polano, La Rayna Talavera workshop, the tiled churches in San Francisco Chulula, dinner at La Rayna and Casona de la China Poblana, and the Museum Amparo

473963093.name: Beautiful, Ornate Chapel
473963093.author: a TripAdvisor user
473963093.reviewBody: If you enjoy visiting Mexican churches, this chapel is one of the most ornate I\'ve seen anywhere. Sometimes parts of it are closed so check the times that it is open.

472932343.name: Mexican Baroque Pearl
472932343.author: a TripAdvisor user
472932343.reviewBody: It was the most breathtaking experience in Puebla City. The chapel is completely decorated in gold filigrane and has symboilc religious details in its walls, like the "rosary" that is hidden in the decoration, but can be followed once you know it\u00b4s there.  It\u00b4s a Dominican church dedicated to Virgin Mary and the rosary.

472789012.name: You have to see it
472789012.author: a TripAdvisor user
472789012.reviewBody: This church has to be seen to believe. The main alter consists of carved statues of both men and nuns. The part to be seen is to the left. It is a chapel layered in 22 carat gold.

472428074.name: esplendid
472428074.author: a TripAdvisor user
472428074.reviewBody: when you go into the church, you never imagine what will you find at the chapel, it is a treasure that probably, you will not find anywhere, you can\u00b4t miss it

472213195.name: Increible/Amazing
472213195.author: a TripAdvisor user
472213195.reviewBody: Un lugar que se tiene que visitar en puebla, no importa si eres religioso o no tienes que ir. Es una maravilla ver esta capilla, la iglesia en general es bonita, pero esta capilla es fuera de serie. \nIt is a place you must visit in Puebla, it does not matter if you are religious or not you will appreciate this chappel. The church is also beautiful, but you will find something amazing going into the chappel.

471532570.name: Mexican Baroque
471532570.author: a TripAdvisor user
471532570.reviewBody: The "Capilla del Rosario" or Rosary Chapel is a gem of Mexican Baroque architecture. Built in the 17th century by the Spanish order of Dominican of friars it is a tribute to the Virgin Mary. Gilded in gold leaf carvings from floor to ceiling it is an example of the the Mexican interpretation of the Spanish Baroque. A must see for any art lover. Enjoy!

468683140.name: 8th Wonder of the World!
468683140.author: a TripAdvisor user
468683140.reviewBody: Located inside the church of Santo Domingo near the main square / Cathedral of Puebla, the Rosary Chapel (Capilla del Rosario) was regarded as the 8th wonder of the world following its completion in the 17th century. If this is one of your first stops in Mexico, prepare to be amazed by the gold that heavenly adorns this side chapel! Colonial Mexico art and architecture truly produced some of the greatest works in the history of the world!\n\nFor tourists running on a strict schedule, make sure you check out this church and chapel well before or after a mass is scheduled, as the gates to the chapel are closed and you should vacate the sanctuary area when mass is in session. During my first group study abroad trip to Puebla, we arrived to the church of Santo Domingo about 10 minutes before a scheduled mass, so we only were able to briefly see parts of the chapel from the closed gates. The next year, thankfully, we arrived a little bit early. I\'m not sure if the chapel gates are open throughout the day and only closed for mass, but it seemed like it was only open for limited slots of time before the gates were closed again. We had to gather at the closed gates before a staff person opened the gates, allowed the chapel to fill to capacity, and proceeded to give us a full tour albeit without a microphone or loud voice. Try researching the history of this magnificent chapel before visiting, as it will only enhance your experience. Regardless, enjoy the real-deal gold decorations, and take a moment to send up a prayer! iAmo Puebla!

468304811.name: Amazing !!!
468304811.author: a TripAdvisor user
468304811.reviewBody: Amazing chapel, 8th wonder of the world, the gold and details, the love for God and worship at this history chapel is amazing

467936185.name: Awe inspiring.
467936185.author: a TripAdvisor user
467936185.reviewBody: We walked by this church on a Sunday afternoon, just before 2pm.  We had missed the early masses at the Cathedral near the Zocalo so assumed I was out of luck. Not so, when we went inside the "Chapel" for a look, we discovered a mass was just starting.  We stayed for the service, yes, all in Spanish of course.  What a wonderful way to experience a mass in Mexico.  Then we continued our walk and found the Barrio Artista nearby.  \n

467675668.name: Solemnly beautiful !
467675668.author: a TripAdvisor user
467675668.reviewBody: We visited this church from the XVII century, and were pleasantly surprised by the fantastic gold work, and its baroque / new Spanish style. The guide, whose name I cannot recall was very helpful.

467341674.name: Simply marvelous!!
467341674.author: a TripAdvisor user
467341674.reviewBody: It is a baroque style little chapel inside a big church called Santo Domingo. Is is covered in gold leaves and it is simply stunning, shining. You can see the little dark skin angels on the walls, a detail that tells us indigenous people worked for the Spaniards in these buildings.

467072245.name: Golden!
467072245.author: a TripAdvisor user
467072245.reviewBody: One of the nicest colonial churches in Puebla. Restorations nearly complete. Lots of gold leaf has been cleaned.

465387413.name: impressive baroque church
465387413.author: a TripAdvisor user
465387413.reviewBody: A must, if you want to see baroque in its splendor, this is it. Even if you don\u00b4t like this art period, you will be impressed by this gorgeous chapel.

461018124.name: Magnificent
461018124.author: a TripAdvisor user
461018124.reviewBody: I\'ve been to churches in France and Rome that were not nearly as nice or as beautiful.  The church is a must-see if you are in Puebla.

460726767.name: Must visit
460726767.author: a TripAdvisor user
460726767.reviewBody: they say there are about 379 churches in Puebla.  I only went to 5 but  have visited churches and cathedrals all over the world and I can say I was shocked to see how beautiful it is!!!  One of the best I have visited.  From the outside it looks like many other churches but once you step inside you can see wonderfully ornate ceilings, paintings and it is very opulent.  I would definitely recommend you see it!( It is a lot better than the Cathedral in my opinion).

460098756.name: Amazing! Capilla del Rosario
460098756.author: a TripAdvisor user
460098756.reviewBody: The Santo Domingo Church fa\u00e7ade is severely grey quarry stone gives no clue to the opulence within. I thought I was in the wrong place. Upon entering its a masterpiece of baroque architecture and decoration. The sumptuous plasterwork and gold leaf contribute to the extravagant d\u00e9cor that characterizes Mexican baroque style. The Capilla del Rosario, on the south side of the church\'s main altar, is the most magnificent aspect of this church\'s interior.\n

459631049.name: amaizing!!!
459631049.author: a TripAdvisor user
459631049.reviewBody: A place of peace and amazing. The chapel is a wonder of the world. You can not leave Puebla without visiting

458483295.name: Amazing architecture and history
458483295.author: a TripAdvisor user
458483295.reviewBody: We saw this gorgeous chapel on a guided tour. The guide told us the history of why the various things (i.e. sculptures) were there. Even without the history, this place is amazing!

458405772.name: Magnificent barroque!
458405772.author: a TripAdvisor user
458405772.reviewBody: This is a must in a visit to Puebla. The best moment to visit this wonderful chapel it\u00b4s at 6am or 5pm so the sun helps to shine all the gold of this magnificent place. All the figures related to the Dominican order as well as the iconography looks great on detail . The chapel is at the end of the cross of the church in the left hand. The church is Santo Domingo a few blocks from the downtown zocalo of Puebla.

457987196.name: Most exquisite expression of baroque
457987196.author: a TripAdvisor user
457987196.reviewBody: Amazing chapel, baroque at its best. \nThere\'s no way to describe it in words, make sure to see it with your own eyes!!!\n

456744208.name: A beautiful example of colonial art
456744208.author: a TripAdvisor user
456744208.reviewBody: Smaller than other churches in Puebla, but offering exquisite decoration in it\'s interior. Definitely a must see while in Puebla.\n\nAlthough we opted out, there was the option of attending a presentation from one of the church\'s care takers where they explain a lot of it\'s history. If you have the time it could be a good option.

456279484.name: Prepare to be blown away
456279484.author: a TripAdvisor user
456279484.reviewBody: Totally over the top with ornate gold embellishment.  Not sure if I liked it or hated it but well worth seeing

455600757.name: Unbelievable!
455600757.author: a TripAdvisor user
455600757.reviewBody: A bit challenging to find, but this elaborately decorated chapel leaves one breathless. No surface neglected! Yes, it is seriously overdone, but has to be seen. I\'ve heard some of the locals call it the eighth wonder of the world. So find a guide if necessary and go see it!

454544017.name: Not my cup of tea
454544017.author: a TripAdvisor user
454544017.reviewBody: Much is made of this baroque chapel, but it just doesn\'t work for me. We visited a couple years ago and revisited this year after seeing it featured at the new, and world class, Museum of the Baroque, imagining that maybe we had missed something, but I don\'t think so. It\'s just off the Zocalo, only takes a few minutes, and doesn\'t have to cost anything, so it\'s easy to check off your list if you\'re so inclined. I do recommend sticking your head in as many of the large churches in Puebla as you can, and there are a dozen or more in the downtown area. They will present a stunning variety of form and designs, all with 60-70 foot high naves and even higher central domes. That will be a rewarding experience even you can\'t recall which one was which by the time you leave town.

454077741.name: Amazing church but we were not able to take photos there.
454077741.author: a TripAdvisor user
454077741.reviewBody: It was raining when we accidentally arrived at the church. We were at awe when we walked in. There are two churches in one. Make sure you walk far enough so you can see the Chapel. Stay for a mass so you can appreciate all the art and culture of the chapel.

453992355.name: impressive artwork
453992355.author: a TripAdvisor user
453992355.reviewBody: wonderful church just 5 mins from pueblas zocalo. probably the most beautiful church in town in its overall ensemble. great "inquisition baroque"!

453148737.name: On the left of the alter as you walk in
453148737.author: a TripAdvisor user
453148737.reviewBody: It is possible to miss it. Really pretty and if you are lucky you can listen in to a tour group as you look at it :-)

453133726.name: Beautiful Chapel
453133726.author: a TripAdvisor user
453133726.reviewBody: Do not miss visiting this part of the Church.  It should be called the Golden Chapel.  A  man was giving a complete talk on it\'s history while I was visiting.  Unfortunately it was all in Spanish.

453108979.name: Gold everywhere
453108979.author: a TripAdvisor user
453108979.reviewBody: This is a must in Puebla. Beautiful chapel in gold that tells so much about the religiousness of the people of Puebla as it tells about its history. Really a must!

452847769.name: the 8th Wonder of the World
452847769.author: a TripAdvisor user
452847769.reviewBody: You don\u00b4t have to be a religious person to feel touched by this place.\nA MUST when you come to Puebla, definitely a MUST

451371904.name: beautiful and peaceful
451371904.author: a TripAdvisor user
451371904.reviewBody: It is a beautiful and peaceful place with lots of painting and architecture and the extensive use of gold foils is amazing.

450559032.name: Jaw-dropping gold-leaf decoration.
450559032.author: a TripAdvisor user
450559032.reviewBody: Truly amazing baroque handicraft. A marvel of local artisanship in devotional art. Well worth the visit

448714307.name: Must
448714307.author: a TripAdvisor user
448714307.reviewBody: It looks a little plain on the outside but once inside, the visual treats just keep coming. \n\nThe baroque style, statues, paintings and use of light are truly incredible.

448707356.name: Very impressive, beautiful!
448707356.author: a TripAdvisor user
448707356.reviewBody: Even if you have only a few minutes, walk in and make the turn left towards the front of the church to be in awe by the overwhelming decorations of the chapel!

447923659.name: Just another chapel
447923659.author: a TripAdvisor user
447923659.reviewBody: Lots of gold, nice looking chapel but it\'s not worth extra effort.  5 min does it justice but if you\'ve seen other nice looking chapels before you would not be awed.

447237920.name: Rosary Chapel
447237920.author: a TripAdvisor user
447237920.reviewBody: This chapel truly rivals that of any we have seen in Europe.  An absolute must see when visiting this beautiful colonial city of Puebla.

445981973.name: The Jewel of Puebla
445981973.author: a TripAdvisor user
445981973.reviewBody: The finest example of the Baroque in the western hemisphere. The best time to come here is when the sun is setting because when it comes through the rotunda windows, it bathes everything in the chapel in a stunning, golden glow you\'ll never see any other time of day. Stick around until about 6:00 PM, and they turn on the altar\'s interior lights, so you get a whole new view of it. Ignore the guy lecturing the visitors; he is not an official church employee, and he tells lies regarding the murals (like that the red paint was made with human blood). Take a high-quality camera with you.

445291155.name: Gorgeous Chappel
445291155.author: a TripAdvisor user
445291155.reviewBody: It was one of the most amazing visited places while being in Puebla. I would say it\'s a hidden pearl of the old town. The chapel is small, but gorgeous with extravagant interior. It was really worth to see even personally I\'m not kind of person visiting churches :)

445253195.name: Baroque at its maximum splendor
445253195.author: a TripAdvisor user
445253195.reviewBody: The chapell, inside the non too shabby Church of Santo Domingo, is a masterpiece of Mexican Baroque, with its intricate, gold leaf covered carvings and frescoes. The church was built between 1571 and 1611 and the chapel shortly afterwards, and it is no wonder it took them 40 years. Interestingly, this is part of a still working monastery and you can see some of the benedictine monks come in for the 18:30 rosary. The courtyard outside the church is a welcome respite from the busy shopping streets outside and good place to kick a ball around!

445085949.name: incredible
445085949.author: a TripAdvisor user
445085949.reviewBody: This site is a must see while in Puebla ... truly a beautifully kept gilded treasure.  No flash photos of course, however, the light from the chapel will reflect on the gold and illuminate your photos in some glorious ways.  Check the hours so that you can get inside the chapel itself, sit awhile to take it all in.

444277033.name: Stunning
444277033.author: a TripAdvisor user
444277033.reviewBody: As a northern european protestant, I should probably say that this is jut too OTT, but WOW!!! Absolutely amazing, gilded, ornamentation and huge pained scenes from the bible history. And the centre piece with the virgin Mary is stunning. Must see!

443351323.name: Great place
443351323.author: a TripAdvisor user
443351323.reviewBody: The Rosary Chapel is located about 5 min walking from the main square of the city. To see it you need about 15min max. It is for free and it deserves to be n.1 in trip advisor of Puebla city

443190940.name: Indescribable, A must see
443190940.author: a TripAdvisor user
443190940.reviewBody: The chapel is indescribable and a must see. I wish I had gotten there a bit earlier. I knew the chapel closed at 12:45 and had plenty of time to see it, but did not account for the groups that would be at the front, blocking an unhindered view. I tried to wait them out but with so much to see they were understandably not in a hurry to leave.

440221797.name: Beautiful!
440221797.author: a TripAdvisor user
440221797.reviewBody: It\'s a block from Zocalo, free, and beautifully constructed. \n\nI\'m not one for churches, but the architecture is pretty spectacular!

440029554.name: Check the hours carefully
440029554.author: a TripAdvisor user
440029554.reviewBody: Didn\'t actually get in because the opening hours of the church in which the Chapel is are tricky when it is not Saturday/Sunday. During the week on most days the church is closed mid-day. And I couldn\'t find the hours online. See attached photo for the hours...which I just added to this listing :)

439648704.name: Beautiful Capilla in Puebla
439648704.author: a TripAdvisor user
439648704.reviewBody: It is a most seeing location, if you go make the time to stay 10 minutes to listen to the Tour guide there they are amazing and really friendly. They explain you about the Capilla. Doesn\'t take that long and you learn and see more than if you only step in and out it was worth it to sit and listen the story and see how beautiful it is from the inside

439145254.name: Getting married in some of the nicest chapels in the world
439145254.author: a TripAdvisor user
439145254.reviewBody:
My wife and I got lucky to get married in the Capilla Rosario just some weeks ago. I haven't been there before and I was speechles at the beginning when I entered this place. 

Full of gold this looks like a chamber of a pirate treasure. So many nice details in the designs. Additionally to that you'll find some very nice paintings. Just stunning. 

After this first impression my wife entered the church which gave me the second moment of being speechless. Visiting this place is awesome and getting married there is from another world.

437630698.name: A must see site.
437630698.author: a TripAdvisor user
437630698.reviewBody: This is a beautiful architecture inside the chapel that when you see it one is mesmerized by its beauty, the detail put on its construction and its decoration is unique. When visiting make sure you have a tour guide or some knowledge about its history.

436696328.name: A must see when in Puebla
436696328.author: a TripAdvisor user
436696328.reviewBody: The Capilla Del Rosario is within the Templo de Santa Domingo. It\'s walls and ceiling are decorated with impressive wood work. Certainly unique in its form and size.

436239080.name: Amazing
436239080.author: a TripAdvisor user
436239080.reviewBody: Impressive.  A very beautiful church.  The architecture and the adornments of the church are well woth the visit.  No entrance fee except and no pictures allowed.

436061619.name: AMAZING
436061619.author: a TripAdvisor user
436061619.reviewBody: I am not a religious person, but this chapel is breathtaking! Its a shame you cant take a picture or buy a postcard of it.

435994317.name: Impressive
435994317.author: a TripAdvisor user
435994317.reviewBody: Impressive cathedral. Lots of gold. I\'m not a religious person but do love architecture so well worth a visit. Free entry. No cameras

435595123.name: Excellent historic place for peace and tranquillity.
435595123.author: a TripAdvisor user
435595123.reviewBody:
I visited Rosary with my friends on 12th October 2016.

I was mesmerised with the grandeur of the place. It is not only magnificent but has the historic importance also.

One of the best experience here was the peace and tranquillity which I enjoyed. I sat down for half an hour on the bench inside the Rosary and prayed. I had very exhilirating experience in my body after sitting and praying.

The delicate, sophisticated and well maintained artisitic creations on the walls inside the Rosary is worth seeing with one's own eyes. It is not possible to describe it in words. It has to be seen to believe and appreciate its beauty.

I am happy and lucky to have come to Puebla and visit this place.

431269593.name: stunning
431269593.author: a TripAdvisor user
431269593.reviewBody: if you ever set a foot in Puebla, which you must, you certainly need to see this chappel. it cannot be discribed.\nbe carefull couse it doesnt open all the time. check the visiting hours

430333326.name: A Jewel Of A Church
430333326.author: a TripAdvisor user
430333326.reviewBody: The energy of this amazing structure is incredible. It is so beautiful, that it takes your breath away. I could have sat there for hours just meditating and taking in the mystical energy.

428008430.name: Glimmering Chapel overwhealms
428008430.author: a TripAdvisor user
428008430.reviewBody: Splendor literally calls  as an arch reveals not just a small chapel but a towering altar, dome and uniquely tiled nave.  This is an amazing space one wishes one could have more access to as the viewing area is somewhat limited to protect the gilt surfaces.  Seen with shafts of sunlight playing on baroque detail, it is a spectacle of movement and glory.

426656209.name: This is a must in Puebla
426656209.author: a TripAdvisor user
426656209.reviewBody: This is unique, this small chapel is living rosary...please ask the explenation of a guide so you wont miss all the meanings of the architecture. In this case all that brigths it is gold...

426162506.name: Amazinf
426162506.author: a TripAdvisor user
426162506.reviewBody: Incredible, you will get to the church and actually don\'t expect what you are going to see inside. Neighborhood around has lots of local attraction right in downtown Puebla. Have your camera ready.

424804698.name: Do not miss
424804698.author: a TripAdvisor user
424804698.reviewBody: A beautiful chapel whose artwork and ornate decoration will knock your socks off. If you happen to speak Spanish, a gentleman will explain everything to you for whatever you want to give him. An amazing place.

424302683.name: Stunning!
424302683.author: a TripAdvisor user
424302683.reviewBody: A must-visit place when in Puebla. This is truly one of the most beautiful religious buildings in Mexico!

424064996.name: A delightful suprise
424064996.author: a TripAdvisor user
424064996.reviewBody: During our visit to Puebla we didn\'t really have a plan of action. We mostly walked around and visited location as we stumbled upon them. The chapel was located in a small church. We walked in and looked around but when we got to the front of the church we were taking in by the beauty of the Rosary Chapel. Breathtaking.

419997378.name: The most beautiful chapel in America
419997378.author: a TripAdvisor user
419997378.reviewBody:
This tiny chapel inside the Santo Domingo church is one of the most amazing places I have seen. So many details! Si beautiful!

Please try to listen to the explanation of the tourist guides that are there.

It is a MUST if you visit Puebla.

419604962.name: Most beautiful of all churches
419604962.author: a TripAdvisor user
419604962.reviewBody: Without a doubt, the most beautiful of all churches in Puebla...and believe me, there\'s many! Enter here and get lost in Baroque beauty!

418003971.name: One of the awesome altars that I\u00b4ve ever see!
418003971.author: a TripAdvisor user
418003971.reviewBody: From outside it\u00b4s not so attractive but once you go in you can apreciate the altar which is awesome! very detailed worked very meaningfull.

417736488.name: Lots of churches in Puebla, but this was my favorite
417736488.author: a TripAdvisor user
417736488.reviewBody: I was astounded by the artwork, the quality of the many statues and the beautiful woodwork.  After you have absorbed all of that,  you have to look up at the ceiling.  It was breathtaking.  I had to sit down and absorb it all.  Hard to believe the time and talent it took to create such artwork.  Well worth the visit and just a couple of blocks off the Zocalo.

416609474.name: Must see
416609474.author: a TripAdvisor user
416609474.reviewBody: Great art work impressive amounts of gold. Go all the way in  and the chapel is on the left side. Free of charge. I was amazed at how different it is from current churches.The shop at the church has nice things.

416284182.name: Most Beautiful Chapel ever
416284182.author: a TripAdvisor user
416284182.reviewBody: It\'s just AMAZING and breath taking the beauty, the extravagance and the detailed this immaculate chapel is. Truly a piece of art. Worth every second the visit there.

415832303.name: A must see in Puebla
415832303.author: a TripAdvisor user
415832303.reviewBody: If you are not that much into churches, as there are a lot in Puebla, this is the one you must see. The chapel with all the gold ornaments is just breathtaking

414750666.name: Beautiful
414750666.author: a TripAdvisor user
414750666.reviewBody: Lots of interesting details with lots of stories behind. Get a guide to get insider knowledge! Check opening hours too so that you don\'t miss the opportunity to see this beautiful place

414318093.name: You must visit!
414318093.author: a TripAdvisor user
414318093.reviewBody: Even by Mexican standards, this is an amazing church and the Rosary Chapel has to be seen to be believed! I don\'t think that I have ever seen so much gold leaf in one place.

412119550.name: Rich
412119550.author: a TripAdvisor user
412119550.reviewBody: It\'s worth checking out the opening hours for the convent it\'s in as the richly decorated chapel full of gold and silver and general bling will leave you stunned. One of the places in Puebla I highly recommend visiting!

409651270.name: Considered a Wonder of the World!
409651270.author: a TripAdvisor user
409651270.reviewBody: If you are in Puebla you have to see this chapel. Free admission and an incredible work of art and architecture. Ideal place for destination Catholic weddings. Totally covered in 24K gold leaf. Hire a bilingual guide to understand its design better. Guides are usually available on site. No visitors or photos allowed during mass service.

408078567.name: Our favorite church
408078567.author: a TripAdvisor user
408078567.reviewBody: Absolutely stunning. Do not skip this one. It\'s an easy walk from the main plaza and is surrounded by interesting retail. Definitely a beautiful church. It has a small store inside.

406722933.name: Capilla del Rosario
406722933.author: a TripAdvisor user
406722933.reviewBody: Magnificient!, Beautiful, Awe striking. If you are in Puebla you HAVE to see it, it is a masterpiece of Baroque Art. Read about the wealth in gold and the time it took to be built before you go, so you\'ll have a more complete idea of what you are seeing. Not to be missed!

404639206.name: you\'ll need dark glasses
404639206.author: a TripAdvisor user
404639206.reviewBody: This small chapel located inside the larger Santo Domingo Church is in the very ornate Spanish baroque Churrigueresque style and, as if that\'s not enough to dazzle, it\'s completely covered with gold.  If you think all churches are pretty much the same, have a look at this one!

404498593.name: amazing!
404498593.author: a TripAdvisor user
404498593.reviewBody: A must see Church. They surely don\'t make them like they use to. The detail in it is breath-taking. Highly recommend it if you are in Puebla.

402177538.name: Diamond in the Ruff
402177538.author: a TripAdvisor user
402177538.reviewBody: This place is beautiful.  If there is a service in session they will not let you enter to take pictures.  We waited until afterwards, and there were a few ladies praying and they were upset when we came in to take pictures.

398945926.name: beautiful Roman Catholic Chapel
398945926.author: a TripAdvisor user
398945926.reviewBody: I am not of the Roman Catholic persuasion. But this is a beautiful chapel worth seeing. Everything is painted with gold leaf. There are tour guides available. No tours during mass.

398217912.name: This is a must see!
398217912.author: a TripAdvisor user
398217912.reviewBody: This church is two churches in one building . Both are very pretty churches but this chapel is amazing . We were lucky enough that they had \na mass when we went to visit the chapel. What a great experience !

397598978.name: A must in your trip to Puebla
397598978.author: a TripAdvisor user
397598978.reviewBody: Capilla del Rosario is a clear example of the novohispanic baroque. Puebla is full of that art expression but in particular this place will leave you astonish. You can be in there for hours watching and observing every detail of it. It is a clear example of the art that you can only encounter in sacred places.Take your time to visit this place. It is very impressive.

397417024.name: Amazing - a must see in Puebla
397417024.author: a TripAdvisor user
397417024.reviewBody: This chapel is a small annexe off the Templo de Santa Domingo in the centre of a busy shopping area in the centre of Puebla. It is best accessed on foot. As you go down the aisle, it is to the left of the altar. It is truly amazing a real treasure: baroque with the walls and ceiling covered in gold leaf. It took 40 years to build seemingly: from 1650 to 1690. A must-see.

397126804.name: Amazing Jewel
397126804.author: a TripAdvisor user
397126804.reviewBody: One of the top spots to visit while in Puebla, Mexico. All the craft involved in the decoration of the walls and ceiling is just incredible and the gold used is just amazing.

396956005.name: One of the most unbelievable churches
396956005.author: a TripAdvisor user
396956005.reviewBody: This is one of the most fantastically decorated churches I\'ve seen, just as good or better than some cathedrals, but smaller and not as crowded. There are some, um, interesting statues. Such as a full-size, bloody Christ after being crucified. Too gruesome for kids.

394817846.name: Awsome !!!
394817846.author: a TripAdvisor user
394817846.reviewBody: One of the nicest chapels I\'ve ever visited.  All the engravings are simply beautiful, it is spectacular.  If you visit Puebla, this is one of the must see places.

393265272.name: Stunningly beautiful
393265272.author: a TripAdvisor user
393265272.reviewBody: This is one of the great churches in Puebla, a city full of them. This is the big one, and this is its spectacular chapel.\nBaroque in the extreme. Bring reverence and don\'t take photos.

392116523.name: A gem
392116523.author: a TripAdvisor user
392116523.reviewBody: Every time I have family and friends visit I make sure to take them. If we are really lucky, there are docents who will give you an explanation of the ornamentation of the chapel for a small tip. These talks are usually in Spanish, but you may find one who can give it in other languages. It really is worth the visit!

387481160.name: What an Opulent Chapel
387481160.author: a TripAdvisor user
387481160.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful churches I have ever seen. The painting and decorations are just breathtaking. There is no charge for entry. Worth the visit when in Puebla.

387337889.name: Beautiful chapel!
387337889.author: a TripAdvisor user
387337889.reviewBody: Really beautiful chapel, amazing detail throughout the whole building.  Definitely worth a visit when you are in Puebla!

384725355.name: Amazing!
384725355.author: a TripAdvisor user
384725355.reviewBody: Beautiful chapel, amazingly detailed and covered in gold! Someone was offering a free tour of the chapel (tip optional but recommended) in which he described the symbolism of the chapel. It is a place you must visit while in Puebla!

382480208.name: Wow! Wow! Wow!
382480208.author: a TripAdvisor user
382480208.reviewBody: Such an amazing and beautiful cathedral. A must visit anytime you are in Puebla. Very humbling and awe inspiring.

378684150.name: Exquisite
378684150.author: a TripAdvisor user
378684150.reviewBody: This visit was quite inspiring. The art is sublime, and it can overpower if you don\'t take it all in slowly. Of course, if you are Catholic and you have prayed the Rosary it makes sense. Nevertheless, everyone should visit for a mind blowing experience. I would go back again and again for the sensory pleasure of looking at such beauty crafted by the natives, of the supposed New World...

375799977.name: Extraordinary, moving, spectacular...
375799977.author: a TripAdvisor user
375799977.reviewBody: Ornate indigenous woodcarving coated with dazzling, almost completely pure gold. Spanish Arabic tiling and motifs, hidden figures with allegorical meanings. Mexican Baroque at one of its finest. If the builders from a few hundred years ago where aiming to overwhelm, they did a good job. On a sunny and quiet day, it is a mystical experience.

375602422.name: Must see site in quaint Puebla
375602422.author: a TripAdvisor user
375602422.reviewBody: This is a site you must visit when in Puebla - absolutely breathtaking! The outside of this chapel is deceiving but once you step inside it is a different world! The detail is astonishing and not to be missed.

375241916.name: Amazing church.
375241916.author: a TripAdvisor user
375241916.reviewBody: Is an amazing church with gold paper all around it, down side is cant not take pictures inside but is understanding since the ligth can damage the pictures. Lot of the pictures there around 200 years at leas.

374956731.name: The "must" place to visit in Puebla
374956731.author: a TripAdvisor user
374956731.reviewBody: The "Capilla de Rosario" is the best example of baroque art in Churches. The style is so pure and the art work is so impressive. I strongly suggest a guideto get a good explanation of all the work and the history of how the work was made.\nIt is fully covered with 24 karat gold, a one of a kind place to visit.

374680413.name: Wow!
374680413.author: a TripAdvisor user
374680413.reviewBody: This is not to miss!  I was blown away by the intricate details and all the gold that was in the Rosary Chapel.  This is a gem and rivals any I\'ve seen in Europe.  Do not miss!

370214520.name: The most beautiful church!  Breathtaking!
370214520.author: a TripAdvisor user
370214520.reviewBody: I would travel to Puebla just to see this church!  You will be amazed at beauty of the art and architecture.  It is radiant!  I have been in churches all over the world and this wins!

369609943.name: One of the most beautiful and elaborate churches I\'ve seen
369609943.author: a TripAdvisor user
369609943.reviewBody: Enter the church and then go to the back of it and turn left. You will go into a beautiful room with very elaborate decoration.

369119631.name: Breathless!
369119631.author: a TripAdvisor user
369119631.reviewBody: I have seen a lot of churches in my life, but this is probably the best I have ever seen! Absolutely beautiful!

368423471.name: A must if you are in Puebla downtown
368423471.author: a TripAdvisor user
368423471.reviewBody: This was our last stop in Puebla and definitely the cherry on the cake of our trip. We were told to go at or around 4:30 pm on that saturday because the church was closed before that. \nAbsolutely stunning.

368287398.name: "Enjoy mexican Barroco"
368287398.author: a TripAdvisor user
368287398.reviewBody: This is the most, in our city. Located in the Santo Domingo Church, downtown  very close to the Cathedral. This small Chapel cover of gold, show the way mexican understand and create "el barroco".

365783141.name: A Real Surprise
365783141.author: a TripAdvisor user
365783141.reviewBody: This is a must stop for all visitors to Puebla. We attended a wedding here and learned the history of the church property. Please visit this property and take the tour.

364958978.name: Beautiful church, amazing architecture
364958978.author: a TripAdvisor user
364958978.reviewBody: Wort seeing. it is so detailed and magnificent in its decoration that you probably end up taking a lot of pictures.

364672944.name: Incredible!
364672944.author: a TripAdvisor user
364672944.reviewBody: This is a stunning church and religious or not it is well worth visiting. The interior decor is amazing.

363185127.name: Very ornate
363185127.author: a TripAdvisor user
363185127.reviewBody: This chapel does not disappoint. If you love the Baroque style you must see this chapel. I have never seen so much gold in one place! We happened in while a speaker was telling the history to a group, so that was nice. All of the churches are free to enter and the locals are welcoming and friendly. Puebla has had many of their buildings listed as unesco heritage sites and this chapel is one because of the unique baroque style. If you enjoy seeing churches as I do, this one is worth the time to park and walk to.

362134672.name: Absolutely spectacular !
362134672.author: a TripAdvisor user
362134672.reviewBody: Having seen vast numbers of churches in different parts of the world I was not expecting to be blown away this morning when I arrived at the Rosary Chapel.\nThe main church you enter through is nothing to dismiss but when you get towards the main altar and glance to the left you will wowed by what you\'ll see . The Roasry Chapel will knock your socks off with it\'s golden magnificence . Photos cannot begin to do justice to what is truly a spectacular sight. Don\'t miss this place !

360665279.name: Take binoculars
360665279.author: a TripAdvisor user
360665279.reviewBody: The detail is so extraordinary you really need binoculars to see it. If you are a photographer, you really need a decent soon lens and a tripod. There seem to be no restrictions on the latter, although flash is NOT allowed. My guess is the light is best in the afternoon.

359753095.name: Spectacular
359753095.author: a TripAdvisor user
359753095.reviewBody: There are so many beautiful churches in Mexico, but this chapel is definitely a must see. Not only for Christians or art lovers.

359546992.name: Gorgeous chapel
359546992.author: a TripAdvisor user
359546992.reviewBody: This very ornated chapel is just espectacular! And only two blocks from the main square! You do not need to be catholic to admire this piece of art.

359414957.name: A Modern Wonder
359414957.author: a TripAdvisor user
359414957.reviewBody:
This is a great place that should be included in the list of modern wonders.

Getting into there is really impressive, almost the same feeling of visiting a european church.

Visits are at afternoon just for a few minutes after religious service.

A guide is a good choice, they offer a clear and brief description of chapel history for a tip.

357621819.name: Gorgeous
357621819.author: a TripAdvisor user
357621819.reviewBody: The ornate detail is amazing! It provides an abundance of photography opportunities. I highly recommend seeing it.

355372419.name: Churriguera in its splendor
355372419.author: a TripAdvisor user
355372419.reviewBody: Even if you are not catolic it is an excelent place to visit. The splendor of the Churrigueresco. A must for architects.

354900001.name: Baroque gem
354900001.author: a TripAdvisor user
354900001.reviewBody: I prefer pre-Hispanic sights, but this chapel is splendid, for its color and its workmanship. Still, the two churches in Cholula are by far the best of Puebla.

353179877.name: So many churches, but this is the one to visit
353179877.author: a TripAdvisor user
353179877.reviewBody: From the outside this looks like all the other churches, but you really must stop in here...the large main alter is not what you are after, it is the smaller alter to the side...

350917915.name: If You Visit Only One - This Should be It
350917915.author: a TripAdvisor user
350917915.reviewBody: Puebla does not have a shortage of Catholic churches to put it mildly.  They run the gamut from small neighbourhood to gargantuan behemoths.   The interior of the Rosario (IMO) makes it the stunning example of ostentatious church building.  Unbelievable for the time it was built. You can take photos inside whereas the cathedral forbids it.  Rosario has an amazing interior.

349303895.name: Dazzling!
349303895.author: a TripAdvisor user
349303895.reviewBody: Mexican baroque, angel faces galore, gold leaf from all angles, for some like a taste of heaven perhaps. No flash pics allowed, closed to the public during mass and I believe, for the lunch hour. Optional: a guide who will give a detailed explanation. Note, this is not the main altar in the church but a chapel up near the front and off to the left.

348584340.name: Good to see.
348584340.author: a TripAdvisor user
348584340.reviewBody: Beautiful church. There are many many churches in Mexico and they all start to run together in your mind\'s eye but this one is really beautiful and a a must see.

348530887.name: Lovely church was completely adorned inside with flowers when I visited
348530887.author: a TripAdvisor user
348530887.reviewBody: Another must see whilst in Puebla architecture is so beautiful and the feeling when you look at the ceiling, is fantastic

347589691.name: You have to visit this place.
347589691.author: a TripAdvisor user
347589691.reviewBody: Barrocan style capilla. Is absolutly amazing. Ask for a guide they speak all languages. Don\u00b4t use flash

346721998.name: Quite stunning
346721998.author: a TripAdvisor user
346721998.reviewBody: Yes this is both ornate and stunning, but thee is a quietness in the small side chapel that seemed to dampen some of the ostentatious use of gold leaf. I hesitate to say that this chapel will need significant fiscal assistance soon if it is to keep up its luster

345991645.name: Beautiful!
345991645.author: a TripAdvisor user
345991645.reviewBody: Much smaller than the cathedral but equally ornate. No problem taking pictures if you don\'t use flash. A guided tour is always nice, but also nice to just sit down and take it in. The altarpiece especially is worth a lengthy study.

345950901.name: Unbelievable!
345950901.author: a TripAdvisor user
345950901.reviewBody: Don\'t miss it.  We went twice while we were there. This ornate chapel is beyond opulent.  Words and pictures cannot begin to convey what you will see.

345263848.name: Spectacular Waste
345263848.author: a TripAdvisor user
345263848.reviewBody: Yes, the gold is magnificent. However, the paintings that the gold surrounds need restoration. They\'re so dingy that it\'s hard to discern what they represent.

341076219.name: Magnificent chapel
341076219.author: a TripAdvisor user
341076219.reviewBody: Considered the 8 th wonder of the new world,  if you are in a hurry and you only are 1 day in Puebla this is a must. You will see the wonderful decoration of gold!  Just take into account a couple of links things.  The rosary chapel is usually open until 12 pm,  and reopened at 4 pm to 6:30 pm.  Don\'t be fooled by the guides inside the place,  it is free to stay and take pictures.  Just no flash.

340585788.name: Amazing Chapel
340585788.author: a TripAdvisor user
340585788.reviewBody: Amazing chapel, very recommended to visit if you are in Puebla, I would say "must see" category. Beautiful paintings and gold decor.

338180939.name: Must see!
338180939.author: a TripAdvisor user
338180939.reviewBody: When you walk in to the Church it is not that amazing, once you turn and see the chapel wow! The work and all that gold leaf is just unbelievable.

337678328.name: Gold and history!!!!
337678328.author: a TripAdvisor user
337678328.reviewBody: You musto to know the one of the seven new wonder in the world!!!! Come to Puebla City and visit THE ROSARY CHAPEL,!!

337336722.name: At first it looks like a simple church. Then...
337336722.author: a TripAdvisor user
337336722.reviewBody: Walk into the main church and you\'ll find that it looks like countless other churches in Puebla, in Mexico, in Latin America. Once you turn the corner into the chapel, however, you realize this is a real 24k gem. There\'s gold everywhere you rest your eye. It\'s a good size chapel and the gold just shimmers in all directions

336530556.name: Hermoso altar de Oro
336530556.author: a TripAdvisor user
336530556.reviewBody: Puebla is famous for having 365 churches, one for each day of the year. The Spanish people wrote this fact , which is not accurate, but as I know it has more than 100 beautiful and original churches. The church of Santo Domingo in the historic quarter is famous for its inside Gold made chapel, Capilla del Rosario which is very beautiful.

334847140.name: Fantastic Chapel To Visit!
334847140.author: a TripAdvisor user
334847140.reviewBody: Many might wonder what the fuss is all about with visiting churches. However, if there is just one church you visit in Puebla (or even the whole of M\u00e9xico), try to make it this one.\n\nI grand enough main church opens to a side chapel with the most extensive gilding and paintings. Not to be missed!

333151410.name: A sight not to be missed
333151410.author: a TripAdvisor user
333151410.reviewBody: I have seen more than 100 chapels all over the world, and this one is among the most impressive and beautiful. The art critics were right. You enter into a fairyland of gold leafed sculptures and floral designs that engulfs you completely, gasping at the details you can\'t quite make out. Wherever you look there is a detail you want to see surrounded by fluid beaty and a fervid yet peaceful aesthetic sense. It is not to be missed.

332666061.name: BREATHTAKING!
332666061.author: a TripAdvisor user
332666061.reviewBody: I have visited Churches and Cathedrals in Europe and Temples in Asia.  This one is the equal of any of those in beauty.  A guide is available (for a tip) to explain the construction of the chapel.  I would advise you pay the man and listen to his fascinating history of the place.

332134219.name: Absolutely Beautiful!
332134219.author: a TripAdvisor user
332134219.reviewBody: The chapel and church interior is beautifully ornate with gilded altars everywhere! Don\'t miss it!! We went at night and got to listen to a free Christmas choral concert. It was magical.

330408295.name: Amazing Chapel, Worth All the Stars!
330408295.author: a TripAdvisor user
330408295.reviewBody: Absolutely breathtaking little gem in the heart of Puebla. Not to be missed! Just takes a few minutes, but well worth the time.

329336377.name: Beautiful chapel
329336377.author: a TripAdvisor user
329336377.reviewBody: This is a stunning chapel and a must visit in Puebla. It is in the main cathedral and can\'t be described. Go early in your visit because you might want to return. If you are tired from a long day in the city just go to sit and regroup.

325369980.name: Beautiful place to pause and reflect on a busy day
325369980.author: a TripAdvisor user
325369980.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful Capilla in Puebla.  There are many churches and Capilla in the Zona Colonial of Puebla and this is one of the most beautiful. Only a block from the Zocalo, it\'s in the heart of the tourist area, but still very worth a stop.  The fresh flowers alone are memorable, as is the side chapel.  Don\'t miss it.

321925729.name: Lots of gold!!
321925729.author: a TripAdvisor user
321925729.reviewBody: I was impressive. Gold everywhere.  The history is also fascinating. It is said to be one if the wonders of the world.\nAll mexican architecture and design. \n

321388020.name: Golden Celebration of Spirituality!
321388020.author: a TripAdvisor user
321388020.reviewBody: This place is absolutely breathtaking. A massive, regal, aged church with a cathedral that is literally dripping gold. \nThis place is a "must visit." And it is free of charge to see.

321264357.name: Astonishing
321264357.author: a TripAdvisor user
321264357.reviewBody: Not really interested in chappels/churches, but this is amazing. It is difficult to take a picture that describes all the magnificence of this place.

317040435.name: fantastic chapel; just a MUST to visit in Puebla
317040435.author: a TripAdvisor user
317040435.reviewBody: This is one of the greatest Chapel of Mexico - and we have seen many, many churches in this beautiful country.

316590158.name: A Must-See stop in Puebla
316590158.author: a TripAdvisor user
316590158.reviewBody: An assault on the senses, the shear amount of shiny gold int he chapel is quite amazing.  The Santa Domingo Church is worth a visit alone, but the chapel makes this a must-stop while visiting Puebla.  We visited during a weekday and found it to be very quiet, allowing us some peaceful time inside the chapel to take it all in.

315978215.name: beautiful room, but that\'s it
315978215.author: a TripAdvisor user
315978215.reviewBody: Yes, this chapel had the most beautiful side chapel I have ever seen, but that\'s really all it is. Spent about 15 minutes in the church, worth seeing, but if short on time the cathedral is the church not to miss.

315085437.name: A must see! And it\'s free.
315085437.author: a TripAdvisor user
315085437.reviewBody: A must see while in Puebla. Over the top gold leaf everywhere and one of the best chapels and churches in all of mexico!

313554428.name: Stunning arcitecture and high cultural significance!
313554428.author: a TripAdvisor user
313554428.reviewBody: Stunning arcitecture and high cultural significance! This site is a must visit in Puebla as it is essentially an icon of the city.

310258009.name: Extravagant Church!
310258009.author: a TripAdvisor user
310258009.reviewBody: Looking at the chapel from the outside you can easily see that it is large and grandiose, but the grounds surrounding it are rather bland and uninviting. However, don\'t let that deter you from entering, because once you do, you will be overwhelmed by the extravagance and beauty that is inside. Allow yourself at least 20 minutes to slowly walk around and examine the details in the structure and decorations of the chapel.

309113987.name: Don\'t miss
309113987.author: a TripAdvisor user
309113987.reviewBody: The chapel is a real gem. It is located in the center of the old city, not far from the zocalo, so it is easy to reach. Lush gold all over the place, really impressive.

307487457.name: Beautiful from a distance
307487457.author: a TripAdvisor user
307487457.reviewBody: I visited the Capilla in the Santo Domingo church twice with a friend, but never got inside, because we arrived once before it was open (2 p.m.) and once just after it closed for an evening service (6 p.m.).  From standing at the door during the service when the Capilla was fully illuminated, it looked beautiful.  So, make certain you visit between the hours of 2 and 6 p.m., to enjoy it fully.

307228191.name: Beatiful place
307228191.author: a TripAdvisor user
307228191.reviewBody: A very nice place to visit. Full of gold and amazing work and paintings. Close to the chapel you can walk into the famous street full of traditional Puebla sweets...make sure to visit La Gran Fama, best place to buy sweets, very fresh and made with real ingredients...other use sugar instead of real pumpkin glaze for the famous tortitas Santa Clara. La gran fama is next to hermanos Sedan house-museum.

305461669.name: amazing place
305461669.author: a TripAdvisor user
305461669.reviewBody: This cathedral is an Amazing place. One of the best decorated cathedral i ever seen . Its a must visit place in Puebla.

299008923.name: Beautiful sight in a majestic city
299008923.author: a TripAdvisor user
299008923.reviewBody: It is the jewel of the crown. It is beautiful and impressive. A must see in this beautiful and well kept city.

298502814.name: Beautiful
298502814.author: a TripAdvisor user
298502814.reviewBody: Beautiful chapel. Well worth the time to visit this and the adjoining church. Be respectful and do not enter if there is a mass in progress

298330383.name: its a place that I visit with people that caomes from outside of my town
298330383.author: a TripAdvisor user
298330383.reviewBody: is one of the most recomended places to visit in Puebla, is a wonderfull churk al\nnd this chapell wich is located at the left front of the inside is all painted in gold color and its magnificent and very interesting to see the sculptures and desing of it

297903927.name: Absolutely Stunning
297903927.author: a TripAdvisor user
297903927.reviewBody: I have never seen so much gold in a cathedral. The entire cathedral is so very ornately decorated. I was rather struck with the extensive depiction of the suffering of Christ vs His love and forgiveness.  I guess  it was the thoughts when this was built.

297338111.name: Absolutely stunning Cathedral
297338111.author: a TripAdvisor user
297338111.reviewBody: This is an absolutely stunning Cathedral. The ceiling was one to rival the Sistine Chapel and it had gold everywhere. The paintings depicted brown faces to reflect the local Indians who helped construct the church.

295829078.name: Baroque Basillica-magnificent!
295829078.author: a TripAdvisor user
295829078.reviewBody: This is a exquisite example of a Baroque style church in Puebla. It is magnificent-just stunningly beautiful. The church was built in stages and the history of the church is fascinating. Photos cannot capture the beautiful. Take time to explore around the church and take in re local culture and flavor of this colonial city.

295571642.name: Hypnotising Architechture!
295571642.author: a TripAdvisor user
295571642.reviewBody: all the gold in the church and its sheer size will dazzle you to submission! we were lucky or unlucky to witness a wedding at the chapel during our visit; so saw a lovely bride but couldn\'t see the inner chapel up close. still so worth a visit!

295417364.name: Get a guide, it\'s really interesting!!!
295417364.author: a TripAdvisor user
295417364.reviewBody: Mesmerizing... This Domus Aureus is all made of a special 21 karat gold, the technique they used in order to build it up is just amazing!!! Get a guide, he will explain it as well as the iconography, it\'s really really interesting. NOT TO MISS !!

295050249.name: Rosary Chapel -- Simply Stunning
295050249.author: a TripAdvisor user
295050249.reviewBody: I\'ve "done" lots of churches in my travels.  You get tired of them, right? Well, don\'t miss this one -- it\'s simply stunning. Plus, the walk down the pedestrian street on a weekend, brimming with life is worth it by itself.

290551456.name: Stunning! And I have photos to prove it.
290551456.author: a TripAdvisor user
290551456.reviewBody: This place is stunningly beautiful. Volunteer guides give informative tours in Spanish about every 15 minutes, but do not hassle you to tip them. Photos are allowed without flash.

290245424.name: Beautiful chapel
290245424.author: a TripAdvisor user
290245424.reviewBody: We visited this chapel and it was seriously breathtaking. I have seen many churches in my travels and this was one of the best.  It is entirely decorated with gold and is intricate and ornate. Definitely a must see!

289301765.name: WOW I have no words!
289301765.author: a TripAdvisor user
289301765.reviewBody: A definite must see. Amazing detail that overloads the senses.it\'s overwhelming and humbling and elevating that someone could envision this and create it. I\'m going back definitely

286460696.name: The Rosary Chapel
286460696.author: a TripAdvisor user
286460696.reviewBody: What an awesome place! The history is evident in the structure and individual chapels! It is interesting to observe the changes as society has progressed and the Chapel has kept up with technology to accommodate worshipers!

285170483.name: This is a must, this chapel really stands out for a reason.
285170483.author: a TripAdvisor user
285170483.reviewBody: This is a must, this chapel really stands out for a reason. Many groups come here and its a great place to take amazing pictures of the best baroque style chapel.

284374991.name: Beautiful
284374991.author: a TripAdvisor user
284374991.reviewBody: Really beautiful church - must be seen to be appreciated as pictures do not do it justice.   Unbelievable detail and workmanship - a must see

284223492.name: golden chapel
284223492.author: a TripAdvisor user
284223492.reviewBody: Interesting history of this chapel makes it even more beautiful. You can feel special atmosphere and precious details covered with gold which makes you wonder if heaven is like this?

282754803.name: A must in Puebla!!
282754803.author: a TripAdvisor user
282754803.reviewBody: This is place you must visit when  you are traveling to Puebla. The art, details, decoration and everything inside this place is just amazing.

281905478.name: Must
281905478.author: a TripAdvisor user
281905478.reviewBody: Cool place if you havent seen another gold chapel, hehehe, jsut kidding, the place its cool, go, its a place that you will remember after.

279017070.name: A place to visit while in Puebla
279017070.author: a TripAdvisor user
279017070.reviewBody: I liked everything and recommend that you listen to the guide that is at the Chapel to know the history of the Chapel

278238687.name: Magnificent Chapel!
278238687.author: a TripAdvisor user
278238687.reviewBody: This small chapel is in the Iglesia de Santo Domingo a short walk from the Zocolo. The church itself is not that unusual so one is not prepared for the magnificence of the chapel within. It is truly incredible. Don\'t miss it.

278204187.name: Beautiful...
278204187.author: a TripAdvisor user
278204187.reviewBody: This church is unique, beautiful, and over the top gilded with gold. There are daily tours of the church.

277919647.name: Spectacular...will leave you breathless
277919647.author: a TripAdvisor user
277919647.reviewBody: It is a small chapel in downtown that has all made out of gold! If you go with a tour guide you can learn a lot of history and cultural data about its construction and meaning.

277836140.name: Must see!!
277836140.author: a TripAdvisor user
277836140.reviewBody: I am not a big fan of barocco, but this chapel is amazing. The most beautiful chapel I ever saw, and I saw A LOT all around the world.

277635273.name: Must visit
277635273.author: a TripAdvisor user
277635273.reviewBody: After the cathedral this is a must see atraction, if you get a guide it will be a lot more interesting.\nright next is the old convent and now is a beautiful museum, make sure you have several hours for you to visit.

273023796.name: SPECTACULAR!!!
273023796.author: a TripAdvisor user
273023796.reviewBody: Is one of the most beautiful churches I have ever been to.  Small, but highly decorated.  The details in decoration are simply beautiful and with lots of gold.  This is the nicest church Puebla has.  A must see, definitely you can\u00b4t leave without visiting it.

270998285.name: Jaw dropping
270998285.author: a TripAdvisor user
270998285.reviewBody: The city of Puebla is looking great the last couple of years. This was my first visit to this church and after seeing churches all over Europe I was not expecting to be so impressed. My jaw dropped and hearing the explanation I was so moved I cried.

270757592.name: Excellent Detail
