270757592.author: a TripAdvisor user
270757592.reviewBody: This may have been the most amazing church I\'ve visited. Including those in Europe. Plan to make this a stop as you walk around Puebla. Photos do not do this chapel justice by any means.

270281922.name: The most beautiful Chapel in Mexico
270281922.author: a TripAdvisor user
270281922.reviewBody: If you\'re in Puebla, you must visit the chapel, will be amazed as soon as you look inside. Just have to wait until the mass ends to get inside.

267707190.name: The \'MUST SEE\' Chapel in Puebla
267707190.author: a TripAdvisor user
267707190.reviewBody: Outside, the Capilla del Rosario is unassuming and plain. But, inside, WOW!!! One is left in utter awe and amazement. It is simply breathtakingly beautiful!!! A true Puebla "Must See."

265365342.name: Beautiful!
265365342.author: a TripAdvisor user
265365342.reviewBody: Was amazed by the details and beauty! Worth a stop! You think the main church is great, but the chapel is the real gem!

265226106.name: One Beautiful Church
265226106.author: a TripAdvisor user
265226106.reviewBody: This is a must visit. The Chapel is quite amazing and it is 400 years old. A great place to reflect.

262332768.name: Wow - just Wow
262332768.author: a TripAdvisor user
262332768.reviewBody: Pretty unbelievable place.  Dripping with gold and the Iglesia de  Santo Domingo is also increible. It is not open all the time.  When we were there, it opened at 4 PM but it is well worth the wait.  You will be blown away by the ostentatious display of wealth.

259325133.name: A must
259325133.author: a TripAdvisor user
259325133.reviewBody: I mean, an absolute MUST.  Do not miss this, even if you hate churches!  Completely over-the-top!  Flash cameras forbidden

258671044.name: Exquisite Baroque Style
258671044.author: a TripAdvisor user
258671044.reviewBody: This is a special location that I believe most people would find quite inspiring, whether of not one is a person of faith.  It is an inspiring and uplifting experience to be surrounded by such beauty and elaborate creative style. The mind can be boggled by the sheer immensity and grandeur and stylistic presentation of the angelic realms that are represented in the endless display of statues and figures and paintings , where everything appears to be golden , as if one had entered the angelic realms themselves.  Quite an Energy !

257491367.name: I\'ve never seen anything like it!
257491367.author: a TripAdvisor user
257491367.reviewBody: Mind blowing to think this was all build hundreds of years ago.    I took a tour with Carlos Rivero tours.  Carlos knew all the details and was of great benefit to my understanding of this marvelous chapel and many other sights in Puebla.

256441813.name: A highlight in Puebla.
256441813.author: a TripAdvisor user
256441813.reviewBody: Of course go see this high example of rococo with a new world twist!  Note, that it is closed during lunch time.  The guide in the chapel gives a good explanation to whomever will listen.

256090644.name: Took my breath away
256090644.author: a TripAdvisor user
256090644.reviewBody: The pictures looked fantastic and it was better than the pictures.  You truly have to see it to believe it.  \n\nIf you can only see 1 thing make it this.

256041667.name: Just when you thought you\'ve seen it all...
256041667.author: a TripAdvisor user
256041667.reviewBody: I have seen my fair share of ornately designed churches in my years of travel but this by far beats most hands down. The jaw-droppingly intricate carved sculptors on the walls almost makes this chapel gaudy in a way. Do note that you are not allowed to visit during services. We saw a signage that said there\'s a fee to see the Chapel but we weren\'t charge. Maybe because we visited right after the service on a Sunday.

255868855.name: Dazzling Mexican Baroque Chapel
255868855.author: a TripAdvisor user
255868855.reviewBody: This chapel, constructed in 1690, is an example of Mexican baroque in the extreme, with more  gold than we\'d ever seen in one place!

255691022.name: Attention to details in the sculptures
255691022.author: a TripAdvisor user
255691022.reviewBody:
Gorgeous Church with beautiful ornate carvings and detailed designs inside. when you look at the outside of this Church you dont expect it to be like what it is on the inside...

The altar has gold detailing inside and a beautiful little chapel with more detialed designs, even the ceiling had gold plated patterns and designs

recommended

255082590.name: Not to miss
255082590.author: a TripAdvisor user
255082590.reviewBody: The Capilla del Rosario inside the Church of Santo Domingo in downtown Puebla,  is without a doubt the  finest example of religious Barroco style in the whole world.   It\u00b4s so spectacular that even Pope John Paul II was amazed of its beauty and detail when he visited Puebla, naming it "Shrine of the Americas".  Just two blocks from Puebla\u00b4s Central Park.  Definitely the highlight of Puebla.

252489861.name: Amazing
252489861.author: a TripAdvisor user
252489861.reviewBody: I have travelled around the world and this chapel is breath taking. The detail and layer upon layer of gilt are amazing. A must see when in Puebla walking distance from the centro

252413936.name: It\u00b4s almost a miracle
252413936.author: a TripAdvisor user
252413936.reviewBody: In my personal opinion, the Capilla del Rosario and the Santo Domingo church (in Oaxaca City) are the finest expressions of religious art in this continent, that shows the best of the Indian and European cultures.

252326465.name: Unbelievable!  A Must See
252326465.author: a TripAdvisor user
252326465.reviewBody: You visit many churches and think they are all the same  BUT this one is unbelievable.  Our guide took us to this one and it is probably one of my favorites if not the favorite.  Don\'t miss it.

250073531.name: Totally over the top
250073531.author: a TripAdvisor user
250073531.reviewBody: If you like a surfeit of gilt, this is for you.  Viewable only from outside the gate when I was there.  Intricate and ornate and totally over the top.  Restraint was a word unknown to the designer.

249164372.name: Must see in Puebla
249164372.author: a TripAdvisor user
249164372.reviewBody: There are many, many churches in Puebla and the Rosario is "just" one chapel in one of them, but it should for sure not be missed.\nThe details are absolutely gorgeous, the colours amazing and it is just stunning.\nMake sure you do not go during a service as it will be closed for a while.

248317576.name: nice; smaller than expected
248317576.author: a TripAdvisor user
248317576.reviewBody: I wished there was a guide to explain the chapel to me.  A bit overwhelming in the amount of gold.  Kept running into weddings (went three times in attempt) and could not really spend enough time there.

247809471.name: Great place for a weding
247809471.author: a TripAdvisor user
247809471.reviewBody: It is a beautiful Chapel in the middle of Puebla all covered in Gold. It is inside the Santo Domingo Church.

247477409.name: Amazing.
247477409.author: a TripAdvisor user
247477409.reviewBody: Amazing! You will find it incredible.  I could not imagine such a place.  It is a shame that leaving the place, you found many poor people.

247013002.name: do not miss this one!
247013002.author: a TripAdvisor user
247013002.reviewBody: beautiful chapel short walk from the Zocalo. Guides do presentations in Spanish and English - last about 10 min.

246048400.name: Historic place.
246048400.author: a TripAdvisor user
246048400.reviewBody: This is amazing place to see, because everything inside the chapel is pure Gold, it is wonderful!!!!!!!!!!!!!......

245936517.name: Go on a Saturday afternoon.
245936517.author: a TripAdvisor user
245936517.reviewBody: If you go on a Saturday afternoon you might get to see a wedding there and it is a beautiful experience with all the gold in the background.

244365805.name: gorgeous
244365805.author: a TripAdvisor user
244365805.reviewBody: one of the most beautiful chapels i have seen. covered in gold leaf and beautiful carvings over almost every inch of it,  its like getting into the treasure chamber of some kingdom.  a must see.

242569286.name: Amazing.
242569286.author: a TripAdvisor user
242569286.reviewBody: We were fortunate to talk to a tour guide after he just finished with his group.  He told us the capilla was going to be illuminated in 10 minutes (8pm) and if we had time to stay and see it lite up.  Boy, he wasn\'t kidding.  It was amazing without light but, when the lights went on it was like one of the most,if not the most beautiful churches I\'ve ever laid my eyes on.  If in Puebla it\'s a must to visit the Capilla del Rosario and ask someone there when they light up the capilla.  Try to see it illuminated, it will be something you\'ll be telling people about for years to come.

242431994.name: Don\'t miss it, if you like to see BAROQUE ART
242431994.author: a TripAdvisor user
242431994.reviewBody:
Baroque art at his best!
Small chapelle, inside Sto. Domingo church.
Check for open hours, (unusual hours) try to get a tourist guide, inside the chuch there is no info available.
Yo can't visit  during mass.
It's worth it!

241191685.name: Phenomenal
241191685.author: a TripAdvisor user
241191685.reviewBody: Amazing - had a great tour, suggest you pay one of the on site guides to explain this amazing sight. Very reasonable - tip for the value you receive.

241163586.name: Just awesome!!
241163586.author: a TripAdvisor user
241163586.reviewBody: An excellent example of baroque architecture, this is a must when you visit Puebla, all made with gold

240730147.name: One of the 7 wonders of the world in the 90\'s
240730147.author: a TripAdvisor user
240730147.reviewBody: All the small Chapel is covered by gold.... just like that !! You should not miss the chance to visit this chapel if you are already in the downtown of the city, it is walking distance from the "Zocalo"

240276635.name: Mexicos Gold
240276635.author: a TripAdvisor user
240276635.reviewBody: Amazing view, here you can see how church and spanish intruders exploited the poor indigene people of the country

239857514.name: Rosary chapel
239857514.author: a TripAdvisor user
239857514.reviewBody: Amazing, incredible, impressive art work, you will not beleive what you\'ll see. Gold leafs all over the place very interesting place to visit.

239130523.name: Astonishing find
239130523.author: a TripAdvisor user
239130523.reviewBody: The side chapel dripping in gold was a real surprise. Free tours (in Spanish) explained the history of the building & its significance.

238981746.name: What a beautiful place
238981746.author: a TripAdvisor user
238981746.reviewBody: This chapel is incredible... you can not visit Puebla without going to la Iglesia of Santo Domingo and visiting this chapel.

238972380.name: Amazing
238972380.author: a TripAdvisor user
238972380.reviewBody: The opulence and wealth of this church is overwhelming. It also has a great history -well worth a visit.

238456657.name: Bring your sunglasses!
238456657.author: a TripAdvisor user
238456657.reviewBody: Wow! You don\'t expect to be dazzled looking at the outside.  What a surprise when you come inside the Church.  The hand made baroque artwork is beautiful and then they covered it all in gold.  This is truly exceptional when you consider that it was all built in the late 1500\'s.  Take a while to admire all the beautifully carved detail work. Be sure to leave them something to be able to maintain this art treasure.

237643378.name: Amazing chapel
237643378.author: a TripAdvisor user
237643378.reviewBody: You will be amazed of the beauty of this place. Totally worth visiting, the architecture and what men can do can impress anyone. Well kept and there are local tour guys explaining the place

235491277.name: The best Mexican Barroc Art
235491277.author: a TripAdvisor user
235491277.reviewBody: These Chapel is inside the Saint Domingo Church. was built in honor of the Rosary Virgin I don\'t remember the date of it is about  1560. Many poets have written  inspired on it\'s golden covered Mexican Barroc  art it\'s one of the best in all Mexico only in Oaxaca they have one bigger, but the gold covered of this Chapel is just admirable

235415663.name: Spectacular
235415663.author: a TripAdvisor user
235415663.reviewBody: Just go into this church and have a look at the opulence.  It\u2019s quite incredible. When you walk into the church, it looks like most other but you need to go to the front and turn left to get into this capel.

234433548.name: Takes Your Breath Away
234433548.author: a TripAdvisor user
234433548.reviewBody: Wow! I think if I said anymore I\'d ruin the experience for anyone who hasn\'t stepped foot inside this magnificent spectacle. It truly is incredible and completely over the top!! Loved it.

233592875.name: Stunning
233592875.author: a TripAdvisor user
233592875.reviewBody: The capilla cannot be captured by photo - you must see for yourself all the gilted ceilings and sculpture!

232029264.name: Gorgeous
232029264.author: a TripAdvisor user
232029264.reviewBody: Well worth a look, and a guide happened to be there when I went and gave a very interesting talk about it.

231075007.name: A must see
231075007.author: a TripAdvisor user
231075007.reviewBody: A small exquisitely ornate chapel, we enjoyed its peace and serenity amid the bustle of busy downtown Puebla.  It\'s a wonderful place to spend some time in quiet contemplation.

230685384.name: So much detail
230685384.author: a TripAdvisor user
230685384.reviewBody: While visiting Puebla, we made sure to visit as many cathedrals, chapels and churches as possible. This one was beautiful, every little detail about the chapel was great. I recommend hitting this one up!

229320900.name: golden
229320900.author: a TripAdvisor user
229320900.reviewBody: small & perfectly formed gilt gold chapel. Worthy of a top attraction in Puebla.  Dont think I have ever seen so much gold leaf in such a small place before.

226793405.name: Glowing and glittering
226793405.author: a TripAdvisor user
226793405.reviewBody: The chapel is filled with gilted angels, figures and adornments. It is a tribute the the workmanship of the 16th and 17 centuries and the attempt in the baroque period of the Mexican Catholic church to head toward excess in an attempt to convey the divine

225865197.name: I have never seen anything like this!
225865197.author: a TripAdvisor user
225865197.reviewBody: The gold leaf decoration was astounding. There wasn\'t a bare surface that didn\'t have a design. To be sitting in a church that was built in the early 16th century was awesome. At the time I was visiting the church a wedding had just finished and a first communion for children was in process.

223301118.name: BEAUTIFUL
223301118.author: a TripAdvisor user
223301118.reviewBody: The detail on the making of this chapel is just perfect, everything is made of 23Karat gold... A Must see if you visit Puebla.

220421175.name: Horror Vacui
220421175.author: a TripAdvisor user
220421175.reviewBody: This is something that cannot be missed during a visit to Puebla. Exquisite baroque gem inside the Santo Domingo church.

214328163.name: Worth a Stop
214328163.author: a TripAdvisor user
214328163.reviewBody: This is a beautiful chapel well worth a look. There was a sign with a bit of information on it in English and Spanish as well as a small store with post cards and books.

210344232.name: Beautiful views of the city
210344232.author: a TripAdvisor user
210344232.reviewBody: This is a beautiful church on a hill overlooking most of the city.  It\'s absolutely beautiful.  It\'s a bit of a hike, so go early in the day before it gets too hot.

209400817.name: Breath taking
209400817.author: a TripAdvisor user
209400817.reviewBody: WOW!!  Absolutely amazing.  Many chapels or churches that you come across in Mexico will look like they are decorated with gold, but they really are not.  This chapel, everything you look at that looks like gold, is actually 100% gold.  This is a must see and walking distance to the Zocalo.

208372119.name: Stunning
208372119.author: a TripAdvisor user
208372119.reviewBody: However much time you mean to spend in the chapel it will not be enough. The overall impression is stunning, but as you begin to understand how each bit fits together time just disappears. We had an excellent guide but even he  said there was too much in the chapel for any one person to get their head around.

202716560.name: Gorgeous place.
202716560.author: a TripAdvisor user
202716560.reviewBody: Truly amazing, the best spot in Puebla. The details are beautiful and you need to take your time to admire everything.

202599789.name: Don\'t miss it.
202599789.author: a TripAdvisor user
202599789.reviewBody: In Puebla, you see a lot of churches, but this chapel is must see. Knowledgable Interpretation of this baroque masterpiece is available in Spanish. Written interpretative material in English is minimal.

202505399.name: is amazing
202505399.author: a TripAdvisor user
202505399.reviewBody:
when you visit this cathedral you will be excited from this decoration, with so many colors, with so rich things on...you will stay there looking around like in shock

very nice cathedral inside and from outside too

i like a lot

201937154.name: Amazingly beautiful!
201937154.author: a TripAdvisor user
201937154.reviewBody: This Chapel is a short walk from most places in the historic center of Puebla. I was amazed by the amount of detail and gold everywhere within the church! It is one of the few churches I have seen in the Americas that can compare to the great churches of Europe!

201004335.name: Well worth a Visit
201004335.author: a TripAdvisor user
201004335.reviewBody: I visited this beautiful ornately decorated chapel in early evening just in time for mass. The priest invited the tourists to stay, so I observed the ritual for half an hour.  So much detail, I always think of the workers who built these structures so long ago, how hard they worked for little or no recompense.

199196671.name: Must see
199196671.author: a TripAdvisor user
199196671.reviewBody: I have been to many cathedrals in Europe, but this was my first visit to one in Mexico and it did not dissapoint. The workmanship is mind blowing and it is really worth while to just sit and look at all the detail.

198393695.name: Amazing
198393695.author: a TripAdvisor user
198393695.reviewBody: Beautiful golden chapel. The details are unreal. We went 2 times and admired all the details. The church is also impressive.

197546864.name: Breathtaking
197546864.author: a TripAdvisor user
197546864.reviewBody: Absolutely, beautiful, breathtaking, gold chapel.  It was closed when we first got there but we were happy we went back later in the day - it is really worth seeing.

196936563.name: Must see!
196936563.author: a TripAdvisor user
196936563.reviewBody: Mexican baroque in galore!!! I have seen many Catholic churches around the world but nothing like this. 21 karat gold all around  . . . fine artistry and architecture  . . .\nA masterpiece. If you have time for two sites to see in Puebla this is one of them and the next one is Santa Maria de Tonantzitlan in the nearby town.

195895393.name: Good baroque
195895393.author: a TripAdvisor user
195895393.reviewBody: Good example of baroque in Mexico with gold leaf on the decorations.  Snall but interesting.  Also, ex convents are good to visit to see life in vice regal Mexico

195378316.name: Heavily gilded ornate chapel
195378316.author: a TripAdvisor user
195378316.reviewBody: I do not feel that the church is anything special, although nice enough. The chapel is worth seeing for its massive amount of gold sculpture.\n\nI am sure it is also of great interest to lovers of religious art, of which I have to confess to being very uneducated.

194796630.name: A TRUE MASTERPIECE
194796630.author: a TripAdvisor user
194796630.reviewBody:
I have been around the world and have visited some of the most exciting and important churches around the world, but this is truly a masterpiece! I will say that I was far more impressed with the Rosary Chapel than I was with the cathedral of Notre Dame. ALTHOUGH I LOVED THE CATHEDRAL OF NOTRE DAME!!! This just gives you a bit of an idea of how GLORIOUS this is.  I was simply in AWE! 

plan a visit if one is not planned already and visit this unforgettable chapel which is a true wonder, some even say it is the 8th world wonder.

Enjoy!

192799803.name: Breath taking
192799803.author: a TripAdvisor user
192799803.reviewBody: A must-see when visiting Puebla. Take time to absorb the art. Do not allow any religious beliefs to befog the appreciation of a true labor of love and faith. Sit for a while in the chapel where there is always an art history course is being taught by professors in many languages.

190985658.name: OMG!!!
190985658.author: a TripAdvisor user
190985658.reviewBody: Wow. No expense spared here! The Spanish conquistadors certainly adored their gold and it shows! No such thing as "over-the-top" in Mexico, except possibly here!\n

190887666.name: Wow!
190887666.author: a TripAdvisor user
190887666.reviewBody: Just go there - its a wow!\nSeen a lot of churches and temples in our travels but this little side chapel really stands out.

190180571.name: Very pretty
190180571.author: a TripAdvisor user
190180571.reviewBody: Beautiful church.  Would be nice to have guided tours.  There are "volunteer" tour guides available who give pretty good tours for tips.

187221280.name: The Jewel in the Crown
187221280.author: a TripAdvisor user
187221280.reviewBody: The detail work and shear size of this place is inspiring. Everywhere you look your mind is taken to another time. Every detail of this Chapel is perfect. I will return again. So lovely.

185585145.name: Unique and marvelous work of art
185585145.author: a TripAdvisor user
185585145.reviewBody: Dazzling and detailed in all aspects. I\'ve never seen so much gold in one place used so artistically. I\'ve been there at three different times of day, and the way the sunlight highlights the gold changes the way you see the art. Don\'t miss this place.

182777590.name: A beautiful chapel to see
182777590.author: a TripAdvisor user
182777590.reviewBody: An amazingly beautiful chapel of gold and dedicated to Our Lady.This is by far one of the most beautiful chapels I have ever seen. This is a must visit for Puebla churches.

182399959.name: wow
182399959.author: a TripAdvisor user
182399959.reviewBody: We were in the Vatican exactly a year ago and visited St. Peters Basilica and the Sistine Chapel. The Rosary Chapel has the same wow factor. Far, far smaller but it forces you to just stand there and gaze in awe at the gold. By far the most impressive one we have seen in Mexico.\nMake sure that when you enter the main cathedral, you go to the front and then head left, into the chapel. We almost forgot. The main cathedral is nice but not nearly as sensational.

177796135.name: Beautiful, a must see!
177796135.author: a TripAdvisor user
177796135.reviewBody: The Santo Domingo Church isn\'t much to see on the outside, at least not compare with many others around Puebla.  But inside lies a gem -- the Capilla del Rosario.  By all means take some time to spend here -- the chapel is beautiful, the gilding and artwork superb, it will take your breath away.

177679292.name: wonderful
177679292.author: a TripAdvisor user
177679292.reviewBody: This is the most exquisite example of spanish baroque in the new world: the gilded decorations are breathtaking. Visit this place in the evening when it is illuminated by spots: the gold will shine in your eyes.

176637608.name: Magnificent!
176637608.author: a TripAdvisor user
176637608.reviewBody: I must say that we are not religious, but I always try to include a church/synagogue/mosque, etc in our itinerary because the truth is that the most stunning architecture is found in buildings that are dedicated to a deity. In this case, this statement could not have been truer. All the ornamentation is blindly shining due to the precious metals used everywhere. Take a guided tour because there are many interesting facts about this attraction. I highly recommend a visit.

175483842.name: Stunning church!
175483842.author: a TripAdvisor user
175483842.reviewBody: This church puts on shame churches in Europe, absolutely beautiful. Beyond words. I got married there.

174192647.name: Beautifull!
174192647.author: a TripAdvisor user
174192647.reviewBody: La Capilla del Rosario Its a beautiful place to visit. Dont miss! Just close to the center and it is something special and diferente.

173188492.name: A must see
173188492.author: a TripAdvisor user
173188492.reviewBody:
Amazing Baroque church. Covered in 24k gold, it is impressive. Many people say, "if you see one church you've seen them all." Not the case with this one. 

*Closes at 8:30
*Looks great at night

172259969.name: Incredible Mexian barroque work on gold
172259969.author: a TripAdvisor user
172259969.reviewBody: Great place to visit if you like history and religious art. The chapel displays a unique style and an amazing amount of gold. It is a very unique church and a recommended stop for all travelers

169804438.name: Stunning chapel
169804438.author: a TripAdvisor user
169804438.reviewBody: I stop by accident and I am glad I did, you must go at night when the lights are on or at around 5 p.m. when the sunlight lighten the chapel

167859872.name: Fantastic experience
167859872.author: a TripAdvisor user
167859872.reviewBody: Not to be believed rococo chapel. You could travel the world over and would be hard pressed to see something as magnificent as this.

167190279.name: Just WOW
167190279.author: a TripAdvisor user
167190279.reviewBody: Absolutely brilliant. Gold everywhere and the craftsmanship is amazing.\nFlash photography is not allowed and really pictures don\'t do the church justice.

165094322.name: Surrounded by gold
165094322.author: a TripAdvisor user
165094322.reviewBody: You can find this gorgeous chapel inside the church of Santo Domingo.\nThe details of the decorations are overwhelming. Almost all the roof and walls are covered in gold. Fascinating!\nUndeniably a Must see while visiting Puebla in Mexico.

164298121.name: A riot of gold leaf!
164298121.author: a TripAdvisor user
164298121.reviewBody: Part of our walking tour of old Puebla - the Rosary Chapel is a must-see. A riot of gold-leaf and carvings.

164211515.name: Stunning
164211515.author: a TripAdvisor user
164211515.reviewBody: Not often you are stopped in your tracks by such an amazing, intricate, gold chapel that actually stands to the left side of the main church. Such wealth and opulence is rarely seen done so well. Prepare to sit and marvel at it

162385688.name: Golden Chapel
162385688.author: a TripAdvisor user
162385688.reviewBody: It\'s the "GOLDEN" chapel from Puebla. You have to see this if you are traveling to Puebla. It\'s positioned in the down town.

162235646.name: Beautiful
162235646.author: a TripAdvisor user
162235646.reviewBody: Its interior beauty is magnificent. It is all done with gold brought from far away. In the time of its construction, something like this must have been quite impressive to see while they built it.

161807234.name: Jaw Dropping!
161807234.author: a TripAdvisor user
161807234.reviewBody: The main part of the church and the main altar are quite amazing, but once you turn the corner and look into this capilla I guarantee you will be speechless! Photos cannot do this justice!

160072348.name: Worth a visit!
160072348.author: a TripAdvisor user
160072348.reviewBody: Enter through the church and make a right for a spectacular surprise.It\'s incredible!\nVery ornate work and well preserved.

159635266.name: Major bling
159635266.author: a TripAdvisor user
159635266.reviewBody: A pretty astounding level of decoration in this church - very much worth a visit. It does make you think about the shock and awe tactics used by organised religion - this has got to be the most ornate piece of architecture I have ever seen.

157979793.name: amazing
157979793.author: a TripAdvisor user
157979793.reviewBody: try not to look at too many photos of this place if you\'re going to be traveling to Puebla. located in the Santo Domingo church the first thing you see when you walk in are dozens of figurines against a golden wall. This is a prelude to the spectacular display as you make your way up the aisle and then to the left where the Rosary Chapel is. bring your camera but please be respectful as others are normally worshipping. The church itself pales in comparison to others around it from the outside but the treasure is inside.

157414989.name: Retrurn again and again...
157414989.author: a TripAdvisor user
157414989.reviewBody: Even in the Good Friday crush of pilgrims, the visit to one of the wonders of the world is inspiring.  The beautiful chapel is of the main nape of the what could be a historic cathedral.  Words can not do justice to the beauty and intricacies of the gold gilded ceiling in the chapel.

157188164.name: Chapel that\'s Solid Gold - Amazing
157188164.author: a TripAdvisor user
157188164.reviewBody: The Rosary Chapel is a must-see when visiting Puebla.  Be sure to ask at your hotel what hours the church housing the Rosary Chapel are open to avoid a wasted trip.  The Rosary Chapel is located at the corner of the Pedestrian-Only street of Cinco de Mayo and 4 Poniente.

156603019.name: hermosaaaaa... incredible!!
156603019.author: a TripAdvisor user
156603019.reviewBody:
omg this is one of the pretties thinks i ever see on my life, i loved everything inside in just wooow wonderfull geougeuos, you dont have to be catholic to be impress, this is a place you cant dont froget visit.

Esta capilla es de las mas bonitas que eh visto en toda mi vida al estar hay puedes sentir una paz inmensa y la luz que radia es impresionante no puedes dejar de visitar a la virgen del rosario.

155981101.name: Stunning!
155981101.author: a TripAdvisor user
155981101.reviewBody: Do not miss this chapel.  I walked into the church and it was lovely, but not "special".. Then I looked to my left and my breath was taken away!  I have traveled the world looking at temples/churches and this one chapel will always remain a "main memory" for me!  (Don\'t go on Sundays and make note of the hours it\'s open).

155841476.name: Unbelievable
155841476.author: a TripAdvisor user
155841476.reviewBody: Amazing decorated chapel, covered with gold leaf, with all kinds of religious figures as well as mermaids and complex strapwork. One of the many wonders of Mexico.

154977240.name: Worth the visit
154977240.author: a TripAdvisor user
154977240.reviewBody: It is a small chapel, however all the decoration is on real gold, it is marvelous, even if you are not a religious fellow. Walk with caution from zocalo to this place is my only advice. Also, some days this chapel is closed, i really don\'t remember the exact dates, but you can ask around.

153133720.name: absolutely gorgeous
153133720.author: a TripAdvisor user
153133720.reviewBody: I\'ve seen a lot of churches over the years, in Mexico, France, Spain, Italy, the USA.  This one may be the most gorgeous; very ornate, encrusted everywhere with gold (all mined in Leon, Mexico, acc. to the guide), beautifully restored and maintained.  Everyone who goes to Puebla should see it.

152531733.name: One of the most beauitful churches I have seen in Mexico!
152531733.author: a TripAdvisor user
152531733.reviewBody: I have been traveling in Mexico for over twenty years and walking inside La Capilla del Rosario took my breath away.  I ended up going back two more times to take in it\'s beauty!  This chapel is considered one of the eighth wonders of the world.  It was so over the top!  Don\'t miss this if you visit Puebla!

151475056.name: A special place
151475056.author: a TripAdvisor user
151475056.reviewBody: Being non-Christian I find cathedrals and churches somewhat on the boring side after 3 or 4. This chapel is so different that I\'m glad I wondered in. well worth a walk through. Beautifully decorated.

151273028.name: A must see
151273028.author: a TripAdvisor user
151273028.reviewBody: The chapel is just fabulous. Bright gilded and colourful. A treasure in Puebla. The cherubs almost smile at you

151144851.name: so beautiful .. must see!
151144851.author: a TripAdvisor user
151144851.reviewBody: It is amassing, is a must see  when you visit Puebla,Mexico. Everything inside looks so beautiful so much work in the Spanish barroco    architecture and the mix of French culture as well. built by the Mexican Indians they will make Angels that are mounted into the wall with faces painted in dark colors,looking at the Mexican skin color of the creators.. also the story says that the Mexican natives that built the church will have the stone idols hidden behind  the front of the temple so when they were invited to participate in worshiping to the Christianity in reality they were praying to their Gods making the Spanish believe that they were conquered .

149617894.name: Gold and Glory of the Colonial Age
149617894.author: a TripAdvisor user
149617894.reviewBody: The Capilla was an amazing site, in the left nave of the Cathedral of Pueble, almost hidden as you walk down the onyx-floored aisles, until suddenly you realize that the golden gleam from the high-set windows is actually - gold, everywhere, covering just about every surface above the chest-high Talavera tile wainscoting.  Description pales; there is really no way to put in words the amazing workmanship and the sheer quantity of gold leaf covering the walls and high vaulted ceiling.  It\'s even difficult to take pictures of the Chapel, as the light that reflects off every gilt surface confounds eye and light sensor alike.  As a testament to the power and rapaciousness of the conquering Spaniards, it leaves one in awe.  What a 17th Century native would have thought or felt, hammered into speechlessness by the weight of towering open spaces covered by tons of vaulted stone and acres of gold, simply cannot be imagined.

149023251.name: a wonder of the world, must see!
149023251.author: a TripAdvisor user
149023251.reviewBody: Church looks run down, but the chappel is inside, is amazing\n5 blocks from the Cathedral, you can visit the dulcerias on 6th St

148761653.name: Absolute must!
148761653.author: a TripAdvisor user
148761653.reviewBody: Until you see it for yourself, anything wrtten will sound cliche.  This site is an absolute MUST see when visiting Puebla.

148660743.name: Wow, no wonder its ranked #1!
148660743.author: a TripAdvisor user
148660743.reviewBody: Indian artists worked for forty years to complete this masterpiece. Walls are decorated with sculpted plaster that has been gilded, everything done by local artists in the traditional Baroque style of the New Spain. The design is full of symbolism meant to assist in the conversion of the local population to Catholicism, everything explained by local and very knowledgeable guides.

147631510.name: One of the world\'s wonders !!!
147631510.author: a TripAdvisor user
147631510.reviewBody: Many people think that Europe is the largest \u201cholder\u201d of the world historical and art masterpieces. Yes and no. Because some countries  keep and preserve such unique  super-masterpieces, that the quality and value of some could  easily eclipse many well advertised places.  And Mexico is one of such amazing countries. People know some \u201cofficial\u201d lists of The Wonders of the World, but in Mexico there are several real-real WONDERS and one of them is Rosary Chapel (Capilla de la Virgin del Rosario) in the City of Puebla (2 hrs. by car \u2013 east of Mexico City).Being in Mexico without visiting this place is a big loss for any advanced tourist or art lover. This place is triple \u201cMUST SEE\u201d !  You could  read a lot about the place, but just one glance at this chapel fills you up with feeling of something unbelievable\u2026 You look and you try to understand the greatness of some unknown local talents who managed to create at the end of 17th century this massive wood carving  covered with 24-carate gold. Ask any local person where  this Chapel is located and they immediately send you to a right direction. Smart people  say that one image is more eloquent than 1000 words. See my pictures (taken on 12-12-12) and you will understand why this expression is so right.\n\nalftul

147514964.name: Mexican Baroque
147514964.author: a TripAdvisor user
147514964.reviewBody:
Construction of the Santo Domingo church took place between 1571 and 1611, except for the left tower which was not completed until the 19th century. The dark grey facade is severe, but the interior of the church is more ornate, with gilded stucco work. The impressive main altar dates to 1688 and is attributed to Pedro Maldonado.

To the left of the main altar is the Rosary Chapel (pictured above), built in 1690. This is an outstanding example of Mexican Baroque, with dazzling use of gilded stucco and onyx stonework.

Next door to the Santo Domingo church, at 5 de Mayo 409, is the Galeria Bello y Zetina. This small museum features 19th century fine and decorative arts, with paintings by Jose Agustin Arrieta and Gerardo Murillo Cornado (known as Dr. Atl). Entrance is free.

146558248.name: THE EIGHT MARVEL
146558248.author: a TripAdvisor user
146558248.reviewBody: The so called "Eight Marvel of the World" is this magnificent chapel, both for it\'s imposing golden decoration and the wonderful statues and paintings, and for it\'s profound theological significance. REALLY A MUST IN PUEBLA.

146108765.name: Worth seeing
146108765.author: a TripAdvisor user
146108765.reviewBody: Insanely stunning and elaborate chapel with swirly gold bits everywhere. Like walking into Gianni Versace\'s brain.

145104759.name: Lots of Gilt
145104759.author: a TripAdvisor user
145104759.reviewBody: You can see why the Poblanos hold this place in their hearts. The Lady is everywhere, but she\'s very beautiful here.

145061783.name: if you could only see one church, make it this one
145061783.author: a TripAdvisor user
145061783.reviewBody: puebla has a crazy amount of churches and i was pretty \'churched\' out when we got here but it was the most memorable of them all. the chapel has amazing and makes for some awesome photos.

144108916.name: Holy Gold
144108916.author: a TripAdvisor user
144108916.reviewBody: Amazing.  What a sight with all that gold.  Glad we happened back to see this one (we\'d first dropped by midday when the church was closed).  It was moving to see the, what seemed like infinite, decorations gleaming in the late afternoon light.  I would recommend going after 4 pm to get a sense of the place with sunlight beaming it during the late afternoon.

142910290.name: Incredible!!! Something to see
142910290.author: a TripAdvisor user
142910290.reviewBody: The chapel is one of the most beautiful things I have ever seen. All the decorations are in gold. If you visit Puebla you MUST go there. I would like to add that the travel warning for Puebla is not longer there. Give yourself a chance and visit Puebla, a safe and amazing city!

142683507.name: Extraordinary
142683507.author: a TripAdvisor user
142683507.reviewBody: Please dont miss visiting this beautifull chapel.  It is just like the Santo Domingo Church in Oaxaca but in a small scale.

141616443.name: Wedding
141616443.author: a TripAdvisor user
141616443.reviewBody: Beautiful   gold chapel,my niece celebrated her wedding  in this awesome chapel,it was an amazing event!!

139944918.name: Beautiful, most seen place
139944918.author: a TripAdvisor user
139944918.reviewBody: hand made, cover with gold, one of the most amazing places Puebla has to offer definitely a place to visit and take a tour guide to have the whole explanation on how and why it was made like that.

139531779.name: rosary chapel
139531779.author: a TripAdvisor user
139531779.reviewBody: i loved the detailed artwork and gold layered baroque. beautiful design, there is a guide that will tell you the history of the rosary chapel and will point out certain details in the paintings.

133934581.name: A Church Beyond Compare
133934581.author: a TripAdvisor user
133934581.reviewBody: When you walk into this stadium-size church, you can\'t believe las indigenous built it; or anyone for that matter.  I believe it\'s the largest church in North America, but don\'t quote me.  You can see it from any view in Puebla, Mexico.  At night, it\'s magical.

131984113.name: wonderful
131984113.author: a TripAdvisor user
131984113.reviewBody: so much history! loved the ancient buildings! everything is wonderful

130434179.name: Unbelievably beautiful chapel hidden away
130434179.author: a TripAdvisor user
130434179.reviewBody: This chapel deserves to be protected forever. What a beautiful setting and lovely gold work. Seems a shame it is just there with no indications. Even a bit hard to find

130018503.name: Extraordinary decoration a must see
130018503.author: a TripAdvisor user
130018503.reviewBody: With fantastic baroque decoration in gold leaf this has to be the best if not one of the best catholic buildings in colonial Latin America. A singular building if you ever saw one a definitely worth a trip to Puebla

129552892.name: Spectacular!
129552892.author: a TripAdvisor user
129552892.reviewBody: This church is not to be missed.  If you speak Spanish it is well worth it to get one of the guides at the entrance.  For a small fee they will explain everything.  It is amazing!

128256347.name: Will blow you away
128256347.author: a TripAdvisor user
128256347.reviewBody: A wonderful church with gold everywhere. Not to be missed!!!!

128113371.name: The crown jewel of Puebla!
128113371.author: a TripAdvisor user
128113371.reviewBody: It\'s one of the most beautiful chapels I\'ve ever seen. Don\'t fool yourself when you enter the main church to be disappointed not to see the full golden baroque decor, the Rosary Chapel is a small side chapel at the far left corner of the main church. One you turn left and gaze at this marvel, time passes by while you wonder every little detail of this chapel.

126996026.name: amazing exterior and interior
126996026.author: a TripAdvisor user
126996026.reviewBody: The inside trim looked pure gold! The showcase Jesus dead body also amazing!

126067011.name: gold and more gold
126067011.author: a TripAdvisor user
126067011.reviewBody: Magnificent, gold leaf everywhere, visually almost overwhelming Mexican Baroque chapel. People are chipping off some of the gold leaf  on the carvings and it\'s roped off along the lower sides. This is the case in many of the churches and chapels and has never been so broadly obvious as this year.

125784231.name: Oh, so pretty!
125784231.author: a TripAdvisor user
125784231.reviewBody: There is something about visiting shrines of the faithful, and the Capilla del Rosario is gorgeous!  The intricate, carved ceiling is breathtaking, and is an excellent example of Mexican baroque, which is like European baroque on steroids!  The carving is sculpted, gilded plaster and the cupola is in the shape of a crown for the Virgin - all very beautiful.

124932367.name: Gorgeous, a must see in Puebla!
124932367.author: a TripAdvisor user
124932367.reviewBody: We found out about this chapel from the tourism office at the Zocalo and I am so happy that we did!  This was one of the most stunning buildings I have ever seen.  I can\'t believe how ornate the chapel was.  The work was very detailed and beautiful.  Definitely a must see!

124834785.name: So much gold!
124834785.author: a TripAdvisor user
124834785.reviewBody: The chapel is so beautiful - a must see.  It is free to enter and filled with more gold than I have ever seen in a church.  Do not miss it.

123849184.name: Capilla del Rosario
123849184.author: a TripAdvisor user
123849184.reviewBody: extremely ornate, gilded chapel inside the Catedral San Sebastian.

123000907.name: Beautiful Chapel
123000907.author: a TripAdvisor user
123000907.reviewBody: They don\'t allow flash cameras so only one of the pictures I took came out decent.  But ooh what a beautiful chapel.  A must see when you are in Puebla.

122669081.name: Must See!
122669081.author: a TripAdvisor user
122669081.reviewBody: This is the most beautiful chapel in Puebla. The Chapel is part of a Church that is nice, but not nearly as wonderful as the Rosary Chapel. You wont regret it!

122445788.name: extraordinary
122445788.author: a TripAdvisor user
122445788.reviewBody: The whole chapel is made of (real) gold...unbelievable...but it great for the... believers

122280342.name: Don\'t miss this
122280342.author: a TripAdvisor user
122280342.reviewBody: Just don\'t miss this, it is worth a visit to the domingo church, wich is nothing special, altough on a big ground. Walk in and further to the end of the church and turn left, you will not believe you eyes, its beautyfull!

121038346.name: A well known yet hidden Mexican treasure!
121038346.author: a TripAdvisor user
121038346.reviewBody: This amazing church is located Puebla\'s downtown. Hard to describe the magnificent barroc decoration and style that reings in this place. You can always hire a tour guide so you enjoy the story of this beautiful building. Withing this church you will find the Chapel, all covered by gold sheets. This place is a MUST in Puebla, but get some turist information about visit hours and open days.

119597563.name: Fantastic
119597563.author: a TripAdvisor user
119597563.reviewBody: This is an incredible old church with over the top Baroque Rosary Chapel.   One of the best churches I have seen.  Amazingly, the churches of Acatepec and Tonzintla were better!

118934942.name: Workmanship to rival European churches
118934942.author: a TripAdvisor user
118934942.reviewBody: The Sto Domingo Church in Puebla hides a treasure box in the Capilla del Rosario. The little gold box is a loving tribute to the Virgin Mary with the portrayal of the mysteries of the holy rosary. Unfortunately photography\'s not allowed and the photos being sold do not fully reflect the grandeur of the chapel.

118467822.name: Better than gold
118467822.author: a TripAdvisor user
118467822.reviewBody: The capilla del Rosario (Rosary Chapel)  shines not only because of the abundant gold-plated altars and decorations, but because of its rich statues, paintings and architecture. By comparison, the larger church of Santo Domingo de Guzman, where the chapel is located, looks gloomy and dark because it has not been cleaned for years. You cannot miss this place if you travel to Puebla. Along with the Biblioteca Palafoxiana and the Casa del Dean, the Rosary Chapel is a "must".

22446837.name: Don\'t miss the Rosary Chapel in the Santo Domingo Church
22446837.author: a TripAdvisor user
22446837.reviewBody: The Santo Domingo Church is just a short few minutes walk north from the center of town (the Zocalo). It\'s a huge church and nice enough on its own but you have to walk all the way to the front of the church and then look to the left side. What is there is amazing. It is as incredible of a Baroque chapel as you will see anywhere in the world. It\'s one of those sights that might leave you with your jaw dropped and mouth open. The tiles, carvings, statues, and gold everywhere leaves you amazed. You have to see it for yourself. Words cannot describe this sight. Over the top? Maybe so but it is also the way it was done by the church once upon a time and this is probably the ultimate example of this kind of opulence. Don\'t go during the early afternoon hours when many churches are closed (lunch time).

1537191.name: The most spectacular example of dedication I have ever seen
1537191.author: a TripAdvisor user
1537191.reviewBody:
The interior of this church is staggering -- every square meter is covered with sculpted, painted images of human faces and ornate decoration, including the dome, which must be at least 20 meters above the floor. The chapel is immaculate, cared for by a private organization.

This is, in its own way, the Cistine Chapel of North America. While Michalangelo has been recognized for hundreds of years not only for his artistry, but also for his planning and execution of the design, the work that went into the planning and execution of this church is simply beyond anything I have seen anywhere else in the world.

Alas, our tour got away late from Mexico City, and we had less than 15 minutes to absorb this church. However, that was enough time for me to take some fairly high-resolution digital photographs of the interior, which can be seen at www.pbase.com/mel_sny/mexico2003

There are many other sites to, in and from Puebla worth your spending the day it takes to even begin to see a few.

677352462.name: Our hotel was here
677352462.author: a TripAdvisor user
677352462.reviewBody: We stayed at the Mesones Sacrist\u00eda on Callejon de los Sapos. Fun street, lots of activity, and market on weekends. Colorful and great for photography.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

674824132.name: A beautiful little road
674824132.author: a TripAdvisor user
674824132.reviewBody: A beautiful place to walk by holding hands. Romantic and colorful it made us feel happy and it\'s right in the center Puebla. I would love to live in one of these happy blue and red and green houses

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

670312317.name: Antiques for all seekers
670312317.author: a TripAdvisor user
670312317.reviewBody: You can find just about anything amongst the street stalls , between 80 to 100. I went on a Sunday at 11 am.\n\nDon\u2019t overlook the normal stores as they also have their surprises

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

668769903.name: Great Shopping!
668769903.author: a TripAdvisor user
668769903.reviewBody: We visited 3 times during our stay in Puebla! This is an excellent place to shop for handmade goods.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

665380286.name: Lo mejor de puebla
665380286.author: a TripAdvisor user
665380286.reviewBody: Hello, I strongly recommend you visit this alley of toads since you will find many old and very beautiful things are expensive but the supreme truth is worth the people of Puebla is very nice sympathetic in some of the businesses that enter this alley the jente me I explained how many years ago I had the product they sold because it was a car, in that alley of toads my boyfriend bought a very nice old mini bicycle red color cost him $ 2000 his tires are still rubber and is in good condition, they will be very distracted and everything is going to like them because there are very valuable things I hope and it will be of much use to my opinion \ud83d\ude18

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

664877951.name: Flea Market
664877951.author: a TripAdvisor user
664877951.reviewBody: The flea market on the weekend here is great. It\'s not just antiques or junky souvenirs, in fact, there\'s not a lot of the typical mass produced touristy junk you see in some parts of Mexico. There\'s lots of handicrafts or just random neat stuff like you\'d find at a flea market at home. Like old luchadore movie posters, handmade notebooks, and plenty of local art.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

662594447.name: Interesting street that should be included in a walk through Puebla
662594447.author: a TripAdvisor user
662594447.reviewBody: Nice opportunity to view another street in Puebla filled with culture art and more. Always something to view and part of a full walk through this amazing city.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

658449626.name: definitely don\'t pass this up
658449626.author: a TripAdvisor user
658449626.reviewBody: One of the more charming areas of Puebla. Quiet elegance and history walk together. Antique stores, hotels and cafes predominate.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

655686512.name: Pretty and picturesque
655686512.author: a TripAdvisor user
655686512.reviewBody: This is such a lovely little street on which to stroll in Puebla.  We were there on the weekend, so it was chock-full of people out shopping and just having a good time.  You should take a walk over here while you are in Puebla.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

654787790.name: Don\'t Miss!
654787790.author: a TripAdvisor user
654787790.reviewBody: The prettiest part of Puebla; pedestrian street(s) with lots of interesting little shops and good, moderately-priced restaurants.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

654293720.name: Nice Walk!
654293720.author: a TripAdvisor user
654293720.reviewBody: We were staying not to far from this area, so we decided to take an evening walk.  There are lots of different shops to visit and at the end of the street is John Lennon Alley, where you can get something to eat.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

653807218.name: My favorite street in Puebla!
653807218.author: a TripAdvisor user
653807218.reviewBody: Lovely artisan & antique shops, coffee shops, offering beautiful, serene and charming atmosphere, both day and night.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

653537781.name: A must in Puebla!
653537781.author: a TripAdvisor user
653537781.reviewBody: El Callej\u00f3n de los Sapos is really neat. We went twice, once on Sunday afternoon and once on a Monday morning. Both opportunities were great - Sunday there\u2019s a big flea market and it was fun to walk around. Plus, we tried some unique foods. Monday it was basically empty, so we got some really pretty pictures. I would really recommend checking it out! Calm, beautiful, and great for pics!

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

653521776.name: Touristy
653521776.author: a TripAdvisor user
653521776.reviewBody: Too touristy..we had more fun walking around the edges of the historic district finding wonderful tiled houses and local markets.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

652230116.name: 1000\u2019s of items old and new
652230116.author: a TripAdvisor user
652230116.reviewBody: This is a \u201cflea market,\u201d so to speak, that\u2019s filled with old and new objects. You can get fresh street food, antiques, handmade jewelry and junk. Of course one man\u2019s junk is... you can certainly find treasures. I went home with a lovely dark blue embroidered woven runner that could go on a table or a bed or used as a shawl.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

649528752.name: A NICE STREET
649528752.author: a TripAdvisor user
649528752.reviewBody: Located at about 200 meters from the Puebla Cathedral.  It is a neighborhood of old houses, painted in festive and intense colors, such as pink, purple, yellow, light blue, etc., giving a very pleasant atmosphere.   In this street you will find restaurants of various kinds of food, such as Mexican, vegetarian, desserts, and so on.  There are also several antique and ceramic shops. This is a recommended visit, to take a walk through the Street and enjoy a nice time.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

645824120.name: Beautiful area for photographs
645824120.author: a TripAdvisor user
645824120.reviewBody: This short section of street is really pretty.  I have always loved the variety of colors in Mexican buildings, and this is no exception.  I actually ended up returning a couple of times, as I was wandering around the city.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

642290394.name: Fun touristy area where half the tourists are Mexicans at least
642290394.author: a TripAdvisor user
642290394.reviewBody: It\'s really a series of streets that run into each other.  Lots of shops, restaurants, antiques, street vendors and all kinds of activity.  Everyone seems to have a great time and it\'s very safe.  Close by is the Artisan\'s Market and a few other set asides plus two or three churches close by

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

641504468.name: OK tourist Experience
641504468.author: a TripAdvisor user
641504468.reviewBody: Sapos is a colourful semi pedestrian street with a mesh-mash of antiques, talavera and other trinkets on display for sale in shops and on the street side. Nice place to browse and people watch with some decent restaurants nearby.  Its a popular area of the city for local artisans to set up and sell their wares on the adjoining streets.  It is one of the delights that make Puebla an enjoyable visitor experience we enjoy on every Puebla visit.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

641290488.name: Antique stores
641290488.author: a TripAdvisor user
641290488.reviewBody: This alley features pedestrian access only with vibrant colored townhouses full of small cafes, restaurants, and dusty antique stores. Nice addition to a city walking tour and a light lunch in the area.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

640156356.name: Shopping!
640156356.author: a TripAdvisor user
640156356.reviewBody: Tons of merchants where you can find antiques and new things. Definitely worth taking a stroll and buying some trinkets or if you have the luggage space the big items!!

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

638239172.name: My favourite image of Puebla
638239172.author: a TripAdvisor user
638239172.reviewBody: This incredibly colourful and vibrant street really sums up Puebla to me. It is a beautiful walk through this colourful environment and there are a number of artisan shops and bars/cafes.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

637534670.name: Don\'t expect to find wonderful antique treasures or vintage handcrafts...
637534670.author: a TripAdvisor user
637534670.reviewBody: It\'s worth a walk through, especially if you collect LP\'s from the early days of popular and rock music. Vendors sell mostly beat-up household stuff, although a few have items of more age and quality. Don\'t hold your breath hoping to come across a breath taking find. The shops, although more expensive, have much higher quality.\nDuring the month of December, some vendors are there everyday. Sunday still seems to be the day with the most sellers out.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

631314307.name: Meander, stop, look, taste and shop
631314307.author: a TripAdvisor user
631314307.reviewBody: I strolled this alley my first night in Puebla City and returned daily during the morning, afternoon or evening.  The area is completely safe and there is always something to purchase from antiques to local bead and leather crafts.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

627521541.name: A travel in the time
627521541.author: a TripAdvisor user
627521541.reviewBody: If you want to forget everything, enjoy good music, a delicious beer and buy some art, you should definitely visit this place.\nSi quieres olvidarte de todo, disfrutar buena m\u00fasica, una deliciosa cerveza y comprar algo de arte, definitivamente debes visitar este lugar.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

616115874.name: The best shopping
616115874.author: a TripAdvisor user
616115874.reviewBody: This alley has the best that Puebla has to offer. Typical Mexican artisan items and high end handmade clothing. Antiques like I\u2019ve never seen before.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

615217287.name: Great for a Sunday walk
615217287.author: a TripAdvisor user
615217287.reviewBody: This colorful streets are full of shops, furniture stores and restaurants . On sundays you can also find a flea market selling antiques but also many different crafts . You can also stroll and have an icecream  or stop by la pasita for their old liquor

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

613956167.name: Such a nice street
613956167.author: a TripAdvisor user
613956167.reviewBody: Such a beautiful and coloured street, with plenty of antique shops, old furniture, nice coffee shops, handmade staff...

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

606872797.name: Stroll here to get a visual taste of Puebla\u2019s vibrant colors
606872797.author: a TripAdvisor user
606872797.reviewBody: This is a short walk from the Zocolo and a place to visit within your first few hours of being in Puebla. The ceramics you may see, in and around the city, will remind you of this stroll. It\u2019s fun and pretty fast to stroll through the side streets admiring the handicraft vendors who set up shops daily. The street itself reminds me of the islands near Venice, Italy. If you are a photographer, you can find charming, colorful vignettes here.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

604487248.name: Cool place
604487248.author: a TripAdvisor user
604487248.reviewBody: I visited this location twice.  First time I visited I spend only 30 minutes because they were closing the stands.  The second time, I took my time and purchased several items for my family.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

601257212.name: Amazing antique stores and some of the best restaurants.
601257212.author: a TripAdvisor user
601257212.reviewBody: This is a back in time zone. Many old houses with XIX century architecture that have been converted into fine restaurants and bars and many into antique shops. Great place to visit. You can walk from the Zocalo to here.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

600870061.name: Nice walk.
600870061.author: a TripAdvisor user
600870061.reviewBody: We went to the alley on Sunday and ppl sell antiques here. (Like a small Mercado)\nIt is good to walk here and enjoy the environment. There are some restaurantes pretty near to. \nYou can do the whole walk in like 45 minutes.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

598986694.name: fun neighborhood on sunday mornings
598986694.author: a TripAdvisor user
598986694.reviewBody: this area is quite trendy and packed with people on the weekends and sunday mornings, good spot to buy something unusual or a gift for someone back home.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

595697349.name: Anything You Might Look For
595697349.author: a TripAdvisor user
595697349.reviewBody: This public market is stuffed with tiendas selling just about anything you could imagine, new, used and antique. The atmosphere is relaxed and lots of families wander through the crowded aisles on weekends. This is an ancient market in the Centro, and the architecture reflects that age. This is certainly worth a morning or afternoon stroll, though I wouldn\'t expect to find your gifts there.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

591699386.name: Fun to see
591699386.author: a TripAdvisor user
591699386.reviewBody: Every cool city has a flea market and Puebla is no exception. I didn\'t,find anything to buy but you might stumble upon a used book or LP, Beatles memorabilia or a good price on local artesania. Good dining in the area too.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

588111727.name: Traditional area in downtown with handcrafts on weekends
588111727.author: a TripAdvisor user
588111727.reviewBody: Traditional area in downtown with handcrafts on weekends.\nUnfortunately we visit in the middle of the week, but some stores open.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

583769584.name: Fun shopping experience
583769584.author: a TripAdvisor user
583769584.reviewBody: Lots of handmade textile articles and jewelry.  We were not looking for antiques or furniture but there are tons of interesting collectible items. Found some really cool friendship type bracelets and typical hand embroidered "mananitas" - a rectangular poncho that women can wear diagonally or horizontally.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

579980836.name: Antiques!
579980836.author: a TripAdvisor user
579980836.reviewBody: Great weekend antique market. Vendors seemed fair and willing to negotiate.  Great restaurants and musicians.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

576646233.name: Excellent on Sundayss....
576646233.author: a TripAdvisor user
576646233.reviewBody: This area has interesting antique shops that are more open for haggling on the weekdays, but on Sundays the streets are full of vendors. There are also people from the countryside selling coffee and other goods on the periphery at unusually good prices. A good opportunity to sample street foods outside of the market too. A fun way to spend a Sunday....

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

573085578.name: A Sunday must
573085578.author: a TripAdvisor user
573085578.reviewBody: It is a lovely street any day, but if you\'re in Puebla on Sunday, don\'t miss the artisan and flea market in this street and adjacent plaza. It\'s lots of fun and you can find some very interesting souvenirs.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

563964779.name: A stroll through history
563964779.author: a TripAdvisor user
563964779.reviewBody: A friend said this was a must visit, and I can see why.  While there are many shops that are not of interest to the typical tourist, there were treasures to unearth and the ambiance was charming and colorful.  We went back two or three times just to stroll and window shop after our \'purchasing\' trip.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

562371258.name: I Tried to figure out why this place is called Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)
562371258.author: a TripAdvisor user
562371258.reviewBody: I had done my research on lots of the places we were to visit during our 9 day tour of central Mexico, this place was no exception. But! as all the reviewers state, frog alley is really happening mainly on the weekends and in the evening. So when do we arrive, @ 11 am on a Wednesday, the restaurant didn\'t open for another hour. Which pretty much ended our Puebla walking tour. We got a bite to eat at the McDonald\'s in the square and walked back to our hotel for part 2 of our busy day. The good thing was, I did find out why its called the Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos), because It may be hopping on the weekends and in the evenings, but it croaked when we were there.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

561817591.name: Lovely
561817591.author: a TripAdvisor user
561817591.reviewBody: Nice Flea Market during the weekend. At the end of the alley don\u2019t miss the best \u201cCantina\u201d in town, La Pasita!!

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

559082957.name: A must on the weekend!
559082957.author: a TripAdvisor user
559082957.reviewBody: It\u2019s really no more that a flea market, but it is most distinctly a Mexican one. If you want a quick-but-thorough overview of what was hot or important in Mexico over the last century, come here. If you leave absolutely empty-handed, I\u2019d be surprised. Also check out the excellent crafts market in nearby Carolino, or the equidistant Mercado Analco. You can easily use up a day!  Saturday and Sunday only.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

558586174.name: Beautiful part of town
558586174.author: a TripAdvisor user
558586174.reviewBody: See it on a Sunday but also when it\'s quiet - two completely different experiences.  The photos on quiet days are better as there is nothing stopping you getting shots of these pretty buildings !\n\nThe Sunday market is great though.  So much interesting stuff for sale + buskers etc

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

557787262.name: Interesting
557787262.author: a TripAdvisor user
557787262.reviewBody: A must see particularly on a Sunday. The area was very large and there were many shops and stalls. Friendly people.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

555748459.name: Picturesque Street
555748459.author: a TripAdvisor user
555748459.reviewBody: A must to see when you visit Puebla. It is a side street from the zocalo. It has great building with wonderful architecture and colors, typical of Puebla. There are quaint restaurants and bars ad well as shops.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

554285791.name: Little bit small but lots to see
554285791.author: a TripAdvisor user
554285791.reviewBody:
I visited here both in the day and at night. Both times are great. 
The stalls pretty much have the same things but it’s interesting to see what’s for sale. 
I was told to not buy here because the more authentic items are south which is where I’m heading. 
Frankly I didn’t really want anything either. But further along there are some galleries that have unique artwork an the artisans actually sit out the front of their galleries and paint so you can view their work. 
Wheelchair friendly. Kid friendly. No wifi. Toilets available for 5 pesos.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

551281413.name: A MUST
551281413.author: a TripAdvisor user
551281413.reviewBody: When you come to Puebla (preferably on a weekend day, you cannot miss the ambiance, antiques and crafts in the alley and square of the frogs... It is a MUST

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

549450377.name: Great place to walk around or good for souvenirs too.
549450377.author: a TripAdvisor user
549450377.reviewBody:
Great area to walk around in. My hotel was there so I found out about it. Close to Zocalo. 
As some have mentioned buy your souvenirs here. Open air sellers on a couple of streets and I got Talavera pieces much cheaper than say Cholula. Cholula wanted 140 pesos for a piece I got for 50 pesos at this street market. 

Anyway just walk around and check out some of the antique stores and restaurants too. Very safe area as well. Although most all of Pueblo was safe.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

526414871.name: Nice walk, quaint
526414871.author: a TripAdvisor user
526414871.reviewBody: Lovely walk in the downtown area. Some shops have nice crafts, others some antiques and others just junk. There are also some small cafes, a couple of restaurants and just around the corner the traditional bar "La Pasita" where you can stop and order one shot of "Pasita".

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

516712914.name: Time machine
516712914.author: a TripAdvisor user
516712914.reviewBody: El callej\u00f3n de los sapos is one of most biggest antiquities market in puebla, also a beautiful corridor behind la compa\u00f1\u00eda church that invites visits the most famous liquor store called la pasita is an special grapevine drink with an special cheese touch !

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

501889813.name: Great place for a souvenir
501889813.author: a TripAdvisor user
501889813.reviewBody: If you\'re looking for something to take with you from Puebla, this is the place to go. There a lot of hand crafted knickknacks, clothing, toys, etc.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

497921133.name: Very nice
497921133.author: a TripAdvisor user
497921133.reviewBody: A traditional place to visit very nice walk with a lot of interesting things to buy and or just look.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

496371287.name: Quaint and colourful
496371287.author: a TripAdvisor user
496371287.reviewBody: Part of historic Puebla this narrow street merits a visit, just walk from Parian market up along the street and turn up towards the mainsquare when done. It will reward you with vibrantly coloured, wellkept housefronts, antiqueshops and a few eateries

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

492199466.name: Picturesque Street
492199466.author: a TripAdvisor user
492199466.reviewBody: The Alley of the Frogs or Callej\u00f3n de los Sapos is a beautiful street filled with small antiques and Mexican souvenir stores. It\'s right downtown, makes for a perfect walk from Puebla\'s cathedral to El Carolino (Puebla\'s University building)Those streets are so full of amazing stores and vendors. The street comes alive on weekends, specially Sundays when the antique market opens. If you go to Puebla, don\'t miss this gem.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

491524490.name: A place to go if you like flea markets
491524490.author: a TripAdvisor user
491524490.reviewBody: Situated very near the Zocalo, a very peculiar flea market, although I am not a shopper I could see that you might find anything from expensive art work to used trinkets.  In the nearby alleys you can find local crafts.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

485991108.name: colorful and interesting
485991108.author: a TripAdvisor user
485991108.reviewBody: we went there on sturday so they had some small shops on the street. that makes the steeet more beautiful and also interesting. you can see some antique crafts, pitures or photos. great to visit!

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

479640670.name: Do not buy crafts here
479640670.author: a TripAdvisor user
479640670.reviewBody: This is a very interesting market, with nice things to see and good place for affordable souvenirs but the quality of the product is not good. My recommendation is to spend a bit more and get the real thing in one of the authentic ceramic workshops

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

478072141.name: Loved it
478072141.author: a TripAdvisor user
478072141.reviewBody: I usually will cruise through a market at top speed but this was something else! Every stall had really interesting and beautiful antiques, I went up and down every single aisle and I hope its on again tomorrow because I want to go back!

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

475882379.name: Great area to meander through
475882379.author: a TripAdvisor user
475882379.reviewBody: There over a holiday weekend, Easter, and this was one of the many lovely areas visited. The re are around 3 blocks with a nice mix of souvenirs, flea market type finds/stores and real antique stores.  I think I was most impressed with the real antique stores, for the most part the ones that were open but didn\'t flood the street with their stuff.  Lots of helpful staff and some beautiful old things on display from large furniture pieces to smaller things you could carry home on a plane. Unless you just don\'t like shopping or colorful interesting areas, you\'ll likely find its a pleasant stroll.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

474313122.name: A fun shopping stroll
474313122.author: a TripAdvisor user
474313122.reviewBody: This charming little street is chock full of small antique stores, some filled with touristy kitsch and others hiding the occasional treasure. We visited at the beginning of Semana Santa and all the surrounding streets were also filled with vendors, shoppers and gawkers.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

472225381.name: Fun weekend plan
472225381.author: a TripAdvisor user
472225381.reviewBody: It\'s a nice place to go on a Saturday afternoon , there\'s lots of different things for sale, mostly antiques . Good Prices and great talking with the vendors. \nYou must like to "chacharear" like we say.. which means to shop for hours for not always so useful stuff. It\'s mostly the experience and the walking around the streets. It can\'t get crowded.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

465388256.name: for antique and flea market lovers
465388256.author: a TripAdvisor user
465388256.reviewBody: A very cute street with different vendors and products, you can find gorgeous and valuable things, and you can get ripped off as well, but that\u00b4s up to you, there\u00b4s lots to see, and buy!

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

464823214.name: Antique fair on weekends is fun
464823214.author: a TripAdvisor user
464823214.reviewBody: Every Sat & Sun, antique fair pops up here. It was fun looking around the stalls. We bought a few items.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

460785789.name: Great place to buy souvenirs
460785789.author: a TripAdvisor user
460785789.reviewBody: Best souvenirs in town and awesome antiques as well don\'t forget to enter in to every store you will no regret it!

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

457399346.name: Antiques & weekend Flea Market
457399346.author: a TripAdvisor user
457399346.reviewBody: Strange name in English for the area known as Sapo\'s.  Several antique shops in this area along with a very active weekend flea market which has crafts, antiques and many different collectable items.  Some of these antique shops can be spendy and others of great value. Picked up 5 beautiful chandeliers for my new condo being renovated for what just one them would have costs up north.\n    The area is just about 3 blocks from the Zocalo (City Center Park) of this UNESCO Heritage City.  This area of shopping is about 3 blocks total in length.  Good place to spend the afternoon on weekends.  Most of the antiques shops are closed on Monday and many do not open till 1pm.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

456745618.name: Shopping for antiques and the unusual stuff
456745618.author: a TripAdvisor user
456745618.reviewBody:
If you're in Puebla during a weekend, Callejon de los Sapos is a must!
I had been there before but always on weekdays, I was surprised to visit again but this time during the weekend. It was very alive with plenty to explore specially if you collect anything, for sure you'll find something unusual that interests you.

There's also a street full of handcraft vendors and artists where you can continue exploring. Also a number of restaurants where you can have mole or bars to chill out, have a drink and just observe the activity around you.

Don't be surprised if at the end of your visit you end up carrying more stuff than you had initially planned.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

456571162.name: Great way to pass the time.
456571162.author: a TripAdvisor user
456571162.reviewBody: The best flea market I\'ve seen in a very long time. What makes this one special? The location.The street-lined stores with multi-colored walls and balconies are the best. Bargaining is the order of day here so come for some fun.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

456279690.name: A lovely plaza
456279690.author: a TripAdvisor user
456279690.reviewBody: Just a nice sweet and picturesque walking space whIch is nice but nithIng special. Dont make a special trip

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

453147717.name: Excellent flea market.
453147717.author: a TripAdvisor user
