453147717.reviewBody: Lots of cool things to browse and but in this nice setting. Remember to walk down the street at one end of the market (crossing a main road) and you will be in one of the emost beautiful streets in Puebla - Calle 6 Sur - Look it up

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

443177235.name: Not my thing
443177235.author: a TripAdvisor user
443177235.reviewBody: We went on a Sunday and while this might be a fascinating place for antique lovers, I found the section set up for the weekend crowded and uninteresting. The shops were a bit more interesting and we enjoyed talking with the shop owners.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

440026827.name: Nice shops, but really need to see it on the weekend
440026827.author: a TripAdvisor user
440026827.reviewBody: I was expecting a bit more given the reviews. The shops along the alley and plaza were nice and had interesting items to look at and buy. But since we went on a Friday it was a bit dead and the plaza was empty of merchant tents. Apparently all the tents appear only on the weekends when the flea market is. So my advice is to only check this out on the weekend if possible.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

437499463.name: Excellent market for connoisseurs of antiques in Puebla.
437499463.author: a TripAdvisor user
437499463.reviewBody:
I visited Alley of Frogs on Sunday 9th October 2016.
This market is vibrant on Saturdays and Sundays. Located in the historic portion of the city amidst magnificent and colossal colonial buildings, the market has antiques, souvenirs and furnitures reminiscent of rich and traditional Mexican cultures.
The market has conventional shops as well as traditional street stalls. I would advise you to purchase from traditional stalls than shops because former is cheaper.
I found it delight and right place for hunters and collectors of antiques etc.
I stuffed my backpack with small and unique gifts for my family and friends without pinch on my pocket.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

433423601.name: Amazing place, fun, fun fun!
433423601.author: a TripAdvisor user
433423601.reviewBody: You could find amazing pieces and antiques to buy don\'t miss "La Casa de la Luna" shop 6 sur 310 callejon de los sapos centro this store is the best one it has amazing things paintings lamps and artifacts is is lovely and the owner Ma Elizabeth Rodriguez Mu\u00f1oz de Cote is a darling! Also ask for "la pasita" to have a nice liqueur you will love it my friends!

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

430557083.name: Very nice flea market and local market close to Zocalo-historic center
430557083.author: a TripAdvisor user
430557083.reviewBody: The market in the the historic center. the alley is very nice, the building are from the colonial era. there also local market when walking toward the Zocalo with local arts. less then 15 minutes walking from the old town historic center and maun square.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

424811239.name: Walk through here!
424811239.author: a TripAdvisor user
424811239.reviewBody: You can walk through here, but there is not much to buy. Mostly old stuff that you probably don\'t need.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

417905253.name: Fun to visit, not to buy
417905253.author: a TripAdvisor user
417905253.reviewBody: It is interesting and enjoyable to walk around the different stalls and see the variety of product, however I do not recommend buying here if you are looking for high quality, authentic pieces. You will see quite a price difference between the ceramic pieces here and at shops but it is due to a very different quality and probably manufacturing process. If you are looking for the real thing, do not buy here

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

405589121.name: not the Alley, it is the Plaza of Sapos that should be the review
405589121.author: a TripAdvisor user
405589121.reviewBody: a fantastic place on Sundays for lovers of flea markets and antiques. There is everything from the junkiest of junk to great art pieces, jewelry, books, toys, decor, etc.  It is a place always crowed, and a must for me every time i can spend a Sunday in Puebla. Over the years I have found great additions to my various collections, gifts for friends and family and true historical pieces. The fun is to define with piece of trash or treasure we want and then bargain of the right price

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

403292850.name: Wonderful Cultural Experience
403292850.author: a TripAdvisor user
403292850.reviewBody: Wonderful Cultural Experience. It\'s a place to purchase beautiful souvenirs and to experience the wonderful rich culture of Puebla City. The locals are very nice with great hospitality.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

402017439.name: Not great on a Thursday
402017439.author: a TripAdvisor user
402017439.reviewBody: Some okay shops but pretty small area. I guess the weekend is better as vendors come in with better things to sell. Either way if you\'re close to the park and main church it\'s worth checking out.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

400599999.name: Great area for a wander
400599999.author: a TripAdvisor user
400599999.reviewBody: This part of Puebla known as "Los Sapos" has a great feel to it. It\'s very bohemian and relaxed. You will probably wander into the area from El Parian or El Barrio de Los Artistas.  There\'s a surprise in every antique shop: antique milk churns (husband nearly bought one!), antique horse riding Spurs, advertising trays, VW bottle openers, sewing machines, ceramics, religious images and more serious collectors\' items. You can try to bargain down the prices. When you are done, go for a coffee in the courtyard cafes around the area.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

387338295.name: Great visit!
387338295.author: a TripAdvisor user
387338295.reviewBody: Enjoyed wandering along this road.  Not sure how well known it is, we were travelling on a group tour and of our group only my friends and I went here.  Picturesque and great antique shops and little arty boutiques.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

385044842.name: Forget the SELFIES!
385044842.author: a TripAdvisor user
385044842.reviewBody: This is such a nice street to enjoy the antique shops. No selfies; the colors are amazing so do not do the place a disservice with a selfie. Take pictures of the place.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

383695023.name: Unique antiques lining the street
383695023.author: a TripAdvisor user
383695023.reviewBody: We love this place. It is a must stop in all our trips to Puebla. This alley is basically lined with great antiques. It has a flea market type of feel to it, with locals displaying their goods on stands on either sides of the plaza. You will find everything from old coins, antique arts and crafts, magazines and even old record players. Well worth the visit. It\'s located only a few blocks from the main plaza in Puebla.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

380879333.name: Lots of fun.
380879333.author: a TripAdvisor user
380879333.reviewBody: During the week it\'s lined with antiques shops.  If you like flea markets you\'ll enjoy visiting on weekends when you\'ll find antiques and souvenirs.  I bought Talavera refrigerator magnets as souvenirs which were only 2/3s of what they were charging in El Parian.  While you\'re there have a meal or snack at the wonderful hotel Meson Sacristia, where there\'s great Mexican music on weekends.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

378613928.name: Sunday Antique Market - A Must!
378613928.author: a TripAdvisor user
378613928.reviewBody: I\'ve been during the week and there were only a few shops open. On the weekend however, this alley is jammed with tables and tables of various antiques and treasures. Worth a wonder through if you\'re able!

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

378113120.name: Antiques
378113120.author: a TripAdvisor user
378113120.reviewBody: Antiques, 2nd had items, furniture, LPs, books, vintage, restaurants, cafes. Just for walk around.\nYou will find something for everyone.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

374244459.name: great place for a good walk and shopping artcrafts
374244459.author: a TripAdvisor user
374244459.reviewBody: this is a very tipical place to visit and to see many different artcrafts from Puebla and the arrouns also you can find antiques, good place to eat somthing or to make a stop to have a drink family enviromental , dont miss

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

368431188.name: One man\'s trash is another man\'s treasure
368431188.author: a TripAdvisor user
368431188.reviewBody: You will definitely find a lot of antiquities here, something might work for you, you never know. We were not looking to spend any money so we just walked by. You will definitely go "I remember we used to have that" or "my grandma had one like this!" moments several times.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

367487583.name: Great antiquity bazar on sundays
367487583.author: a TripAdvisor user
367487583.reviewBody: Here you can find some nice restaurants and places to chill out on week days.\nOn the weekend (mainly sunday) they set antiquities bazar on this place where one can find from old books, toys, music, etc.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

364959543.name: Little trinket street
364959543.author: a TripAdvisor user
364959543.reviewBody: They sell a lot of junk mixed with interesting stuff. Worth strolling the street because they have all kind of paintings, old rusted keys, dogs,cats made of cly and I think I saw a rooster and a hen too.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

363497830.name: Flea Market on Saturday
363497830.author: a TripAdvisor user
363497830.reviewBody: We were visiting Puebla on Saturday and happened upon this nice little street filled with antique shops.  It was a lovely day and there happened to be a flea market set up in the middle of the street.  It was nice to walk thru and look, I guess I am just not into antiques!  Nice people and a few eating places outside and OH YES, a street vendor selling crickets to eat with fresh lime squeezed on top.  I just couldn\'t bring myself to do it!  So sorry!

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

362495218.name: Trending Upwards
362495218.author: a TripAdvisor user
362495218.reviewBody: Fifteen years ago or so, this spot actually had more going for it, but it seems to be trying to revitalize itself with new shops selling artisan items mixed in with the standby bric-a-brac stores, as well as some small hip restaurants like San Patrono on the corner (a super lunch or treat spot). Many buildings undergoing remodelling, which bodes well for the area just a few blocks from the zocalo.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

357621263.name: Picturesque walk
357621263.author: a TripAdvisor user
357621263.reviewBody: The area is beautiful to stroll through. You will be amazed with the variety of things you can purchase. It is basically a flea market and it is very busy on the weekends. I enjoyed looking at the architecture the most.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

336533471.name: Colorful buildings with antique shops
336533471.author: a TripAdvisor user
336533471.reviewBody: I visited the callej\u00f3n de los Sapos 15 years ago, the street has not changed but the stores have. It used to be a street full of antique shops but not anymore. Expect to find stores with old used furniture and objects. You can take pictures of the colorful buildings , find a souvenir or eat a snack. We bought dried Chapulines. I recommend tasting them in a restaurant with guacamole.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

333715480.name: In love!
333715480.author: a TripAdvisor user
333715480.reviewBody: The best place to find everithing antique that you want and you would not find it in a common market.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

326526228.name: Nice walk
326526228.author: a TripAdvisor user
326526228.reviewBody: My favorite street on Puebla, is small, colorful and beautiful.\nOn the weekends you can find a flea market and antique stores all the other days.\nIs very near to all the other atractions in the downtown and to finish your visit I will recommend to drink a "pasita".

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

321926920.name: Cute street
321926920.author: a TripAdvisor user
321926920.reviewBody: I walk down memory lane and the history it holds. Nice buildings. If this is a tourist spot. I think they should invest in cleaning up the graffiti. But it was nice to hear the history.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

318799196.name: Colonial, crafty and antiquey
318799196.author: a TripAdvisor user
318799196.reviewBody: On weekends there\'s a flea market, and the area has lots of neat shops with crafts, from jewelry to clothing, antiques and "rustic" furniture. There\'s a boutique hotel on this street with multi-colored buildings, a vegetarian restaurant and a European bakery nearby, as well. There\'s an excellent art gallery on the square. Be ready to spend at least a couple of hours there, and it\'s right downtown.

itemReviewed.name: Alley of the Frogs (Callejon de los Sapos)

677351999.name: Lively Zocalo
677351999.author: a TripAdvisor user
677351999.reviewBody: The Zocalo is the place to be for people watching in any Mexican city, and Puebla is no exception. Always full of people, vendors, children, parades, music, etc, and especially so in the evening.  Great fun, and excellent for photography!

671904496.name: Great place to visit
671904496.author: a TripAdvisor user
671904496.reviewBody: Zocalo is located in the heart of historic center of Puebla city, which is UNESCO listed World heritage site. This place is very beautiful, clean and safe. Amazing architectures.

668769352.name: On the weekends, the zocalo turned into a carnival!
668769352.author: a TripAdvisor user
668769352.reviewBody: Great people watching, buskers, vendors, musicians. There are several good restaurants on the edge of the zocalo.

667041727.name: Visit to Puebla downtown
667041727.author: a TripAdvisor user
667041727.reviewBody: It is an mamazing place to visit, they are very clean, the stores are nice, good price, very traditional according to the history of the city, very recommended the tour on tourist bus

664868493.name: Rosca de Reyes!
664868493.author: a TripAdvisor user
664868493.reviewBody: The area isn\'t huge, but it is nice to visit and go for a walk. We were lucky enough to be here during the Epiphany in 2018, when they serve the Rosca de Reyes. Apparently they one they had set up in the Zocalo was the biggest one in Mexico. It was huge and filled up the whole street, and people were lining up for it all day before the event started in the early evening. We wanted to try it and thought we might not be in Puebla again at the same time of year, so we waited in the massive line with everyone else. It was a lot of fun even though I didn\'t find the baby Jesus or see anyone around me find him (I think I heard there were multiples because it was such a big event and the pastry was giant). If you find yourself in Puebla during the Epiphany, it\'s a really cool experience. I have been in Mexico during Epiphany before, but never gone to a big community thing like this. Everyone was really friendly and welcoming, so you can feel comfortable going as a foreigner if they do the giant bread (more like a cake) every year.

663993671.name: A beautiful swuare
663993671.author: a TripAdvisor user
663993671.reviewBody: This is the central old city square, with typical Spanish influence, the Cathedral, cafes and museums. The architecture is typical Spanish. It is definitely a beautiful site.

662596003.name: The heart and should of the city- vibrant and alive!
662596003.author: a TripAdvisor user
662596003.reviewBody: Every day I visited the Zocalo toes wheat was happening Each day had a different vibe with lots of action especially on the week-end with music and concerts. Do not miss.

660263476.name: Small but cute
660263476.author: a TripAdvisor user
660263476.reviewBody: Having visited several towns like this, the actual plaza is on the small size but the cathedral is huge so that makes it look even smaller. Like all of them there are a pletora of restaurants and bars all around it. It is well kept and clean.

658902240.name: Always visit the zocalo
658902240.author: a TripAdvisor user
658902240.reviewBody: That\'s the thing to do in Mexico... head to the zocalos and soak in the life over a few drinks and food. Great place for people watching and generally chill out.

658448994.name: fast food dominates
658448994.author: a TripAdvisor user
658448994.reviewBody: There is some energy in the Zocalo but unfortunately fast food chains like McDonald\'s, Burger King, Domino\'s, Subway and Carl Junior\'s Hamburger have taken root. Music is blasting in some establishments loud enough to break ear drums. Walk a few blocks away for better and quieter restaurants.

656126931.name: Imazing place rich of culture
656126931.author: a TripAdvisor user
656126931.reviewBody: This is by far the nicest and biggest main plaza in Latin America, is surrounded by history, museums, the Mexican Cathedral and hundreds of restaurants and thousands of people.

655278513.name: Smaller than you might expect
655278513.author: a TripAdvisor user
655278513.reviewBody: It\'s not the Zocalo of Mexico City, but it is impressive in its own right, with lovely architecture surrounding it and shade trees with benches underneath.  There was an obstacle course set up the day I was there for toddlers to ride their tricycles!  It is a lovely place worth strolling through if you are in Puebla.

654011365.name: One of the BEST of all the Zocalos we have seen.
654011365.author: a TripAdvisor user
654011365.reviewBody: At night this place is very popular with nice lights and all that is around it. During the day it is even better with the beautiful government building on one side and the cathedral on the other. Multiple restaurants And a McDonalds should you want a familiar breakfast.\n\nOff the streets around you will find other interesting places such a the library and a long mall.

653814412.name: Great place to rest or eat!
653814412.author: a TripAdvisor user
653814412.reviewBody:
This is a very nice area with a beautiful park,restaurants and the Puebla Tourist office.
After walking through the park we bought a drink and sat on one of the many park benches and enjoyed watching watching all the people go by.
The only drawback to this park is it is surrounded by a very busy street.

653807417.name: Beautiful place!
653807417.author: a TripAdvisor user
653807417.reviewBody: Zocalo is the heart of Puebla, with its stunning Cathedral, gorgeous gardens with monumental fountain, surrounded by portals with great restaurants and shops. Tourist Office, located in the portals, is of great help - ready to answer all your questions! Currency exchange is also in the portals.

653715845.name: Baroque bauty
653715845.author: a TripAdvisor user
653715845.reviewBody: Pueblas zocalo is one of the most beautiful downtowns of all the Mexican cities. Take a walk even at night is delightful

652231341.name: Historical district with shops and food.
652231341.author: a TripAdvisor user
652231341.reviewBody: Food. Historical architecture. Clowns and balloons and musicians. A lovely place to stroll and take in the cultural vibes of the city.

651349430.name: The lively heart of the city
651349430.author: a TripAdvisor user
651349430.reviewBody: The beating heart of the city surrounded by lots of wonderful historic buildings. Always a lively place to visit with sellers of various things, demonstrations or people just hanging out. Plenty of places to eat and drink too close by. Would be strange to visit Puebla and not go through it at least once!

647422111.name: Pleasant
647422111.author: a TripAdvisor user
647422111.reviewBody: Zocalo\u2019s are the best place for a little wander and a spot of people watching all over Mexico and this one is no exception.

647148852.name: Beautiful zocalo
647148852.author: a TripAdvisor user
647148852.reviewBody: A nice stroll through the zocalo has many trees for shade and a lovely vibe. It\u2019s peaceful and lively at the same time. Surrounded by churches, shops and restaurants.

646050133.name: Three Kings Day
646050133.author: a TripAdvisor user
646050133.reviewBody: I stayed at a hotel near by.  Wanted to experience Three Kings Day in the Zocalo and it was quite the experience.  Live entertainment and the food was awesome.  They were giving away toys and also I happened to see the largest rosca I have ever seen.  A piece was served along with a cup of hot chocolate/coffee to all that were in line.  It was a very nice experience.

645825880.name: Especially beautiful around Christmas time
645825880.author: a TripAdvisor user
645825880.reviewBody: I was in Puebla in December, so everywhere there were decorations and lights.  The Zocalo in Puebla is always busy - people walking to and fro, and is a great place to people watch.

642896468.name: Browsing
642896468.author: a TripAdvisor user
642896468.reviewBody: Took a stroll to the cathedral in Puebla and visited the z\u00f3calo on the way, there were lots of people selling hand made things and offering to sell candy, candles, balloons and other things. Not sure what the crime is like but there was a lot of police presence but it did feel safe enough not to be to concerned of pick pockets but still be weary lots of beggars around. Pros very pretty, cons sad to see lots of poor people struggling.

641964253.name: Lively and lovely
641964253.author: a TripAdvisor user
641964253.reviewBody: The atmosphere here was lively and lovely! People were chatting, buying balloons or enjoying the sun. The square is surrounded by nice arcades.

641287750.name: Wonderful location
641287750.author: a TripAdvisor user
641287750.reviewBody: This is a great focal point for the city of Puebla. Full of cafes, banks, shops, and bookstores. The best way to immerse yourself in a culture and people is to sit for a while and watch the time pass.

640155811.name: December Days/Nights
640155811.author: a TripAdvisor user
640155811.reviewBody: \nWe had beautiful weather and their gardens and atmosphere is excellent. Definitely a place I\'ve visited more than once and would go back!! Enjoy the restaurants that have balconies allowing you to see the Zocalo!

639622142.name: Visit to Puebla
639622142.author: a TripAdvisor user
639622142.reviewBody: Great zocalo/plaza, it was christmas decorated and beautiful, great walking around the plaza and to go to the cathedral

638238386.name: Beautiful area
638238386.author: a TripAdvisor user
638238386.reviewBody: In the centre of the beautiful town of Puebla, this is definitely a must see for all travelers in the area. The Cathedral stands high above anything else is of an immense scale.

636762842.name: Busy
636762842.author: a TripAdvisor user
636762842.reviewBody: This is a busy crossroads, with interesting buildings around it, including the Cathedral and the Municipal building.  It has a nicely planted central area.

634941660.name: great place
634941660.author: a TripAdvisor user
634941660.reviewBody: this state is a great place to stay whith your family and friends, you can visit the catedrals in this town and arounthis there are  lot of places to eat like restaurants and little shops of food, also you can walk on the town and enter to the catedrals.

631308988.name: Zocalo is the place to see, be and meet
631308988.author: a TripAdvisor user
631308988.reviewBody: The central square is busy with families, vendors and tourists day and night.  The Cathedral and Municipal Buildings flank the square.  Quaint shops and restaurants line the cobbled streets, tour buses line up along the side, well lit, well-cared for grounds, trees and artwork galore.  There was live music at night and lots of visible police walking around.

631107597.name: Heart of el centro historico
631107597.author: a TripAdvisor user
631107597.reviewBody: One cannot miss the z\u00f3calo while in Puebla. We were there for Dia De Los Muertos and the square was packed with people, vendors and performers. The following morning we went back and could then appreciate the art installations that we didn\u2019t notice the night before. They had a collection of skeleton figures, all festively painted (see photos). The Catedral de Puebla, tourist information office and shops and restaurants all line the square.

630610802.name: Lots of fun
630610802.author: a TripAdvisor user
630610802.reviewBody:
I visited here with the Dia des Muertos celebrations.
The atmosphere was lively and very family friendly.
Travelling solo, at no one time did I feel unsafe, it was a big friendly party.
Would recommend, safe and happy place to have a hot chocolate, and a chat with the locals.

630384708.name: Wonderful zocalo
630384708.author: a TripAdvisor user
630384708.reviewBody: We were here during Dia de los muertos and it was such fun to walk around the zocalo and take in all the activities and families having a great time. The ofrendas in the area are fantastic!

628265731.name: Green and nice
628265731.author: a TripAdvisor user
628265731.reviewBody: Lots of trees and very nice and quiet. This square is surrounded by the must important buildings of puebla and also many restaurants.

628045940.name: You can only view 1/4 of the inside
628045940.author: a TripAdvisor user
628045940.reviewBody: This is a very impressive church, but the fact that you can only walk the front 1/4 of it is a little silly. We have been to many churches in the Yucatan, and you can explore most of them. The people watching outside, and the trees in the park to the side of it are quite impressive, but there were so many more ornate things that were just out of our view.

624858137.name: So much history
624858137.author: a TripAdvisor user
624858137.reviewBody: If you are going don\u2019t miss all the churches, libraries and museums you can take 3 whole days to visit everything and enjoy the places. Some great  restaurants in this blocks of the city. Don\u2019t missed them too. Stop in the terrace to take a picture of the main church and the park called \u201czocalo\u201d. Take pictures, observe and enjoy.

621803899.name: Amazing
621803899.author: a TripAdvisor user
621803899.reviewBody: That place of the z\u00f3calo and catedral it\u2019s so cool.. you can go around an have a walk.. go inside the catedral it\u2019s beautiful and eat some local stuff \n

621429031.name: Nice place to walk around during the day but strangely quiet after dark.
621429031.author: a TripAdvisor user
621429031.reviewBody: Lots of churches, restaurants and shops with plenty of trees to shade you from the sun. Bustling during the day but eerily empty at night except for the surrounding restaurants.

621059556.name: Zocalo
621059556.author: a TripAdvisor user
621059556.reviewBody: Being the centre of Puebla, there\u2019s a lot of churches and hotels surrounding it. A good place to stroll along during the day. At night it can be a little quiet compared to zocalo in Mexico City

616115152.name: The center of Puebla
616115152.author: a TripAdvisor user
616115152.reviewBody: The Z\u00f3calo is the heart of Puebla. Start thee and work your way out. Take a tour from there. Sit by a bench and watch the kids play. Watch the evening projections on the church show. It\u2019s magic.

615267696.name: Wonderful city center!
615267696.author: a TripAdvisor user
615267696.reviewBody: Like most, the venue changes every 10 feet!  Musicians, lovers, food, kids playing, shade, balloons, and the cacophony of living.  Very safe and very close to shops and eateries.  I could spend the entire day here!

614645584.name: Active zocolo
614645584.author: a TripAdvisor user
614645584.reviewBody: Alive night and day. Various bands add to festiivities. The Klezmer band was excellent. Various restaurants. Cemiita restaurant serves this local dish.

614356893.name: Vibrant place!
614356893.author: a TripAdvisor user
614356893.reviewBody: Vibrant public square with a beautiful fountain, trees and benches surrounded by eateries, shops and historic church.\nGreat vibe, clean and safe to walk around.

614194067.name: A great place to get away from business
614194067.author: a TripAdvisor user
614194067.reviewBody: Lots of beautiful stores, bars and restaurants. Great place to people watch and walk away from the business you are in town for.

614173007.name: Gorgeous city
614173007.author: a TripAdvisor user
614173007.reviewBody: A simply gorgeous city with classic colonial architecture  not least an amazng church about every 100 metres - Great food also - don\'t forget the mole poblano! And the ice cream with a knob of chile in the middle......My tip would be - stay here a good 3/4 days and visit Mexico City from here, it\'s not that far.

613663211.name: The main square of a beautiful city
613663211.author: a TripAdvisor user
613663211.reviewBody: This is the main square of a beautiful city, with trees, statues, plants and ornaments.  The point of maximum interes.

606854859.name: Impressive Cathedral
606854859.author: a TripAdvisor user
606854859.reviewBody: Beautiful and gorgeous Cathedral, please do not hesitate on hiring the tourists guides, they will talk about all the interesting and historical events around the site and the city.

606752250.name: The center where everybody meets
606752250.author: a TripAdvisor user
606752250.reviewBody: We stayed across the street and it was the perfect location to start and end each day\u2019s exploration. We were even able to be witness to a peaceful demonstration march of individuals and organizations protesting an issue. It\u2019s a lovely place to spend time and get to know locals and tourists alike.

604492209.name: Very lively place
604492209.author: a TripAdvisor user
604492209.reviewBody: The place is full of life.  Many good restaurant to choose from.  The  heart of the city is there.  I did visited my two night at the city.  Will visit again.

603689453.name: Must visit
603689453.author: a TripAdvisor user
603689453.reviewBody: It\u2019s a lovely, lively and even peaceful place to begin your visit to Puebla\u2019s historic center.  \nCathedral, restaurants, bars and lots of shopping opportunities in the area.

603311341.name: Busy & attractive area
603311341.author: a TripAdvisor user
603311341.reviewBody: There are multiple stores, restaurants and historic buildings around El Zocalo.  Enjoy the experience of having a coffee, ice cream or a meal while enjoying watching the crowd go by.

601254040.name: All food and drink varieties you want.
601254040.author: a TripAdvisor user
601254040.reviewBody: The Zocalo in all Mexico is where the center of the government and the main plaza, together most of the time with the city Catherdral is located. The Zocalo in Puebla is big and has many different types of restaurants and bars. After a tour it is a must to go there, to chill out.

600866846.name: Good.
600866846.author: a TripAdvisor user
600866846.reviewBody: Z\u00f3calo Is not that impressive.\nIs like any other Z\u00f3calo from any other Mexican estate. \nGood thing is that there are a lot of restaurants over there and is necessary that you try the Chile en Hogada.

593997746.name: very interesting
593997746.author: a TripAdvisor user
593997746.reviewBody: great place if you are looking to eat or drink something in one of the many cafes, or just relax and enjoy the view

593013043.name: Beautiful Historic Centre
593013043.author: a TripAdvisor user
593013043.reviewBody: What a lovely city square, surrounded by coffee shops, bars and restaurants. With the main cathedral on one side and old city hall on the other and mature trees in a park like setting, it is a classic layout. Recommended

592568890.name: it deserves a stop
592568890.author: a TripAdvisor user
592568890.reviewBody: Very nice area full of restaurants and bar. it s also a stop for many buses. I warmly recommend to stop for a drink in one of the bars with little terraces overlooking the zocalo. it s very crowded on Sundays. You can find 2 atms.

591786063.name: Enjoy
591786063.author: a TripAdvisor user
591786063.reviewBody: Enjoying  the z\u00f3calo, the people, the weather,  the smell. Overall a very nice square. Lots to see, just grab a chair, beer or juice and watch people. Feel save with all the police around.

589615014.name: Pure Puebla
589615014.author: a TripAdvisor user
589615014.reviewBody: The Zocalo is the heart of Puebla. Restaurants on three sides and the Basilica on the fourth.  In the middle is a park where everyone hangs out. Great people watching. Busy everyday, but really humming on the weekends; singles, kids, families, old folks.

588456589.name: Zocalo the heart of town
588456589.author: a TripAdvisor user
588456589.reviewBody: Do not miss it.  Lots of cafes and visitors.  The artisan shop is a must for viewing the many crafts of Puebla.  Good tourist office as well.  Walk from there into the neighborhoods.

588108784.name: Nice historical place, 2 must-visit places there
588108784.author: a TripAdvisor user
588108784.reviewBody: Nice historical place, 2 must-visit places there: the Cathedral of Puebla, the Palafoxian Library (accross the street).\nNice historical place, 2 must-visit places there: the Cathedral of Puebla, the Palafoxian Library (accross the street).\n

586563723.name: Bustling and beutiful
586563723.author: a TripAdvisor user
586563723.reviewBody: Puebla\'s Z\u00f3calo is beautiful and I retesting to visit. You have the tallest cathedral in america, and close by a very nice chapel as well. The pedestrian street right beside the z\u00f3calo is lines with beautiful trees that give the area a natual look that contrasts well with the buildings. \n\nIt\'s pretty safe as there are many police patrolling the area.

586038780.name: Peaceful and alive
586038780.author: a TripAdvisor user
586038780.reviewBody: I love Puebla because of its Zocalo. Shops and cafes in one corner. A cathedral in another corner and a live park in the middle.

583705730.name: Central Puebla and the zocalo are a treasure
583705730.author: a TripAdvisor user
583705730.reviewBody: The zocalo in puebla is busy and can be noisy but it is in good condition and represents a time when the center of town was where it was happening.  with the cathedral next door it ads a pleasant visual aspect of the visit.  lots of places to eat around and other activities, one can easily spend a half hour or more enjoying the scenery.

582652477.name: Bright, lively, green hub of Puebla Centro
582652477.author: a TripAdvisor user
582652477.reviewBody: The Z\u00f3calo in Puebla was lushly green & vibrant, but not particularly large compared to other z\u00f3calos I saw in Mexico. A continuous tide of local people strolled through it at night, being Christmas the park was beautifully decked out in an eye-catching display of brightly lit archways. The dazzling lights of the square nicely set off the towering Puebla Cathedral behind it, making the fortress-like structure look even more impressive & imposing. Great food options all sides of the Z\u00f3calo, including the best pasteleria (with real chocolate!) I found outside of Ideal Pasteleria in Mexico City  (opposite the Z\u00f3calo on Calle 16 de Septiembre).

582507276.name: The nicest plaza in our roadtrip
582507276.author: a TripAdvisor user
582507276.reviewBody: Great at any time of the day for people watching, strolling, enjoying the sun, the shade, the twilight...think you get the idea.

582089340.name: Wonderful Place
582089340.author: a TripAdvisor user
582089340.reviewBody: Wonderful Place in Puebla - Mexico. In the evening nice Music and chilled people. We loved it. A really good Place to Go!

581812682.name: Great central location for people watching and tourist-type activities.
581812682.author: a TripAdvisor user
581812682.reviewBody: I currently live in Puebla as part of my search for where I want to live in Mexico. The Zocalo has beautiful churches, museums (all free on Mondays,) restaurants for all palates (McDonalds and Burger King unfortunately are both located there), hotels for every pocket book, and is home to that fabulous PUEBLA sign that all tourists use as the backdrop for their photos. It is safe and very pretty. Be forewarned however, that you will rarely find English speakers in or near the Zocalo.  The Zocalo is also the gateway to many, many local handicraft stalls in many alleys. Just follow the crowds!

581709320.name: Historical City
581709320.author: a TripAdvisor user
581709320.reviewBody: Puebla is one of the most beautiful cities in Mexico. Puebla is a Colonial city. Downtown Puebla is full of colonial building, all of them, architectural jewels.\nPuebla\u00b4s Zocalo is the center point. There you can find the Cathedral, Goverment Palace, and meny other places.

581452838.name: Crowded green space
581452838.author: a TripAdvisor user
581452838.reviewBody: Very commercialized space surrounding the zocalo but it remains a lovely space to sit or to listen to music or view peerformers

581303064.name: A true Zocalo!
581303064.author: a TripAdvisor user
581303064.reviewBody: Was explained to us that this is a \u2018true\u2019 zocalo as it\u2019s 5 steps up and not level with the street. Beautiful and relaxed atmosphere... lots of shady spots to lounge around in. A must visit in Puebla.

580002305.name: Best people watching site ever!
580002305.author: a TripAdvisor user
580002305.reviewBody: The central squares in Mexican cities and towns are great places for observing the Mexican people and life in Mexico.  The zocalo in Puebla is large and shaded by beautiful trees and very clean.  It\'s a crossroads any day of the week but on Sundays it\'s a wonderful place to spend a couple of hours.  Full of people, families walking, music, balloon sellers, restaurants in the arcades across the street..What a great tradition!

579980173.name: Full of life
579980173.author: a TripAdvisor user
579980173.reviewBody: This is such a wonderful zocalo. Clean, full of energy and life. There are a number of musician and artists of all kinds. There are also many restaurants although we found the better restaurants are a street or 2 off the zocalo. But they are great outdoor areas to have a cocktail or coffee and do some people watching.  Lots of shopping and beautiful churches to visit as well. People are very kind.

577979217.name: Simply amazing
577979217.author: a TripAdvisor user
577979217.reviewBody: Words cannot describe the opulence and grandeur of a cathedral like this. It is such a pity that you can\u2019t take photos inside. Even at night it\u2019s grandeur doesn\u2019t disappoint.

577246823.name: Great for a walk
577246823.author: a TripAdvisor user
577246823.reviewBody: We enjoyed walking around the Zocalo in Puebla. There was a nice exhibit of Frida Kahlo photographed by Murray at the museum. The square is heavily used by the locals and one can grab a coffee or a bite to eat.

576647815.name: Antiguo y Moderno....
576647815.author: a TripAdvisor user
576647815.reviewBody: The Zocalo in Puebla is a pleasant mix of old and new. there are several good restaurants around the square. Also there are many good museums in the vicinity. I also recommend walking up the Avenue 5 de Mayo away from the Zocalo to get a taste of everyday life in Puebla.

576546963.name: The Heart of Puebla
576546963.author: a TripAdvisor user
576546963.reviewBody: A beautiful and vibrant park in the heart of the central historic district.  The grounds are well manicured and there always seems to be some kind of entertainment, from a street musician to a theater group.  There are several very nice sidewalk restaurants bordering the Zocalo.  One has a cream of cilantro soup that is the best I have ever had.

576073291.name: Magnificent Mexican Baroque
576073291.author: a TripAdvisor user
576073291.reviewBody: If in Puebla, a visit of the Cathedral de Puebla next to the Zocalo is well worth the time. It\u2019s awe inspiring magnificence is a testimony to the power of faith.

572562470.name: One of many big central squares
572562470.author: a TripAdvisor user
572562470.reviewBody: Look it\'s a nice place with lots of people in it, shops and restaurants surrounding it plus the usual church/cathedral etc. Also the tour buses lining up to take people for their loops around the city.\n\nYou\'ll end up there in most cases just to visit or do other things but don\'t make a special trip. While it\'s nice others in Mexico are better.

572221140.name: Somethings interesting in every direction
572221140.author: a TripAdvisor user
572221140.reviewBody: Aside from the towering shade trees in this large square next to the Puebla Cathedral, the z\u00f3calo is a great place to walk *around*. Try all four streets, stroll the arcades, try an icy sidral or spicy empanada, listen to a huapango or marimba band, hop on a tour bus and come back to this lively square for a great little supper of indigenous foods. We stayed in Puebla 3 weeks and never tired of this place!

570676061.name: A Beautiful Green Space in the Heart of Puebla
570676061.author: a TripAdvisor user
570676061.reviewBody: Unlike the ugly Plaza Galatia in Guadalajara the Zocalo is a park-like setting filled with beautiful trees and other plants, a lovely fountain, and plenty of benches.

570232115.name: Beautiful Cathedral and plaza in Puebla, Mexico
570232115.author: a TripAdvisor user
570232115.reviewBody: it\'s an amazing place to visit, with many buildings that are old and in great shape.  The Cathedral, the churches around it and the wonderful restaurants to take a break and eat great food.

568339455.name: People Watching Central
568339455.author: a TripAdvisor user
568339455.reviewBody: Like many Mexican city zocalos, this is an excellent place to watch people, make acquaintances, watch performers and street buskers, see salespeople ply their trade, eat all variety of snacks, partake of cafe life around the perimeter, or all of the above! Puebla\'s zocalo is no different. Here you can see typical Mexican public life in one of the oldest Mexican cities. This is a beautiful place to see and understand the cultural life of Puebla.

568178101.name: real Mexico
568178101.author: a TripAdvisor user
568178101.reviewBody: Yes there are plenty of tourists and tours that come to the zocolo - but if you watch closely you\'ll see much of Mexico happen in a zocolo.  As is frequently true, this one includes a church, lots of sidewalks, a music pavilion, plaza, lots of trees and small vendors.  It\'s surrounded by restaurants, shops and municipal buildings - many that have historical significance - some with plaques explaining their significance.  But watch for the details and you\'ll often see children, parades, families, poverty, working people as well as well-to-do persons .  Stop for a coffee/beer/margarita and listen to the various languages and guess the native people groups or origin of tourists.  Give generous tips and especially donate to destitute women and children.

567505092.name: Nice place to walk around and sit people watching.
567505092.author: a TripAdvisor user
567505092.reviewBody: As other Zocalos,it\'s green park and surrounded by numerous shopping and eating and a church. It\'s must do if you are visiting Puebla anyway.

566887289.name: Beautiful square and Cathedral in a city of churches
566887289.author: a TripAdvisor user
566887289.reviewBody: One of the many beautiful churches in Puebla City.  Really enjoyed walking around the church and square both day and night.

566375568.name: Nice place and echanting
566375568.author: a TripAdvisor user
566375568.reviewBody:
1. Nice place. 
2. Lots of hustle bustle., 
3. Nice places to eat. You get vegetarian food as well at some shops. you need to find the pizza shop which gives vegetarian food. 
4. Tour buses stands which takes you for the city tours. Nice and short. 
5. Lot of small toys for the kids are sold on the street. it makes it very good. 
6. Old and historic.

566354706.name: Busy place
566354706.author: a TripAdvisor user
566354706.reviewBody: Nice shady spot to get a feel for downtown. \nGood meeting place to get info, tour buses and talk to other tourists.

566101636.name: The most beautifully alive Zocalo!
566101636.author: a TripAdvisor user
566101636.reviewBody: Compared to the main squares in Guanajuato, San Miguel de Allende, Queretaro and Ciudad de Mexico, this is our favorite Zocalo. Bursting with life, surrounded by arched walkways (Portales), we easily spend hours watching the world go by. Not to be missed: a bronze model of the Centro Historico just outside the tourist info center.

565247814.name: Sunday Celebrations in the Zocalo
565247814.author: a TripAdvisor user
565247814.reviewBody: We were in Puebla on a Sunday and saw all the excitement and celebration the people were showing. Families crowded the area, balloons, food, music, spontaneous dancing!!! What a treat!

564860774.name: Beautiful Beautiful Beautiful
564860774.author: a TripAdvisor user
564860774.reviewBody: Of course, no one would visit Puebla without seeing the Zocalo (main square). Wander and enjoy -- eat at the surrounding streetside restaurants. This is almost a no-brainer. Don\'t miss it.

563043541.name: The Main plaza or gatheering location of a Mexican city, Zocalo
563043541.author: a TripAdvisor user
563043541.reviewBody: On our trip to central Mexico we had the pleasure of visiting 3 of the main cities in this region.  We learned that all of these places have many things in common. Number one is that all have a main gathering or central place, usually located with a beautiful church nearby. In other words the Zocalo. Very lively place to visit and always a lot of local atmosphere to go around.

562999362.name: Mexican Bourbon Street
562999362.author: a TripAdvisor user
562999362.reviewBody: If you like to walk, eat, sight-see, party and people watch....this is the place. A great area of historic value, bars, hotels and restaurants abound. Heavy police presence so safety concerns are at a minimum. A definite must if you find yourself in the area.

562598883.name: Stunning
562598883.author: a TripAdvisor user
562598883.reviewBody: We made a day trip to Puebla and picked the Zocalo as our first stop. Soon enough we got to know that one day is not sufficient for Puebla by any means. You need to stay at least for a night here to enjoy the beauty. A day trip from Mexico City isn\u2019t enough! The Zocalo is the place to experience it all in the old town of Puebla. The two basilicas are stunning beyond thought. Another fun activity is people watching. Take your time and wander around in the narrow streets and enjoy the colorful architecture and snack around while walking. This trip to Puebla was worth it and if I make it here second time, I will stay for one night for sure.

562342304.name: Very cute and worth a stroll
562342304.author: a TripAdvisor user
562342304.reviewBody: I visited the Zocalo on an afternoon stroll during a business trip.  Very green with ample historic markers in english.

561812111.name: Lot of things to see - Lot of History
561812111.author: a TripAdvisor user
561812111.reviewBody: This is a nice touristic place. I love the buildings and their history. In this area, one can find very good museums, a lot of churches, nice coffee places and nice places where to buy traditional candies among other things. On weekends there are tons of people and musicians playing music on the streets (there were some pretty good ones!)\nI have the feeling it is a safe place (obviously paying attention to your surroundings as one would do in any city).

560497329.name: Beautiful with lots of activity.
560497329.author: a TripAdvisor user
560497329.reviewBody: Plaza in the historical center of Puebla, surrounded by the cathedral, restaurants, cafes, banks.  Groups of musicians on surrounding sidewalks.  Great people watching

559432568.name: Bustling heart of the city with many attractions and restaurants.
559432568.author: a TripAdvisor user
559432568.reviewBody: The zocalo (central plaza) is a busy place which incorporates the cathedral and city hall. It is surrounded by restaurants and we suggest having breakfast or lunch on one of the first floor balconies overlooking the plaza to take in all activities below. Several museums and attractions are within short walking distance. City tour buses depart next to the cathedral. The city tour lasts well over one hour and is an excellent way to visit the attractions farther away from the city core, where you can hop on and off at the various locations. On weekends and holidays the plaza invariably hosts musicians and performers. A visit to Puebla is not complete without having experienced the central plaza!

558910768.name: Our first visit to the Square
558910768.author: a TripAdvisor user
558910768.reviewBody: We came from CHOLULA on the new light rail. A fun trip but the train seems underused.  Fifty pesos to take a cab to the Zocalo.  Mexican city squares are always fun with all the families, balloon sellers and a lot of action. The tourist office is across the park from the cathedral, so you can get a free downtown map.

558585458.name: One of the nicest in Mexico
558585458.author: a TripAdvisor user
558585458.reviewBody:
A really large and beautiful square surrounded by nice buildings, cafes and restaurants.

There is a real buzz about the place until late in the evening.

We were lucky enough to see a parade when we were there.  Excellent !

558170738.name: Ideal place to hang out!!
558170738.author: a TripAdvisor user
558170738.reviewBody: Restaurants, bars, coffee shops and more you can find there... great place to hang around and chill.\n\nat night you can even have the chance to hear some mariachis playing in the restaurants near by. Also there is a tourist information office

557764006.name: Mexico at its best
557764006.author: a TripAdvisor user
557764006.reviewBody: The Zocalo is a great place to people watch and take in the culture of Mexico. The square has shops and restaurants on three sides and the Cathedral on the fourth. The square proper is usually filled with families, musicians and street vendors. While working in Puebla for the month, I would go there most days for lunch or dinner. Security is very good. There are always multiple police walking the street.

557593332.name: Very nice
557593332.author: a TripAdvisor user
557593332.reviewBody: A very nice public square with a lot of history. Free wifi is available here, which makes it a nice place to sit and watch the crowds.

555956925.name: Lots of fun ! You can shop till you drop.
555956925.author: a TripAdvisor user
555956925.reviewBody: 9 of us enjoyed our trip to Taxco. We enjoyed the zocalo with its shopping, bar hopping and enjoying the restaurantes. People were friendly and never felt any concerns for safety. Lots of music and activities.

555881290.name: One of the places people needs to know
555881290.author: a TripAdvisor user
555881290.reviewBody: In my personal opinion this is one of the places that you need to know and take some time to walk around and know it\'s history. During the day or night, enjoy it during the weekends and during the night know the legends.

555747653.name: Great place
555747653.author: a TripAdvisor user
555747653.reviewBody: Typical square in Mexico. Full of people with fountains and alit of activity. The Basilica is on one side and shops under porticos on the others. Good place to start a walking. tour.

555620211.name: Exploring with friends
555620211.author: a TripAdvisor user
555620211.reviewBody: Took a trip to Puebla Mexico with friends recently and the zocalo was our absolute favorite. Street vendors, great restaurants and tons of great shopping. We were able to get lots of typical candies, few outfits and some fun jewelry. Can\u2019t wait to go back this summer!

555066238.name: Central Park of Puebla
555066238.author: a TripAdvisor user
555066238.reviewBody: Zocalo is the Central Park of city of Puebla.\nFrom there you can have access to Catedral of Puebla with magnificent decoration and municipal.\nAnd from there, you can enjoy buses go round City of Puebla.

554832262.name: Amazing part of CDMX
554832262.author: a TripAdvisor user
554832262.reviewBody: I stayed in a hostel in Zocalo.I used to go ther every night and do people watching.It was during Christmas time and the Zocalo was decorated very nicely.It was full of people people people.Lot of restaurants and shops also.Very vibrant part.Safe also.

554239703.name: Heart beat of historical Mexico
554239703.author: a TripAdvisor user
554239703.reviewBody:
So much to see around Zocalo and it’s the launching pad for many other places. Surrounded on all four sides by iconic buildings, you can easily spend a couple of hours exploring. 
At Christmas and other important events it becomes the central meeting point for people to celebrate. 
There are plenty of jewellery shops with restaurants above on one side who haggle to get you into their stores / cafes. Annoying. 
This is also a good starting point down some of the more popular shopping streets in
Mexico. 
Historically the place is a blend of old and new which at time contradicts itself and other times complements it. 
Watch the traffic as it seems to come at you from all directions. 
Wheelchair friendly. Kid friendly.

553234496.name: Lots of action
553234496.author: a TripAdvisor user
553234496.reviewBody: Great place tp relax and people watch. Although quite small, it has lots of things surrounding it so there is a continual stream of people coming and going.\n\nOne side features a row of restaurants with tables in the shade.

552624081.name: Amazing symbol of Spanish catholic influence
552624081.author: a TripAdvisor user
552624081.reviewBody: Would recommend visiting in order to see the impact of influence from both Spanish and catholic spheres.

551525428.name: Beautiful
551525428.author: a TripAdvisor user
551525428.reviewBody: This plaza has a ton of Resteraunts.  The cathedral is massive. It is also a nice place to relax and people watch.  And get your shoes shined.

551363987.name: Magical, beautiful, at least during the holidays.
551363987.author: a TripAdvisor user
551363987.reviewBody:
A truly gorgeous park to visit day or night.  Relatively small for the number of people who walk around and enjoy some outside time.   We were there during the Christmas season, and it was full of lights, people, music... I absolutely fell in love with the place,  it was great time to be there.   We could have walked around the park for hours and discover new performers, food vendors, new sights, new places to relax and people watch.  There are some many restaurants surrounding the zocalo, but I didn't have a chance to try any of them.

Tip:  Bring lots of small cash and reward the excellent musicians around the zocalo. 

I plan to go back one day and I hope that the park is as festive as when I saw it.

Final Note:  Safety is always a big concern to us, and we felt very safe walking around at night in the zocalo and surrounding streets (although didn't see it after 11 pm).  Lots of family, foreign tourists, etc.

547918511.name: Lovely central park, especially at the holidays
547918511.author: a TripAdvisor user
547918511.reviewBody: This is really a lovely park surrounded on three side by arcaded buildings and on the south by the Cathedral. It is especially beautiful at night during the holiday season with all the decorations and lights. There were throngs of people taking pictures or just strolling around.

546129712.name: A meeting place
546129712.author: a TripAdvisor user
546129712.reviewBody: The space is the heart of Centro Historico. On three sides are  coffee shops and restaurants, the fourth side is the Catedral de Puebla. There are various sculptures, walking paths, benches and vendors. Right now it is decorated for Christmas - lots of blue and white lights in the z\u00f3cola and on the adjacent buildings. A very popular spot to people watch, relax or enjoy the view.

545651655.name: The soul of the city
545651655.author: a TripAdvisor user
545651655.reviewBody: This area is very crowded and a bit overwhelming. SO many people and things happening, aztec dancers, healers, protesters, giant police presence with big guns, families on holiday, museum goers, lost tourists (like us) and everyone else you can imagine. They hold big events here, Ricky Martin was performing for free here when we were here, for instance, which we didn\'t stick around for. But everyone including the police was friendly to us. I kind of think if you didn\'t see this at least once during your visit, you didn\'t really see the city.

542744092.name: typical zocalo
542744092.author: a TripAdvisor user
542744092.reviewBody: its a typical zocalo (central square) in Mexico. you definitely need to spend some time here and the roads around the centtral square

541619712.name: Beautiful!
541619712.author: a TripAdvisor user
541619712.reviewBody: Great city to explore, took the tour bus of the city and its quite intriguing as to its history, loved the tip of the city it takes you too and you can see it almost all of it!

539795246.name: Loving Peubla!
539795246.author: a TripAdvisor user
539795246.reviewBody: Loved the Zocalo in  Peubla, so much color and things happening, people dancing impromptu during the day, children blowing bubbles, old men selling huge bunches of balloons all surrounded by great cafes and restaurants.  At the front stands the imposing Cathedral.  Spent lovely days and nights there!

538625578.name: Amazing Zocalo
538625578.author: a TripAdvisor user
538625578.reviewBody: Very traditional and well maintained zocalo. There are lots of small stalls and restaurants to enjoy. I felt very safe walking around there, definitely check it out if you are in Puebla. My only issue would be with the parking, it can be difficult to find somewhere but if you look around you will eventually!

538182994.name: Wonderful Centro Historico.
538182994.author: a TripAdvisor user
538182994.reviewBody: One of Mexico\u2019s most important Colonial cities, Puebla is not touristy. It helps understand how different each Colonial City is from any other.

536448534.name: A must when in Puebla
536448534.author: a TripAdvisor user
536448534.reviewBody: This place is the center of downtown Puebla, full of interesting things to visit and restaurants to eat. This place gives you the right perspective of Puebla city

536296359.name: A People Watching Paradise
536296359.author: a TripAdvisor user
536296359.reviewBody: The zocalo in Puebla seems active all hours of the day and night. It pulses with activity in a laid back sort of way.

528602603.name: Beautiful
528602603.author: a TripAdvisor user
528602603.reviewBody: Amazing historical cathedral , very rich in paints, take the tour so you can learn about it, and then enjoy the main square, so nice to drink a coffee and enjoy the unique ambiance

521050586.name: Beautiful place to visit!
521050586.author: a TripAdvisor user
521050586.reviewBody: Puebla has invested in tourism and so it\'s Zocalo (historic center) is very much alive with restaurants and commerce. Even at night the cathedral lights up and a light projection show for the family begins. Free guides are there to promote the city and its cultural heritage. We are so impressed, we\'d go back in a heart beat!

514876390.name: Super nice!
514876390.author: a TripAdvisor user
514876390.reviewBody: My wife, 2 kids and I went on a backpacking trip and were really impressed by Puebla! Everything is clean, well organized. People are friendly and the place seems to be very safe also. The cathedral, the park in front and the surrounding colonial style streets just look amazing,  we are already planning a trip back as there is lots of things to do there also!

511311020.name: can\'t miss it...
511311020.author: a TripAdvisor user
511311020.reviewBody: ... the square is the center of town... from there, everything is easily accessible by walking or strolling...

507596419.name: Beautiful!
507596419.author: a TripAdvisor user
507596419.reviewBody: Beautiful zocalo with lots of choices of restaurants and surrounded of historic buildings. The cathedral is there and it is a "must" , you have to visit. In the zocalo you can grab different buses that offer tours thru the city and nearby towns such as Cholula. We took a tour of the city of Puebla and another tour to the nearby city of Cholula which were both excellent.  Our last day in Puebla we had breakfast at the balcony of one of the restaurants overlooking the Zocalo early in the morning, beautiful, very serene, excellent way to start the day.

507375610.name: Interesting and Worth a Visit
507375610.author: a TripAdvisor user
507375610.reviewBody: Zocalo is an interesting place to visit for the architecture and layout of the square.  There is a fountain in the center and you are surrounded by brightly colored umbrellas on all sides from various restaurants.  The landscape of the square is beautiful.  This being said, crowds are drawn to this area as well as tourist buses.  The buses tend to obstruct the view at times but this is just part of this area.  It\'s worth one visit but, if you don\'t like crowds, that might be the only visit.

506745028.name: Beautiful town square!
506745028.author: a TripAdvisor user
506745028.reviewBody: Very well maintained and clean! A lovely place to people watch. Fun for families and visitors. Very safe and fun!

502341631.name: Lovely atmosphere, a nice place to chill.
502341631.author: a TripAdvisor user
502341631.reviewBody: You will probably walk through here numerous times while walking around Puebla, it has such a great atmosphere and is even nicer in the evenings when all the buildings are lit and people are out and about!

497998853.name: The Happening Place
497998853.author: a TripAdvisor user
497998853.reviewBody: I absolutely love this area ,there\'s always something going on... great shopping ,dining , bars.. you name it!!   It is always fun here in the city centre and it\'s a beautiful area as well!! Don\'t hesitate to go here and just hang out for the day. One of the many famous cathedrals is also there. One of the BEST places to just go hang out in Puebla!

497918052.name: Very charming Zocalo and town in general, the weather is very nice.
497918052.author: a TripAdvisor user
497918052.reviewBody: The Zocalo is charming and has a great coffee shop we enjoyed the Zocalo very much. Consider getting a shoe shine is perfect.

497786949.name: Nice!
497786949.author: a TripAdvisor user
497786949.reviewBody: It\'s a very good area, better than I expect, safe clean and beautiful that you should not miss if you are in Puebla!

492299870.name: Great church
492299870.author: a TripAdvisor user
492299870.reviewBody: If you visit Puebla you should visit this Church.\nThe patio has a great new of the to Towers and if you go inside you have to see the organ

488662038.name: Zocalo in Puebla
488662038.author: a TripAdvisor user
488662038.reviewBody: There is apparently only one Zocalo in Mexico and that is the one in Mexico City. This version is very nice though - lots of trees for shade and interesting art works. There are plenty of seats, but we never found one that was in the shade and unoccupied - always plenty going on and very close to a number of good restaurants

488589257.name: Lovely, vibrant city square.
488589257.author: a TripAdvisor user
488589257.reviewBody: Best time to visit is in may.\nFelt like there was something always going on. Food, music, something to drink, and beautiful buildings

488218362.name: One of the most beautiful Z\u00f3calo\'s in Mexico!
488218362.author: a TripAdvisor user
488218362.reviewBody: We have visited the Z\u00f3calo in Puebla many times over the last years. The Z\u00f3calo from Puebla is simply one of the most beautiful Z\u00f3calo\'s in Mexico! The cathedral and the buildings with arcaded sidewalks give it a historic atmosphere. The restaurants at the Z\u00f3calo are not very special but it is nice to sit down there and just watch. \nAlso the UNESCO world heritage old city center is worth a visit. Just go there!

487829753.name: Beautiful
487829753.author: a TripAdvisor user
487829753.reviewBody: There is always something new at the Z\u00f3calo whenever you go. Nice to have a walk around and take pictures

485796550.name: cozy but active. we love it.
485796550.author: a TripAdvisor user
485796550.reviewBody: zocalo is not that big and lots of restaurants, municipal and iglesia were surounded. it makes really cozy but colorful and exciting atmosphere.

481262973.name: Great
481262973.author: a TripAdvisor user
481262973.reviewBody: Everything was calmful and peaceful I was really happy I went to the cathedral and I ate at mural De los poblanos

481066767.name: Stunning
481066767.author: a TripAdvisor user
481066767.reviewBody: This may be the prettiest zocalo in Mexico.  It\'s surrounded by great buildings and filled with life.

478102603.name: Mexico at its best.
478102603.author: a TripAdvisor user
478102603.reviewBody: The Zocola and the Church are must do\'s. We started and ended everyday there. Shops, street vendors coffee shops and upscale resturants. The restaurants were a little $$ but go a block or two any direction and prices drop and places get a little more quint.\nLots of street food options in the midday.

478071162.name: Pretty great
478071162.author: a TripAdvisor user
478071162.reviewBody: Busy, happy Zocalo. The views of the church etc. are amazing. Not too many street food options (my fav) but plenty of restaurants. I sat on a bench to eat an enourmous torta and got up and left my kindle sitting on the bench... came running back 5 minutes later to find it still there so very greatful to either the level of honesty or the sheer luck of the situation. You honestly can\'t not visit this place.

477796239.name: Beautiful
477796239.author: a TripAdvisor user
477796239.reviewBody: The church and the square are beautiful. There are many coffee shops and restaurants in the area to visit and eat at. A must if visiting puebla.

477792091.name: Nice visit
477792091.author: a TripAdvisor user
477792091.reviewBody: Huge square filled with trees, historic buildings and restaurants. Try one of the nice terraces around the square.

476525059.name: A great place to visit
476525059.author: a TripAdvisor user
476525059.reviewBody: It is fun to visit the Zocalo, to eat at one of the restaurants, enjoy the music and watch the world go by.  Especially on Sundays, families are there enjoying themselves.

476156147.name: Simply awesome
476156147.author: a TripAdvisor user
476156147.reviewBody: I was there during Easter, and even it was quite crowded, I found it as very magical place. You can just sit and watch what\'s going on around you for hours. You can find there lots of cafe\'s and restaurants around. It has very beautiful atmosphere...\nFrom Zocalo, you can also take all tourist buses.

475683206.name: Lovely evening atmosphere!
475683206.author: a TripAdvisor user
475683206.reviewBody: What a lovely square and it is so great to see it brimming with activity.  Very safe environment, lots of families, couples, etc. eating dinner, walking around and shopping.  It was Avery happy and pleasant place to go to and only a block fro. Where I\'m staying!

475343080.name: A Great Place to Hang Out
475343080.author: a TripAdvisor user
475343080.reviewBody: Hang out IN the zocalo park, buy balloons, pass the time of day, maybe hear some musicians. Or cross the streets and visit restaurants, bars, historical sites -- you are in the heart of Puebla. My only complaint is that McDonalds opened a branch a few years ago right on the zocalo. In fairness, they provided a bunch of jobs for local teens -- and attracted (of course) a slew of visiting American college students. Bleah.

474813886.name: Where Life Happens
474813886.author: a TripAdvisor user
474813886.reviewBody: Center of town great for people watching, learning about political protests, surrounded by awesome restaurants, participating in fun physical exercises....  But the best by far is Sundays at noon when the municipal symphony orchestra plays on the square and people dance the tango.  You can as well.

474716711.name: A cool shady place to sit and survey the sights, sounds, smells and people of a Pueblo Magico.
474716711.author: a TripAdvisor user
474716711.reviewBody:
I have been visiting the zocalo off and on for fifteen years. I enjoy the opportunity to sit outside, have a coffee and read a book in the middle of winter. Sometimes I have even written letters to the folks back home to describe my experience because it really is so unique for an ex-Brit used to long cold winters in central Canada.

Topolino's is a great spot for a super cup of coffee and a view of the never-ending perambulations of people from all walks of life. The flirtatious young people provide never-ending entertainment as they vie for each others attention while they circulate in opposite directions around the heavily treed square. The many tiled benches offer a shady resting place for the older set and mothers with sleepy little ones.

The nicely restored kiosk in the middle of the park also provides excellent coffee, as well as a variety of snacks and other delicious drinks, thanks to the resident Italian Coffee Company cafe. The upper level patio area around the bandstand offers superlative views of the park, its attractive gardens and the surrounding buildings.

In my estimation, a perfect spot to cuddle up to your loved one, enjoy a chat with a friend or simply sit in quiet contemplation of the world around you.

473962909.name: Delightful Space to Relax
473962909.author: a TripAdvisor user
473962909.reviewBody: Like most Mexican towns, Puebla has a lovely town square, where you can stroll and relax. Worth some of your visiting time.

472426868.name: Very Nice place to walk around
472426868.author: a TripAdvisor user
472426868.reviewBody: I think it is the best zocalo in Mexico, very nice, you can walk around and find very nice buildings, in a very good shape, clean, full of life, a lot of museums and churches to visit just one or two blocks away, Little cafes and restaurants

472225003.name: It\'s a nice walk
472225003.author: a TripAdvisor user
472225003.reviewBody:
The walk around the main plaza is really nice . There's a lot of restaurants, a Dalí rain, a sculpture, and the basilica . 
The people are nice and you can always find something to do and to shop. 
The only thing is, there's a lot of street vendors that clash with the beautiful scenery. 
However is a must even if your trip is a short one.

471532980.name: Z\u00f3calo
471532980.author: a TripAdvisor user
471532980.reviewBody: Pueblas Main Square is a charming well kept park and public space. \nFull of life and color it is good place to sit and watch people passing by and take the temperature of a beautiful Mexican town.

469425628.name: Best Zocalo in all of Mexico!!!
469425628.author: a TripAdvisor user
469425628.reviewBody:
From the 350+ year old Puebla Cathedral to the nearby Palacio Municipal de Puebla (city hall building) - all of which surrounds a beautiful, tree-covered central park - I would like to proclaim that Puebla's Zocalo is the best city square in all of Mexico! 

Even if you prefer El Zocalo in Mexico City (and rightfully so, considering their own superb National Cathedral, National Palace, and the two Federal District buildings, along with a large, open city square able to hold tens of thousands of people), this gathering space in Puebla reigns supreme in my eyes as it is the perfect place to gather on a Sunday morning or afternoon. 

The streets and workplace are closed on this traditional day of rest, as Mexican culture remains a family-orientated society. And where do they choose to spend family time? Right here, and in the local street markets! This isn't just a place where tourists flock. No, the locals and their children are here in massive numbers! It's a very kid-friendly environment, with street performances and food and people dressed in large Disney character costumes engaging with the crowd. Day or night, this is the place to be!!! (Oh, and enjoy the Zocalo when the lights are turned on in the evening! Go to a Sunday night mass at the Cathedral, have a bite to eat, and simply enjoy the lights and laughter!) iAmo Puebla!

469160868.name: Beautiful Zocalo
469160868.author: a TripAdvisor user
469160868.reviewBody: I found the Zocalo de Puebla to be one of the most beautiful Zocalos in all of Mexico. Surrounded by beautiful buildings and next to the stunning Puebla Cathedral, it is a lovely place to visit at any time of day or night. I visited the Zocalo every day of my trip to Puebla. You can easily catch a tour bus from here and its near all of the attractions of the centro historico.

468305270.name: relaxing
468305270.author: a TripAdvisor user
468305270.reviewBody: Walking in Zocalo plaza is great and relaxing, you can find food, coffee, ice cream, and see the most beautiful plaza in Mexico

468290348.name: Loved it!!!
468290348.author: a TripAdvisor user
468290348.reviewBody: I love history, I love this amazing place....makes me feel like going back in time....really beautiful

467935059.name: A park for residents and tourists alike.
467935059.author: a TripAdvisor user
467935059.reviewBody: This large park in the center of the historical district is a must see, or should I say, a must enjoy.  When you\'re ready to stop for a breather from all the walking, or just want to people watch on a bench in the shade of large trees, the Zocalo has it all.  A classic large fountain, restaurants that ring the streets, balloon sales people that are hidden under their load of inflated, colorful balloons. I miss it already. \n

465315053.name: Very small for size of city
465315053.author: a TripAdvisor user
465315053.reviewBody: Beautiful zocolo, but surprisingly small considering the size of the city. Great people watching. The restaurants around it are very touristy, although offering local dishes. Enjoy the park for what it is, but venture a few blocks away for better food. Don\'t miss the Cathedral on the corner. ( you can\'t miss it)!  The entire zocolo is surrounded by beautiful architectural gems.

464375432.name: Nice z\u00f3calo but DONT EAT HERE
464375432.author: a TripAdvisor user
464375432.reviewBody: The z\u00f3calo is beautiful and it is nicely maintained although quite busy. Sadly, there are many tourist buses parked here but that is a reality in any Mexican city. We had breakfast at one of the restaurants on the portales and the food was terrible, service shameful and so overpriced! That was our most expensive and worst meal in all of Puebla. You will have a much better meal anywhere else I\'m sure.

463329464.name: Holiday
463329464.author: a TripAdvisor user
463329464.reviewBody: The zocalo was outstanding, the different restaurants were very accommodating. While visiting we spent every night at the Zocalo, watching the buskers, having coffee or having drinks. There is a lot to do in the nearby streets including day markets.

462505997.name: Surprisingly small
462505997.author: a TripAdvisor user
462505997.reviewBody: Compared to most Mexican cities of this size, the zocala feels quite small.  Mostly outdoor cafe\'s surround it with a nice green space at the center..There is a very beautiful church on one corner that should not be missed.  A street just off of it is pedestrian and quite interesting.  It actually seemed to be more active then the actual square.

460893168.name: Nice Zocalo
460893168.author: a TripAdvisor user
460893168.reviewBody: The Zocalo of Puebla is nice, but it has changed over the years.  A few years ago it did not have that many Tourist buses so it was more like a real city Zocalo. Now it is packed with Tourist Buses which make the city seem a little fake.

460813847.name: Great Place!
460813847.author: a TripAdvisor user
460813847.reviewBody: The Zocalo was a magnificent place to snag a coffee and relax in Puebla.  Superb photography opportunities abound with the church and the artwork.  Very nice!

460101254.name: Puebla Zocalo!
460101254.author: a TripAdvisor user
460101254.reviewBody: The Zocalo is very busy but accessible! We went several times to eat, and to buy some traditional candy. We also took the puebla bus tour which was excellent!

459633396.name: Amaizing!!!
459633396.author: a TripAdvisor user
459633396.reviewBody: The cathedral of the city, imposing and wonderful, place to feel in peace and to admire its architectural beauty.

459160175.name: Great Space, Lovely archetecture.
459160175.author: a TripAdvisor user
459160175.reviewBody: We love going to the zocalo.  Great tip: On the Zocalo there is a McDonalds and, you can get up to the terrace for a great view for the price of a coffee or an ice-cream.  :)

457982649.name: Warm and friendly
457982649.author: a TripAdvisor user
457982649.reviewBody: It\'s so wonderful to see people out and enjoying each other\'s company and the beautiful day. It\'s a great place to relax and people watch.

454531184.name: Not to be missed, even if you wanted to
454531184.author: a TripAdvisor user
454531184.reviewBody: The Zocalo is literally in the center of town and in the center of local life. Puebla\'s street grid system is centered there. It\'s an appropriate and inevitable starting and/or ending place for any downtown touring. The square is always filled with people and vendors. It is surrounded on three sides by cafes perfect for people watching and a restorative, although the view from those on the west side is partially blocked by parked hop on/hop off buses. There are a half dozen or so major sites, including the extraordinary cathedral, either on or just off the square and dozens of excellent restaurants nearby.

453484614.name: Picturesque center of a picturesque city
453484614.author: a TripAdvisor user
453484614.reviewBody: The zocalo is a great place to start your exploration of Puebla.  It\'s a pretty and relaxing square with fountains, trees, statues, etc.  The official tourist office is across the street and the cathedral is on the other side.  There are dozens of churches, museums, and markets within just a few blocks.

453362431.name: Everything in one spot
453362431.author: a TripAdvisor user
453362431.reviewBody: The Zocalo had great views, great restaurants, access to shopping and local commerce, connections with locals, museums, the tourism and tour offices, beautiful cathedrals, and all of the city tours left from that location. It was an excellent place to know what was happening in the city.

453148421.name: A fantastic Zocalo
453148421.author: a TripAdvisor user
