453148421.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful in Mexico. Plenty to eat, see, people watch. Interestingly, the square is on the side of the church. There are lots of pretty streets around Puebla. Find a walking map online and spend a couple of hours walking around.

452933409.name: day and night- need 2 visits
452933409.author: a TripAdvisor user
452933409.reviewBody: You must come here both during the day and night. Find a cafe or bar an watch Puebla life walk by.  The Zocalo really lights up at night

452848296.name: the heart of Puebla
452848296.author: a TripAdvisor user
452848296.reviewBody: The cathedral with the tallest towers in America. It is a treasure keeping treasures. This is definitely A MUST

452586172.name: A Jewel of a City
452586172.author: a TripAdvisor user
452586172.reviewBody:
We just spent 4 days in this historic colonial city.  Without a doubt, Pueblo has to be one of the most beautiful cities in all of Mexico!  We have been to about 20 colonial cities in this country over the years and few of them can top Pueblo for the beauty, the culture, the food and the ease of the people.

The Zocalo is one of the nicest that we have seen with all of the buildings in very good condition.  The lighting at night is something to be seen and enjoyed either walking around the park or simply sitting on a bench and watching the world go by. The Cathedral lit up at night is not to be missed if you like Colonial architecture.

The streets are very clean and not overly crowded  and I felt very safe at all times, day or night. Restaurants are many and varied with some very tasty food for quite reasonable prices.  A bargain of a City! Enough to do both inside the City and the surrounding area to keep you busy for 3-4 days easily. And an added bonus for us was that there didn't seem to be a lot of "Norte Americanos"  wandering around which tells me that this city is still somewhat undiscovered, which is so much the better.

Even though we have been traveling in Mexico for the past 20+ years, this was our first trip to Puebla, but it won't be our last! Don't miss this jewel.

450038427.name: A magical city
450038427.author: a TripAdvisor user
450038427.reviewBody: So much to do in Puebla , you really need a whole weekend to explore .. \nso much history , amazing restaurants and I suggest to all to get on the double decker bus and take a city tour ... \nDon\'t forget to try the mole in Puebla and get some beautiful pottery ...

449893026.name: this is another treat for the eyes
449893026.author: a TripAdvisor user
449893026.reviewBody: I loved Puebla with its colonial style, wonderful food, and sighseeings. Cholula\'s Pyramids (no so much for the church) and surroundings (the tunnels and so) are worth the trip.  If you are in the area or even in Mexico city and have a day to spend, go to Puebla, you won\'t regret it!...

449750463.name: A short walk from our hotel, Casareyna
449750463.author: a TripAdvisor user
449750463.reviewBody: A great place to visit and easily reached by walking. Lovely architecture and great places to visit.

448707971.name: Mexican joie-de-vivre summarized in a square
448707971.author: a TripAdvisor user
448707971.reviewBody: Go there, look around, sit on a bench, spend some time in a coffeeshop, enjoy the views, the cathedral, people gathering to enjoy life.

447181012.name: night experience
447181012.author: a TripAdvisor user
447181012.reviewBody: Very beautiful  place most wonderful at night with its lighting affects \nI really like the Puebla zocalo! for impressive colonial architecture and historic feel with a modern day atmosphere. Great food a wide variety of eating options at all levels and costs. The scenery is beautiful with the Cathedral Basilica being the main feature.\nThere was so much to do we couldn\'t fit it all into our schedule. I recommend get there early and take the 1hr tour of the city. There are many areas were you can sit enjoy coffee, ice cream and drinks. We love Puebla.

446940122.name: GREAT AREA TO VISIT IN PUEBLA
446940122.author: a TripAdvisor user
446940122.reviewBody: With the help and guidance of friends from Mexico City we discovered this beautiful old colonial city and its Zocalo (city center.) What a beautiful area. There is much to see and do. You will not be disappointed.

446763688.name: People watching mecca
446763688.author: a TripAdvisor user
446763688.reviewBody: We passed through this square many times during the day and at night and it was always a busy place. It seemed to be a big destination for families. It was well lit for Christmas and people watching was the main activity.

444275923.name: Beautiful plaza in the old town
444275923.author: a TripAdvisor user
444275923.reviewBody: A picturesque small town square surrounded by beautiful, colonial buildings, and also the Cathedral and the theatre. There are plenty of restaurants and coffe bars all round the plaza. The plaza itself has large, shady trees and places to sit and watch people walking by

443324723.name: A happening place!
443324723.author: a TripAdvisor user
443324723.reviewBody: We have just returned from a week\'s visit to Puebla during which we were in, around and through the Zocalo several times. There is always a lot going on here. As are many of the Zocalos in Mexico, it is surrounded by restaurants, cafes and tourist shops all of which seem to be doing a booming business. We had the added benefit of being there in December when it, along with all of the Puebla Centro area is beautifully lit up. Of course the cathedral is also right there and the Bibliotheque and Amparo Museum all of which are must visits. If you are in Puebla, you will not want to miss the opportunity to just sit and observe some of the activities. It is, after all, the heart of the city.

442643497.name: A big flat piece of pavement
442643497.author: a TripAdvisor user
442643497.reviewBody: So on most days, the Zocalo is just a big flat nothing with cars running around and beautiful buildings surrounding it.  But get there at the right time of year, and it turns into a spectacular spot.  When we were there in late November, they were building all sorts of structures for Christmas fun, including what looked like a ski run.  There was also a plastic, or metal, Christmas tree well over 100 feet tall and beautifully decorated.

440222105.name: Happening!
440222105.author: a TripAdvisor user
440222105.reviewBody:
There's a bus to Zocalo from the big bus terminal you arrived in, if you arrived by bus. It's 6 pesos, and takes about 20 minutes (in traffic)

It's a typical Zocalo of a Mexican city; architecture, museums, restaurants, and hostels/hotels are all within a 15 minute walk!

440033138.name: Fun, Friendly, artistic, historic and cultural feel
440033138.author: a TripAdvisor user
440033138.reviewBody:
I really like the Puebla zocalo! it keeps an historic feel with a modern day atmosphere. Fantastic food options, great for a morning coffee to start your day, lunch, and a spectacular backdrop for dinner. A wide variety of eating options at all levels and costs. 
this is a personal favourite for people watching! 
The streets are closed off in the day allowing enthusiastic street performers, markets and other activity to thrive.

The scenery is beautiful with the Cathedral Basilica being the main feature.

If your into "ballots" this is a must hahah, I've never seen so many wild, whacky and style of balloons! Though its a tourist mecca (mostly domestic) there is a feeling of fun and very safe area to enjoy.

439396749.name: impressive architecture, genuine mexican experience
439396749.author: a TripAdvisor user
439396749.reviewBody: if you are looking for impressive colonial architecture, combined with a very genuine mexican experience, including many shops and local tourists, this is a great place to visit.  We stayed right  across the street at la alhondiga for a very resasonable rate even though they aren\'t found here on tripadvisor

437467293.name: Beautiful
437467293.author: a TripAdvisor user
437467293.reviewBody: Lovely by day or night. We enjoyed dance, music, and theater in the two nights that we spent visiting the Zocalo. There was so much going on we couldn\'t fit it all into our schedule.

436725076.name: Charming/ Encantador
436725076.author: a TripAdvisor user
436725076.reviewBody: Zocalo was a fun very vibrant place to visit and walk around, full of life, street vendors and Mexico\'s wonderful color and people. Very busy, quite touristy but worth visiting.\n\nMe encant\u00f3 caminar por el Zocalo de Puebla, esta lleno de color y vida, un poco comercial y tur\u00edstico, pero cale la pena conocer.

435589468.name: Great experience at Zocalo
435589468.author: a TripAdvisor user
435589468.reviewBody:
We visited Zocalo on 12th October 2016. 
First we came during day time. We were advised to see in the night also, so we again visited it during night.
I was mesmerised with its beauty and splendour. It is really marvellous. I also liked the cleanliness of the surroundings. It was awesome during night with the perfect lights. Its grandeur is well appreciated during night with excellent lights. We also enjoyed food in the restaurant with the backdrop of Zocalo in the night. It is one of the memorable moments of your life.
I can't believe that the city of Puebla has such magnificent historic places.

435212481.name: Lively spot
435212481.author: a TripAdvisor user
435212481.reviewBody: On Saturday night the vibe is busy, busy, busy!! Packed with people there is something for everyone. We returned Sunday night to a totally different scene - closed to traffic in sections the zocalo was so family friendly - kids running around playing - so much fun.  Certainly amongst one of the best zocalo\'s we\'ve been to.

434608985.name: Absolutely loved Puebla
434608985.author: a TripAdvisor user
434608985.reviewBody:
This isn't a review of the Zocalo itself (which was beautiful) but rather of the city of Puebla in general. I wish I'd stayed longer to explore more of its beautiful architecture, but we were only there for a short time... but the best of times. 

Puebla is an absolutely charming city with lots to do and see, the people seem lovely and I can't wait to go back.

If you plan a trip to Mexico City, please take a day or two out of your trip to go down to Puebla, you won't regret it.

433424401.name: Impressive
433424401.author: a TripAdvisor user
433424401.reviewBody: Be ready to be amace this is a rich wonderful and great cathedral so big that is almost gigantic and the iron works stone and wood is unique a must see in Puebla this city lives around this wholy place!

431625804.name: Mandatory visit!!!
431625804.author: a TripAdvisor user
431625804.reviewBody: A marvelous location! You can\u00b4t miss this beautiful location. Try to make yourself available to be at the mass, they play the organ.

430421295.name: Don\'t miss the Zocalo!
430421295.author: a TripAdvisor user
430421295.reviewBody: The main plaza Zocalo is GREAT!  Buzz of local activity with restaurants, coffee shops and ice cream places.  I loved the PUEBLA sign in the center square.  Tourists were lined up waiting to take a picture with the sign.  Great place to people watch.  The Zocalo was our starting point after a morning cappuccino from one of the coffee shops.  We wandered through the neighboring streets and churches taking in the sights of Pueblo.

430334032.name: Incredible!
430334032.author: a TripAdvisor user
430334032.reviewBody: Stunning Gothic architecture. I love old churches and this cathedral is a must see. Sit and meditate and ponder what it took to build this magnificent piece of art.

427967653.name: The heart of the city
427967653.author: a TripAdvisor user
427967653.reviewBody: The heart of the city and a great place to wander and people watch. Everything you need is here or close

427898167.name: Central Starting point
427898167.author: a TripAdvisor user
427898167.reviewBody: Good place to begin a day from and enjoy the crowds 24/7. Busy streets on three sides make side walk dining sometimes not the quietest, but the energy of the site, cathedral, and govt. center compliment the shaded sidewalk cafes.

427070042.name: very colonial and beautiful
427070042.author: a TripAdvisor user
427070042.reviewBody: make sure you visit downtown puebla, it is very beautiful a lot places to go and eat, and zocalo is one of the greatest in Mexico

426163184.name: Outatanding
426163184.author: a TripAdvisor user
426163184.reviewBody: Take your time to walk thru the Cathedral it\'s amazing. You will find incredible air organs inside the cathedral, you actually be able to hear them if it\'s at noon or if there is a wedding going on, which they go one every weekend.

424805265.name: Lots going on
424805265.author: a TripAdvisor user
424805265.reviewBody: Enjoy people watching and the activity that occurs in the middle of town. A wonderful place to walk and plan your tour of the city.

424303899.name: A great shady focal point for the Centro Historico
424303899.author: a TripAdvisor user
424303899.reviewBody: What a great shady space to draw together the beautiful buildings of Puebla\'s Centro Historico, especially the stunning Palacio Municipal and the sombre massiveness of the Cathedral of Puebla.

424063854.name: Relaxing
424063854.author: a TripAdvisor user
424063854.reviewBody: The zocalo in Puebla was fantastic. We were able to choose places to eat and shop during our visit. I recommend get there early and take the 1hr tour of the city. There are many areas were you can sit enjoy coffee, ice cream and drinks. We absolutely loved this area in Puebla.

423839071.name: Spend a few hours enjoying the Zocalo.
423839071.author: a TripAdvisor user
423839071.reviewBody: It is well worth spending a few hours in this area. Sit and watch the world go by, have a coffee and absorb the local culture. Walking tours and bus tours can be taken from here. The buildings are fantastic, a central point from where you can explore Puebla.

423529117.name: Beautiful to visit and hang around to people watch.
423529117.author: a TripAdvisor user
423529117.reviewBody: It\'s very lively, lots of locals coming to spend the afternoon. Great for people watching. There is also touribus leaving from the main square. Great to learn some history of Puebla.

419539475.name: Very pretty plaza and buildings!
419539475.author: a TripAdvisor user
419539475.reviewBody: Very nice central square with plenty of room to walk around or sit and nice places to eat/shops with things to buy. It\'s obvious that Mexicans take great pride in their culture and the main square is the best example of that. Just keep an eye out as you would in any other city and you\'ll be fine!

417994790.name: NIce Crowdy Square
417994790.author: a TripAdvisor user
417994790.reviewBody: Typical central square, rounded by the Cathedral , Central Government Building, live Music and restaurants, a nice place to visit and enjoy local atractions

415173236.name: An amazingly modern yet classical city
415173236.author: a TripAdvisor user
415173236.reviewBody: The Zocalo is the heart of the city, is so alive you can feel it. Just sit back and enjoy the people of Puebla stroll by going about their day. This is usually one of our first stops and we enjoy sipping coffee as the day goes by. The French colonial architecture is beautiful and the cathedral towing over it all is just amazing.

415161250.name: Right in the heart of the city
415161250.author: a TripAdvisor user
415161250.reviewBody: You won\'t miss it. It\'s in the heart of the City of Puebla.\nit\'s one of the three largest cathedrals in America continent of this type after the one in Mexico City, and Lima, Peru.\nIt\'s similar to the one in Mexico City. You don\'t need to come all the way to Puebla for this. But Puebla itself is a very nice city to visit, similar to that of Plaza de Mayor in Madrid, the colonial feel.

413567335.name: A must visit
413567335.author: a TripAdvisor user
413567335.reviewBody: The zocalo is surrounded of restaurants, shopping stores, the cathedral, taxis, bus tours, the tourism office, and is in the middle of a beautiful park.  To be there at any time of the day is just perfect.   The restaurants tables are just located in the outside with umbrellas and you can drink coffee, wine, with a nice dinner and great company and admire the beautiful views of Puebla

412701677.name: One of the Best
412701677.author: a TripAdvisor user
412701677.reviewBody: Every town in Mexico has a zocalo but Puebla\'s is one of the best I have seen. Very large so you don\'t feel crowded. And of course there is the cathedral and nearby iglesias. Lots of charming restaurants in the area also.

408490955.name: Fun time
408490955.author: a TripAdvisor user
408490955.reviewBody: We were walking on Sunday around 10;00 and we found lots of activities there for the entire family. I did zumba with Michel, we were visiting the city. Nice place to spend on sunday, they hace bikes to ride, games for kids, etc

406740271.name: Main Square in Puebla
406740271.author: a TripAdvisor user
406740271.reviewBody: Typical square in the center of town. You can take a Touribus ride around the city from here an d have coffe, a beer or ice cream sitting on the many outdoor cafes around the square.

403712192.name: Very pretty
403712192.author: a TripAdvisor user
403712192.reviewBody: The place was really pretty, I found it a bit sad that there were so many children, women and young men selling all kinds of stuff and you feel a bit harassed by them. But the view of the cathedral is stunning, as well as the park itself

402018716.name: Lots of stuff to see
402018716.author: a TripAdvisor user
402018716.reviewBody: Pretty good area to meet friends and get an ice cream or a coffee or a full on meal. Tons of shops in the square as well as vendors all over the place. Some fountains for the kiddos to play in on hot days.

398304660.name: Great centrum to expierience culture in Puebla!
398304660.author: a TripAdvisor user
398304660.reviewBody: The Zocalo in Puebla is the centrum from the City. Here you\'ll find the Catedral and a lot of shops and restaurants. In the middle there is a little park where you can also rest.

398238185.name: The heart and lung of the city
398238185.author: a TripAdvisor user
398238185.reviewBody:
The Zocolo in Puebla is a people-watching paradise! It is a hive of activity and photo ops. The day I was there (Sun 24th July) el Combate de Flores was being celebrated: a parade of vintage cars, bicycles and tricycles where passengers threw flowers at females in the cheering crowds to commemorate the 485th anniversary of the foundation of Puebla - an ancient tradition that has recently been revived again by the Town Hall. It was last celebrated in the Zocalo in 1969. 

The Zocalo is surrounded by places to sit out and to eat (terrazas) and coffee shops. I would recommend meeting for Sunday brunch with friends in Hotel del Portal or having churros in Antiguo Churreria del Catedral which are both in Los Portales
(Arches) of the square surrounding the Zocalo. Or to take a sneaky selfie of the Zocalo from the balcony of second floor of the bookshop "Editorial Trillos" as you search for children's books there.

398226908.name: Great atmosphere!
398226908.author: a TripAdvisor user
398226908.reviewBody: The atmosphere in the Zocalo was lively! It was very clean and there were not sellers on each street corner. Tourist buses leave from el Zocalo to go sight seeing. Also a person can find a number of restaurants around this plaza. One can sit and watch people all day long and never get bored.

396445424.name: Architecture
396445424.author: a TripAdvisor user
396445424.reviewBody: Puebla is a great place to walk and buy stuff off the streets interact with locals and see all the great structure\'s... Its worth a half day walk.....phone broke fix it at the plaza technology.. Everything can be found and bought...keep low key don\'t flash cash...have fun

394959057.name: Vibrant
394959057.author: a TripAdvisor user
394959057.reviewBody: Zocalo is where all the life is. Seems like everyone from the town and outside hang around here. Extremely lively with food, music and colors.

394795161.name: Just Wonderful and Peaceful
394795161.author: a TripAdvisor user
394795161.reviewBody: I loved this place, lots of places to sit and people watch, there is history everywhere, architecture abounds and lots of street vendors and the park is so wonderful and even though is it alive with people, very peaceful.  The trees are beautiful as is the fountain and artwork.  Loved Puebla!

393344396.name: Beautiful and romantic place to be!
393344396.author: a TripAdvisor user
393344396.reviewBody: A beautiful and romance place not to be missed while visiting Mexico.  Another charming city reminds you of Europe.  Lots of shops, restaurants to enjoy.

392193045.name: Tons of places to shop, and sit down with a coffee cup
392193045.author: a TripAdvisor user
392193045.reviewBody: Every time I\'m in Puebla visiting family, I visit the Zocalo. There are many places to shop. Recently, I did a tour that departs from the zocalo, and goes around the city. i definitely recommend to do the tour. It\'s a red double decker bus.

382748624.name: Beautiful bustling space
382748624.author: a TripAdvisor user
382748624.reviewBody: I was here in January 2016 around Dias de Reyes  and this was a beautiful experience - cathedrals and chapels, street vendors, sounds, sights, shoe shiners, foods and open air markets. There was shopping and snacks to be had, along with souvenirs and soccer jerseys.\n\nThe architecture was beautiful and I recommend anyone just to wander around and take it all in. If you are a shutterbug, make sure you have enough memory on your card / phone and maybe even an extra battery!

382480427.name: A must do
382480427.author: a TripAdvisor user
382480427.reviewBody: El Zocalo is a great place to walk around, sight-see, and to eat. Such a pretty town square with lots to offer

381203499.name: Fun European town center
381203499.author: a TripAdvisor user
381203499.reviewBody: We came straight to the zocalo for dinner the first night we visited Puebla.  As the sun was setting we enjoyed walking around looking at all of the people and eating at a lovely Italian restaurant.  There is so much to see and do here!  I wish we could\'ve spent more time there!

380669717.name: Interesting Architecture
380669717.author: a TripAdvisor user
380669717.reviewBody:
You can see  some of the earthquake damage that has not been repaired.....

In front of the church are  windows over excavation sites, but they were dirty, so one really couldn't see the details

The cross w/ the calaveras was very interesting

Interior of the church is  full of light & the pipe organs are magnificent

379522894.name: Best Zocalo we went to
379522894.author: a TripAdvisor user
379522894.reviewBody: Surrounded by stunning buildings, with excellent cafes the central area was full of locals & visitors just sitting, walking around, talking. It was full of colour, with balloon sellers, locals selling very colourful ware. Just a great place to sit & enjoy life

378776808.name: Wonderfully used by locals
378776808.author: a TripAdvisor user
378776808.reviewBody: Still an important part of this historic district, full of families wandering with balloons and ice creams. Lovely architecture. Felt safe day and night.

377312253.name: A great people place
377312253.author: a TripAdvisor user
377312253.reviewBody:
The zocalo like most in Mexican cities is a meeting place.   Couples, families and lovers.         

This zocalo was a constant buzz of humanity.   

Beautiful trees,  benches, fountains, statuary.       

Framed by the cathedral on one side and arches with restaurants, bars, cafes and stores and services line the other three sides.

Most of all the people watching is fun. 

You should  go to Puebla.

377058156.name: Magnificent Architecture, Worth the stroll
377058156.author: a TripAdvisor user
377058156.reviewBody: Zocalo, the main square, is definitely worth the stroll. If you enjoy architecture. It is lined with beautiful Spanish colonial houses and the cathedral is like no other. There are many restaurants, coffee shops and bars around the Zocalo. Unfortunately, there aren\'t many tour guides to hire to learn more about its history.  We stayed at a hotel in the Zocalo and were lucky to get a zocalo view. We enjoyed the night city life view from our hotel rooftop. During the month of December, expect traffic due to the events going on. You will find many streets around the Zocalo closed. In the month of December, the city fills the Zocalo with activities for children. i.e. ice skating ring, slides, Los Reyes (the three kings) wall climbing and other fun activities for the little ones in the family.

375796257.name: Nothing much in the Z\u00f3calo itself, but plenty nearby
375796257.author: a TripAdvisor user
375796257.reviewBody: Compared to the great Z\u00f3calo of nearby Cholula and it\'s multiple caf\u00e9s and restaurants, the Z\u00f3calo is unimpressive. The quaint greenery and tiled z\u00f3calo of Atlixco is more colourful... And I could go on. Some of the restaurants are good, but the main attractions are elsewhere.

375596657.name: Beautiful place
375596657.author: a TripAdvisor user
375596657.reviewBody: Beautiful place to learn about history and the architecture is awesome  Went there ti explore the city with my girlfriend

375240082.name: Puebla de los angeles,
375240082.author: a TripAdvisor user
375240082.reviewBody: Awesome city nice cool weather, down town is realy prety at night, lot of those building are at least over 100 years old,nice museums,and lot of places to eat.

374920385.name: There is always something happening
374920385.author: a TripAdvisor user
374920385.reviewBody: There is always dance, yoga classes in the square. Unlike other Mexican squares, this one has got trees everywhere, so if feeling hot, take a stroll here.

374680967.name: Must see!
374680967.author: a TripAdvisor user
374680967.reviewBody: Great park in the center of the historic center.  There are a ton of sounds, smells and views.  There was a concert while I was there and it was great to see the show and the interaction.  The area has any kind of food you could want and has a ton of shops.  \n\nPuebla is an untapped city and I\'m surprised there is not more international tourism.

372788523.name: Clean and beautiful Zocalo
372788523.author: a TripAdvisor user
372788523.reviewBody: The government has done a really good job on keeping this plaza clean and safe. Surrounded by amazing colonial buildings, church and restaurants. If you are taking a table make sure you get one in the middle of the Restaurant and no on the edge to keep vendors away or kids selling gum.

372376001.name: Must visit in Puebla
372376001.author: a TripAdvisor user
372376001.reviewBody: The place sets the center of the city. It is usually full of locals, and around the area you will find many shops and restaurants.

371012357.name: Wonderful historic place.
371012357.author: a TripAdvisor user
371012357.reviewBody: Colonial. With one word I can describe this wonderful place: colonial. If you have visited some other places like this in\nMexico like, Morelia or Zacatecas, this is mandatory because  is full of history about Mexican early history.\n

370418773.name: Centre of Puebla
370418773.author: a TripAdvisor user
370418773.reviewBody: Very clean, beautiful buildings. Easy to find Taxis for return to hotel.\nTuribus travelling around the city or to Cholula, good way to see the city.

370373907.name: worth the visit
370373907.author: a TripAdvisor user
370373907.reviewBody: it is such an interesting place to visit, crowded on weekends, lots to see and shops to visit.  stop for ice cream at one of the many shops.  one of them serves your ice cream, I had tequila and lime with red wine...how bad can that be.  people watching at its finest.  hard to park but its worth it.  the architecture is amazing very colonial take lots of pictures

369610570.name: A plaza full of life and surrounded by beautiful buildings
369610570.author: a TripAdvisor user
369610570.reviewBody: Visiting the Zocalo is a must. Beautiful buildings surround this lively plaza which is full of locals and will provide you with a great taste of what Puebla is all about.

368144631.name: A lovely Zocalo, with outdoors dining options.
368144631.author: a TripAdvisor user
368144631.reviewBody: Wow! This place was busy,busy,busy last weekend, as the city hosted it\'s annual festival. The cathedral was the focal point of a sound and light show at 8 pm on Saturday and it was stunning. Even though the place was packed, there was a muy tranquillo atmosphere. Very nice.

367783413.name: Just Amazing
367783413.author: a TripAdvisor user
367783413.reviewBody: You can see all history in every corner, the colonial building looks so great. One of my favorite cities in Mexico.

367486182.name: Simply beautiful
367486182.author: a TripAdvisor user
367486182.reviewBody: The Zocalo of Puebla is very beautiful. It has everything, a lot of things to see (the Cathedral, the Park itself, around there are some nice restaurants with tasty food, snacks and drinks), it is perfect for a little sunday stroll through the city.

366212693.name: A very colonial square
366212693.author: a TripAdvisor user
366212693.reviewBody:
Visit the zocalo it's like to travel on past . The square is very clean and safe, contains. A beautiful church , with neo Classic and Barroco style. 

Small fountains near the cathedral and Puebla signage convert the point as a beautiful place for photo.

This spot it's very Spanish style , classic architecture

363419568.name: Beautiful city
363419568.author: a TripAdvisor user
363419568.reviewBody: This is a wonderful place to be with family, friends or couple.  It\'s quaint and so beautiful. You won\'t regret been here.

363354897.name: A lovely place ...
363354897.author: a TripAdvisor user
363354897.reviewBody: Day and night the Zocalo is a lovely place to visit. It is anchored on one side by the beautiful basilica church, on the other three by distinctive  Spanish colonial architecture, and smack in the middle is a park which has inviting shade trees, gardens, and even some modern sculpture. At night the lighting on the basilica is stunning. \nDon\'t miss spending time here in the heart of Puebla.

363182243.name: Fun place
363182243.author: a TripAdvisor user
363182243.reviewBody: We enjoyed seeing the sites and shopping in the Zocalo. We went down twice and it is very crowded with a lot of traffic and traffic fumes but so much to see and a lively environment.

362844072.name: Beautiful
362844072.author: a TripAdvisor user
362844072.reviewBody: Beautiful at night!  We drove here and checked into our hotel.  The weather here is just perfect.  Lots of people, places to eat and lovely trees.  The church is lighted well and is really pretty at night.

361344944.name: Perfect People Watching!
361344944.author: a TripAdvisor user
361344944.reviewBody: If you love to people watch this is the perfect spot!  There are people from all over the world who visit this place and they all end up in the Zocalo!   The food around the zocalo is only ok, but the atmosphere is wonderful.  It rained hard there, as it does daily in the summer months, but everyone was kind and helping one another to get out of the rain.  It was great to see strangers helping the elderly.  You will enjoy the smells of a variety of food and drinks.  Perfect place to stop for a nice lunch and enjoy the area.

359418427.name: Shopping
359418427.author: a TripAdvisor user
359418427.reviewBody: We spent about half a day here. Good place to shop ( prices very reasonable) We found the locals very willing to talk about their shops & merchandise for sale. We also had a very good lunch at a restaurant named VIPS.  Kind of like an American " Dennys ".  English speaking servers.

359415683.name: Main square for having a quiet afternoon
359415683.author: a TripAdvisor user
359415683.reviewBody: This is the main square of the downtown area. From here you could visit government palace, local cathedral, Amparo Museum and have many food choices.

358608781.name: Very nice!
358608781.author: a TripAdvisor user
358608781.reviewBody: Fantastic square, on the side of the church, a fountain, statues, lots off people around, very vivid!

357667701.name: Typically lovely Mexican central meeting place
357667701.author: a TripAdvisor user
357667701.reviewBody: The square is a great meeting place, always full of people and activity, beautifully lit at night. It looks onto the Cathedral, an imposing building which was also beautifully lit at night, although inside not especially ornate. The Zocalo has many  basic eating places but seemed to lack any good and characterful restaurants.

357622469.name: Was a blast!
357622469.author: a TripAdvisor user
357622469.reviewBody: We visited on the weekend of Palm Sunday and there was always something going on in Zocalo: dancing, clowns, DJs, etc. It was fun and festive. My favorite part was simply eating on a patio and people watching.

356444705.name: Puebla has one of the most beautiful zocalo in Mexico.
356444705.author: a TripAdvisor user
356444705.reviewBody: Every time we come to Puebla we discover something new. This square is always beautiful but always also has something new going on. Some art, entertainment or music. It is surrounded by gorgeous Historic buildings that have been painstakingly restored. There are many pedestrian friendly streets to stroll and shop and lots of fabulous restaurants including one of the best pizzerias at Almalfi only a block from the zocalo.

355848320.name: Beautiful architecture
355848320.author: a TripAdvisor user
355848320.reviewBody: Coworkers and I visited this church in the afternoon after work. A young Children\'s Choir was practicing American Christmas songs. Felt like I was back home in the states. If you love architecture and wood carvings, this is the best Church to visit in the Puebla area

355464776.name: One of the finest zocalos in Mexico
355464776.author: a TripAdvisor user
355464776.reviewBody: The zocola is THE place to be on a Sunday in Puebla. There is music and dancing, magicians and cartoon characters, balloons, a small mercado and of course the surrounding restaurants. During the week it is a lovely gathering place with lots of benches, a fountain and trees.  Grab a cup of coffee and spend a quite morning with your guide book.

353180799.name: Where is all meets!
353180799.author: a TripAdvisor user
353180799.reviewBody: A fantastic area to walk around or just sit and people watch in the park or at a cafe on the side. Lively with a wonderful vibe.

352422319.name: Very nice place to walk, even at night.
352422319.author: a TripAdvisor user
352422319.reviewBody: They have all around good food stores, and restaurant, very nice place to walk around, even at night, went walking from the zocalo to the hotel, 2 miles very safe place.

349279956.name: The place to be!
349279956.author: a TripAdvisor user
349279956.reviewBody: Like most Zocalo\'s throughout Mexico it\'s the place to hangout maybe have a meal or bebida while you watch the world go by. Such a vibrant place.

348973119.name: very good
348973119.author: a TripAdvisor user
348973119.reviewBody: Area is very nice, the City of Puebla has lots to offer, great food, things to do, however if you are a tourist taxi and transportation will charge you double the fare, do you homework first. Hotel Marriot Las Animas staff will call you a taxi and you will be double charge. Call your own taxi.

348961263.name: Beautiful Plaza in a very colonial city
348961263.author: a TripAdvisor user
348961263.reviewBody: The Cathedral, fountain, government palace and restaurants make this zocalo plaza a place ideal to chill out, enjoy the view, visit the amazing Cathedral and enjoy the beautiful architecture of downtown Puebla. I personally enjoy strolling the streets hunting for amazing local arts and crafts and eating at one of many amazing restaurants around the area.

348944746.name: Lovely
348944746.author: a TripAdvisor user
348944746.reviewBody: One of the nicest Zocalos we\'ve been to.  Lovely trees and and night enchanting lighting.  Always busy with families, young lovers, grandmas - everyone having a good time.

348588474.name: BEAUTIFUL.
348588474.author: a TripAdvisor user
348588474.reviewBody: Beautiful town square; my favorite in Mexico. Gorgeous, lush old trees, well kept grounds. Perfect location to people watch and wile away a few hours.

348528250.name: Feel totally at home here you can feel the whole community spirit
348528250.author: a TripAdvisor user
348528250.reviewBody: Beautiful cathedral, Sunday is family day here and it\'s so nice just to see people with their family enjoying themselves

347652655.name: The heat of it all
347652655.author: a TripAdvisor user
347652655.reviewBody: I always love to visit the main squares of Mexican towns (often called Z\u00f3calos).\nThis one in particular is great because of its humongous ancestral trees surrounding the plaza.\nSenior travelers watch out, the Z\u00f3calo isn\'t at street level, and the plaza can\'t be accessed other than the stairs on its sides.

346000492.name: Fun Day
346000492.author: a TripAdvisor user
346000492.reviewBody: We enjoyed our time at and around the Zocalo. It is a park visited by many people on a daily basis. There are a lot of restaurants and coffee shops around and the park is nice to just sit and relax. A nice size market is just about 10 min walk from the Zocalo.

345927912.name: A BEAUTIFUL ZOCALO!
345927912.author: a TripAdvisor user
345927912.reviewBody: We have been living and traveling in Mexico (all in all about 1 year). This is a seriously nice Zocalo. \nBeautifully manicured, constant cleaning, the plant pots even are Talavera, many benches, beautiful fauna.

343898195.name: Where to be when visting Puebla
343898195.author: a TripAdvisor user
343898195.reviewBody: We just got back from a visit to Puebla for 8 days, staying a half block from the zocalo. It is a great location, a quick walk to most of the historical zone and an affordable cab ride to other areas. \nEach day there was something going on in the zocalo - muisic, clowns, and so on, so it was always filled with people and families.It is quieter late at night, and if you are looking for more of the night life that is across town.

342504244.name: Bohemian, friendly market & lovely traditional cafes
342504244.author: a TripAdvisor user
342504244.reviewBody: It was a sunny warm day so it helps going to market . The downtown has a unique charisma, and slower pace of life than M\u00e9xico city or Guadalajara for example. It\'s full of character. Churches on every street , everyone selling something and a lot which is handicrafts and very interesting. Diverse selection of things in the market .Some of the walls and buildings are brightly painted which is lovely .prices in general are lower in Puebla than M\u00e9xico city for souvenirs and eating out etc . Greatly recommend going to the market on the Saturday.  Allow a couple of hours or u may miss a bargain !

338571202.name: the central plaza of Puebla
338571202.author: a TripAdvisor user
338571202.reviewBody: A nice place to sit or walk around. There is always something going on. Around the paza are serveral restuarants good for dining and people watching

338155242.name: Lots to see
338155242.author: a TripAdvisor user
338155242.reviewBody: There is a lot of action going happening around this area. Lots to see, eat, and shop. Be careful of traffic as it goes in many directions and the signs are not so correct.

337743278.name: Christmas is an enchanted time to visit
337743278.author: a TripAdvisor user
337743278.reviewBody: lights, families, ice skating, food, & vendors. Beautiful 4 days at the Hotel Royalty (get a Jr. suite - they overlook the Zocalo)

337389003.name: Center of town activities
337389003.author: a TripAdvisor user
337389003.reviewBody: Christmas festivities were going on so there was a toboggan, numerous Christmas venues, and of course food.

336532329.name: Nice Zocalo
336532329.author: a TripAdvisor user
336532329.reviewBody: The Zocalo in Puebla is spacious and has the life you can expect in a typical Mexican Plaza. You can find food, artesanias, musicians, pets, people strolling and children playing around. All around you have an Mexican Colonial arcade where you can find coffee shops, restaurants, hotels and souvenir shops. Look at the beautiful "Santo Tom\u00e1s marble floor" in red and gray colors and also at the cantera in the buildings. The highlight of the Plaza is the Cathedral.

333111921.name: A wonderful place to spend a Saturday
333111921.author: a TripAdvisor user
333111921.reviewBody:
In Puebla the city does a light show spectacular most Saturday evenings onto the cathedral.  My preferred seat of choice is across the street on the second floor of the Tartlett Coffeehouse.  It is a great light show.  

You can buy everything, anything or nothing at the Zocalo and have a great time - there is always live music playing at one of twenty spots OR sit a few minutes and the band will certainly come to (for a tip!) 

Oh how I love Puebla!

332794199.name: the hart of the city
332794199.author: a TripAdvisor user
332794199.reviewBody: very  lively  area  to visit  and  seat in  any the the several  restaurants of coffe houses  that surrond the plaza  and serve very good food and drinks \nenjoy the atmosphere and  the view of the cathedral

332666780.name: CHRISTMAS HERE IS NOT TO BE MISSED!
332666780.author: a TripAdvisor user
332666780.reviewBody: I had not visited Puebla since the late 1960s.  The Zocalo is one part of Puebla that is essentially the same as back then.  It is currently decorated for the Christmas holidays and the flowers and lights are spectacular.  Rows of "gingerbread" houses will house food and crafts sales.  Wear a jacket at night as it can get a bit chilly here in December.

332484619.name: At the heart of Mexico -  Tacky & Huge Colonial Heritage
332484619.author: a TripAdvisor user
332484619.reviewBody: The remais of a bloody forced occupation by Spanish conquerors, are placed around this, huge, hot and tacky place, at the heart of Mexico DF.\nI mean, tacky architecture, because shades of grey and stones are so heavy - compared to original ancient Mayan taste.Most of them are filled with gold masterpieces inside, nothing to be proud of, from my point of view.\nBut, like The Vatican - Saint Peter\'s Plaza -  Z\u00f3calo is the epicenter of a Nation\'s epiphany of culture, past, present and future. Opportunities are to see traditional ancient rituals and folkloric dances throughout the week. Also its the major stage to several popular celebrations - check calendars-. Around this unusual place, churches are side by side with ruins from ancient Mexico, and new and old tourists, mixed with the crowded sidewalks. Nice opportunity to feel the real Mexican heat, and lost yourself into an urban adventure and seat in some "Taqueria" choose something to eat, and of course, drink too.

331711184.name: Center  of  community  activity
331711184.author: a TripAdvisor user
331711184.reviewBody: Full of families  and children  sidewalk  entertainment.  Tourist  bureau  is not very helpful  but  can book  tours although we  used Trip Advisors recommendation

330408498.name: One of the Best Zocalos in Mexico
330408498.author: a TripAdvisor user
330408498.reviewBody: Always humming with activity, we were here to enjoy the lights & sights on a November Sunday evening. Not much better than hanging out in Pueblo\'s Zocalo!

329941448.name: Very Nice Zocolo
329941448.author: a TripAdvisor user
329941448.reviewBody: Very easy to get to with lots of atmosphere. We had a great time just walking around and looking at all of the shops.

328594693.name: One of the best historical sites in town
328594693.author: a TripAdvisor user
328594693.reviewBody: The architecture of this building is fantastic and the local government is taking very good care of it. It is located in the main garden/public square in downtown.

326569552.name: loved this place very magical
326569552.author: a TripAdvisor user
326569552.reviewBody: we spent hours here the whole town is amazing, the food and people. But this place was amazing too . I loved Mexico and it is one of the places i would go back to again and again.

326527210.name: Beautiful landmark
326527210.author: a TripAdvisor user
326527210.reviewBody: The Z\u00f3calo is the main square of Puebla, everything was build around it, so you will find all the important places near, like the cathedral, the city hall, museums and of course you will be able to admire the amazing barroque architecture of the city.\nIt\'s always full of people and you will always find something to do.

326108071.name: Great meeting place
326108071.author: a TripAdvisor user
326108071.reviewBody: We were there for the Dia De Los Muertos. It was fantastic to see so many people out dressed up in costume.There were many families with their kids in costume. All were super friendly.

326045695.name: Famous landmark of Puebla
326045695.author: a TripAdvisor user
326045695.reviewBody: Surrounded by centuries of architecture yet full of life, the plaza throbs with music, laughter, shrieking children and vendors.  Wander under the enormous trees careful of the flocks of birds above.  Lots of outdoor tables for a drink or bite under the arcades.

324476997.name: Lots of things to see and do
324476997.author: a TripAdvisor user
324476997.reviewBody: The square was being prepared for Dia De Los Muertos was we visited.  It appears there is always something going on.  There are lots of greats places to visit in this area, restaurants to visit and a great place to start for any visit to Mexico City.

320740633.name: One of the Liveliest Zocalos in Mexico
320740633.author: a TripAdvisor user
320740633.reviewBody: Forget tourist guide books that characterize Puebla as staid and conservative. Usually, the impressive zocalo (dwarfed by that concrete monstrosity in D.F.) has buskers, rock groups, and other activity that lend quite a pleasant charm to the city\'s *centro.* Because the dollar is strong, one can eat breakfast under the *portales* for less than $5 US, chow down on the famous Las Ranas *tacos arabes* just around the corner, or have a *milanesa* at any restaurant on the park periphery. You might run into a member of a local guild, young *creollos* keeping medieval traditions alive in a charming way. The food is good, the buskers for the most part unobtrusive, and the people watching simply sensational.

319392993.name: Beautiful city
319392993.author: a TripAdvisor user
319392993.reviewBody: Puebla is a beautiful Mexican city.  Its Zocalo has several restaurants.  There are usually buskers and other street entertainers near the church/cathedral at the centre of the zocalo.  Enjoy this great little city, less than 2 hours from Mexico City!

316609671.name: Hub of the city.  Always lots going on!
316609671.author: a TripAdvisor user
316609671.reviewBody: After spending 6 weeks in Puebla we often found ourselves strolling in and around the Zocalo.  There seems to always be something going on here. It is a hub of activity.  Many of the main attractions in Puebla are a stones throw from here, the Cathedral, the Biblioteca Palafoxiana, and the Santo Domingo Church.  We foudn the rewstaurants around the Zocalo ok for a quick coffee or drink, but too touristy for dinner and there is a constant stream of beggars and people trying to sell tourist stuff, I would suggest heading a few blocks away for better choices.\n

316171288.name: Amazing Place
316171288.author: a TripAdvisor user
316171288.reviewBody: This is one of the best place in the entering planet , you\'ve gotta to see it  , no doubt come to visit Puebla and enjoy the Zocalo \nsurrounded of very interesting museums

315981934.name: a great zocalo
315981934.author: a TripAdvisor user
315981934.reviewBody: A fantastic main square, especially when lit up at night in September for the national independence day holiday (left up all month). Had a few good coffee shops. Bars, and restaurants around it, and lots of people. Encircled by the governor\'s palace on one side and the cathedral on the other.

315086033.name: Can\'t miss it.
315086033.author: a TripAdvisor user
315086033.reviewBody: You can\'t miss the Zocalo as it\'s the center of life in the historic centro. It\'s clean, well landscaped and it seems there was always some activity or event being held there, many of which were very interesting to watch. And not every restaurant on the Zocalo are higher priced. We found one where breakfast was as cheap AND better than any other place in town.

313605125.name: Colonial memories
313605125.author: a TripAdvisor user
313605125.reviewBody: This Zocalo is the classic Spaniard colonial plaza in the middle of the city. Always enjoyable. Full of culture, architecture, history, life... Maybe this is one of the most beautiful of Latin America.

313555097.name: The social center of Puebla ... a historic plaza!
313555097.author: a TripAdvisor user
313555097.reviewBody: The social center of Puebla ... a historic plaza! It is a really nice place to walk around especially in the evening amongst poblanos out for a nice time with their families.\n\nNice architecture surrounds the plaza on all sides.

313012661.name: Nice place to sit and eat ice cream like a local
313012661.author: a TripAdvisor user
313012661.reviewBody: Like all the  zocalo we\'ve visited Puebla\'s is no different concerning the it\'s function as a meeting and hangout place. The colorful buildings abound and the cathedral watches over the square with rightful pride. Great streets full of sweet things and artisanale products depart from every corner making it a good start and end point.

312952534.name: Most beautiful zocalo or second?
312952534.author: a TripAdvisor user
312952534.reviewBody: One of the big riddle once you visit all large cities of central Mexico will be: Is Puebla\'s main square the most beautiful in Mexico or is Morelia\'s? Well, after over 100 trips to Mexico in 18 years I still haven\'t made up my mind. Morelia\'s zocalo is more "artistic" in a traditional sense, but Puebla\'s is definitely more lively, with its cafes, restaurants and crowds strolling under its arcades with any kind of weather. The South side is completely dominated by Puebla\'s huge cathedral, whereas the other 3 sides have arcades all around that allow you to enjoy this central square with garden regardless from the weather. There are Italian Coffee shops (the best coffee shop franchisee in Mexico - even better than Starbucks) on each of the 3 sides, so you can decide which side you like most, take a seat and relax between one museum and the other.

303078529.name: Always something happening
303078529.author: a TripAdvisor user
303078529.reviewBody: Loved this place.  Active all the time.  Free movies, music, activities, etc.  Clowns on the weekend.  Big sandpit where you can watch, in deckchairs, the free movies on a giant inflatable screen.  Demonstrations, kids running around.  Just wonderful chaos.  Take a bench and take it in.

302868579.name: Very, very nice
302868579.author: a TripAdvisor user
302868579.reviewBody: the Zocalo or central plaza of Puebla is a very nice spot to people watch and take in the atmosphere of this beautiful city. When we were there a beach had been set up in the plaza and at night they showed a movie. From here you can easily walk to the Biblioteca Palafoxiana, the Cathedral is on the plaza and the over-the-top Church of Santo Domingo a short step away.

301214853.name: Excellent City!
301214853.author: a TripAdvisor user
301214853.reviewBody: It\u00b4s an excellent place... history, clean, atractive, and all you are looking for. \nIf you are trying to find a place that envolves all the activities you can imagine, next to Mexico  City, close to  Veracruz, and a lot of things to do

298503902.name: Great place to hang out
298503902.author: a TripAdvisor user
298503902.reviewBody: A really fun place to hang out. There are always lots of people and lots of family and individual activities going on.

297904455.name: Popping With Activity
297904455.author: a TripAdvisor user
297904455.reviewBody: Such a busy place with lots of places to eat and buy things. Lots of music and activities for all ages.

297695380.name: Beutiful buildings
297695380.author: a TripAdvisor user
297695380.reviewBody: In the area around the Zocalo, there are beautiful buildings! Take for example the Palacio Federal. This building has a beautiful and intricate external design!\nOn my next return to Puebla, I will definitely come back to these sights!

297621381.name: Wow!
297621381.author: a TripAdvisor user
297621381.reviewBody: Will keep it short.. So glad we decided to go to Puebla instead of Mexico City.. Just visiting downtown Puebla and its "Zocalo" is worth the travel.

297339327.name: Don\'t spoil your Zocalo MC
297339327.author: a TripAdvisor user
297339327.reviewBody: A vibrant centre of Mexico City.  The only negative I can add as a tourist is that it needs to be kept free for use by the public, not rented out for commercial events. We were right opposite for 6 days and saw marquees and tents go up and down.

295829655.name: Take in the local scene!
295829655.author: a TripAdvisor user
295829655.reviewBody: Grab a seat, sit at a cafe or on a park bench and take in the scene-dancers, singers, artisans, musicians, acrobats. It is a colorful place that is a treat to all your senses. Beautiful spot to people watch.

295417983.name: Pretty, but...
295417983.author: a TripAdvisor user
295417983.reviewBody: it\'s all fun and games and pretty until... fresh, sun heated chewing gum sticks to you... be careful and keep it clean please :)

295051112.name: A Vibrant Slice of Life on the Zocalo
295051112.author: a TripAdvisor user
295051112.reviewBody: A bustling Zocalo, particularly on weekends.  Free wifi!  Buskers, puppeteers, acrobats and, when I visited, male and female heavyweight wrestling -- to the delight of the local crowds.  Locals and visitors just hanging out, people-watching.

291807467.name: Nice to sit and watch the dynamic of Mexican life
291807467.author: a TripAdvisor user
291807467.reviewBody:
Well, it's a very dynamic place where you can see all styles of different people. Tourists of course and Poblanos.

Best way is to buy a coffee and sit on a bench in the middle of the plaza.

From the plaza you can start walking around all the neighbour streets which we enjoyed very much. The whole neighborhood is really historic and has an old beautiful, colorful architecture.

290738074.name: Another plaza in a historic city
290738074.author: a TripAdvisor user
290738074.reviewBody: it\'s the zocalo. Pretty nice little plaza, but not really what I would call spectacular. It\'s really worth checking it out at night, its very photogenic at that time, and lit beautifully.

290248939.name: Love it!
290248939.author: a TripAdvisor user
290248939.reviewBody: I spent six weeks in Puebla and the zocalo was one of my favorite places to spend time.  It is easy to find anything you want near the zocalo.  It is surrounded by beautiful buildings.  Honestly, my favorite thing to do was people watch.  There are always vendors, shows, concerts, and many other things going on.

288946818.name: Lovely central oasis
288946818.author: a TripAdvisor user
288946818.reviewBody: Beautiful, relaxing and well maintained refuge at heart of centro historico.  Lots of trees and benches, plus fountains.  Excellent people watching, with families, balloon vendors and casual strollers.  Lots of restaurants (including McD and BK and fancier options) on the perimeter streets, as well as the huge Catedral Basilica.  Equally pleasant in the evening, altho mosquitoes like the place too.  Appeared very safe, without the dodgy characters sometimes found in similar locations in some other Mexican cities,

286828550.name: the best catedral in Mexico
286828550.author: a TripAdvisor user
286828550.reviewBody: one oof the biggest catedral in latin america, excelent place to visit and to enjoy a guided trip. also you can stay there foe a mess en weekends

286459514.name: Town Square
286459514.author: a TripAdvisor user
286459514.reviewBody: Very beautiful cathedral and square. They is always some festivity happening here. The cathedral is a wonderful work of art!

284570928.name: Beautiful
284570928.author: a TripAdvisor user
284570928.reviewBody: This place is so nice and clean!! One of the cleanest places I\'ve been in Mexico.  The cathedral is beautiful and the restaurants surrounding the zocalo add to the charm of the area.

284376697.name: Wonderful place for families
284376697.author: a TripAdvisor user
284376697.reviewBody: The zocalo truly gives you the feel of the Mexican culture - so many families enjoying the area and always buzzing.   There is so much to see and do nearby as well.

283959461.name: Very Nice Zocalo
283959461.author: a TripAdvisor user
283959461.reviewBody: This Zocalo is beautiful, there are restaurants around the Zocalo where you can eat and have a drink while enjoying the view.  It is nice to see the locals and lots of tourist having a good time.  Nice lace to spend a few hours to relax\n\n

282453582.name: The heart and soul of colonial Puebla
282453582.author: a TripAdvisor user
282453582.reviewBody: nothing really that special but a lively and large square  where POBLANOS and visitors get a rest and a drink ,enjoy some street artist performance or  prepare for next museum visit ,.\na few restaurants have roof terrace to enjoy the view

281756550.name: Lunch in the centre of Puebla
281756550.author: a TripAdvisor user
281756550.reviewBody: The concept of the Zocalo is brilliant, bringing people together in the middle of town to eat, drink and be merry.  There are plenty of places to do this as well as the Cathedral to explore.

280795360.name: Nice place to visit
280795360.author: a TripAdvisor user
280795360.reviewBody: The Zocalo come to light in the evening with lots of stalls which generally sell touristy products. During the day you can get a great photo of the Catedral which dates to the 1600\'s. You can go into the Cathedral and if you are lucky you may see a wedding. The tourist office is opposite the Cathedral so, provided that they are open, you can get enough information for you visit.

279586078.name: Quaint Town Square
279586078.author: a TripAdvisor user
279586078.reviewBody: Very relaxing small town square in the town where there are more churches than stores, 360 churches in Cholula.

279159833.name: Center of the city
279159833.author: a TripAdvisor user
279159833.reviewBody: From the Zocalo there are dozens of restaurants, shops and churches, all within a 3 block area.  Don\'t miss the Talavera factory where traditional Puebla blue and white dishes are made.

279019143.name: Great place to walk around
279019143.author: a TripAdvisor user
279019143.reviewBody: We walk around the Zocalo and had lunch in one of the restaurants there, the people are so friendly, we felt safe, we listen to live music and also did some shopping

278243901.name: Pleasant Ooen Space
278243901.author: a TripAdvisor user
278243901.reviewBody: This is the perfect place in the city center to sit and relax and watch the Mexican people at play. It is safe and clean and well maintained. The surrounding colonial buildings and the cathedral are beautiful. Have a drink and a shoe shine and enjoy life!

277839651.name: Little Europe in the heart of Mexico.
277839651.author: a TripAdvisor user
277839651.reviewBody: Nice and clean and not-so-small city center. It takes more than an hour of brisk walk just to cross it. The city looks very European, more Spanish than Mexican. Most of the center are end of 19 century buildings but there are plenty of 18th century ones. The weather is cooler than in Mexico city, the crowd is relaxed, young and cheerful. it much safer than Mexico City.

277526435.name: Paradise
277526435.author: a TripAdvisor user
277526435.reviewBody: Beautifully maintained center of the city.  Relaxing, good for people-watching.  Lots of romance in the air.

277194194.name: Zoca-woah!
277194194.author: a TripAdvisor user
277194194.reviewBody: Shocked by the interior size of the cathedral, not sure I\'ve ever seen anything quite like it.\n\nEasily accessible and very quiet. Lovely areas to sit outside and places to grab a drink and people watch!

275631530.name: Exuburent City Center
275631530.author: a TripAdvisor user
275631530.reviewBody: There is a lot to do and see in this vibrant city center Zocalo.  There are restaurants and interesting architecture to admire. Open air concerts, street performers, locals selling their wares. A fun way to spend many hours walking around the square and surroundings.

275433115.name: lots of activity
275433115.author: a TripAdvisor user
275433115.reviewBody: a great place to spend time. all of the restaurants under the arches are inviting, the park has plenty of benches to people watch, there is always something going on.

274530070.name: Good place to begin your Puebla adventure
274530070.author: a TripAdvisor user
274530070.reviewBody: This is a great place to begin your exploration of Puebla. There are interesting things from every direction out from the Zocalo. It is an interesting destination in and of itself. Weekends it is a carnival-like atmosphere, with street performers, venders selling sweets and toys. If you like to people watch, it is a great place to get a coffee and snack at one of the cafe\'s around the square.

273613828.name: Excellent experience
273613828.author: a TripAdvisor user
273613828.reviewBody: Excellent place and an absolute must for any visitor to Puebla. Well worth spending an hour or two wandering around and visiting a restaurant or two as well. Don\'t miss it!!

270998508.name: The Heart of Puebla
270998508.author: a TripAdvisor user
270998508.reviewBody: I feel bad for all the business travelers that come to Puebla and don\'t have time to visit the Zocalo.   it is the Heart of Puebla and so rick in culture and History.  I love it every time !

270757166.name: Amazing Experience
270757166.author: a TripAdvisor user
270757166.reviewBody: This is a great place to relax and to experience the culture of Puebla. Beautiful trees line the paths of the zocolo, along with a cool fountain and a gigantic cathedral nearby. Definitely plan to walk through here when visiting Puebla. As a side note, I felt very safe here at all hours of the day and night. It didn\'t seem to get too crowded during the day nor too isolated in the evening.

270487555.name: Walk at the heart of the city
270487555.author: a TripAdvisor user
270487555.reviewBody: This is also a must-visit place when you go to Puebla. This is where you will meet the different people and culture of the city, with lots of establishments (food, banks, etc) to cater needs of tourists.

267757291.name: A true reflection of the city
267757291.author: a TripAdvisor user
267757291.reviewBody: Like many towns in Mexico, the Zocalo is the heart of the community and reflects the people and culture. The Zocalo in Puebla is always alive with varying attractions and vendors. There are many restaurants, stores, and hotels that border the square, and fountains, benches, shade trees, and sculptures in the centre. The tourist information centre, tour bus ticket booth, and bike share station, are also located in the Zocalo.

267741502.name: Puebla\'s Zocalo must not be missed!
267741502.author: a TripAdvisor user
267741502.reviewBody: When in Puebla, one simply must visit the Zocalo area. There are many restaurants and little shops surrounding the area. Banks are here, too - in case you need an ATM or need to exchange currency.

267436941.name: A lot of fun
267436941.author: a TripAdvisor user
267436941.reviewBody: There are always lots of people and Mexican tourists there,  On Sunday, there are Zumba, games, and bicyle riding..

267430221.name: Beautiful at night!
267430221.author: a TripAdvisor user
267430221.reviewBody: Absolutely gorgeous place to walk around at night. All the buildings are lit up in colorful lights and the main plaza is surrounded by lively restaurants and bars. Also, a fun and relaxing place to spend a Sunday afternoon. \n\nESLVentures.com

266163202.name: for tourist is a good example of the traditions
266163202.author: a TripAdvisor user
266163202.reviewBody: Zocalo or main plaza is the place that almost  all cities in Mexico have. Is the place where on Sundays the bands play music, candies, crafts and souvenirs are sold, Some Sundays  senior citizens get together and dance the Danzon music that some say came from Cuba and other say is native from the state of Veracruz. The Zocalo is surrounded by the Portales another Spanish traditional constructions where fine restaurant and really nice food is served. The tourist  busses do a main stop at the Zocalo so you can buy tours around  the city to enjoy the place

265365906.name: Lot\'s of stuff going on!
265365906.author: a TripAdvisor user
265365906.reviewBody: Many good restaurants line the Zocalo as do shops, and the tourism office. The Zocalo itself is beautiful with a large fountain, nice gardens, and a great view of the cathedral! It is not over crowded and they really limit the amount of vendors which is nice! You can also hop on bus tours of the city from here as well.

265151619.name: Second Semana Santa- Crazy Activity!
265151619.author: a TripAdvisor user
265151619.reviewBody: Just want you want, lots of activity at the city center. It was a holiday and this was the place to be. Always something happening.

264035952.name: A must experience when in Puebla!
264035952.author: a TripAdvisor user
264035952.reviewBody:
I went to the Zocalo my first visit to the region and now ever time I plan a return trip regardless if it is alone for business, with business associates or colleagues or soon in July when I bring my husband for his first visit to the region. 

There is nothing you desire that you cannot find here; the best of eats and drinks of all kinds; artists, masters of music.  I highly encourage a week day visit but the weekend festivities are certainly something everyone should experience - the best way I can explain to an American it is your county fair, a neighborhood garage sale, foodie & drink show with entertainers from all backgrounds preforming music, games and dancing! 

I did not observe anything inappropriate or out of the ordinary that would stop me from bringing my 5 yr old grand on a future visit! She would love the dancing and music and who doesn't love trying new foods!

257967108.name: Fantastic
257967108.author: a TripAdvisor user
257967108.reviewBody: We were in Puebla 28 th Feb for 3 days, and stayed one street from the Zocalo. It is large, clean , organised, has one of the best Cathedrals I have ever seen, it is safe, has wonderful bars & restaurants offering many delights, it has a tourist information centre giving out free maps & free information to assist tourists enjoy the city. You can board the city tour bus from the Zocalo, it has events happening every weekend which are great to see. This is everything that Oaxaca\'s Zocalo was not, which I had the misfortune to visit a few days earlier. However the best thing about the Zocalo in Puebla is the people themselves.The people are proud of Puebla, pleased to have visitors and respect the space itself. No crime, no dirt or mess, just friendly, happy people.A must see on a trip to Puebla.

256090900.name: Lively
256090900.author: a TripAdvisor user
256090900.reviewBody: I could have spent a week in the zocola eating, drinking and watching the show around me.    There was activity everywhere ...dancing, people on stilts, mimes )I guess they weren\'t activity), a marching band with added hand drums that gave a \nLatin beat to the marching songs.

256038682.name: Was super crowded
256038682.author: a TripAdvisor user
256038682.reviewBody: A large park with trees in front of the cathedral. Quite charming. On weekends, there are people dancing to Latino music, selling balloons, playing games. We went on Valentine\'s weekend, which was quite unpleasant because there were way to many people.

255870035.name: Pleasant place to relax and people-watch
255870035.author: a TripAdvisor user
255870035.reviewBody: Puebla\'s Zocalo is a delightful place. The tempo is relaxed and the people friendly. The beautiful park is a gathering place for the local people. Plentiful balloon sellers offer large selections of multicolored balloons, children play and older people rest on plentiful park benches. Surrounding the zocalo are restaurants of all kinds, offering both indoor and outdoor seating. We especially enjoyed sitting outside, under the umbrellas, watching the crowds while we enjoyed a traditional Mexican meal or a snack of ice cream. The only drawback to sitting outside is that it makes one a target for beggars and peddlars.

255768825.name: Awesome
255768825.author: a TripAdvisor user
255768825.reviewBody: Best zocalo in mexico, lots of shops and restaurants, lots of activities. Great to stroll around at night, very safe.

253390073.name: The Heart of a City
253390073.author: a TripAdvisor user
253390073.reviewBody: The Zocalo is the true heart of Puebla .Traditional ,peaceful ,historic ,lively ,full of fun .Restaurants galore  to fill your every need .

253307854.name: Zocalo, Puebla
253307854.author: a TripAdvisor user
253307854.reviewBody: The Zocalo in Puebla is a beautiful spot and a highlight in Puebla. You can enjoy a good coffee, icecream or a great Mexican meal in the neighbourhood.

252326646.name: Wonderful Park
252326646.author: a TripAdvisor user
252326646.reviewBody: We really enjoyed visiting the park every day and night.  On the weekends there are lots of entertainers.  Lots of activity!

252272064.name: So much to visit here. Don\'t forget it
252272064.author: a TripAdvisor user
252272064.reviewBody:
It is very hard to place in such a small space ALL you can visit in this area called the Zocalo and or the Down Town Mexico City area.
You must go there, take the red Turibus and step down for a small walk if you are short of time. Or in even tighter schedule, take a cab or the Subway.
On the other hand if you can allocate a couple of days, then you will get the sense for this. The visit is awesome really, full of contrast and history. The food is great, old "real" cantinas. Spanish restaurants. Bars. Coffe places, that are roasting the coffee in front of you and the whole street smells delicious!
Believe me you will get the true feeling of the City here.
Be street wise. Don't stay till late. Plan your visit!
Enjoy

250024144.name: Family friendly
250024144.author: a TripAdvisor user
250024144.reviewBody: Great to see so many happy families playing in the Zocola. On Sunday\'s the zocola has entertainment with clowns and music.  The resturants around the square are good to sit and watch all the fun..

249502833.name: Relaxing, yet full of life
249502833.author: a TripAdvisor user
249502833.reviewBody: This is a beautiful square with a fountain and very mature trees (individually labeled with their botanical names), and plenty of bench seating.  Kids feeding (and chasing) the pigeons, lovers, families, and at times music.

249363584.name: Zocalo was hopping
249363584.author: a TripAdvisor user
249363584.reviewBody: We were there over New Year\'s Eve and the place was crazy with people.  Almost to the point you could not walk.  The Zocalo has many restaurants that are on all sides.  Food and drinks were reasonable and a great place to people watch.

249165267.name: Very cute during Christmas
249165267.author: a TripAdvisor user
249165267.reviewBody: We visited Puebla shortly before Christmas and the Zocalo was beautifully decorated and even a small Christmas market, a sledge slope and an ice skating ring were set up. It was especially nice during night.\n\nThere are several restaurants around the Zocalo, some of them seemed very touristy while many catered to locals (we tried a few) and served good food.

248529576.name: Beautiful City Square!
248529576.author: a TripAdvisor user
248529576.reviewBody: The Puebla city square is impressive as is the rest of the old city.  There are a plethora of trees lining the streets are many places serving delicious food.  We ate at Taqueria Los Angeles and ate tasty Tacos Arabes and Tacos al Pastor.

246103079.name: Lovely place to have a drink and relax
246103079.author: a TripAdvisor user
246103079.reviewBody: The zocalo is surrended by numerous cafes and restaurants which allow you to relax while enjoying the view of the wonderful cathedrale. A great way to relax before contunuing to explore this beautiful UNESCO city.

245843227.name: A tree lined park with benches to rest weary legs.
245843227.author: a TripAdvisor user
245843227.reviewBody:
A lovely meeting place with cool fountains, pleasing trees, street cafes and shopping areas. There were a large variety of food available. Shopping for Mexican produced items could not have been cheaper. Cotton garments, toys, day-to-day requirements were all being sold in small and medium sized shops. Even international branded goods were available.

There are a large number of historical attractions accessible on foot from here. There are hop-on, hop-off buses also available from one side of the Zocalo. 

There is not much of public parking space in the vicinity.

245765185.name: A very nice place tu visit, special on Crhistmas.
245765185.author: a TripAdvisor user
245765185.reviewBody: Puebla, Mexico, is a beautiful City, friendly people, good food, cheeps prices and to many places to visit.

245139587.name: CHRISTMASS TIME
245139587.author: a TripAdvisor user
245139587.reviewBody: Stroll around the place, enjoy all the street vendors and the lightnings of the surrounding buildings and the Zocalo itself.\nLet your shoes shine by one of the stalls and sit down in a bank and watch people and children enjoy this beautiful place, in one of the outdoor restaurants which fence the Zocalo. Or try some of the many food stalls decorated seasonally which are place around the square.\nSpecially in Christmas Time it\u00b4s a magical place.

244735725.name: Very lively town suare
244735725.author: a TripAdvisor user
244735725.reviewBody: I visited in December and the Zocalo is all decked out for Christmas.  In addition to the usual decorations and music there was a skating rink, a mini ski slope and a small area for kids to play in the snow.  This is a good place to have a coffee at one of the many adjacent restaurants and take in a bit of the local life.

244365432.name: town square
244365432.author: a TripAdvisor user
244365432.reviewBody: we saw the cathedral and the markets nearby and just chilled in the small shops around this area.sat by the fountain and watched the world go by as we ate. quite clean and calm. no parking though

242616571.name: A place to relax and enjoy!
242616571.author: a TripAdvisor user
242616571.reviewBody: Most Mexican cities have a central park, called Zocalo.  In Puebla, Zocalo is truly the hub of activity as visitors and families  are there all the time.  It is a beautiful town square, lushly landscaped and full of fountains, monuments and other things of interest.  As well, one can enjoy delicious food and drink at the many restaurants (ranging from American burger joints to upscale Poblano foods).  I highly recommend resting and enjoying a coffee beverage at one of the Italian Coffee Company locations located on any of the four side of the square.

242190214.name: must see
242190214.author: a TripAdvisor user
242190214.reviewBody: must see,  the heart of historic puebla.  true colonial mexican town and walkable.  many restaurants near central square. open air bus leave from  here.  can walk up cinch de mayo street heading north. hotels here are older as the buildings go back to 1500s.

241191880.name: Vibrant historical area
241191880.author: a TripAdvisor user
241191880.reviewBody: Clean, well maintained, great cathedra views. Impressive civic buildings. Great selection of bars, restaurants. Easy walking.

240269306.name: Just rest here for some time
240269306.author: a TripAdvisor user
240269306.reviewBody: Not too great to loose the overview. In the arcades take a break for coffee, lunch, dinner or just a drink.

240205263.name: Nice walk
240205263.author: a TripAdvisor user
240205263.reviewBody: Very nice place for a walk! Interesting picture taken with big P U E B L A letters!\n\nIt can get really cramped sometimes.

239331382.name: Glorious catedral dominating the square.
239331382.author: a TripAdvisor user
239331382.reviewBody: Bustling square with a wonderful cathedral dominating. Colonial buildings surrounding here, lots of bars and restaurants and shops on the adjoining streets. Lovely gardens within the square and as we were there, the Christmas decorations were just put up.

239131001.name: Fun to walk through
239131001.author: a TripAdvisor user
239131001.reviewBody: We visited on the same day as the local Pride march, which was great fun. But the restaurants and bars around the Zocalo are overpriced and overlooked.

238981987.name: One of the best Zocalos of Mexico
238981987.author: a TripAdvisor user
238981987.reviewBody: This is a very charming place... it does not have many tourists so you will feel like real Mexico. You will see families strolling around and couples sitting in the benches kissing..

238682059.name: As beautiful as the capital
238682059.author: a TripAdvisor user
238682059.reviewBody: The Puebla Zocalo it\' s not so large of the capital Mexico City, but it charming as well.\nThe square is full of great restaurants and cafe, and it\' s there you can take the tour bus to see all the atractions on the town.

237668515.name: Zocalo as enchanting as it should be
237668515.author: a TripAdvisor user
237668515.reviewBody: The zocalo in Puebla is one of the most beautiful plazas (main square) that we\'ve seen. Green, clean, well maintained. It clearly shows the pride of the people of Puebla for their city.

237644204.name: The place to be for Dia de Muertos
237644204.author: a TripAdvisor user
237644204.reviewBody: I was lucky enough to be in the right place for Dia de Muertos , it was an experience to see young and adults dress up for Dia de Muertos. Lots of activities and fun in a square that is nicely kept, the gardens are beautiful and well maintained and all around full of many places to seek. Don\'t miss zocalo in Puebla since a everyone happens there and get a table by the balcony in Los Nevados restaurant for the cherry on top

235416584.name: Historic and Vibey
235416584.author: a TripAdvisor user
235416584.reviewBody: There are a number of restuarants and inter esting stores to be found around the Zocalo - which is right next to the Catherdral.  There is a restuarant called Nevados which is on the 1st floor but the entrance is down a side passage.  Go there and experience great hospitality, food and signature cocktails!

233208132.name: A small town feel like
233208132.author: a TripAdvisor user
