233208132.reviewBody: Although Puebla is a big city, you feel you are in a small and cosy town. Lots of shops and people seem to be very friendly. My family and I felt very safe at all times.

230647725.name: The heart of Puebla
230647725.author: a TripAdvisor user
230647725.reviewBody: Breath the lively atmoshphere in the evening, nice bars and restaurants. Also walk the surrounding streets, e.g. candy street.

229321165.name: its where it all happens!
229321165.author: a TripAdvisor user
229321165.reviewBody: just wish that the city council would ban traffic around the zocalo as this would so enhance the strolling experience. As it is - its all a bit polluted as car fumes seem to sit in the square. This is a great pity as its a really happening square - great for people watching and vibe.  Having said that the square (like the rest of Puebla) is really neat and surprisingly (given the volume of people) clean.

226793812.name: Great people watching plaza
226793812.author: a TripAdvisor user
226793812.reviewBody: One of the beautiful central plazas in mexico, with trees, balloons, lovers, kids, portals with restaurants flack the side of this elegant and lively zocalao

226020220.name: Nice
226020220.author: a TripAdvisor user
226020220.reviewBody: Good place to visit and have a cup of cofee. You can Enjoy the sight of the cathedral ,specially in the night

225985616.name: Typical Sunday
225985616.author: a TripAdvisor user
225985616.reviewBody:
The Zocalo is the central hub for activities in Puebla.  One spots singles, couples and entire families especially on weekends.

One striking fact is that in spite of all the people, the entire Zocalo is being constantly cleaned and swept by City employees!  Even the smallest piece of paper disappears in short order.

A great example of the vibrancy of the people of Puebla!

224337523.name: fine but ...
224337523.author: a TripAdvisor user
224337523.reviewBody: Go there to have a feel of what the core center of Puebla looks like. It is very busy, rather touristic and not as beautiful or typical as other areas of Puebla can be. Other areas in town are more authentic to my taste (Parke San Francisco). Many tour buses start from there and it is a convenient way (and cheap!) to discover the city.

223301840.name: Very beautiful colonial buldings
223301840.author: a TripAdvisor user
223301840.reviewBody: The Zocalo is pretty, surrounded by nice colonial buildings, museums, little restaurants and shops. It has a very Mexican feeling. It\u2019s kept very well maintained and clean.  It\u2019s nice to go there by an ice cream and just seat relax and watch people pass by, I went in July and the weather was warm and perfect, although it can get very hot we were lucky.The Zocalo is pretty surrounded by nice colonial buildings and full of people and nice little restaurants

222525170.name: Full of life!!!
222525170.author: a TripAdvisor user
222525170.reviewBody: This is a place for people to meet people, to enjoy the plaza and have fun, its surrunded by historic buildings and nice outdoor cafes and restaurants.

222511584.name: Is The Plaza ( DOWNTOWN.)
222511584.author: a TripAdvisor user
222511584.reviewBody: Downtown, bars, restaurants all around this beautiful plaza. And is also a good point to meet when you get lost in the city.

221762136.name: Lovely square for strolling and relaxing
221762136.author: a TripAdvisor user
221762136.reviewBody: The Zocalo in Puebla is a very harmonious square in typical Spanish colonial style. The central area, laid out as a park, nice in itself, is surrounded on 3 sides by low, 2-3 storey, period buildings with arcaded terraces as well as street-side tables. The fourth side is filled by a side-view of the impressive cathedral. We spent a very pleasant couple of hours early evening having a drink and people watching, as many locals took their evening stroll.

215626521.name: Well preserved and excellent to start your tour
215626521.author: a TripAdvisor user
215626521.reviewBody: The view and the shadow from its trees. This main square is the heart of the city. You can take some tours from here. And visit to the cathedral

214562385.name: Still lovely
214562385.author: a TripAdvisor user
214562385.reviewBody: One of our favorite zocalos in Mexico, which is saying a lot, because of the many tall trees and ever changing art displays. However, we were disappointed to see a McDonalds right on the square. It did affect the character of this otherwise charming space.

214328661.name: Great for a stroll
214328661.author: a TripAdvisor user
214328661.reviewBody: I was very impressed with how clean and tranquil the zocalo was. There was always something going on, from soccer games to concerts. It was great to spend a few evenings strolling along, enjoying coffee and food in the variety of restaurants that border it.

211233972.name: Historical place
211233972.author: a TripAdvisor user
211233972.reviewBody: there a lot of information that you can get and read from this places \nnear to the commerce district \na lot of traditional candy

209400581.name: Amazing!!
209400581.author: a TripAdvisor user
209400581.reviewBody: Beautiful Zocalo with lots of things to do.  They have some great coffee shops surrounding the Zocalo.  It\'s a great spot to just relax, sip an espresso, and people watch.

208374840.name: Good for the Photographic Memory
208374840.author: a TripAdvisor user
208374840.reviewBody: The Zocalo is a good starting point for viewing the various European influences in the architecture of the surrounding roads. The Zocalo itself provides some shade against the heat of the sun at any time of day. A photogenic square it is a must for the brief visitor wanting to capture some quick memories of Puebla.

207758687.name: Quintessential Colonial Mexico
207758687.author: a TripAdvisor user
207758687.reviewBody: The Zocalo or main plaza is a charming square dating to the city\'s inception in 1531. It is flanked on each side by beautiful colonial buildings including, the cathedral, and city hall. Sit on a bench relax and enjoy.

203670281.name: Relax for a moment!
203670281.author: a TripAdvisor user
203670281.reviewBody: Very cool place to hang out and there is actually free wi-fi in the park. Having said that, you can\'t always get a good signal, so don\'t depend on it. At night there are balloons for sale. There is also water shooting out of the parking area so kids can play in that. The cathedral is on one side of the Zocalo and there are a lot of restaurants on the other side (though I can recommend against the crepes).

203324857.name: The perfect place to enjoy life!
203324857.author: a TripAdvisor user
203324857.reviewBody: Sitting on a bench in the Zocalo...reading, relaxing...and boom...all of a sudden there is a clown show to watch...then a symphony orchestra is playing...then a bugle and drum band is practicing...then a group of young students conducting an interview of English speakers....this is life in Puebla...always exciting, always something different happening.  We went there every day and some times twice a day just to enjoy the real Mexican experience!

202426420.name: The Zocalo
202426420.author: a TripAdvisor user
202426420.reviewBody: The Zocalo is a park and meeting place, and is the heart and soul with every city in Mexico. Amost everything worth seeing sort of spirals off it. When you go to see a city everything is in within walking distance of the Zocalo.\n\nSpend the day people watching in the zoo club. What\'s the children play, what\'s the musicians clay, interact with the students that want to practice English, watch young lovers kissing on a park bench unless you need, we just watched people walking by and the normal routine. Wonderful past time when you visit in the country. Embrace it.

201937455.name: Cool Area to Hangout
201937455.author: a TripAdvisor user
201937455.reviewBody: While we saw very few American tourists on our trip to Puebla we did make friends with lots of tourists from all over Mexico! This seems to be where most tourists congregate in the evening to enjoy the warm air and some good food. \n\nThere are several restaurants around the square. There is also a tourist information center where we were able to book a night tour of Puebla for 100 pesos.

201596537.name: I love the Zocalos in Mexico
201596537.author: a TripAdvisor user
201596537.reviewBody: They are great places watch people enjoy themselves at all times of the day but particularly in the evening. Vendors of all types, children, young lovers, families, and even tourists. The one in Puebla is great and certainly good for a few hours in the evening. Get a seat in a restaurant with outside seating, there are lots of choices.

201337314.name: Great architectre (Barroco)
201337314.author: a TripAdvisor user
201337314.reviewBody: The second biggesst Cathedral that I have seen and watch after. San Pedro in Rome\nExample of Barroco architecture\nA most seen

201214504.name: Great Place
201214504.author: a TripAdvisor user
201214504.reviewBody: It doesn\'t matter the hour of the day or your budget, I think it\'s one of the most beautiful downtowns in Mexico... You can walk around and get to the Rosario Chapel, la plaza known as "Los Sapos" and the Cathedral and you\'ll have a great time, very recommended

198590705.name: Stroll the plaza of old mexico
198590705.author: a TripAdvisor user
198590705.reviewBody: The fountain, the cathedral, the people, the traffic, the hotels, the life that is the center of Puebla is found in the Zocalo.  You will be mesemerized by this place.  The are ample restaurants to enjoy the food and the ambiance.  Ask for a table at the window, you won\'t be disappointed.

197546973.name: Wonderful Main Square
197546973.author: a TripAdvisor user
197546973.reviewBody: Great place to people watch.  Lots of shops and restaurants and of course the cathedral takes pride of place.

196592507.name: The heart of Puebla
196592507.author: a TripAdvisor user
196592507.reviewBody:
We went at Christmas season so the Zocalo was packed with stages and stands. I've love to see it in its natural, uncrowded state, but still we loved it. The Zocalo is rung with shops and restaurants. 

I especially like the very small, but excellent book store that  specializes in Mexican history and art. The store, I wish it I noted the name, has a reading table and you're welcome to sit down and examine the books you might want to buy. No pressure. 

We also saw a traveling exhibit of puppet show stages from the Czech Republic in a gallery on the Zocalo. Fascinating and delightful. Mexico is a land of wonder and unexpected surprises.

195895700.name: Nice hang out
195895700.author: a TripAdvisor user
195895700.reviewBody: Great for people watching and traditional mexical life.  Wonderful baloon sellers, cafe life around the park and a quiet presence in the city.

193600604.name: Clean, friendly and beautiful
193600604.author: a TripAdvisor user
193600604.reviewBody: Too bad there is a mcdonalds and a subway.  But try not to look in that direction.  There is plenty of colonial architecture to see.  Nice restaurants too.

192594387.name: The place to be in Puebla
192594387.author: a TripAdvisor user
192594387.reviewBody: This main plaza of Puebla is beautiful with the cathedral on one side and restaurants all around. There is food service till 2 am at some of the places. I went to the OXXO and bought a beer (serveral one at a time) and drank them causally in the plaza. Great people watching place.

191942159.name: Beautiful
191942159.author: a TripAdvisor user
191942159.reviewBody: You have to make a stop here, take a walk in the portales and go to Cathedral, the architecture is exquisit, just take in count the traffic jams, it\'s really crowded.

190333895.name: Lively, Colonial Square
190333895.author: a TripAdvisor user
190333895.reviewBody: You can do much worse than the Zocalo in Puebla. Yummy eateries, great dulcerias and all the street life that you never get in the USA abound. A great way to spend an afternoon chowing on tacos al pastor, people watching, and living la vida Mexicana.

189922750.name: Wonderful Experience
189922750.author: a TripAdvisor user
189922750.reviewBody: Great place to visit (day-time & night-time) especially during the Holiday season!  Had the best mole in Mexico at the hotel\'s restaurant (can\'t remember the name) on this square!

187220925.name: Central Park
187220925.author: a TripAdvisor user
187220925.reviewBody: Enjoy watching venders and children playing. Its a lovely park. Everything there is worth seeing. Shopping, coffee, foods, and the colors and the music. Be prepared to have groups of 4 or 5 students practice their languages on you. Very cute.

184774762.name: Nicer zocalo than most
184774762.author: a TripAdvisor user
184774762.reviewBody: Puebla\'s pretty zocalo seems to be busy both during the day and at night; the evening also brings beautiful views of the illuminated cathedral and park areas.

184011636.name: Teaming with life
184011636.author: a TripAdvisor user
184011636.reviewBody: We happened to be here a day before \'dia de Los muertos\' and the Zocalo was pumping with zombies, smurfs, clowns, calaveras and even chucky was there.\nThis is a must see. \nIf you go to Puebla and fail to visit the Zocalo there\'s something wrong with you.

182778793.name: Cool for people watching
182778793.author: a TripAdvisor user
182778793.reviewBody: This square is nice; not as large as I thought it would be but easy to get about when it\'s not too crowded. It\'s good for having a break and taking in the Puebla scene. It\'s surrounded by loads of shops, cafes, restaurants and street vendors selling various items. \nOn one side is the beautiful Municipal Palace and on the other is the impressive Puebla Cathedral.

182400393.name: Very attractive trees.
182400393.author: a TripAdvisor user
182400393.reviewBody: Many of the parks we visited in Mexico lacked the mature trees that this area has. Nice fountain in the center and a great place to sit and people watch. When we were there, a military marine exhibit was going on which made things much more congested but still nice.

181026735.name: Great for a nice walk
181026735.author: a TripAdvisor user
181026735.reviewBody: This is a great place for a walk, you can see lovely restaurants, the cathetral and some shops where you can buy local candies, souvenirs, etc.

180362957.name: Lively and Pretty Zocalo
180362957.author: a TripAdvisor user
180362957.reviewBody: It was Sunday in Puebla so the closed streets around the Zocalo were filled with families and balloons.  I enjoyed walking through the trees and gardens of the Zocalo and the narrow pedestrian streets that branch of from it.

180176148.name: Main Square Puebla
180176148.author: a TripAdvisor user
180176148.reviewBody: Very nicely kept, the "Zocalo" or main town square is a worthwile visit, plenty of restaurants and coffee shops in the area, and many nice colonial monuments are nearby.

178337267.name: The heart of Puebla
178337267.author: a TripAdvisor user
178337267.reviewBody: "Z\u00f3calo" is not really the right name for this main square of Puebla.  Historically, the word z\u00f3calo only applies to the main square in M\u00e9xico City where during several years the pedestal (or "z\u00f3calo") of an unfinished monument gave the name to the place. This said, the main square of Puebla is the right place to meet and start your journey through numerous monuments, restaurants and interesting places to visit in this magnificent city. A couple of blocks in any direction from the square you have the best museums, churches, restaurants, etc. And the square itself is interesting, because everyone goes there just to see each other, to have the sense that we still live in a small society.

177728233.name: Nice
177728233.author: a TripAdvisor user
177728233.reviewBody: It\'s like every Zocalo around there are a lot\'s of restaurant but there are not really good. It\'s a small Zocalo.

174747267.name: Z\u00f3calo
174747267.author: a TripAdvisor user
174747267.reviewBody: The z\u00f3calo is the central meeting place for family and friends. It is cool and breezy with enormous laurel trees. Many times, especially Friday afternoons, there are live musical performances.

174200333.name: Puebla Zocalo
174200333.author: a TripAdvisor user
174200333.reviewBody: The Zocalo, teh center of Peubla, its a great place for a walk, a coffee, dinner and walk sightseeing. Its beautifull and well maintained. Its also good to walk around at the end of the day when they light up town.

171992521.name: Always something to do.
171992521.author: a TripAdvisor user
171992521.reviewBody: If you don\'t know what to do during your visit to Puebla you can do what I did... go to the Zocalo, there are always things going on including many FREE concerts.

171269069.name: Great place to get a feel of the town
171269069.author: a TripAdvisor user
171269069.reviewBody: I love zocalos in Mexican towns, they are usually full of life. My wife and I went to Puebla for 3 days, and every day there was something in the zocalo: a saxophone concert, a mariachi concert, some religious group visiting from another town and singing their "My Lord"s etc. It is truly the heart of Puebla!

169989867.name: Zocalo de Puebla WOW
169989867.author: a TripAdvisor user
169989867.reviewBody: If you visiting Puebla, You must stop by ZOCALO.  It is Mexico COLONIAL,Try to visit the near by Churchs and walk aroun it is amazing experience.

169752379.name: Best on weekend
169752379.author: a TripAdvisor user
169752379.reviewBody: During the week the Zocalo is pleasant enough, but it really comes alive on the weekend, especially Sunday.  Usually there is music, lots of activity -- vendors, exhibits, clowns, lots of Poblanos because it\'s an enjoyable way to spend a day with the family that doesn\'t cost anything apart from snack type foods.   I personally dislike clowns but they are a big part of the culture.  It\'s safe at night, the crafts and restaurants are just O.K.  Save your $$ and do a little research to find the best food and crafts.

169665236.name: The best Cathedral in Latin America!!
169665236.author: a TripAdvisor user
169665236.reviewBody: Visit the City of the Angels , Founded in 1531 to St Michael, between  Mexico City and Veracruz with the best food in the East side of Mexico

166561484.name: Good to fell Puebla
166561484.author: a TripAdvisor user
166561484.reviewBody: The place worths a walk, with cafes, restaurants, some craft stores and the cathedral. I felt safe to walk there in the night.

164528736.name: A good place to people watch
164528736.author: a TripAdvisor user
164528736.reviewBody: Puebla zocalo is a pleasant place to while away your time people watching. There are plenty of cafes and restaurants around the square as well as the cathedral.

164109359.name: a nice square to visit on a sunday
164109359.author: a TripAdvisor user
164109359.reviewBody: Zocalo on a sunday is a fun place to visit , seat and relax. There are plenty of vendors plying their wares , dancing and music too. security is utmost as police are found in every corner of the square. it is easily reached by metro.. By the way , we found using the metro is safe even at night .

160091634.name: The Center of Puebla is it\'s Heartbeat!
160091634.author: a TripAdvisor user
160091634.reviewBody: If you get to visit this amazing city, you will no doubt have a chance to walk in it\'s Zocalo dotted with manicured flower gardens, beautiful iron benches, fountains and large established trees. Cafes surround it along with the Cathedral and the Presidential Palace. This cosmopolitan park is a great place to sit and rest your feet. It\'s a great spot to watch Poblanos living their busy lives. Enjoy!

158758642.name: As it should be
158758642.author: a TripAdvisor user
158758642.reviewBody:
The zocalo, and in fact all of the historic centre' has been dramatically improved over the last few years. 

Puebla is an ever growing city in terms of population and the spread of the city and it is good to see that time and effort has been taken to ensure the historic centre is kept up to scratch.

Not as fancy or snobby as Angelopolis or some of the shopping centres that are dotted around town but the centre makes for a nice walk to wander past the many churches, independent shops and stalls in a relaxed and now very clean environment and compared to other parts of the city it is very pram friendly.

157298220.name: Action central
157298220.author: a TripAdvisor user
157298220.reviewBody: We arrived in Puebla  late  on a Saturday night. We were directed to the Zocalo by hotel staff as a place where we would find something to eat. The streets leading from our hotel to the square were deserted but the square was a hub of a activity. Vendors selling balloons, food, trinkets, families eating out, musicians entertains at the outdoor restaurants. There was definitely a holiday spirit in this crowd of local Pueblans!

157188432.name: Center of City of Puebla
157188432.author: a TripAdvisor user
157188432.reviewBody: Puebla\'s zocolo is one of the largest in Mexico.  The large fountain in the zocolo is a favorite spot for photographs.  Next to the zocolo is the main cathedral of the City of Puebla, which will rival the great cathedrals of Europe.

156898759.name: Beautiful Zocalo
156898759.author: a TripAdvisor user
156898759.reviewBody: Great place to walk around and enjoy the scenery.  The zocalo is very charming with bright colored buildings and a friendly atmosphere.

154977588.name: Good place for pictures of the Cathedral.
154977588.author: a TripAdvisor user
154977588.reviewBody: It is a rather medium park, nothing much to do, just walk around and take pictures. You can get good shots of the towers of the cathedral from here.

153896999.name: One of the best
153896999.author: a TripAdvisor user
153896999.reviewBody:
We live in Mexico, and once a month try to visit a new area of the country to learn more about our adopted country.

Aside from where we live (Queretaro) Puebla is one of our favorite cities. This was our second visit and it is just as charming as it was the first time. 

The zocolo is the heart of this colonial city as it is in numerous other Mexican places. But, this one is special. It is large and filled with beautiful fountains, beautiful people and many green natural areas. We love it. Lots of restaurants are located nearby and shops. There is also an excellent city tour that leaves from here.

One of our favorite things about this area is when you leave the zocolo there is a long, wide pedestrian walkway with lots of shops and eateries and a really nice plaza with lots of really cool stores.

I am sure this would be worth your while to visit!

153812476.name: The Town Square is the Place to Be
153812476.author: a TripAdvisor user
153812476.reviewBody: This is a lovely place to visit and on weekends they have special events with bands and dancers.  It is nice to just sit and watch the people go by too. This is also where you can catch a tour bus to various locations. So much going on and still a great place to relax!

153259285.name: Awesome place to spend a Sunday
153259285.author: a TripAdvisor user
153259285.reviewBody: This place is always filled with activity but it is best enjoyed on weekends when all the locals come out to walk around.

152585418.name: Pretty Zocalo
152585418.author: a TripAdvisor user
152585418.reviewBody: Puebla has a really nice and well-kept zocalo. There is an Italian Coffee Company store on every street (what\'s up with that?), it\'s busy with people, pretty as well. It\'d be nicer without cars, but that\'d be asking for too much.

152046719.name: Pretty and fun to people watch.
152046719.author: a TripAdvisor user
152046719.reviewBody: Landscaping is nice. Take a seat on one of the benches and just people watch. Nice place to chill and just admire the Cathedral.

151145435.name: Zocalo is the place to gather!
151145435.author: a TripAdvisor user
151145435.reviewBody:
The Zocalo in Puebla or Plaza Principal .is the place to gather ether with friends,family or if you want to meet someone or have a date with a good friend. 
The Zocalo has been for ever since the 1500 hundreds,since Puebla was built and ever since has so much history and memories to many of us that we lived or had visit the beautiful city of Puebla.
The Zocalo has beautiful fountains just live Spain and lots of benches to sit around, lots of trees and the whistle of sound from the nature of all kinds of birds that come and go.
It has a multicultural people that visit the Zocalo from turist to Native Puebla people called Poblanos,,and most days you will find all kinds of vendors with balloons,clowns and all kinds of people trying to sell to you arts and craft's ...the Zocalo faces the beautiful Catedral of Puebla and Los Portales where you will find all kinds of restaurants and arts and craft.

150617076.name: A vibrant central square
150617076.author: a TripAdvisor user
150617076.reviewBody: There is always something going on in Puebla\'s zocalo and plenty to see: clowns, vendors of all sorts...the people watching is superb. There are places to sit in the square or you can grab a seat at one of the restaurants or cafes lining the square.  Not to be missed.

149903809.name: Lively City Square
149903809.author: a TripAdvisor user
149903809.reviewBody: There was a lovely public art installation and a political rally when I was there.  Also, it was definitely the hang out for teenage lovers.

148564457.name: Great restaurants and plenty of people watching
148564457.author: a TripAdvisor user
148564457.reviewBody: Mi Viejo Pueblito has a great staff and a wonderful kids area. My normally shy four-year-old went with the woman willingly and came back with a handmade ornament. Food is over-priced, but that\'s to be expected given the location.

147514817.name: Very nice near the cathedral.
147514817.author: a TripAdvisor user
147514817.reviewBody: Puebla\'s Zocalo has existed since the founding of the city in 1531 but was mainly used as a marketplace until the 1700s. Throughout history it has been a meeting place and social center of the city. This tree-lined square is surrounded by a variety of shops and restaurants.

147371195.name: Historic hearth of Puebla
147371195.author: a TripAdvisor user
147371195.reviewBody: On the weekend there lots of people around, the place gets lively till around 8 pm.  There are restaurants and bars where you can sit outside where you aways keep sight of the Cathedral.

147331283.name: The Puebla Zocalo,  4 plus
147331283.author: a TripAdvisor user
147331283.reviewBody: The zocalo in Puebla is the one against which all others should be judged.  It has magnificent plantings, charming sculpture and is surrounded by handsome buildings, Many of them magnificent works of art in their own right.  Not only that, but it attracts a wonderful crowd into the evening and is close to many fine restaurants open late for dinner.  Wow! Can you hardly wait to be there?

147215958.name: A fun night out
147215958.author: a TripAdvisor user
147215958.reviewBody: There are great places to eat all around the central square.  We were in town on a holiday weekend and it was a great place to hang out.  There is a tourist market about 8 or 9 blocks away that we had to get directions too.

146577541.name: Nice place to stroll around
146577541.author: a TripAdvisor user
146577541.reviewBody: The great thing is that it is also very close to various other things, like the artisans market and lots of restaurants.  The guides at the tourism center were very helpful in recommending local attractions.  Nice and clean center...

146558663.name: A TASTE OF MEXICO
146558663.author: a TripAdvisor user
146558663.reviewBody: Take your time to enjoy a Mexican dish under the "portal" while you listen to folklore music in this charming spot.

145139398.name: Nice and relaxing
145139398.author: a TripAdvisor user
145139398.reviewBody:
On our way through Mexico we also stopped in the nice town of Puebla. Like many Mexican cities there is a Zocalo - the main Plaza/Square. That's mostly where the heart and life of the town is.

The Zocalo in Puebla is a really nice one. Lots of space to walk and opportunities to sit and relax. It's surrounded by many Hotels and Restaurants and flanked by a lovely Cathedral (the tallest in Mexico) on one side.
It's great to sit down in a restaurant, get a drink and just do some people-watching. That's what we did (after it got dark) and we enjoyed it very much. Many places here offer the same kind of food and have similar menus. So it doesn't really matter much where to sit down. Especially if you're only drinking (best food is not on the Zocalo - try the "El Mural de los Poblanos"). Later at night the area might get a bit deserted (after around 10pm), so if you feel uneasy about that you should head "home" before.

The Zocalo is really good fun for two, three hours. And if you get bored, stroll around the nice walking street called "Cinqo de Mayo" just next to the Zocalo.

Wanna know more about my trips? Check my profile where you'll also find my website with more info about my travels.

145104894.name: Great Trees
145104894.author: a TripAdvisor user
145104894.reviewBody: Protests everyday make this zocalo one of the most active I\'ve seen in Mexico. Very clean, lots of shade and the food under the porticos was not bad at all.

144384349.name: The main square in Puebla
144384349.author: a TripAdvisor user
144384349.reviewBody: Very nice, very pleasant, a lot of activity going on; the city tour bus (recomended) leaves from one of the square sidewalks. There are severeal good restaurants around the square ... forgot their names ... a Tco restaurant, an talian restaurant and a Hotel that places tables in the sidewalk.: the three are good. Families, children, locals, tourists. everybody is in and around the Zocalo. Sat and Sun are the best days to visit, even the municipal band plays classic music in teh square.

143555402.name: Beautiful Historic Area
143555402.author: a TripAdvisor user
143555402.reviewBody: The Zocalo is where you want to stay if you are going to Puebla. There are numerous hotels to chose from. There is a beautiful square with a fountain lined by hotels and restaurants on three sides and the cathedral on the fourth side. It is also a short walk to El Parian and the artists district, which is where you can buy a lot of souvenirs. The restaurants along the square are pricey, which means you would pay about the same as in the US. If you venture off a couple of blocks from the square, you can find really great little restaurants with really good prices. We ate lunch for 6 people and paid about $16.

142910438.name: Eat at the Main Plaza!
142910438.author: a TripAdvisor user
142910438.reviewBody: The Main Plaza called Zocalo is full of interesting things to watch. We ate and have a beer there and the feeling of being in a colonial city was incredible. The guys selling balloons and the people just walking around are incredible.\n\n

142684941.name: Fun & Exciting
142684941.author: a TripAdvisor user
142684941.reviewBody: Great variety of foods, drinks, shopping and things to do!  Tons of local eateries and also your typical chain restaurants like McDonalds, Burger Kins, and KFC.

141616577.name: Walking
141616577.author: a TripAdvisor user
141616577.reviewBody: Zocalo is the place to walk anytime during the day , have lunch, ice-cream, in the evening go for a drink, walk around the  center plaza.

140833360.name: great vacations
140833360.author: a TripAdvisor user
140833360.reviewBody: ive recently been traveling alot, im trying to go to as many states as i can in this year and zocalo is one amazing place i loved the atmosphere there and theres so many people from everywhere and locals too its just so beautiful. i was in puebla for about 5 days and im glad i went to el zocalo. theres restaurants there with music and the food is delicious. Me and my girlfriend are definetly going back there for more days.

140503053.name: Hub of Activity
140503053.author: a TripAdvisor user
140503053.reviewBody: Definitely the place to start exploring the "centro area" of Puebla.  We were there over a weekend and it was obvious that this was a major attraction for the people of Puebla.  With certain streets shut down on Sundays, it transforms into an area for strolling or biking.\n\nAs mentioned in my review of Hotel Royalty, staying on the Zocalo isn\'t for those who don\'t care for noise and semi constant chaos.  We wanted the experience one time and now that we have "been there, done that", we will stay a block or two off the Zocalo on future visits.

139532146.name: lot to see
139532146.author: a TripAdvisor user
139532146.reviewBody: there is a lot going on here especially on the weekends.  nice fountain in front of CATHEDRAL, there are some restaurants with music and if you\'re lucky to be there when there are festivities, there is folkloric music and dancing, clowns, etc. Lot of stores to shop in.

138165347.name: Magical Place
138165347.author: a TripAdvisor user
138165347.reviewBody: The Zocalo was my favorite place in Puebla.  It is bustling with life and people--vendors, families, couples, tourists, pidgeons, and so much more.  It is a must visit place.  Wish I had had days to spend there and people watch.

137575763.name: The best things in life are free.......
137575763.author: a TripAdvisor user
137575763.reviewBody: Its an old adage, but nowhere does it apply more than in Mexico... and particularly in the Zocalo.\nWe always look for accommodation on or near the Plazuelas and Zocalos.. because of an evening ,one can just wander down amongst the action.. mingle with the Mexican families and watch the children all interact.. have some fascinating conversations..  all for nothing... although if you wish you can hop into an omnipresent OXXO store and buy a Bohemian Obscura beer and a can of Margarita  for 27 pesos and sit and consume on a park bench.    They do not mind as long as you do not consume to excess.   And one of the best Zocalos in all of Mexico is right here in Puebla.

135435099.name: take a walk!!
135435099.author: a TripAdvisor user
135435099.reviewBody: so many places to eat, places to shop and a place just to walk around and take pictures. don\'t forget your camera and an extra memory!

135055442.name: Nice place to people watch
135055442.author: a TripAdvisor user
135055442.reviewBody: I love the Zocalo in Puebla!  It is always filled with both locals and visitors and there is always something going on.  It is surrounded with shops, restaurants and a historic cathedral.  The Zocalo is ground zero for Puebla and the rest of the city spreads out from there.  My favorite thing to do there is sit on one of the cast iron benches and people watch.  The only negative thing about it - watch out for the plethora of birds!

133934949.name: The Hub of the City
133934949.author: a TripAdvisor user
133934949.reviewBody: El Zocalo in Puebla is rimmed by a variety of government buildings that tower over a plethora of restaurants.  At night, it is lit like Disneyland with special emphasis on the brightly colored buildings.  At any time, day or night, one can watch muscians of all genres of music, political rallies, clowns, festivals, parades and celebrations.  It is a magnet that will bring you back time and time again.  Puro Mexicano.

132778793.name: Great place to sit back and relax and people watch
132778793.author: a TripAdvisor user
132778793.reviewBody: Giant central square flanked by restaurants and local vendors offer a nice introduction into the city of Puebla.

132044502.name: The Z\u00f3calo in Puebla
132044502.author: a TripAdvisor user
132044502.reviewBody: The Z\u00f3calo in Puebla was a great place to hang out and have a drink or coffee with a piece of sweet bread (pan dulce). The Z\u00f3calo had a very European feel and look to it. Any time of day or in the evening there was always something going on in the Z\u00f3calo. If you are a people watcher like I am, then this am the place for you. Just off the Z\u00f3calo was a wonder public walkway with shopping and restaurants. This is one of the best parts of Puebla.

131984367.name: great place!
131984367.author: a TripAdvisor user
131984367.reviewBody: you have to go there and spend a whole afternoon breathing and enjoying the whole local scene and air! wonderful!

130557508.name: A traditional Mexican town centre - came alive at night
130557508.author: a TripAdvisor user
130557508.reviewBody: There was a bonus when we were there, which was a free public concert.

130443415.name: Small, but comfortable
130443415.author: a TripAdvisor user
130443415.reviewBody: A nice place to sit and watch the world go by, especially if you stop in for some ince cream at the near-by ice cream shop !

130434214.name: Everyone so laid back
130434214.author: a TripAdvisor user
130434214.reviewBody: Restaurants, a lot of trees, people just enjoying themselves: a little of a small town in a big city. Very beautiful and we felt safe and unbothered by people.

129894681.name: full of live - spectacular
129894681.author: a TripAdvisor user
129894681.reviewBody: we had live music and it was full of people. phantastic atmosphere

129621761.name: Typical zocalo experience
129621761.author: a TripAdvisor user
129621761.reviewBody: The zocalo in Puebla is very typical but nice because there is a lot of green space and places to sit and relax. It\'s filled with vendors and various performers and there are lots of restaurants that are a bit expensive but have an excellent view of the park!

129307563.name: Anyone in Puebla, has to visit the Zocalo area.  This is such a true picture of Mexico.
129307563.author: a TripAdvisor user
129307563.reviewBody: The park is nicley done with trees, flowers, benches, and wrought iron fences.  The area is surronded by restaurants, both fast and fine dining.  They are many coffee shops, stores, turibus tours, and beautiful historic places to see.

128363014.name: Lots of people
128363014.author: a TripAdvisor user
128363014.reviewBody: There were people everywhere. You have to see it. You can see a bit of everything, the rich, poor, young, and old.

128113712.name: The best spot to make it the center of your Puebla downtown tour!
128113712.author: a TripAdvisor user
128113712.reviewBody: It\'s one of the most beautiful zocalos (Central Civic Plaza) in Mexico. It\'s surrounded by plenty of architectural beauties like the City Hall, the Cathedral, etc. It\'s full of small restaurants with terraces servicing on the exterior where you can enjoy the views of century old trees and the cathedral. You can either enjoy lunch or just refresh with a Corona while you set yourself to continue touring downtown.

127425456.name: Just beautiful
127425456.author: a TripAdvisor user
127425456.reviewBody: Have a drink at the Royalty and enjoy a day or evening watching people passing by the Cathedral

127296508.name: Picturesque
127296508.author: a TripAdvisor user
127296508.reviewBody: Tree lined and shady, with shops all around and beautiful architecture. Lovely area.

127269142.name: Alive, large and beautiful!
127269142.author: a TripAdvisor user
127269142.reviewBody: The Puebla zocalo is quite large and heavily used day and evening.  It\'s a place for everybody --- families, young people, couples, clowns, art and other displays.  Restaurants line three sides, with moderately good food and lots of drinks.  There are at least 2, maybe more, Italian Coffee Companies there (the Mexican Starbucks replica.)  Everybody goes there and likes the zocalo.

127264736.name: One of the most beautiful zocalos in Mexico!
127264736.author: a TripAdvisor user
127264736.reviewBody: We went on a long weekend to Puebla from Zihuatanejo to see how televara was made (Mexican pottery).  We stayed a few blocks from the zocalo, and spend most of our time in or near it.  The zocalo itself is a very pretty one with a fountain, artwork and pathways.  It is surrounded on three sides by shops and restuarants, giving the whole place an old-world feel, while the fourth side is occupied by the Cathedral of the Immaculate Conception.  There always seems to be lots of people around, just enjoying the scene.  We will be going back.

126991267.name: A very nice place
126991267.author: a TripAdvisor user
126991267.reviewBody: this place is great it has the cathedral an a nice fountain in the middle of the plaza. Lots of entertainers only problem they are in spanish. Overall a nice place.

126464458.name: Clean, restful, entertaining, beautiful.
126464458.author: a TripAdvisor user
126464458.reviewBody: The zocalo is full of people relaxing and enjoying the good weather and good company.  It was lovely to see the number of young lovers holding hands and nuzzling.  And it was fun to see the school children playing in the fountain, running through the water, getting wet, and then playing with friends.  It is a clean, safe, and friendly environment.

126230422.name: Excellent meeting place
126230422.author: a TripAdvisor user
126230422.reviewBody: I absolutely love this place mainly because of it\'s outdoor restaurant seating. it reminds me a lot of Europe and when I lived in Spain. The Zocalo (Town square) is the center of the city. Mexico is the only Spanish speaking country that calls it\'s town center by this name. A must visit.

126068407.name: One of Mexico\'s best
126068407.author: a TripAdvisor user
126068407.reviewBody: GREAT place to people watch. This zocalo has something for everyone, and everyone is there. Some restaurants/cafes better than others. Hotel Royalty always has great drinks and food,very good soups (sopa Poblana, sopa Azteca) , great flan.\nReally good art gallery on the zocalo always has some fascinating show that would interest anyone. It\'s a few doors from near municipal palace, very good tourist office, 2 sides of zocalo lined with  cafes, generally filled with people. Someone is always cleaning streets, sidewalks. Park itself is beautiful with lots of benches and walls of seating lining the Basilica.  At lunchtime there\'s hardly a free spot to sit along this wall or anywhere else. Performers, music, artists, musicians, dancers, kids playing and being entertained by clowns. It\'s a great place to take a break.

125931747.name: People watching and relaxing
125931747.author: a TripAdvisor user
125931747.reviewBody: This is the heart of the town.  Take your time, watch the people, have a beer, relax and  enjoy.  Life the way it\'s supposed to be!

125515627.name: City Center
125515627.author: a TripAdvisor user
125515627.reviewBody: An excellent place to walk around among trees, water fountains, etc.

124932739.name: Nice historic building
124932739.author: a TripAdvisor user
124932739.reviewBody: The Zocalo itself was a nice looking, well maintained historic building.  We asked to go inside but were told it was only for "VIPs."  The surrounding buildings were much more impressive than the Zocalo itself, but overlooking the park in the centro makes it a fun and lively spot.

124834926.name: Nice, but not as beautiful as others
124834926.author: a TripAdvisor user
124834926.reviewBody: The zocalo itself is not that fantastic, but the surrounding buildings are really worth seeing.  It is a well kept \'jardin\' with some interesting corporate art (Nescafe cups).  There are far more interesting zocalos in Mexico, but if you are in Puebla, you should see it.

124299930.name: A must stop in Puebla
124299930.author: a TripAdvisor user
124299930.reviewBody: Really nice place to go and relaxed. The Zocalo is surrounded by a lot of restaurants that offer great Mexican food of the region; like cemitas, chicken mole, cecina and many more. \n\nA visit to the Vittorio\'s restaurant is a must, really great Mexican and Italian food combination.

124268274.name: Beautiful!!
124268274.author: a TripAdvisor user
124268274.reviewBody: This is a typicall mexican plaza with a twist. Puebla is a majestic city and it shows in its zocalo and surrounding buildings. Restaurants in the Portales are very good and unexpensive. Try Vittorios for great italian and mexican food and also the tacos arabes in the first restaurant of the block

124134422.name: Charming place
124134422.author: a TripAdvisor user
124134422.reviewBody: charming zocalo, very friendly people.  The puppet museum is on one side of the zocalo and the bull fighting museum is only a short walk.

123849442.name: Perfect place to gather your wits and plan the next move over a beer or coffee.
123849442.author: a TripAdvisor user
123849442.reviewBody: lovely park surrounded by colonnaded buildings with street level cafes; a busy gathering place but cheerful and clean

123781577.name: The heart of the city
123781577.author: a TripAdvisor user
123781577.reviewBody: We started each day with a taxi ride to the Zocalo. On one side is the Cathedral, on the opposite side, the municipal building which contains the tourist information center. On the other sides are portales (covered arcades) with wonderful small restaurants. In the center, a grand fountain, shady walks, flowers, benches, and prime people watching.

123314619.name: a happening place
123314619.author: a TripAdvisor user
123314619.reviewBody: I was there for a parade in honor of the Three Kings, or Epiphany, so the z\u00f3calo was full of families waiting for the big event, which was indeed colorful. Two sides of the z\u00f3calo have restaurants and cafes with a range of cuisines and price ranges.

122876920.name: Lovely Place to people watch
122876920.author: a TripAdvisor user
122876920.reviewBody: Chill and see the laid back couples walk on by - there are many of them!

122789875.name: Lively historical center
122789875.author: a TripAdvisor user
122789875.reviewBody: beautiful colonial architecture and nice restaurants.

122633178.name: Expansive, impressive, busy and lively
122633178.author: a TripAdvisor user
122633178.reviewBody: Everything...especially streetside cafes and views of the cathedral

122598547.name: Shopping!
122598547.author: a TripAdvisor user
122598547.reviewBody: Vital center of the city, beautiful Christmas decorations, many restaurants and interesting shops, felt very safe.

122581678.name: Beautiful colonial city center
122581678.author: a TripAdvisor user
122581678.reviewBody: Clean, safe, beautifully maintained.  Lovely sculptures.

122495652.name: Clean and safe
122495652.author: a TripAdvisor user
122495652.reviewBody: The Zocalo is lined with many places to eat, both formal and casual... it is safe, easy to navigate, clean, and friendly.

122467559.name: Another fine Mexican square
122467559.author: a TripAdvisor user
122467559.reviewBody: Well done topiary, large fountain, great street scene but a little bit jumbled.

122445845.name: must see
122445845.author: a TripAdvisor user
122445845.reviewBody: the center of this town is beautifully kept, the civil and religious buildings are spectacular, great place to sit and relax

121467470.name: Great experience
121467470.author: a TripAdvisor user
121467470.reviewBody: It\'s a nice area with great views a lot of nice places where you can eat close by.

121402060.name: Mexico at it\'s best
121402060.author: a TripAdvisor user
121402060.reviewBody: Beautiful city square with everything you\'d expect from Mexico.  Mariachi bands, street vendors, sidewalk cafes and restaurants, nice galleries, and a beautiful cathedral.

121038411.name: My favorite place in Puebla
121038411.author: a TripAdvisor user
121038411.reviewBody: To have a tour in the Zocalo is the first step when visiting Puebla. Get amazed by the local vibe, the beautiful surroundings and the stunning architecture. Have a drink or a meal in any restaurant in the Portales (near the park) and enjoy the sunset and the cosmopolitan atmosphere. I\'m tired of Puebla\'s Zocalo.

120996305.name: Lovely and lots of shade.
120996305.author: a TripAdvisor user
120996305.reviewBody: Such a beautiful zocalo with many species of trees and plants. Lots of benches, lots of opportunity to buy stuff, lots of kids playing, great live music. Wonderful people space. Wish we had places like this in Canada.

120613911.name: Lively and fund to be part of
120613911.author: a TripAdvisor user
120613911.reviewBody: All the music and people watching. Much activity especially on the weekends.

119955443.name: A trip back in time
119955443.author: a TripAdvisor user
119955443.reviewBody: One of the most gorgeous and safe colonial centers in Mexico. The cathedral should and cannot be missed and enjoy a mexican meal in one of the many restaurants as you "peoplewatch"

119919940.name: an obvious destination
119919940.author: a TripAdvisor user
119919940.reviewBody: every Mexican town/city has a main square/plaza, called the Zocalo. Puebla\'s is very pretty, lots of trees, cathedral on one side and colonnade on the other 3 with wide choice of restaurants etc

119812856.name: Beautiful & relaxing
119812856.author: a TripAdvisor user
119812856.reviewBody: Loved the Zocalo. Beautiful setting, lots of nice people.

119776695.name: Good evening relax space
119776695.author: a TripAdvisor user
119776695.reviewBody: weekends are busiest, with local families and visitors from D.F. and environs

119597391.name: Charming Central Park
119597391.author: a TripAdvisor user
119597391.reviewBody: The center of Puebla is replete with art deco buildings and a first rate cathedral that surround the zocalo.

119236816.name: excellent colinial place in the centre of puebla
119236816.author: a TripAdvisor user
119236816.reviewBody: This is a nice place if you are visiting from another country and it\'s your first visit to puebla, there are many good things to see there, the churches, the restaurants,  some nice hotels there too and some excelent bars that have a great sight of it at night.   You might want to get there by cab or bus, if you take your car there you may have trouble parking, although there are parking places, they are quite crowded on weekends.

92963065.name: beautiful square amazing zocalo
92963065.author: a TripAdvisor user
92963065.reviewBody: people who visit puebla will spend most of their time in here specially night time coffee drink and dinner the atmosphere is amazing with zocalo beautiful lights , makes u talk forever :D ..  lotta restaurant bars .. try to have lunch in a balcony . i love people who play music makes it even much better . puebla zocalo never gets old . <3

22446429.name: Our favorite Zocalo is in Puebla
22446429.author: a TripAdvisor user
22446429.reviewBody: I suppose it can sound a bit mundane. Another zocalo. The Cathedral on one side of the plaza, City Hall on another, lots of restaurants and side-walk cafes, trees and gardens all over the place, kids playing with their balloons, and sometimes a concert at night in front of the Cathedral. While that seems to be typical of Mexico\'s zocalos this one is special. There is lots of room and plenty of benches, many trees for shade, always something going on, and it is often crowded but it is always fun. The plaza is surrounded by beautiful buildings. The colorful tourist bus starts from here. The fast food places do not distract from the magic of the place. The very good tourist office is on the square near the government building. Try to be there on a weekend when the main street that passes by is usually shut down giving pedestrians and kids playing even more room. This is a great old colonial city with a great deal to offer and you can spend days in Puebla. Don\'t miss the Zocalo. We came back to it each evening.

13895377.name: The pulse of Puebla.
13895377.author: a TripAdvisor user
13895377.reviewBody: What a beautiful square. Surrounded by some stunning colonial buildings and a fantastically beautifull church, it\'s easy to spend time watching life go. They should kick out McDonalds, but what can you do? I especially enjoyed walking some of the streets a few blocks behind the square and seeing all the little storfront food stalls and shops. The buildings are really something, even the ones in need of a fresh coat of paint. We only had a day there but I would definately reeturn and spend more time.

10060531.name: View pulse of city
10060531.author: a TripAdvisor user
10060531.reviewBody: Excellent resting location to view locals bustling from one point to the next as well as national and international tourist.

7673507.name: Nice place for an evening walk and dinner
7673507.author: a TripAdvisor user
7673507.reviewBody: This is a very calm place, full of trees and a beautiful fountain. It has several nice buildings around, including the astounding cathedral (one of the oldest in America). There are several places to dinner, restaurants, bars, with live music and good ambient, even karaoke. For the more young there are also McDonalds and Carl\'s Junior.\nA good idea to spend the evening/night includes walking in the Zocalo, visiting the cathedral, and then watching a folkloric scene in the city teather and dinning in some restaurant, without walking more than a mile to any place.\n

677344729.name: Great little museum of ancient cultures in what is today Mexico
677344729.author: a TripAdvisor user
677344729.reviewBody: Very well maintained museum of the local Mexican cultures, history, and archeology. Almost like a mini version of the Museum of Anthropology in Mexico City.  The very nice little rooftop restaurant and the views from up there were an added bonus.

677221219.name: Interesting pre-Columbian artifacts
677221219.author: a TripAdvisor user
677221219.reviewBody: The museum had kind of a random assortment of items, but we really liked the pre-Columbian artifacts. That part of the museum (on the ground floor) provided nice context with a huge timeline outlining architectural achievements in different societies dating back several millennia. The building itself is beautiful too. The modern art section: eh. But given that this cost about $3 USD, it\'s definitely worth checking out. We didn\'t eat on the patio, but it looked beautiful.

670140084.name: Great museum
670140084.author: a TripAdvisor user
670140084.reviewBody: We went there on a Sunday afternoon which offers free entry to all visitors. The museum is well organized, well kept and modern with lots of different things to see. It would have been better if there are more English descriptions on the wall, some part of the collection have English descriptions and some not. They also have audio/visual film which you could sit down and watch to learn about the history. \n\nRemember to go up to the rooftop to have some snacks and drinks so that you can have a nice view of zocalo de puebla from the rooftop. Overall good museum and is free on Sunday so it\u2019s extra awesome.

669988843.name: Nice combination of modern and colonial architecture, temporal art exhibitions, nice view of city from roof
669988843.author: a TripAdvisor user
669988843.reviewBody: This museum is in downtown, the outside of the building has a typical colonial architecture, inside is very modern, art exhibitions are temporal, Sundays entrance is free, from the roof you can get a spectacular view of the city.

668769587.name: very nice art museum
668769587.author: a TripAdvisor user
668769587.reviewBody: This is a very nice art museum that has a lovely roof top cafe and a reasonably priced gift shop on the ground level.

668177045.name: Great exhibition
668177045.author: a TripAdvisor user
668177045.reviewBody: This place actually surprised us with a very modern setting and beautiful exhibition.\nDownstairs is the permanent and upstairs itinerant. We are not into modern art much so upstairs exhibition was just ok but we dedicated a nice time downstairs enjoying beautifully conserved pieces. \nDon\'t miss it if you\'re in town.

666194445.name: Great Pre-Colombian Collection and Terrace
666194445.author: a TripAdvisor user
666194445.reviewBody:
The pre-Colombian collection is excellent.  I took the audio tour and struggled to match the narrative with the exhibits but eventually figured it out.  Finding the display that matched the track got to be pretty aggravating after a while.

I'm not much of a modern art fan and this collection didn't change my mind.  The video 'piece' of glass being broken on a pile of trash was just annoying (the guard kept looking my way with a look of 'Please take me out of here.'

The rooftop terrace with its view of the historical district is wonderful.

662593463.name: A must to visit
662593463.author: a TripAdvisor user
662593463.reviewBody: Enjoyed the opportunity to see the offerings of this museum in the center of town. Excellent place to lunch as well. Great gift shop!

661740473.name: Superb Museum
661740473.author: a TripAdvisor user
661740473.reviewBody: This is a fantastic museum\u2014plan on at least 2-3 hours to see everything. They have a wonderful mix: modern art, a fantastic prehispanic collection as well as some special exhibitions. Museum staff was very courteous and kept us going in the right direction through the exhibits. We really enjoyed it, and it was very affordable. Our children were free, and for us two adults it was only 70 pesos.

659954075.name: Super well kept museum and a great roof garden terrace on top.
659954075.author: a TripAdvisor user
659954075.reviewBody:
Super well kept museum and a great roof garden terrace on top.

Very well curated permanent Mexican archaeological exhibit on the first floor as well as interesting temporary modern art exhibits above.

Very well designed and impressively presented museum.The rooftop terrace restaurant/bar is amazing with great views of Downtown Puebla. 

Highly recommended as a stop in Puebla.

659685688.name: Varied art exhibitions and architecture.
659685688.author: a TripAdvisor user
659685688.reviewBody: We viewed a stunning photography exhibition, a show of modern Mexico art and rooms of Mexican furniture. There is also a huge Yves Klein installation-famous blue!The restaurant has indoor and outdoor seating with stunning views.\nNot to be missed!

659373983.name: Wonderful collections in a fabulous building.
659373983.author: a TripAdvisor user
659373983.reviewBody: This is a wonderful Museum with fabulous objects and interesting temporary exhibitions.  The whole place has been extended and renovated in the past few years, with great taste and elan.  My favourite area is the Pre Hispanic Collection, but there are other parts of the Museum which would suit other tastes. The roof top terrace his a delightful place to have a coffee or a light meal and the view from there is fantastic.  I would put this very high on my list of must-see things to do in Puebla.

656998246.name: Fantastic museum, worth a long visit
656998246.author: a TripAdvisor user
656998246.reviewBody: We went in expecting a relatively short visit and came out almost 3 hours later. What a collection of art and historical objects;well displayed and labelled. You can easily spend half a day there, there is so much to see. Wonderful.

656092700.name: Don\u2019t miss it.
656092700.author: a TripAdvisor user
656092700.reviewBody: We planned to give this museum a quick visit and ended up staying several hours. All the exhibits were worth seeing, the building itself is fairly new and well-designed, and the staff is helpful. There\u2019s a rooftop cafe with a great view although the service was a bit spotty. They offer a breakfast buffet but we opted for coffee and a pastry since it took so long to get anyone to wait on our table.

655278209.name: An amazing compilation of artifacts
655278209.author: a TripAdvisor user
655278209.reviewBody: The Museo Amparo is simply amazing!  There is a beautiful roof-top area where you can eat or have a drink, offering incredible views of the city; you can even see the volcano in the distance on a clear day.  Inside the museum is the most concise pictorial timeline I have ever seen, depicting events happening all over the globe at the same specific times.  The artifacts in the museum make me wonder how all of this stuff survived the ages - it is tastefully arranged and displayed.  Lots of figurines, jewelry, pottery, masks, and more.  I am so glad I got to experience this beautiful collection of history. You can even take photos without a flash!

654394338.name: Ancient to contemporary
654394338.author: a TripAdvisor user
654394338.reviewBody: Beautiful modern museum, very well managed.  Exhibits were primarily ancient native artifacts from the region.\n\nWe would have benefited with more English explanations or descriptions but still very worthwhile.

654012866.name: Very Modern
654012866.author: a TripAdvisor user
654012866.reviewBody: We thought this place to be very modern and well put together. It is rambling so try not to miss all of what you want to see.\n\nGo out on roof to see some of the city and have lunch it you like.

653574493.name: A must see
653574493.author: a TripAdvisor user
653574493.reviewBody: So enjoyed these various displays and how art was used for social justice and statements. SO much to view and read. Lost my group as I stayed behind to read it all. Fortunately our hotel was across the street!

652846715.name: Wonderful museum
652846715.author: a TripAdvisor user
652846715.reviewBody: This is as good as any museum in the world.  Great collection of pre-Spanish artefacts and of modern art. Fabulous roof top with extensive views

652577323.name: One of a kind Museum with important permanent collection.
652577323.author: a TripAdvisor user
652577323.reviewBody: There is always one or various simultaneous exhibitions going on.  The exibitions are world class and extremely well curated.  The permanent collection houses some of the most important pre-colombian small objects rescued by the Saenz family through the last half of the 20th century.  The building is a colonial jewel,  the views on the roof bar are spectacular.  It is an ideal spot for chilling after a long day of museum visits.

651349216.name: Go!
651349216.author: a TripAdvisor user
651349216.reviewBody:
Very good museum that is bigger than it looks on the outside. We visited on a Sunday and it was free! However, only a few dollars any other day its open. 

The museum has several different types of exhibit including a contemporary modern art section, a photographic section - black and whites taken in the 60's of Mexico City and surrounds, although not sure if this was a temporary exhibit and furniture, paintings and such like set out in rooms of one of the houses of the museum. However, we visited particularly for the mexican artifacts and we were not disappointed. Some amazing pieces here some of which look as if they were made a few years ago rather than hundreds, they are in such good condition.Shame there wasn't more explanation in English but it didn't matter too much. Definitely worth a visit as it is rare to find ancient sculptures and pottery of this type in such fantastic condition.

The museum building is also beautiful set in two historic houses with lovely courtyards and there is a good cafe on the top floor.

649738501.name: Enlightening
649738501.author: a TripAdvisor user
649738501.reviewBody: Interesting . Well kept. Extensive collection in well lit, well organizEd displays . Highly recommended , and it\u2019s just off the zocalo. We went in a Saturday and admission was free, too

649237965.name: Excellent experience
649237965.author: a TripAdvisor user
649237965.reviewBody: Visited in Monday when the museum entry was free. Paid a little extra for a guided tour and I had a personal guide. She provided very interesting in explanations about the pre Spanish indigenous artifacts which was fascinating. The temporary exhibit was nothing to write home about. The roof top was very pleasant to enjoy the beautiful\nWeather.

647553151.name: Unexpected and amazing museum
647553151.author: a TripAdvisor user
647553151.reviewBody: I dint have much information and I arrived and was totally surprised at the fantastic building, the quality of the exhibition and the diversity of the pieces. Technology is well used to create an experience that it is hard to forget. The terrace is the cherry of the pie. Amazing views of some of the ley churches of this amazing city.

647405630.name: Spectacular!
647405630.author: a TripAdvisor user
647405630.reviewBody:
This museum is an absolute must! First, the building is gorgeous - set in colonial houses with historic rooms, courtyards and a truly spectacular rooftop cafe (with stunning views of the local churches).
There is a nicely curated private collection of prehispanic pieces. For an extra 70 pesos, I bought a very thoughtful and well organized English booklet that provided context and cultural background to these pieces. They threw in a poster of the very interesting wall mural that compares civilizarions around the world. 
We also enjoyed the colonial furniture and art exhibition that was especially nice with the items in real colonial rooms. There were also exhibits of beautiful contemporary tapestries and vivid protest poster art.
I think the admission was 55 pesos. A great value to see inside (and on the roof of) one of Puebla's gems.

647148617.name: Beautifully museum
647148617.author: a TripAdvisor user
647148617.reviewBody: Just a few minutes from the zocalo, a beautiful and informative museum. Lovely rooftop terrace with restaurant, great views and herbs (rosemary, lavender, etc) plante\u00e9 all along. Worth the visit.

646811207.name: MANY PIECES OF ART
646811207.author: a TripAdvisor user
646811207.reviewBody: It was an old hospital, which is now a beautiful colonial building with museum rooms with an extensive material of pre-Hispanic ceramic pieces and stone sculptures. There are three floors of exhibition halls. There are also many paintings. Right at the center there is a modern construction made of steel and glass, in which at the third floor there is a restaurant where you can have lunch enjoying the views of at least 20 domes of nearby churches. Cost per entrance is $2. On Sundays the entrance is free. Recommended visit

646051648.name: The finest museum en Puebla
646051648.author: a TripAdvisor user
646051648.reviewBody: Installed in a colonial building, the museum displays with state of the art technology very good exhibitions.

645823511.name: Very interesting Museum
645823511.author: a TripAdvisor user
645823511.reviewBody: I went to the Museum with my Guide from the Spanish Institute of Puebla.  We only went to the pre-Hispanic section, and it was very informative and interesting.  BTW, the museum is free on Mondays.

644094158.name: Remarkable Pre-Colombian Collection
644094158.author: a TripAdvisor user
644094158.reviewBody: This museum turned out to be a surprise.  The overall collection was excellent, but the pre-Columbian pieces were outstanding examples of Mexico\'s cultures.  Some even better than in the National Anthropology museum!  Pieces were well-displayed.  Museum also had a pleasant rooftop cafe with a great vistas of the city.

643564763.name: Worth it !
643564763.author: a TripAdvisor user
643564763.reviewBody: Small.  Interesting g building and collection.  It\u2019s a museum that Mexicans visit when in Puebla.  Nice roof area, too.

641895148.name: Do not miss - very good museum
641895148.author: a TripAdvisor user
641895148.reviewBody: World class museum that takes presentation to the next level. Superb prehispanic collection but other expos worthwhile as well. Rooftop cafe has stunning views. Very good gift shop. What\u2019s not to love?

641450545.name: Small and informative
641450545.author: a TripAdvisor user
641450545.reviewBody: This museum has a nice mix of ancient native artifacts and a small section on more current living quarters (18th century). The entrance has a more modern monochrome piece by Yves Klein   The museum is a nice size for those that are impatient.

641137720.name: Great Museum, Cool Rooftop Cafe
641137720.author: a TripAdvisor user
641137720.reviewBody: In addition to all the other positive things said about this wonderful museum, we fell in love with the rooftop caf\u00e9. This is a great place to see the skyline of historic Puebla and we came back many times, day and night.\n\nif you are planning on being in Puebla for more than a couple of days I recommend getting a caf\u00e9 pass for 135 pesos so you can stop off for a sandwich, a coffee, or a drink and enjoy the tranquility of the rooftop and the amazing skyline.

640203422.name: Vale la pena
640203422.author: a TripAdvisor user
640203422.reviewBody: El Museo Amparo es espectacular.  It\'s housed in a beautiful 18th century building with contemporary additions, including the glass-enclosed lobby and the gorgeous rooftop terrace cafe, which boasts an extraordinary view of Puebla\'s rooftops and the surrounding mountains.  Many people go just for the cafe.  The collection of pre-Hispanic artifacts is excellent and highly informative as is the 19th century art collection.  It\'s also free on Sundays and Mondays although very reasonable ($35 pesos) on other days.

639004670.name: Museum Puebla
639004670.author: a TripAdvisor user
639004670.reviewBody: Best museum in town with changing exhebitions. Best place to have a coffee on the roof garden, with nice city view.

636763026.name: Fabulous museum
636763026.author: a TripAdvisor user
636763026.reviewBody: This is a great collection of art from pre-Colombian, to Colonial (in Colonial decorated rooms) through modern.  Be sure to at least have a coffee in the cafe on the top floor with its glass walls and fabulous views.  We had a quick, good lunch there.

636759616.name: Much worse than expected
636759616.author: a TripAdvisor user
636759616.reviewBody: We got many recommendations to visit this place, but most probably it depends a lot on what exhibitions there are at this moment.\nPersonally I liked only exhibitions on the 1st floor. I didn\u2019t like 2nd and 3rd floor.\nOn the first floor there is history time line and I really liked it.

632938525.name: Beautiful museum.
632938525.author: a TripAdvisor user
632938525.reviewBody: Located in the colonial area of Puebla, this museum has outstanding pre hispanic and colonial collections tastefully displayed with the most modern technology. The building itself is beautiful and the views from the terrace are magnificent. This museum is a must for any visitor to this marvelous city.

631453787.name: Came for the Friday DJ
631453787.author: a TripAdvisor user
631453787.reviewBody: We came for the DJ who was to come on at 8:00, but didn\'t arrive until almost 9:00. Looking back on the website is when he was supposed to stop playing, but we read 10 at the time. The view of the church was amazing from 7:50 until 8 when they shut off the lights that highlight the outside. I guess they turn them back on at 9, but we did not stick around to find out. It cost $3 US to get access to the cafe on the roof. The food looked mediocre, but the overpriced beers were cold. If you stay at the right BNB look for our single-use \'frequent cafe users\' card we left behind for anyone.

628413075.name: Nice museum
628413075.author: a TripAdvisor user
628413075.reviewBody: When we arrived, there were 6 people at reception and only one working selling tickets. The rest, were just chatting and doing nothing. \n\nIs very big and you can also go to the roof and take photos of the top of the churches of Puebla.

621530503.name: Great museum with a rooftop restaurant with views of the city
621530503.author: a TripAdvisor user
621530503.reviewBody: We thoroughly enjoyed the Amparo Museum. The collection was very impressive, really nice museum shop and the rooftop bar is worth at least a drink to get some nice views of the city. Right in Centro so easy to visit and well worth the time.

618026571.name: \u2661\u2661\u2661
618026571.author: a TripAdvisor user
618026571.reviewBody: This museum blew me away with its broad and deep collection of colonial and pre-Columbian art. What made my visit extra-special, however, was a temporary exhibit of several thousand retablos. This was really my introduction to retablos, small religious thank-you notes painted on tin.

615069081.name: Nice museum, rooftop is a must!
615069081.author: a TripAdvisor user
615069081.reviewBody: We loved this museum - I could spend days looking at pre-columbian artefacts - but the rooftop terrace was what made it extra special. Sitting in the warm sun while sipping a cerveza was the perfect way to end our visit!

614645154.name: A must see
614645154.author: a TripAdvisor user
614645154.reviewBody: Recent addition includes a lovely roof top cafe with excellent views.\nExcellent collection with outstanding special, temporary exhibits.\n

614238427.name: Excellent pre columbian art, beautiful view from the terrace
614238427.author: a TripAdvisor user
614238427.reviewBody: This museum is free on Sunday and Monday,  and close on Tuesday.  The entrance fee is 35pesos and the pre columbian collection is very interesting.  The modern part doesn\'t impress me so much. The view from the terrace is amazing.

613545622.name: World class and memorable
613545622.author: a TripAdvisor user
613545622.reviewBody: A highlight of our visit, so good we went twice. This is a splendidly curated collection of objects and information about pre-Conquest art and culture.  The audio guide to this collection is very helpful. In addition, the short-term exhibits were thought-provoking and stimulating.  And, the roof top cafe offers great coffee and snacks with the best view in Puebla.

607684165.name: Love the prehispanic area
607684165.author: a TripAdvisor user
607684165.reviewBody: The museum has several expos, but I only visited the prehispanic one. You start with a timeline showing different cultures dating back thousands of years, then you go through rooms showcasing different mexican cultures like Aztec and Mayan.

605154956.name: Excellent museum, very well-organized!
605154956.author: a TripAdvisor user
605154956.reviewBody: This museum was amazing!   It had a range of exhibits from very recent and timely (immigration) to ancient and fascinating.  Well worth your time!

601864679.name: Excellent Small Museum
601864679.author: a TripAdvisor user
601864679.reviewBody: This small, very well appointed, private museum was surprising in it\'s scope, in the excellent condition of it\'s structure, and organization of it\'s staff. The  Museo Amparo has on display, the largest private collection of  "Meso-American, Pre-Columbian art collection, and over 1300 works od colonial art from the 19th and 20th centuries. There was a children\'s outreach program underway when I visited the museum on a Sunday. \n\nIf you enjoy Museums and art collection, then in Puebla, Museo Amparo should be at the top of your list.

601173265.name: Great collection of contemporary art.
601173265.author: a TripAdvisor user
601173265.reviewBody: This museum has a collection that spans pre-hispanic to contemporary.  Some of the best contemporary art I saw in all of Mexico.

598986254.name: very interesting
598986254.author: a TripAdvisor user
598986254.reviewBody: visited while there was a textile exhibit on the second floor, found both aspects of the museum and the house itself very interesting. The timeline which shows concurrent events in the americas and europe is worth seeing. Entry is free on certain days. \n\nThe only negative was the staff monitoring the rooms has little information to offer and in our case, on 2 occasions stood immediately in front of the piece we were trying to admire... seemingly on purpose? maybe a little training on how museum personnel should behave would benefit everyone.

595707621.name: Great Starting Place in Puebla
595707621.author: a TripAdvisor user
595707621.reviewBody: This museum is located several blocks south of the Zocalo, and occupies a historic house. It is a great place to start exploring Puebla, because its exhibits cover the entire history of the area. There are many fine artefacts from each era, and good explanations. (I don\'t remember if any were in English.) It\'s worth 3-4 hours.

593628506.name: A little of everything
593628506.author: a TripAdvisor user
593628506.reviewBody: Definitely worth a stop. I especially enjoyed the contemporary art exhibits. There is an excellent cafe with a view at the top of the museum. I ran out if time before visiting the gift shop so I will need to return!

590967250.name: Great Mesoamerican collection
590967250.author: a TripAdvisor user
590967250.reviewBody: The Amparo is a modern museum with a good collection of Mesoamerican artifacts. In addition, the second floor has colonial and modern art from Puebla. The colonial collection is worth the time. Most people can skip the modern collection. I would give the Amparo a five, except there is little English.

590719004.name: Fabulous Pre-hispanic pottery and sculpture
590719004.author: a TripAdvisor user
590719004.reviewBody: We spent an hour and a half this morning at the museum while waiting for a friend to head out with. There is a lovely section of pre-Hispanic art to peruse and we will really have to return for a more leisurely and in-depth tour. I really enjoyed the section describing the writing systems used by different societies and the ongoing attempts to decipher some of them.

590085936.name: Great insight into the History of Mexico
590085936.author: a TripAdvisor user
590085936.reviewBody: I took a day trip from Mexico City to Puebla in April and this was my favourite memory of Puebla. It\'s a wonderful museum in a historical building in the centre of town and is very well laid out, showcasing pre-Columbian, Colonial and Modern Art. The time line wall is a good, informative feature. Lots to see in this pleasing museum, although there was very little English. As other posters have mentioned, be sure to check out the roof top terrace to enjoy the views over the city. Museo Amparo is a bargain for $25 Mexican pesos.

583502801.name: Great place and great exhibits
583502801.author: a TripAdvisor user
583502801.reviewBody: Mexican prehsipanic exhibition is wonderful and the museum itself is also a piece of art. \nThis museum was designed by one of the most important Mexican architects, Pedro Ram\u00edrez V\u00e1zquez, who unified various buildings to create this unique building, that you don\u2019t expect from the outside.

582506908.name: Great museum
582506908.author: a TripAdvisor user
582506908.reviewBody: Modern building around courtyard, excellent exhibits.  The timeline was REALLY good - unfortunately they don\'t sell copies of this in the shop!  Upstairs was a contemporary exhibition, several rooms each with off the wall ideas, not really our scene, but the colonial style furniture in rooms was good.

581708732.name: Arts in Puebla
581708732.author: a TripAdvisor user
581708732.reviewBody: Amparo Museum is a "must" in your visit to Puebla. This is one of the best museums in the city; the permanent collection is a sample of the culture of Mexico. The place itself deserve the visit.

579092305.name: World Class Museum
579092305.author: a TripAdvisor user
579092305.reviewBody: ......Museo Amparo is a world class museum set in a beautiful building. The rooftop restaurant is delicious and offers incredible views of the city. The nighttime events on the rooftop are also a good time and included in your daily ticket price. The artworks are well curated and the themes thought-provoking. Excellent museum!

578286574.name: Fascinating
