578286574.author: a TripAdvisor user
578286574.reviewBody: One of the best museums I have visited. The entry-way timeline gives a fascinating overview of architecture and human development over the centuries worldwide. The pre-contact displays were informative (if you speak Spanish or have the Google translation app!) Upstairs the exhibit by Yoshua Okon was thought provoking and his new liberalism critique was a great tie-in to the pre colonial artefacts below. A great combination of art old and new.

575408780.name: Fantastic museum
575408780.author: a TripAdvisor user
575408780.reviewBody: Amazing shows with contemporary mexican artists.  We saw a Yosua Okon show that blew our minds - incisive, revealing and troubling but hilarious representation of the dark underbelly of the insidious worldwide corporate cultural revolution. Will go back for look at the permanent collections.

575054685.name: Visit
575054685.author: a TripAdvisor user
575054685.reviewBody: Beautiful museum with a nice terrace on the top, the view is amazing you can see few churches and the famous Puebla Cathedral. It\'s also possible to eat and have a drink there. The prehispanic collection is really interesting.

571733356.name: Excellent museum
571733356.author: a TripAdvisor user
571733356.reviewBody: First rate, really nice local prehispanico stuff and very nice modern art (several special shows, quite cutting edge and political). Also a great rooftop for a drink.

569791355.name: A must while visiting this lovely area
569791355.author: a TripAdvisor user
569791355.reviewBody: Such a great museum in the heart of the historic district. So much to learn and explore. It is beautifully laid out and I really enjoyed the special exhibits. The rooftop restaurant and caf\u00e9 give stunning views for the entire city. Should be a must on anybody\u2019s list while visiting Puebla.

568341936.name: Must-See Triad of Museums
568341936.author: a TripAdvisor user
568341936.reviewBody: With exhibits centering on Pre-Hispanic artifacts, Colonial Art and Modern Art, this museum is a part of any comprehensive visit to Puebla. In addition, there is a roof-top patio where you can rest your feet after walking the museum.

567907069.name: Small gem
567907069.author: a TripAdvisor user
567907069.reviewBody: This is a mixed museum with some new art exhibitions and the permanent collections of Colonial art and artifacts and, most importantly, pre-Columbian art objects.\nIt is the pre-Columbian collection on display that is really worth the trip.  There wasn\'t a 2nd-rate piece on display. Amazing stuff. They even had decent labels (although only in Spanish).  There were no translations of the labels into other languages, but I didn\'t find that much of a drawback here.

567586749.name: The Perfect Place to Chill
567586749.author: a TripAdvisor user
567586749.reviewBody: It\u2019s hard to describe how this museum was converted into such a spectacular and inviting space. Buildings put to multiple uses over the centuries have been melded into spaces housing a compendious collection of pre-Colombian , colonial, 19th century, and modern art.  It would be easy to spend a whole day moving between the different galleries, taking time to visit the top floor cafe and outside deck with views of the domes and towers of the churches that seem to surround the museum.  There is enough English signage to satisfy most who cannot read Spanish and they offer audio guides in English. Modern exhibitions change regularly and highlight world renowned artists. The permanent pre-Columbian collection is reputed to be among the best in Mexico and covers all regions of the country. There is a tableau that presents a timeline comparing archeology of Mexico to that of all five regions of the world through 1500 C.E. And finally, on a hot afternoon, the air conditioning was source of relief.

564670977.name: The MUST in Puebla
564670977.author: a TripAdvisor user
564670977.reviewBody: Three different museums in one: prehispanic, virreinal and modern art.\nThe building is also amazing.

563598160.name: Interesting information on pre-Columbian Mexico
563598160.author: a TripAdvisor user
563598160.reviewBody: The exposition on languages and writing is excellent as is some pre-Columbian art and pottery. It helps to know Spanish to understand the signs. The museum is free on Mondays (and it\'s one of the few museums open on Mondays). Otherwise, it is always free to go up on the terrace, which has a cafe and views of the center.

561812561.name: Huge and Wonderful
561812561.author: a TripAdvisor user
561812561.reviewBody: This is a huge museum, so go with time. It is excellent too. It has exhibitions of pre-Colombian items and sometimes modern art. They have guided tours that you can book with anticipation. They are free on Sundays. The employees are very nice and knowledgeable, so they will answer your questions or guide you toward who knows. I really enjoyed this place.

559699593.name: A true gem in Puebla
559699593.author: a TripAdvisor user
559699593.reviewBody: The Museo Amparo was a highlight of our recent 3 day stay in Puebla.  It\u2019s a beautifully designed modern new museum within a very old historic building, with nicely laid out exhibits.  We spent our entire 2-3 hours in the wonderful pre-Hispanic collection using the audio-guide in English, and didn\u2019t see it all.  Afterwards, we had a nice light lunch from the rooftop cafe on the delightful outdoor terrace.  Nicely curated gift-shop.  Well done, highly recommend.

559430685.name: Highlight of Puebla
559430685.author: a TripAdvisor user
559430685.reviewBody: A great little museum, English translations in your ears, and a superb spot for a coffee, beer, or whatever on the rooftop overlooking the historical district.  Don\'t miss it.

557786912.name: Very interesting
557786912.author: a TripAdvisor user
557786912.reviewBody: This museum is a must see with Pre Colombian artefacts very well labelled and set out. The pieces were also well lit.

553803370.name: Beautiful building and collection
553803370.author: a TripAdvisor user
553803370.reviewBody: We really enjoyed our time in this museum. The collection is up to par with the best museums in Mexico and the setting is quite special.

553627131.name: Odd mix of art and artifacts
553627131.author: a TripAdvisor user
553627131.reviewBody:
The museum contains several art installations as well as museum pieces.

The museum pieces appear to be well curated with a Spanish only sign for every piece. We had a guide that provided background info. Audio headsets were available and would be required if you can not read Spanish. 

Going to the roof top terrace to look over the city was also interesting. Part of it contains a cafe.

550842209.name: Excellent exhibitions (permanent y temporary)
550842209.author: a TripAdvisor user
550842209.reviewBody: Very diverse exhibitions (Mexican prehispanic , Mexican colonial , photographies , textile contemporary art ) but excellent quality for each of them and very good way to show the different pieces \ud83d\udc4d\nOn top of that , good architecture and stunning roof top garden (with options for eating ) \nWorth to go there

549449761.name: Open Mondays and free..and amazing
549449761.author: a TripAdvisor user
549449761.reviewBody:
This is a wonderful museum. I arrived to Puebla on a Monday and went to the friendly tourist info office on the Zocalo. Free info and map and they mentioned that Amparo was open on Mondays and free. 

Great installation, modern well laid out. First floor has some very special pre Hispanic artifacts mostly Toltec, Olmec and Mayan. Some really world class pieces.
The art exhibits on second floor were pretty nice as well.

But the best is the third floor where the cafeteria is. You have a level view of many many church steeples 360 degrees. A very unique perspective.

On days when not free I believe it was only 50 pesos entry fee. A bargain.

548664939.name: Must see
548664939.author: a TripAdvisor user
548664939.reviewBody: A very nice, well organised museum. Perfect balance between good explanations and artworks. Even the teenagers liked it. Plus the cafe on the terrace is stunning.

548234107.name: Many diverse exhibitions
548234107.author: a TripAdvisor user
548234107.reviewBody: Big museum with many temporal exhibitions, enough to wonder about for some hours when you are into art. Loved the pho graphs exhibitions.\nThe exhibition rooms are very well kept, as in space, light, colouring design, many museum guards and not that many visitors.\nThe terrace on the rooftop is a must, a wonderful spot for drink or to have lunch there with the city view of Puebla.

547920135.name: Hiuge museum with many different types of exhibits
547920135.author: a TripAdvisor user
547920135.reviewBody: This museum was quite large with all kinds of exhibits. The one problem was that most of the signs were in Spanish (which I don\'t speak). Everything from prehistoric displays to photography and art work were represented

546702859.name: City Landmark - Amazing Roof top
546702859.author: a TripAdvisor user
546702859.reviewBody: City Landmark - Amazing Roof top, nice for a drink or to eat something.\nVery interesting things to see there about Mexican Culture

544888205.name: beautiful museum
544888205.author: a TripAdvisor user
544888205.reviewBody: beautiful museum but small and the shows were not very interesting. the gift shop has some beautiful interesting local jewelry and objects.

541919484.name: World class museum
541919484.author: a TripAdvisor user
541919484.reviewBody: World class in everyway. Fabulous collections of pre hispanic artifacts imaginatively displayed using modern technolodgy including a fabulous time line wall comparing different cultures around the world with Mexico.\nInteresting collection of modern art and temporary collections plus a fabulous rooftop caf\u00e9 with first class views over Puebla.\n

540072530.name: Noteworthy permanent and temporary exhibits
540072530.author: a TripAdvisor user
540072530.reviewBody: While not huge, the museum\u00b4s permanent collections provide a comprehensive sense of the history of Puebla over the centuries. You never know what the temporary exhibits may offer, but always entertaining.

529521493.name: fantastic museum
529521493.author: a TripAdvisor user
529521493.reviewBody: I gave the National anthropological museum a five star and after seeing Amparo museum I actually thin it may have been better. The exhibits are great and the artifacts are even more impressive. They have an are for children to do art work and if you are so inclined adults can do it as well. The halls are very nicely decorated and some of the outdoor displays are very interesting. I was not a big fan of the upstairs new art work but that was not the reason we went. It was also free on sunday. Great place for 2-3 hours

528247619.name: Ampari Museum
528247619.author: a TripAdvisor user
528247619.reviewBody: This is a great museum we went back for a second day. Our main interest is in archaeology and this museum did not let us down.

527823714.name: A very nice museum to visit while in Puebla
527823714.author: a TripAdvisor user
527823714.reviewBody: Arrive early and skip the temporal exhibitions. At the end, grab a meal at the cafeteria located at the top.

524890214.name: Unexpected, awesome and majestic
524890214.author: a TripAdvisor user
524890214.reviewBody:
By far the best thing to see in Puebla. It should be number one.

An awesome mixture of anthropology and modern art.

It looks tiny from the outside, but it is massive. We ended up spending two hours (and we don't stop to see every single thing in detail in any museum usually!).

The audio guide is a must for the pre-Hispanic art part. The rest has no audio guide.

Worth the visit! Amazing restaurant just by the exit within the museum grounds.

520498570.name: A must see but attendants are a bit jumpy with young children
520498570.author: a TripAdvisor user
520498570.reviewBody: Visited the museum which is absolutely gorgeous! however if you need some attention and you are travelling with young children please do come to the museum and feel like there\'s the secret service following you around to every single room. More than once we were reminded to hold my three year old hand at all times (at some point I asked if they wanted to give it a try themselves) and do not touch absolutely nothing as if the walls were going to collapse from a toddler\'s wee jump. Anyway, good experience all and all, we visited running away from the rain, if you need good size and clean bathrooms for changing nappies this is the place. The terrace is lovely and the exhibitions both prehispanic and modern art just incredible. They have a fantastic collection of Prehispanic art btw!!!

518582494.name: A gorgeous and fascinating museum
518582494.author: a TripAdvisor user
518582494.reviewBody: Half colonial, half stunningly modern, this wonderful museum of Mexican culture is a must--from its beautiful, thematically-organized pre-hispanic rooms to its changing exhibitions of modern and post-modern art. Best of all, perhaps, is the view from the rooftop, which commands the entire city: the surrounding mountains and more beautiful church domes and towers than you can count. The rooftop also has a lovely cafe and restaurant.

514028622.name: Must See in Puebla!
514028622.author: a TripAdvisor user
514028622.reviewBody: I was blown away by this museum, the quality of the displays, lighting, artwork, explanations... All superb!\nThe top floor has a cafe that has a great view of a lot of the church domes and is a really pleasant place to stop by for a cup of coffee. \nThe museum has a permanent collection of Pre-Columbian art and also a space to special exhibitions which will be hosting the Andy Warhol exhibition next month.

511311696.name: yes...
511311696.author: a TripAdvisor user
511311696.reviewBody: ... a must see... very well arranged which makes for a nice 2 hour escape into mexican and columbian history...

509367782.name: Puebla\'s must known museum
509367782.author: a TripAdvisor user
509367782.reviewBody: This museum shows about Mexican culture and has different exhibitions occasionally. It is located downtown and if you like museums it\'s a must.

509291926.name: Buying Talavera
509291926.author: a TripAdvisor user
509291926.reviewBody: Beautiful shop for the best pieces. Great variety, prices very affordable. Don\'t worry about carrying things home. It was wrapped so well I could have dropped it and it would\'ve just bounced!

506266385.name: Exceptional Museum
506266385.author: a TripAdvisor user
506266385.reviewBody:
The Museo Amparo should be on the list of every museum lover. This is truly an amazing museum. The beautiful, modern galleries are set in a historic building housing one of the most impressive collections of Pre-Colombian and colonial Mexican art. 

The galleries are filled with beautiful works of art and impressive artifacts. There is an army of staff to help you if you have any questions. Impressive building, great museum layout, nice little gift shop.

Don't miss the rooftop terrace! One of my favorite moment during my trip to Puebla was enjoying a drink on the terrace with breathtaking views of the Cathedral and surrounding areas.

505632455.name: Wonderful Museum
505632455.author: a TripAdvisor user
505632455.reviewBody: This Museum has a beautiful collection of Pre-Columbian Art from all different parts of Mexico, and the Museography is very well displayed. A "must see" in Puebla.

504013648.name: Great view from the rooftop cafe!!
504013648.author: a TripAdvisor user
504013648.reviewBody:
My partner and I popped in here for a drink, so cannot review the museum but want to review the cafe at the top. 

We were recommended this cafe as a place to go in order to see a beautiful view. The view was quite nice, but the drinks were not worth it. I ordered a mango soda and it wasn't too nice, so I decided to go back and order a glass of wine. I accepted that the location was rather special, and so I should have more. However, what I was presented with was approximately 50ml of red wine for $75! Yes, cheap in comparison to the UK, but definitely not worth the money. 

By the time I got back to my table, I realised that there was a fly in the glass - presumably from where the glass had been stood as I'd carried it with my hand over the top (so not to spill the precious liquid inside). I went back and the barista was not happy and explained that they had no other wine left! 

I settled for a beer and went back to sit in the sun and enjoy the view. Moral of the story? Visit the museum and enjoy a beer with a view - but avoid the wine!

503005260.name: open on Mondays, and free entrance on Mondays!
503005260.author: a TripAdvisor user
503005260.reviewBody: This is a good place to be on a Monday when all the state owned museums are closed. \nWe loved the archeology exhibits - the pieces selected are of the highest. The way Mexican museums use lights to highlight the art is absolutely the best in the world. We are not great fans of modern art and we were skeptical about the other exhibits, but the photographs on the exhibits are also very interesting. It is great to see this world class museum in Puebla - we visited here 3 or 4 years ago when the museum was under renovation. They did a fantastic job and this place is simply first class.

502343843.name: Don\'t miss this wonderful museum!
502343843.author: a TripAdvisor user
502343843.reviewBody: What a lovely way to spend an hour or two... this museum is truly worth visiting. Lovely exhibitions and displays. Everything is so well presented and it\'s obvious that a lot of care has gone into this museum space. The timeline wall is such a cool feature!! and the views from the 3rd level rooftop are fantastic. Well worth the 35 pesos entry fee, and part of a wonderful wander around the historic neighbourhood of Puebla. It offers great insight into the history of Mexico.

501988022.name: A mix of classic and modern
501988022.author: a TripAdvisor user
501988022.reviewBody: Located conveniently south of the main plaza in Puebla, this museum has something for all art lovers. The first floor consists of b&w photos, second floor is a walkthrough of the house/palace of one of the premier families of the 19th century.  Third floor is like a Mexican acid trip. The terrace on the roof with a great cafe overlooking downtown was fantastic as well. Check it out I think it was like 35 pesos =<2dollars

500302711.name: One of the top Museums in all of Mexico
500302711.author: a TripAdvisor user
500302711.reviewBody: The greatest prehipanic private colection, the Museo Amparo is one of the best museums in all of Mexico and certainly an icon in Puebla City. Always offering the best exhibitions. it is a Must on your trip to Puebla.

498559822.name: Best museum I\'ve been in a while
498559822.author: a TripAdvisor user
498559822.reviewBody: This is a wonderful place to visit. Just the building is amazing. They have a beautiful mix of traditional and modern spaces that flows wonderfully. The permanent exhibit is wonderful, they have impressive pre-hispanic artifacts very well conserved. The way the museum is designed is wonderful, it takes you trough the patios and corridors so you can enjoy every room. In the upper floor they have a nice collection of objects from the nineteenth century and a traditional kitchen. At the top floor you\'ll find a very nice cafeteria and a terrace that\'t super comfortable and has an amazing view of the city, specially the Cathedral. I\'m completely sure you\'ll enjoy your visit.

494116680.name: Excellent museum with awesome exhibits
494116680.author: a TripAdvisor user
494116680.reviewBody: My husband and I visited this museum last weekend. It was a Sunday and the entrance was free! It was very organized, modern and the temporary exhibits were varied and interesting. The roof top has an amazing view of the entire city. You won\'t be disappointed.

482189324.name: Great view from the roof deck cafe!
482189324.author: a TripAdvisor user
482189324.reviewBody: Good museum with permanent archeological exhibits and traveling art exhibits,  but the highlight was definitely the view of Puebla from the roof!

479352061.name: thisd is the most beautifull privated museum in town
479352061.author: a TripAdvisor user
479352061.reviewBody: Too big, full of expositions, the permanent one is good in of for one full day, the old part is painted as a cave primitive paintings: What a beautiful effect

477797388.name: Interesting
477797388.author: a TripAdvisor user
477797388.reviewBody: Interesting museum. Very well done. We liked the Mexican art but were not a fan of the contemporary/modern section. Check out the rooftop bar.

477790868.name: Amazing Pre Hispanic collection
477790868.author: a TripAdvisor user
477790868.reviewBody: This museum is a must. The place is new and very well maintained. The collection of pre Hispanic pieces is very special with some unique items. A must.

476958101.name: Great value and content here
476958101.author: a TripAdvisor user
476958101.reviewBody: Paid only 35 MXN and it felt like I was committing highway robbery. Amazing museum that offers various exhibits and each one felt unique from each other. Three floors with 2-3 different exhibits on each and topped off with a nice roof view that gives you a great view and various places to sit down and enjoy the scenery. Only regret is that I wasn\'t able to give this place more time in my schedule, could easily spend hours here.

475562784.name: A modern museum with many treasures
475562784.author: a TripAdvisor user
475562784.reviewBody: This museum has many items from ancient times including from Teotihuac\u00e1n. The collection is well cared for and huge.

474277469.name: Small and very moden museum
474277469.author: a TripAdvisor user
474277469.reviewBody: The Museo Amparo is one of the "must" places to visit in Puebla. It is a small and modern museum that offers a very good selection of temporary expositions. The architecture is beautiful and has a roof terrace that offers one of the gorgeous views of the city of Puebla. During the evenings it offers Jazz or Chamber Music entertainment while having a drink, and on weekends they serve breakfast in a relaxed atmosphere.\nIf you plan to visit the museum roof terrace but not the exhibits, it is recommended to acquire the "amigos del museo" card, it gives access without paying the museum fee

473962777.name: Wonderful Historical/Cultural Museum
473962777.author: a TripAdvisor user
473962777.reviewBody: If you have visited Mexico City\'s Famous Anthropological Museum and liked it, you will enjoy the Amparo. It is very much the same but smaller. The exhibits are interactive and modern but if you don\'t speak Spanish, you\'ll get through the place faster. Don\'t miss the wonderful restaurant in the courtyard adjacent to the museum. Can\'t recall the name but it\'s first class.

473849797.name: super modern, really nice museum and roof top cafe
473849797.author: a TripAdvisor user
473849797.reviewBody: Very nice collection (including some ultra modern art) and a fine rooftop cafe. We sat on the roof and sketched and painted! Small but excellent gift shop.

472959094.name: Come for the Collection, Stay for the View
472959094.author: a TripAdvisor user
472959094.reviewBody: Excellent, modern museum with a an impressive and beautifully displayed permanent collections of  Pre-Columbian art and Mexican votives as well as exciting temporary exhibitions.  Don\'t miss the beautiful and expansive rooftop cafe that is one of the city\'s most delightful wine sipping (or beer savoring) spots.

471535665.name: Mexican treasures
471535665.author: a TripAdvisor user
471535665.reviewBody: The Amparo is a small museum with an incredible collection of Mexican art. In particular the permanent collection of Pre Columbian art with exquisite examples of early Mayan and Olmec pieces rarely seen in other museums.\nHighly recommend on a visit to Puebla. Enjoy!

467293634.name: Terrific museum in Puebla
467293634.author: a TripAdvisor user
467293634.reviewBody: The Amparo is a wonderful new museum in Puebla.  Its architecture juxtaposes antique and modern very well, and the rotating exhibits keep it fresh.  A great central atrium and glass elevator, and a stupendous roof deck with restaurant and views to die for.  It is a great place for an evening cocktail.  Awesome gift shop with good artisanal crafts, too!

467073273.name: World class
467073273.author: a TripAdvisor user
467073273.reviewBody: Exhibitions compared favorably with what we have seen at the MCA in Boston and the New museum in NYC.

466146871.name: Great historical timeline
466146871.author: a TripAdvisor user
466146871.reviewBody: The Museum was great! The timeline of 6 continents over a huge historical span was\nfantastic. Some people started at the wrong end - I think. I would suggest starting at the\nearliest date which was father than the entrance. The gift shop was varied, reasonable and had some very unusual things. Nice way to spend an afternoon.

465389963.name: best museum in Puebla, one of the best in the country
465389963.author: a TripAdvisor user
465389963.reviewBody: Do not leave Puebla without a visit here. The terrace has great views and its very modern, but in perfect harmony with the old builiding, Every room and space is very well adapted for a museum, easy to explore and the temporary exhibits are of great quality, as the museum design for the permanent collection. I love the old/new mix in the building, two renowed mexican architechts have worked in it and it shows.

464821947.name: Great history and art museum, including temporary exhibition
464821947.author: a TripAdvisor user
464821947.reviewBody: When we\'re there they had temporary exhibition of photography re Zapatista movement, which was excellent. From history to modern art, it\'s well versed museum.

462373357.name: A Gem
462373357.author: a TripAdvisor user
462373357.reviewBody: One of the best museums in Puebla. The audio tours in English are excellent and well worth getting. The caf\u00e9 upstairs has stunning views and decent coffee.

461432917.name: Excellent beautiful museum
461432917.author: a TripAdvisor user
461432917.reviewBody: The terrace view is spectacular!!\nThe restored home and early MEXICAN art is great. Centrally located, a must see!

460893609.name: Great Terrace
460893609.author: a TripAdvisor user
460893609.reviewBody: If you go to Puebla you need to visit Amparo and have a coffee or a drink on the terrace. I went on a Monday and was surprised that it was free. Although it was a little chilly in the morning when we arrived, by one the temperature was ideal to spend some time at the terrace.

460786299.name: Great museum
460786299.author: a TripAdvisor user
460786299.reviewBody: Don\'t miss it it is a great museum located on a remodel 200 year old building breath taking views from the top terrace with a bar a good food enjoy!

460122392.name: Great
460122392.author: a TripAdvisor user
460122392.reviewBody: Nice collections great explanation and pieces only problem not enough spaces for disable people what may difficult their appreciation

459423513.name: Amazing history of MesoAmerica
459423513.author: a TripAdvisor user
459423513.reviewBody: This museum is laid out so well.  The art pieces are fantastic but the videos they show really add a lot.  I had visited a pyramid outside of Cuernavaca and seen the juegos de pelota fields but didn\'t have any idea how they played.  This museum showed a video of it.   \n\nI loved all the school children who were there and how well I could see they were being treated.

458715971.name: napoli
458715971.author: a TripAdvisor user
458715971.reviewBody: small,quiet and informative. entrance fee is cheap.\neasy to find on the street near the plaza paring in the center.

456794656.name: Worth a trip to Puebla
456794656.author: a TripAdvisor user
456794656.reviewBody: The museum was opened 2 years ago and is brilliant.  A timeline comparing developments in art between Mexico and the rest of the world was incredibly well done; wish I had a copy. The permanent collection is filled with incredible works of art but the big thing is the audio guide, which was probably one of the best we\'ve ever had in any museum for the general background it provided of the history, culture and art of Mexico, and in some ways, the whole world.

456219261.name: Another gem in Puebla
456219261.author: a TripAdvisor user
456219261.reviewBody: Clever design exhibit well laid out. Wonderful collection. The modern component was not to my taste but it was thoughtfully incorporated. \nNice restaurant in enclosed courtyard.

456044982.name: Stylish gallery mixes modern with traditional
456044982.author: a TripAdvisor user
456044982.reviewBody: This was one of two must see places on my whistle-stop one night visit to Puebla. Set in what looks like a traditional building it has exhibits in what look like modern wings so blending traditional with modern. Some of the permanent collection reminds me of Mexico City Museum of Anthropology so if you must that take this. There is a cool cafe on the top floor. Some of the modern exhibitions were top class some baffling as modern art is but always interesting.

454541336.name: The Puebla museum to visit
454541336.author: a TripAdvisor user
454541336.reviewBody: There are numerous museums in Puebla, including the stunning new, and world class, Museum of the Baroque, but if you only go to one, this would be my choice. We spent three hours pouring over their breath taking pre-Columbian collection, then had a light lunch in their rooftop cafe with its marvelous views. Admittedly the collection is more pan-Mexican than local since there was no local pre-Columbia occupation, but you\'re just two blocks from the Zocalo in a lovely repurposed colonial building. It was our second visit in two years and we just loved it.

452485205.name: Very interesting museum.
452485205.author: a TripAdvisor user
452485205.reviewBody: The Amparo museum has a great deal of interesting exhibits depicting the Maya and other ancient civilizations of Mexico.  Lots of artifacts.  One wall had a timeline comparing developments in Mexico with developments at the same time in Africa, the Middle East, Asia, Europe, North and South America, and the Pacific islands.  They also had video of people speaking Maya and other ancient languages.  All-in-all, and excellent museum.

452348861.name: very nice museum
452348861.author: a TripAdvisor user
452348861.reviewBody: Nice museum with excellent views from their terrace.  Very helpful staff and very complete and interesting exhibitions.

447929685.name: Great museum
447929685.author: a TripAdvisor user
447929685.reviewBody: New museum.  Great collection.  Rooftop views are amazing.  Cafe on top is very good.  A must in Puebla.

444666140.name: Best kept secret sunset view
444666140.author: a TripAdvisor user
444666140.reviewBody: Please do not miss going to the roof top of the museum there is an awesome cafe, go there after your museum visit and enjoy the marvelous view of the city.

442758399.name: Definitely worth a visit
442758399.author: a TripAdvisor user
442758399.reviewBody: Excellent collection of pre Columbian artefacts well displayed with very good audio explanation available. The place to go to get a handle on Mexico before the days of Cortes.

442374892.name: Enjoyed the history and cafe
442374892.author: a TripAdvisor user
442374892.reviewBody: 40 pesos included the audio guide, which was just for the Mesoamerican section, and entry. It was well worth it. For me this was the most interesting section and I really enjoyed the cafe and views from the roof. I did feel very watched during my visit and while the staff members in each room were friendly, I would have liked a bit more distance.

440222971.name: Loved it!
440222971.author: a TripAdvisor user
440222971.reviewBody:
Absolutely brilliant, three blocks from Zocalo, and easy to find. It's 35 pesos to enter, and is worth every penny!

The exhibits range from early mesoamerican art to a pretty colonial era apartment/house. 

I spent two hours in there, and would only warn people who can't speak Spanish that they should probably take the audio tour. I was fine without that, though, as I've been here for 6 months.

440030931.name: Rooftop Bar is where it\'s at!
440030931.author: a TripAdvisor user
440030931.reviewBody:
On a beautiful sunny afternoon at sunset the rooftop bar/cafe at the Amporo is a chilled out, relaxed place to enjoy a beer, cocktail or even a tequila as the sun sets. With expansive 360 degree views of the city rooftops and church steeples you can also take in the majestic red, pink and blue sky colours of the setting sun. The rooftop also provides a unique view of the large and often snowcapped and smoking live Telephone volcano in the near distance. 

I didn't get to the museum itself as it was closing time, but i hear its got some great modern art installations worth checking out. 
For $35 peso for two people includes admission to the museum and the rooftop

436695218.name: Very modern museum where art is well presented
436695218.author: a TripAdvisor user
436695218.reviewBody: Museo Amparo has a good permanent exhibition on Mexican history and changing modern art exhibitions. On the roof they have a very nice caf\u00e9 where you have a good view on the town. Certainly worthwhile to visit when in Puebla and you like modern art.

435994472.name: Interesting place
435994472.author: a TripAdvisor user
435994472.reviewBody: Interesting museum. Free on Sunday\'s. Great for understanding local history. Don\'t laugh too loudly though - I got told off! \nAmazing view from roof terrace

435617167.name: Great place to have glimpse of rich Mexican culture
435617167.author: a TripAdvisor user
435617167.reviewBody:
I visited Puebla from 6th to 14th October 2016 for the CBSG and WAZA Conference.

I visited the Amparo Museum and had dinner also.

The museum located in the centre of Puebla city, in the erstwhile colonial building, which was residence of a rich person, is great experience. Its wide courtyards are beautiful. 

It has excellent collection of pre-hispanic, colonial, modern and contemporary items of arts and culture, which include vases, figures, sculptures, tools and implements as well as furniture. The interactive multimedia facility is excellent learning experience.

Another added attraction was the food and drinks on its top floor. The shots of tequilla with lime and salt was very refreshing and excellent for a perfect evening.

I liked the educational materials in the museum and loved the food served afterwards.

433420562.name: World class museum
433420562.author: a TripAdvisor user
433420562.reviewBody: Simply saying don\'t dare to miss place if you go to Puebla, it is impressive it is the best recover building project that I ever see and the terrace has the must amazing views of the city!

430419381.name: Yes ... Amparo Museum is worth a visit!
430419381.author: a TripAdvisor user
430419381.reviewBody: We loved the Amparo Museum in Puebla.  Lots to see and there are several floors to explore .... plus a coffee shop on the top floor.  The city views are wonderful.  Modern museum but through one door you will find a beautiful home from years ago.  I loved seeing the furniture and artwork at that exhibit!  The museum is full of Mexican history with exhibits featuring pre-columbian artifacts including Mayan, Olmec, and Aztec.  The building is walking distance from the Zocalo.  It is definitely worth a visit!

428998009.name: This museum is a must see in Puebla
428998009.author: a TripAdvisor user
428998009.reviewBody: Even if you do not have time to visit the museum (try to find time); a visit to the rooftop cafe is a must!  The views of the city are absolutely amazing and worth the sometimes slow cafe service. :)

428009706.name: PreColumbian gems
428009706.author: a TripAdvisor user
428009706.reviewBody: A jewel, filled with beautifully displayed objects of all aspects of the cultural life of preColumbian peoples.  Great attention has been paid to layout and logical reveals of items.  35 pesos and not much more for an interpretive unit, it is well worth several hours to get up close to Mayan stella, sculptures, and a look into a world once nearly lost.  The building has a second floor for special shows and a third floor bar/restaurant/snack space that is a glassed wonder leading to a deck with panoramic city views. Spectacular!  Enjoy several hours getting to see the backgorund of indigenous culture in an equally amazing setting.

424807874.name: Amazing Museum
424807874.author: a TripAdvisor user
424807874.reviewBody: Don\'t miss this museum which includes all types of items that will wow you. Lots to see. When you get tired go to the third floor for a drink and a very nice view.

423529927.name: Perfect size museum!
423529927.author: a TripAdvisor user
423529927.reviewBody: This is a perfect size museum to spend a couple o hours in. Interesting architecture, great views from the roof top cafe. Has great collection to see.

422504714.name: Excellent
422504714.author: a TripAdvisor user
422504714.reviewBody: I have visited many museums in Mexico. This is one of the best! Lots of good examples of artifacts. Entrance price is very good. Make sure to visit the restaurant on the top floor - the views are excellent.

420244604.name: Excelent
420244604.author: a TripAdvisor user
420244604.reviewBody: Great Museum!! The prehispanic collection is amazing! People are nice and most helpful, the place looks in great shape, competes with any good museum in the world. Third floor terrace is a must

417735302.name: good, but didn\'t seem to have much
417735302.author: a TripAdvisor user
417735302.reviewBody: We loved everything we saw, especially the prehispanic art.  There were some beautiful pieces, some very unusual.  I was a bit disappointed by the amount of information about the majority of the pieces.  Rather than say a piece was from one of the ruins, it said it was from an area or state in Mexico.  I did, however learn about some cultures and places that I had previously not been aware of.  the time line was also very enlightening and we spent at least 20 minutes there.  I was expecting to see more present day indigenous art and was very disappointed to find that void in the collections.

417281673.name: Top quality Museum
417281673.author: a TripAdvisor user
417281673.reviewBody: Fabulous permanent exhibit that takes you through Pre Hispanic Mexico to the conquest and beyond. Excellent changing exhibitions and a great gift store.

416611893.name: Old and new
416611893.author: a TripAdvisor user
416611893.reviewBody: It a great mixture of old and new. The old house with the new technology. A must visit the collection is small but still significant. You will get a good idea on how people use to live.

412616367.name: Beautifully Set Out Museum
412616367.author: a TripAdvisor user
412616367.reviewBody: This is a must when visiting Puebla. A beautiful and interesting museum. The museum provides an overview of Mexican art from the Pre-Columbian period to present day.

410307779.name: Best of both worlds
410307779.author: a TripAdvisor user
410307779.reviewBody: The Amparo is one of the very few places where both precolombian and contemporary art are so well displayed and enjoyable. and exhibit for every taste, even if I would not miss any of them!

409655295.name: History, Art, Architecture in the Heart of Puebla
409655295.author: a TripAdvisor user
409655295.reviewBody: If you are into incredible views and incredible architecture then this is a must see. The museum is housed in one of many historic buildings in downtown. Not one of the most flashy ones either, but once inside it will take your breath away. Seniors enjoy complimentary admission. An original museum shop, a nice restaurant adjacent on the first floor and an amazing coffee shop on the rooftop terrace. Live music every Friday starting at 8 p.m. You have to see this place!

409053352.name: excellent museum
409053352.author: a TripAdvisor user
409053352.reviewBody: Excellent museum, we went in a museum night and there were several activities for the kids, so they learned a lot. the terrace has a beautiful view

405595314.name: World Class
405595314.author: a TripAdvisor user
405595314.reviewBody: They\'ve updated this since 2 years ago when I was here. You hear Maya and Nahua voices as you walk through the new galleries. Great timeline of all cultures on a huge wall. Great contemporary art also and antique rooms of furniture. \nGo to the roof have a coffee or lunch. Beautiful setting overlooking the domes of Puebla. Bag check lady super friendly, and she speaks English which was helpful to my lousy Spanish!\n

404684467.name: Fine Museum in the Heart of Pueble
404684467.author: a TripAdvisor user
404684467.reviewBody: Incredible permanent exhibit of Indigenous cultures in Mexico. Also saw an exhibit on the work of the photographer Paul Strand. Be sure to head upstairs for the rooftop cafe, with its incredible views of the city.

404640218.name: Very Interesting with great city views
404640218.author: a TripAdvisor user
404640218.reviewBody: A very interesting museum mixing old and contemporary art, always worth a visit because the temporary exhibits change.  The rooftop caf\u00e9 is great for a sandwich, cold drink and fabulous views of the many church domes and steeples throughout the city.

395595833.name: Great collections
395595833.author: a TripAdvisor user
395595833.reviewBody: Varied collection of photographs, sculpture and furniture that explains Puebla\u00b4s history. If you are interested in History, art and photographs you can enjoy the collections. If not, They do sell tickets for the rooftop restaurant alone it will be a great way to see the Puebla, the church tops around the museum and the beautiful atmosphere will be a great way to spend your evening.

392887163.name: Great museum. Great view
392887163.author: a TripAdvisor user
392887163.reviewBody:
The center of Puebla is beautiful. Very well taken care of, lots of nice places to visit. 
The museum is great. It has been rebuild inside an old colonial building combining modern design on steel and glass, inside the original building.

It shows a very complete permanent exposition with Tolteca, Mexica, Aztec and Maya pieces.

It has a roof cafe with a beautiful view over the cathedral and the city that must be seen.

388865918.name: An amazing experience! A great museum
388865918.author: a TripAdvisor user
388865918.reviewBody: The museum has been recently remodeled with stunning XXI century architecture and museography with a colonia masterpiece.\nThe atrium and services are great, masterfully designed and managed. Great exhibitions of ancient history of the world and Mexico, current events and XX century photographers.  \nA must if visiting Puebla

387059011.name: Nice roof garden cafe
387059011.author: a TripAdvisor user
387059011.reviewBody: Go there in the evening when the sun gets down and drink a coffe watching the nearby cupulas and roofs over the busy city

378612910.name: Super interesting & well laid out
378612910.author: a TripAdvisor user
378612910.reviewBody: We stumbled into this museum thanks to a free museum night around the city. We easily spent a few hours here exploring their collections of Mexican natural history and other photography exhibits available. So glad we went!

376065449.name: Definitely worth visiting
376065449.author: a TripAdvisor user
376065449.reviewBody: They have a chronological diagram of the major constructions built in different parts of the world, very interesting to compare. After the visit you should definitely go to the cafe on the roof top. If you are lucky and it\'s not cloudy you will see the volcano. It\'s interesting, that the lady in the clock room and stores facilities speaks very good English and knows a few words from other languages as well. She should replace those useless girls in the ticket desk or in the tourist information office, who can\'t speak a word of English and generally don\'t know much.

375100901.name: Incredible! I want to go back and spend more time
375100901.author: a TripAdvisor user
375100901.reviewBody: Truly a well done museum. Excellent collections. Great layout of the museum. Love love the terrace. \n\nWould have been nice to see a little more English translations, but otherwise, just excellent all around.

374920884.name: Emptyish museum... interesting architecture
374920884.author: a TripAdvisor user
374920884.reviewBody: The Amparo museum is really nice, housed in an old building. But the collecions are very small... so it seems that you could use your time better while in Puebla. The coffee shop at the top is lovely, but you have to pay the museum fee to get there.

374682720.name: Could have had a better experience.
374682720.author: a TripAdvisor user
374682720.reviewBody:
When I was in Puebla (May 15) I knew nothing of this museum and was recommended to me by the tourism center, so we decided to check it out.  Waking in the building was impressive and looked promising.  My father, mother and I bought tickets and took off to the exhibits.  First off the exhibits are nice and tells a great history for the region.  The rotating exhibits were a little too far fetched for me and I wasn't impressed, except for the Mexican Folk Art that was the first exhibit.  The rooftop cafe and views was the best thing about the museum 

The main and big reason that I rated so low was the staff in the museum who watched over the rooms.  They seemed to hover too close stare at us and follow.  It made it really uncomfortable to view the artwork I've been in other museums with more security and have not felt this uncomfortable.. 

For me to go back to this museum the exhibit would have to be pretty special to me...

374379651.name: Beautiful Art, Beautiful Building.
374379651.author: a TripAdvisor user
374379651.reviewBody:
I visited two museums in Puebla with the Museo Internacional del Barroco being the other. I had heard so much about the Barroco museum and was urged to go there by friends. No one mentioned Museo Amparo and frankly, this museum was a lot better.

I'll start off with the terrace, don't miss it. You can easily spend an hour up there sipping on tea or coffee as you read a book or look at the city skyline with dozens of cupolas rising into the sky. There's a coffee shop up there as well. This terrace is beautifully designed with seating, walking areas and greens. 

The museum itself is separated into three floors with a permanent collection of Pre-Hispanic art on the ground floor. The works on display are beautiful and very well kept. These are works of arts I remember reading and seeing in history books growing up in Mexico and to see them live was surreal. The collection is very extensive so give yourself plenty of time to see each artifact and read about. 

there are also works of photography and books on display on the other two floors. Some displays are permanent while others are temporary but judging from the temporary exhibits I saw this museum goes all out when acquiring and putting art on display. 

The building itself has a colonial facade but once you walk inside you'll be pleasantly surprised by how modern this museum is. The lobby itself is breathtaking. There was no money spared when they built this museum and I'm glad they saved the facade to make it fit the historic neighborhood. The museum itself is housed in what used to be two building, a hospital and a private home.

This hotel has been around for 25 years and frankly it doesn't get the attention it deserves. I highly recommend a visit to this museum. Photography is allowed but  backpacks must be stored in their locker room.

I was really surprised by the use of technology at this museum. Again, they didn't spare expenses. The way they incorporate technology to further the experience and to learn more about the art on display is excellent.

There is also a gift shop, restaurant and library on site. 

The museum is closed Tuesdays. On Mondays the entrance is free and it's $35 pesos, about $2 dollars, the rest of the week.

367484654.name: Nice Museum, with different expos
367484654.author: a TripAdvisor user
367484654.reviewBody: The museum has a very interesting exposition of the history or Mexico in its different eras and cultures.\nIt also counts with different expositions that change periodically, for example modern art

365831192.name: Museo Amparo -- Don\'t Miss It
365831192.author: a TripAdvisor user
365831192.reviewBody: The Amparo Museum in Puebla is small, with an outstanding collection of precolumbian art and artifacts, beautifully displayed, plus miscellaneous more modern items. You can take it in in about an hour. Well worth the time. Much of the signage is in Spanish only, but there are cards available in each room with explanations in English and other languages.

364674501.name: Superb museum
364674501.author: a TripAdvisor user
364674501.reviewBody: This is one of the best museums we have ever visited. The artifacts are arranged in clear and interesting way and the lighting is so good everything is is beautifully displayed. Staff are very pleasant and helpful. You will need a couple of hours here to see it all, but it is well worth it. Don\'t miss this one!

362546828.name: The Amparo is a "must" in Puebla.
362546828.author: a TripAdvisor user
362546828.reviewBody: This beautiful museum features a timeline that puts Mexican history in context with developments in Europe, Asia, the US and the rest of Latin America. Its pre-Columbian collection includes beautifully displayed pieces that represent the art, religion and everyday life of early communities in the area that is now Mexico. Explanations are in Spanish, but the exhibits are worth a trip even if you are unable to read the language. The museum is free and conveniently located just a block or so from the city\'s main square. Don\'t miss it!

361341975.name: Wonderful Museum
361341975.author: a TripAdvisor user
361341975.reviewBody: We really enjoyed this museum on a recent trip that included Puebla.  It is housed in one of the oldest buildings of the area which in itself was a joy to be in.  The museum includes a wonderful collection of ancient historical works of art.  At the top is a excellent little coffee shop with the most excellent views of the city rooftops.  We really enjoyed our time both in the museum and looking at all the different roof styles from ancient roofs of clay and brick to new and modern.  This is a must do when in Puebla!

359582805.name: Amazing place!
359582805.author: a TripAdvisor user
359582805.reviewBody: I was impresed with the groun floor. The collection is excellent, but especially the display and the use of technology. Wonderful and succesful presentation. I did not like the modern art part, but that is a question of taste.

359418485.name: What a Great Museum Should Be!
359418485.author: a TripAdvisor user
359418485.reviewBody: This is definitely the best museum in the city. It combines everything a great museum should include. A great collection with a great museography, a beautiful combination of colonnial and modern architecture, great spaces for reading, having coffee or lunch, an amazing terrace where you could have one of the best views of the city and a great gift shop.

358609443.name: Fantastic Museun..
358609443.author: a TripAdvisor user
358609443.reviewBody: Private Museum, fantastic job, in the same molds as american museums, although there\'s not many pieces, they came from privates collections, but the exhibitions put them in groups by themes, so the visitations is very good, dinamic, and very interesting. They have guides in the tours, and they are very helpful . They also have kids groups, to put hem in contact with the art, my kids loved it!!!\n

357436949.name: Completely engaging
357436949.author: a TripAdvisor user
357436949.reviewBody: This museum is on a par with the Anthropological Museum in Mexico City and a must for any one interested in both precontact and colonial Mexico.  The permanent collections of both are engaging and for the precontact collection particularly nicely curated.  The Talavara kitchen of this home now museum is still completely in tact and worth the visit for anyone who is exploring the talavara scene in Puebla.  They also have a museum shop with some very high quality work from around the country. Monday was free!  And there is a cafe and deck on the top floor - the views are incredible!

354899854.name: A world-class museum
354899854.author: a TripAdvisor user
354899854.reviewBody: Thanks to the best museographic science the Amparo has become a jewel. We did not even want to see the second floor (devoted to the Spanish Vice royalty), which we had seen some 20 years ago. The pre-Hispanic ground floor is enough: extraordinary pieces of art, so well explained, well arranged and well exhibited that we thought it surpassed the famed National Museum of Anthropology in Mexico City. We also saw a very beautiful and moving documentary on the third floor, devoted to contemporary exhibitions (as also part of the second). The modern building is very beautiful.

350922530.name: Not to be missed!
350922530.author: a TripAdvisor user
350922530.reviewBody:
Great museum collection in a beautiful environment.
Indigenous collection is wonderfully
Displayed and very comprehensive.
Needs several hours.
Current collections also worth  a visit.
Seniors with ID free!

350632820.name: Excellent History Lesson
350632820.author: a TripAdvisor user
350632820.reviewBody:
The Amparo Museum in the historic center of Puebla, is one of the most important historical museums in Mexico.  It was inaugurated in 1991 and sponsored by the Amparo Foundation founded in 1979 by Manuel Espinoza Yglesias in honour of his wife.  The museum is housed in an 18th-century Baroque hospital.

The museum’s permanent collection traces Mexico’s development over its history with one of the most important collections of pre-Hispanic, colonial and modern art in Mexico, with dates of pieces ranging from 2,500 BCE.

Do not leave without checking out the amazing views of surrounding church domes and spires from the roof cafe.  Admission is $75 Pesos each.  Fortunately some of the main explanations are in English, or you can rent an audio device for more detail.

349019502.name: Amazing!
349019502.author: a TripAdvisor user
349019502.reviewBody: The museum is for everyone.  A fantastic mesoamerican collection, and some very interesting modern exhibits as well.  The building is beautiful.  On the outside it looks like a colonial mansion. On the inside it looks like the Musem of Modern Art in NYC.  Plus, the best restaurant in Puebla, El Estoril, is housed in the building as well.  A don\'t miss!!

345952103.name: Be sure to visit the Amparo Museum
345952103.author: a TripAdvisor user
345952103.reviewBody: Three floors of displays of the Mexican culture from earliest times.  Many artifiacts of early life early civilizations were there which were well set out but most explanations were in Spanish only.

345480955.name: Another part of our mini Mesoamerican education
345480955.author: a TripAdvisor user
345480955.reviewBody: The building itself is quite wonderful, but with an English audio guide and the excellent written English labels, the best part of this exhibit is the Mesoamerican collection. Themes that ran through centuries and groups are easy to follow and the objects themselves are outstanding. We now understand the origins of images by Tamayo and his contemporaries. \n\nThe guide is 25 pasos and the museum is also 25 pasos or free for seniors.

342370034.name: Guided tour.
342370034.author: a TripAdvisor user
342370034.reviewBody: We took a group of new teachers to Mexico to Puebla. At the Museum we had a guide in Spanish, one in English and special guides for the children. The guides were excellent and so knowledgeable. The museum is well organized and spotless and the staff are helpful and kind. We saw Goeritz and early Mexican exhibits and everyone was really impressed. After refreshments at the wonderful cafeteria we were taken to the main cathedral and the Capilla de Rosario. Both with excellent explanations.Then to the street of Mexican Candies and back to the museum for a delicous lunch at Estoril Restaurant. I highly recommend this visit to Mexicans and foreigners alike.

338571522.name: Puebla\'s best museum
338571522.author: a TripAdvisor user
338571522.reviewBody: It is a nice colonial building and there is a lot about the history of Mexico and Punebla itself. Sheets with explanation  in English

334307018.name: Superb ancient Mexican artefacts and interesting contemporary exhibitions
334307018.author: a TripAdvisor user
334307018.reviewBody:
Very impressive collection of artefacts from all over Mexico in their permanent collection.
Also have a number of interesting contemporary temporary exhibitions.
Museum itself has been renovated and is a beautiful space.
Free on Mondays.

333150826.name: A could- be great.
333150826.author: a TripAdvisor user
333150826.reviewBody: The Museo Amparo has all the makings of a very good museum, but doesn\'t follow through. It is well lit, except when the exhibits demand a higher level of lighting to read the words on the artwork. It has plenty of audivisual aids, but the sounds from the exhibits are more annoyiing than useful when you are looking at something else. It is supposed to have a good pre-hispanic collection concetrating on the aesthetic, but I found better in the Diego rivera museum in Mexico city. It is fairly well curated, but not completely- leaving one feeling they have missed something. It is brutally bright white, except that the exhibits you want to be well lit aren\'t. The guards chase you out of the rooms in a uni-directional manner, even if you aren\'t ready to leave. The temp exhibit was of no use to me, though that will change by the time someone reads this.There were far better artists in the 50\'s than the one they chose. How about David Siqueros, or some Mexican artist? No. It was a european German expressionist artist.

331316096.name: World class museum in central Puebla
331316096.author: a TripAdvisor user
331316096.reviewBody: A spectacular pre Hispanic museum with excellent audioguides and two other superb art installations (Matthias Goeritz particularly impressive). Great rooftop cafe.

330237684.name: go to the roof!
330237684.author: a TripAdvisor user
330237684.reviewBody: The Amparo is a really good museum, with small but informative displays. There is a room on the second floor that houses up to date exhibitions and that is a treat. One more floor up and you are on the \'terraza\'. The terrace gives you a magnificent view of the city and surrounding country side. There is a bar for refreshments or you can just sit amongst the rosemary and other greenery and enjoy the ambiance.

326525507.name: Amazing
326525507.author: a TripAdvisor user
326525507.reviewBody:
The museum has an amazing collection and the building it's beautiful by itself.
You can go to the coffe on the rooftop and have and incredible view of Pueblas downtown.
They also have a library that you can visit for free.
Undoubtly a must visit in Puebla.

326107589.name: worth a visit.
326107589.author: a TripAdvisor user
326107589.reviewBody: a very worthwhile museum and well run and in good condition. We were a group of 10 people and were not disappointed.

323445572.name: Amazing Collection of Mexican Pre-history Artifacts
323445572.author: a TripAdvisor user
323445572.reviewBody: This very modern museum contains one of the best and most complete collection of ancient Mexican artifacts in the world. Many of the pieces are simply breathtaking and the displays are interestingly arranged by theme. We also thought the displays to be well lit and well positioned for viewing. We thoroughly enjoyed the historical displays in the museum. There is also a section of modern or contemporary pieces which paled by comparison, in our opinion. Also don\'t miss a trip to the rooftop terrace which offers some spectacular views of the city and the countless number of churches. If you have an interest in Mexican history, the Amparo Museum is a rewarding must-see.

320738332.name: Well Worth at Least a Half-Day, More if the Virreinal "Rembrandts" are on Display
320738332.author: a TripAdvisor user
320738332.reviewBody: Puebla, Mexico\'s Amparo Museum can stand proudly in comparison to comparable sights in the U.S. and Canada, thanks in large part to a renovation that cost millions -- this photo an indication of value for the pesos: lots of glass, chrome, and polished granite. I haven\'t been in such a nice museum since touring the similar Mus\u00e9e des beaux-arts de Montr\u00e9al. A second-floor installation at the Amparo, a one-man show that amazed, nevertheless deprived me of the joys of experiencing paintings of the Epoch of the Viceroys, as amusing as Cubist art if only because most of the personages depicted look positively sour-pussed (as they generally were). The swank barista expresso bar upstairs has corridors that frame the many crowns of the huge 16th-17th century cathedral below. I must assume that the Amparo\'s virreinal collection at least rivals that of Tepotzotlan.

318694688.name: Best museum in puebla
318694688.author: a TripAdvisor user
318694688.reviewBody: Good museum to get overview of mexican history. Fantastic building in city center.\nNice roof terrace and bar just food lacks of quality - no real kitchen, more fast food. Good for simple coffee.

312984077.name: Nice modern museum
312984077.author: a TripAdvisor user
312984077.reviewBody: Last time I was here there was an exhibition of pictures of a famous Hungarian photographer whose name I can\'t remeber. I was surprised by the care and style of the museum and of the way the pictures were exhibited and arranged around the place.

311408426.name: Lovely Museum a must if you are in Puebla
311408426.author: a TripAdvisor user
311408426.reviewBody: Here is a very modern museum in one of the oldest parts of Puebla the City Center. On display there where 3 galleries, the best a biggest was the Pre-Hispanic collection. It was beautiful.

310001320.name: One of the nicest museums in Mexico.
310001320.author: a TripAdvisor user
310001320.reviewBody: Great museum to admire Mexican ancient art and culture without ending exhausted.  Go to the roof to admire Puebla\'s churches.

308733882.name: Lovely museum with gorgeous roof deck.
308733882.author: a TripAdvisor user
308733882.reviewBody: This is a lovely, well-curated museum with gorgeous roof deck. From the roof you can see the tops of nearby churches. Go on Friday or Sat when the deck is open late!\n\nI was there for ~hour but wish I spent more time.

308537781.name: Check Out Some of the Roots of Mexican Culture
308537781.author: a TripAdvisor user
308537781.reviewBody: This is a beautiful museum featuring Aztec and other pre-Columbian artifacts.  It is housed in modern architecture with a curator who obviously knows their stuff.

307076705.name: Unexpectedly nice museum
307076705.author: a TripAdvisor user
307076705.reviewBody: This was, for me, an unexpectedly nice museum.  Puebla is a large city of 2+ million inhabitants, si I probably should not have been surprised.  The focus here is pre-Hispanic artifacts.  So, if that\'s not a period of time with which you\'re interested ... I don\'t think you\'d enjoy visiting.  It\'s well organized, well staffed and clean.

304823854.name: Eclectic museum - outstanding contemporary galleries
304823854.author: a TripAdvisor user
304823854.reviewBody: This was an unexpected highlight of our trip to Puebla.  Like it\'s outstanding architecture, the collection and galleries are an unusual collision of disparate periods and styles that shouldn\'t work, but somehow does. The original core was apparently a wealthy family home and collection dating back to the Spanish colonial period, interesting and lovely.  To this, someone very thoughtful and creative added a beautifully presented and well contextualized collection of pre-Columbian art (interspersed with a few wonderful and not intrusive contemporary sound and visual works suggesting ongoing artistic continuity with what others might regard as artifacts from a distant time), a small, but stunning museum within the museum with movingly curated contemporary galleries, and a third, winding area for temporary exhibits, displaying during our visit a gorgeous abundance of works by South African artist William Kentridge.  The spectacular Modernist roof garden with its glass box cafe and expansive decks melting into glorious views of Centro\'s colonial architecture expands and literally caps the museum\'s fusion of old and new.  We were fortunate to be there for an evening of experimental, ambient music on the roof, sipping drinks amongst planters of lavender with Puebla\'s spires alight before us in the cool evening air.  Really, you should go.

299009331.name: Excellent collection and museography
299009331.author: a TripAdvisor user
299009331.reviewBody: Please do not miss this museum. The collection is beautiful and it is presented in a very interesting way. It blends prehispanic with colonial, which is something strange in Mexico, where Spanish culture tends to be set aside. I really loved it! On top, there is a beautiful terrace overlooking the city.

298563221.name: Top-notch international quality. De calidad internacional.
298563221.author: a TripAdvisor user
298563221.reviewBody: Recently revamped, this museum has collections from PreColumbian times to the present, including seasonal expositions, special Creche collections in December, headphones with guided tours, and much more. Free on Mondays. One new addition is the caf\u00e9 on the roof, with a wonderful view of the Cathedral cupulas.\nRecientemente remodelado, tiene colecciones desde tiempos precolombinos hasta el presente, exposiciones temporales, colecciones de nacimientos t\u00edpicos en diciembre, aud\u00edfonos con "tour" guiado y mucho m\u00e1s. Gratis los lunes! El caf\u00e9 en el techo tiene una hermosa vista de las c\u00fapulas de la catedral.

298505271.name: Great Museum
298505271.author: a TripAdvisor user
298505271.reviewBody: Excellent museum with both artifacts and new exhibits to view. Be sure and take the elevator to the top and have coffee in the restaurant and enjoy the view.

298504049.name: excelent museum
298504049.author: a TripAdvisor user
298504049.reviewBody: one of the best historical museums in puebla , with historical information and digital audio ,very well design and mantain,also it has a very good restaurant , and some special acivities on weekends

298099891.name: Amparo sets the standard for all archaeological museums in Mexico
298099891.author: a TripAdvisor user
298099891.reviewBody: Amparo is an outstanding museum that is everything one wishes in a mid size collection setting. Fluid design, well framed displays and the right kind of light for flashless photography makes for an informative and entertaining experience throughout. In my view, one needs at least a full day to truly appreciate its collections. Be sure to watch the video that shows an interview with an indigenous woman in her native tongue. It is a testament to the variety of Indigenous languages still spoken in Mexico and provides the historical continuity with the collections. In terms of logistics, their entrance fee for foreigners is ridiculously low compared to other museums of similar standing worldwide. They are strict about the no liquids rule past the reception area, so be sure to leave your large purses or other large objects at the front desk. As your eyes wonder through one the world\'s leading collections of pre-Columbian art, you\'ll understand their vigilance. This place is a crown jewel of Meso-American culture. I already want to come back.

297697644.name: Love The Arches!
297697644.author: a TripAdvisor user
297697644.reviewBody: What is quite captivating about this museum is the architecture of the building and the design like that of a quad. There are also numerous arches present which are so beautiful! \nBest of all this museum is FREE!

295148391.name: It was Hard to Leave
295148391.author: a TripAdvisor user
295148391.reviewBody: Friends told us we were going to be here for three hours. When they said that before we got to the museum, 3 hours seemed way too long. But after we got here there was so much to see,  we had to tear ourselves away to leave after three hours  There are amazing collections of pre-Columbian and modern Art. I was fascinated to learn stuff I never knew, like that Diego Rivera had a cubist period - and that he wasn\'t in Mexico during the revolution.   Very good interpretive exhibits.   Great rooftop caf\u00e9

291750926.name: Muy maravilloso
291750926.author: a TripAdvisor user
291750926.reviewBody: This museum has an incredible collection of pre-Columbian art.  Be sure to rent the headset so you can hear descriptions in English (or your language).  Do not miss a visit to the rooftop caf\u00e9 where the views are amazing...a kaleidoscope of church spires and domes.  The margarita wasn\'t great so just get a Coke.  You won\'t be disappointed!

290822746.name: Great little museum
290822746.author: a TripAdvisor user
290822746.reviewBody: I visited the Mueso Amparo twice during my stay in Puebla.  It took me two visits to see everything because I like to read all the information in museums.  The main floor has a small exhibit on restoring art and a larger exhibit on prehispanic art.  I think it has a nice little collection of prehispanic art.  The second floor has virreinal art and a recreation of a house.  Seeing the house was my favorite part.  The rooms are beautiful.  The second floor also houses the traveling exhibits.  I would definitely recommend visiting this museum if you\'re in Puebla.  Also, it is free on Mondays!

290552150.name: World-class museum
290552150.author: a TripAdvisor user
290552150.reviewBody: Excellent museum with modern installations. Covers Pre-Columbian era, colonial era, and features temporary shows of contemporary art. When I was there there was a world-class show of the work of South African William Kentridge. Friendly and helpful staff. Excellent gift shop.

284379551.name: Very nice museum
284379551.author: a TripAdvisor user
284379551.reviewBody: Great exhibits - would have been even better if more included info in English as it is extensive and there is a whole lot of info to take in.

282136762.name: Really enjoyed it
282136762.author: a TripAdvisor user
282136762.reviewBody: The museum was excellent and only 100 pesos for both of us, well laid out, well worth a visit. Really nice roof patio with fantastic views over the city - great for photographs.

280379866.name: Great museum
280379866.author: a TripAdvisor user
280379866.reviewBody: I have been here several times. If you visit no other museum here, do this one.  A lot of rotating exhibitions, and a fine collection of pre-Colombian artifacts.  Also some fine restore 19th century rooms.  Best of all, there is a splendid cafe on the roof with great views of the cathedral.  Entry is about $4. Give it a couple of hours, at least

275860316.name: Beautiful Modern Building, Excellant Art
275860316.author: a TripAdvisor user
275860316.reviewBody: Went to see modern art at this beautifully situated and ultra modern building. the shows were current and well curated. The outdoor restaurant and rooftop space was stunning, both for its architecture and views.

272570839.name: Nice prehispanic collection
272570839.author: a TripAdvisor user
272570839.reviewBody: We have visited the Amparo museum on a Monday, it\'s one of the rare attractions to be open on a Monday, and it\'s free access on that day. On the ground floor, very nice prehispanic collection, well documented. Wonderful view on the historic district from the terrasse upstairs. Very pleasant museum.

270151196.name: Super Collection of pre-hispanic items
270151196.author: a TripAdvisor user
270151196.reviewBody: Excellent pre-hispanic museum with great curation and an excellent comparative time-line  of world cultures

267438641.name: A must
267438641.author: a TripAdvisor user
267438641.reviewBody: Beautifully presented art.  Terrace where you can see the city.  Free admission on Mondays.  I want there on Monday, so don\'t know the usual entrance fee.

265365611.name: Cool building, great terrace!
265365611.author: a TripAdvisor user
265365611.reviewBody: The museum has some great galleries, but the roof top terrace had to be my favorite! Was the perfect place to relax after walking through the museum!

263686621.name: Great museum, beware of the security ladies.
263686621.author: a TripAdvisor user
263686621.reviewBody: We loved the museum! They restyled the inner rooms and the result was incredible! Good expositions that really opened our eyes, great terrace (don\'t miss the opportunity to drink a beer with that beautiful landscape) and in general, everything was great! The only opportunity... The security ladies, they should be more sensitive with the people.

263497357.name: Do not miss the terrace!
263497357.author: a TripAdvisor user
263497357.reviewBody: The museum itself is really nice but in my opinion what is worth is the amazing terrace they have!! It is breathtaking and absolutely beautiful! Do not miss it! You can see all the churches and rooftops from above!!! My favorite terrace in the city! I love to get drinks here!

261961595.name: Art with a view!
261961595.author: a TripAdvisor user
261961595.reviewBody: First rate art museum near the center of Puebla.  Be sure to leave some time to linger and enjoy the views from the rooftop terrace (with bar).  Admission is free on Mondays.

257017515.name: Great museum with an even better terrace
257017515.author: a TripAdvisor user
257017515.reviewBody: This is a great place to spend a day. You can visit the museum for about 3 hours and then you can go to their terrace and have a coffee as you take pictures of the Cathedral.

256428743.name: One of my favourite museums ever.
256428743.author: a TripAdvisor user
256428743.reviewBody: A great museum situated at a beautiful house with modern inside redesign. You have to visit if visiting Puebla.

256090997.name: Good collection and great rooftop to survey the town
256090997.author: a TripAdvisor user
256090997.reviewBody: Plus, the gift shop has high quality items. Definitely go up to the rooftop to get a good glimpse of the town and all the chapels from on high.  To visit the galleries takes about 30 minutes and when we were there, featured the work of Orozco and Sequieros and other mexican artists.

255868108.name: Great museum of preHispanic and Colonial artifacts
255868108.author: a TripAdvisor user
255868108.reviewBody: This museum is housed in an original colonial home. Most impressive and fascinating to us was the extensive collection of pre-Hispanic artifacts. But also impressive is the colonial section housed on the second floor. The kitchen and certain living rooms are preserved much as they were in colonial times, and display many pieces from the 16th and 17th centuries. We benefited greatly from the willingness of a security guard by the name of Juan to provide some commentary for us in English.

255778005.name: Lots to see
255778005.author: a TripAdvisor user
255778005.reviewBody: A lot to see here.  Don\'t miss the colonial kitchen.  Thank you to Juan for helping translate for us!  Views from the rooftop cafe are great.

255134204.name: Enjoyable exhibit
255134204.author: a TripAdvisor user
255134204.reviewBody: The building is an interesting mix of old and new put nicely together with an amazing rooftop terrace (has a lovely garden and 360 degree view of the city). We were sold student tickets I think accidentally but we didn\'t mind or question it. The layout of rooms were a little confusing and we were constantly being told which direction to go in and out by all the staff (didn\'t help that we don\'t speak Spanish). The only issue I had was while in each gallery you\'re always being followed by 3+ security members so it makes you feel like you need to keep moving!

253582963.name: Celestial Cafe
253582963.author: a TripAdvisor user
253582963.reviewBody: The Museo Amparo has some great art\u2014but what I loved most was its rooftop cafe. Grab a coffee from the bar inside, then wander around the outside area. It\'s filled with a huge variety of flowering and aromatic plants in different-shaped containers, tables and chairs, telescopes. The best part is feeling as though you could reach out and touch the intricately tiled and painted domes of the baroque buildings all around. A great place to go any time of the day.

253390628.name: A MUST See
253390628.author: a TripAdvisor user
253390628.reviewBody: A beautiful building featuring the BEST of the area .The restaurant on the roof is to die for .What a view

250542011.name: Old and New
250542011.author: a TripAdvisor user
250542011.reviewBody: What an interesting museum. There were antiquities from the region and contemporary art. It was a real surprise. It is a small manageable museum. They have a fantastic roof top garden cafe with indoor and outdoor seating. The cafe is glass on all sides so you get a great view if the weather requires you sit inside.  The museum shop was great with very well made objects: jewelry, weaving, purses, glass, ceramics, books, etc. Well worth looking into for a memory of Puebla.

249620185.name: it must depend on the exhibits based on other\'s assessments
249620185.author: a TripAdvisor user
249620185.reviewBody:
We spent a week in Puebla, our hotel, our cooking class, our food tour were all given 5 stars. We were hoping to issue an equally positive response to our museum experience. Granted, the pre-Hispanic collection was very good and we were equally pleased with the period furniture on display.
We had an opportunity to view  a display of modern art in the same building. Perhaps I lack vision and am  will be willing to admit my shortcomings, but when I see three plastic covered 8 1/2 X 11 inch panels, at varies stages of torn plastic, I  become confused. A 3 foot by 3 foot square panel on the floor with a single piece of the foil from the top of a wine bottle, lacks inspiration, at least for me.  I have difficulty with the merit and what seems to be lack of effort that goes into what is called art in this gallery. There were, in my estimation, a multitude of similar disappointing examples. The Walker Art Center in Minneapolis MN, which I really enjoy,  made, what I thought, a lack luster contribution. All said, you cannot beat the view from the roof of the gallery. Worth seeing, particularly on the day we visited, it was free.
A note: the guards were very insistent that visiting the gallery should be done as instructed by following the predetermined sequence of rooms.
English subtitles, would be handy for the Spanish challenged.

249595166.name: Great rooftop viewing area
249595166.author: a TripAdvisor user
249595166.reviewBody: Like others before me, I was wowed by the rooftop terrace, which has a cafe and an almost 360-degree view of the city.  Make sure that you walk all the way around the terrace.
