I almost missed part of the view.  The museum itself had some interesting things to see, but some of the pre-colonial pieces had been replaced by special expositions of modern art.

249584436.name: crazy art
249584436.author: a TripAdvisor user
249584436.reviewBody: WE re a little more conservative in our taste but this was very interesting and a beautiful museum.  The gift shop is lovely and if you go with an open mind, you will find something that you enjoy.

249134905.name: A good, concise collection and an amazing rooftop cafe.
249134905.author: a TripAdvisor user
249134905.reviewBody: I particularly enjoyed the Pre-hispanic collection and the one with arte virreinal, which I think is permanent and is housed in what used to be the actual house in which Museo Amparo was built. You definitely check it out, particularly what I think is the ballroom, which has pretty pink walls and a beautiful chandelier, and the kitchen. Those were the best rooms. The Pre-hispanic exhibition was great because it was small and to the point, you could actually see the difference in the artistic production of each civilization. After you check out the collections, go to the rooftop cafe. You will have the most amazing view of the domes and towers from different churches, one of them the Cathedral. I think the best time to got is just before sunset, that way you see the skyline during day and night. What a view!

248831481.name: Simple
248831481.author: a TripAdvisor user
248831481.reviewBody: It will always depends on what they are showing at the time, but its not big and it doesnt usually house masterpieces. Check a flyer and see if you are interested, I found a couple of pieces worthy and memorable.

247671051.name: Amazing museum, wonderful setting, great rooftop cafe, must see the view!
247671051.author: a TripAdvisor user
247671051.reviewBody: Loved the whole place, the exhibits, the space, the cafe, the rooftop, and the shop-- an excellent place to shop!

247013212.name: good lunch
247013212.author: a TripAdvisor user
247013212.reviewBody: had great sandwiches with a wonderful view from the rooftop cafe. Need to have a pass but it is just 1 per party and only around $3

246491050.name: Archaelogy.
246491050.author: a TripAdvisor user
246491050.reviewBody: Good stuff from neighboring sites. Also some surprise good modern art! Wish there was more old and less new, but a sparkling, nice new museum. Can\'t go wrong here.

246102939.name: Enjoyable and insightful museum
246102939.author: a TripAdvisor user
246102939.reviewBody: I spent a good hour roaming the numerous exhibits of the Amparo museum. Although there was a little bit too much modern art for my taste, the cafe with a beautiful terasse overlooking the cathedrale was a highlight.

245935956.name: The roof Cafe... More said.
245935956.author: a TripAdvisor user
245935956.reviewBody: If you want a relaxing afternoon seeing all the steeple of Puebla have a coffee at their terrace you will really enjoy it.

239131560.name: Great roof terrace
239131560.author: a TripAdvisor user
239131560.reviewBody: It is worth paying the 35 pesos just to head straight to the roof, where you can buy a drink and enjoy the panorama of Puebla: tiled cupulas aplenty. The museum itself consists of a series of big white rooms (lovely original beams) and disparate displays. The collection of pre-Hispanic art is probably very good but the poor signing means it is tiresome to figure out what you\'re looking at; there is no over-arching connection between the objects thus no readily available lesson for the amateur; and there wasn\'t all that much of it. I really liked some of the modern art but my companion was unimpressed & most of it was really pushing the limits of accessibility.

238981617.name: Excellent roof terrace
238981617.author: a TripAdvisor user
238981617.reviewBody: This museum is one of a kind. Although not in the middle of the Historic Center of Puebla it offer a great museum experience and an awesome terrace.

237904510.name: Modern Museum with old stuff
237904510.author: a TripAdvisor user
237904510.reviewBody: I like museums that diversify their showings and make a point of searching out interesting objects that have a historic significance.  This museum has a lot of old stuff that is just old stuff related to churches.  If you like religious items you will find about 500 years of items from churches or convents.  The most interesting item I found was the view from the rooftop of the surrounding city.

235946076.name: First Class Innovative Delight
235946076.author: a TripAdvisor user
235946076.reviewBody: The exhibits while I visited were a combination of avant-garde and colonial. The museum building is very old, but you\'d never know it once inside and going through the exhibits...which are extremely well curated and designed. There is a rooftop cafe and the entire roof has a beautiful new wooden floor, with comfortable chairs and potted plants and small gardens. This, to encourage people to sit outside and read, visit, or have lunch.\nThe view of the city--and all the church steeples and cupolas is stunning. Do not miss this treat--which for me was totally unexpected: an inviting public rooftop right in the middle of this UNESCO World Heritage City..

235170466.name: Interesting collection, attractive building, great shop
235170466.author: a TripAdvisor user
235170466.reviewBody: We were most interested in the well curated exhibits of pre-Colombian art. However, the rooms devoted to Puebla during colonial times had charm.  The top floor has a coffee shop and lovely outdoor seating with great views of the city.  The gift shop is an added bonus with work by local artisans.

231852506.name: A must do
231852506.author: a TripAdvisor user
231852506.reviewBody: Amparo museum is our best, the colonial art at his best, also Barroco art and several prehispanic pieces.

229321860.name: Made my visit
229321860.author: a TripAdvisor user
229321860.reviewBody: The museum is in two colonial-era buildings that date from the 17th and 18th centuries - linked seamlessly.  This is one of the most gorgeous and sympathetic historic building conversions ever!  It was  so beautiful that it deserves a visit in its own right and for its own sake - don\'t worry about what exhibitions are on!  Check out the roof terrace with cafe and cupola views.  Museo Amparo was the best surprise of Puebla - a must see for any lover of colonial and contemporary art.

227747840.name: Scenic view if the Basilica
227747840.author: a TripAdvisor user
227747840.reviewBody: It had a beautiful view of the Puebla cathedral and the cafe was designed so neat. Love they way the put the outside terrace very modern and overlooking old city. Delightful.

227189198.name: Great collections in a beautiful old setting
227189198.author: a TripAdvisor user
227189198.reviewBody: This is an excellent gallery with some really interesting modern exhibits, beautifully put together. The view from the roof of Puebla is awesome.

226793987.name: Beautiful buidling, check thei exhibit.
226793987.author: a TripAdvisor user
226793987.reviewBody: We went to see their much praised collection of preHispanic art and none was on display. There was a fascinating exhibit of contempary art. Sadly it was not what I wanted to see. There is also a rooftop terrace with a restaurant and spectacular views of the city and mountains. Do visit this in Puebla.!

225839139.name: must go place in Puebla
225839139.author: a TripAdvisor user
225839139.reviewBody:
a must go place in Puebla.  close to historical city center and it has lots of detail english insturctions/explanations to the visitors.

the roof terrace is good too, people can have a coffe here with beautiful view.

check room available!

225550597.name: A contrast to the colonial setting
225550597.author: a TripAdvisor user
225550597.reviewBody: Neat museum, great temporary art, displayed inside a modern building with a trendy rooftop bar. Definitely a must see in Puebla!

225526600.name: One of the best visits in Puebla
225526600.author: a TripAdvisor user
225526600.reviewBody: Do not miss Museo Amparo. Its permanent collection is stupendous, from pre-Colombian artifacts to colonial art, and the wonderful itinerary exhibits. You can easily spend 2-3 hours. Bring a camera so you can take wonderful pics from the terrace cafe of the museum, from where you can enjoy some of the best vistas of the colonial city. The domes of the many colonial churches that make Puebla famous look amazing from the terrace. Enjoy the museum early in the morning or toward the end of the afternoon to better enjoy the terrace.

223302709.name: Nice Expos
223302709.author: a TripAdvisor user
223302709.reviewBody: the building look brand new and nice. they had a VERY good contemporary latin american exhibition .....Definetively worth a visit even if it\'s quick

221860942.name: Refreshing modernity hides inside centuries-old shell
221860942.author: a TripAdvisor user
221860942.reviewBody: This is an architectural wonder with great permanent collection and special exhibits.  The modern steel and glass structure is encased in a rather nondescript old shell of a Puebla building.  Once you go inside, you\'ll be amazed.  The rooftop garden is not to be missed.

214326976.name: Lovely Museum
214326976.author: a TripAdvisor user
214326976.reviewBody: This museum has a great mix of exhibits to please everyone. The Mexican Text exhibit is awesome, and even has cards with English translations. Well worth a visit!

209460460.name: Beautiful building!
209460460.author: a TripAdvisor user
209460460.reviewBody: Beautiful building integrating colonial aspects of the original buildings!   The rooftop terrace is spectacular!

207759673.name: Great view from the roof
207759673.author: a TripAdvisor user
207759673.reviewBody: The art collection was more of what you see in the cathedral. The cafe at the roof top has a great view of all the churches and their domes.

205459018.name: A "must see" Museum
205459018.author: a TripAdvisor user
205459018.reviewBody: This museum is full of beautiful pieces and also enjoy the wonderful blend of Colonial and modern architecture. Perfect for a morning visit. There is a wonderful gift shop for small souvenirs and it has a Roof top cafe with great views of Downtown Puebla.

202776044.name: AWESOME
202776044.author: a TripAdvisor user
202776044.reviewBody: This is a "must see" attraction, a multi-level building with contemporary art on the first level and antiques and period art on other levels spanning centuries of Mexican history. The rooftop terrace offers great views of nearby churches, and a very nice cafe.

202425482.name: A Gem in Puebla.
202425482.author: a TripAdvisor user
202425482.reviewBody: This museum is located centrally in downtown. It\'s a wonderful little museum that you should come up and see. Free on Mondays I believe, maybe it was Sunday, I forget. Check your listings. I love the museum because it was not like most. This was a little bit more than usual. It has a connection to the Cathedral from some of the donations i see, nice artifacts. \n\nI recommend that you go to the rooftop garden oh my gosh. And they have a cafe up there and some of the best views of the city of Puebla. It\'s a must see.

202320692.name: Wait until renovations are done
202320692.author: a TripAdvisor user
202320692.reviewBody: I\'ve been to this museum before and saw fantastic pre-Columbian pieces that are certainly a draw for the US tourist.  This time, however, that whole section was closed for renovations, and they had a few choice pieces.

200990459.name: Our first stop
200990459.author: a TripAdvisor user
200990459.reviewBody:
On visiting Puebla, this was one of our first stops.  The Museum is very easy to locate.  We visited on a Monday, so the admission was free.

The lobby is lovely..a cross stitch display covering the walls, which a cross stitcher certainly appreciates!  However, a lovely commentary explains the significance of the stitching of the women of this wonderful country.

The building is large, airy and beautiful.  The exhibits we saw were fascinating and covered the gamit from photographs to church to pre-hispanic relics.

After our visit we retired to the rooftop to have a cool drink and enjoy the view of the centro from a great rooftop.  We thought it would be wonderful to come back in the evening, but unfortunately this beautiful building closes at 6!

We loved our visit and are recommending it to our friends.

200650758.name: Nice and suprising stop in Puebla
200650758.author: a TripAdvisor user
200650758.reviewBody: Near the Zocalo in an old colonial building, this museum really surprised me. Passing through the old edifice, you walk into a stunning modern museum. Part of the exhibits change regularly, and include contemporary art. The main permanent exhibits are religious art affiliated with the cathedral, and a small but good collection of ancient Mexican artifacts. The top-floor terrace has excellent views over the cathedral and the rest of central Puebla. As a plus, it\'s both free and open on Mondays. Definitely a worthwhile destination if you are in the area.

199932486.name: Mondays: open AND free
199932486.author: a TripAdvisor user
199932486.reviewBody: We arrived in Puebla on a Sunday and thought that Monday will be a bust as far as museums.  What a pleasant surprise: the Amparo was not only open but also had free admission on Mondays.\nAdmittedly, we had such a great time on the lovely roof having a sandwich and coffee and enjoying the view that the collection seemed secondary.  Very cool design and lobby and very interesting T shirts in the gift shop.

199568520.name: most of the pre-hispanic art not on display
199568520.author: a TripAdvisor user
199568520.reviewBody: We were quite disappointed because most of the pre-Hispanic art was not on display.  What was there was excellent, but it was very little.

197873398.name: A lovely way to spend a morning in Pueblo
197873398.author: a TripAdvisor user
197873398.reviewBody: There are many more facits to this museum than you could imagine - recommended by Lonely Planet. Something different around every corner in a beautiful building, all well displayed\n\nFinally enjoy a cup of coffee etc in the roof top restaurant and take in the view of the city

197547176.name: Interesting Museum
197547176.author: a TripAdvisor user
197547176.reviewBody: This museum was recommended to us and we were glad we went to visit..  It is very innovative and there is an absolutely incredible collection of silver.  Highly recommended.

195896249.name: Excellent reuse of building
195896249.author: a TripAdvisor user
195896249.reviewBody: Collection is good vice regal items and a few pre columbian artifacts.  The most interesting is the use of architectural repurposing and the terrace on the roof with a superb view of Puebla

195125589.name: Beautiful Collections
195125589.author: a TripAdvisor user
195125589.reviewBody: A great collection.  Our favorite part was the middle floor, an ancient building and lovely furniture.  Not to be missed.

193883935.name: Great new museum
193883935.author: a TripAdvisor user
193883935.reviewBody: Wonderful exhibits and a cafe on the roof with an amazing view of the Puebla skyline (plus WIFI). Worth the price of admission just to relax inside or outside. My husband loved the exhibit of silver objects

193490248.name: Great museum with fabulous views from rooftop
193490248.author: a TripAdvisor user
193490248.reviewBody: We really enjoyed this museum especially its permanent anthropology collection. Its a new building , well laid out and very comfortable. But the roof top caf\u00e9 and garden were a real surprise  with fabulous views of the city. Free on Mondays.

193292848.name: what a surprise
193292848.author: a TripAdvisor user
193292848.reviewBody: we  booked four nights in puebla and really we could have done everything in 2 or maximum 3 days. we didn\'t fancy another museum after seeing so many in mexico city.however\uff0csince we had one extra day,we might as well go and what a great surprise..the sliver cillections was amazing and rooms full of antique furniture.don\'t forget to have a coffee or beer (25pasos)at the roof top cafe. with such a beautiful view,i could have sit there for the whole afternoon.

191104494.name: Great museum-well worth the visit
191104494.author: a TripAdvisor user
191104494.reviewBody: For 35 pesos, or nothing if you\'re over 60, you get to see pre-hispanic collections, a stunning "made-in-mexico" silver jewelry collection, artifacts from the Puebla Cathedral, and a wonderful-though temporary- photography exhibit by Kati ??, an Austro/Hungarian native who moved to Paris, Spain, and then Mexico in 1939 where she lived and photographed until her death in 2000. \n\nThe building is recently renovated and has a great rooftop cafe with a balcony with views over the city. Worth it all around!

188879842.name: A surprise find
188879842.author: a TripAdvisor user
188879842.reviewBody: This was just one of those spontaneous museum visits.  We bumped into it whilst walking around the city.  What a great surprise!  Excellent art (there are currently four exhibits).  The exhibitions are extremely well laid out..there\'s just enough to make it worth it but not overly cramped with everything and the kitchen sink.  The current exhibitions include sacred art, works in silver, pre-colonial treasures, and a photography exhibit -  a really nice mix.  I sure hope this is their standard.  The staff was really helpful and tolerated our poor Spanish with great professionalism.  As a bonus, there is a really nice cafe on top of the museum that gives you a view of that neighborhood from above.

188847932.name: Must-see in Puebla
188847932.author: a TripAdvisor user
188847932.reviewBody: This is a beautifully designed museum that is well worth an hour or two of your time in Puebla, even without access to the pre-hispanic collection.  When I was there, I saw a stunning exhibition of photographs by Graciela Iturbide and then went up to the rooftop terrace (the cafe was not open when I visited, but I would have loved to spend an afternoon up there).  \n\nBe sure to take your camera with you so you can get photographs of the skyline and Popo from the terrace.

186693871.name: What a surprise!
186693871.author: a TripAdvisor user
186693871.reviewBody: This is a superbly designed museum built within a classic old building.  Not quite finished when we visited, but still first class.  The roof top dining area will be stunning when it is completed, and the city views from there are amazing

185786080.name: Worth your while
185786080.author: a TripAdvisor user
185786080.reviewBody: Don\'t forget to visit this place. It\'s an awesome collection of pre-hispanic artifacts. No photo taking of the collections :(

180460895.name: A good private collection made public
180460895.author: a TripAdvisor user
180460895.reviewBody: This museum of pre-Columbian objects has a few gems, and it si well worth seeing if you are a fan of pre-Columbian art. It is small and not representative as is common with private collections.

169534229.name: High- quality museum
169534229.author: a TripAdvisor user
169534229.reviewBody: Building is a blend of old architecture and a new, glass like addition. The exhibit was extremely interesting and the experience as a must see in Puebla. The building is truly beautiful and art pieces world-class. We travel throughout Europe and would put Amparo in a very high category. Puebla in general has exceeded expectations. Just fantastic.

167012173.name: Still worth a visit
167012173.author: a TripAdvisor user
167012173.reviewBody: Even with the pre-Hispanic art gallery closed temporarily it is worth stopping here and going up to the roof terrace. The building itself and the view from the terrace are worth seeing. A modern glass and steel box has been installed behind the colonial fa\u00e7ade but I found it really beautiful and I liked the minimalist roof garden and there is a cool caf\u00e9 up there where you can pause to view the cupolas of the cathedral and the roof vista. These things are a matter of taste and I would have been less pleased to have had to pay any significant entrance fee - it was free when we went - I was unimpressed with the photography of Graciella Iturbide on exhibition and would have begrudged paying to see it.

166787959.name: Amparo Museum.
166787959.author: a TripAdvisor user
166787959.reviewBody: This has been my favourite museum from Puebla since I can long remember, and now with the remodelling it\u2019s a must of the city, not only because of the prehispanic art collection they own (one of the bests of the country) as well as the colonial art collection, but because of the great view of the cathedral cupolas that you can admire from the new terrace.\n\nOnly $35 pesos for one day visit to the collections and the terrace, and if you like this last I suggest to buy the $35 pesos card that will allow you to visit the terrace(only the terrace) as many times you wish. Enjoy a coffee with a great view, but don\u2019t forget the museum it\u2019s open until 6:00pm

166554117.name: Warning: prehispanic exhibition hall is temporarily closed
166554117.author: a TripAdvisor user
166554117.reviewBody: This museum underwent a recent reform. It is very nice, particularly its roof with views to the Cathedral and Puebla. They will re-open all exhibition halls till december 2013. In spite of this, it\'s still worth visiting its virreynal hall, its terrace, and a temporary exhibition of photography.

162144722.name: INtrerestin mix of modern and colonial architecture
162144722.author: a TripAdvisor user
162144722.reviewBody: I redicovered the museum and I must say the renovation is spectacular, I\'m not sure I like so much modernism, but it looks impressive. There was a beautiful Temporary Exhibit of GRACIELA ITURBIDE, which I found awsome and worth the entrance.\nThe Virreynal exhibit was beautiful as well.\nThe Terrace View of Puebla is great.

161325142.name: Go for the roof top view
161325142.author: a TripAdvisor user
161325142.reviewBody: I kind of found this museum by accident, after wondering around the streets. Mondays are free admission and it\'s closed on Tuesdays. I would go back for spectacular roof top view of Puebla.

160407971.name: Everything closed for renovation, just some daft photos
160407971.author: a TripAdvisor user
160407971.reviewBody: There is a stylish cafe on top.the museum itself is closed for renovation, they still allow entry to the modern part where some uninteresting photos are displayed.

160091056.name: Don\'t Go Until the Renovation is Complete!
160091056.author: a TripAdvisor user
160091056.reviewBody: We went and paid, not realizing that the museum is in renovation and all but the religious collection is closed. Wait two years, and then go. The museum has a great collection that is well worth seeing.

158523751.name: Largely closed until 2014
158523751.author: a TripAdvisor user
158523751.reviewBody: The centerpiece of the Museo Amparo\'s collection -- over 2,500 pieces of pre-Colombian art and artifacts -- is closed for renovation until October 2013...no, December 2013...well, you get the idea.  Other galleries with temporary exhibits -- a photographer and religious artifacts from Pueblan homes -- are open, but thank God I went on a Monday when it\'s free!

155989513.name: Great temporary exposition
155989513.author: a TripAdvisor user
155989513.reviewBody:
First of all, this is a whole new section that was built. Very modern. Very clean. Very bright. Open, 1 or 2 months only.

They had a temporary exposition of the photos of one of Latin Americas best B&W photographer, Graciela Iturbe. Excellent play on light, texture, technique and subject. One can easily see why she is considered one of the best. If you are into photography, it is a worthwhile visit.

The other buildings, containing the colonial and precolonial art were closed for renovation.

155756528.name: Startled and amazed
155756528.author: a TripAdvisor user
155756528.reviewBody: When one enters Museo Amparo is the same feeling as if you were entering any world class museum. I had the privilege to see the Graciela Inturbide photography exhibit and it was exquisite: Lighting, curatorial work, overall arrangement. Allow yourself some time for a coffee at their terrace which overlooks the magnificent Catedral de Puebla.

154442907.name: Newly Remodelled
154442907.author: a TripAdvisor user
154442907.reviewBody: This is a world class museum that has been completely remodeled so although it is in an older building the inside is great. You can not leave Puebla without visiting this museum.

153259252.name: Snoozer
153259252.author: a TripAdvisor user
153259252.reviewBody: Unless you really like museums, I\'d skip this one and enjoy many of the other amazing sites in this city.

152585460.name: Nice, but under construction
152585460.author: a TripAdvisor user
152585460.reviewBody: We were first excited, then slightly disappointed because a lot of the exhibits were not there (reconstruction). However, it was still interesting.

151474562.name: Not worth visiting until renovation finished
151474562.author: a TripAdvisor user
151474562.reviewBody: I visited on a Monday which was fortuitous since it was free. The prehispanic section - which I think is the best- is closed for at least 18 months whilst it is renovated. One is able to ppek into the entrance though and it is a shame it was closed as it looks great.\nI found the silver section and the furniture section not that interesting and most explanations were in Spanish only.\nI would not recommend it until the most interesting part reopened.

150618166.name: Nice but not as great as advertised
150618166.author: a TripAdvisor user
150618166.reviewBody: We enjoyed our visit to this museum but were underimpressed--maybe because our expectations were set very high by the guidebooks.  We enjoyed the exhibits but there weren\'t many.  We almost missed the second building.

150581845.name: Very interesting!
150581845.author: a TripAdvisor user
150581845.reviewBody: This museo is a must see on a visit to Puebla!! I particularly enjoyed the displays of art that we saw.

148852800.name: Overstated probably due to renovations.
148852800.author: a TripAdvisor user
148852800.reviewBody: Everybody recommended this museum. However, the place was great but the exhibits somehow scarce according to the expected. The buildings had many works in process so probably our opinion may be biased on the wrong side.

147515054.name: Mexico\u2019s development over its history
147515054.author: a TripAdvisor user
147515054.reviewBody: The Amparo Museum, located in the historic center of Puebla, is one of the most important historical museums in Mexico.[1] It was inaugurated in 1991 and sponsored by the Amparo Foundation,[2] which was founded in 1979 by Manuel Espinoza Yglesias in honor of his wife.[3]

145105021.name: A Surprise in Two Buildings
145105021.author: a TripAdvisor user
145105021.reviewBody: The PreColumbian section was closed when we were there, but the few pieces they had out were exemplary. Loved the timeline of mankind. The people who work there are so proud of their collection it would be impossible not to agree.

144704869.name: Where\'s the pre Hispanic pieces?
144704869.author: a TripAdvisor user
144704869.reviewBody: All but 7 of the pre Hispanic pieces are put away for the next year during a big reconstruction. This was not told to us as we bought our ticket. Come back in a year and I\'m sure this would get 5 stars.

143621466.name: Pretty Little Museum
143621466.author: a TripAdvisor user
143621466.reviewBody: This museum is a great find. It is small and it doesn\'t take long to walk through, but they have some nice pieces. The museum is in this wonderful, historic building which is the typical style you think of when it comes to mexican buildings, with the courtyard inside. There are a range of art pieces including paintings, sculptures, and furniture. It cost around $4 entry total for 5 people. This is also one of the only attractions that I have seen that has central air. If you are walking around on a hot day, take a walk through the museum to cool off.

143424478.name: Special.
143424478.author: a TripAdvisor user
143424478.reviewBody:
I’ve visited this museum several times, mostly because I used to live in the city. The place has always been different, mostly due to the way the exhibitions are managed. With this I mean that while in a conventional museum you would only find a collection of items with just a tiny descriptive tag the people at this museum tries to have a more didactic approach.

Lately, they’ve been doing things to keep with the times but, personally, I think that it was not as amazing as it used to be. Maybe the technology is more expensive or something, I don’t know. Currently is a very good museum but is far from the time when I experienced there for the first time a touch-screen interface and that was like twenty years ago.

Anyway, the collection is good, although I always skip the colonial part of it. It’s a good place to spend a couple of hours if you’re somewhere nearby.

137314128.name: Disappointing
137314128.author: a TripAdvisor user
137314128.reviewBody: Much talked about, but on the day of our visit,, only one display room was open,rather curious since this is the holiday season in Mexico.

135436939.name: amazing!!!
135436939.author: a TripAdvisor user
135436939.reviewBody: there was an exhibition about things made of silver, like rosaries, candle holders, trays, images of our lady of guadalupe.. incredible and beautiful!!!!!

134750350.name: Excellent! (But the permanent collection is closed summer of 2012)
134750350.author: a TripAdvisor user
134750350.reviewBody: Great great museum, being renovated currently, so not quite the must-see right now as it will be when the renovation is complete.  Pre-columbian collection is the best in the area.

132778932.name: Best docent I\'ve worked with in Mexico
132778932.author: a TripAdvisor user
132778932.reviewBody: Only three exhibits were open when we went, but we were blown away by the work of architect Enrique Norton. His work both in Mexico and NYC was incredible. I was excited to see his new plans for the Guggenheim Museum being proposed in Guadalajara. The next day we walked to his La Mantarraya Park which just opened last month in the city.

128256402.name: great pre-hispanic collection
128256402.author: a TripAdvisor user
128256402.reviewBody: Time well spent at this museum with a great collection of pre-hispanic artifacts.

127269061.name: An excellent museum of pre-Columbian artifacts
127269061.author: a TripAdvisor user
127269061.reviewBody: The Amparo Museum is a very well constructed and managed museum of pre-Columbian history.  The items displayed are excellent.  The explanations are not hard for "so-so Spanish readers" to understand.

126456755.name: Small, but insighful!
126456755.author: a TripAdvisor user
126456755.reviewBody:
The prehispanic part of the museum is one of the best - not too big (so you will not get exhausted) covers all regions of Mexico (and Guatemala). Which is good, to see the items compared, not only "this is our pyramid and what we have found in it".

What is more important, the museum guides you through the eras of 'indigenas' in Mexico giving you the overview that made me understand context of all pyramids I have seen so far in the region. Also nice is a timeline showing the civilisation and art achievements in all continents compared. You can see what happened in Mexico when there were pyramids in Egipt, or what kind of art was created in Asia when there was Leonardo daVinci in Italy. Really nice.
Definitely worth visiting!!

125931525.name: Says it All without words
125931525.author: a TripAdvisor user
125931525.reviewBody: Fantastic way to learn about pre-colonial Mexico.  Visual timeline says it all.  History in pictures and artifacts. Fun information for kids, on understanding daily life, rituals.  This museum is a must see.

124838935.name: LOVED IT!!  Extremely interesting ...
124838935.author: a TripAdvisor user
124838935.reviewBody: I have to give a disclaimer that I am incredibly interested in ancient cultures (especially those in Mexico) so I was expecting to enjoy the museum.  What I was not expecting, however, was the size of the museum and the number of pieces in their collection.  There was a huge amount of fascinating prehispanic items - statues, figurines, pottery, carvings, etc.  The collection included items from throughout Mexico spanning the entire prehispanic history.  It inncluded artifacts from Tolteca, Totonaca, Nayarit, Azteca, Maya, Huasteca, Olmec, and other civilizations.  The museum was clean and very well maintained.  Even my husband, who has shown very little interest in this type of thing, was enthralled.  Visiting the museum was our favorite stop in Puebla!  \n\nThe only thing which was slightly annoying was that if you wanted to take photos, you had to pay an extra 50 pesos (~$5).  I declined to pay that and instead ended up purchasing a book with beautiful color photos (much better than those I would have taken myself) and also descriptions of the pieces.  Admission was 35 pesos per person.  Note that they are closed on Tuesdays ... we atttempted to visit on a Tuesday but had to postpone our visit til Wednesday morning.

124835213.name: Good, but not very big
124835213.author: a TripAdvisor user
124835213.reviewBody: The museum has some nice artifacts, but it is quite small and can be seen in 30 minutes or so.  It is definitely worth seeing while you are in Puebla, but don\'t set aside too much time for it.

124269032.name: Great museum
124269032.author: a TripAdvisor user
124269032.reviewBody: This is one of Mexico\'s best museums, with an important prehispanic collection and modern art pieces. Their temporal exhibits are allways interesting. Right now is getting a makeover but it\'ll remain open during the renovations.

123977878.name: Worth More than One Visit
123977878.author: a TripAdvisor user
123977878.reviewBody: The Amparo Museum was recommended by a friend in Mexico city and we were not disappointed.  While keeping the outside colonial structure intact, the modern interior was perfectly designed to highlight each artifact to perfection.  The sequence of exhibits, focused lighting and soft pallet of wall colors added to the enjoyment of circling through the rooms.  Even the gift store was beautifully appointed and stocked with books and replicas about the pieces,

122468137.name: This museum knocked my socks off!
122468137.author: a TripAdvisor user
122468137.reviewBody: Wandered in thinking it would be another small regional museum--tight budget, earnest, proud, but modest.  After touring the contemporary art section, I found the pre-Columbian wing.  Magnificient!  Terrific pieces, excellent displays, and bi-lingual signs which explained a great deal without going overboard.  I\'ve seen a lot of museums in Mexico, and this is a jewel.

120613942.name: Many treasures
120613942.author: a TripAdvisor user
120613942.reviewBody: I was impressed by the quality of the collection and the displays which allows one to learn a lot.

120469327.name: Gem...not to be missed!
120469327.author: a TripAdvisor user
120469327.reviewBody: If you are a serious museum buff, not to be missed. Not only is the collection impressive, but it is house in two seventeeth & eighteenth century buildings.\n\nQuite by chance, I managed to be in Puebla at a time when 2 experts in the field of Mayan writing had a scheduled one week course being offered; one was from Mexico City & the other was from Spain.  I was able to attend the (free) opening evening celebrations, hear them present (in Spanish) an overview of their life\'s work as well as visit the special exhibit that would be open to the public the next day. It was an expected thrill to catch this event!

119919903.name: A must see
119919903.author: a TripAdvisor user
119919903.reviewBody: superb collection of pre-hispanic and pre-colombian art, utensils and other stuff. well laid out, well explained (mostly in english too) and also a great collection of modern Mexican art too.

119812889.name: Old & New Worlds
119812889.author: a TripAdvisor user
119812889.reviewBody: Beautiful Museum. They had a modern exhibit upstairs and the permanent collection downstairs of the ruins. An interesting contrast!

116939482.name: One of the best museum I have visited
116939482.author: a TripAdvisor user
116939482.reviewBody: I was so impressed by the collections the have. Wow, impressive. Loved the museum itself and the way you visit the different room.  The special exibit (about the king) was fantastic. I loved it!  The museum was super clean and people were friendly.  I was with young children which didn\'t allow me to spend as much time as I would had liked looking around. I would love to go back, and this time alone!  I strongly recommend this museum!

113138217.name: Amazing Museum - Wonderful Collection
113138217.author: a TripAdvisor user
113138217.reviewBody: We visited the Amparo Museum last month while staying in Puebla and really enjoyed it. It\'s a beautiful museum with a wonderful collection. There were two contemporary exhibits at the time which were both wonderful. We especially enjoyed the vast Prehispanic collection. Great experience - a must see!

22447281.name: A good look at Pre-Columbian Arts
22447281.author: a TripAdvisor user
22447281.reviewBody: This is a very good museum. You can see pre-Hispanic objects elsewhere but this place is nicely laid out and roomy, descriptions are in English as well as Spanish, and what is there for you to see is worth your time unless you have seen many museums like this one before. In addition, it also has a collection of colonial art and furniture. It is also open on Mondays when most other museums are closed and also free on Mondays. There is a shop and cafe. Don\'t bring your camera unless you want to pay extra for the privilege of taking photos. It\'s just a short walk to the south of the Zocalo in the center of Puebla.

19814268.name: excellent museum of pre-Columbian art
19814268.author: a TripAdvisor user
19814268.reviewBody: The Amparo is a modern and well-laid out Museum of pre-Columbian art with explanations in both Spanish and English, located in downtown Puebla located inside a beautiful old building. Because Puebla is not as frequently visited as Mexico City, the museum was spacious and not overrun at all when I visited in late August (mild climate, by the way). The museum shop is full of stuff, but sadly most of it is local tourist tat. There is a shop specializing in talavera pottery, but for that you want to go to the artisan\'s district, where you\'ll get a larger selection at better prices.

649004313.name: Parque Paseo de Gigantes is a must visit in Puebla
649004313.author: a TripAdvisor user
649004313.reviewBody: This attraction is free and you can view all the mini monuments in 2 hours. It is very accessible as it is located off the Hermanos Serdan Blvd. It is a 30 minute ride from the downtown and close to major hotels off the Sedan Blvd. The park is divided by countries, Mexico, USA, Germany, Italy, France, Egypt, England, Japan, Australia and China.

address.streetAddress: Calle Francisco Villa 4 Las Fuentes de Puebla

643436343.name: Illustrative!
643436343.author: a TripAdvisor user
643436343.reviewBody: The idea is old, and can be found in many cities in the world, but the experience is well worth it if you happen to be in Puebla.  The park offers a promenade on which you can see some of the most iconic monuments of the planet, such as the White House, the Kremlin, the Pyramids of Giza, the Eiffel Tower, and many more.  The walk takes about an hour, but it is truly enjoyable.

address.streetAddress: Calle Francisco Villa 4 Las Fuentes de Puebla

632834458.name: Very interesting place
632834458.author: a TripAdvisor user
632834458.reviewBody:
El Parque Paseo de los Gigantes is a very interesting place, because there are many edifications that are very loyal to the real ones, and in the front part of every edification, there is a plate that shows all the information and the history about this buildings.
It is a very nice place to visit if you go whit your family, even if you go alone or whit a partner, there are many things to see, you can gain a lot of knowledge about the most important and famous places of the world.
All the Park is divided by sections, of the continents and the countries, whit his respective environment and music of each part of the continent.
I like this place a lot, and it is better if you go in the night, definitely it is a very amazing experience.

address.streetAddress: Calle Francisco Villa 4 Las Fuentes de Puebla

589250114.name: Brilliant and FREE!
589250114.author: a TripAdvisor user
589250114.reviewBody: This gem of a park is rally accessible being right in the city. As a family we thoroughly enjoyed walking around and seeing the many themed miniature landmark models which are thoughtfully presented on what turns out to be quite a large site with a connecting bridge to walk over. It\'s wonderfully typecast so that when you are looking at Buckingham palace, Big Ben and the British Houses of Parliament there is a soundtrack over the loudspeakers that switches between the national anthem and the Beatles. We finished up with a game of mini-golf for which we were happy to pay the modest entry fee.

address.streetAddress: Calle Francisco Villa 4 Las Fuentes de Puebla

512377170.name: Incredible!! Love it
512377170.author: a TripAdvisor user
512377170.reviewBody:
A tiny trip around the world free !!

 There are replicas from all over the world from Mexico China usa Japón Paris Germany plus there's a little mini golf and tenis courts also a path for bicycle excelente choice to go with the kids

address.streetAddress: Calle Francisco Villa 4 Las Fuentes de Puebla

484113519.name: Best park ever!
484113519.author: a TripAdvisor user
484113519.reviewBody:
What a great way to take a world tour on a sunny afternoon. This is a beautiful park to walk in and has absolutely awesome landscaping. I have seen many of the buildings in real life, and the detail work in the park is incredible. 

I am posting a photo of Notre Dame. Looking at the miniature version allowed me to see architectural features I missed on the real thing. Look at those gargoyles!

The fact they play appropriate music for each site (Beatles music in London, for example) is truly inspired design. And f you need a break, for 35 pesos you can play a fun round of mini golf.

address.streetAddress: Calle Francisco Villa 4 Las Fuentes de Puebla

472778740.name: Interesting way to see some of the great structures of the world!
472778740.author: a TripAdvisor user
472778740.reviewBody: Found this park when walking around the Marriott hotel. It has about 50 miniature models of some of the popular man made structures from around the world. They were all very authentic looking. A nice way to take an hour or so stroll. There is also biking, Putt putt golf, tennis courts and handball courts onsite.

address.streetAddress: Calle Francisco Villa 4 Las Fuentes de Puebla

677346343.name: Beautiful antique library, the first in the Americas
677346343.author: a TripAdvisor user
677346343.reviewBody: Beautiful little library museum, with 5,000 volumes of old books, exquisite wood furniture, and other artifacts. Great photography subject too.

676927778.name: Amazing room!
676927778.author: a TripAdvisor user
676927778.reviewBody: This amazing room is a bibliophiles dream come true - 46,000 books mas ou menos! The entire room is carved wood and on three levels - one of the most beautiful collections I have seen.

676251648.name: Medieval scientific library with books by Kepler, Newton, Descartes and other greats
676251648.author: a TripAdvisor user
676251648.reviewBody: Worth visit for everybody interested in history of natural sciences - most medieval libraries funded by monks have mostly books related to religion or everydays life, this one has (in special glass displays) first editions of works by Kepler, Newton, Descartes and other greats. Also some even older textbooks on astronomy, mathematics, moon maps, very unusual collection! Also the library is beautiful by itself, long hall with old but well preserved bookshelves full of ancient tomes, old tables and chairs, everything well harmonized.

671551128.name: Amazing to see
671551128.author: a TripAdvisor user
671551128.reviewBody: It is close to everything and only takes a few minutes to walk to. The history that those books hold would be increadable to see. The effort to build the room and to catalog the books must have been amazing. It didnt cost much at all to get in so well worth the money

668769772.name: small but worth the trip
668769772.author: a TripAdvisor user
668769772.reviewBody: I believe it cost $2 to get into this library. It is small but definitely worth visiting. it is beautifully kept and the details of the woodwork are stunning.

664876753.name: Important Historical Library
664876753.author: a TripAdvisor user
664876753.reviewBody: You don\'t need to have an interest in rare/antique texts to visit this library, or a specific interest in architecture. If you simply enjoy libraries and books in general, you will still probably find this library very interesting. I particularly enjoyed seeing the old furniture and equipment on display, like the book wheel (not sure what the correct term is) for doing research with multiple texts at once.

663994762.name: Amazing wood wotk
663994762.author: a TripAdvisor user
663994762.reviewBody: This is a very rich library not only in books but also in decoration. The hand crafted wood is really beautiful. The building and the decoration takes you back in time.

662593575.name: Amazing library with a rich history.
662593575.author: a TripAdvisor user
662593575.reviewBody: Glad I had the opportunity to visit this amazing site in Puebla. Beautiful and the understanding of how ti was created is amazing.

659374446.name: Wonderful library, a time capsule.
659374446.author: a TripAdvisor user
659374446.reviewBody: Like the Cathedral, which is very close by, this is something everyone who comes to Puebla should go and see.  Its a wonderful and grand room, obviously filled with books, but also scientific material, and gives a good idea of how erudite the Jesuits were, especially Bishop Palafox.

658448502.name: excellent if your interest is in centuries old tomes
658448502.author: a TripAdvisor user
658448502.reviewBody: The library is probably not for everyone. It is not hands on and you can merely cast a glance at what was once a world class library with its roots in Puebla\'s birth as a colonial city. If old books and their habitat is your "thing", you will be most pleased. Nothing to touch, handle or with which to interact. Very visual and cerebral, not tactile.

656998869.name: Beautiful old library
656998869.author: a TripAdvisor user
656998869.reviewBody: What a collection of historical material. The wood in the library is beautiful and the collection includes a few unique books. You can\'t touch anything but the visit is worth it just for the ambiance of the room. Loved it.

656094154.name: Amazing place
656094154.author: a TripAdvisor user
656094154.reviewBody: Don\u2019t miss this. It\u2019s a short visit but quite spectacular. There are guides available but since it\u2019s only one small room, we wandered around ourselves in complete awe that the library had been so beautifully preserved.

654385750.name: Beautiful Library
654385750.author: a TripAdvisor user
654385750.reviewBody: Along with England\u2019s Bodleian library, a must-visit for bibliophiles. Beautifully preserved books are everywhere, including an interesting depiction of St. Thomas Aquinas. (February 2019)

654012613.name: Very Beautiful Room
654012613.author: a TripAdvisor user
654012613.reviewBody: We had to return as the opening is after 11:00, but it was worth it\n\nNot Prague\u2019s famous library but really worth the time.  Just across from cathedral.

653817124.name: Worth the visit!
653817124.author: a TripAdvisor user
653817124.reviewBody:
Beautiful historical library!

Founded in 1646, it was the first public library in colonial Mexico and is sometimes considered the first in the Americas

I especially like what the founder said “He who succeeds without books is in an inconsolable darkness, on a mountain without company, on a path without a crosier, in darkness without a guide.”

653113634.name: Public Library!!
653113634.author: a TripAdvisor user
653113634.reviewBody: What a gift to the community the founder of this library made when he required that it be open not just yo clergy but to the public as well. Beautiful setting, amazing books and we happened to be there when there was a music and dance festival on the ground floor!

652847420.name: A special place
652847420.author: a TripAdvisor user
652847420.reviewBody: That Bishop Panafox was inspired to create this fabulous library.  Absolutely worth visiting.  My wife now wants me to build something like it at home,

648833516.name: A unique historic place that is worth visiting
648833516.author: a TripAdvisor user
648833516.reviewBody: Considered to be the first public library in all of Latin America.  Really cool room, with a large collection of old books.  Certainly worth visiting if you are in Puebla.

645823847.name: Went in on a whim
645823847.author: a TripAdvisor user
645823847.reviewBody: I decided, sort of last minute, to go into the Biblioteca Palafoxiana, and was very glad I did.  I love libraries, and the room in which many of the books are stored is absolutely gorgeous.  There were many titles from all over the world, in all different languages.  The books in the area that tourists go in are only on display; in order to do any research there, as in many libraries of this type, one must make an appointment.

645241792.name: Oldest in Western Hemisphere
645241792.author: a TripAdvisor user
645241792.reviewBody: History and library buffs, this is a must check out. A little bit hard to find and though it may appear, entry is not free, but well worth even a short visit. Tickets were minimal pricing. Antique wood shelving and staircases and interesting display in glass cases adorn this rectangular space. There\'s even a bilingual text in Nahuatl and Spanish in one of the case. Ipads display some of the other items. Well worth it even for a 15 minute short visit.

644094594.name: Wonderful Library
644094594.author: a TripAdvisor user
644094594.reviewBody: A library that merits is history. This was the most famous library in the Americas, and seeing it made it clear of its importance.  Worth the visit.  Poor signage, however.

641895541.name: Was blown away: wonder of the world
641895541.author: a TripAdvisor user
641895541.reviewBody: This could easily be a new wonder of the world- like walking into a Harry Potter set, the first library of the Americas is a treasure that must be seen. Put it on your list and make sure you see it. Highly recommended.

641288663.name: Difficult to find
641288663.author: a TripAdvisor user
641288663.reviewBody: The location is tucked away and difficult to find, one the second floor of a nondescript building, but the trek is worth it for a glimpse at this beautiful library. Wood paneling and a spiral staircase along with the tile floor are lovely.

636762949.name: A quick visit
636762949.author: a TripAdvisor user
636762949.reviewBody: This room is atmospheric and historically significant.  It is lovely to see the racks of manuscripts and books.

636759110.name: Really nice
636759110.author: a TripAdvisor user
636759110.reviewBody: Really nice experience. It is not a big place and there is entrance fee. Really great experience. \nI can guess it can be really crowded when many turists are around.

634208205.name: Amazing Place
634208205.author: a TripAdvisor user
634208205.reviewBody:
This extraordinary place it's a little bit hidden inside a building in downtown.
You go upstairs and see this amazing Library with all kind of things on the table and many books in different floors.
Religious images are inside the place too.
It's an amazing place you should visit. 
Entrance costs 40 pesos about 3 dollars.

633681730.name: Amazing
633681730.author: a TripAdvisor user
633681730.reviewBody: Not something you see everyday.  The volumes and excerpts in the exhibits are fascinating.  I\'d swear that some of the volumes came off the first Guttenberg presses.  Much to see in the courtyard.  Don\'t miss this place.

631302239.name: The first public library in North America
631302239.author: a TripAdvisor user
631302239.reviewBody: I am so happy that I did not miss touring this small but spectacular historic library near the Cathedral.  There was a huge line up on November 2 due to the displays of alters in honour of the dead on the main floor, but on Saturday morning we went at 10 when it opened and it was so lovely.  The ancient books, furnishings and wood work was amazing.

631257565.name: Amazing collections and historic feel
631257565.author: a TripAdvisor user
631257565.reviewBody: This place is gorgeous, its a happy place for book nerdies. It was a bit crowded because there is a altar for the dead tour in there at the time and there was a line, but if you go around 10am there is very few people and can go to the main place which is the library. Pay something around 40 pesos per person and theres also a locker, its a beautiful place to visit and to be able to see such old well preserved books is a priviledge.

628268130.name: 45 pesos for 5 minutes walk
628268130.author: a TripAdvisor user
628268130.reviewBody: This library is inside the house of culture. Is a very tiny space, which is a problem when a few people are inside,  and it takes 5 minutes to visit. Better to take the picture from outside.

627831794.name: Breathtaking - Don\u2019t miss it when visiting Puebla
627831794.author: a TripAdvisor user
627831794.reviewBody: I\u2019ve had the fortune of visiting many historic places around the world and must honestly say that I was impressed by the Biblioteca Palafoxiana. It is very small but so full of character and you can \u2018smell history while inside\u2019. You can stand on the main isle and admire the rows of books for 5 mins or a couple of hours, it is truly up to you. Regardless of how much time you spend inside I truly believe you will come out saying it was worth stopping by and visiting the FIRST PUBLIC LIBRARY in the America\u2019s (North, Central or South) with over 45,000 on display...

624536577.name: Jewel of museum for MezoAmerican history
624536577.author: a TripAdvisor user
624536577.reviewBody: A gorgeous presentation of history and art. The new architecture is excellent.  Nice rooftop cafe for coffee or drinks

621430718.name: A must
621430718.author: a TripAdvisor user
621430718.reviewBody: Beautiful place a must see when in puebla.\nTake the tour the staff will gladly tell you all the stories of this beautiful library.

619497417.name: Beautiful
619497417.author: a TripAdvisor user
619497417.reviewBody: Housed on the upper floor of a building devoted to the arts, is this library collection displayed in tiers of rich colored wood.  It has a cathedral like feel.  Open books on tables in the center of the room offer a glimpse into printing history.  This place was foremost on my Puebla list.  I wrote to them before my visit regarding genealogy research.  Their negative answer was prompt.  It\'s not that kind of library.  Do not walk through quickly.

616241186.name: Must see in Puebla, very well kept
616241186.author: a TripAdvisor user
616241186.reviewBody: This is a hidden gem in Puebla, it was closed for maintenance for a long time, however now that it has reopened, it is a must see in Puebla. With around 40,000 old books, it is a quick visit but totally worth it, and it is across the street from the cathedral, so if you are around, do not miss it!

616115610.name: A gem!
616115610.author: a TripAdvisor user
616115610.reviewBody: What a treat it was to go to the oldest library in North America. I walked out of there feeling so good that we made the time to show the kids this gem.

614347892.name: UNESCO Memory of the World Register.
614347892.author: a TripAdvisor user
614347892.reviewBody: The Biblioteca Palafoxiana is a library in Puebla, Mexico and a must to visit.Founded in 1646, it was the first public library in colonial Mexico,[and is sometimes considered the first in the Americas.It has more than 45,000 books and manuscripts. In 2005, it was listed on UNESCO\'s Memory of the World Register.

613955171.name: Beautiful impressive library
613955171.author: a TripAdvisor user
613955171.reviewBody: This is a beautiful and impressive library, with lots of books accumulated in time and very nice architecture.

606751120.name: Lovely library, the oldest in the Americas
606751120.author: a TripAdvisor user
606751120.reviewBody: The library is not well marked on the street, but persist, find the building and go up to the second floor. There you will pay and be offered a free tour by a knowledgeable guide. Be sure to tip her/him for their time and expertise. Our guide was young and fun and brought history alive for our short visit. We enjoyed learning some new words in Spanish and helping her learn a few new words in English.

605438428.name: AN UNEXPECTED JEWEL
605438428.author: a TripAdvisor user
605438428.reviewBody: Centrally located, 2 blocks from El Zocalo de Puebla.  "la bibloteca" is a  unique place where wisdom, science and faith have collided for more than 300 years.

605154588.name: What a gem!
605154588.author: a TripAdvisor user
605154588.reviewBody: Loved this small, compact but extremely historic library.  Small online kiosks allowed one to view rare books up close and in great detail.  Very worth a visit.

603309497.name: historical site
603309497.author: a TripAdvisor user
603309497.reviewBody: visit this library to get a flavor of the historical treasure of Puebla; the decoration and art is beautiful

601176886.name: Book lovers dream.
601176886.author: a TripAdvisor user
601176886.reviewBody: If you love books and libraries this is wonderful.  Very historic.  This is on my top 10 list of things to see in Puebla or sure.

600032759.name: Great Library!
600032759.author: a TripAdvisor user
600032759.reviewBody:
5* Biblioteca Palefoxiana
Located on backside of the Cathedral; part of La Casa de la Cultura
Zillions of antiquarian books e.g., Isaac Newton, polyglot Bible
Beautiful décor of three story library; tiled floors
Admission of 40 pesos, photos allowed without flash, must check in backpacks, packages into lockers
Also, can see the art exhibits on second floor e.g., retrofitted art e.g., Da Vinci ‘s “The Last Supper.”
Keep library receipt in order to use bathroom

596829122.name: A very interesting place to be at!
596829122.author: a TripAdvisor user
596829122.reviewBody: A very nice experience to get close to hundred years of history..would be nice to have somebody explaining a lottle more about the place

596493051.name: Worth visiting this historical library
596493051.author: a TripAdvisor user
596493051.reviewBody: Impressive library with a unique collection of very old books (many hand-written). This relatively small library (for current standards) is located in a historical colonial building, which makes the visit even more worthwhile.

595707985.name: Book Lovers Delight
595707985.author: a TripAdvisor user
595707985.reviewBody: This library is truly ancient, ornate, and filled to the ceiling with antique volumes. It is very much like the Bodlian Library in Oxford, U.K., and just as "hands-off." There are several approachable exhibits, but for the most part, you just stand and appreciate the antiquity and the beauty.  It is located right off the Zocalo, so you don\'t have to devote much time to seeing it. Twenty minutes inside is about what you might want.

593410661.name: Reverence
593410661.author: a TripAdvisor user
593410661.reviewBody: Imagine the dedication it took to create this library, stock it with books, and take care of it for almost 500 years. Awesome.

593387942.name: Flabbergasted
593387942.author: a TripAdvisor user
593387942.reviewBody: What an amazing place, the sheer beauty of the library, the books, the smell, the wooden shelves. And again the Catholic Church with golden altar. Also a exposition of the cathedral statues, paintings, restoration work in progress. Beautiful

590964765.name: A slice of history
590964765.author: a TripAdvisor user
590964765.reviewBody: The Bibliotec is an impressive library to spend a few minutes walking. It has a small admission, 30 pesos, or you can just stand at the door and look in.

588605611.name: A must
588605611.author: a TripAdvisor user
588605611.reviewBody: This library is a museum now , the books in the first floor are kept behind cages , and they charge for the visit , and it  shouldn\u2019t be the case , buy it is worth the price because it is beatiful . It is very well kept , it is the first public library in America, founded in 1646. It is considered a Historic Monument .

588106768.name: Very nice historical place
588106768.author: a TripAdvisor user
588106768.reviewBody:
Very nice historical place.
One of the places you must visit in Puebla, crossing the street after visiting the Cathedral of Puebla in downtown.
Very nice historical place.
One of the places you must visit in Puebla, crossing the street after visiting the Cathedral of Puebla in downtown.

586295810.name: Outstanding Slice of History
586295810.author: a TripAdvisor user
586295810.reviewBody: A must see...this slice of history was a direct relationship of the great history of Puebla.  Make sure you look at Sir Issac Newton.

583503712.name: One of the most important librarles in the world
583503712.author: a TripAdvisor user
583503712.reviewBody: A very well kept number of books, some of them unique in a gorgeous place where time seemed to stop. An althar is also part of this wobderful library!

581450942.name: Wonders of old books
581450942.author: a TripAdvisor user
581450942.reviewBody: Worthwhile for those of us who appreciate the rarity of books from the 1400 & 1500\u2019s. Beautifully kept and I am sure a good source of information for those qualified to look at the books.

581323449.name: A tru must in Puebla
581323449.author: a TripAdvisor user
581323449.reviewBody: This library owes its existence to the Spanish Bishop Juan de Palafox y Mendoza who held the office of Bishop first in Puebla de los Angeles, and later graduated to an even high post of Vice Rey and Captain General of New Spain. He was also a scholar and the collection here is absolutely mind boggling not to mention the beautifully sculpted library and an incredibly ornate door. So, the library is worth a visit both as an architectural monument and as treasure cove of bibliographic rarities.\nAs it is housed in the House of Culture, there are frequent folkloric exhibitions, warmly greeted by local public, and also high quality handicrafts are on sale.

581303439.name: First library in Mexico
581303439.author: a TripAdvisor user
581303439.reviewBody: Highly recommend stopping by this library.. first one in Mexico and a UNESCO site for the books that go back hundreds of years. Even a bible that is translated into 9 languages.

580942514.name: Old, Dusty
580942514.author: a TripAdvisor user
580942514.reviewBody: An incredible collection of old books, not for circulation.\nNever had to pay to enter a Library\nNice crafts for sale downstairs

574579001.name: Very interesting!
574579001.author: a TripAdvisor user
574579001.reviewBody: Here you can find one of the oldest collections of books. Most of them had to do with religion but there are also lots related to medical and botanical matters. Love the smell of old books.

572045494.name: For History Lovers
572045494.author: a TripAdvisor user
572045494.reviewBody:
The Biblioteca Palafoxiana is a jewel of Puebla. As the first library in Latin America conserves its collection with original pieces.

Since Medicine to Mathematics to Theology or Cartography. Books with more than 500 years! Lot of world knowledge and rare book can be found here.

PRO TIP: You can find more information at palafoxiana.com and even ask to review some of those rare books (only research purpose)

571934668.name: Spectacular!
571934668.author: a TripAdvisor user
571934668.reviewBody: Its history is immense and beautifully displayed. The details of the library are fascinating. They really need to make a effort at preserving these manuscripts and books, perhaps some organization can assist them in this endeavor to preserve these antiquities, which will not last forever.

571733562.name: Totally beautiful
571733562.author: a TripAdvisor user
571733562.reviewBody: Incredible very old Spanish library, well worth the visit. Basically\none room, but oh what a room. GO!

570677440.name: Oldest public library in the Americas, est. 1646. Don\'t miss it.
570677440.author: a TripAdvisor user
570677440.reviewBody: There are 5,000 antique books including a Hebrew bible and 16th century dictionary in a beautiful colonial building.

569402026.name: Amazing
569402026.author: a TripAdvisor user
569402026.reviewBody: This place it\u2019s historical. It has books that were collected since 1498, the library was open in the 1600 and it has a very nice and amazing collection of books

566890503.name: Great Find
566890503.author: a TripAdvisor user
566890503.reviewBody: Across street from Puebla Cathedral and a rare gem.  Tucked away on the second floor of a courtyard building, this library has an amazing history as it has moved around a few times over the years.  A must see and free!

563967397.name: inspirational
563967397.author: a TripAdvisor user
563967397.reviewBody: IT does not take long to tour this wonderful place and is worth every minute to just soak in the antiquity! One of the things i especially enjoyed was how worn down the tile floor was from centuries of use!

561817451.name: Must visit
561817451.author: a TripAdvisor user
561817451.reviewBody: Small, but worth visiting. There is a cost of $40 pesos. This is the first Public Library in America!!! Loved it!

560736045.name: A must see for any one who loves books, history and woodwork!
560736045.author: a TripAdvisor user
560736045.reviewBody: The value of the books stored here, the wood work and the history of this first pubic library make this place an absolute must. An illegitimate son who became a priest and wanted people to be able to read...what a history.

560727115.name: Books, books, books
560727115.author: a TripAdvisor user
560727115.reviewBody: Over 45,000 books in this incredible library. The architecture is remarkable. There are Samsung LCDs that you will find in English that ate most helpful. Don\'t miss this treasure trove of history.

557428636.name: Very charming and well preserved
557428636.author: a TripAdvisor user
557428636.reviewBody: This library is really worth a stop. It is very charming and beautiful inside. It could have been more informative.\nNote: we were received by a very impolite and rude person \u2014 Jos\u00e9 Luis \u2014 whose attitude contrasted with the library\'s serenity and poised atmosphere.

553627684.name: Museum not library
553627684.author: a TripAdvisor user
553627684.reviewBody: This is more a museum than a library since none of the books are accessible to read.\n\nBasically it\'s a big room with 3 stories of bookcases filled with old rotting books.

553576974.name: Fascinating to see!
553576974.author: a TripAdvisor user
553576974.reviewBody: 371 years old, the first library in the Americas. No, you can\'t read or even touch the books because they\'re centuries old, but for a history buff this is worth seeing. It costs 20 pesos to enter (about a dollar).

551356719.name: Beautiful Library
551356719.author: a TripAdvisor user
551356719.reviewBody: The Biblioteca Palafoxiana is the first library in Mexico. It is located near the Zocalo in a building which is now the Casa de la Cultura. The library is just one big room with a three story gallery full of books. You can just visit the ground floor. It is beautiful to see all this antique books. The library is worth a visit.

550095048.name: Magnificent Library
550095048.author: a TripAdvisor user
550095048.reviewBody: This building is a must do visit in Puebla for its historical and architectural importance. It houses an extensive library\nwith more than 45 thousand tomes dating back to colonial times, still in use today. The Bibliotheca Palafoxiana named after Juan de Palafox y Mendoza, bishop of Puebla, was the first public library in Mexico and dates back to 1646. Guides are available in English and Spanish at the entrance to give you a background history of the place. \nEnjoy!

547921338.name: Impressive library but there is an admission fee
547921338.author: a TripAdvisor user
547921338.reviewBody: I went to this library but did not pay to enter. I just took photos from the entrance. Since I don\'t speak Spanish, I didn\'t think it was worth it to look at the individual books on display.

546127856.name: Masterful wood work
546127856.author: a TripAdvisor user
546127856.reviewBody: The Biblioteca is the oldest in the Americas and the 10th oldest in the world. The volumes are still in use today for research. What is most impressive is the detailed wood carving. It is well worth a visit. There is a small entrance fee.

544129693.name: Stunning
544129693.author: a TripAdvisor user
544129693.reviewBody: What a nice surprise seeing this library. It reminds me of the one in Weimar. It is very beautiful and it is a must see. Located in the building marked Casa de Cultura on the Street on your right if facing the cathedral at the Z\u00f3calo.

541920002.name: Great collection
541920002.author: a TripAdvisor user
541920002.reviewBody: worth half an hour to see a collection of ancient books set in an historic building close to the cathedral

516461109.name: Must see next to the Cathedral
516461109.author: a TripAdvisor user
516461109.reviewBody: Amazing library / museum from the 1600\'s. If you want to feel the meaning of the word awesome, think about the feeling you will have when you visit this place.

512381038.name: A library 250 years old
512381038.author: a TripAdvisor user
512381038.reviewBody: It\'s a library that has more than 250 years old if you love books then you need to come here ask for the guide to tell you all the history behind the place wonderful

511319006.name: quick in an\' out...
511319006.author: a TripAdvisor user
511319006.reviewBody: ... not something for everyone but worth the trip if you are into books and libraries... costs money to enter and takes about 20 minutes to explore...

507251502.name: 1st public library in Mexico
507251502.author: a TripAdvisor user
507251502.reviewBody: The library was founded in 1646 by Juan de Palafox and contains over 40,000 books from the 15th to 20th century.  The exquisitely designed library has many religious texts including Hebrew scriptures translated into Spanish.  A rare find!

487829899.name: Beautiful
487829899.author: a TripAdvisor user
487829899.reviewBody: A hidden gem in Puebla. Beautiful and photogenic. It is definitely a must see because it is really pretty.

487421369.name: Impressive collection and a quick visit.
487421369.author: a TripAdvisor user
487421369.reviewBody: Lovely library with so many old books and history.  Worth a visit and please get a guide (discretionary tip).

485990757.name: interesting and elegant
485990757.author: a TripAdvisor user
485990757.reviewBody: its not that big but looks interesting. all the books are really old so we cant touch it but we can see some intersting book in the special glass.

478071895.name: Very cool
478071895.author: a TripAdvisor user
478071895.reviewBody: I felt like I was in the library from The Beauty and The Beast! It was super cool. Its a shame those books are all locked away behind a cage for preservation because I\'m sure some of them would be very interesting to skim through. It was honestly stunning, recommend!

474814322.name: A paradise for book-lovers
474814322.author: a TripAdvisor user
474814322.reviewBody: This treasure of a library has books dating back to the inquisition, covering a vast array of topics with narration in several different languages.  In one display case it had the early speculations of what the moon might consist of, etc and beside that ancient writing was a book displaying the first astronauts having walked on the moon.  Leaves you with chills it is so cool an experience.

473962468.name: More than a Library
473962468.author: a TripAdvisor user
473962468.reviewBody: This place was historic and can be compared to a small British Museum since it has many historic books. From a visual perspective, it is stunning. Definitely worth an hour of your visit.

473613044.name: must see in Puebla
473613044.author: a TripAdvisor user
473613044.reviewBody: Wonderful place in the middle of Puebla. The library itself is not big, but really  interesting place. That it is the oldest library in the Western Hemisphere.

471525271.name: Worth a stop
471525271.author: a TripAdvisor user
471525271.reviewBody: Ornate historic library and cultural center.  Quite a fascinating spot and not far from the Cathedral and other historic sites in the city\'s old center.  There was a classical concert in the patio during our Sunday afternoon visit.

467294332.name: Oldest library in the Western Hemisphere
467294332.author: a TripAdvisor user
467294332.reviewBody: A delightful little gem in the middle of old Puebla.  The library itself is not super large, but the alter, paneling a ceiling make it very chapel like.  That it is the oldest library in the Western Hemisphere is very cool.

462949453.name: In a city of stone a beautiful display of wood artistry.
462949453.author: a TripAdvisor user
462949453.reviewBody: As a bibliophile I had to see the first public library in the Americas. Enjoyed looking at the old volumes of which there are around 45,000. There were several volumes on display but the library could be much more interesting if a larger variety were available for study. The space is used for events so perhaps they like to keep floorspace open for those.

459829838.name: Beautiful library
459829838.author: a TripAdvisor user
459829838.reviewBody: Too bad they charge for this library.  Libraries should be free for everyone to visit.  Beautiful books and woodwork but not a lot to see.

459632191.name: amaizing!!
459632191.author: a TripAdvisor user
459632191.reviewBody: A library with an extraordinary collection and very conserved. It is spectacular to visit it in the house of the culture of Puebla. Amazing

452848766.name: Fantastic!
452848766.author: a TripAdvisor user
452848766.reviewBody: Appointed Memory of the World by UNESCO, it is considered the first Public Library in the Americas. A MUST

452209468.name: What a great library - great if you speak Spanish or have an interpreter
452209468.author: a TripAdvisor user
452209468.reviewBody:
It is one of the old libraries, built over centuries, kept beautifully. You will find a few thousand old books, it just is spectacular.
As we do not speak Spanish (and there is just Spanish in this library) we had a guide willing to tell us something about what you see for "you give me what my work is worth to you". It was a good investment, otherwise we would just have walked around, impressed by the beauty of the room and floor, and walked out again. At least we got some idea how the library was founded, built over time, and how you could be one of fortunate who really can study the books. To do so you need a special permission (which takes quite some time before there is an approval for mostly scholars).
I wish there would be a printed pamphlet in English, German, French and probably Japanese (or Chinese), but there is not.
And there is a fee of MSN 25 per person, which is not much, but you should be aware of it.
At the end: we liked it and at the same time disappointed.

450559327.name: One of the best preserved libraries from the XVII century.
450559327.author: a TripAdvisor user
450559327.reviewBody: If you are book worm, the sensation of seeing all these antique books in this marvelous place is incredible. Many of the books are openly displayed in glass cases. A true treasure

449742067.name: The beauty of (a place for) books
449742067.author: a TripAdvisor user
449742067.reviewBody: This 17th century library is a beauty. Definitely a must-see. The entrance, the wooden ornaments and shelves, the talavera floor. The books on display give a glimpse of the rare books in this well-kept collection. Its declaration by UNESCO as Memory of the World says it all. There is a guide on hand who, when questioned, gives evidence that he knows both facts and context. Otherwise he sticks to things you can read in Wikipedia.  And since you are there, you might as well visit in the same building the Puebla State cultural center and the exhibit of treasuries of the cathedral.

445250140.name: Spectacular, free and underappreciated
445250140.author: a TripAdvisor user
445250140.reviewBody: Just behind the beautiful Puebla cathedral, in the 2nd floor of a non-descript building lies this gem. Three floors of old books await, with beautiful natural lighting and carved book cases. Even the floors are pretty. This a pretty quick visit, even if you ask the staff to give you a guided tour.

442757778.name: Amazing!
442757778.author: a TripAdvisor user
442757778.reviewBody: This is the first public library in the Americas. Filled with ancient manuscripts in remarkable condition. Original maps from the days of Cortes. It\'s worth a visit just to see the remarkable woodwork. Definitely a place to visit in Puebla.

442477139.name: Didn\'t want to leave
442477139.author: a TripAdvisor user
442477139.reviewBody: I first went on a Monday to discover that the library is closed on Mondays, but was able to get a good picture of the impressive door. On Tuesday, I arrived as a very large group was entering and decided to return later, a good move because later, there were very few people visiting. Once inside, I didn\'t want to leave. I walked the room several times, used the iPad to read all available information, thankfully in English, and then was very happy to have the guide approach me and offer to share much more information. He was an official guide, but worked solely for tips. He let me pick the price and offered to take US bills. I will likely return before leaving Puebla.

440222605.name: My favourite part of Puebla!
440222605.author: a TripAdvisor user
440222605.reviewBody:
It's a block from Zocalo, costs 25 pesos (or is free on Sundays!) and it's so worth visiting if you like history/books/historical books! 

The guide at the entrance addressed me in Spanish, but spoke fluent English, Italian, and French as well. His German was apparently very good too! He explained that the books could be accessed on a university archive online using the library's email address to request a read. There are books about geography, philosophy, etc in 16 different languages.
