288686146.reviewBody: This is a nice day trip from Puebla (Capitol). It was cloudy overcast and sprinkling the day we went. Be sure to take a jacket....mid-July and the temp was in the 50s. We took my friend\'s 7 year old niece, and she thoroughly enjoyed it. There is something for every age, young to old. The tour guide we had was phenomenal and informative.

284382471.name: Beautiful scenery
284382471.author: a TripAdvisor user
284382471.reviewBody: Wonderful scenery.   However it is much colder here than in Puebla - be sure to take warm clothing.     Great activity for kids!

277954667.name: Incredible Natural Sights
277954667.author: a TripAdvisor user
277954667.reviewBody: This is a big park with huge natural formations that depict various things depending on your imagination. There are several options in order to traverse this huge area. The route that I took with my family involved using a horse-drawn carriage which holds around 12 people. The guide then explains the park and illustrates image is connected with the rock. Sometimes you can see it and others you cannot. \nAfter you finish the tour, you can walk around as you please. There are horses and bicycles available depending on your liking. If you go walking you can head to the area where there is ziplining. Even though you are scared, take this incredible experience. You soar above the park and it\'s an incredible adrenaline rush.

240270013.name: Rocks that rock you
240270013.author: a TripAdvisor user
240270013.reviewBody: From Puebla town more than 2 hours by car. Wonderful landscape, take a picnic there, chill out and climb the rocks that are looking like faces.

176552758.name: Astonishing
176552758.author: a TripAdvisor user
176552758.reviewBody:
This place is full of an enigmatic feeling. The experience begins even before arriving, since the ride is though a beautiful forest and landscape where eventually you find friendly Mexican people always willing to smile.

At the entrance you have a person that explains the park, the facilities, costs, hours (she did it to us in Spanish and I am not sure they have available English speaking guides.

There are a good variety of small restaurants operated by the locals (all services are provided by a “coperativa”, similar to a union); bicycles and horses to rent. You can contract a guide or go by your own and leave your imagination fly over the formations. Not only what is there, but how was that formed? how did it get there?

Definitely a place to find peace and meditate in absolut contact with nature. This is Mexico.

168652960.name: Beatiful and quiet place for a nice ride
168652960.author: a TripAdvisor user
168652960.reviewBody:
The place is beautiful with many different rock formations, we arrived at 11:00 hours and there was no fog in the park so we were able to enjoy all the ride. You can rent bicycles, horses, monkeys or even a cart with a horse.

We travel with small kids ranging from 4-11 and everyone enjoyed the ride. It is about 1:30 minutes walk trough the main path (two ways).

In the park there is a zip-line where kids can have a 180 ride like superman.

The park has restrooms, a restaurant, and a small farm were kids can feed some animals such as chickens, ducks, etc...

The park entrance is free but the tours such as the bicycles and horses do cost, the horse tour price was 100 pesos per horse for the whole tour (1:30).

In general, you do not need a tour, you can just walk trough the park, however, the tour guide can show you some special forms in the stones which gives more fun to the trip.

There is a place for camping with tends, it cost extra.

People was very friendly and helpful.

162729303.name: Beautiful
162729303.author: a TripAdvisor user
162729303.reviewBody: Absolutely beautiful and magical worth the relatively long trip from Puebla. I recommend to hire a guide. This is not really necessary to find you way. However he/she will help you to imagine different persons or objects in the shape of the rocks.  I found this quite entertaining. I stayed only a few hours in the afternoon. I realized that it might be interesting to stay a full day our even a night (on full moon) which allows you to enjoy the view of the rocks in different lights. The park has a few restaurants. However, only one was open in November. It was very good and was extremely inexpensive.

129766745.name: A beautiful and misterious place to visit in Puebla.
129766745.author: a TripAdvisor user
129766745.reviewBody: I strongly encourage families with pets to escape to this amazing and magical destination within the mountains of Puebla. Although it could take a while to get there (due to the fog and the small road conditions from Zacatl\u00e1n, the nearest town), it\'s worthy to visit! There\'s not entrance fee though you can always leave a tip for the people who checks over this place. You can find a restaurant, WC and horse rides. Once you\'ve wandered all around, you can travel back to the beautiful town of Zacatl\u00e1n and enjoy of the local vibe and choose a beautiful place where to spend the night. The road from Apizaco is in great conditions and it only takes two hours to get there from Puebla city.

129272055.name: OK but do not drive to far for it
129272055.author: a TripAdvisor user
129272055.reviewBody: park with mounted boulders. Well, if you know one of the parks like Bryce or Grand Canyon in the US, maybe it is not that exciting. Went during a long weekend in Mexico visiting other places as well. You can hike and have some food in one of the little restaurants in the park.

124835413.name: Wonderful formations
124835413.author: a TripAdvisor user
124835413.reviewBody:
It is quite a long way to go, but it is definitely worth the trip.  

You can hire a horse or a donkey for 100 pesos an hour(with guide) and the guide will take you on a little journey through the park and your imagination.  It really is a wonderful way to spend an hour or so.  

The fog can descend very quickly with little notice and visibility can drop to a metre, so you should certainly get a horse and guide (people have been lost for hours in the fog).

122053643.name: Park with rocks
122053643.author: a TripAdvisor user
122053643.reviewBody: It was very cold and hard to see the rock formations. Not for children. Walked around for a short time and took some pictures but would probably not come again.

677347647.name: Huge Catholic Cathedral
677347647.author: a TripAdvisor user
677347647.reviewBody: There are more catholic churches in Mexico than you can shake a stick at, and they kind of look the same.  This one however, is very large and has an appealing exterior that is great for photography.

677221439.name: Gorgeous
677221439.author: a TripAdvisor user
677221439.reviewBody: Gorgeous cathedral on the inside. Very well preserved with stunning artwork. Doesn\'t look like much on the outside, but worth checking out. Hours for tourists can be a little spotty, but don\'t be deterred if you have to come back another time.

672332661.name: One of the best
672332661.author: a TripAdvisor user
672332661.reviewBody: Although Puebla is well known for its 365 churches this one is definitely the best. It has nothing to envy to any other cathedral in the world. During night is close but is very nice illuminated outside. Worth to see it! A piece of jewelry full of history.

671731895.name: Great views day or night
671731895.author: a TripAdvisor user
671731895.reviewBody: Very close to everything, you can see it from the zocalo. Beautiful shots at night with the lights on.

668772090.name: Laser Light show on the weekend
668772090.author: a TripAdvisor user
668772090.reviewBody: We toured the cathedral during the day and it was beautiful. However, when we were having dinner across the street later that evening, the hostess told us to go out on to the patio so we could see the light show. It was a fascinating laser light show set to music!

663994200.name: Magnificent church
663994200.author: a TripAdvisor user
663994200.reviewBody: Your visit to Puebla will not be complete, unless you visit this church. It is magnificent with a very detailed decoration, beautiful architecture and exquisite art. This is a must in this city.

660819955.name: Beautiful church
660819955.author: a TripAdvisor user
660819955.reviewBody: I understand that the cathedral should be in Lima, Peru and opposite. There was a mistake. It is a beautiful church with some different architecture.

660264151.name: Huge
660264151.author: a TripAdvisor user
660264151.reviewBody: I am not in to churches but being in Puebla you just gotta go in to see it, can not miss it, it is huge, but you cant really comprehend the size until you are in there. The ceiling is so high up there. Lots of things to see and they even have small tv playing the interesting bits of trivia and history (but in spanish). Woth to look around for a bit.

659374373.name: One of the great cathedrals of Mexico.
659374373.author: a TripAdvisor user
659374373.reviewBody: This is one of the oldest and most magnificent Cathedrals in Mexico, (Mexico City and Morelia are my other two favourites) so should be on everyone\u2019s tour of Puebla.  Both the interior and exterior are splendid and imposing.  I particularly like the choir and the organ, but this is not to dismiss the rest of the building.  It\u2019s worth going a number of times, just to get the atmosphere and really enjoy how wonderful it is.

658902089.name: Zocalo cathedral
658902089.author: a TripAdvisor user
658902089.reviewBody: This is one of the stops in Puebla. Go in the afternoon/ evening and soak in the atmosphere along with the cathedral; this is a local slice of life.

658449317.name: if this is your first cathedral
658449317.author: a TripAdvisor user
658449317.reviewBody: This enormous church is just about what you would expect; it is massive, dark and highly ornate. After seeing dozens of similar buildings one gets jaded and bored with churches. However, if cathedrals are your thing, you will get a nice slice of cathedral in Puebla.

655683724.name: Beautiful architecture and interior
655683724.author: a TripAdvisor user
655683724.reviewBody: La Catedral de Puebla was consecrated in 1649 as the original national cathedral; it is the second largest in Mexico, constructed in the Renaissance and Baroque styles.  At 69 meters high, its steeple and bell tower is the tallest in Mexico.  The Cathedral\u2019s stark stone exterior stands in sharp contrast to its resplendent interior features. I am not sure which impressed me more, the outside or the inside, which is lovely and peaceful.

654012191.name: Near Zocalo
654012191.author: a TripAdvisor user
654012191.reviewBody: I would not say this is a knock out interior but worth a visit. Just across from Zocala so easy to find. ( Do not miss library across the street after 11:00.

653815649.name: Took me by surprise when I entered!
653815649.author: a TripAdvisor user
653815649.reviewBody: We travel quite a lot and have visited many churches, but this one literally took my breath away!  The immensity of the interior allowed for an abundance of religious art work and sculpture.  Also noteworthy was the spectacular organ which was playing when we were there.\n\nHighly recommend visiting this magnificent Cathedral!

652578903.name: Puebla was the center of the Holy Seat during the colony and this is it\'s masterpiece!
652578903.author: a TripAdvisor user
652578903.reviewBody: I visit everytime I am in Puebla.  It is always a surprise!  Last time the organist was rehearsing for mass.  I was enthralled by the music, the light coming in from the "vitrales," large stained glass windows, danced on the marble statues in the central altar.\nI stayed for two hours!  And, I loved every moment of it.  A must!  I recommend using a guide as it is always better to appreciate with more information.

652230943.name: Massive and masterful and beautiful construction
652230943.author: a TripAdvisor user
652230943.reviewBody: This is a work of art. It was built from 1575-1690. If you go inside while mass is going on you will not be able to see the whole building.

647553644.name: Huge, surprising, rare catedral.
647553644.author: a TripAdvisor user
647553644.reviewBody: Beautiful at day and also at night, this huge Cathedral is located at the Zocalo and totally worth to see. I have the chance to presence a ceremony. The priest and the music converted it in an unforgettable experience.

645826083.name: A beautiful church
645826083.author: a TripAdvisor user
645826083.reviewBody: The Basilica in Puebla is, as are all of the churches in this city, very pretty.  I spent quite a bit of time in there, to absorb it all.  Highly recommend if you enjoy churches.

642897162.name: Visit
642897162.author: a TripAdvisor user
642897162.reviewBody: The church is very impressive inside with amazing gold architecture. The size was pretty big it is a must see for travelers visiting Puebla. Pros beautiful, no cons really.

642295648.name: Huge 16 th century cathedral, nicer then one in Mexico zcity?
642295648.author: a TripAdvisor user
642295648.reviewBody: It\'s huge, it\'s beautiful.  Might even say there is too much decoration, painting, statues all overAltar is interesting as are the various sub-altars.  We were told this was built originally as the national cathedral instead of the one in the actual capital, Mexico City.  It certainly is a must see as is the Zocolo in front.

641964579.name: Angels
641964579.author: a TripAdvisor user
641964579.reviewBody: The church itself is a beautiful place of worship. I also liked the many angels on the fences surrounding it.

640723357.name: Beautiful landmark
640723357.author: a TripAdvisor user
640723357.reviewBody: Definitely worth going inside and outside is beautiful surroundings to spend walking around, taking pictures and enjoying the restaurants and museums.

639622349.name: Visit to Puebla
639622349.author: a TripAdvisor user
639622349.reviewBody: Wonderful cathedral at Puebla, beautiful inside, and they have video with the explanation of the construction and inside

638239055.name: Immense scale
638239055.author: a TripAdvisor user
638239055.reviewBody: The Cathedral Basilica de Puebla stands high about anything else in the immediate area and serves to be a centre piece over the Zocalo that makes for a stunning capture. The interior is one of the most beautiful that I have witnessed and it is thus definitely classified as a must see.

636762900.name: Light and beautiful
636762900.author: a TripAdvisor user
636762900.reviewBody: After so many heavily decorated churches this one feels light and airy with its light ceiling and windows.  The Altar o the Kings is fantastic.

636758924.name: Inside it is very nice
636758924.author: a TripAdvisor user
636758924.reviewBody: It looks much better inside than outside and it is for free. \nIt is so big and nice. \nUsually I don\u2019t like to go inside churches, but this time I enjoyed time there.

634656129.name: A must stop in Puebla
634656129.author: a TripAdvisor user
634656129.reviewBody: Went to Puebla on a day trip from Mexico City while on a pilgrimage to Our Lady of Gaudalope. \nThis Cathedral will match any that I\'ve seen in Europe.   The architecture, statues and altars will anyone\'s spirt and soul towards heaven.

634256357.name: Big construction
634256357.author: a TripAdvisor user
634256357.reviewBody: If you visit Puebla you know the Catholicism is very present in every corner.\nA lot of churches around the city.\nBit the cathedral is a place you must go.

631303637.name: Accessible Central Puebla City Cathedral
631303637.author: a TripAdvisor user
631303637.reviewBody: The Cathedral is huge.  It is under some renovation, but still very accessible.  The interior is stunning.  At night there was a light show on the front of the building.

628265608.name: Huge
628265608.author: a TripAdvisor user
628265608.reviewBody: Very huge and very grey. Is like a dark spot you see in Puebla when the rest of churches are all in color. Amazing inside also.

617911579.name: Amazing pipe organ
617911579.author: a TripAdvisor user
617911579.reviewBody: As many of the "new world" cathedrals, is a stunning piece of architecture.  Full of religious paintings of a huge size, almost like murals.\nBut the most stunning is the pipe organ, you must go inside the building and see it.\nRemember not pictures are allowed.

614378897.name: Step into history!
614378897.author: a TripAdvisor user
614378897.reviewBody: An amazing spiritual place with beautiful beautiful details all around. Check out the doors, the floors the details on the walls and of course take time to disconnect.

613787594.name: MARRIED HERE
613787594.author: a TripAdvisor user
613787594.reviewBody: no words can describe the feeling. Not easy to go thru the process of the archdiocese and interviews/paperwork/certification....\n\nBut, it was undoubtedly the perfect place to get married

613662506.name: Impressive colonial cathedral
613662506.author: a TripAdvisor user
613662506.reviewBody: Impressive colonial cathedral, very huge and beautiful, considered to be the second largest church in Mexico.

610688916.name: The Cathedral Basilica of Puebla is an architectural jewel of 1649
610688916.author: a TripAdvisor user
610688916.reviewBody: \nThe Cathedral Basilica of Puebla is an architectural jewel of 1649, a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. It must be visited on its trip to Puebla, the second most important in Lationoamerica.

603701061.name: A very baroque beatiful church
603701061.author: a TripAdvisor user
603701061.reviewBody: Is a must to visit, inside the church there are a great and antique pieces of art\nOutside you can admire the door

603310612.name: Colonial cathedral
603310612.author: a TripAdvisor user
603310612.reviewBody: This is a beautiful cathedral representing the art and style of the era it was built in. Masses are scheduled on a daily basis.  Get a great picture at night when the Cathedral is lit

601866361.name: Impressive for Cathedral Visitors
601866361.author: a TripAdvisor user
601866361.reviewBody: This large, and elegant cathedral on the Zocalo in Centro Puebla, is a fine example of the large Spanish cathedrals built within the Mexican Republic. Due to it\'s construction of dark cantera, the exterior of the Cathedral is dark and foreboding. However, on the inside it is light and very impressive to see, and experience a great Mexican cathedral.\n

601766961.name: Stunning Basilica!
601766961.author: a TripAdvisor user
601766961.reviewBody: A huge basilica that has stood the test of time. There are so many little chapels within this basilica and beautiful organ. This was a very special place for me to see personally, as my husband great grandfather worked on the gold leaf in one of the little side chapels, so it was fantastic to see this piece of family history. I believe on Friday and Saturday night the city has a  video mapping show on the basilica and this would be fun to see. There are many roof top bars surrounding the basilica and it was great to go to one of the them and watch the sunset.

601253009.name: One of the best Churches in the world.
601253009.author: a TripAdvisor user
601253009.reviewBody: You must go there while in Puebla. It is breath taking. You must hear the story about how it was built.

601180876.name: Stunning Baroque Cathedral
601180876.author: a TripAdvisor user
601180876.reviewBody: The Cathedral is one of the most beautiful and interesting I have every seen.  I wonderful example of the Baroque period.

600034190.name: Exquisite!
600034190.author: a TripAdvisor user
600034190.reviewBody:
5*p Catedral
Beautiful church in the center of town
The Baroque architecture is exquisite, both inside and out
It has two towers; neoclassical and baroque styles

593998084.name: great and majestic
593998084.author: a TripAdvisor user
593998084.reviewBody: if you are in Puebla, this is the place not to be missed, located in the centre, is presents some great architectural masterpieces

592534541.name: a must see
592534541.author: a TripAdvisor user
592534541.reviewBody: Very beautiful monument.  Spanish architecture.  well preserved. there are Masses many times a day. It is very well located next to the zocalo.

591786469.name: Gotta love the Catholics
591786469.author: a TripAdvisor user
591786469.reviewBody: Every holiday gotta see a church, cathedral cos the Catholic Church always has lots of \ud83d\udcb0 to spend. This one is overwhelming. So many statues , gold and what not.

590956848.name: Impressive
590956848.author: a TripAdvisor user
590956848.reviewBody: The Basilica is an impressive church. While the outside is nothing special, the interior is extensively decorated with statues,  paintings,  iron work, etc. I have been in it four times and still see something new every time I turn a corner. Some nights there is a light show in the front.

588104277.name: Very nice historical building
588104277.author: a TripAdvisor user
588104277.reviewBody:
Very nice historical building.
One of the attractions you must visit in Puebla.
Full of history and nice and interesting construction and details.
Watch the monumental organ

586186876.name: Lots of history in this cathedral
586186876.author: a TripAdvisor user
586186876.reviewBody: There is a lot to learn about Mexico\'s history at this landmark cathedral in Puebla. The interiors are also beautiful and there are multiple altars, each with its own history. Worth spending time on a guided tour here

586038281.name: Cathedral with great history
586038281.author: a TripAdvisor user
586038281.reviewBody: You can find different type of churches in Puebla. This cathedral is not the most beautiful of them but it is the most important of them.

583770784.name: Dark exterior conceals impressive interior
583770784.author: a TripAdvisor user
583770784.reviewBody: LIke most large cathedrals you can\'t help but feel spiritually moved by the awe-inspiring tall ceilings, massive arches and columns, with a humongous pipe organ playing and the smell of incense in the air.

582680376.name: Beautiful cathedral in the middle of everything
582680376.author: a TripAdvisor user
582680376.reviewBody: Beautiful cathedral located in the middle of town. When in Puebla a most to see. Around the cathedral many shops are located to do your shopping. Small park next to it, to observe the atmosphere.

581530898.name: Tradition
581530898.author: a TripAdvisor user
581530898.reviewBody: More than an impressive, big beautiful building it\'s nice to see people going to it with their Sunday typical clothes.

581452532.name: Large Cathederal with many chapels.
581452532.author: a TripAdvisor user
581452532.reviewBody: I wish they had the funds to have the many old paintings cleaned and restored if need be.  They have darkened to the point of obscurity.

581303133.name: Beautiful church!
581303133.author: a TripAdvisor user
581303133.reviewBody: Stunning church in the zocalo. Highly recommend stopping by. Always something lively happening outside the doors and central to everything in Puebla.

575438448.name: Puebla, the State of Churches
575438448.author: a TripAdvisor user
575438448.reviewBody: There is so much history in Mexico and I was totally amazed to hear that supposedly there are over 300 churches in the state of Puebla.  I am just so taken away with the craftsmanship (by hand) that is done in these historic churches and the gold leaf.  Most importantly to the Mexican people is the preservation of their churches.  Regardless of the damage over time and especially with earthquakes, they repair rather than tear down. It is roughly a two hour drive from Mexico City and if visiting the city, with time, I would add Puebla on your list of places to visit.  We have experienced that in many of the churches taking pictures is prohibited.  Respect that.  If uncertain, ask someone.  Some places will allow photo\'s without flash.  So, don\'t be totally disappointed.  Observe and ask.  Mexico has some of thee longest standing buildings in North America many being the churches.  We were here in the preparation for Easter.

570675428.name: One of the most beautiful colonial cathedrals in Mexico.
570675428.author: a TripAdvisor user
570675428.reviewBody: I enjoyed the colorful Good Friday procession which circled the Zocalo. The church is said to be the tallest in Mexico and is well maintained.

570275307.name: Amazing juerly of Puebla
570275307.author: a TripAdvisor user
570275307.reviewBody: This fantastic chirch in the heart of old Mexican Spanish city Puebla. You can see amazing fresks and the greatest altars depicted nicest sculptures, and listen the organ\'s music while watching all this beautiful pictures.

567577532.name: Center of Zocalo
567577532.author: a TripAdvisor user
567577532.reviewBody: Typical church, nothing special.it\'s under renovating and forbid taking pictures inside.Worth to get in to take a look.

565669022.author: a TripAdvisor user
565669022.reviewBody: Grossly opulent. Imagine all of the good work that could have been done for the poor and needy, but instead a grandiose church was built. The Catholic Church in a nutshell.

565093834.name: Stunning, as always!
565093834.author: a TripAdvisor user
565093834.reviewBody: You can\'t miss the Cathedral. A must! Great shops and restaurants around it, too. Do not miss the night view-it is lit stunningly!

563039515.name: Extremly historic and beautiful church that has an awesome organ to match
563039515.author: a TripAdvisor user
563039515.reviewBody: Catedral Basilica de Puebla is a Roman Catholic church in the city of Puebla. It is a colonial cathedral who\'s history began almost 500 years ago. It was on our city of Puebla downtown walk. Remove hats and camera\'s with flash. There is a very massive and awesome organ as well.

563000505.name: Stunning!
563000505.author: a TripAdvisor user
563000505.reviewBody: How can one not have an instant draw to a church that was built in the 1600\u2019s? This church holds so much historical value not to mention the faith aspect. It\u2019s a sanctuary and whatever your belief, you will be amazed at the magnitude and details built by human beings!

562342635.name: Beautiful
562342635.author: a TripAdvisor user
562342635.reviewBody: A massive cathedral that dates to the 16th and 17th centuries.  They were doing some renovations (from earthquake?) While there, but still a grand old lady and one of the largest old churches in the Americas.

560726320.name: Grande
560726320.author: a TripAdvisor user
560726320.reviewBody: Yes, this was rated one of the top five attraction in pueblo. An accurate notation. The architecture is casssic inside and out. This church had major damage after the 2017 earthquake. Inside you will see workmen  risking their lives high on scaffolding making repairs.

559083713.name: Duh
559083713.author: a TripAdvisor user
559083713.reviewBody: One of the most spectacular cathedrals in the Americas. Built over a couple of centuries, it\u2019s a whopper, with a central structure by Manuel Tols\u00e1. It won\u2019t take long and costs nothing, so it would be foolish to skip it. Photography is prohibited inside (translation: be discreet!)

557592716.name: Nice
557592716.author: a TripAdvisor user
557592716.reviewBody: Nice cathedral opposite the Zocalo. Interior is nice as well. No pictures allowed inside, for some reason.

556582852.name: It is superb
556582852.author: a TripAdvisor user
556582852.reviewBody: It is a really magnificent place to visit. It may be compared with any other famous in Europe. It is a must for visit.

554286119.name: Another day another cathedral
554286119.author: a TripAdvisor user
554286119.reviewBody: One thing about Mexico is that they have a lot of churches and cathedrals. This is no different other than it does sit on one side of the Zocalo in town. Inside is the usual with a few repairs being done. No worshippers. No fee to enter bit of course donations accepted. \nWheelchair friendly. Kid friendly. No wifi. No toilets.

553803128.name: One of the most beautiful in the country
553803128.author: a TripAdvisor user
553803128.reviewBody: This church is one of the best examples of religious architecture in Mexico! I recommend spending some time inside and learning about its interesting history. The design was meant for Mexico City

553626338.name: Huge
553626338.author: a TripAdvisor user
553626338.reviewBody: This is a monster of a building.\n\nThe dome is currently obscured by supporting scaffolding after the September 2017 earth quake.

552558679.name: One oof the best in Mexico
552558679.author: a TripAdvisor user
552558679.reviewBody: Going there and knowing the history is something that you have to do. Night lights are nice so you can enjoy the show

547919466.name: Beautiful interiors to explore
547919466.author: a TripAdvisor user
547919466.reviewBody: This cathedral has a really beautiful interior. In fact I was more impressed than at the cathedral in Mexico City. Though not as large, the interior was spectacular. Especially the central stage area, modeled after St Peters in Rome.

546129349.name: Amazing
546129349.author: a TripAdvisor user
546129349.reviewBody: The Catedral is huge! There are 14 alters and a massive pipe organ. A wonderful mural is painted on the central cupola. It is overwhelming.

539085603.name: Ancient history, tradition and architecture.
539085603.author: a TripAdvisor user
539085603.reviewBody: According to history of the church is a monument to local traditions regarding catholic fate , longterm architectonic project (almost 100 years of construction) and in particular the central construction designated for the singers and piano players are amazing; also the sculptures in the center of the church are overwhelming.\n\nConsider to visit the church in the morning and take some pictures of the main view from the main plaza during the night or from the terraces of the restaurants ; there a really good shot may give you the best picture of your trip.

537002839.name: Stunning
537002839.author: a TripAdvisor user
537002839.reviewBody: The church is stunning! There is a rich history and beautiful art--this is nearby the center of the old city and should not be missed.

535902526.name: Beautiful place
535902526.author: a TripAdvisor user
535902526.reviewBody: The cathedral is beautiful and amassing. Full of history, culture and tradition. One of the best churches I have ever visited in M\u00e9xico

532398055.name: Beautiful Renaissance Era Cathedral Well Worth a Visit.
532398055.author: a TripAdvisor user
532398055.reviewBody:
This grand renaissance ear Cathedral is mostly undamaged from the earthquake and definitely worth a visit. Construction took over 100 years to complete, but what stands today is a testament to architectural design of the era. 

Unfortunately you aren't allowed to take photo's while inside the cathedral. The interior is beautifully decorated. Underneath the main alter several passed bishops are buried. You can find tour guides outside the church who will explain it's history and take you around some surrounding sites on a pay-what-you-feel tipping style tour. 

It's also worth a visit at night while the church is lit up, and make sure you bring your camera.

529536613.name: A majestic ediface.
529536613.author: a TripAdvisor user
529536613.reviewBody: I have visited Puebla\'s distinctive cathedral several times and always enjoyed the experience. My interest is historical not religious and there is much to be learned of Mexico\'s past in its hallowed aisles.

520499443.name: Gorgeous!
520499443.author: a TripAdvisor user
520499443.reviewBody: This place is absolutely gorgeous! Visit when there\'s no service and remember to take your hats off! It\'s a shame we didn\'t see any information in English but there must be located somewhere. For those speaking Spanish there\'s an audio available that describes the style and the main features of the cathedral. A must see in Puebla and pram/buggy friendly.

515666975.name: Side trip
515666975.author: a TripAdvisor user
515666975.reviewBody: If you are on business and have the opportunity to take a side trip in Puebla this Cathedral is a must! It\'s beautiful inside and out and gives a great feel for the people and the love for the community!

514573588.name: Wow
514573588.author: a TripAdvisor user
514573588.reviewBody: This church rivals if not exceeds the opulence of those in Europe and Spain on the inside.  I don\'t know much about architecture but the outside was not too ornate.  Worth walking through and enjoy the paintings.

511310376.name: go at night...
511310376.author: a TripAdvisor user
511310376.reviewBody: ... the cathedral as well as most chapels and churches are lit at night, making for a nice walking tour, admiring the lights... the basilica, on weekends, displays the story of independence on the cathedral walls...

509466974.name: Majestic!!!
509466974.author: a TripAdvisor user
509466974.reviewBody: If you appreciate religious art, this is a cathedral you will not want to miss... probably the most majestic cathedral in the country!!!

509369070.name: Simply the best
509369070.author: a TripAdvisor user
509369070.reviewBody: This is the most beautiful cathedral of Mexico. DEFINITELY A MUST is you are visiting Puebla. It\'s beautiful

507597272.name: Another gorgeous cathedral in Mexico
507597272.author: a TripAdvisor user
507597272.reviewBody: The second largest cathedral in Mexico with tons of history. Puebla has 77 churches in the downtown, the cathedral you must visit.

506782455.name: Beautiful Cathedral!
506782455.author: a TripAdvisor user
506782455.reviewBody: Such a lovely church! A must when visiting Puebla! Across from the zocalo, you can\'t miss it! A very nice place to attend mass!

498980594.name: Impressive chapel, a must see in Puebla
498980594.author: a TripAdvisor user
498980594.reviewBody: This is a colonial jewel dedicated to the Virgin of the Rosary. Beyond its religious significant, this chapel is so ornate and full of gold that it is mesmerizing to anyone who visits. The chapel is a religious building still in use so I recommend respect while visiting. I was there while a mass was in process and it was kind of cool, but it meant no pictures and no walking around.

497922469.name: A must see
497922469.author: a TripAdvisor user
497922469.reviewBody: We are a bit tired of visiting churches, however this is a must.\nA Cathedral with exquisite taste for Baroque style, must see.

491116466.name: Historic cathedral in city center
491116466.author: a TripAdvisor user
491116466.reviewBody: Huge cathedral with interesting architecture and iconography and a huge pipe organ in the center, Unlike much of Puebla\'s colonial architecture, the cathedral is in the baroque style and is located on the central square (the Zocalo).

482772897.name: El Viento City tour
482772897.author: a TripAdvisor user
482772897.reviewBody: This was on our first day in Puebla. Maria was great at pointing out the details and history of the church.

478214986.name: Huge
478214986.author: a TripAdvisor user
478214986.reviewBody: This is a massive church. Some stories say this was supposed to be Mexico City\'s cathedral and the construction plans were mixed up in the trip from Spain, but who knows, might just be a tale. The church is worth a visit. Very high ceilings and an amazing musical instrument.

478071556.name: Beautiful!
478071556.author: a TripAdvisor user
478071556.reviewBody: I am really not one for churches and cathedrals but this one is absolutely stunning, probably the most amazing I\'ve ever seen. There was a service happening when I went inside but I sat quietly to the side and watched for a little bit. Being there was very calming and enjoyable and if some guy hasn\'t came and sat unnecessarily close to me (there were plenty of empty pews) I would have stayed longer. Will probably go back again tomorrow.

477796251.name: Beautiful
477796251.author: a TripAdvisor user
477796251.reviewBody: Beautiful church with lots of history. Definitely worth stopping inside and checking out the architecture. You might even be able to see a mass.

476526101.name: A Classic Baroque Cathedral
476526101.author: a TripAdvisor user
476526101.reviewBody: We attended Palm Sunday Mass at the Cathedral, presided over by the Archbishop of Puebla.  Everyone was friendly, happy and very helpful (we don\'t speak Spanish at all well).  A very positive experience

475683500.name: Pretty church in the middle of it all!
475683500.author: a TripAdvisor user
475683500.reviewBody: I just happened to visit on Easter weekend and this church was brimming with activity!  Such a pretty place to visit in the city and lots of nice architecture in the building. It sits in the main square Pandora there is a super ton lot of things to do around it. Great place to visit!\n

474372854.name: Historical
474372854.author: a TripAdvisor user
474372854.reviewBody: Very nice church to visit. Please keep in my that people are actually worshipping. Architecture is outstanding..

472530028.name: Nice Cathedral
472530028.author: a TripAdvisor user
472530028.reviewBody: If you enjoy Churches and History, this is a great stop.The inside is amazing and a different layout than most I have been in.

472428714.name: it is on the zocalo
472428714.author: a TripAdvisor user
472428714.reviewBody: it is a very old building in the zocalo of the City, inside it is a very interesting building, very big, with a beautiful chore, and surronded by angels all around

472036199.name: A must see
472036199.author: a TripAdvisor user
472036199.reviewBody: The outside is very austere, the main door is facing the plaza , once you go inside, a 43 mts roof hangs over you, full of frescos, and a beautiful altar right in the middle of the cathedral is in front of you, right across the organ is huge! The church is very well preserved and has touristic information in Spanish English and French . \nIt\'s a church that is filled with detail, and to just walk around is a pleasure \nYou definitely cannot miss it in your way trough town.

469419847.name: A true landmark of Mexico!
469419847.author: a TripAdvisor user
469419847.reviewBody:
The highlight of Puebla (not just their amazing Zocalo!), hands down, is their 350+ year old Cathedral / Basilica. This marvelous architectural achievement - a combination of the Renaissance and Baroque styles along with 14 domed chapels - dominates the downtown area landscape of Puebla (especially when lit up during the evening!) 

I highly suggest walking all around the exterior of the building just to properly soak it all in. Research a little about this legendary church before visiting. I really am emotionally moved by my visits to many of the stunningly-amazing churches in central Mexico, as several have near their main entrance a life-size model of Jesus following his crucifixion (see attached photo). Seeing and relating to the suffering and death of Jesus in this way seems to be a commonality in Mexican culture, and it has a profound impact on this American, as we don't see this kind of thing in the U.S. 

Finally, if you're looking for a mass to attend, look no further than the Cathedral. The Catholic mass is universal, in that the layout of having the liturgy of the word and Eucharist is the same throughout the word, albeit in different languages. It was amazing to be in the first 20 pews and to experience a holy mass in this church. Even using the hard wooden kneelers (see attached photo) were a nice example of culture shock! And as it was a Sunday evening mass, I was privileged to be one of the only students from my study abroad group to see the Zocalo and Cathedral lit up at night! God is good! iAmo Puebla!

467939148.name: The anchor to the Zocalo
467939148.author: a TripAdvisor user
467939148.reviewBody: An amazing Cathedral. We had the fun of seeing a video show projected on its\' facade our first night there.  Breathtaking spot.

464140123.name: Beautiful
464140123.author: a TripAdvisor user
464140123.reviewBody: Words cannot describe this Catedral. Paintings were incredible, organs were the best I\'ve seen. The ceiling made me dizzy with glee. No way not to enjoy or see it if you are in Puebla.

463772295.name: The best place in Puebla
463772295.author: a TripAdvisor user
463772295.reviewBody: Here you will find the roots of the mexican culture that is not pure spanish, neither pure indigenous culture.\nThis magnificent building represent the first and most important construcion made on XVI century

463552704.name: Gorgeous Cathedral BUT......
463552704.author: a TripAdvisor user
463552704.reviewBody: Yes, it is a remarkable cathedral but the experience of visiting it is marred by the many video screens mounted on columns blasting out continuous explanations of the cathedral\'s history.  You cannot escape the video voice.  It is everywhere.  You have no moment of peace to contemplate the grandeur of the space and the many rich details.  I feel sorry for those who come to the cathedral to pray.

460786700.name: Impressive catedral
460786700.author: a TripAdvisor user
460786700.reviewBody: Beautiful building and amazing art pieces inside the outside plaza is so nice and relaxing don\'t miss the inside

460712566.name: Night light Showe
460712566.author: a TripAdvisor user
460712566.reviewBody: the Cathedral is beautiful and at 8:30 and 9:15 pm they offer a light show with a brief history of Puebla.  The explanation is in spanish and not great but the light show is a must.

458596307.name: Amazing church and similar area at the Vatican.
458596307.author: a TripAdvisor user
458596307.reviewBody: Walking inside the church. I realize has a similar area like the  Vatican at saint Peter church.  In Puebla the church is very organize. Unfortunately we are not allow to take pictures. But I took one :)

458480958.name: Gorgeous
458480958.author: a TripAdvisor user
458480958.reviewBody: Beautiful architecture. Gorgeous both during the day and at night. Can enjoy looking at it from the Zocolo.

454538790.name: Not to be missed
454538790.author: a TripAdvisor user
454538790.reviewBody: This is without question one of the loveliest cathedrals I have visited in a lifetime of travel, and certainly superior to the National Cathedral in Mexico City. It would not be out of place anywhere in Italy. It\'s towers are said to be the tallest in Latin America. It\'s exterior, particularly the facade is quite plain, but it\'s  interior is elegant, yet restrained. We\'re not Catholic, but really wanted to attend mass there.

453109384.name: It is a big and beautiful place
453109384.author: a TripAdvisor user
453109384.reviewBody: This cathedral is really something. It is huge and so gorgeous. If you visit Puebla and the city center do not miss this place. You won\'t regret it.

452934042.name: Must go inside
452934042.author: a TripAdvisor user
452934042.reviewBody: I often just walk around the outside of churches and Cathedrals but you must go inside. I spent a long time wandering around inside. It was very beautiful. Mak sure you come back at night as it really lights up

452849219.name: A MUST!!!
452849219.author: a TripAdvisor user
452849219.reviewBody: The Cathedral of the Immaculate Conception, heart and sould of Puebla, World Heritage City, by UNESCO, a MUST SEE!

450038749.name: Beautiful basilica
450038749.author: a TripAdvisor user
450038749.reviewBody: This basilica is huge and pretty spectacular .. a must see ! Take your time and say a prayer .. \nthere are tons of little posadas in that area close to the basilica worth staying .

448149422.name: A must
448149422.author: a TripAdvisor user
448149422.reviewBody: Not much from the outside but don\'t let that deceive you. The interior is absolutely jaw-dropping. \n\nDon\'t forget to look up.

445095546.name: no photos allowed
445095546.author: a TripAdvisor user
445095546.reviewBody: Visited the cathedral on St Nicholas Day and was disappointed even non flash photos were not allowed.  Such a beautiful place to visit though, with it\'s immense pipe organ and stations.

444278267.name: Serene
444278267.author: a TripAdvisor user
444278267.reviewBody: Beautiful, huge, cathedral on the on side of the Zocalo plaza. Beautiful interior, especially the central altar. If you\'re lucky, you\'ll get to hear the organ and choir in practice or during mass. Then take a seat and just enjoy the serenity for a few minutes. Life outside doesn\'t go away, but it feels distant for a while

440031177.name: quite impressive
440031177.author: a TripAdvisor user
440031177.reviewBody:
depending on how long you have been in Mexico, you will have no doubt seen hundreds if not thousands of churches, after a while they all become quite similar to some degree. However i did enjoy this grand church and the fact that is is right in the middle of downtown zocalo- you ay as well check it out.

the grand organ is amazing and only wish i could have heard its sound. 

its worth the visit and has some good signage explaining he different parts of the church and the history. The doors are massive and majestic, and the scene at sunset and the evening is beautiful.

439648313.name: Beautiful Cathedral
439648313.author: a TripAdvisor user
439648313.reviewBody: One of the places to go see in Puebla, a nice afternoon walking around it is beautiful outside and inside, even if you are not Catholic it\'s a beautiful place to see and admire.

435598706.name: Great and historic place to visit in Puebla
435598706.author: a TripAdvisor user
435598706.reviewBody:
I visited the place on 12th October 2016 with my friends.

It is one of the historic place in the city of Puebla. I was particularly mesmerised with its magnificence, grandeur and art work on the roofs of the domes from inside. The maintenance and cleanliness of the place is praiseworthy.

I also took the opportunity to sat down on the bence and to pray. It was very exhilarating feeling. The perfect peace and tranquillity inside the Church was great experience.

It is one of the place to understand the historic importance of the city of Puebla during Spanish rule.

435212780.name: Spectacular
435212780.author: a TripAdvisor user
435212780.reviewBody: At night the lights against a dark sky make this spot look particularly beautiful.  The interior is absolutely massive - very easy to see why this is a popular spot.

434568396.name: Breathtaking Cathedral in Downtown Puebla
434568396.author: a TripAdvisor user
434568396.reviewBody: Hard to describe the beauty inside this cathedral. Statues, paintings and ornate woodwork surrounds you when you enter this building. The main altar was beautiful, but the thing that I loved the most were all the side chapels. There were probably at least 6 along both long walls on either side of the main altar area. Each one dedicated to someone or something related to the religion. The only drawback was that no photos were allowed, and it would have been so wonderful to be able to take back photos of the interior.

428990026.name: Beautiful Cathedral
428990026.author: a TripAdvisor user
428990026.reviewBody: It is an interesting place to see. Located right in the main square. It is a must see landmark of Puebla. \n

427967964.name: Beautiful architect
427967964.author: a TripAdvisor user
427967964.reviewBody: Puebla has 72 churches many very beautiful but the cathedral is the most impressive. Well worth a visit

427903643.name: Towering complex!
427903643.author: a TripAdvisor user
427903643.reviewBody: I ggasped when I walked into the tremendous volume this church encloses...of immense proportion, it rivals the Cathedral in Mexico City, if not in gilt.  No Photos allowed inside the Cathedral, photographers.

427070374.name: great cathedral
427070374.author: a TripAdvisor user
427070374.reviewBody: at nights on Friday and Saturday, there is a light show that explain you a lot of the history of puebla.

424863225.name: Beautiful
424863225.author: a TripAdvisor user
424863225.reviewBody: A must see and right on the same road as Nueva Luna Hotel! The details in the Cathedral are so intricate - they have a video that tells the history which is great. It\'s very well taken care of!

424805892.name: Beautiful Church with Light Show on Weekends
424805892.author: a TripAdvisor user
424805892.reviewBody: If you are here, you will visit the beautiful Capilla del Rosario. On top of that it is a beautiful church that has light and music show on the weekend with projected light on the building choreographed to music. Awesome!

422279536.name: Magnificent old time grandeur.
422279536.author: a TripAdvisor user
422279536.reviewBody: Beautiful artistic and religious experience.  Good explanations in English. One of the finest we have seen in Mexico.

420519286.name: Large and unique
420519286.author: a TripAdvisor user
420519286.reviewBody: Just a wonderful and very large cathedral. Could probably use some restoration. A lot of places could.

420501208.name: Beautiful
420501208.author: a TripAdvisor user
420501208.reviewBody: Huge church, grand, well taken care of. Functioning church too.\n\nThe organ inside is big - seems to be that way for major churches.

417997005.name: Impressive!
417997005.author: a TripAdvisor user
417997005.reviewBody: It\u00b4s one of the main attractions of Puebla and it\u00b4s well deserved. It\u00b4s really huge and very well maintained. It\u00b4s an example of the power of the People that designed the city

417966958.name: Most beautiful church in Mexico
417966958.author: a TripAdvisor user
417966958.reviewBody: This is majestic! the best of colonial architecture in display. Do not miss entering and walking around

417737745.name: Had to visit this twice, I liked it so much
417737745.author: a TripAdvisor user
417737745.reviewBody: The only problem with the cathedral is that we couldn\'t take pictures.  The scale of the cathedral was amazing.  It was like a church fit inside a huge building.  The organ was the most beautiful organ I had ever seen.  My husband couldn\'t help sneaking a photo of the organ.  You aren\'t supposed to take photos , but it is so beautiful, you want to remember it, or study it later.  That was the only downside.  So I returned a second time on the same day.

407624697.name: Beautiful Baroque Catedral
407624697.author: a TripAdvisor user
407624697.reviewBody: Puebla was on the route between Veracruz (where most ships from Europe landed) and Mexico City. It is a gem of a colonial era and as such the Cathedral is an important example of the wealth existing there in the XVII century. Located besides the Zocalo, with open air cafes surrounding the main square.

406199104.name: Very beautiful church
406199104.author: a TripAdvisor user
406199104.reviewBody: This is a really beautiful church located right in front of the main square in Downtown Puebla. The outside of the building is really impressive, but the inside is incredible. You can spend some time watching the paintings and the building itself. Please, just remember that this is a religious place, so no photos are allowed and please remain silent while inside the church.

403649939.name: Gorgeous!
403649939.author: a TripAdvisor user
403649939.reviewBody: Go this year to any and all Cathedrals to walk through the main doors of forgiveness! Beautiful architecture and artwork. Cathedrals in Mexico rival those in Europe, must see.

402018280.name: Excellent church to visit
402018280.author: a TripAdvisor user
402018280.reviewBody: Both inside and outside are exquisite. Well taken care of and neat. The organ is pretty cool and the altar is very impressive. Reminds me a bit of the cathedral in Seville Spain.

399269136.name: Best Cathedral in the WORLD
399269136.author: a TripAdvisor user
399269136.reviewBody:
I dont really know the Cathedrals in Vaticano City, but this for sure must be one of the best in the world. 

Its a huge and just so beautiful. Any art lovers would be thirll to be inside and just for taking some pictures 

For real this MUST BE ONE OF THE BEST Cathedrals in the whole WORLD.

398946807.name: Beautiful, old Basilica
398946807.author: a TripAdvisor user
398946807.reviewBody: I am not of the Roman Catholic persuasion. I prefer reading the Bible. But the Basilica is the second oldest in the Americas and well worth seeing for its beauty and for the insights it gives about the heart of that religion. No photos most places. No touring in areas where mass is being given. But the place is large enough that there are sites to see even during mass. Walk respectfully around confessions being given.

398835782.name: Incredible site - a Must while in Puebla
398835782.author: a TripAdvisor user
398835782.reviewBody: The Cathedral is located right at the heart of Puebla. It is a magnificent edification and quite impressive when you get there. Very well preserved, it hosts not only regular masses but also some choirs and special religious occasions (this year, the Door at the middle, called "La Puerta del Perd\u00f3n" or Door of Forgiveness, is open for all to enter. It is said that if you enter this door, all your sins will be forgiven (although my mum says you have to stay for the entire Mass so there\'s a catch in this deal ;-) haha).\nThe interior is beautiful, and a good place not only for worship but also to discover the beautiful treasures Puebla has to offer.\nI would indeed recommend this place to anyone visiting Puebla.

398225847.name: Very antique !
398225847.author: a TripAdvisor user
398225847.reviewBody: The cathedral looks a lot like the Mexico\'s cathedral . I was disappointed that I could not take pictures. The main altar is beautiful. There was a video that ran all the time while we were there explaining the different art pieces of the cathedral. The cathedral was under repair but that did not take away from its beauty. If you visit Puebla, you need to visit the cathedral.

394818926.name: One of the nicest cathedrals in the world
394818926.author: a TripAdvisor user
394818926.reviewBody: I\'ve visited many churches and chapels in Europe, but Puebla\'s Cathedral is the best.  Its size, its pipe organ, all the images are simply wonderful.

394815288.name: Beautiful Catheral
394815288.author: a TripAdvisor user
394815288.reviewBody: Not as magnificent as the Capilla de Rosario but beautiful all the same.  it is said that it was built over a river and if they had put bells in the towers it would have sunk the church.  built around 1575 it towers the city\'s main square and is said to be 230 feet tall and the tallest in Mexico.  beautiful carved onyx statues of saints and angels and domed ceiling.  Enjoyed my visit, we were told that we were there at a special time, there was a colorful arch over the doorway, we were told that if we entered while that arch was over the door, our sins would be forgiven....it was a time of forgiveness  the sign says Adored is the Holy Sacrament  and below it says (Purisima is songs and prayers ) to the Holy Mary or Virgin Mary.  Cathedral Heritage Site, rich in history and detail.

393344576.name: Beautiful and historic place to visit
393344576.author: a TripAdvisor user
393344576.reviewBody: A beautiful place not to be missed when visiting the Puebla.  Enjoy the magnificent view of the Cathedral and the mass is usually packed with people.

393063979.name: Nice Cathedral Nice Scuare
393063979.author: a TripAdvisor user
393063979.reviewBody: The Cathedral is quite Nice, it comes to complete the historic center of Puebla. Richer cathedral that the temples you meet in the population around, it does not make a Guau!!! When you came in. But as said it is a great stop when you visit the center of Puebla. Don\'t miss it

387675736.name: Big big church with so many details to look at
387675736.author: a TripAdvisor user
387675736.reviewBody:
The Catedral Basilica in Puebla is one of the nicest churches in the city. Dircetly in the historic centrum you will find this very very big building.

From the outside not that beautiful but if you go inside you won't be able to stop looking. So many nice details in paintings and architecture. Beautiful! 

There is no entry to pay.

386226535.name: Amazing Building.
386226535.author: a TripAdvisor user
386226535.reviewBody: What an incredible church to visit. Such opulent decorations and beautifully painted throughout. A defiantly must see when visiting Puebla.

375652102.name: Interesting, but not spectacular
375652102.author: a TripAdvisor user
375652102.reviewBody: It is definitely interesting - especially if you have never been to one of these massive Mexican Baroque churches - but for grandeur it falls short of Mexico City\'s and does not have the charm of others like the Morelia Cathedral (with it\'s distinctive pink tuff stone). Worth stopping by if you are in the area checking out nearby attractions, but I would not make it the centerpiece of a visit.

375244205.name: Great Cathedral
375244205.author: a TripAdvisor user
375244205.reviewBody: I believe that church is been around for close to 400 years or more, this last may were doing work in the inside. Same thing about other churches can not made videos or take fotos,,also if you have time go to Cholula only few minutes from puebla city this small city has 365 churches, and the pyramid, si better to go by taxi since is hard to find parking and lot of traffic.

374681585.name: Absolutely amazing!
374681585.author: a TripAdvisor user
374681585.reviewBody: My family and I were first blown away by the amount of people in the courtyard out front...including us, there were 9..!!!  The exterior rivaled any in Europe and if this was in Europe there would have been 900 people!  The basilica is right next to the Zocolo and central to many of the other area attractions!  Don\'t miss this, GO!

374271527.name: Outstanding!
374271527.author: a TripAdvisor user
374271527.reviewBody:
This is one of my top favorite cathedrals/religious buildings in Mexico. 

Do not miss the interior and its beutiful and impresive pipe organs. 

When not in use for mass or religious events it is basically a museum. You can visit on your own but I guess hiring a guide would make the experience much better since Im sure there are a lot of hidden treasures and facts inside and out the building.

372789352.name: Stunning church full of History
372789352.author: a TripAdvisor user
372789352.reviewBody: Stunning church full of History. Is a beautiful colonial building full of detail and amazing views. Pretty huge!

370288829.name: Beautiful
370288829.author: a TripAdvisor user
370288829.reviewBody: Really beautiful. The baroque style was interesting. Just to think how many artisans it took to complete it is amazing. I wish I could have taken photos inside.

370177240.name: Good
370177240.author: a TripAdvisor user
370177240.reviewBody: Very nice place to visit with family or colleagues. Located in the center of the city and has lots of places to eat.

370090430.name: Breathtaking
370090430.author: a TripAdvisor user
370090430.reviewBody: We walked in and had to sit down as we were overwhelmed from the beauty and needed a minute to take it all in, Its a must see if you are in Puebla.

369612422.name: Imposing Cathedral right next to the Zocalo
369612422.author: a TripAdvisor user
369612422.reviewBody: Beautiful cathedral on the outside and with some grandeur inside. Recommend for a quick visit, outside structure more impressive than inside.

367551184.name: Oye of the mostrar nace and Hugo catedrales in M\u00e9xico
367551184.author: a TripAdvisor user
367551184.reviewBody: If you come to Puebla you cannot miss the visit to the cathedral, the arquitecture is magnificencia and all\u00e1 the detalles are really impressuve you have to visit White you are in town

366577581.name: In awe
366577581.author: a TripAdvisor user
366577581.reviewBody: It is truly a historic and fantastic experience.\nAnybody going to Puebla should see this place...it is beautiful and very well preserved.

363362238.name: Nice but a bit plain inside
363362238.author: a TripAdvisor user
363362238.reviewBody: The Cathedral anchors one side of the Zocalo, the main square. It is a majestic building on the outside and looks fantastic at night when illuminated . The inside is certainly nice enough with a beautiful organ but a bit plain in comparison to other churches you\'ll see in Mexico.

363183724.name: Don\'t let the outside fool you
363183724.author: a TripAdvisor user
363183724.reviewBody: The outside is not very pretty but definitely take the time to go in. It is a grand cathedral inside. I was so surprised because I had already seen Rosary chapel and thought it would be the most beautiful downtown but personally I loved all the woodwork and just how big and magnificent this cathedral is! \nI recommend taking the time to see this church.

361345144.name: Beautiful Catedral
361345144.author: a TripAdvisor user
361345144.reviewBody: Another beautiful cathedral in Puebla.  They are all simply magnificent, full of gold and ancient history of the church.

359416433.name: One of the biggest mexican cathedrals
359416433.author: a TripAdvisor user
359416433.reviewBody: This is a must if you visit Puebla. A great view of city\'s history.\n\nNo photos are supposed to be allowed.

359134934.name: a masterpiece
359134934.author: a TripAdvisor user
359134934.reviewBody: This church has a very different design from most churches. Once you walk into the church, you would feel stunned by the glorious interior decoration and magnificent outfit. I can\'t describe too much as I don\'t even know the English words for those stuff inside the church. All I can say that I can fully understand why it took nearly 200 years to finish the building of the whole church.

358608917.name: Beautiful cathedral!
358608917.author: a TripAdvisor user
358608917.reviewBody: Insides it remind me the cathedral os San Peter in Vatican, very spacious, and lots of gold, and pictures from the passages..

357623494.name: Beautiful Church
357623494.author: a TripAdvisor user
357623494.reviewBody: This church is beautiful and allowed people to explore more than others. It isn\'t as ornate as some, but don\'t be fooled. They are all gorgeous! I enjoyed hearing the bells even though I couldn\'t figure out what their purpose was (not on the hour).

350942163.name: Baroque
350942163.author: a TripAdvisor user
350942163.reviewBody:
I enjoyed the visit to various churches with baroque design. 
I love the architectural places, the intricate designs, magnificent churches and the history of Puebla.
I love this tour, the downside is the distance from Mexico City to Puebla, it ranges from 2-3 hours depending upon the traffic. Other than that it's rewarding. 
I didn't enjoy the food which is included in our mexitour. Please bring your biscuit or smell snack, the food from Hotel Colonial is disgusting. I don't know how they cook there, prices are triple. Please do not include any food in your tour. 
Overall, we enjoyed it.

348962194.name: WOW!!! Amazing Cathedral
348962194.author: a TripAdvisor user
348962194.reviewBody: It has to be one of the most amazing cathedrals in Mexico. The history it has, the amazing place with gigantic areas divides into 2 sections by a Gigantic organ is well worth the visit. Buit in the 1700\'s it is a jewel in an amazing city like Puebla. After visiting the cathedral, enjoy a stoll on the zocalo and relax having a coffee in the main plaza. A MUST if you visit puebla

348917948.name: impressive
348917948.author: a TripAdvisor user
348917948.reviewBody: go to the other churches in the city center too,also  to the art\'s street, try to feel the wonderful atmosphere and to enjoy the architecture of the town.

348589276.name: Neat church to see.
348589276.author: a TripAdvisor user
348589276.reviewBody: If you have the time, it\'s nice to pop in and see the well done religious works of art through out the cathedral.

347963536.name: Impressive scale, restricted access
347963536.author: a TripAdvisor user
347963536.reviewBody: The sheer scale of the cathedral will impress.  Take a walk completely around the exterior to appreciate the domes and towers.  Inside, though, visitors are restricted from access to altar and choir.  A statue of Jesus lying in a glass crypt in the back of the church captivated this visitor, mostly for his curly red wig and half-lidded eyes.

347651827.name: Great place for free
347651827.author: a TripAdvisor user
347651827.reviewBody: I visited the place with a non-religious perspective and was amazed by its architecture and preservation work. No pictures allowed inside even without flash, and since it\'s a religious temple, visitors must show respect and not wear shorts, and gents must take off hats. Very clean restrooms for $5MXN

347609817.name: Cathedral visit on Candelaria February 2nd
347609817.author: a TripAdvisor user
347609817.reviewBody: We just happened to be in the Zocolo on February 2nd, an important day in the Christian calendar in Mexico. In the streets outside the church demonstrators chanted political slogans,encouraged by demagogues over loudspeakers. In the cathedral plaza crowds of uniformed school children marshalled by their teachers queued to receive a blessing from a mitred bishop with crook. Acolytes sprinkled the kids with holy water as the bishop read passages from an enormous bible held by a steward. The column was joined by other worshippers carrying babies in their arms, or in baskets. On closer examination the babies proved to be dolls representing the infant Jesus, as Candelaria celebrates the presentation of the infant Christ at the temple.\nInside this immense church volunteers had transformed the usual excesses of the baroque with lavish displays of fresh spring flowers, their scents mingling with the massed choirs of children\'s voices soaring to the accompaniment of an electric violin.

345989572.name: Breathtaking
345989572.author: a TripAdvisor user
345989572.reviewBody: Definitely worth a visit. Not supposed to take pictures although everybody did (including me. Sorry...) \n\nTook a guided tour, although there was so much I would be willing to go back alone to just sit and take in all the different altarpieces, paintings and chapels.

345264728.name: Grand Structure
345264728.author: a TripAdvisor user
345264728.reviewBody: The immensity of this structure is amazing. Onyx floor tiles, gilded altars, elaborate metal doors to each of the fourteen side chapels, and intricately carved, matching wooden doors highlight the craftsmanship of this long-ago time.

342156149.name: Breathtaking Cathedral
342156149.author: a TripAdvisor user
342156149.reviewBody: This Cathedral looks like any other beautiful Cathedral ... until you enter inside.  WOW you get overpowered with beauty of the gold covered interior.  Never seen so much gold in my life.  The art work and absolutely everything about this Cathedral is stunning.  I\'ve visited several Cathedrals but never one like this.  It\'s definitely a must see in Puebla.  Amazing!!

338861940.name: A top site in beautiful Puebla
338861940.author: a TripAdvisor user
338861940.reviewBody: This is one of the beautiful things to see in Puebla. It has an interesting architectural history behind it and the interior is gorgeous with several altars within, each with its own character.

338570846.name: impressive cathedal
338570846.author: a TripAdvisor user
338570846.reviewBody: Very attractive interior with nice frescous an several side chapels. It is in the very centre of the city

338544766.name: Another R.C. Beauty
338544766.author: a TripAdvisor user
338544766.reviewBody: The Cathedral Basilica in Puebla is another triumph of beauty for Roman Catholicism.\nIt is huge, and the second largest in Mexico after the one in the capital, as befits the fourth largest city in the country. The real name of the town is Puebla de Los Angeles, and to underline this fact, the cathedral in incredibly ornate with a great deal of gold in place. With no direct relevance, we were pleased to see that Puebla also boasts a large Woolworths.

338155649.name: Huge Church
338155649.author: a TripAdvisor user
338155649.reviewBody: This church has a lot of activity going on and you may not be able to enter and see all of it during certain times. Very nice.

337388623.name: Simple, big
337388623.author: a TripAdvisor user
337388623.reviewBody: It;s a large place that\'s adjacent to the central square. However, given the tremendous number of churches in the area, it\'s surprisingly uninteresting beyond it\'s sheer size.

336532846.name: Beautiful Cathedral
336532846.author: a TripAdvisor user
336532846.reviewBody: The Zocalo in Puebla is spacious and has the life you can expect in a typical Mexican Plaza.  All around you have an Mexican Colonial arcade where you can find coffee shops, restaurants, hotels and souvenir shops. Look at the beautiful "Santo Tom\u00e1s marble floor" in red and gray colors and also at the cantera in the buildings. The highlight of the Plaza is the Cathedral. This Cathedral was supposed to be in Mexico city but the architectural plans were sent to Puebla by error, so you will find a very large and beautiful Cathedral. Don\'t miss the musical organ on the entrance.

334847326.name: Unfortunately Does Not Allow Photography
334847326.author: a TripAdvisor user
334847326.reviewBody: A cathedral with so much to see, but does not allow any form of photography. I waste, since I am unlikely to remember all the details. Videos explain various aspects of the cathedral in Spanish are played, so that you can just sit and listen and wonder...

332794497.name: impressing  monumental  simbol  of this ancient  city
332794497.author: a TripAdvisor user
332794497.reviewBody: number one atraction to this ancient  city , make sure  you  visit the inside and the near by zocalo square

328595234.name: Beatiful place
328595234.author: a TripAdvisor user
328595234.reviewBody: The most beatiful building in town and one of the most beatiful Churches in M\u00e9xico which already gives you an idea. The details both inside and out of this building are amazing. No matter hwo the weather could be you can always get fantastic pictures here!

322193466.name: Visit the light show if you can.
322193466.author: a TripAdvisor user
322193466.reviewBody: The cathedral itself is beautiful but not as much as some of the other churches in the area.  I personally didn\'t love the inside as much others because it is not as open and impressive.  \n\nHowever if you are in the city on Friday or Saturday night the light show that is projected on the main facade is really impressive.

315978627.name: favorite church in Mexico
315978627.author: a TripAdvisor user
315978627.reviewBody: The cathedral of puebla sits offset but adjacent to the zocalo. Thus far, it has been my favorite church in the new world, reminds me of one I would expect to see in southern Europe.  Easily worth a look, save at least half an hour if not a full hour to appreciate this beauty

314572576.name: Lots of history and social activities going on
314572576.author: a TripAdvisor user
314572576.reviewBody: Outstanding example of colonia architecture that is still regularly use by locals for a variety of religious ceremonies and events. They should charge foreigners access fees and use them to improve the general area in things like accessibility, washrooms, materials and merchandise, etc. As it is the case with most Mexican landmarks, there\'s a very low fee for foreigners. This needs to change. Overall, plan to be there at least a couple of hours and bring binoculars or small telescope to look at the detail in the high ceelings.

313605787.name: Colossal
313605787.author: a TripAdvisor user
313605787.reviewBody: This Baroque cathedral remains from the colonial past of the city. It has seen many historical events. Visiting it, is to live again what happen there. \n\nProbably one of the most preserved and beautiful church in the country.

313555648.name: Classic Mexican Cathedral with impressive architecture!
313555648.author: a TripAdvisor user
313555648.reviewBody: Classic Mexican Cathedral with impressive architecture! The major church in one of the most religous states in Mexico ... a must see if visiting from outside of Puebla!

312502140.name: great colonial times
312502140.author: a TripAdvisor user
312502140.reviewBody: Traditional cathedral, big size, imposant...you can visite daily for free. Dont hesitate to spent a time and devote to burn one or more candles...

312057479.name: Nice, but not special
312057479.author: a TripAdvisor user
312057479.reviewBody: I know people from Puebla like to believe they are and have the very best every time; but I just can\'t refrain from letting them know that it simply isn\'t that way. So, they also believe they have the most gorgeous and beautiful church in the world (the Saint Peter\'s of the Americas, they say!), but apart from having the highest clock towers in Latinamerica this is just another ordinary cathedral like dozens around Mexico and many other Latinamerican countries. Besides, if you have a camera, once inside you will soon be approached by a ghost-like short old lady who will tell you in perfect English "NO PHOTO!". Just don\'t care and take all the pics you want. AFter all there is NO MOnalisa painting in here that will be affected by your flashlight.

309503097.name: One more Cathedral
309503097.author: a TripAdvisor user
309503097.reviewBody: Just another Cathedral, looks like any other insignificant one. When in Puebla, go to see Chapel de Rosario, much more impressive.

305958930.name: Good Gold God
305958930.author: a TripAdvisor user
305958930.reviewBody: I really enjoyed the opportunity to know this church and its Rosario chapel inside all made by gold... Don\'t forget to attend the free tour guide they offer there

304440395.name: Don\'t miss this
304440395.author: a TripAdvisor user
304440395.reviewBody: If you\'re in puebla, take time to visit downtown and enjoy the zocalo and the Cathedral. Every Sunday you can ejnjoy music at the Zocalo, people, and see wonderful colors around. Around the vence of the Cathedral you can see angels on top.

303482815.name: Superb cathedral with 3 organs
303482815.author: a TripAdvisor user
303482815.reviewBody: It is a must to visit. It has 3 organs and several chapels. The wooden doors are magnificent. The roof design is beautiful.

301991560.name: Only Time to Visit 1 Church? Make it the Rosary Chapel. But the Cathedral is Nice.
301991560.author: a TripAdvisor user
301991560.reviewBody: If you only have time for 1 church in Puebla, make it to the Rosary Chapel. It\'s amazing. \nThe cathedral is interesting and inspiring and huge, like so many others in Mexico. Note that there are signs all over asking for no cameras (with or without flash); but you\'ll undoubtedly see a few foreign tourists disrespecting the request.  Please don\'t be one of them.

299009065.name: Nice cathedral but not much inside
299009065.author: a TripAdvisor user
299009065.reviewBody: The cathedral is very nice from the outside, but I did not find it any different from any other cathedral in Mexico. While it is nice, there are better sights in Puebla. Go to the Rosary Chapel.

298504625.name: Beautiful
298504625.author: a TripAdvisor user
298504625.reviewBody: Beautiful cathedral of Puebla. This church was started in the 1500s --rich in history and the inside is worth the visit. It is located next to the zocalo.

297905177.name: Must See
297905177.author: a TripAdvisor user
297905177.reviewBody: No words!  A must see when in Puebla! It is in the center of town and worth your time to see a building built so long ago.

297693852.name: Very, very beautiful basilica
297693852.author: a TripAdvisor user
297693852.reviewBody: This basilica is quite picturesque and stands out in the city of Puebla. Didn\'t get a chance to see the inside as time was very short unfortunately\nThere is a resemblance to the Oaxaca Cathedral of Santo Domingo.

290737545.name: Another Church in the city of 360 churches
290737545.author: a TripAdvisor user
290737545.reviewBody: So, they won\'t let you take pictures inside, but nothing will happen to you if you do anyway, except for an angry little woman will berate you verbally. lol.

290248663.name: Beautiful church
290248663.author: a TripAdvisor user
290248663.reviewBody: I love seeing churches when I travel.  I think churches show us the history of a city.  The cathedral of Puebla is no different. In a city of many churches, this one stands out.  It is the largest and one of the most beautiful.  It is also on the zocalo, close to many other attractions.

286947601.name: one of the biggest and most beautifull catedral in mexico
286947601.author: a TripAdvisor user
286947601.reviewBody: its a very impresive catedral with huge a\u00edsles and ornamentation including the old organ that its still in service, a very well recomended place to visite here in town

286462389.name: Walking Tour
286462389.author: a TripAdvisor user
286462389.reviewBody: Lovely Chapel near the Zocalo. Often missed by travelers, but worth a visit not as grand as the Rosary Chapel or the Main Cathedral but worth the visit.

282217545.name: Impressive building not much done for visitors
282217545.author: a TripAdvisor user
282217545.reviewBody:
Visitors are asked not to walk around the cathedral during religious offices , which is fair  .
so normal visit hours are from 10 to 11 am and from 2 to 5 pm .
unfortuantely it is almost impossible to apreciate the paintings and the sculptures in the lateral chapels as they are very dark and without light at these recomended visit hours .
on a global note  not much explanation is available to understand better the architecture and the work of arts inside these majestuous  cathedral , this could be easily improved

280378847.name: A must see
280378847.author: a TripAdvisor user
280378847.reviewBody: I think this is the loveliest big Cathedral in all of Mexico.  The design is more Italian than traditional Mexican, but nonetheless spectacular.  Photography forbidden (a rule that is generally ignored).

279020216.name: A beautiful church
279020216.author: a TripAdvisor user
279020216.reviewBody: This is one of the biggest churches I\'ve seen, you can hear the priest clear and loud anywhere in the church when there\'s a mass

277915854.name: Awesome architecture
277915854.author: a TripAdvisor user
277915854.reviewBody: Great and majestic catholic building!! The atrium as well as the pipe organ will leave you breathless.

277365272.name: Good lightshow
277365272.author: a TripAdvisor user
277365272.reviewBody: Inside the cathedral is beautiful, but nothing that separates it from others. A nice thing to watch is the free light-show at night (free) that highlights some historic events. Nice to check out.

275630858.name: Lovely Day Trip From Mexico City
275630858.author: a TripAdvisor user
275630858.reviewBody: Just a short drive from the hustle of Mexico City is the charming town of Puebla.  This town center is really nice for walking with a large square (Zocalo) and a beautiful basilica that you do not want to miss.  The main altar, I believe, is a dedication to Franciscans and the side chapel is over the top opulent.   There is much to see in this beautiful Catholic church and in the town of Puebla itself. Highly recommend for travelers to Mexico City to day trip Puebla and nearby Cholula.

275433006.name: worth the visit
275433006.author: a TripAdvisor user
