275433006.reviewBody: we took a guided tour all through puebla, and this church was huge and beautiful. the organ is one of the biggest in america. have someone explain it when you are there so you get the full effect

274529179.name: Beautiful Cathedral, inside and out
274529179.author: a TripAdvisor user
274529179.reviewBody: If you visit the Zocalo, you can\'t miss the Cathedral. It is an impressive structure. Definietly go in if you can. It is open during the day when services are not going on. It is beautifully apportioned and well maintained. You can\'t use flash photography, so go during the day to take pictures inside. At night the sometimes project images onto the outside of the Cathedral set to music. When we were there it was something to do with the Battle of Puebla (I think).

274291202.name: Magnificent cathedral in the main square
274291202.author: a TripAdvisor user
274291202.reviewBody: This cathedral is Mexico\'s second largest and was built in 1649. It has a tiled dome similar to St Peters in Rome and 14 side chapels. The full name of the town is "Puebla de los Angeles" or People of the Angels and the large courtyard out front has pillars of angels to symbolize this. If you are in Puebla, but sure to view this amazing feat of Godliness.

273880341.name: Always something for entertaiment
273880341.author: a TripAdvisor user
273880341.reviewBody: An icon of Puebla. The Architecture is amazing and City full of history. The Cathedral is a most to visit when you are in town. I fully recommend form September to December. Full of activities,National and  international events and concerts  .

271883743.name: First time hearing mass in spanish...
271883743.author: a TripAdvisor user
271883743.reviewBody: Went to a Sunday mass with Mexican family.  The mass is very similar with masses in the Philippines.  The people are very much like Filipinos.  Felt at home.  Knowing a little spanish..my knowledge of the language expanded a little bit because of the similarities.  The church architectural design is so nice.  I love the people and the culture too because of the similarities with Filipinos except that we have different opinion in boxing...but that does not matter.

271041507.name: Beautiful cathedral - the focal point of the city planning
271041507.author: a TripAdvisor user
271041507.reviewBody: The cathedral was meant to be the most important building in the city - no doubt about it: just look at its location (along the Zocalo), interior & exterior design, and the fact it has its own plaza in front of it, although being located next to the city\'s main square. It\'s definitely worth a visit. Especially if you\'re tired of the overwhelming late baroque of some other churches in Puebla and Cholula.

267755613.name: Extravagant Church!
267755613.author: a TripAdvisor user
267755613.reviewBody: This church is truly extravagant and grandiose. It has amazing chapels inside which are each unique and beautiful as well. Even if visiting churches isn\'t your thing, or you think you\'ve seen them all, this one still deserves a visit as the details and size are incredible. Sadly there are many national and foreign visitors who disrespectfully ignore the many signs throughout the church that prohibit the use of any cameras, cell phones, and video cameras (regardless if they have flash or not). Please respect this request and just enjoy your time admiring the decor and work that has gone into building and maintaining this incredible church.

267741856.name: Worth a look inside!!
267741856.author: a TripAdvisor user
267741856.reviewBody: The Catedral Basicica de Puebla may not be Puebla\'s most beautiful church, but it is very beautiful nonetheless and worth a visit inside.

267429778.name: Amazing Architecture
267429778.author: a TripAdvisor user
267429778.reviewBody: What a stunning church surrounded by a lively place. The light show at night was fantastic. A must see! \nESLVentures.com

266473005.name: Beautiful church but can\'t take photos
266473005.author: a TripAdvisor user
266473005.reviewBody: This is a really lovely and huge cathedral in Puebla centro, if you visit the zocalo you can\'t miss it! The stone work is beautiful inside and out but unfortunately there are signs everywhere inside saying no photos. A majority of people were ignoring the signs but there are staff who will tell you off so beware. I found that in the morning the sun makes taking photos of the front facade difficult, the afternoon light was much more appealing.

259428507.name: Grand !!
259428507.author: a TripAdvisor user
259428507.reviewBody: We did not use a guide so it is hard to understand the full history but it is extremely complex and imagining the construction in that day and age............

258669755.name: majestic architecture
258669755.author: a TripAdvisor user
258669755.reviewBody: this historic cathedral was built by the Spanish Monarchy and very ornate  with huge variety  of ornamental statues and ceilings and.chapels.

256344441.name: A must see in Puebla, but...
256344441.author: a TripAdvisor user
256344441.reviewBody: Big, with over the top Mexican baroque decoration everywhere, it dominates the Zocolo. If you are there, you must take a peek inside.\n\nFrom a historical point of view, though, it (like the other posh big churches in the country) was the product of the ruthless domination of,  and wealth extraction from the local people by the Spanish conquerers. Thinking about this certainly creates a bit of mental dissonance!

256090737.name: Overwhelming
256090737.author: a TripAdvisor user
256090737.reviewBody: The cathedral is huge.  Beautiful.  The art in it is great.  I went back for mass which was conducted by the happiest priest I have ever seen!

256042909.name: Do not miss the light show on weekend nights...
256042909.author: a TripAdvisor user
256042909.reviewBody: We passed by the Cathedral on our way back to hotel one night and caught the light show by accident (I think it was around 8 pm on a Saturday night - check timings with the Tourist Information). We were told later by the hotel it\'s only on weekend nights. If you have been to the Loire chateaus in France and you liked their light shows, this will not disappoint. In fact, it was better than that in France may be because it was FREE. The colorful play of lights on the fa\u00e7ade was incredible. The only downside is the commentary was in Spanish.

255702667.name: Awesome
255702667.author: a TripAdvisor user
255702667.reviewBody: Beautifully preserved , no entrance fees, one of the top site to visit in puebla, worth a visit definitely

255666738.name: Another Puebla must-see
255666738.author: a TripAdvisor user
255666738.reviewBody: Enormous cathedral, very majestic, with an amazing interior.  Only down-side.  You are not supposed to take ANY pictures in the interior.  But I say many people sneaking it.  Not the end of the world.

255481243.name: Yet another great church but no photos
255481243.author: a TripAdvisor user
255481243.reviewBody: Once you get to the central area of Puebla (Centro Historico) you see some great colourful building facades which are best seen during the day hours if possible. The Cathedral was worth a visit despite not being able to take photos. on the walk around you have some fabulous thing to buy so come with an empty suitcase.

254775143.name: Worth a visit!
254775143.author: a TripAdvisor user
254775143.reviewBody: I love visiting the Cathedral of Puebla for its sheer magnitud. The flying buttresses, and pipe organ are works of art. \nAt Christmas they set up a life size nativity scene made of talavera. \nThe entrance is free.

253390443.name: Cathedral
253390443.author: a TripAdvisor user
253390443.reviewBody: Peaceful ,not as garish as some .Worth a visit . Right on the Zocalo . All that you need within reach .

252271330.name: A visit in it self
252271330.author: a TripAdvisor user
252271330.reviewBody: This monument, besides having a deep spiritual value for any Christian or Catholic from the world. Is a work of art.\nVery well preserved, full of history and myth!\nDon\'t forget to visit it when you go to Puebla!

252012463.name: beautiful
252012463.author: a TripAdvisor user
252012463.reviewBody: the Cathedral is  beautiful, its wonderful t enter and feel the peace surrounding you. \nthe sound of the church bells are unique and wonderful.

250097320.name: Cathedral worth a visit
250097320.author: a TripAdvisor user
250097320.reviewBody: A beautiful cathedral right on the Puebla zocolo. Amazing paintings on the interior walls and richly decorated.

249164968.name: Beautiful cathedral
249164968.author: a TripAdvisor user
249164968.reviewBody: The cathedral is stunning already from the outside and absolutely amazing on the inside.\nOne night the city had a light show projected on the facade, which was beautiful and a great experience. I am not sure whether this is a weekly / daily thing.

248529338.name: Lord of the Rings have nothing on these Towers!
248529338.author: a TripAdvisor user
248529338.reviewBody:
This cathedral boasts two of the largest cathedral towers in all of the Americas.  They truly are impressive.  

The inside of the church is quite interesting as well, though you are not allowed to take pictures inside.  There is even a really mean lady that scolds you if she catches you taking pictures.  Don't mess with her!

  Down the street there is also a cultural center that has more exhibits related to the cathedral that were worth seeing.

248318126.name: nothing spectacular
248318126.author: a TripAdvisor user
248318126.reviewBody: Went briefly for mass--very crowded.  Expected that.  But nothing stands out from other cathedrals around the country.

247699110.name: One of Mexico\'s treasure
247699110.author: a TripAdvisor user
247699110.reviewBody: If you are in Puebla and have a half day to spare I highly recommend going to the Catedral de Puebla.  The cathedral itself is beautiful and you can\'t help but be amazed that it was built over 500 years ago.  There are always festivals, shows or something going on in the square.  There are lots of shops and great restaurants in the square.  Some restaurants even have rooftop views which is great at sunset.

246059675.name: Grand Scale
246059675.author: a TripAdvisor user
246059675.reviewBody: Historically important.  Impressive pipe organ and claims to be the largest basilica dome in the Americas

245842655.name: A wonderful Cathedral and small city around the town center
245842655.author: a TripAdvisor user
245842655.reviewBody:
First of all I need to appreciate our drive from Mexico City to Puebla. Once we were out of Mexico City limits, the highway became less crowded and the beautiful country side opened up. First came the breath taking views of two volcanoes - Iztaccihuatl (dead) and Popocatepetl (Smoking mountain still live). There were lovely views of the harvested corn fields on either side. 

Before we entered the Puebla city, we saw a large group of industries including the Volks Wagen car plant. Once we entered the Historical center and the Zocalo, it was mostly historically important attractions. The Cathedral was the centre piece. Photography is not allowed inside. Around the Cathedral there are a large number of small and medium sized churches and museums. 

The town center in front of the Cathedral has a large number of shady trees, fountains and benches for the wary travellers. The streets around the place has a number of street cafes and restaurants. 

The golden decorative pieces in the cathedral were breath taking. No wonder photography was not allowed inside. There were roving security personnel enforcing the rule. 

The visit to Puebla was a fantastic experience

245139079.name: CATHEDRAL
245139079.author: a TripAdvisor user
245139079.reviewBody: One of the emblematic landmarks in the city of Puebla. Get impressed by it\u00b4s architecture and dimensions. Part of the history of the city.

244366145.name: nice cathedral
244366145.author: a TripAdvisor user
244366145.reviewBody: large and spacious its probably not as ostentatious as europe\'s cathedrals but is very calm and soothing. located near the square, it still manages to be quiet and holy. nice to visit before going off to the markets or sightseeing.

243486350.name: Beautiful!
243486350.author: a TripAdvisor user
243486350.reviewBody: Free admission, well worth a visit. Beautiful golden ornaments. Photos without flash allowed inside. \n

243140345.name: Religiuos art
243140345.author: a TripAdvisor user
243140345.reviewBody: This monumental Cathedral is close to "zocalo" (the principal square), on the 16 de septiembre street.  His architecture is similar to the Cathedral in Mexico city. Inside is better with his unique religiuos paints, "portal del altar mayor", and one special place can be visit it, in a holidays or Big dates, requiere special order.\nTherein has "renacentista, barroco, y necl\u00e1scico" art. Two towers highest in Mexico, in one tower with his Maria bell.

242616017.name: Impressive Cathedral
242616017.author: a TripAdvisor user
242616017.reviewBody: The cathedral is located in Zocalo, the heart of the city of Puebla.  Visitors are more than welcome to enter and admire the beauty of the architecture and the history of the cathedral, which was begun in the 1530s.

240268670.name: Heart of catholic Mexico
240268670.author: a TripAdvisor user
240268670.reviewBody: Just beside the Zocalo (central place of Puebla) constructed on ruins of pre-hispanic temples.\nImpressive but not slaying the site. Inside as all Curches in Mexico showing the wealth the spaniards exploited from the indigene population. I prefer this one to the Cathedral in Mexico City.

239857260.name: Basilica de Puebla
239857260.author: a TripAdvisor user
239857260.reviewBody: A must see in Puebla. I never seen anything as impressive, since my trip to the pyramids of Egypt. Really huge work of art.

239130798.name: Big, impressive colonial cathedral
239130798.author: a TripAdvisor user
239130798.reviewBody: The Cathedral is impressive - unsurprising as most of the huge edifices constructed by the Spanish in Mexico were built with the express purpose of impressing. It is not quite as impressive as the Catedral Metropolitana in the centre.

238459153.name: Tallest Spires in the Americas
238459153.author: a TripAdvisor user
238459153.reviewBody: All 138 churches in Puebla are built on top of the Aztec temples found by the Spanish.  In many cases they disassembled the so-called pagan temples and used the same stones to build the church.  Such is the case with this church, it not only has the tallest towers in the Americas but it is huge in size and very similar in design and layout to the Vatican church in Rome.  The church is a work of art but what they don\'t tell you is that it was built with slave Indian labor and the populace was subjected to huge taxes for many years to pay for it.  The church was the dominant political party that ruled the new world.

237886684.name: the most important site in Puebla
237886684.author: a TripAdvisor user
237886684.reviewBody: an awesome sight, you will go back several times. history oozes out of every stone. so quiet and peaceful, an oasis of calm.

237668977.name: Outside very impressive
237668977.author: a TripAdvisor user
237668977.reviewBody: While being a little like most of the cathedrals on the inside, the Puebla cathedral is unique on the outside. With its remarkable facade and towers that can be seen from miles away definitely worth a visit.

237643735.name: One of the best
237643735.author: a TripAdvisor user
237643735.reviewBody: I\'ve seen many cathedrals and Puebla\'s will not disappoint you. It\'s architecture is amazing, size and how well kept is it. Try to go when there is service and you will feel the local flavor for how devoted Mexicans are to Catholicism

235491716.name: Cathedral full of history
235491716.author: a TripAdvisor user
235491716.reviewBody: One of the oldest Cathedrals in America, constructed about 1560 and till today even the earthquakes is complete. Some figures of Mexican history are buried here even because of their track they are ignored but the Cathedral organ is monumental and  always keep in very good condition at least once a month a concert  is given so people can keep and idea of how great this organ is

235415995.name: Stunning old church
235415995.author: a TripAdvisor user
235415995.reviewBody: Like most Catherdrals, the artwork, detail and level of elaboration is quite remarkable and one can only marvel at the engineering and planning that went into such a place before the days of CAD.

231487623.name: Incredible visit
231487623.author: a TripAdvisor user
231487623.reviewBody: The cathedral is in the city center so getting there is a little annoying because of traffic. However, once you get there you forget all about it! The outside architecture and stone masonry is incredible and the inside is to die for. Simply have to visit!

230686051.name: Favorite
230686051.author: a TripAdvisor user
230686051.reviewBody: This was my favorite Cathedral/Church to visit in Puebla! The location, the building its self, the inside was amazing and huge! Loved my visit here, I\'ll be sure to return!

230647510.name: A spectacular 16th century monument
230647510.author: a TripAdvisor user
230647510.reviewBody: Interesting to see the blond and blue eyed angels in the Mexican environment - what kind of message would that have sent to the common public throughout the centuries?

227747488.name: Beautiful old church
227747488.author: a TripAdvisor user
227747488.reviewBody: I have visited the church several times and never get tired of it. It\'s a beautiful church inside which took 300 years to build. Very peaceful inside you just drown in its beauty and decoration. Surreal. Must see when in Puebla. And the zocalo is just in front with nice caf\u00e9s.

226868991.name: A moment in the past
226868991.author: a TripAdvisor user
226868991.reviewBody: I arrive there in the moment that a couple is marry. They prepare a classic rural event. Chariot horses, children holding the tail of the girlfriend and roses way. The general public can access the church in the wedding, so I went in. Monumental interior. Wood decorations. You can smell old. Inside you can forget the present and go in the past for seconds meanwhile you hear the music of the organ. Cathedral of Puebla was a really nice place.

226793581.name: Tallest towers in Mexico and wonderful art inside
226793581.author: a TripAdvisor user
226793581.reviewBody: This is a magnificent Cathedarl started just 40 years after Cortes led the conquest of Mexico in 1519.\nThere are many side chapels, alters, three grand organs and statues and painting everywhere.It i very impressive.

226476219.name: Amazing & beautiful
226476219.author: a TripAdvisor user
226476219.reviewBody: So sureal, just an amazing place to go, the ornate design inside was truly magical, you could feel the peace and blessings of cathedral...

223301419.name: Another Colonial Big Church worth to visit though
223301419.author: a TripAdvisor user
223301419.reviewBody: I guess I\'m very much ignorant in architecture and for me the cathedral in Puebla could be any other big church built in colonial times in any place in Latin America, but still all these buildings are quite amazing and if you are in Puebla, it\'s definitively worth to visit the cathedral

221859775.name: Interior is so much more serene than exterior
221859775.author: a TripAdvisor user
221859775.reviewBody: Use of natural light is extraordinary for a cathedral of this age.  One thing I found odd was that the candles lit by each altar are electric, not real flames.

220306165.name: Very nice cathedral as most of Mexican downtown\'s
220306165.author: a TripAdvisor user
220306165.reviewBody: I live in Mexico City and you get to see the biggest cathedral of the country and it\'s impressive, but once you know this one you are amazed as well. It\'s really beautiful and if you get to hear the legend of the main bell and how it got there, you will just love it more.\n\nTry the restaurants in front of the main square they are really delicious. Hard to park though.

219797905.name: Great Architecture
219797905.author: a TripAdvisor user
219797905.reviewBody: Love that cathedral, is magnificent, the acoustic is great.\nSurrounded by the main plaza, you can spend hours there.

214563589.name: Huge, elaborate interior
214563589.author: a TripAdvisor user
214563589.reviewBody: Right on the zocalo, the cathedral\'s interior is cavernous, filled with little side chapels. The organ is especially ornate.

214328476.name: Wow!
214328476.author: a TripAdvisor user
214328476.reviewBody: I was happy to finally see the huge cathedral after people told me it\'s larger than the one in Mexico City. It didn\'t dissapoint! The cathedral is beautiful, with many fine details on the gates surrounding it.

211233879.name: Beautiful chapel
211233879.author: a TripAdvisor user
211233879.reviewBody: It is a beautiful place with tons of history and near to the commerce district were you can find mexican and Poblana handicrafts selection

210382904.name: Beautiful architecture
210382904.author: a TripAdvisor user
210382904.reviewBody: The Cathedral of Puela is situated in the center of the city, the Zocalo, and it is pretty amazing. It\'s very big and beautiful inside, definetely worth visitingif you go to Puebla.

209400449.name: Beautiful, reminds me of Spain
209400449.author: a TripAdvisor user
209400449.reviewBody: This is a very beautiful Cathedral!  It reminds me a lot of the Cathedral of Santiago de Compestela.  Although the Cathedral is amazing, the Mass we stayed for was rather lax.  Definitely worth staying for Mass though.  They have bathrooms tucked away outside the Cathedral and it costs $3 pesos to use it.

208379300.name: Even a Brief Visit has Value
208379300.author: a TripAdvisor user
208379300.reviewBody: Even if you only have a few minutes to spare, it is worth taking a quick look inside the main door. The cool air inside was in stark contrast to the heat in the Zocalo outside. As soon as you enter your eyes will naturally look to the alter and then up to the roof. The thing that hit me first was size, decoration as good as it is coming second.

207759474.name: A Must
207759474.author: a TripAdvisor user
207759474.reviewBody: Gorgeous cathedral, gold leaf everywhere, well lit, amazing domes, magnificent paintings, a journey to the past.

206545633.name: Very nice Cathedral
206545633.author: a TripAdvisor user
206545633.reviewBody: It is right on the main town square/park and it is beautiful.  We were surprised to find this gem in such a small town.  Worth your time to walk through this wonderful chapel.

203669086.name: Gorgeous and huge cathedral
203669086.author: a TripAdvisor user
203669086.reviewBody: Gorgeous and in a convenient spot right in the middle of the centro, next to the Zocalo. Huge cathedral that is still in use today.

203353130.name: WOW!  BIG!
203353130.author: a TripAdvisor user
203353130.reviewBody: This cathedral is enormous, and I wish there would have been an English-speaking tour to learn about the history of this international treasure.

202505515.name: you must visit
202505515.author: a TripAdvisor user
202505515.reviewBody:
the cathedral is in the center of puebla

from outside and from inside is an excellent building with nice decoration

i like a lot  and i visit this cathedral not just once....

201593769.name: Im[pressive
201593769.author: a TripAdvisor user
201593769.reviewBody: There are many churches in Puebla but the Cathedral is a must to visit. It large and imposing and located next to the zocalo. Quite ornate inside. One of the most beautiful churches in Mexico.

201347389.name: A jewel
201347389.author: a TripAdvisor user
201347389.reviewBody: Believer or not there is so much art to appreciate here it is a real jewel!! It\'s the heart of the city along with the Zocalo which is right across the street. Many have said that this cathedral is prettier than the one in Mexico City and I will have to agree!

198590626.name: The Spirituality of Old Mexico
198590626.author: a TripAdvisor user
198590626.reviewBody: What a treat for all believers and especially catholics.  The mystery of the ancient Roman Catholic church is so apparent inside the walls of this beautiful cathedral.  Celebrate mass with the bishop.  The organ is a treat, as well.

198498463.name: Beautiful
198498463.author: a TripAdvisor user
198498463.reviewBody: I loved this cathedral so much to see.  It has a lot to offer, well worth visiting.  My family and I really enjoyed all the scenery and loved to learn all about it.

197547056.name: Impressive Cathedral
197547056.author: a TripAdvisor user
197547056.reviewBody: The Cathedral is really beautiful. It was more impressive than we thought it would be and enjoyed our visit there.

196237248.name: must see!!!
196237248.author: a TripAdvisor user
196237248.reviewBody: Super church, one of the best in Mexico, specialy by night... just around the zocalo... In Puebla you could found more than 60 churches...

195895596.name: Strong presence on Zocolo
195895596.author: a TripAdvisor user
195895596.reviewBody: Tallest bell towers in Mexico, but not particularly inspiring in y opinion.  The stone is grey cantera which makes it dark.  Interior is nice but not a revelation of construction styles.

195378837.name: Large imposing cathedral
195378837.author: a TripAdvisor user
195378837.reviewBody: The cathedral in Puebla dominates one side of the Zocola. It is very large and one of the key attractions to see in Puebla. The high altar is impressive and rather different from many other churches of this period. There are some interesting carvings and beautiful doors. For me, not worth a long visit unless you are better informed on the finer points of colonial churches.\n\nThe cathedral is closed to visitors at lunchtime.

195125403.name: Beautiful Cathedral
195125403.author: a TripAdvisor user
195125403.reviewBody: This is a masterpiece, reminded me of the Cathedral in Santiago de Compostela.  Very well preserved and worth a couple of visits to take it all in.

194794785.name: ABSOLUTELY STUNNING!!
194794785.author: a TripAdvisor user
194794785.reviewBody:
I had been told how amazing this cathedral was and I was even told that the architectural plans for this cathedral were actually the plans for the cathedral in Mexico city but that they were switched.  I didn't believe it because someone from Puebla had told me but NOW THAT I HAVE SEEN IT, I DO BELIEVE IT!!!  This is an amazing church!! absolutely GLORIOUS!!! And I will admit that it is far more GORGEOUS than the cathedral in Mexico City.

This is an absolute MUST see if you are near Puebla.  While you are there, you have to see the church of the holy rosary which is a MASTERPIECE!! it is only about 3 blocks away. 

enjoy!!

193600519.name: One of mexicos finest churches
193600519.author: a TripAdvisor user
193600519.reviewBody: Do not miss,  the main cathedral is beautiful.  Then the chapel with the gold is stunning.  \nThe beauty and the artistry are worth taking your time to see the details,

191957952.name: a must see
191957952.author: a TripAdvisor user
191957952.reviewBody: go inside to see the gold decor and beautiful statues its beautiful during the day and in the night, make sure you check their opening times

191941884.name: Amazing
191941884.author: a TripAdvisor user
191941884.reviewBody: The size, the interior, the paintings, the pipe organ, everything, just amazing. This is a must in Puebla, you will not regret it.\n

190985761.name: Worth the visit.
190985761.author: a TripAdvisor user
190985761.reviewBody: Another highly adorned church but worth it to get a good understanding of how Mexico was built from the Spanish conquerors.

190887802.name: Simply Grand
190887802.author: a TripAdvisor user
190887802.reviewBody: A must see on the Plaza in Puebla. Quite huge with interesting nooks and crannies. Visited on a Sunday so timed it to hear the organ and service.

190225533.name: Cathedral
190225533.author: a TripAdvisor user
190225533.reviewBody: This is the reason to come to puebla. This cathedral is the best in mexico, having visited more than i can count. This cathedral is on par with the best in europe, really the only ones i recall offhand that are clearly better were the vatican and westminster abbey, def prefer to notre dame or il duomo. Way better than the pyramid in nearby cholula.

189922219.name: Most impressive of the three Cathedrals we saw in Mexico
189922219.author: a TripAdvisor user
189922219.reviewBody: We toured the cathedrals in Puebla, Mexico City, and Guadalajara.  Puebla\'s is the most impressive by far.

187221082.name: Cathederal or Wedding Cake?
187221082.author: a TripAdvisor user
187221082.reviewBody: You will not believe the beauty of the inside and out of this Cathedral. Stunning. Bring your zoom and wide angle. It sites white and pure next to the Zocalo. There are hundreds of churches here worth seeing, and this needs to be your first.

185230030.name: Great Big Basilica de Puebla
185230030.author: a TripAdvisor user
185230030.reviewBody: It\'s big, it\'s old and it\'s beautiful. Towering above all the other cathedrals in downtown Puebla, if you can see only one, than this historic site is the one worth visiting. The area near the cathedral is also a great place for shopping and eating and resting your legs in the nearby park. If you go to Puebla, this cathedral is one of the must see sites.

182778621.name: Impressive
182778621.author: a TripAdvisor user
182778621.reviewBody: This is a massive Baroque cathedral and the architecture and interior art are great. It\'s a wonderful place of worship. It\'s just across from the zocalo with a gated entrance.

182400269.name: worth a visit
182400269.author: a TripAdvisor user
182400269.reviewBody: Not as \'wow\' as the Rosary Chapel nearby but this has some outstanding features both inside and out. Well worth a few moments of your time if you are in Puebla.

180460615.name: Large but somber
180460615.author: a TripAdvisor user
180460615.reviewBody: The Cathedral of Puebla is maybe impressive by its somber appearance and size, but as mexican baroque Cathedrals go it is a esthetically a rather poor specimen.

179235549.name: Great day trip
179235549.author: a TripAdvisor user
179235549.reviewBody: Took a day tour to Puebla from Mexico City. Beautiful even though it was raining. It\'s a nice getaway from the craziness in Mexico Ciry

177728159.name: Great Cathedral
177728159.author: a TripAdvisor user
177728159.reviewBody: This is the nicest cathedrale I\'ve visited. It\'s also very diffrent than the others. At the inside there is a large organ.

174198481.name: Catedral Puebla
174198481.author: a TripAdvisor user
174198481.reviewBody: It is a huge baroque cathedral located in the main square of Puebla\'s. Its is a beautifull Catedral and its really nice to see in the day and in the night with the lights. Puebla is the light town and you will see many historical building with lights.

171598477.name: The tallest Cathedral in  Latin America
171598477.author: a TripAdvisor user
171598477.reviewBody: I went to the Cathedral on a Saturday afternoon and they had a free concert... I could not believe the way the sound fill the Cathedral. It was one of the best musical experiences I have had.

170461843.name: Cannot be missed
170461843.author: a TripAdvisor user
170461843.reviewBody: This cathedral is one of the most beautiful in Mexico. It is one of the first ones that I saw in Mexico and, after traveling extensively in MX and Latin America, it continues to fascinate me.

169537433.name: Could be most extraordinary in Mexico
169537433.author: a TripAdvisor user
169537433.reviewBody: The metropolitan Cathedral in Mexico City is amazing but I would consider the Basilica in same category. Spectacular and another part of the beautiful heritage of Puebla.

168610879.name: Pleasantly Surprised by Puebla
168610879.author: a TripAdvisor user
168610879.reviewBody: I didn\'t realize all that Puebla is to offer, including the Cathedral of Puebla. Another example of beautiful colonial architecture. Notice the impressive doors and all the details.

166593358.name: Wonderful - a must see
166593358.author: a TripAdvisor user
166593358.reviewBody: Dis not expect this size and kind of artwork in Puebla.  It was interesting also to walk around the basilica as it is located right at the Puebla downtown area.  Try a Chicken Mole at one of the local Mexican Restaurants.

164109516.name: Cathedral of Puebla
164109516.author: a TripAdvisor user
164109516.reviewBody: Being a basilica , it is big and we found the decor as usual , nothing spectacular as compared to the small church of Tonantzintlan.

160090598.name: The most beautiful church in Mexico!
160090598.author: a TripAdvisor user
160090598.reviewBody: If you visit the city of Puebla, you cannot miss going to the Cathedral. If you can get a good guide, it is worth understanding the symbolism of this amazing structure. Puebla known as the City of Angels has many angels in its cathedral. It is beautiful display of Christian beliefs with more uplifting images and paintings than other churches in Mexico.

157340874.name: Really worth a visit
157340874.author: a TripAdvisor user
157340874.reviewBody: The building is really worth visiting make sure you look up into the roof as there is so much to look at.

157297762.name: Palm Sunday
157297762.author: a TripAdvisor user
157297762.reviewBody: The Cathedral itself is an architectural gem. We attended a  Palm Sunday service officiated by the bishop. There was standing room only. We went early to get a good seat. He pageantry was something very special.

156789605.name: It is monumental
156789605.author: a TripAdvisor user
156789605.reviewBody: From the minute you walk in to the Cathedral you can see that you are in a special place. I was lucky enough to go during a special celebration and hear the organ play... it was great.

154977441.name: Good place for a visit
154977441.author: a TripAdvisor user
154977441.reviewBody: It is a great cathedral, very well preserved, i absolutely love the details on the wood doors. You can walk around and take pictures, without any problem. Love the details on the ceilings. A must in Puebla.

154553876.name: Overwhelming beauty
154553876.author: a TripAdvisor user
154553876.reviewBody: The Cathedral de Puebla is a must see during your trip to Puebla. It is centrally located and a part of the Zocalo, so easy to access. The cathedral is second in size to the Cathedral Metropolitan in Mexico City. And it\'s twin towers are the tallest in Mexico! The interior of this cathedral is so stunningly ornate, shiny, and detailed that the eye almost doesn\'t know where to look next! But keep looking and try not to miss a thing!

153813421.name: Beautiful to See
153813421.author: a TripAdvisor user
153813421.reviewBody: This cathedral is still in use today. When services are not going on you can take non-flask photos of the art work that is everywhere, walls, ceiling, etc. The gold leaf is almost blinding so be prepared.

153521291.name: Beautiful
153521291.author: a TripAdvisor user
153521291.reviewBody: Beautiful cathedral which was completed in the 17th Century. Tourists are welcome when there are not religious services going on, and photography is permitted without flash. There are gorgeous chapels all around the outer edge, and the pipe organ is impressive.

152585379.name: Very nice...
152585379.author: a TripAdvisor user
152585379.reviewBody: ... as expected. Full of gold. It\'s a nice church but it depends on how much of a church goer you are.

152532304.name: Pretty amazing!
152532304.author: a TripAdvisor user
152532304.reviewBody: The Cathedral of Puebla is an amazing structure especially the interior which is a mixture of baroque and neo-classic architecture.  Be sure to see this when you visit Puebla.  You won\'t be disppoainted.

152139551.name: Opulence
152139551.author: a TripAdvisor user
152139551.reviewBody: The Zocalo in Puebla is a remarkable place and the Catedral is the centerpiece.  The place is more a work of art than a building.  From floor to ceiling, history and master craftsmanship combine to make a stunningly beautiful place.

151273397.name: Interesting
151273397.author: a TripAdvisor user
151273397.reviewBody: This cathedral is a must visit in Puebla. It dominates the zocalo and is currently undergoing reprinting - a mammoth effort.

150616845.name: Muy monumental!
150616845.author: a TripAdvisor user
150616845.reviewBody: This enormous cathedral was our introduction to the amazing number of churches in Mexico, but particularly in Puebla, where there seems to be at least one impressive specimen per block. Even if you are not religious, the amazing attention to detail and the almost crazy amount of ornamentation is worth experiencing.

148094933.name: Just a wonderful example of Colonial Architecture
148094933.author: a TripAdvisor user
148094933.reviewBody:
The second largest cathedral after the one in Mexico City, the Cathedral in Puebla is a wonderful place to visit. 

Like in most colonial towns in Mexico, Puebla’s cathedral is right next to the main square and walking distance to great restaurants and museums. The Cathedral is a nice example of Roman architecture with strong massive structural elements and small windows which make for a very dramatic interior. It has two towers (which – at 70 meters - used to be the tallest in the continent)  which frame a beautiful façade in renaissance style and inside you will find 14 chapels along with a beautiful altar and pipe organ that is richly decorated.

The Cathedral is open to the public free of charge, only flash photography is forbidden.

148041115.name: Joya arquitect\u00f3nica
148041115.author: a TripAdvisor user
148041115.reviewBody: The catedral in downtown Puebla is one of the most important attractions in a town that is full of attractions and churhces. The bas\u00edlica is enormous, with very high towers, a grand organ, and several bays.  The importance of the catholic faith in Mexico cannot be underestimated, as this and many other churches in Puelba, nearby Cholula, and elsewhere testify. \nThis church, I think, is one of the finest buildings of colonial Mexico.

147514885.name: Treasure of colonial art
147514885.author: a TripAdvisor user
147514885.reviewBody: Puebla\'s cathedral, dedicated to the Immaculate Conception, is a treasure of colonial art. Designed by Francisco Becerra, the first stage of construction took place between 1575 and 1618. The initial plans included four corner towers like the cathedral of Valladolid, Spain. The bases of the towers were built and stand as testimony to the lofty plans. The second phase of construction was under the direction of Bishop Juan de Palafox y Mendoza who consecrated the cathedral on April 18, 1649. The main facade, in the sober mannerist style, is made of dark grey quarrystone and was completed in 1664.

147371367.name: Like european major Cathedrals
147371367.author: a TripAdvisor user
147371367.reviewBody: A very impressive masterpiece, it remembers the European Cathedral, if possible try to be at a mass to listen the monumental organ.  Stroll slowly looking around all the rich details, although is not so high, all the same it inspire respect.

147331033.name: One of the world\'s Great churches
147331033.author: a TripAdvisor user
147331033.reviewBody: This is a magnificent church.  So often cathedrals are dark and disjointed.  Magnificent pieces may be hiding around a corner, but as a whole it does not work.  This church has fantastic art and delightful harmony.  I love it!

146558513.name: THE NICEST CATHEDRAL IN MEXICO
146558513.author: a TripAdvisor user
146558513.reviewBody: Even though slightly smaller than Mexico Cathedral, this one is probably nicer. Magnificently kept, extraordinarily luminous, this typically Spanish-American religious monument must be visited.

145528523.name: Surrounded by Angels
145528523.author: a TripAdvisor user
145528523.reviewBody: Huge, imposing, for me the most interesting features are the angels sitting atop the fence ringing the cathedral.  At the magic hour between daylight and dusk, the sun illuminates these angels and they look like they can fly. Wonderful photo ops for all.

145104811.name: On a Par with European Cathedrals
145104811.author: a TripAdvisor user
145104811.reviewBody: Often Mexican churches are more roughly hewn and decorated, but this cathedral is quite beautiful, and the organ is astounding.

143549127.name: Absolutely Beautiful
143549127.author: a TripAdvisor user
143549127.reviewBody: This Cathedral is absolutely gorgeous. If you are going to Puebla, this is a must see. It is enormous and the ceilings are stunning. It is free to enter and is located in the downtown historic district. Even people who are not religious will appreciate the architecture and the art inside.

142910558.name: Angels help to build the cathedral!
142910558.author: a TripAdvisor user
142910558.reviewBody: The cathedral is huge and full of history. You feel transported to the past. They told me that there is a legend that the angels took the bells and put them in the towers. That is why Puebla is called Puebla of the Angels. Neat History!

141616506.name: Visit
141616506.author: a TripAdvisor user
141616506.reviewBody: I felt so bless entering this holly place, the main altar is beautiful, some of the images look very real.

141268548.name: One of the most beautiful cathedrals in Mexico
141268548.author: a TripAdvisor user
141268548.reviewBody: This is one impressive cathedral. In a city that boasts 365 churches, this one certainly sticks out. One of the nicest, if not the nicest I have seen in Mexico

141097587.name: Great for sightseeing!
141097587.author: a TripAdvisor user
141097587.reviewBody: One of the landmarks to visit. Only second from the one in Mexico City. If you have the chance, listen to the guides that offer the "inside stories" of the site.

138858285.name: Beautiful, do see
138858285.author: a TripAdvisor user
138858285.reviewBody: The great ceiling, the stained glass work, the  sculpture of Christ which evoked intense emotions, perhaps because it was of a supine Christ and not the usual ones of him on/with a cross

138628499.name: Ven a Puebla, seguro te quedas!
138628499.author: a TripAdvisor user
138628499.reviewBody: It\'s not because I\'m from Puebla, but because I have visited so many cathedrals in Mexico and in Spain, this one it\'s very impressive! Just the history alone, I\'m not a believer but I actually like the history is another mystery like how they build the pyramids in Egypt, well, there are no documents in how they got the big bell on top of the tallest tower! Then walking inside you can see different cultures French, Spanish, Mexican, I just know that once you see this cathedral you will see how beautiful is!! Also remember that you are in one of the best states in Mexico!

138612501.name: Ok if you\'re into that sort of thing.
138612501.author: a TripAdvisor user
138612501.reviewBody: It\'s a big church. The alter is very impressive, unlike any I\'ve seen. The rest of the cathedral is large and pretty. We stayed about 15 minutes.

137313869.name: Big and impressive
137313869.author: a TripAdvisor user
137313869.reviewBody: The legend of that angels lifted the bells to their places in the towers. The impressive size of the church.

135434455.name: amazing place
135434455.author: a TripAdvisor user
135434455.reviewBody: i liked the arquitectural design, the paintings, etc, I don\'t like that there\'s no restrooms available and that is a minus when you\'re traveling with little ones!!

132521437.name: Beautiful cathedral, lovely setting
132521437.author: a TripAdvisor user
132521437.reviewBody: This is one of the best cathedrals that I have had the pleasure to visit.  The exterior is typically baroque, and well-maintained, but the real surprise was to enter a well-proportioned and beautiful interior.  The cathedral does not have the usual central aisle, the architects having preferred to use the centre for the organs.  This helps to give the interior a more balanced spacing.  Beautiful decorating, as could be expected in the finest cathedrals around the world, which is well -maintained, made this a very pleasing visit.

132334408.name: Worth it
132334408.author: a TripAdvisor user
132334408.reviewBody: you can go for free, and it is beautiful, the art in the catedral is very historic, you can take photos

131984157.name: gorgeous!
131984157.author: a TripAdvisor user
131984157.reviewBody: beautiful so much history, very soothing place, loved it!

131381108.name: Perfect place for our wedding
131381108.author: a TripAdvisor user
131381108.reviewBody: My wife and I were married here and I could think of a better place to have a wedding.  It\'s a beautiful cathedral that rivals many churches in Europe.  I love the ornate architecture and looking at all of the chapels.  It also happens to be next to the beautiful zocalo and many good restaurants and shops.

130557404.name: Closed preparing for Cinco de Mayo
130557404.author: a TripAdvisor user
130557404.reviewBody: Unfortunately closed like many attractions in Puebla in early May

130076253.name: Fantastic historic site ... a must see destination
130076253.author: a TripAdvisor user
130076253.reviewBody: Most likely this is the best known church in Puebla, of which there are many! Any time of the year it is a beautiful site to visit, the adjacent park area provides a place to rest and take in the sites. A worthwhile destination with many excellent shops & restaurants within walking distance in every direction

129432490.name: La Raquel
129432490.author: a TripAdvisor user
129432490.reviewBody: Raquel, as Juan de Palafox y Mendoza called it, was magnificent!  far better than the cathredal of Mexico City

128113956.name: Impressive as a monument and a faith temple.
128113956.author: a TripAdvisor user
128113956.reviewBody:
The building has many legends surrounding it regarding its construction, make sure to find some guide that can explain you all the details, you will really enjoy it. The exterior is great and a true landmark, but the interior is really stunning and beautiful. The choir and wind pipes from the huge organ are great and the extensive art throughout the basilica is gorgeous.

Not to miss while in Puebla.

127425491.name: A Must to see in Puebla
127425491.author: a TripAdvisor user
127425491.reviewBody: If you don\'t see anything in Puebla see at least the Cathedral.

127296336.name: Lovely
127296336.author: a TripAdvisor user
127296336.reviewBody: Beautiful interior. 7 chapels on each side of the nave. Highly decorated.

127178730.name: So beatiful building
127178730.author: a TripAdvisor user
127178730.reviewBody: You can breath art ant Puebla\'s streets, the Cathedral is small but beautiful, with  all the colonial style paintings.

126991570.name: cathedral very nice in the inside
126991570.author: a TripAdvisor user
126991570.reviewBody: This visit was great because the they were playing the pipe organ the sound inside of the cathedral was majestic. also the inside it is very nice.

126981570.name: Great tourist attraction
126981570.author: a TripAdvisor user
126981570.reviewBody: I loved the historical value. I love history and art, so this allowed me to indulge both of my loves.  I would suggest that any tourist should visit this wonderful place!  If you are a history buff, you would absolutely love this!

126798182.name: Must see if in Puebla
126798182.author: a TripAdvisor user
126798182.reviewBody: \nIf you are planning a visit to Puebla there are things that can\u00b4t be out of your list This Cathedral is one of the biggest and oldest in Latin America don\u00b4t miss it

126759308.name: Nice little basilica with the golden touch!
126759308.author: a TripAdvisor user
126759308.reviewBody: We didn\'t stay long. They have daily closing hours. Check before you go!\n

126464380.name: A destination for the faithful
126464380.author: a TripAdvisor user
126464380.reviewBody: The attention to detail and workmanship are amazing, considering the age of this beautiful iglesia.

126230651.name: A Must See!
126230651.author: a TripAdvisor user
126230651.reviewBody: The catedral of Puebla is considered the largest in Mexico and resembles the catedral in Valladolid, Spain with the exception that the one in Spain has 4 towers and this one has only 2. Another interesting fact is that the catedral is pictured on the back of the 500 pesos bill. Enjoy!

126067510.name: Stunning
126067510.author: a TripAdvisor user
126067510.reviewBody: This magnificent building has all of the amazing features of many of Mexico\'s top Colonial churches but the paintings in this church are in a class of their own. The scale of the church nearly dwarfs some of these huge paintings.  When you stop and really look at any single one and imagine it in a large museum, the skill and accomplishment  is mind boggling. There are lots of them and they are knockouts.  The massive wooden panels and doors at the back and all of the carved ornamentation pay tribute to the amazing skill of the local woodworkers . (The furniture sold a few blocks away reflect the same designs and styles as the massive carved structures in this church.) The basilica is often filled with groups from other parts of Mexico but it is  so huge it never seems really full. It\'s especially beautiful during Semana Santa, the week preceeding Easter, with many palm artists sitting in the front courtyard making all sorts and sizes of unique palm decorations for Easter week ceremonies. In Puebla, this is the biggest fiesta period short of Cinco de Mayo.

124932533.name: Beautiful and HUGE!
124932533.author: a TripAdvisor user
124932533.reviewBody: This has to be the largest cathedral I have ever been in.  Incredible detailing and truly stunning.  Wish I would have been able to attend an actual mass there.  The organ was huge and very special.

124834828.name: Impressive
124834828.author: a TripAdvisor user
124834828.reviewBody: The cathedral is the second biggest in Latin America and very impressive.  It is not the most beautiful church I have seen, but it is worth seeing.

124299759.name: Impresive Cathedral
124299759.author: a TripAdvisor user
124299759.reviewBody: What a Cathedral, big surprise. I did not think it was that big, similar to the one in Mexico City. Recommended, the arquitecture is great.

124268080.name: Breathtaking
124268080.author: a TripAdvisor user
124268080.reviewBody: The new exterior lighting is just amazing. Take your time to appreciate all the interior details and the sacred art.

124256966.name: Jaw dropping
124256966.author: a TripAdvisor user
124256966.reviewBody: One chapel in the church is stunning to look at.  It is all in gold plating.  Well worth the trip to Puebla.  Also it is a nice town with plenty of motels near the plaza.

123836413.name: Beautiful Cathedral!!!
123836413.author: a TripAdvisor user
123836413.reviewBody: It\u00b4s huge and beautiful. The Cathedral is well maintained and very clean from the moment on go in through the gates.\nThe organ looks amazing.\nWe got there during a mass and it was full. Try to avoid going on those times.

123782520.name: grandiose history
123782520.author: a TripAdvisor user
123782520.reviewBody: This is the cathedral of the city that was planned by angels - history and faith made tangible. My favorite things: the weathered giant doors and thresholds, the floor tiles worn by feet long gone. What I would have liked: brochures and guides in English and other languages to tell me what I was seeing. But that is part of what makes Puebla special: it is not run for the foreign tourists, it is always about discovering something you did not expect.

122876962.name: Amazing
122876962.author: a TripAdvisor user
122876962.reviewBody: Architecture is breathtaking. Many many chapels here.

122581881.name: Gorgeous cathedral
122581881.author: a TripAdvisor user
122581881.reviewBody: Lots of gold accents, astonishing organ.  The impressive architecture and interior chapels rival cathedrals anywhere.

122495708.name: Study before you visit.
122495708.author: a TripAdvisor user
122495708.reviewBody: This Cathedral is a history museum in itself.  Study and learn about this incredible building before you go if possible... there is so much and over so many centuries for you to discover.

122467679.name: Enormous
122467679.author: a TripAdvisor user
122467679.reviewBody: I haven\'t checked the statistics, but this has to be one of the very largest Cathedrals in Mexico.  Not the flair (or gaudiness, take your pick) of the Mexican Baroque style, but large and grand.

119776856.name: Do visit here
119776856.author: a TripAdvisor user
119776856.reviewBody: Just get inside and wander a bit....it is something to see, you very likely will not regret it (if you do, then you, my friend, are a turd).  This comment comes from an athiest.

119597467.name: Beatiful Old Catedral
119597467.author: a TripAdvisor user
119597467.reviewBody: A handsome and richly ornamented interior.  Center altar features Mary surrounded by marble apostles.  don\' miss the arch angel holding the fish to the right of the main altar.

22447769.name: You can\'t miss this church- it\'s huge
22447769.author: a TripAdvisor user
22447769.reviewBody: If you are in the middle of Puebla you can\'t miss this church. It is gigantic and fills up an entire block just to the south of one of the nicest zocalos in all of Mexico. It\'s tall, wide, and long. Look on the 500 peso note and there it is too. Plus there is lots to see inside with some descriptions in both Spanish and English. While we were in Puebla a Dia de los Muertos (Day of the Dead) video show was presented on the outside wall of the cathedral to those hundreds who gathered in the Zocalo. That was amazing.

671731347.name: Great view of the city
671731347.author: a TripAdvisor user
671731347.reviewBody: Really cheap 30mxn one way. We were at the fair and took it one way. And took and uber from there to our next stop.

address.streetAddress: Calzada Unidad Civica 5 de Mayo (Ejercito de Oriente) s/n Paseo del Teleferico

651577544.name: Short trip but worthwhile and cheap
651577544.author: a TripAdvisor user
651577544.reviewBody: You can walk to the telferico from the historic centre in about 30 mins. Its only been operating since 2016 so pretty new and modern. Its only a very short ride but provides for excellent views of landmarks and buildings you wouldn\'t otherwise see as well as the volcanoes on the outskirts. You also get some commentary from one of the young staff members on the ride so it\'s a bargain at 500 pesos for the return trip. It runs every 15 mins.\n\nWhilst you\'re in the area take time to stroll around the park and look at the 5 May celebration floats that are now on view there. Really interesting and kids will enjoy it too.

address.streetAddress: Calzada Unidad Civica 5 de Mayo (Ejercito de Oriente) s/n Paseo del Teleferico

643577472.name: Short interesting birds eye view of the city
643577472.author: a TripAdvisor user
643577472.reviewBody: Inexpensive, short (10 minutes or so) birds eye view of the city.  Really a panoramic view.  We took it round trip and had a blast snapping lots of photos.

address.streetAddress: Calzada Unidad Civica 5 de Mayo (Ejercito de Oriente) s/n Paseo del Teleferico

640420451.name: Panomramic City view
640420451.author: a TripAdvisor user
640420451.reviewBody: Excellent panoramic view of Puebla city; short distance, but well worth it. Round trip is best. Takes you near fortes for the Cinco de Mayo battle.

address.streetAddress: Calzada Unidad Civica 5 de Mayo (Ejercito de Oriente) s/n Paseo del Teleferico

634287475.name: Great view of city at reasonable price
634287475.author: a TripAdvisor user
634287475.reviewBody: Not a long wait, not expensive, standing room only but only a 10 minute ride one way. Would recommend round trip because it\u2019s not so easy to get back on foot, although not that far. Puebla is huge evidenced by the view. The surrounding park has museums, walkways and food stands.

address.streetAddress: Calzada Unidad Civica 5 de Mayo (Ejercito de Oriente) s/n Paseo del Teleferico

632039884.name: A nice quick visit!
632039884.author: a TripAdvisor user
632039884.reviewBody: It is worth the visit, the view is nice and in one of the points there are museums you can visit as well. The price is fair.

address.streetAddress: Calzada Unidad Civica 5 de Mayo (Ejercito de Oriente) s/n Paseo del Teleferico

603314052.name: Great view of the city
603314052.author: a TripAdvisor user
603314052.reviewBody: Even though this is a short ride it gives you the opportunity to view the city completely.  Defintely worth it!

address.streetAddress: Calzada Unidad Civica 5 de Mayo (Ejercito de Oriente) s/n Paseo del Teleferico

600872576.name: Great experience.
600872576.author: a TripAdvisor user
600872576.reviewBody: You have to pay $50 Mexican pesos for a round trip. The view is great and it takes like 3 minutes to arrive a the other building. If it is raining they don\'t offer rides.

address.streetAddress: Calzada Unidad Civica 5 de Mayo (Ejercito de Oriente) s/n Paseo del Teleferico

588563581.name: Nice landscape
588563581.author: a TripAdvisor user
588563581.reviewBody: This attraction is to take pictures of the city of Puebla from some 40 m high. I reccomend to use this touristic transportation once or twice, only if you are interesting in phtograpy and if you are at the same time interested in visiting other nearby attractions.

address.streetAddress: Calzada Unidad Civica 5 de Mayo (Ejercito de Oriente) s/n Paseo del Teleferico

555717516.name: A must
555717516.author: a TripAdvisor user
555717516.reviewBody: An amazing way to enjoy Puebla, definetly a tourist atraction that is worth the visit. The staff is amazing the organization is first world and everything is super clean. An amazing way to get to the fuertes.

address.streetAddress: Calzada Unidad Civica 5 de Mayo (Ejercito de Oriente) s/n Paseo del Teleferico

553806568.name: Disappointing view
553806568.author: a TripAdvisor user
553806568.reviewBody: I love the idea, however setting is not high enough to provide a great view. Very short ride and a bit out of the way! Taxi needed from the city center.

address.streetAddress: Calzada Unidad Civica 5 de Mayo (Ejercito de Oriente) s/n Paseo del Teleferico

551143012.name: Loooooong wait, short ride.
551143012.author: a TripAdvisor user
551143012.reviewBody:
We waited over one hour for the ride, and it wasn’t a particularly busy day.  
There was only one person coordinating access, which is unnecessarily complicated.   Outside, there are two lines, with no one to tell you which line is what. When they let you in they just move you in groups to another waiting area, then to a another waiting (seating) area until you get to the elevator.   Once you take the elevator, you wait upstairs again.   Takes about 15 min to move from area to area, plus the time you spend outside in line.  
The ride is short, tower to tower, the explanations are in Spanish only, and the view depends on the time of day and weather conditions.    I suspect that early morning rides or sunset rides are better.  My view that day was mediocre. 
When you exit your first ride and if you have a round trip ticket (don’t!) you have to wait for the elevator, go downstairs outside to the back of the line, and wait another hour or more to return.  RIDICULOUS! 
We purchased the round trip ticket from the Turibus (don’t) and did not get preferential priority in line as promised. 
We did not use the return trip, ordered uber to get back to town and continued enjoying our day. 
Tip: if you must do this thing, buy a one way ticket and then call uber from the second tower.  I suppose this is a good option for people who have plenty of time and don’t mind standing up waiting for hours.  
However, my suggestion is to skip this ride and visit beautiful churches and museums instead.

address.streetAddress: Calzada Unidad Civica 5 de Mayo (Ejercito de Oriente) s/n Paseo del Teleferico

539846614.name: Great place to get a bird\'s-eye view of Puebla.
539846614.author: a TripAdvisor user
539846614.reviewBody: The Teleferico is a cable or tram car that travels between two very high towers in the Zona Hist\u00f3rica de Los Fuertes. You can get terrific views of the city, the volcanoes and of course the park below. It is 850 meters between the towers, so it isn\u00b4t a long ride, and it is straight across. It doesn\'t go up an incline.

address.streetAddress: Calzada Unidad Civica 5 de Mayo (Ejercito de Oriente) s/n Paseo del Teleferico

506283557.name: Only for Spanish speaking tourists
506283557.author: a TripAdvisor user
506283557.reviewBody: Did a return trip with a friend, I don\'t speak fluent Spanish so was not able to understand the guides explanation of the landmarks in Puebla.  I requested english to be spoken so then the guide was out of breath explaining in both languages.  I made a complaint at the reception, as I explained you took my money yet provide not service or support for a tourist.

address.streetAddress: Calzada Unidad Civica 5 de Mayo (Ejercito de Oriente) s/n Paseo del Teleferico

501343476.name: Nice, but short
501343476.author: a TripAdvisor user
501343476.reviewBody: I\'ve ridden the telef\u00e9rico twice now. Once at night and once during the day. I prefer the view during the day, when you can actually see what things are. It is a good way to get a view of the city, but it is short, and not particularly exciting or informative.

address.streetAddress: Calzada Unidad Civica 5 de Mayo (Ejercito de Oriente) s/n Paseo del Teleferico

478650023.name: It was alright
478650023.author: a TripAdvisor user
478650023.reviewBody: Was cool to see the size of Puebla from that height and it was a nice view but the trip was short and not particularly exciting.

address.streetAddress: Calzada Unidad Civica 5 de Mayo (Ejercito de Oriente) s/n Paseo del Teleferico

460105077.name: Teleferico de Puebla
460105077.author: a TripAdvisor user
460105077.reviewBody: The teleferico is short and sweet . The view is amazing! \nWe enjoyed the ride back and forth. You can get some great photos. The park is enjoyable and interactive.

address.streetAddress: Calzada Unidad Civica 5 de Mayo (Ejercito de Oriente) s/n Paseo del Teleferico

457987455.name: Good ride, bad logistics
457987455.author: a TripAdvisor user
457987455.reviewBody: This is a diferent way to see the city of Puebla, nice ride!\nIt would help to improve the logistics to get in line mostly on the way back when you purchase the round ticket

address.streetAddress: Calzada Unidad Civica 5 de Mayo (Ejercito de Oriente) s/n Paseo del Teleferico

447605370.name: Sunset cable car
447605370.author: a TripAdvisor user
447605370.reviewBody:
Enjoyed the cable car on our first night in Puebla.  It is a must see!  Costs only $50 pesos round trip.

We entered at the park and rode to the side near the evolution museum.  Luckily, by the time we got on the car, the sun was setting.  We got a gorgeous view of the city.  

The line can be a bit long but for a sunset trip, it was worth the wait!

address.streetAddress: Calzada Unidad Civica 5 de Mayo (Ejercito de Oriente) s/n Paseo del Teleferico

443351908.name: Nice place
443351908.author: a TripAdvisor user
443351908.reviewBody: This new Teleferico de Puebla is greatplace to visit, you can enjoy the view on the city. It cost only 30 mx single way. The way takes about 7 min.

address.streetAddress: Calzada Unidad Civica 5 de Mayo (Ejercito de Oriente) s/n Paseo del Teleferico

420189873.name: Nice but average experience
420189873.author: a TripAdvisor user
420189873.reviewBody: The experience was nice but there are so many things to visit in Puebla that this teleferico would be last of my list for my next visit.

address.streetAddress: Calzada Unidad Civica 5 de Mayo (Ejercito de Oriente) s/n Paseo del Teleferico

674577712.name: TRADITIONAL CANDIES PLACE
674577712.author: a TripAdvisor user
674577712.reviewBody: This is a great street, not only because of the builds that are full of history and colors also for its locals or stores that sell many traditional candies of this city, people are really friendly and open mind too.

664878856.name: Try Some Mexican Candy
664878856.author: a TripAdvisor user
664878856.reviewBody: If you\'re curious about the local candy (Puebla has some styles different from other parts of Mexico), then it\'s worth a visit. Most of the shops will offer you samples to try, and the more "Mom & Pop" type shops are very low pressure. I\'d recommend visiting the small shops where they make their own candy, rather than going to some of the bigger shops that just resell the candy from various vendors. You will probably have a more enjoyable experience that way. The candy is quite sweet, I wasn\'t a huge fan of it and didn\'t buy any. However, there were a few varieties of cookies that some of the shops were selling that were very good.

662594958.name: What a lovely street, a must place to visit
662594958.author: a TripAdvisor user
662594958.reviewBody: Opportunity to see an taste the delicious sweets that city makes. Perfect stroll down the street with wonderful folks offering their goods. Loved the amaranth candy .Yummy!

658902786.name: If this is on your way strolling around...
658902786.author: a TripAdvisor user
658902786.reviewBody: ... candy street but not a must visit. Peep if and you will probably as Puebla is small enough. Walk around, walk around... that\'s what you do in Puebla.

649972798.name: Beware - Check the Map
649972798.author: a TripAdvisor user
649972798.reviewBody: We followed the directions on The TripAdvisor map.\nThese were completely wrong and nowhere near.\nThe street is  Av 6 Oriente but between Calle 4 Nte and Calle 2 Nte

649531085.name: A MUST VISIT
649531085.author: a TripAdvisor user
649531085.reviewBody: This is a famous street, a visitor in Puebla cannot leave without knowing about it and buying some sweets to take away.  There are approximately 250 meters of length in this street, which is full on both sides with typical sweets stores of Puebla.  I estimate that there are 90 different stores, most have their own specialties and you can find everything, starting with milk sweets, crystallized fruits, nougat, pistachio, tamarind and chamoy, you also find marzipan, coconut sweets, etc.  This is paradise for sweets lovers.  In each store they try to sell you the specialty of the house.  My favorites: The crystallized oranges.  Super recommended!

648834205.name: Interesting to walk through once
648834205.author: a TripAdvisor user
648834205.reviewBody: It\'s an OK street to walk through once, so see a selection of typical Poblano sweets, which are moslty candied fruits and derivatives thereof.  This kind of sweets wasn\'t really our thing, and while I was hoping to find some artisan mexican chocolates in those shops too, I din\'t see any.  On the positive side, most vendors are very friendly, willing to explain what they sell, and to offer tasting samples.

647149143.name: Candy lined street!
647149143.author: a TripAdvisor user
647149143.reviewBody: Every other shop here has a variety of candies and sweets for every tastebud. Explore the shops, shop for Talavera and stroll along the street to see vendors of all kinds.

643578542.name: All manner of Mexican candy
643578542.author: a TripAdvisor user
643578542.reviewBody: Truly extraordinary Street with shop after shop of mostly Mexican candy.  We\'ve lived almost 20 years in Latin America in five countries and had never seen many of these specialized candies.  Many were also familiar.  Limit the children though!

637535219.name: Diabetics and dieyers  beware!
637535219.author: a TripAdvisor user
637535219.reviewBody: Shop after shop after shop displaying  traditional and enticing candies and cookies of all kinds. Some places are fairly utilitarian, but a few have displays so enticing they almost reach out and pull you into the attractive shops. Several stores are historic, and a good place to buy classic rompope and other local liquers. My advice: tour both sides of the street before actually buying anything, as it just gets better and better. The sweets-loaded  bowls and baskets make attractive gifts and can take the edge off a dark and  cold winter\'s night.

632756134.name: Not far from the main square
632756134.author: a TripAdvisor user
632756134.reviewBody: We stopped at "DulceriaFaty"(loved the name) to buy the traditional sweet potato candies. They also have a nice selection of Talavera pottery especially small, packable pieces.

629105585.name: Nothing too special
629105585.author: a TripAdvisor user
629105585.reviewBody: On this street, you can see many sweet stores. All the stores have almost the same and we tried some sweets and for me, they were a bit overpriced.

613956705.name: Sweets for everyone
613956705.author: a TripAdvisor user
613956705.reviewBody: This area is the well known for buying sweet things. There are also other shops with sweets in other areas but here you can really find lots of sweets.

603312448.name: Sweets for all tastes
603312448.author: a TripAdvisor user
603312448.reviewBody: lots of local shops selling multiple type of local candies, pastries and sweets.  If you have a sweet tooth this is the place for you.  Stores will let you try products before you buy

591698340.name: I love Mexican carmel
591698340.author: a TripAdvisor user
591698340.reviewBody: It was fun to walk down el Callejon de Los Dulces and pop into the shops. My favorites are anything carmel and guayaba. But ask the store clerks for reccommendations. You will have fun!

581302678.name: Always a hit!
581302678.author: a TripAdvisor user
581302678.reviewBody: A kids dream come true, street filled with candy shops (& Talavera for the adults!). Worth strolling down to take in the sights and enjoy a few \u2018dulces\u2019 along the way.

572221914.name: If you like sugar...
572221914.author: a TripAdvisor user
572221914.reviewBody: ...you\'ll love this place. Chocolate, caramel, fruit-flavor, these shops have it all. One is a coffee/chocolate specialist; another does sugar in all its forms; the list goes on literally for a city block. After that, you\'ll need all that wonderful city walking to work off the post-delight effects.

571935272.name: Delicious!
571935272.author: a TripAdvisor user
571935272.reviewBody: Lovely little historical street containing numerous well-known candy shops. My favorite was Santa Clara and they appear to have everything neatly organized and clean. The lady used plastic gloves to place our candy in a cute little white box. Definitely would recommend this particular candy shop.

571081644.name: Candy street all the way
571081644.author: a TripAdvisor user
571081644.reviewBody: If you have a sweet tooth and have no issues with diabetes, then you have come to the right place. Big variety of different sweets that will certainly meet you \u201csweet\u201d. Go after a meal to enjoy some desserts.

569771726.name: Great traditional candies
569771726.author: a TripAdvisor user
569771726.reviewBody: On this street you can find a sweet taste of Puebla. From traditional sweet potato to borrachitos you will sweeten your day.

569402203.name: The best candies in Mexico
569402203.author: a TripAdvisor user
569402203.reviewBody: This historical street offers you the best candies in town and maybe in Mexico, but the store that you had to visit is La Gran Fama which is more than 100 years old and they are still producing the candies just like they did 100 years ago.

566375276.name: Not quite as expected
566375276.author: a TripAdvisor user
566375276.reviewBody: 1. There are shops which sells the sweets. Lot of shops selling similar things which makes the market as competitive. \n2. Didnt find good shops for gifts. Basically you cannot eat all the sweets there. Or if you plan to bring some gift back for your friends, the packaging is not that great. \n3. Nothing extra ordinary. You can find same sweets and items outside this street as well in almost the same price.

554805214.name: Sugar Shopping
554805214.author: a TripAdvisor user
554805214.reviewBody:
This is a weird attraction. It is simply a boring street that has lots of shops selling the same thing. The thing they are selling is sweets. Most shops have the same range of products on offer at the same price. So you only need to go in 1 shop. No need for a whole street.

I found was that some (many?) of the sweets used nuts and honey as opposed to raw sugar. So the sweets were different from back home.

Good for 10 minutes of your life.

554238263.name: Why candies why not Street of Sweets
554238263.author: a TripAdvisor user
554238263.reviewBody:
Great place for the sweet tooth and has pretty much everything Mexican when it comes to sugary delights + more. 
We were treated to some lovely tastes as we wandered down here late at night. 
What also caught my eye was the lovely craftsmanship of the colourful ceramics. Just takes your breath away. 
This is a must visit even if you’re not into sweets. It’s a place of colour and vibrancy and leads to so many others great places in Puebla. 
Wheelchair friendly. Kid friendly.

553804159.name: Colorful and delicious
553804159.author: a TripAdvisor user
553804159.reviewBody: You should not leave Puebla without trying one or many of the traditional sweets.  They are also a great souvenir for family. We enjoyed looking at the variety at these traditional stores

553748946.name: Overrated
553748946.author: a TripAdvisor user
553748946.reviewBody: A few shops selling the same traditional Mexican sweets with little variety between them. Once you\'ve seen one you\'ve seen them all. I enjoy sweets but just choose a shop and get everything there, no need to shop around.

553588732.name: Some nice local candyshops
553588732.author: a TripAdvisor user
553588732.reviewBody: The street runs a few blocks, not every shop sells candies, but several do.\nLook for the ones with  counter filled with looseweight candies and shop a customized blend of camotes, borrachitos and dried fruit and nuts!

551861530.name: Even if you only look is worth looking
551861530.author: a TripAdvisor user
551861530.reviewBody: This is Mexico, even if you are not planning to buy candy just enjoy going in and out from the many candy stores there are on the street, by the way, the location in the map by tripadvisor site is not correct.  The street is very close to Mercado La Victoria.

548717858.name: **Wrong location but worth the trip
548717858.author: a TripAdvisor user
548717858.reviewBody: Be advised the location shown on the map is wrong and not in the best area of town. The actual Calle is on 6th but much closer to the zocalo. Check google maps or other source for location.

546128169.name: Candy lovers
546128169.author: a TripAdvisor user
546128169.reviewBody: I was in Puebla about 6 years ago and was looking forward to finding the Street of Candies again. Many, many shops offering a wide variety of traditional Mexican candies, Talavera pottery and other crafts. You will quickly notice that the shops carry the same items, but it\'s fun to look.

541619990.name: Make sure you take a lot!
541619990.author: a TripAdvisor user
541619990.reviewBody: Stopped by the street where there is nothing but candy, Puebla has the greatest local candy, cant think of the name, but believe me you will want to take some more after you\'ve eaten them all!

541472737.name: Cute little street filled with candy stores
541472737.author: a TripAdvisor user
541472737.reviewBody: Each store along this lane is filled with traditional candies that are super cheap. Whether you are an adult or a child you will enjoy this little lane. It won\'t take long to wander along it so its easy to add to your itinerary.  Buy a few different delights and enjoy!

524198327.name: Almost overwhelming!
524198327.author: a TripAdvisor user
524198327.reviewBody: There are so many different candy shops here that it is amazing! They all offer pretty much the same thing. Because it so difficult to decide I ended up buying a pre wrapped Talavera plate with a nice selection of different candies on it. As I was buying it for a gift, this made for a nice presentation.

510229198.name: Traditional Puebla Sweets
510229198.author: a TripAdvisor user
510229198.reviewBody: Most of the shops sell the same things. These candies are largely dissimilar to North American sweets.  Some are based on sweet potato flavored with orange, strawberry, lime and so on. Soft, mildly flavored, not my favorite. They also sell toasted nuts and seeds made into something like brittle only the nuts and seeds are held together with a minimum of sugar, its 95% or more nuts and seeds; I like these way to much. There are also lots of Mexican sweet-salty-sour-chile fruit combos; these are the staple of Mexican sweets and unusual for Americans but they are addictive. They have cooked milk based candies, like caramels but not chewy (no butter?).  I did not see cajeta, the reduced goat milk caramel sauce common in Mexico City or local chocolates.  There are a few ice cream stores - Mexican ice cream and ices are quite good and the local flavors especially worth getting - one can\'t just get guanabana (sour sop) or maracuya (passion fruit) just about anywhere in the USA.  There are also a few places that sell cookies and the chocolate cocada is crisp and dangerously good.

503842259.name: Street of candy
503842259.author: a TripAdvisor user
503842259.reviewBody: For all those who love typical Mexican sweets you cannot miss this place. The street is lined with stores full of sweets. We bought some candies from Tortitas de Santa Clara.  Its hard to say which is the best place to go too because most stores carry the same items..

501886530.name: Lots of sweet treats!
501886530.author: a TripAdvisor user

497920649.name: Beautiful walk
497920649.author: a TripAdvisor user
497920649.reviewBody: A very enjoyable walk very nice, clean and safe walk to the best part of town. a must do. Tray it you will not regret it.\n

487833505.name: Worth a visit...
487833505.author: a TripAdvisor user
487833505.reviewBody: First, we thought it was a joke that there was a street here lined up with candy stores - and here we are... Small stores/shops that sell candies of different flavors.\nYou just have to figure out what you want, which flavor to choose and what to eat first.\nTo those who have the sweet tooth and crave sugar, then come over and dive in...

484065438.name: Increible
484065438.author: a TripAdvisor user
484065438.reviewBody: Una calle llena de color y de todos los sabores mexicanos. Fresco, colorido y delicioso, definitivamente en mi lista de obligatorios. / A single street colorful and with all mexican flavors. Fresh and delicious, definitely is in my list of the "must visit"

478285466.name: Delicious
478285466.author: a TripAdvisor user
478285466.reviewBody: A whole street full of traditional candy shops. All of them look similar but walk by first before you buy candy to really understand the differences.

478072366.name: It was fine...
478072366.author: a TripAdvisor user
