478072366.reviewBody: Not quite so amazingly exciting. Every store kind of has the same stuff and I have no clue what any of it was. If I get a sugar craving I might go back and try my luck but honestly I\'d rather just stick with chocolate to be safe :p

476237053.name: What a Treat!
476237053.author: a TripAdvisor user
476237053.reviewBody: I really enjoyed my visit here. It reminded me of my childhood. I tried every candy from 3 different stores. I\'m surprised to find out that each store has something different to offer. \n\nThis is a \'must\' visit if you are in Puebla, Mexico. It\'s an adventure and a treat at the same time.

472226211.name: Typical candy
472226211.author: a TripAdvisor user
472226211.reviewBody: You can find all the traditional candies from Puebla in this street. Great for gifts but be sure to try some!

460966869.name: napoli
460966869.author: a TripAdvisor user
460966869.reviewBody: Loots of candies but the best store is the Gran Fama!!!  Delicious treats!\nAlso do not miss the chocolate store with all kinds of truffles!!!

460103610.name: The best Camote Candy!
460103610.author: a TripAdvisor user
460103610.reviewBody: I enjoyed seeing an eating all the candy offered. Every single store has its niche. I highly recommend El Convento de Santa Clara Fundada en 1907, 6 oriente 210. They are very helpful and let you sample anything you want. I bought traditional candy, mole, and talavera. Great service!

458596283.name: Like sweets?
458596283.author: a TripAdvisor user
458596283.reviewBody: Both sides of this block are lined with shops featuring the abundant varieties of sweets of Pueblo. Coffee shops, too. Especially recommended: tortitas of Santa Clarita...a shortbread like cookie with a sweet glaze center. Simply addictive!

440223121.name: It\'s good!
440223121.author: a TripAdvisor user
440223121.reviewBody: What it says on the tin! It\'s a block or two from Zocalo, and there\'s a lot of sweet candy shops to check out. Chocolate raisins are 12 pesos for 100g!

439649977.name: Different options
439649977.author: a TripAdvisor user
439649977.reviewBody: When you go to Puebla is a most stop location, everybody knows that when you go to Puebla you have to get candies and Mole, you can not leave without this items besides going to restaurants to eat the traditional food and visiting the historical sites they have. This street have different options the candies are amazing and when you look back you already have at least 4 bags with you \ud83d\ude4a\ud83c\udf6c. Yes yes I know I love candy and this was one of my hight lights of my trip and the best part is that I ask a lady in one of the stores about sugar free Puebla candies \ud83c\udf6d since my dad is diabetic but his favorite candy was from here. She told me right away about a store at the other side that start selling sugar free Pueblan candies. It was great all my family even my dad had the opportunity to get souvenirs of candy from Puebla.

428010324.name: Tourist street for candy stores
428010324.author: a TripAdvisor user
428010324.reviewBody: You will here of the Convent of the origin of the candies, Then you will get to experience several blocks of door to door storefront candy shops...generally not of the chocolate, but cane sugar variations..  6 Oriente is a great walking street, however, but is is not a must see.

424811918.name: Lot\'s of Candy
424811918.author: a TripAdvisor user
424811918.reviewBody: There are a lot of candy stores here but they mostly have the same stuff. The "camotes," a candy made with yams are very good and also try the different kinds of nuts especially peanuts coated with sugar that look like butter toffee peanuts and taste a lot better!

423841684.name: Traditional Mexican Sweets ... yummy!
423841684.author: a TripAdvisor user
423841684.reviewBody: The street of candies is exactly what it says! There are many shops to choose from all selling delicious sweets (candies). Some may contain chilli - so ask. There is a good selection of various sweets ... try them all. Some stores will give you a taste. My favourite are the various coconut \u00b4bars\u00b4.

408079033.name: Interesting but didn\'t care for the csndy
408079033.author: a TripAdvisor user
408079033.reviewBody: It\'s worth a stroll down the street but we didn\'t care for the candy. But it\'s neat to see the different things they can do with sugar. It\'s worth the stroll.

404641335.name: Sugar overload!
404641335.author: a TripAdvisor user
404641335.reviewBody: Mexicans love anything with sugar (they even add it to canned tomato soup and to ham & cheese sandwiches).  This street has shop after shop of real Mexican sweets: cookies, candies, even a few vegetables made sweet.  Certainly worth a stroll and a look.  The peanut bars stuck together with honey are my favorites!

398305272.name: A streed where you can buy candies, nothing special
398305272.author: a TripAdvisor user
398305272.reviewBody: You will find typical mexican candies in this street. Nice souveniers for family and friends in home. \nBesides that you need to like the mexican sweets, which is not my favourite in the world.

398219178.name: Yummy!
398219178.author: a TripAdvisor user
398219178.reviewBody: I was able to buy the candy made in Puebla. We found good prices and the street is very interesting. The Puebla camotes are very popular and a must taste for every tourist.

394782020.name: Calling all with a Sweet Tooth!
394782020.author: a TripAdvisor user
394782020.reviewBody: I have a really huge -- bulging out of my mouth --sweet tooth, so does my mother, we were in heaven on this street.  Santa Clara nuns back in the day started the tradition of making sweets and today they can be purchased throughout Puebla but especially on this street.  I loved walking around Puebla! --be careful not to over-do it, lots of good food in Puebla as well!

383292836.name: Awesome street for eating local candies
383292836.author: a TripAdvisor user
383292836.reviewBody: Not pretty sure if i had to write my reviews in english or spanish but I think that its worth it in English for foreign visitors. Im not from this city but I\'ve been living here for a couple of year and this is THE BEST STREET TO EAT CADIES in the state. Try "Tortitas de santa clara" those cookies are awesome \ud83d\ude02

375551701.name: i have never seen anything like it
375551701.author: a TripAdvisor user
375551701.reviewBody: It is literally eye candy.  2 or 3 streets on both sides with local candies.  beautifully wrapped like gifts.  some are in bulk.  but it is the color, the variety, the packaging that attracted my attention. All on one street!  officially Santa Clara St.

368570623.name: Authentic Sweets
368570623.author: a TripAdvisor user
368570623.reviewBody: Good street to find authentic Poblano sweets and to compare prices. A lot of the stores offer a gift basket options with a little bit of every candy for a set price. Some of the candy stores also sell souvenirs but I recommend going to the market 5 minutes away for your souvenirs, Mercado el Parian.

358609559.name: Very Sweeet..
358609559.author: a TripAdvisor user
358609559.reviewBody: For the lovers of candy , as are the Mexicans... you will love the street.. but not sure if you dont like them...

349305185.name: For an original snack or gift, typical sweets
349305185.author: a TripAdvisor user
349305185.reviewBody: Candied fruit, milk-based candies with pumpkin-seed paste,nutritious amaranth, gingerbread piggies, "camote" sweets made of sweet potatoes, and much more. For a gift, buy a variety in a basket or Talavera plate! Look for the dulcer\u00eda with a huge antique mirror, if you can.

348590805.name: Nice to see
348590805.author: a TripAdvisor user
348590805.reviewBody: The street isn\'t very long and worth the walk down to browse the various shops and see the specialty candies of the area. Many of the shops also sold talavera pottery and rompope.

346662794.name: A dream come true for sweet lovers!
346662794.author: a TripAdvisor user
346662794.reviewBody: I am in general not too enamored with Mexican sweets. They are always a tad too sugary, often made from condensed milk and rarely if ever really fresh (the sugar conserves them for months).   \nThis street has lots of candy stores. Take your time, I stopped at a particular beautiful one (the name escapes me but it has a huge crystal chandelier and is beautiful inside - easy to find). I tried the Dulce de Leche and several others. The woman kindly offered me a cup of coffee and explained the sweets. Nice, especially on a cold overcast morning.

342671648.name: Take some of Puebla with you
342671648.author: a TripAdvisor user
342671648.reviewBody: All the strip stores offers mostly the same products, of the same quality and same price, \n\nDo not break your head and feet walking it all when you can get all the candies at the first store you visit.

340817257.name: Handy Fever!
340817257.author: a TripAdvisor user
340817257.reviewBody: This street has lots of stores with tons of candies but not common ones,  these are typical from Puebla.  My favorite ones are Las glorias,  muegano de Tehuac\u00e1n,  dulce de pi\u00f1\u00f3n and tortita de Santa Clara. Just an advice,  first check out the prices of every store and compare.  Sometimes a store can have double the normal price.

336400787.name: Street of the Candies - 6 oriente -
336400787.author: a TripAdvisor user
336400787.reviewBody: If is (or not) your first time in Puebla City, it it very recommendable to walk the three blocks that take you from cities downtown to 6 oriente, also kbown as "calle de los dulces". There are more than 20 typical candies stores wich offer a large variety of delicious hand made original Puebla style candies. Is a must see when in town.

323776131.name: Lots of candy shops and a few restaurants
323776131.author: a TripAdvisor user
323776131.reviewBody: As the name implies, this street has a high number of candy shops. They all sell basically the same selections of candy, but some have their specialties. It is best to shop around. Some of them will have samples for you to try if you are unfamiliar with the local candy. My favorites are the Borachos, candies made with liquor. There are several restaurants on the street. They range from touristy to more authentic. Overall it is a fun place to visit in Puebla.

321264742.name: Hard to choose
321264742.author: a TripAdvisor user
321264742.reviewBody: Macaron con leche, the best choice and it is really hard to choose. Otherwise we saw most of the candies all around the area.

318979056.name: is a typical area to visit and to buy regional candies in Puebla
318979056.author: a TripAdvisor user
318979056.reviewBody: here you can find a very big offer of different typical candies that were produce in Puebla for ovver a century , they are made of different fruits and flavors ,and there \u00e1rea special cookies call tortitas de santa clara , also you find the rompope wich is a licorize eggnog , also very typical

317483440.name: Fun Place to buy candy.
317483440.author: a TripAdvisor user
317483440.reviewBody: This is several blocks of streets that are dedicated to candy shops. Lots to offer in the way of true Mexican candy--much of which is unique to Puebla.

315073588.name: A must see in Puebla
315073588.author: a TripAdvisor user
315073588.reviewBody: A beautiful town ,a beautiful Street . A MUST see vacation spot . Safe ,and interesting ,a great combination .

312139066.name: Yummi Yummi Yummi!!
312139066.author: a TripAdvisor user
312139066.reviewBody: If you are one of those tourists who cannot come back home with empty hands and yopu don\'t wanna carry the udual typical souvenir, then here is where you wanna take a stroll on the day before travelling back home. Not only will you find the most delicious original and tradicional candies and sweets od Puebla, but you\'ll also get them cheaper than anywhere else; especially cheaper than the few stores in the main square who buy their goods in these same stores and then charge you three times the price.

308787244.name: Definitely Worth to Try Local Candies and Desserts
308787244.author: a TripAdvisor user
308787244.reviewBody:
We did walk through this area and we stopped in one of the shops to get variety of local desserts. I would suggest you to try various desserts and candies in here since you may not like some of them (some of them had too much sugar).

Prices are not that expensive and you can ask for a small discount.

Since I am Turkish and I love Turkish desserts I cannot say that I am impressed but I can say that these are worth to try. I did not try the candies that are covered with chillies but if you are into that type of desserts then probably this is the place you are looking for.

307229352.name: Best of all is La Gran Fama
307229352.author: a TripAdvisor user
307229352.reviewBody: Best place to buy sweets and candies and cookies is LA GRAN FAMA next to her manos Serdan museum. All ingredients are fresh and high quality. Service is awesome and prices are reasonable for the excellent quality. Don\'t be fooled by other stores who don\'t prepare their own sweets and are made in mass production. Hand made sweets from La Gran Fama are extraordinary and delicious. Only for stringent customers looking for the best of the best

305473058.name: Good place to pick up souvenirs
305473058.author: a TripAdvisor user
305473058.reviewBody: Every time I go on vacation I always try to bring back some local candy for the people at work to share. I was getting concerned about finding that on this trip but then came upon this street. I was able to fill up a bag of candy and the prices were reasonable. Had a slight communication problem with the vendors, but it all worked out in the end.

295418927.name: Delicious!
295418927.author: a TripAdvisor user
295418927.reviewBody: Delicious, but really sweet, like, way too much, we bought too much and we could barely eat more than a bite at a time. But it\'s tasty. The thing to do is to buy the little baskets or the clay vases with a little bit of every type of candy. Delicious way to try them all :D

290739473.name: The place to go to buy sweets
290739473.author: a TripAdvisor user
290739473.reviewBody: You can buy all of the \'typical\' puebla sweets here. Some of the shops are better than others, but ultimately, they all sell the same stuff, with only slight differences.

289802088.name: Candy candy everywhere
289802088.author: a TripAdvisor user
289802088.reviewBody: Lots of small shops all carrying pretty much the same thing. Inexpensive souvenir to bring home. Shop keepers are friendly and not really pushy.

284386047.name: Fun Place For Those Who Love Sweets!
284386047.author: a TripAdvisor user
284386047.reviewBody: Wonderful place to check out Mexican candies and most shop owners will let you try various candies before buying.   I highly recommend the coconut lime macaroons and the meringues!

279603536.name: Ok to visit
279603536.author: a TripAdvisor user
279603536.reviewBody: For me, just a bunch of candy stores, so nothing special. However, every store, the people are friendly, even though I was just looking at the items,

275631841.name: Sugar Coma !
275631841.author: a TripAdvisor user
275631841.reviewBody: One walk down the street of candy and you will understand my title, Sugar Coma.  The candy most prevalent is made of a root vegetable similar to a sweet potato. A lot of sugar is added and in most cases, flavorings like coconut, pineapple, etc.  Each shop sells similar goods and they all want to give you a sample. If you have a sweet tooth, don\'t miss it.

268732842.name: Best
268732842.author: a TripAdvisor user
268732842.reviewBody: Super cute and not expensive at all, in here you get candy that you cant find in any other place in mexico, and it\'s not expensive at all! Don\'t forget to try borrachitos!

256050592.name: Candy heaven
256050592.author: a TripAdvisor user
256050592.reviewBody: This is a fun street to walk down and look and sample. The candied key limes are awesome! they tie your package in little boxes that make wonderful gifts at home!

253583453.name: You have to see it to believe it
253583453.author: a TripAdvisor user
253583453.reviewBody: I don\'t even like sweets--but I loved this street. It\'s something out of a fairy tale: a WHOLE BLOCK of candy stores, of all sizes, overflowing with every kind of sweet imaginable, in quantities that Costco could only dream of. Well worth a visit.

252326724.name: Never Saw One of These Before
252326724.author: a TripAdvisor user
252326724.reviewBody: It was fun walking down the street seeing all the candy stores.  I had never seen a street with just candy before.

246103218.name: Interesting small shops selling tradition candies
246103218.author: a TripAdvisor user
246103218.reviewBody: A stroll along the Street of Candies perusing the numerous small shops with extensive candy displays makes a pleasant change from the hustle ans bustle if the main square!

244367295.name: sweet tooth anybody?
244367295.author: a TripAdvisor user
244367295.reviewBody: as the name suggests only sweet shops. got faaaaat just looking around and buying. if you have kids with you.......its either a sugar rush or doling out the moolah. do not enter if on a diet!

239131817.name: Yummy
239131817.author: a TripAdvisor user
239131817.reviewBody: It is a street full of sweet shops. Go.\n\n(Try the peanut \'marizipan\' and the Santa Clara tortitas. Try everything!)

230648059.name: Recommended for Puebla food and souvenirs
230648059.author: a TripAdvisor user
230648059.reviewBody: Very friendly and helpful staff, not pushing you too hard but all willing to held finding the taste of Puebla or the sovenirs you really want.

230025014.name: Cool Street, Lots of Sugar
230025014.author: a TripAdvisor user
230025014.reviewBody: I took my kids to this site and they loved it.  They ran from shop to shop looking for the "one" treat I promised to by them.  After 30 minutes they both found their treats and were pleased.  \n\nThere is one thing that would make this street better....more Chocolate candies.  Sorry but it\'s my vice.

225866174.name: A feast for the eyes!
225866174.author: a TripAdvisor user
225866174.reviewBody: Colour, colour colour delighted the eye walking down Candy Street.\nThe treats were artistically displayed enticing even the strongest of sugar deniers.  So many different types to sample.  It wasn\'t a disappointment.

205280261.name: Good Grade for Ease of Access
205280261.author: a TripAdvisor user
205280261.reviewBody: Yes, it\'s just a strip of a downtown street filled with shops selling sweets, and yes, all you really would want to do is go into three or four of them.  But the variety of product is impressive, and locally made in many cases; and since it\'s a short walk from everywhere in the centro historico, and close to several other sights of interest, you should take the few minutes and walk down the street ... then set up an appointment with your dentist as soon as you get home. So perhaps it\'s average for some reasons, but nevertheless deserves a very good rating for the reasons enumerated.

196592329.name: Fun
196592329.author: a TripAdvisor user
196592329.reviewBody: I\'m not a candy eater, but I loved this block lined with old style sweet shops. Several of the stores have been in business for decades. We found a place that sold nuts and rose de jamaica (hibiscus petals, great for making super Vitamin C rich tea) Me gusta esta calle mucho.

195379144.name: Just a row of sweet shops
195379144.author: a TripAdvisor user
195379144.reviewBody: Sorry but these are just shops selling mainly the same sweets that you can buy in many cities in Mexico. Not worth walking down the road unless you are going to the Museum of the Revolution.

190894983.name: Worth the 30 minutes of viewing!
190894983.author: a TripAdvisor user
190894983.reviewBody: I\'m not someone who chases sweets, but my reason for travel is to see how others live and eat. The "street of candies" is one block long and filled with shops selling sweet stuff. My hotel had some sweets from "Le Central" in the room when we arrived and I found them to be of extraordinary quality. I find that Mexican sweets are way too sweet, and a little bit goes a long way for me. For the half hour it took of my day, I enjoyed it along with a couple of churches on the way.

190051122.name: Average attraction
190051122.author: a TripAdvisor user
190051122.reviewBody: Average attraction that includes many shops that sell typical candies of this region of Mexico.  Street, however, does include a museum related to the Mexican Revolution worth seeing.

182777506.name: Sweet street
182777506.author: a TripAdvisor user
182777506.reviewBody: This really is the street of sweets. There are so many sweet shops to choose from. You\'ll of course have to shop around for who has the best prices but nothing is over the top expensive. Quite shocking when you do the conversion and find out you\'ve paid a lot less for so much but that\'s pretty much with almost anything you buy in Mexico. \nI only bought the coconut and milk pieces. Thought I\'d give the camotes a try as they were so cheap. Glad I didn\'t pay too much; I\'m not a fan of yams or sweet potatoes and that\'s what they taste like. \nThe Santa Clara cookies were really good. This is a great place to go if you want to make your own pi\u00f1ata or Mexican themed gift basket.

174748275.name: Dulces
174748275.author: a TripAdvisor user
174748275.reviewBody: This entire street is filled with sweet shops. Most sweets here are fruit based, not chocolate. Some will give you samples. The local specialty is the camote. You must try some!

165095091.name: Traditional sweets
165095091.author: a TripAdvisor user
165095091.reviewBody: While in Puebla if you have a sweet tooth do not miss visiting this street which is nearby the Church of Santo Domingo. \nA piece of advice: the freshest sweets are those from El Lirio. They produce the sweets themselves.

160704201.name: try it
160704201.author: a TripAdvisor user
160704201.reviewBody: Walking distance from the hotel, in the center. So many good places for great candies. Price is nothing and pleasure is great.

157980179.name: if you\'re a big fan of mexican candies..
157980179.author: a TripAdvisor user
157980179.reviewBody: this is going to be a very easy review to digest: I don\'t like Mexican candy or baked goods.....I tried the camotes along with some other little snacks while we were here. simply not for me and nothing behind the class counters looked even remotely appetizing either.... little Mexican kids would be in heaven though

155841372.name: fun to see
155841372.author: a TripAdvisor user
155841372.reviewBody: The variety of candies, and their strangeness, were fascinating. We purchased a basket of several selections and had a tasting. Worth doing, even if they\'re not what you\'re used to.

155352703.name: Great photo opportunity
155352703.author: a TripAdvisor user
155352703.reviewBody: Cute displays of candy on this street and except for one shop which has no photos on a sign in the window,  no one else seemed to mind us taking pictures.

155082769.name: A little disappointing actually
155082769.author: a TripAdvisor user
155082769.reviewBody: I\'m not sure what I was expecting, but my family is from the Caribbean and we have our array of tropical candies too, and I guess I didn\'t like the local fudges and candies as good as the ones I grew up with.  Much prefered the ones I got at Dulceria La Celaya in D.F.

153813201.name: A Nice Walk
153813201.author: a TripAdvisor user
153813201.reviewBody: The street is lined with candy stores that sell the typical Mexican candies and some special to Puebla. I\'m not a big fan - preferring chocolate to sugar coated jam candy. It is a nice walk and you don\'t have to purchase anything.

152533314.name: Fun to walk through
152533314.author: a TripAdvisor user
152533314.reviewBody: Puebla is known for it\'s camotes which are a yam or fruit like candy rolled up like a tortilla.  I don\'t particularly care for this type of sweet.  The street is full of candies stores specializing in this sweet.  It\'s a fun to walk through it and check out all the window displays even if you don\'t care for this type of dessert.

151273423.name: Fun
151273423.author: a TripAdvisor user
151273423.reviewBody: Smells amazing when you enter this street and easily the most visited street in Puebla. Candies much the same in each shop.

148040954.name: Good candies, little variety
148040954.author: a TripAdvisor user
148040954.reviewBody: The street where all the candies are is quite attractive,  but there is little variety in candy diversity or prices. it is a good place to pick up treats for your friends. A well made and tasty candy is always appreciated, if you are not on a diet or a medical restriction. Go, enjoy, and don\'t overeat.

141617182.name: So sweet !!
141617182.author: a TripAdvisor user
141617182.reviewBody: I read about "el callejon de los dulces"/Street of candies. It was raining that afternoon but I did not mind the walk cause I was so excited of the Idea to see so many different types of candy.Bought a few sweet treats, loved the candy baskets with a heart that reads puebla.

135027265.name: Hand made candies, and all kind of spicy nuts
135027265.author: a TripAdvisor user
135027265.reviewBody: You won\'t go wrong visiting any of the candy stores. I prefer "La Fama" from their secret recipe marzipan sweets, to the world famous "Tortitas de Santa Clara" it\'s a sweet tooth paradise.

134822659.name: You\'ve got to really love Mexican candies...
134822659.author: a TripAdvisor user
134822659.reviewBody: Definitely worth walking down in Puebla, but you\'ve got to be a huge fan of Mexican sweets.  Kids whose tastes run to mass produced candies will be disappointed.

134785138.name: A must for candy lovers
134785138.author: a TripAdvisor user
134785138.reviewBody: My cousin who loves candy went nuts when she saw this street. We didn\'t know what to buy but you can ask for taste.  I really like the humble camote and they come in several flavors and they make a terrific souvenir. Shop around for prices before you buy.

130434372.name: What a great idea
130434372.author: a TripAdvisor user
130434372.reviewBody: If you like candy, that is. So much to choose from but well worth the walk. Puebla is a city you need to walk to really feel.

126230299.name: Delicious Camote (Candied Sweet Potato)
126230299.author: a TripAdvisor user
126230299.reviewBody: This street, also know as Calle Santa Clara is loaded with candy shops all specializing in Camote (Spanish for sweet potato) and also a type of crystalized candy that\'s very popular in Puebla. These candies are famous due to its history of production, which is contributed to the nuns. Don\'t leave Puebla without buying some. The street name is Oriente 5 (Calle Santa Clara).

126070864.name: Candy and more
126070864.author: a TripAdvisor user
126070864.reviewBody: I\'m glad I can\'t get Santa Clara cookies back home. They\'re really rich and really addictive. The candy street has more than candy. \nsome of the best deals on Talavera can be found here. They\'re NOT the quality of Uriarte but fine for gifts for friends and family. \nBuy the best at Uriarte and the rest here.

125783839.name: Gotta\' Check This Out!
125783839.author: a TripAdvisor user
125783839.reviewBody: Mexico makes wonderful dulces, candies, and this street offers a good representation of candies.  The prices are great, and you can capture some great photos of all the dulces.  Visit before the Day of the Dead to get the most selection, but we went in June and there was a lot to see and sample.

124932954.name: Nice street with lots of cute shops
124932954.author: a TripAdvisor user
124932954.reviewBody: I did buy several of the traditional Puebla candies, which were all very good, although didn\'t compare to European chocolates!  My favorite shop on the street was a large shop that made and sold talavera pottery.  They had an amazing selection of pieces there, and the staff was extremely helpful in explaining the different pieces.

124835279.name: A street with sweet shops
124835279.author: a TripAdvisor user
124835279.reviewBody: And that is about it.  The shops sell the same things as each other and they are pretty good, but it is not an attraction in itself.  It is cheaper the further away from the market you go.  A box of borrachitos cost 30 pesos near the market ans 13 pesos about 100 meters or so down the road.

124440823.name: Lots of Candy Shops
124440823.author: a TripAdvisor user
124440823.reviewBody: Ok, the actual candies are unique, a Pueblo speciality, but you can buy them all over the city.  Didn\'t really understand what all the fuss was about.  Was not worth a special trip to this part of town.

124268542.name: Delicious!
124268542.author: a TripAdvisor user
124268542.reviewBody: Try the typical cookies with sugar frosting, you won\'t regret it! Camotes are an acquired taste, so see for yourself if you like them or not!

123782210.name: Unique, historic, colorful, tasty
123782210.author: a TripAdvisor user
123782210.reviewBody: Even if you don\'t have a sweet tooth, this is worthwhile. Puebla is famous for its traditional candies, but beware: they tend to be very very sweet. The famous camotes, made from sweet potato and flavorings, are the sweetest. I prefer tortitas, which look like small flat tarts with a white filling. These are made with squash seed, and have a very subtle, traditional flavor. Our favorite shop is El Lirio, next to the revolution museum. Many of the shops also sell talavera or small souvenirs. All is colorful, a photographer\'s delight. This is also the street to buy mole paste to take home. It\'s the best you can find anywhere. The little restaurant on the corner that sells plastic bags of mole (we forget the name) has wonderful mole paste, and is a good, inexpensive place to get traditonal Poblano dishes like enchiladas mole or cemitas milanesa.

122582365.name: Poblano candies
122582365.author: a TripAdvisor user
122582365.reviewBody: Amazing how many stores sell the colorful typical candies.  Lots offer samples, too.

120032987.name: A sweets lover\'s dream
120032987.author: a TripAdvisor user
120032987.reviewBody: A whole block devoted to fanciful candy stores.  In preparation for the Day of the Dead celebrations, the candy stores were stocked to the ceilings with sugar calaveras (decorated skulls), offerings, and candies in colors not known to nature.

119597638.name: Sweet
119597638.author: a TripAdvisor user
119597638.reviewBody: There are all sorts of candies on this street.  I was sort of surprised that there were no pastry shops.  (I tend to need pastries more than candy and the nearest pastry shop was a hike.)

662594301.name: Interesting way to see the artisans in the area
662594301.author: a TripAdvisor user
662594301.reviewBody: Although it was a quick walk through I am glad I had the opportunity to see this aspect of Puebla and its offerings.

658902505.name: Best part of Puebla
658902505.author: a TripAdvisor user
658902505.reviewBody: You have to stroll around in Puebla. Somehow, stumble across this in the evening. The place come alive in the evening with the plenty of artists, cafes and alfresco dining. Forego them all and head to the street food stalls where everyone is headed as well.

655686151.name: Busy art market
655686151.author: a TripAdvisor user
655686151.reviewBody: This place is located along the edges of a small plaza with a fountain, trees, and seating areas.  Lots of stalls of varying kinds of art are available for purchase.  A bonus of the day we were there was an antique/flea market in the plaza.  I enjoyed seeing Mexicans shopping for the same sort of treasures I look for when shopping.

650908800.name: Feast for the Eyes
650908800.author: a TripAdvisor user
650908800.reviewBody: If you like to see local art, this is the place to visit! We went several times while we were in Puebla as not all artists are there all the time.  There are so many different styles, techniques, skill levels and subjects that it was most enjoyable. There are students painting as well as highly skilled artists. The prices range the gamut. I think this is a must visit for anyone who enjoys art. On the weekends there are street fairs and a very festive atmosphere. Because it is mainly "Open Air" do not go if it is cold as everything seems to shut down!

645824457.name: Went to look for a piece of art
645824457.author: a TripAdvisor user
645824457.reviewBody: I was in Puebla right before Christmas, and was hoping to find Christmas gifts while there.  I was able to find an extremely reasonable piece of acrylic/oil artwork that I took home to my daughter.  It was on display framed, and due to the size and the fact that I had to fit it in my suitcase to get home, I asked if I could get it w/out the frame, which decreased the price.  I was very happy with my purchase.

643564388.name: Lively place in afternoon and early evening
643564388.author: a TripAdvisor user
643564388.reviewBody: We passed by a couple of times but only went thru one afternoon when it was very active.  Lots of stalls and open air vendors with all finds of objects for sale.  You can find tourist items, fine art and scupture.  There are food vendors and restaurants and a couple of art galleries.  Follow it past a few blocks and it morphs into Los Sapos, also interesting

637708743.name: Inviting area in terms of pleasant tree lined pedestrian walk; Art not so much.
637708743.author: a TripAdvisor user
637708743.reviewBody: Continue walking from the Parian Markey to this more relaxed stretch. Shops, cafes, and bars line the street, with some shops offering paintings of a certain decorating type that tends to appeal to tourists, i.e. paintiongs of the Cholula church  atop the pyramid. \nThere are some young artists showing original prints /engravings for sale in the passageway by the university where the arts and crafts folks set up on weekends, a few blocks  away.\nIt\'s pleasant to sit on a bench or at one of the cafes and rest a bit under the trees. At the end of the walking area heading toward the big highway- Blvd Heroes del Cinco de Mayo-is a museum on the left hand side (currently a show of photographs of Frida Kahlo bit check out the current exhibit) and on the right a multistory complex of galleries, cafes, bars with very loud music.

631315669.name: Another beautiful busy market area to stroll
631315669.author: a TripAdvisor user
631315669.reviewBody: Puebla is a walkers paradise, and this are is a shoppers haven as well.  Beautiful area, well lit, lively, colourful and worth several visits during your stay.

630384760.name: So much to see
630384760.author: a TripAdvisor user
630384760.reviewBody: We could have spent all day in one of the Talavera fabricas. The potters and painters were fantastic and it was so worth the 35 pesos entrance.

613956415.name: Local original art
613956415.author: a TripAdvisor user
613956415.reviewBody: This area is full of little shops that are providing local handmade art and original souvenirs for everyone.

603311941.name: local artist\'s finds
603311941.author: a TripAdvisor user
603311941.reviewBody: Area where artists show their work, close to the center of the city and very much visited by locals and tourists.

601767758.name: Artists Heaven!
601767758.author: a TripAdvisor user
601767758.reviewBody: This is a very special part of the town with great atmosphere. It is filled with 43 tiny artists units, where they sit outside displaying their art and creating it as you walk by. Stunning to see and you can pick up something special while you are there. Little coffee shops near by where you can sit and relax.

601174825.name: Fun to see the local crafts
601174825.author: a TripAdvisor user
601174825.reviewBody: I spent a very pleasant afternoon strolling through here looking at   the local crafts.  It was a fun experience.

595701998.name: Cool and pleasant artistic quarter
595701998.author: a TripAdvisor user
595701998.reviewBody: The Barrio is maybe two blocks long, and is very shady, neatly maintained, and full of art shops. Most afternoons, a number of artists will be working outside the galleries, which provides much interest.  The old art student union courtyard is truly pleasant, and on weekends lots of art for sale is displayed on easels out front.

590383102.name: Went back to find an artist...
590383102.author: a TripAdvisor user
590383102.reviewBody:
That sold me an oil painting the last time I was there of flowers that I just love looking at.  He was there and I bought another piece of art, even bigger than the first one!

The whole area, once everyone gets there, is just filled with artists and creativity. This time several of the artists were running Saturday workshops for children and it was full of kids having fun. The art runs the spectrum and lots to see and appreciate, regardless of personal preference. 

Great place to spend some time during an afternoon stroll.

576853520.name: A dozen or more art stalls
576853520.author: a TripAdvisor user
576853520.reviewBody: Lots of original art is on display here.  The artists create their painting in small studios that line the pedestrian street.

571733852.name: Nice place to shop
571733852.author: a TripAdvisor user
571733852.reviewBody: Near our hotel and very pleasant place to walk around and browse. Did not buy anything so little to add to this.

567028735.name: A nice alley with artist...very picturesque.
567028735.author: a TripAdvisor user
567028735.reviewBody: Beyond any opinion on the art offered (I\'m not an expert on this) I found the street very picturesque and worth visiting. It is well arranged and it offers also areas for having coffee, food and buy all kinds of local manufactured goods.

563965995.name: A winner
563965995.author: a TripAdvisor user
563965995.reviewBody: When we travel, we like to pick up local art as a reminder of the trip. Sunday afternoon here the artists were out and I found more than one lovely, very reasonablely priced, small pieces. The artists we interacted with were bi-lingual. You need pesos as no one takes dollars but they do take credit cards.

512184661.name: Magical setting, ok food
512184661.author: a TripAdvisor user
512184661.reviewBody: If I were rating the service it would be a 5. Rating the environment in a plaza next to a fountain it would be a 5. Super entertainment too. But the food is just so so. So a 4. Go. If what you want is to be outside and really feel like you are in Mexico, go.

498680363.name: You never get enough of this Barrio
498680363.author: a TripAdvisor user
498680363.reviewBody: When you enter by the street next to the theatre you immediately get involved in the bohemian mood. I walked several days around and just felt magnetized by the vibe of the area. If you go on the day light you\'ll see how vibrant it is with all the commerces open, people offering all kind of goodies and food, but at night you\'ll love the lighting, the relax and how cozy it can get.

497920136.name: Great Visit
497920136.author: a TripAdvisor user
497920136.reviewBody: Charming place to walk around, very casual and safe, there are a lot of things to see and shop for. We enjoyed this place.

478234457.name: "Portlandis" in Mexico
478234457.author: a TripAdvisor user
478234457.reviewBody: Reminded me of a typical Saturday market. Panhandler\'s, music and artist. I love this stuff. Not huge, but you can spend an hour

478213469.name: Nice walk
478213469.author: a TripAdvisor user
478213469.reviewBody: Nice place to walk and grab a cup of coffee. Mostly artesanal stuff but worth the small walk, just a couple of streets.

475885855.name: One of my favorite streets in Puebla
475885855.author: a TripAdvisor user
475885855.reviewBody: It\'s a lovely walk and not far from the main square.  Lots of actual art booths in the barrio.  There are some touristy type art places, but there were actual artists working when I\'d walk through there. Definitely different type things for sale than a lot of the heavy tourist areas. There were quite a few very nice pieces for sale.

469277389.name: happy artist
469277389.author: a TripAdvisor user
469277389.reviewBody: as an artist I really enjoy any place like this. Lots of talented locals working on their art while you watching. Some paintings were incredible. I walked around probably three times with my wife and we had a great time. The gallery upstairs above the cafe was also full of wonderful art pieces. Any of them which you can buy of course. Puebla is a magical place and absolutely safe even after dark. This artist promenade was big surprise to us since we never heard about it before.

467934118.name: When in Puebla, Mexico.
467934118.author: a TripAdvisor user
467934118.reviewBody: A lovely place to stroll as is most of historical Puebla.  All those doors and more represent an artist\'s studio. Small but full of talent.  There are a couple of cafes within the area, we went to the Cafe Artista and had a very tasty appetizer perfect for a light snack. Lots of servers and a great spot for people watching. In front of the huge sculpture of 4 women.  Go there.

440034162.name: genuine artists at work
440034162.author: a TripAdvisor user
440034162.reviewBody:
a lovely place for an afternoon, sunset or evening stroll. You can see artists live at work and have a chat to learn more. A variety of art styles and types and good little place to pick up something if your looking for some local art. As with all "art" places- its a little touristy, but has a relaxed and no pressure feel as you wander and look your way around. Some cool little bars and cafes with live music and heap happy hour deals for a beer or two.
a quaint and pretty neighbourhood so close to the main Zocalo. 

nearly are also (of course) local markets and stalls offering chew and quality souvenirs, trinkets, clothing, rugs and moments of Puebla.

437263088.name: Perfect evening stroll
437263088.author: a TripAdvisor user
437263088.reviewBody: Lovely evening setting with artists and their works on display. Fountains, sculptures and lights strung up on the street

427893322.name: Sales and artists working
427893322.author: a TripAdvisor user
427893322.reviewBody: Next to the market of regional wares, this is a lovely oasis of calm and varied works for sale. While not the traditional gallery setting, that, indeed is part of its charm.

417741881.name: Found 3 or 4 very nice artists here
417741881.author: a TripAdvisor user
417741881.reviewBody: This is a great idea.  The tiny studios open up during the day so that you can see what they are working on.  About have of the studios had artwork that was beginning artist level. . . it was clear that the artists hadn\'t found themselves yet.  However, it was lovely to see artists actively working on their art.  There were at least 8 artists painting, or working in their studios.  Others had artswork displayed on the street.  Another nice thing about this is that the city has closed off the road to traffic so that the art can spill out into the courtyard that has been created.  This is one of the lovely things about Mexico.  It supports the art.  I saw at least 3 pieces during the day that I would loved to take home with me.  Prices are reasonable.

417063019.name: Great place to purchase original art
417063019.author: a TripAdvisor user
417063019.reviewBody: We bought an amazing painting from a local artist. They were able to roll it up and we carried it home on the plane. There were many beautiful pieces available for sale. If you enjoy having original artwork in your home then visit this area and be prepared to marvel in the talent of the local artists.

391537664.name: VEVY NICE PLACE TO VISIT
391537664.author: a TripAdvisor user
391537664.reviewBody: Yesterday I went to el Barrio del Artista.  there is a lot of small stores where the artist, most of them they paint, they paint and sell

359419315.name: Nice area but not very interesting...
359419315.author: a TripAdvisor user
359419315.reviewBody: This is a nice area, many local artists offer their paintings but not very quality works. It\'s just better to walk through and keeping your way.

357624391.name: Beautiful artwork
357624391.author: a TripAdvisor user
357624391.reviewBody: I enjoyed this short street greatly. It is not only a pretty street, but the variety of displayed artwork is wonderful. The artists are nice and are painting right there in their studios on the street. It\'s great to see.

345847159.name: Lively street
345847159.author: a TripAdvisor user
345847159.reviewBody: Nice area with lots to see. Live music and artists everywhere. \nNice to walk around for a while. Just sit down and relax. Enjoy

320743851.name: Art Not So Hot, Cafe\' Americano Hot Enough
320743851.author: a TripAdvisor user
320743851.reviewBody: The "barrio del Artista" in Puebla, Mexico, is a consternation. It\'s about three blocks, including a little *plazeula,* pretending to be a major attraction for art entusiasts. Mostly, though, what is sold is quickie landscapes that cannot match even Rivera in his childhood watercolors (which make up much of the collection in his *casa natal* in Guanajuato). I watched as an *artista* put the finishing touches on such a work, then hang it out to dry, perchance to attract a gullible tourist. (There were plenty in town, also shopping at El Parian, the talavera temple of kitsch.) Now, here\'s the nice part: you can take a seat at one of the many sidewalk cafe\'s, order a cafe\' Americano, an expresso, or a frothy coffee concoction for a couple of bucks, sit back and enjoy fine conversation and gawking at the passersby. The day we did so, we actually caught sight of some local Goths!

316631846.name: Colorful area to spend a few hours in
316631846.author: a TripAdvisor user
316631846.reviewBody: Cute neighborhood market stalls, selling colorful handicrafts and pottery. It\'s open everyday, we were there at the weekend in September and it wasn\'t too busy.  The architecture is interesting, shame about all the satellite dishes that mar your photos a little. There are coffee shops and plenty of places to eat around here too.  Great for an hour or two of strolling around.,

294093622.name: Great area for creative thinkers
294093622.author: a TripAdvisor user
294093622.reviewBody: The neighborhood provided a great creative outlet for all types of orders, from painters to woodcarvers alike. I love how they had little mini workshop areas for each artisan to work out of. Whether you stop for coffee, eat at a little restaurant, or even just walking through, the neighborhood is worth a visit.

286933015.name: interestin area to see all kind of local art and handcrafts , its a good walking area
286933015.author: a TripAdvisor user
286933015.reviewBody: is a very nice \u00e1rea where you can see the local paiters Works and also where you can buy typical art crafs

285757653.name: Walking around touristic downtown Puebla
285757653.author: a TripAdvisor user
285757653.reviewBody: Just walk by admiring the magnificent architecture, stop a place you like to enjoy a meal or a drink and continue walking around to shop several souvenirs. Then just continue to the "The Sapos" street for a beautiful promenade

277917165.name: Perfect for the afternoon
277917165.author: a TripAdvisor user
277917165.reviewBody: It is a great area where you can choose from several coffee shops or bars to chill out. Perfect for couples or even families. There are also some artistic workshops where you can see the artists doing their job.

256037330.name: Located in a lovely square
256037330.author: a TripAdvisor user
256037330.reviewBody: This is a great place to just sit and people watch. It\'s located in a lovely square. But unless you are interested in buying paintings, there\'s nothing much to do here. Just a few steps away, you\'ll find el Parian, with loads of touristy stuff.

247812507.name: Go on a Saturday
247812507.author: a TripAdvisor user
247812507.reviewBody: It is a great place to visit on a Saturday and see all the Artist doing their paintings and sculpures. A way to spend a relaxing day and maybe buy some local art.

243415792.name: Peaceful area to walk around and have a coffee
243415792.author: a TripAdvisor user
243415792.reviewBody: You can watch artists in full activity, have a coffee in the lovely square and just walk around in these pedestrianised area close by the Crafts market El Parian and five minutes away from the Z\u00f3calo.

239333166.name: A cool bohemian short walk.
239333166.author: a TripAdvisor user
239333166.reviewBody: It is very calm and inspiring for people who enjoy art, to walk down this small alley full of artistic views with bars that wait for you at the end (or beginning, depending on where you start) to enjoy a good priced beer to refresh up.

226002430.name: Sunday Art for Sale
226002430.author: a TripAdvisor user
226002430.reviewBody: We have only visited on a Sunday but it appears to be a popular area to hang out.  Plenty of art for sale in a pleasant setting.

203325333.name: Talented artists and more!
203325333.author: a TripAdvisor user
203325333.reviewBody: We sought out this street since my husband loves to paint.  We were not disappointed.  We saw some very talented masters working their magic on their canvasses.  We stopped for a drink at the Cafe del Artista (don\'t order the nachos...they were served cold!).  On our second trip down this street, we happened upon a folk dance festival that was great fun to watch.  A very pleasant place to stroll and relax and view some great art.

202776328.name: You have to see this
202776328.author: a TripAdvisor user
202776328.reviewBody: Hundreds of artists and vendors and little caf\u00e9s make this area a great place to hang out for at least a half day, maybe more. Watch artists paint pictures in various styles, and try your skill haggling with vendors for goodies of all sorts.

202430881.name: Tourist gift shops.
202430881.author: a TripAdvisor user
202430881.reviewBody: I sort of like to visit this place that night. There\'s a lot of color and smells in the air. It\'s a little bit of a walk from the Zocalo in the center of town. Maybe about 10 or 15 blocks away. And you can walk it. It\'s full of things that you\'ll find for cheap gifts to talavera plates. It\'s very interesting at night. If you there if your little hungry keep an eye open for the local elote. Its sweet boiled white corn, basted with a sticky sauce, rolled in a parma-like cheese, then coated with stripes of hot sauce, yum! Its a delicious late nights what snack. You should have a beer with it. Its a delicious and affordable food. I never worry about street vendors here.

198986623.name: nothing special
198986623.author: a TripAdvisor user
198986623.reviewBody: We went twice and I did not see a reason to return. The second time was not planed. Walk thru if you have the time or sit down and have a drink and rest and then move on. Not a must see.

195379505.name: Not worth seeing
195379505.author: a TripAdvisor user
195379505.reviewBody: It might be mildly interesting that this was established in 1941 (I think) and the tile facade of the original buildings may be worth seeing, but as a centre for art this is seriously lacking in originality and quality.

190986353.name: Just painters
190986353.author: a TripAdvisor user
190986353.reviewBody: I was hoping to find a variety of artistic flavour here, but all there is are small studios of painters. The paintings are nothing special and seem to be done purely for sale. didn\'t get a sense of creativity here. Too bad.

178375645.name: Forget the artists
178375645.author: a TripAdvisor user
178375645.reviewBody: This is a nice place to be because it has been very well revamped, painted and made easy to walk through without any cars around. During the day is calm and in the evenings it can get a bit crowded. The artists working or living in the neighborhood are not great artists, just artists and craftsmen doing what sells the most, with no further artistic ambition. The whole neighborhood has benefited from this renewed urban landscape that only several years back was abandoned.

176348984.name: Great Art
176348984.author: a TripAdvisor user
176348984.reviewBody: Cool area with many great artists.  We bought two beautiful paintings, one from Raymoundo.  The paintings look beautiful in my home.  The Barrio del Artista is directly beside the Parian Market...easy to find.

176224499.name: I love this place.
176224499.author: a TripAdvisor user
176224499.reviewBody: One of my favorite squares. Full of groovy, bohemian vibes, cool cafes with live trova music. A good way to decompress with chelas or tequila after sight seeing.

616232670.name: Such a sweet place
616232670.author: a TripAdvisor user
616232670.reviewBody: We were so happy to see this on tripadvisor and made a stop here on our way back from touring around Tlaxacala and Puebla states. The cool temperature combined with the lavender smells was fantastic. We didn\'t take a tour as it was not in English and only one of us spoke Spanish, but we loved exploring the shop and the facilities. Just beautiful to see the lavender growing in a field. They served us lavender cake and it was amazing.\n\nBack down the road you come in is a great restaurant as well.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Mexico-Puebla km 53.75 Santa Rita Tlahuapan

603700358.name: You can avoid it
603700358.author: a TripAdvisor user
603700358.reviewBody:
Is a standar visit, very desorganized the staff did not know about the procedures. Is a beatiful natural landscape but just fine 
Most of the photos are very Photoshoped
The lavender ítems are kind of expensive 
If you go to Puebla there are a Lot of places you can spend your time: down town, valquirico, Cholula, national parks, africam safari, etc.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Mexico-Puebla km 53.75 Santa Rita Tlahuapan

503028614.name: If you like to see the nature and smell woderful natural scents this is the right place for you.
503028614.author: a TripAdvisor user
503028614.reviewBody: Rancho San Martin it\u00b4s a place where lavender its transformed into natural oil, w\u00e1ter scents, bread , creams and soap. The main production of this place is the destilation of natural scents. The tour its simple , not too fancy , not very big store, but the products are of good quality and the Hood its in the forest so its a charming place to visit. From there you can go behind to Arco\u00edris place where you can fish and camp , watch fireflies as well.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal Mexico-Puebla km 53.75 Santa Rita Tlahuapan

664875015.name: Capilla Del Rosario
664875015.author: a TripAdvisor user
664875015.reviewBody: This church is worth visiting primarily because of the Capilla Del Rosario. It\'s beautifully intricate and ornate, make sure your camera takes good pictures in low lighting if you want to capture it. It\'s an important attraction, but it\'s not super busy and everyone is quiet and respectful. The Capilla makes it one of the nicest churches I have visited in Mexico.

itemReviewed.name: Church of Santo Domingo (Iglesia de Santo Domingo)

662595165.name: A must see in Puebla
662595165.author: a TripAdvisor user
662595165.reviewBody: Beautiful church that is quite amazing . Yes churches everywhere but don\'t miss this one. Stunning site.

itemReviewed.name: Church of Santo Domingo (Iglesia de Santo Domingo)

656996914.name: One of the best churches in Mexico
656996914.author: a TripAdvisor user
656996914.reviewBody: There are many churches in Mexico and many in Puebla itself but the gold gilded capilla in this one is spectacular and puts it right at the top of my list. It really has to be seen to be believed.It\'s an easy walk down cinco de mayo street and it should be a must see while in Puebla.

itemReviewed.name: Church of Santo Domingo (Iglesia de Santo Domingo)

655278936.name: A sacred and stunning place
655278936.author: a TripAdvisor user
655278936.reviewBody: When you remember that Puebla was originally Mexico\'s capital, it makes sense that they would have this impressive church.  Outside is architecturally grand, but you must see the inside, which is quite ornate.  I enjoy the solitude I always experience in these places.  You will get "the feeling" there.

itemReviewed.name: Church of Santo Domingo (Iglesia de Santo Domingo)

651349966.name: Should be one of the churches you visit in Puebla
651349966.author: a TripAdvisor user
651349966.reviewBody: The interior of this church is a real wow! There are so many churches (70?) in Puebla it is difficult to know which ones to visit but I highly recommend a short visit to this one for its sheer ornateness. Amazing gold gilded alters and ceiling with statues of saints and the Mary. I even took a few photos which I rarely do of the inside of churches.

itemReviewed.name: Church of Santo Domingo (Iglesia de Santo Domingo)

643561469.name: Beautiful church where Capilla Rosario is located
643561469.author: a TripAdvisor user
643561469.reviewBody: By itself this is a stunningly beautiful church with gold leaf altars of carved wood.  Nice statuary.  This is where the unbelievable Capilla del Rosario is located on the front left in a separate wing, making this church an absolute MUST  visit location

itemReviewed.name: Church of Santo Domingo (Iglesia de Santo Domingo)

642244087.name: Surprising!
642244087.author: a TripAdvisor user
642244087.reviewBody: Really surprising place, the Capilla del Rosario is amazing, and to hear the story behind it makes you feel grateful. The temple itself is to admire, take a seat and look at all the angles and small chapels around it, but the Capilla is the place not to miss.

itemReviewed.name: Church of Santo Domingo (Iglesia de Santo Domingo)

639032478.name: Beautiful!!
639032478.author: a TripAdvisor user
639032478.reviewBody: Absolutely huge with a lot of gilt in the interior.  Beautiful burgundy upgrades on the outside upper levels of the building.  Very distinctive.

itemReviewed.name: Church of Santo Domingo (Iglesia de Santo Domingo)

638238871.name: Unique alter and statues
638238871.author: a TripAdvisor user
638238871.reviewBody: The centre piece of this Church is unlike any other that I have seen. The golden interior and many statues causes it to, by no means, be in the shadow of the chapel of the Rosary.

itemReviewed.name: Church of Santo Domingo (Iglesia de Santo Domingo)

636762713.name: So Ornate!
636762713.author: a TripAdvisor user
636762713.reviewBody: This is a beautiful church on a nice walking street.  The chapel of the Rosary inside is a treasure of the city with its gilding (on everything!)

itemReviewed.name: Church of Santo Domingo (Iglesia de Santo Domingo)

633379086.name: Experience in the museum
633379086.author: a TripAdvisor user
633379086.reviewBody: It is a great place to visit, go with family, with friends, with your partner or even alone, a place that offers knowledge and a fun and interesting journey learning about the history of evolution over time of the earth. You can observe different and valuable pieces of art, samples and even animals that lived in the past that we did not know existed, besides being a great place to spend Sunday, walk all day enjoying everything the museum offers you, the experience of knowing, amazed you can learn a lot, always believed that museums are a great opportunity to learn in a different way than conventional, to have fun while you learn, it is a different environment, without stress, without pressure, without any complications, you enjoy being there with probably people you do not know or maybe only, it all depends on how you feel, that\'s another advantage, that you do not necessarily have to be accompanied, you can go only you and absolutely nothing happens

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la Evolucion Puebla (Museum of Evolution Puebla)

address.streetAddress: Ejercito de Oriente esq. Cazadores de Morelia Col. Unidad Civica 5 de Mayo. Los Fuertes

632833723.name: A good museum
632833723.author: a TripAdvisor user
632833723.reviewBody:
This museum shows you the evolution of some animals and besides the evolution of humans. That is why I think this is a very good place to visit and learn, because the museum shows you the evolution with the sculptures of the animals, but also explains the evolution with concrete information. It is a place you can visit with everyone and one thing is guaranteed, you will have fun. 
It is important to say that you will take like one hour at least to walk around the museum, so choose a free day to go there 

I absolutely recommend you to visit this place because you can find a lot of interactive activities to do, you will learn about the evolution of life, and you are going to pass a great time.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la Evolucion Puebla (Museum of Evolution Puebla)

address.streetAddress: Ejercito de Oriente esq. Cazadores de Morelia Col. Unidad Civica 5 de Mayo. Los Fuertes

569289262.name: Fantastic free museum with plenty to see
569289262.author: a TripAdvisor user
569289262.reviewBody: What a great museum with good quality exhibits including huge models of past species. Not particularly interactive but visually very impressive and well designed. \nPlenty of information in Spanish (didn\u2019t see any in English) but that didn\u2019t matter to me. Located near the Planetarium (well worth a visit), small eateries, other museums, the cablecar ride (good for views) and the park... this is a gem of a place. Spent a good hour and a half here. If my 6 year old nephew was older we would have stayed longer.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la Evolucion Puebla (Museum of Evolution Puebla)

address.streetAddress: Ejercito de Oriente esq. Cazadores de Morelia Col. Unidad Civica 5 de Mayo. Los Fuertes

463847139.name: Wonderful museum
463847139.author: a TripAdvisor user
463847139.reviewBody: Very well arranged. My boy loved it. We could see dinosaur fossils, skeletons and replicas, and other animals from different eras.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la Evolucion Puebla (Museum of Evolution Puebla)

address.streetAddress: Ejercito de Oriente esq. Cazadores de Morelia Col. Unidad Civica 5 de Mayo. Los Fuertes

442961712.name: Great fun combined with good science!
442961712.author: a TripAdvisor user
442961712.reviewBody: A must if you have kids. The museum is a great combination of fun, kid-friendly showmanship, combined with good, solid, and very current science that is presented clearly, but never dumbed down. The signage is in Spanish only, but very clearly presented. The taxidermy can be a bit moth-eaten, perhaps, but the displays are nonetheless well done, creative, and engaging. 25 pesos. Take a cab or the teleferico to Los Fuertes.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la Evolucion Puebla (Museum of Evolution Puebla)

address.streetAddress: Ejercito de Oriente esq. Cazadores de Morelia Col. Unidad Civica 5 de Mayo. Los Fuertes

439395168.name: The process of evolution is presented in simple but well prepared museography, easy to be understand for everyone.
439395168.author: a TripAdvisor user
439395168.reviewBody: This is a good place to bring kids and adults as well, the order of the place , space and pieces is well done. There are just a few \u00e1reas where ilumination requires repair but in general is an interesting museum to teach evolution, history and natural science together, and to show that we are the new commers to this world and we need to protect it.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la Evolucion Puebla (Museum of Evolution Puebla)

address.streetAddress: Ejercito de Oriente esq. Cazadores de Morelia Col. Unidad Civica 5 de Mayo. Los Fuertes

677237106.name: Super fun!
677237106.author: a TripAdvisor user
677237106.reviewBody: We loved this museum, especially my 5 year old son! We got there early on a Wednesday, and had the place to ourselves. Admission was about one USD per person, free for kids, which I still can\'t quite believe. After exploring the one part of the museum closest to the ticket office, ducking in and out of various railroad cars, a crossing guard helped us across a busy street to the other side. There, a few cabooses were repurposed as kids play areas, and my kids loved coloring and making little engines. Overall, this was fantastic for little kids, and the adults enjoyed the trip through history too.

644845990.name: A must for train enthusiasts
644845990.author: a TripAdvisor user
644845990.reviewBody: Situated just outside Puebla proper, this is a must stop for train buffs.  What\'s especially interesting is that it consists of a collection of all the kinds of trains that have been used in Mexico, some of which played a major role in the last Mexican civil war. Kids will love it

639029341.name: Great for train buffs
639029341.author: a TripAdvisor user
639029341.reviewBody: If you are a train buff you would enjoy this stop.  2 hours is enough for you to have a good look around.

618054224.name: History
618054224.author: a TripAdvisor user
618054224.reviewBody: Trains played a major role in Mexico\'s last major internal war, and that was so easy to imagine while seeing these magnificent iron beasts. I particularly enjoyed seeing and hearing schoolkids playing amongst the trains

591635998.name: Great collection of vintage and antique trains
591635998.author: a TripAdvisor user
591635998.reviewBody: This museum was well worth the visit with a great collection of old passenger, freight and mail trains once used in Mexico.

539847801.name: Railroad museum in the heart of Puebla
539847801.author: a TripAdvisor user
539847801.reviewBody: Relatively large outdoor collection of railroad engines, cars and apparatus. You can access some but not all exhibits. Unfortunately, the indoor area was closed as we got there later in the afternoon.

532393509.name: Museum is Currently Closed
532393509.author: a TripAdvisor user
532393509.reviewBody: We went to this museum only to find it is closed till further notice, possibly due to the earthquake. You can walk around the outside and see some of the train they have in the yard, but generally is not worth visiting until it re-open. No re-open date has been given.

459159850.name: Great Selection of Trains!
459159850.author: a TripAdvisor user
459159850.reviewBody: We went to the museum with our 3 year old daughter.  When we entered, there was an exhibition of bicycles which, was amazing in itself. We then moved over to look at the trains.  There are a great selection of trains freight to passenger, steam, wooden... you name it.  However, I think that the museum could be more interactive for Children.  We couldn\'t access a lot of the trains but, we were informed that on the \'noche de museos\' where museums are open for free that they would be accessible.  Still, it was nice to go and have a look.

456572701.name: Train buff and cyclist delight!
456572701.author: a TripAdvisor user
456572701.reviewBody: A very large and well cared for exhibit. There were some trains that you could not enter and one which was in really bad shape, but I suppose they had not yet had time to work on them. However, the ones that you were allowed to enter were amazing. All but the ones mentioned above were clean and well cared for for the age that they are. \nWhen we visited the entire interior exhibit was devoted to the history of cycling which as a mountain biker, I really enjoyed, so having two interest catered to in one visit was a joy for me. Well worth the time and the price is close to nothing to enter. \nHowever...the one thing that left a sour taste in our mouths was the security guard, more like a boy in uniform, was seen by my wife going through the checked bags left at the door.

409642931.name: A Truly Unique Museum with a Soon to Open Added Bonus
409642931.author: a TripAdvisor user
409642931.reviewBody: This is a jewel of a museum in Puebla. The grounds are well maintained and the trains on exhibit are authentic recreations. Visitors can hop on and off the trains. One of the best ones is the mail cart - only here can one see this. The curators of the museum conduct detailed research in order to provide the visitor with an authentic experience. \nFurthermore, the museum is home to the Mexican railroad industry archives containing over 200,000 original blueprints, over 40,000 books and 86,000 photographs. Researchers and railroad buffs can access these archives with a special permit from the management and with prior written request. The neo-classical train depot dates back to 1869 and the inside houses traveling exhibits. In November there is an amazing symphony performance supported by a band for a total of 120+ musicians. "Sinfonia al Vapor" by Manuel Escandon and "las 4 Estaciones" by Arturo Marquez, are two classical symphonies performed during this event held at the grounds of the museum. \nThe added bonus comes in the form of an adjacent modern depot with train service to Cholula Passengers will be dropped off right in front of the archaeological site of Cacaxtla. Don\'t miss this museum next time you are in Puebla.

355869228.name: A museum for railroad buffs!
355869228.author: a TripAdvisor user
355869228.reviewBody: The museum has a large and impressive collection of locomotives, assorted cars, cranes, coal cars, cabooses and more!  The outdoor displays are in a park like setting, with many mature trees. Many of the cars are open for a walk thru, including a beautifully restored \u00a8primera clase\u00a8 passenger car.  The sight of all this equipment lined up side by side on about 6 rails, is very impressive!  On the opposite side of the street, and still part of the museum admission, are many more engines and cars under restoration work.  The museum, inside the remodeled Puebla passenger station, is an outstanding exhibition of the history of the railroads in Mexico, going from room to room.  A truly outstanding museum and grounds!

338572395.name: a nice railway musem
338572395.author: a TripAdvisor user
338572395.reviewBody: Lot of steam and diesel trains and very much wagons. You can enter most of the exposed trains. A good place for documentation about trains in Mexico

337546864.name: Great museum
337546864.author: a TripAdvisor user
337546864.reviewBody: It is a great museum for Railroad history in Mexico. Never seen one like this in the Country. Plenty of Engines and Cars to visit. Needs some additional investment, but was a great visit in general.

323393005.name: Many more trains that I expected
323393005.author: a TripAdvisor user
323393005.reviewBody: I have been to many train museums and was pleasantly surprised by the amount of trains at this museum.

290042278.name: Awesome hands-on look at trains
290042278.author: a TripAdvisor user
290042278.reviewBody: This outdoor museum is a nice break from typical sightseeing. They have a ton of train cars you can climb in, and signs explaining the history of the Mexican rails and tying it into the larger narrative of Mexican history. It\'s a very neat place, visually, though I could see some people wanting more narration (especially in English). But if you like trains or are sick of typical museums and want to do something a bit different, I\'d highly recommend it.

249598393.name: Fun for train buffs
249598393.author: a TripAdvisor user
249598393.reviewBody: This was a fun place to visit because I love to look at train cars, and there were plenty of them, some of which you can enter.  There are also nice grounds to walk around.  The security guards were a little overzealous, which was more amusing than annoying.

240275091.name: Getting rusty
240275091.author: a TripAdvisor user
240275091.reviewBody: This Museum shows some steamlocomotives - biggest one a Niagara - operating from late 19th century to the nineteenfifties in Mexico and some diesel locomotovies, freight, cars passenger cars, boilers and other equipment. Had been there in the nineteeneighties the number of exhibits increased but in the same time the condition got more and more rusty.

223533071.name: Not your average museum
223533071.author: a TripAdvisor user
223533071.reviewBody: I\u00b4m not a train fan, but I liked this museum. There were no paintings nor scupltures, hehe, but there was a lot of diffrent types of train wagons, just like you would expect from a "train museum".\nThe wagons are clean and in good shape, the only thing I would llike you to know, is that if you\u00b4re visiting Puebla and you want to go there, it\u00b4s not that close to where most of the hotels are.

216883492.name: An OK Atraction
216883492.author: a TripAdvisor user
216883492.reviewBody: We decided to take the kids to see the trains at the museum of trains in Puebla. The price is extremely cheap as you only have to pay for the adults, which cost less than $1 American dollar each, children are free. There is plenty of train history at the open air section of the museum.  You are allowed to enter about 1/4 of the trains at the museum, which was a big disappointment for the kids. There is also an enclosed museum which explains about construction of the trains in previous decades. You can complete the tour in less than two hours.

205198995.name: A History Lesson to Boot
205198995.author: a TripAdvisor user
205198995.reviewBody: Much of the history of Mexico is integrally linked to the railroad, just like it is in Canada, the US, etc. Great learning experience about the connection and some of the history of Mexico. You see, enter, climb onto different types of locamotives (coal, steam, deisel, etc.), passenger cars, cabooses, mail car, etc,  The yard is huge, the variety impressive.  There are also indoor exhibits regarding how the train parts were made, with really neat vintage videos including one about the use of the trains.  To see the inside of the luxury cars (photos are always available though) you have to arrange an appointment through the office for Tuesday - Friday.  Next visit I will definitively do that. I don\'t know how this one compares with other railroad museums, but certainly for a novice I would recommend it.  Downsides:  if you do not understand a bit of written Spanish you will struggle; you are basically left on your own, with a map of what is where, and while staff on site is helpful, it is there more for security than anything else. I can go to Puebla whenever I like, and it took me a decade to get to this place.  Accordingly, if you are only in the city for a couple of days, unless you have a real interest in railways and Mexican history, this might not be a high priority. But for us, it was great and well worth the time spent.

197979697.name: Worth a couple hours of your time
197979697.author: a TripAdvisor user
197979697.reviewBody: We are not railway buffs, athough having travelled on Mexico\'s only passenger service some two years ago - we were drawn to see something of their former trains. It is some distance from the centre & not best sign posted. The trains & carriages were interesting particualry those you can get inside, although there was not a lot of information. The pity is that they look as though they will simply rust away. \n\nThere is also an inside display with interesting pictures etc & a children\'s play ground adjacent. Enjoy

171992451.name: Great History of the Trains in Mexico
171992451.author: a TripAdvisor user
171992451.reviewBody: I really enjoy walking the museum and then getting to actually go on some of the old trains there... great photo opportunities.

168200890.name: Great place to spend a few hours with kids
168200890.author: a TripAdvisor user
168200890.reviewBody: My 2 year old daughter is currently in love with trains so this was a must on our list of things to do in Puebla. There is a 12 peso fee to get in but it\'s worth being able to get up close with the trains. There are so many trains here and a good mix of traditional commuter trains and the rarer trains, such as a mail train. The art exhibit that was in one of the trains was very interesting about the people that ride on top of trains to get across the country. The bathrooms are some of the cleanest public bathrooms that I have seen in Mexico. Be sure you take advantage of that. I wish the gift shop would have been open when we were there but they had just closed and we didn\'t have time to wait around for them to reopen. I would go again.

153854169.name: Rail museum
153854169.author: a TripAdvisor user
153854169.reviewBody: It is a bit of a walk from the Zocalo at a disused station. You can clam be r over the engines and go into the carriages too.

146735601.name: Give it a miss
146735601.author: a TripAdvisor user
146735601.reviewBody: Don\'t get me wrong, I like trains. The problem with this museum is that the signeage isn\'t very good, and few of the trains are open. It\'s a bit out of the way, so I\'d give it a miss.

146108730.name: Great place for trainspotters and transport nerds
146108730.author: a TripAdvisor user
146108730.reviewBody: Lots of beautiful old trains in spacious grounds. Not really enough information though - I still don\'t know WHY there are barely any trains running in Mexico nowadays - and no staff to ask either. There was a weird modern art exhibition in the main building (the old station), with terrible loud audio. Nobody was there. The space should be used for exhibitions that are informative and relevant to the subject of Mexican railways. Gift shop disappointing - no toy/model trains or decent postcards of the trains exhibited at the museum.

145105294.name: Railroad Buffs Would Love This
145105294.author: a TripAdvisor user
145105294.reviewBody: This is a pretty interactive collection set on a big piece of property, all out in the open air. Visitors are allowed to climb into engines and into some of the passenger cars. There is a real variety of engines, from small to gigantic. They had a few cabooses, which are often ignored in RR museums. I wished they had a good shop with some memorabilia to purchase, especially since they have this great car with reproductions of old photos from the 30s-50s of Mexican movie stars who promoted the rails. Should not be missed.

138264505.name: There is "something" about trains  ???????
138264505.author: a TripAdvisor user
138264505.reviewBody: Yes, there is something about them that pleases the general population.. it is not just reminising, cause even children who have never seen one, smile and love them straight away....   It is why we always feel sad when we come across these memories of them in Mexico.. because that is all that is here now;    there are freight trains of course , but no passenger trains; just the relentless noise and pollution of the myriads of combustion engines on the highways.. sad.\nWe were fortunate to journey on one of the very last services i.e. Morelia to Patzcuaro.  costing .27cents each, for one of the most fabulous days we can remember.. the train was packed with local Indios families and we all had so much fun.   The exhibition itself is interesting , if not a bit daunting as other reviewers have mentioned.. do not go Mondays as is closed.

131448853.name: it\'s ok
131448853.author: a TripAdvisor user
131448853.reviewBody: liked it but could have more train cars open, its more like an outdoor display, we missed a guide, it probably made a difference in our visit.

120613985.name: Awesome
120613985.author: a TripAdvisor user
