120613985.reviewBody: A trip through the past. Neat trains and access to interior. Spend at least 2 hours.

677353957.name: Another interesting Catholic church
677353957.author: a TripAdvisor user
677353957.reviewBody: Interesting tall structure with nice colors.  Great for photography.  Easy walk from the historic center of Puebla.

658903120.name: Historically significant
658903120.author: a TripAdvisor user
658903120.reviewBody: Get an idea of the history of Puebla... this is quite a different cathedral from the other and close to the theater district. A pleasant square with ample public transport options make it a good detour.

655687219.name: Another pretty church in Puebla
655687219.author: a TripAdvisor user
655687219.reviewBody: The Saint Francis church is a contrast to the basilica, in that the architecture is completely different, it is colorful, and is smaller.  But it is no less impressive.  With multiple altars and statues, it is a place for quiet reflection, which you can achieve and appreciate even if you are not a Catholic.  I like to collect these feelings and save them for later.

641890376.name: One of most interesting and beautiful churches in Puebla
641890376.author: a TripAdvisor user
641890376.reviewBody: Beautiful both inside and out and it\'s huge three stunning altars inside with a mummified saint on one of the altars. The main fascade is as it was in the 16 th century.  Would take avtourvto getbthe history.  Beautifully lit at nght and can be seen from almost anywhere in the city.

638239315.name: The Yellow Temple
638239315.author: a TripAdvisor user
638239315.reviewBody: This beautifully coloured Church is one of the first things that you will witness upon arrival into the centre of Puebla. It stands at a decent height and serves for a great picture. It is not visited as highly as the other cathedrals and churches and the square just in front is often empty and thus making for a great photo.

631318151.name: Landmark Church for us
631318151.author: a TripAdvisor user
631318151.reviewBody: We could see this church from almost every street in the historic area, was close to our hotel, the Ikonik and was brightly lit at night, a familiar sight which we used to negotiate the streets at night from the central square and restaurants, markets etc back to our hotel at night.

581301435.name: Beautiful!
581301435.author: a TripAdvisor user
581301435.reviewBody: Gorgeous facade and amazing history. Highly recommend going with a guide who can explain the history. Also has a glass \u2018coffin\u2019 with a mummified saint inside. \u2018Creepy\u2019 according to the kids in our groom. Very interesting to the adults. \n

547924678.name: Pretty interior and front facade
547924678.author: a TripAdvisor user
547924678.reviewBody: This church is located east of the highway. The interior is worth a short trip. And the facade is also worth seeing.

478639531.name: Beautiful Church
478639531.author: a TripAdvisor user
478639531.reviewBody: Seeing both during the day and in the evening, I\'m not actually sure which I prefer more!  It\'s got beautiful tile work on the front and e rest is painted in lively colors.  The front courtyard is wide open and lovely and seem d like there were always people milling around it. \n\nThe church inside was quite pretty too, as are most of the lovely historical churches around the city. If you visit puebla, it would be a shame to miss is as it\'s a fairly short walk from the main zocalo - maybe10-15 minutes away. Quite the lovely area around the building too.

459731073.name: A wonderful mix of cultures.
459731073.author: a TripAdvisor user
459731073.reviewBody: Mexican style baroque they call it.  Talavera and baroque decoration.  Just the outside is lovely ceramic.  The inside is as ornate as any other church in Puebla.     \n\nWorth a trip.   A small cemetery in the front

443331150.name: Beautiful and fascinating
443331150.author: a TripAdvisor user
443331150.reviewBody: I walked here from the Z\u00f3calo, passing through the Mercado el Parian and was immediately struck by the size and beauty of the facade that became even more impressive as I got closer. The inside was stark compared to the outside, but impressive in its own right. There was a good amount of information about Fry Sebation de Aparicio whose undecomposed body is on display. It was fascinating. The attached school was letting out when I was leaving, lots of positive energy. Seeing the parents cars packed into a small parking area in front would make US parents appreciate whatever school pickup situation they experience at home. Also in the plaza, a friar was leading older students in a performance rehearsal. This was a nice place to spend some time and watch everyday life in Puebla.

417999946.name: Huge!
417999946.author: a TripAdvisor user
417999946.reviewBody: It\u00b4s in a die of the downtown. walking distance. It\u00b4s really big, with a lot of history about the first 12 Francisacanos that arrived to Puebla. Pls review in detail the main entrance door, it\u00b4s amazing.

380882855.name: Worth a visit.
380882855.author: a TripAdvisor user
380882855.reviewBody: There is an abundance of churches in Puebla, but this is one of the handful that is worth seeing.  Exquisite interior.

347966772.name: Best tiled church in Puebla
347966772.author: a TripAdvisor user
347966772.reviewBody: This church is a short walk west of the centro historico, but worth a visit to view the front facade\'s tiled surface.  There is a side chapel containing the body of a Franciscan friar that kids may find suitably creepy, but the main attraction is outside.  There is also lively commerce in the front plaza.

270980480.name: This is one of the great monuments of the XVI C
270980480.author: a TripAdvisor user
270980480.reviewBody: Go to see this. It is a monument that has to be seen to understand the evangelisation of M\u00e9xico. The Franciscan library and the monastery are incredible.

617512097.name: Regular
617512097.author: a TripAdvisor user
617512097.reviewBody: It\'s not that great, I think it\'s all mounted I didn\'t end up satisfied with the place, the people I the other hand, it\'s really polite and three guides speak in a kind of singing tone that it\'s really amusing,. I recommend this place only if you\'re close by that zone, we traveled by bus like 4 hours changing buses to get there and again 4 to get back and I believe it wasn\'t that great for the effort

586925695.name: Fun thing to descend into the crater of this smallest volcano
586925695.author: a TripAdvisor user
586925695.reviewBody: Cute attractions and fun thing to do. I bit out of the way but if you have time on your hands and like to see more of Puebla, this is a cute trip.

569889742.name: Cool spot
569889742.author: a TripAdvisor user
569889742.reviewBody: Neat little volcano to climb into. Enjoyed the temperature change and tbh it\u2019s a bit of a novelty but worth it if you are in Puebla.

567205872.name: Smallest volcano
567205872.author: a TripAdvisor user
567205872.reviewBody: Nice experience. It is cool to say you\'ve been inside a volcano there is a small park right next to the volcano.

523004812.name: Small...yet interesting.
523004812.author: a TripAdvisor user
523004812.reviewBody: It was interesting to visit a inactive volcano after hundreds of years. Stairs 60 feet down in a spiral. The walls with the volcanic characteristic that makes you think how awesome it is to be standing inside it. Not much to look at but yet there is much to touch and feel.

475519225.name: Double check GPS directions!!
475519225.author: a TripAdvisor user
475519225.reviewBody: Before goes to visit volcano check location. GPS Directions which are here are wrong! Anyway volcano is geat.

458481876.name: Cute baby volcano
458481876.author: a TripAdvisor user
458481876.reviewBody: It\'s an adorable small inactive volcano that you can go down into. There\'s a little pond at the bottom with some fish, and it\'s fun to say you\'ve been inside the smallest volcano.

428557682.name: Nice small "Volcano"
428557682.author: a TripAdvisor user
428557682.reviewBody: The Location is not easy to find, the location at Trip adviser was wrong search in GoogleMaps directly for it.\nNice to be there for a short trip notthing to plan for a day.

428331207.name: You can go inside the smallest vulcan
428331207.author: a TripAdvisor user
428331207.reviewBody: Short and funny thing to do. You can go inside of the smallest vulcan on earth. Short stairway down. Middle of the city. Small entry fee.

424822923.name: Smallest Volcano Ever
424822923.author: a TripAdvisor user
424822923.reviewBody: Spend 30 minutes here. If you speak Spanish, be prepared to be visited by Gabriel or one his brothers who will give the most animated talk on the history of the volcano. You will be entertained and will laugh your head off. Stair down 60 feet into the crater of a small inactive volcano in the center of town.

422165638.name: If you are a geologist- Must see.  Otherwise- Meh
422165638.author: a TripAdvisor user
422165638.reviewBody: This is the worlds smallest volcano.  You can pay a few pesos and climb the fifty feet or so to descend a spiral staircase into the throat.  At the bottom are springs with blind fish.  If you\'re not that into geology, I wouldn\'t bother with the site.

330033408.name: Not much to see but lots to eat !
330033408.author: a TripAdvisor user
330033408.reviewBody: Not so much as a hole in the ground with a mound above still a mini volcano, but a few steps away from it teres a Market full of the tastiest choices in endemic food! dont be afraid to try, enjoy!

298497823.name: not recomended
298497823.author: a TripAdvisor user
298497823.reviewBody: this place suppose to be one of the smallest volcanos with cr\u00e1ter on earth , but the places is not in very good conditions and there is no more to see in the arrounds

261345144.name: Amazing little volcano!!!!!!!
261345144.author: a TripAdvisor user
261345144.reviewBody: I was in Puebla and saw the site on the map, it is also call Volcancito, you have to take a taxi and hopefully the driver will know the location....is a cool visit and it is an extinct crater from the towering volcano a few miles away....worth the visit just to understand how it works.....takes a few minutes to visit and take pictures but worth it.! Very recommended if in Puebla.\nBy the way, most locals do not know the place.

244078467.name: If you\u00b4re in town for a whole week
244078467.author: a TripAdvisor user
244078467.reviewBody:
First of all, it´s not that easy to find because it´s far from downtown Puebla. Try using google maps, because we asked a couple of people and they didn´t know the place or what it was.
When you get there, you go up a latter and then you go down inside the “mini volcano” (don´t wear a skirt), where you can stay for a while. I heard there was a small cafe, but the day I went, it wasn´t there. There´s a little cascade like fountain, and that´s pretty much it.
I´m not sure what to say about the topic regarding being a mini volcano because I´ve heard from some people that “it is an inactive volcano”, and some that it´s not.
I wouldn´t recommend to make a trip out of it, but if you´re curious and have some spare time, go take a look.

230015079.name: Definitely recommended!  Short, cool stop.
230015079.author: a TripAdvisor user
230015079.reviewBody: This little gem is tucked away in a neighborhood and has a small market attached.  It also has several cool jungle gyms / play structures on the grounds.  \n\nIt\'s a quick stop and reasonably priced.  The question is, is it the worlds smallest volcano or largest spring...don\'t know but it is worth the stop.  My kids really liked it.

216890912.name: Good Short Trip
216890912.author: a TripAdvisor user
216890912.reviewBody: According to the sign, this is the worlds smallest volcano. It only cost 10 peso to go in. Don\'t be fooled by the outside stairs thinking that you are only going to peer inside the volcano. They actually have stairs that lead down into the crater. There is a cool little waterfall around the inside part of the crater. I overheard a guide state that the waterfall is natural, but I doubt it. You can be in and out within 10-15 minutes.  There was an older gentleman outside of the park area selling homemade ice cream for 7 pesos. He had a cheese ice cream, similar to cheesecake, which was delicious.

192613266.name: Nice short-trip if you are close-by
192613266.author: a TripAdvisor user
192613266.reviewBody: For us - living in Puebla for a certain time - it was nice to visit this volcanito. It is something special, standing there in the middle of the suburbs and it is fun climbing into the hill and image yourself where the tunnels go and how everything is connected with each other - even this tiny volcano. Maybe especially nice for kids

153771023.name: Interesting for a short trip.
153771023.author: a TripAdvisor user
153771023.reviewBody: The Cuexcomate volcano is interesting for a short visit, but realize that it is out in one of the suburbs of Puebla in the middle of a neighborhood that does not get a lot of outside traffic. If you take a taxi here it would be smart to have the cab wait for you while you see the volcano -- it should take no longer than five or ten minutes and it will save you the hassle of waiting for another taxi to drive by.\n\nAs of March, 2013 the stairway to the top of the volcano is closed off for repairs so we could only view it from the bottom.

623634880.name: Excellent adventure walk through Puebla\'s History!
623634880.author: a TripAdvisor user
623634880.reviewBody: This was a great day adventure in the city of Puebla! The entrance was a little tricky to find but it is located outside of Los Fuertes (Calle 2 Nte 2602A, Barrio de Xanenetla, 72990 Puebla, Pue., Mexico) but it will lead you to Los Fuertes at the exit. I definitely recommend the guided tour. Super enjoyable tour but not sure very small kids would enjoy this.

614236344.name: Interesting adventure
614236344.author: a TripAdvisor user
614236344.reviewBody: Going to ciuda mural Xanenetla is an adventure that you should do if you want to know better Puebla.  Everything is safe.

601771533.name: Excellent underground city tour!
601771533.author: a TripAdvisor user
601771533.reviewBody: Another must see in Puebla. Walking through the underground tunnels you are taken back in time to the era of 5 de Mayo. Very nice tour guide that offers tours in Spanish and English. The entrance fee is only 25pesos and the tour guide is free, but we gave a tip at the end. If you are looking for something different to do then this is a great place to go. The tour is only about 30 minutes. I suggest a closed toe shoe for this tour.

600808022.name: Secret Tunnels of Puebla
600808022.author: a TripAdvisor user
600808022.reviewBody: These tunnels we discover not so long ago, and they were supposed to be used by the Mexican Army against the French invasion of 1862. They are now a museum alike place, with a nice environment and some photos and in-site artifacts that were hidden through the years. The tunnels are clean and they do not smell (perhaps they did couple of years ago). They are very well lit, and with some explanations about the history of the place, although this is just in Spanish \u2013 a big plus would be to have these signs in English or French (as many French visitors may come \u2013 a little part of their history in Puebla). You can ask for a free guide in the beginning of the tunnel.\nYou walk underground in two different sections, with a slight upward slope \u2013 be aware of this. You have to go inside the tunnels through \u20185 de Mayo avenue\u2019, and the exit is next to the park of Loreto Fortress. If you arrive by car, there\u2019s a free parking lot next to the exit, then you\u2019ll walk downhill to the tunnels entrance.\nThe park itself is a nice place to walk around, and visit the other museums located there.

600033483.name: Secret Treasure of Puebla
600033483.author: a TripAdvisor user
600033483.reviewBody:
5*p El Pasaje de 5 de Mayo
One of the secret treasures of Puebla
A series of underground tunnels, used by the clergy, army, and hospital to transport people and things to other churches, hospital
Played a prevalent role in the Battle of Puebla
Well-maintained with explanations in Spanish along the passageways
There is an admission charge

504276937.name: Overwhelming smell, very short
504276937.author: a TripAdvisor user
504276937.reviewBody: We weren\'t sure what we were looking for but the sewer smell was so overwhelming that we practically ran through this short tunnel. When we got to the end, we laughed and said, well that was a waste of time and money.

501344514.name: Great spot!
501344514.author: a TripAdvisor user
501344514.reviewBody: This shows some of the tunnels that run under the city of Puebla. For many years it was rumored that tunnels ran from the cathedral to the forts. They found and opened two sections- this one being the bigger and better section. I was amazed by what they have done with the tunnels! I highly recommend checking them out for a taste of history.

431268318.name: a just found understreet passage
431268318.author: a TripAdvisor user
431268318.reviewBody: it is certainly a lovely stroll in a most beautifull carved  and stone pasted passage that begins in the 5 de mayo av.. and they still don\u00b4t know where does it ends!!. But what they have already rescued it certainly worth a visit. \nbeautifull light through the whole tunnel, fresh air, and lovely place...\nI ould certainly would take pictures there for a the bride & groom, or for aut couture magazines

642718049.name: Shopping
642718049.author: a TripAdvisor user
642718049.reviewBody: Spent 2 hours shopping and had some sushi for lunch, was quite easy to access the shopping centre by the road and parking was only $20 pesos for the 2 hours. Considering it was New Year\u2019s Eve and quite busy it was still comfortable to get around. Pros lots of choice for food and shopping. Cons none to mention really it was a straightforward easy visit. If your looking to find it just look for the big wheel it\u2019s exactly opposite the shopping centre.

582314081.name: Lots of shops
582314081.author: a TripAdvisor user
582314081.reviewBody: Nice shopping mall to wander around, has lots of shops and plenty of people attending in the stores.

553804709.name: A mall like any other
553804709.author: a TripAdvisor user
553804709.reviewBody: Not really a tourist attraction. We needed to buy some clothes for an event but otherwise can\'t find a reason to visit. \n Nice mall but just a mall

501591162.name: A nice mall
501591162.author: a TripAdvisor user
501591162.reviewBody: It\'s not a tourist attraction, but it\'s actually a pretty naive mall. We usually stop here because of the food court. There\'s a lot of options, so the whole family can get what they want!

479640254.name: Shopping destination for locals, nothing to see
479640254.author: a TripAdvisor user
479640254.reviewBody: This is a very nice shopping center but there is nothing interesting to see if you are trying to see cultural or traditional things

476178837.name: A mall
476178837.author: a TripAdvisor user
476178837.reviewBody: Just another mall in case you need to do some shopping while around. Should find most things you need.

467693112.name: I liked it, nice place.
467693112.author: a TripAdvisor user
467693112.reviewBody: I likes the place, there are many restaurants, stores and movie theaters...It is good but nothing extraordinary but pretty comfortable...

453484184.name: Without the ferris wheel, there\'d be no reason to visit.
453484184.author: a TripAdvisor user
453484184.reviewBody: We visited Angelopolis mall because we wanted to ride the Puebla Star ferris wheel.  The ride was great but the mall itself is pretty ordinary - with the same variety of chain stores you might find at any mall in any city.  Of course, there are many traditional mercados in the centro historico but, if you really want a modern shopping mall, the Gallerias Serdan is architecturally much more interesting.

431638063.name: Great city views
431638063.author: a TripAdvisor user
431638063.reviewBody: We visited Puebla with some friends that include some locals. We had a great time getting on the Ferris wheel was the highlight of being in Angelopis. The line move quick and the staff was helpful getting on and off the Ferris wheel. If I ever be back I would love to go back.

417966453.name: Just a mall
417966453.author: a TripAdvisor user
417966453.reviewBody: Good shopping location for locals but nothing interesting to see here from a tourist/ traditional perspective

375136503.name: Amazing view of the city from the top.
375136503.author: a TripAdvisor user
375136503.reviewBody: Is a very pretty start wheel, but some times is closedown for maintenance even know that the web site shows is open. The ticket is around 2 or 3 dollars and 30 dollars for VIP for 6 people and you have a 5 point view, the bottom of the capsule is clear glass.I think is the biggest one in America.

338157843.name: Cool place to visit at night
338157843.author: a TripAdvisor user
338157843.reviewBody: I came during the winter holidays so there was a lot of lighted objects which made for a beautiful view. I went on the eye of puebla and it was a nice view and not a long line.

316605887.name: High End Mall with American and European Stores.
316605887.author: a TripAdvisor user
316605887.reviewBody: This is a high-end mall.  It has many US stores like Ann Taylor Loft, Nine West, Guess but I find them overpriced.  The European stores like Mango and Zara were better value and the local stores like Lob were even better.  The mall is anchored by high end department stores Liverpool and El Palacio del Hierro.  Both have great food courts with a lot of choice for gourmet food.  Liverpool also has Banana Republic and Gap inside.

313560450.name: Huge mega-mall in Puebla ... the enormous semi-new ferris wheel is interesting, especially when lit up. Nothing more!
313560450.author: a TripAdvisor user
313560450.reviewBody: Huge mega-mall in Puebla ... the enormous semi-new ferris wheel is interesting, especially when lit up. Nothing more!

291289021.name: Only shopping and food
291289021.author: a TripAdvisor user
291289021.reviewBody:
The only thing I like is watching people to get an impression of Mexicans with an above-average and higher income.
That's not the real life of México just a stereotype of an US mall. 

Positive: you have a great variety of bars and restaurants.

273202974.name: Pleasant but crowded
273202974.author: a TripAdvisor user
273202974.reviewBody: The place is full of good restaurants and shops and of course you can go to the cinema there, but for me it is too crowded and the prices are high.

173156085.name: The mall !!
173156085.author: a TripAdvisor user
173156085.reviewBody: Amazing mall love Liverpool.  Other large stores are Sears and Palacio. THE place to shop in Puebla! Stores from Europe the US and Mexico. he luxury collection has your high end designers. Close by are Home Depot Costco mega superstore. You have to pay to park here and you have to pay the fee in the mall before you leave. Sometimes i forget and have to run back in which is inconvenient. There also is a casino here and many restaurants to chose from. And a food court. Very impressive beautiful mall.,.

677353413.name: Fun market
677353413.author: a TripAdvisor user
677353413.reviewBody: Spent lots of time walking around this well kept market street and purchased some beautiful Talavera ceramic. Lots of fun stuff for sale at affordable prices. Also great for photography.

670142973.name: Affordable souvenirs
670142973.author: a TripAdvisor user
670142973.reviewBody: You can get many ceramic pottery in this place with affordable pricing. It\u2019s nice to stroll around to see the local products and have some small snacks from the street vendors. We went there on Sunday afternoon but the market was quite empty and quiet which makes it comfortable to walkby.

668772224.name: Plan to spend time here!
668772224.author: a TripAdvisor user
668772224.reviewBody: There is a lot to see, eat, hear, and buy so plan to spend at least a few hours strolling through the mercado.

662595886.name: I love the market!
662595886.author: a TripAdvisor user
662595886.reviewBody: So glad to have the opportunity to visit the market. a must when in any city and this one in Puebla should be visited.

658866525.name: All the local stuff
658866525.author: a TripAdvisor user
658866525.reviewBody: Great selection of tourist tchotchkes.\nFair prices and some quality if you ask and look. Extraordinary variety,\nPleasant shop keepers.

655274527.name: Recommended experience
655274527.author: a TripAdvisor user
655274527.reviewBody: This market covers several blocks.  It is easy to get turned around, so if you are with other people, designate a meeting place first, such as the large cross.  This place has it all:  typical souvenirs, original artwork, nice tee shirts, roasted insects (yes!) snacks, clothing, woven goods, pottery, and more.  I didn\'t feel "bothered" by anyone; no one was aggressive about selling their wares.  All of the merchants from whom I purchased anything made sure I was getting the best exchange rate possible.  I found this market quite enjoyable and would go back in a heartbeat.

654393651.name: Wasn\u2019t what I thought it would be!
654393651.author: a TripAdvisor user
654393651.reviewBody:
Good if you want souvenirs 

It seemed like every vender had the same product but at different prices.  

Wasn’t as large as I thought it would be, went through in 18 minutes and I went into just about every venders shop.

653274453.name: Beautiful at night
653274453.author: a TripAdvisor user
653274453.reviewBody: We walked through the market one early evening. It was very interesting. We especially enjoyed looking at the artist\'s studio spaces. Artists were working in some of the spaces and displaying their work.\n\nWhile there is good original art to be found, there is also a large amount of typical tourist trinkets.  However, there is an interesting selection and the prices are very reasonable.

647422501.name: Tourist heaven
647422501.author: a TripAdvisor user
647422501.reviewBody: This is a great market with all sorts of handicrafts at very competitive prices. Bargaining is fine and it\u2019s hard not to fall into temptation.

646204486.name: Even short on time, great
646204486.author: a TripAdvisor user
646204486.reviewBody: A lively small market worth exploring if we had more time. If looking for the Puebla talavera pottery, many stalls offer it here. Negotiate and bargain with shopkeepers and there pre-teen salespeople (usually a relative). Be careful not to touch or knock anything over as you may be liable for the damage. A nice market!

645824655.name: Amazing Mercado
645824655.author: a TripAdvisor user
645824655.reviewBody: There is anything and everything you could need here.  I had a good time just looking around, and did end up purchasing a couple of small things as gifts.  They had everything from children\'s toys to pottery.

644852116.name: Part of walking street complex--- souvenirs
644852116.author: a TripAdvisor user
644852116.reviewBody: One of the better areas to walk around if you are looking for souvenirs.  We have friends who collect refrigerator magnets from different places.  We found some great ones here for about $1 each.

637704537.name: Mainly colorful mass produced souvenir items.
637704537.author: a TripAdvisor user
637704537.reviewBody: The stalls  mainly provide the type of cheap glitzy wares that tourists the world over seem to buy to take home, for some reason. This type of market is becoming more common in Mexico as time goes by.  A few vendors offer onyx pieces and pretty talavera-type pottery and if you have the energy you can look through their stock. No one sells true talavera pottery (licensed by the government and marked on the bottom DO4 with the workshop/maker name on the bottom) here except for the Talavera Armando shops sprinkled on both sides of the street up from the market. Some of the other stores do offer very attractive type talavera at very good prices.

636762501.name: Nothing terribly high quality or unique
636762501.author: a TripAdvisor user
636762501.reviewBody: This is a tourist market with many of the same items, and nothing too compelling.  Still, it is a nice stroll and an atmospheric place.

634855066.name: Great Stop
634855066.author: a TripAdvisor user
634855066.reviewBody: Great place for local gifts, just do not go early, things are not fully up and running till\n12 to 1pm.

633630528.name: The best place for all your souvenir shopping needs.
633630528.author: a TripAdvisor user
633630528.reviewBody: There is so much here you will find it really hard to choose! So many beautiful hand-crafted items. If you go to the city of Puebla, you must go here. By the way, its just a block away from the Barrio del Artista.

621375489.name: Amazing colorful market
621375489.author: a TripAdvisor user
621375489.reviewBody: This souvenir market is amazing, so rounded with amazing food, traditional candies and very nice people, you can find great things to take with you as souvenirs.

613956946.name: Craft market
613956946.author: a TripAdvisor user
613956946.reviewBody: This is a market with plenty of crafts and handmade creations that are providing an idea of local culture.

611072402.name: Wonderful Arts and Crafts market
611072402.author: a TripAdvisor user
611072402.reviewBody: This is a wonderful arts and crafts market in the historic district of Puebla. It is an easy walk from the central plaza, with food, "shaved" ice and ice cream vendors along the way!! The market had a lot of different booths with different kinds of arts and crafts. I was especially attracted to some Alibrijes from Oaxaca...

608660628.name: Looking for a traditional market in Puebla? This is it!!
608660628.author: a TripAdvisor user
608660628.reviewBody: Mercado El Parian is the best traditional market in Puebla to get the local flavor and buy handcrafts, candies and clothes tailored by communities with natural fibers and tints the way it was done before the colony. Merchants are welcoming and warm, they accept US dollars and Euros and some even take credit cards. Just make sure you allow for enough time to browse around.

601257832.name: Place to buy souvenirs.
601257832.author: a TripAdvisor user
601257832.reviewBody: This is the souvenir market. One stop, many shops. Got to negotiate the prices; they are expecting you to do that.

600868562.name: More less.
600868562.author: a TripAdvisor user
600868562.reviewBody:
If you are in Puebla you have to see the market. But to be honest is not that good.
You can finde Same artesanías everywhere In Mexico. 
But if you have a free time and enjoy artesanías you have to go.

598987110.name: beware the price differences
598987110.author: a TripAdvisor user
598987110.reviewBody: its seems many places sell the exact same items so do your homework before you shop as you may find the same item at anither stall for less, also make sure you are buying items made by artisans in the country and not cheap imitations produced in POC.

591785743.name: Colorful market
591785743.author: a TripAdvisor user
591785743.reviewBody: Waiting till the rain and thunderstorm was over, we strolled around the market with all the nice souvenirs. Too much to choose from. Very nice neighborhood, friendly stall holders.

578356775.name: Artisan shops for Talavera products.
578356775.author: a TripAdvisor user
578356775.reviewBody: There are dozens of shops with real Talavera products mixed in with "Talavera like" products.  Often they are hard to tell apart, but "real" Talavera is a government  sanctioned product, ans some made in the same style is not "real" Talavera, but  can still be very nice.  Generally the certified "real" Talavera commands a higher price, but sometimes the non certified is sold for the same price - it is Mexico!  There seems to be an endless supply of what ever one is looking for - plates, tiles, flower vases and wall and house decorations, that are pretty and nice, and  does it matter if they are not "real" Talavera.  Some of the colors used in the "knock offs" are brighter than the official colors used to produce certified Talavera.  I have a nice collection of both and I love it all.  The prices are really very low compared to being the same item imported to the US.  A $1 item in the Parian market might be found for $20-30 in a US gift shop.  It is really a "don\'t miss" place in the central historic part of Puebla.

572220191.name: Handmade in Mexico
572220191.author: a TripAdvisor user
572220191.reviewBody: We got Talavera items made from local earths at this place for astounding low prices. The talavera in some booths was better quality than some tourist "fabricas" in town. Typical Mexican children\'s toys here too. I saw nothing with a "made in China" tag on it. A fun walk with lots of interesting items.

568346150.name: Need a Gift?
568346150.author: a TripAdvisor user
568346150.reviewBody: Mercado El Parian is a place you both avoid and succumb to: it crawls with tourists doing the exact same thing you don\'t want to do, but are going to do: buy souvenirs. You can find a plethora of tourist grade "arts and crafts" here made in Mexico and probably China as well. Don\'t despair, go with the flow. Buy something if you like it, keep moving if it doesn\'t fit the bill.

567587437.name: Guided tour by top chef
567587437.author: a TripAdvisor user
567587437.reviewBody: If you like local markets, this one close to downtown displays everything you need.   The fruit and vegetable stalls are fascinating. High quality produce including fruits,vegetables and herbs unfamiliar outside of Mexico. One stall offered a fruit that tasted like pumpkin pie filling and nearby was one offering fresh ground peanut butter. A full range of fresh and dried chilis are available. Around the corner is a automated tortilla shop as good as handmade.

567029240.name: Souvenirs!!!!
567029240.author: a TripAdvisor user
567029240.reviewBody: Need something to take away from Puebla ? This is your place. \nIn my case I was looking for stone crucibles that they use to put the salsa in (called molcajetes) and this was the place I finally found them. Even though there is a lot of repetition, if you like the kind of artifacts sold here you will enjoy visiting this place.

563598846.name: Cute souvenirs
563598846.author: a TripAdvisor user
563598846.reviewBody: It\'s a nice stroll. The market is only 3 streets wide and has a good variety of local ceramics (talavera), key chains, shirts, sweets, and other souvenirs. The sellers aren\'t usually too pushy, either.

561591702.name: Take a piece of Puebla with you!
561591702.author: a TripAdvisor user
561591702.reviewBody: You can find awesome souvenirs in this place, things to take for family and friends,and for yourself.  It is so picturesque!  Always remember to bargain when buying stuff.

559436160.name: Fun to browse the many stalls and look for Talavera bargains!
559436160.author: a TripAdvisor user
559436160.reviewBody: Mercado el Parian is a bustling tourist fun place, about 15 minute walking distance from the zocalo. There is a multitude of Talavera pottery for sale and nearby is the Armando Talavera factory, worth a short visit. We found some excellent, reasonably priced pieces at Glafis, which manages market stalls 38,39 and 40. Cash payments attract about 20% discount (if you ask for a discount that is). The Barrio de Artista is an extension of the El Parian market and hosts a number of art shops as well as cafes and restaurants. While sitting outdoors having a drink we were bombarded with vendors of all kinds, so we moved inside to get away from this nuisance. All in all a colourful and fun area to visit and not to be missed on your Puebla visit.

559397212.name: Great shopping
559397212.author: a TripAdvisor user
559397212.reviewBody: El Mercado el Parian is a concentrated area of craft shops where it is possible to find all sorts of crafts produced in Mexico....some hand made and some mass produced.  Very easy and interesting walk from the Zocolo.  Little pressure to buy but you will not be able to resist...low price point.\nWalk thru to the Barrio des Artistes.....nice cafes.

558911505.name: Excellent Talavera pottery stores in the neighborhood
558911505.author: a TripAdvisor user
558911505.reviewBody: The Mercado is just OK, but there are a lot of high end Talavera shops fronting the Mercado with better quality goods than in the Mercado. There is a lot of reconstruction in the area, I assume from previous earthquakes. However it is worth the walk from the Zocalo.  The couple with us did buy some pottery.

557786553.name: Plenty to see
557786553.author: a TripAdvisor user
557786553.reviewBody: This was well worth a visit. I went twice! First on a Sunday when it was buzzing and then on Monday morning which was much quieter. Really good craft market with friendly stall holders.

555747999.name: Typical Artesania Market
555747999.author: a TripAdvisor user
555747999.reviewBody: This is the typical market that sells Mexican clothing, textiles. You can find these wares anywhere in Mexico. The only thing is is different is the ceramics from Talavera. It is small and make sure you bargain.

554805938.name: Tourist trap
554805938.author: a TripAdvisor user
554805938.reviewBody:
Mostly trinkets and trash directed towards tourists. Lots of low quality swag junk.

We did not see any artisan products, Just anonymous large volume stuff.

Why bother?

553588139.name: Nice talavera of varied quality
553588139.author: a TripAdvisor user
553588139.reviewBody: It is nice just to stroll and browse souvenirs such as t-shirts, regional clothing and odds and ends, but the main pull is the tile, or talavera. Just make sure you know what you buy, not everything is talavera, but glazed ceramic. Still nice, but not as durable  or wellmade.\nA wellknown gallery is gallerias Armando, they have several shops and a huge selection of everything from lampbases to sculptures to classic dinnerwaresets!\n

547922561.name: Busy market with many stalls
547922561.author: a TripAdvisor user
547922561.reviewBody: This is a great place to buy souvenirs from Puebla. The merchants are not too aggresive, but the market can get very crowded.

513886322.name: Good offers on everything, from talavera to grocery bags
513886322.author: a TripAdvisor user
513886322.reviewBody: We spent one morning here, roamed the place and ended up purchasing some gifts and talavera digits (address digits). If you want onix stone stuff there is a place accross the street from it, there are also about a dozen places to eat withing half a block of it. \nYou can also get good deals with the "walkers", people selling you fruits, cinnamon, etc. If you wsnt Mole for daily use, a\u00f1mosr everybody will sell you that from a couple different sources at around 70/80 MX pesos per kilogram(presentarion is in 500gram bins, about 18oz). If you want artisan Mole like the one with almonds, it will cost you 110-120/kilogram MX pesos, but those are only available in the restaurants around the market. Overall it is worth the trip, it is about 1/2 mile away from the main plaza (zocalo), and you can also enjoy several churches/chapels on your way there!

507600256.name: Great stop for souvenirs and more
507600256.author: a TripAdvisor user
507600256.reviewBody: The Parian is a market of many vendors offering beautiful locally made crafts. The market has such varieties and great prices. You will find "Talavera " (which is the local made ceramic for which Puebla is known), textiles, local sweets and candies and so much more, everything at the best prices. Don\'t forget to visit!

507438143.name: Fun Finds
507438143.author: a TripAdvisor user
507438143.reviewBody: Walking through I found some fun items that were great for gifts.  There were also the cheap little items but I skipped past those.  You will find items full of color like the skulls often found in Mexico as well as plates and  even candy.  You can be sure to find something for everyone on your list including yourself!

505637030.name: Too much "Mexican Curious" with low quality
505637030.author: a TripAdvisor user
505637030.reviewBody: This "mercado" is OK if you want to get a souvenir, a cheap souvenir, but it is nothing great, under my very personal point of view. I think that the City of Puebla has better places where you can get better souvenirs...with better quality !

503839714.name: El Parian
503839714.author: a TripAdvisor user
503839714.reviewBody: Great place to go shopping for all kinds of hand made things. Loved it very much. Enjoyed the architectue, talavera, food, people watching etc.. Not too far feom here is the Buba Bridge which unfortunately I didnt go to because we arrived late.

498980919.name: Nice market full of Mexicana
498980919.author: a TripAdvisor user
498980919.reviewBody: Lots and lots of crafts here , especially the city\'s famous tiles. The market itself is very pretty with unusual architecture. It is at the entrance of the artistic quarter of Puebla. The salespeople are friendly but not pushy, it is a great experience to visit this market.

498661238.name: This is a place you would want to walk for a little bit
498661238.author: a TripAdvisor user
498661238.reviewBody: Not just because it\'s a very old building full of stories and beautiful corners, but because you can also buy the best craft and the typical talavera in one of the real markets where local people buy from.

496371655.name: A mix of the good, the bad and he ugly
496371655.author: a TripAdvisor user
496371655.reviewBody:
Mainly a market of handicrafts, with eateries and bric-a-brac mixed in.
If you want real talavera it's hard to find and hidden amongst the cheaper ceramic ( still pretty)
Sebastian and Armando ( several stores) carry the real deal and will pack and ship .

491117520.name: OK market with mix of tourist-oriented tchotchkes and local handicrafts
491117520.author: a TripAdvisor user
491117520.reviewBody: OK place for inexpensive souvenirs but hardly a necessary stop in a city where onyx and pottery is so reasonably priced in higher end stores..

490516129.name: Good deals on flea market
490516129.author: a TripAdvisor user
490516129.reviewBody: Walking down the streets of Puebla, you\'re bound to pass by this flea market where a lot of souvenirs, shirts, ceramics and the like are sold to passing tourists. The talaveras or tiles abound this market, and a lot of handicrafts made by locals are sold at low prices. You can grab a hat here if you intend to stay under the sun! Cheap...

488291897.name: Local
488291897.author: a TripAdvisor user
488291897.reviewBody: Nice ambience but I think that people doesn\'t take you seriously and they just want to sell their stuff. They often put music that is not appropriate for the place.

480341981.name: Great shopping for Talvera
480341981.author: a TripAdvisor user
480341981.reviewBody: We found this mercado quite good, living up to other reviews on TripAdvisor.  We were looking for talvera pieces we could actually use in our home, and the location had what we were looking to buy.

471395331.name: Great place to get souvenirs and a local ice cream
471395331.author: a TripAdvisor user
471395331.reviewBody: This outdoor market had tens of shops selling excellent Mexican style clothes, handicrafts and souvenirs. The shop owners were friendly and very accommodating and were never pushy. Some good bargains to be got here though most prices are fairly fixed.It was also never too crowded so very comfortable to walk around. Try the local ice cream which included a mezcal flavor too!

467935573.name: Can you say kitsch?
467935573.author: a TripAdvisor user
467935573.reviewBody: Since I live in Southern California, I\'ve seen these types of markets in Tijuana and Olvera Street in L.A.  Walking the aisles reminded me of them but with much more in the way of Talavera offerings since this is the city renowned for this particular ceramic style.  Good spot to get those quick easy items to take back to family.

464499554.name: Nice market on the edge of the old city center
464499554.author: a TripAdvisor user
464499554.reviewBody: A nice place to walk around. Lots of handmade crafts and paintings for sale. Also nearly every stand or shop sells local sweets!

463827631.name: Cute market, lot of variety
463827631.author: a TripAdvisor user
463827631.reviewBody: Very nice market, picked up some Talavera style tiles here. A great place for anyone shopping for some decent souvenirs.

459312562.name: napoli
459312562.author: a TripAdvisor user
459312562.reviewBody: great place to buy talavera! careful with cheap versions. bartering is okay but not always,depends on the store. nice museum near there.

453483062.name: Just a few blocks from the zocalo.
453483062.author: a TripAdvisor user
453483062.reviewBody: Mercado el Parain is a nice little market just a few blocks from the zocalo.  A lot of typical tourist souvenir items with perhaps a bit of authentic art and craft items.  The restaurants are pretty good and are priced more reasonable than those around the zocalo.

449193625.name: Ok market not outrageously great prices
449193625.author: a TripAdvisor user
449193625.reviewBody: It doesn\'t seem like they like to negotiate too much. Prices are decent but about average when compared to other markets. Would recommend checking it out, they have tons of stuff.

447789350.name: Not the place to go for quality
447789350.author: a TripAdvisor user
447789350.reviewBody: This market is full of different crafts and traditional candy. If you are looking for a cheap souvenirs you will find many options here. However, if you are looking to buy high quality and real traditional pieces, I recommend you go directly to the ceramic workshops. The pieces here are colorful but doesnt compare to the real ones, which are also a bit more expensive

443192088.name: Good for kitschy, touristy items
443192088.author: a TripAdvisor user
443192088.reviewBody: I was here on the weekend and then again during the week. I was just passing through on both occasions and the experiences were vastly different. I would recommend avoiding this area on the weekend when it is miserably crowded if a weekday is an option. The items that were for sale were kitschy and touristy. I bought a magnet and wasn\'t surprised when I saw the same magnet a few booths away.

437058611.name: Interesting but cheap products
437058611.author: a TripAdvisor user
437058611.reviewBody: This is a nice place to walk around, but don\'t go here if you are looking to buy high quality crafts. As it happens, this targets mostly to tourist and it has sadly loss a bit of its charm. Since it is right in the city center it is a fun space to walk around

435902500.name: Fantastic shopping place in the city of Puebla
435902500.author: a TripAdvisor user
435902500.reviewBody: I was on the city of Puebla from 6th to 14th October  2016.\nI spent one evening loitering along Mercado ei Parian. Its location very near to Zocalo is also pergect setting. The Art Galleries, wood carvings, embroidered clothings and local pieces of artistic including talavera are great.The rows of stalls along the strets were found to be cheap and affordable compared to shops. I found it best place to purchase talavera small an beautiful souvenirs for gifts for family and friends. The market is in its full glory in the zfternoon on holidays? Although it is small but it justifies small js beautiful. I find this place particularly stalls cheapest in Puebla.

435735858.name: Fun place for finding handmade Puebla Handcrafts.
435735858.author: a TripAdvisor user
435735858.reviewBody: Had a fun walk around this Mercado, there are Art gallery\'s and \nlittle shops with wood carvings, embroidered clothing, and all kinds of funny typical day of the dead sculptures , candy and talavera ceramics.

435475612.name: Necesitas shopping?
435475612.author: a TripAdvisor user
435475612.reviewBody: Nice tourist place EVERYTHING you could imagine (Mexican) for sale. A great place to spend a few hours

431859811.name: Visiting Puebla and need some gifts to take back?
431859811.author: a TripAdvisor user
431859811.reviewBody:
This is the place!

Why bother with chain stores?  Mercado el Parian is all about the local merchants and artisanry!  Can you say talavera!?

It's about a block of nothing but local merchants selling their stuff.  Some very cool and unique - some very typical and generic but it's all crazy cheap!  Seriously, you can bargain but the stuff is so economically priced that you're getting a great deal regardless.

You'll be in the 'centro' (downtown) so be ready to deal with lots of people and lots of traffic!

Go for the experience - walk away with a great deal!

427896768.name: Tourist Market
427896768.author: a TripAdvisor user
427896768.reviewBody: Colorful rows of multiple product repeats for tourists wanting to experience an outdoor stroll among several rows of stalls - densely packed  in four to six out-of-door rows.  Indoor shops with more expensive lines of goods add to the variety of choices.  Recommended to be coupled with a stroll from the zocalo up 6 Oriente, famed candy shop st.

425348885.name: A beautiful Market
425348885.author: a TripAdvisor user
425348885.reviewBody: I love this market, I felt safe, enjoyed the beautiful hand made goods. I bought all my souvenirs there, the small skulls are beautiful and colorful, the talavera small gifts are perfect for everyone and they look so pretty in our house. Is a must.

424812430.name: A nice local market
424812430.author: a TripAdvisor user
424812430.reviewBody: This is a nice local market. Go on Saturday, but not before 11 AM, since it gets going late. I wouldn\'t say there is much to buy.

423530941.name: One stop for your local craft shopping!
423530941.author: a TripAdvisor user
423530941.reviewBody: It\'s a fun place to visit. It\'s small but you can find any craft that you are looking for from the area. Nice selection of talavera. Personally i find big markets too overwhelming... this is just right size. Good for an afternoon stroll.

422503174.name: Excellent collection of traditional goods.
422503174.author: a TripAdvisor user
422503174.reviewBody: A small area with a number of small stalls selling local traditional Mexican goods. Barter with the owners for a good price, they will negotiate. Worth a visit. Larger shops around the area also selling similar goods. Look at all the stalls before you buy ... lots to choose from.

421507798.name: lots of goodies
421507798.author: a TripAdvisor user
421507798.reviewBody: It is really a pleasure to see and buy in this place all they have is really nice they have items for the home.

419540540.name: Typical tourist stuff, but definitely a great souvenir market with plenty of variety.
419540540.author: a TripAdvisor user
419540540.reviewBody: So... it\'s a tourist thing and you won\'t find things that aren\'t considered "typical" for a tourist to buy, but you can definitely find a lot of interesting things and here\'s the catch: Puebla is where all that stuff is made, so you won\'t find it cheaper in any other city--go ahead and load up on ceramics, weaving and other crafts for a reasonably decent price--just make sure you have room to carry things later! And definitely price-hunt before buying.

417739744.name: I found this area to be small, and not very interesting.
417739744.author: a TripAdvisor user
417739744.reviewBody: I really looked forward to visiting Parian but found it very small and all the shops repeticious.  I did purchase a beautiful certified Puebla talevera plate and am very happy with it, but had to spend 300 pesos to get something that was really  nice.  The quality of the work in most of the shops is nice, but I had other expectations.  I was hoping for some woodworking and other items outside of Talevera.  There was a couple of clothing shops, but they too seemed to purchase thier things from the same factory.

414325352.name: Full of tourist souvenirs
414325352.author: a TripAdvisor user
414325352.reviewBody: A good place to go if you need to pick up some affordable souvenirs. Bright and cheerful and felt very safe.

413318458.name: Beautiful and affordable
413318458.author: a TripAdvisor user
413318458.reviewBody: the items they sell are very nice, the people are friendly you can even bargain some of the items you purchase, great place to buy souvenirs.

404170396.name: As Expected.
404170396.author: a TripAdvisor user
404170396.reviewBody: The location is great. Don\'t miss the Alley of the Frogs, and the artists alley close by. The souvenirs are localised, and the venders weren\'t trying to rip me off... but wouldn\'t come down much.

403379857.name: Mexican "artesanias"
403379857.author: a TripAdvisor user
403379857.reviewBody: If you\'re into Mexican artesanias (crafts, handicrafts) this is the place. El Parian certainly offers the best place to shop for authentic, handmade artifacts. There are many shops to pick from which offers the opportunity to haggle for better deals. \nAlso, a great place to find amazing talavera pieces.

400559945.name: Souvenirs and handcrafts - a must see
400559945.author: a TripAdvisor user
400559945.reviewBody: El Parian is an open air market made up of stalls selling handcrafts and souvenirs: made-to-measure Mariachi suits, embroidered tops, sombreros, Frida Kahlo tee shirts and magnets, lots of distinctive Talavera pottery from Puebla, Mexican wrestler masks, sarapes and cobijos (shawls and blankets) Rompope (an eggnog-like alcoholic drink traditionally made in convent of Santa Clara), camotes (traditional sweets from Puebla made from the tubers of a potato-like plant). Well worth a visit to try out your bargaining skills. Lots to see and buy.

398218487.name: Not the deal I was looking for
398218487.author: a TripAdvisor user
398218487.reviewBody: Merchants were rude and did not seem interested on selling their goods. Prices were the same or more expensive than in other stores. I enjoyed looking at the local stuff but was not impressed by the vendors.

394790115.name: Lovers of Market Shopping, this is for you!!
394790115.author: a TripAdvisor user
394790115.reviewBody: I love shopping in local markets and this was no different, we picked up a lot of locally made items including wonderful scarfs and blouses made by and sold by the locals. Note: one girl at a shop selling scarfs/Pashmina\'s when asked if I could see one, just threw it at me without even moving from her sitting,  elbow on her knee stance....so I told her, guess you aren\'t interested in selling anything and walked away and purchased something from several other vendors who were very attentive and helpful, people are people all around the world...I don\'t put up with rudeness but don\'t let one spoil your adventure......   of course we also picked up some great jewelry here .....and more local candies!!  Will come again, loved Puebla!

388865294.name: Good Place for Typical Touristy Souveniers
388865294.author: a TripAdvisor user
388865294.reviewBody: Great assortment of shops selling all kinds of suveniers and local goods. You can find local candies, liquors, toys and many other interesting article stop take back home.  Tequila shot glasses, ashtrays, etc.

387338648.name: Good for souvenirs
387338648.author: a TripAdvisor user
387338648.reviewBody: Not a huge market but it does have all the souvenirs you could want from Puebla.  It definitely wasn\'t cheap but I was still able to bargain and get good deals so I wasn\'t disappointed!

382690726.name: Same stuff, but still fun!
382690726.author: a TripAdvisor user
382690726.reviewBody: Everybody sells the same stuff, but it\u00b4s fun to stroll the market. Be sure to do some market research as we finally bought some backpacks for 70 pesos, while somewhere else you had to pay 150 for the same ones.

380878525.name: Abundant over-priced souvenirs
380878525.author: a TripAdvisor user
380878525.reviewBody: It\'s touted as a crafts market, but it\'s really for souvenirs.  You can find anything you\'re looking for in the way of souvenirs here. The Talavera tile refrigerator magnets I bought were 15 pesos here but only 10 pesos at the Los Sapos flea market.

369665416.name: Tourist trap
369665416.author: a TripAdvisor user
369665416.reviewBody: Good place to get souvenirs, great variety of local made stuff...it is a good idea to bargain for lowe prices, prices start to go down after you start negotiating.....good place overall....

368569366.name: Good for souvenirs
368569366.author: a TripAdvisor user
368569366.reviewBody: I bought most of the souvenirs from here. A lot of backpacks, purses, key chains, clothing, mugs, ceramic works to choose from. Just go from booth to booth though some booths sell the same things but cheaper. Candy though I would recommend going to Calle 6 oriente y 5 de Mayo. A lot more candy to choose from and cheaper than the market. Overall very friendly people willing to bargain.

364664656.name: Great place for souvenirs
364664656.author: a TripAdvisor user
364664656.reviewBody: Went here several times to pick up some souvenirs at a discount.  Bought a HUGE heavy (queen size) wool handwoven blanket for 600 pesos.  Good thing I packed light.  Lots of textiles and "talavera" being sold here for very reasonable prices.  Although if you want authentic talavera I\'d head a few blocks further and visit the Talavera de la Luz factory.

363186067.name: Normal tourist shopping
363186067.author: a TripAdvisor user
363186067.reviewBody: This area is good for souvenirs and local pottery.  It gets crowded and there is a lot of traffic but you can find parking nearby. Don\'t buy at the first shop you come to because most of the shops have similar things with varying prices. Talavera is there but so are many knock offs. If you just like the style of the pottery and don\'t care about the name you can get tons of it here.

362493784.name: A Little Bit of Puebla
362493784.author: a TripAdvisor user
362493784.reviewBody: Although shopping for souvenirs arguably shouldn\'t be high on your to-do list in Puebla, El Parian can satisfy this itch. Small & quaint though it is, nearby touristy shops can extend the visit.

360525838.name: perfect for souvernirs and gifts!
360525838.author: a TripAdvisor user
360525838.reviewBody: a traditional souvernir market where you can find almost every souvernir from puebla and many others of different parts of mexico: traditional candies (try cocada or the delicious bolitas de pi\u00f1on.) the last ons are delicious; also some clothing, hand made crafts, etc. is not far from the zocalo (main square of downtown)\n\nfor more travel information about several world destinations look for my facebook site as marco rof fotografia

358609915.name: Fantastic Place
358609915.author: a TripAdvisor user
358609915.reviewBody: Very original market, with places for seating along the stores, the stores are very nice, tide, and the prices are good, you can find art from al sides of Mexico..

357624000.name: Tourist things
357624000.author: a TripAdvisor user
357624000.reviewBody: This street was mainly filled with tourist products many of which say Puebla on them. The people are nice and not pushy about selling their wears which I like. It makes for a nice stroll.

355468831.name: Good for a stroll-through
355468831.author: a TripAdvisor user
355468831.reviewBody: This is a small market with lots of tourist items. It was fun to walk through the market and enjoy the colors and bustle. this is a great place for small gifts to take home. Puebla is the true heart of the talavera industry and there are many excellent talavera stores around the market. But if you are looking for truly beautiful talavera, the museum and fabrica are your best bet.

350408660.name: Looking Tired
350408660.author: a TripAdvisor user
350408660.reviewBody: Our third visit to the market and our impression is it is showing its age and could do with some refurbishing.  There were more vacant shops this visit and most open ones sell the same items.  Still worth it for a first time visitor for its historic value.  Yes its for tourists.\n\nEl Parian was the old square of San Roque built in 1805, remodelled in 1961 and is considered the cities first craft market.

348591820.name: Shopping area of Puebla.
348591820.author: a TripAdvisor user
348591820.reviewBody: I think this was the main shopping are of Puebla for traditional handicrafts. Though, it\'s not very big, good values can be found. I bought a 2.5 gallon water jug for $250 pesos where the same thing is being sold in Mexico City for $500 pesos at least.

347956271.name: Smaller than expected
347956271.author: a TripAdvisor user
347956271.reviewBody: Compared to craft markets in other Mexican cities, this was a disappointment.  There were too many souvenir items and not enough craft.  The best shops sold Talavera pottery; a lot of repetition among them, so know what you want and compare.

346145822.name: Craft market
346145822.author: a TripAdvisor user
346145822.reviewBody: This is a good option for purchasing local arts and crafts. You may need some time to look on all the available options. Prices are very reasonable and also you may bargain. Although you can find a huge variety of things this is not the place for the high-end crafts that is available through speciality stores. Fun place to visit and take something home.

345926203.name: SO SO BUT TALAVERA IS NICE
345926203.author: a TripAdvisor user
345926203.reviewBody: The setting is nice. The market is so so except for the Talavera which is beautiful. Don\'t waste your time on embroidered blouses or other trinkets, you can find much nicer ones in other parts of Mexico. As other travelers said, the prices are not good (compared to other markets) and except for the Pottery (Talavera) there was nothing exceptional about the wares offered.  Take a stroll through it though and check it out.

341311221.name: Tourist prices...
341311221.author: a TripAdvisor user
341311221.reviewBody: If you want something crafted  traditionaly from Puebla go and see how talavera is made.  The prices in El Parian are for tourists but if you really liked something just bargain.

339615007.name: hand crafts and moore
339615007.author: a TripAdvisor user
339615007.reviewBody: you can find a lor of mexican hand crafts in this placen its nos expensive and also you can find mexican food

338157294.name: Make sure to barter
338157294.author: a TripAdvisor user
338157294.reviewBody: Great location to pick up things with more cultural significance. All prices are not set so make sure to haggle with prices. There are a lot of interesting things to pick up here.

337576613.name: CHEAP STUFF
337576613.author: a TripAdvisor user
337576613.reviewBody: Our visit to El Parian was disappointng because of the low quality handcrafts that are offered. The variety is large though: textiles, ceramics, leather, etc., but on the low proce and quality segment.

331301530.name: El Parian in Puebla, an oasis for shoppers
331301530.author: a TripAdvisor user
331301530.reviewBody: Great place to sit and watch people, weekends are full of art and fun people.  Lots of booths on the weekend, with homemade keep sakes.

325988419.name: Nice souvenir market
325988419.author: a TripAdvisor user
325988419.reviewBody: You can find all kinds of souvenirs there from paintings to talavera poblana of very good quality. I spent a half of the day in this marvelous market and i enjoyed a lot. It was not easy to decide whta to buy.

325818068.name: Disappointing!
325818068.author: a TripAdvisor user
325818068.reviewBody: We were on a day tour and were taken here for shopping. We found the prices to be 2-3 times more expensive then other markets. The vendors didn\'t seem interested in business and when we asked them to see something that was on a top shelf, they rolled their eyes. So we left! Many items were labelled as being "Talavera" but they were cheap copies. Not impressed with these markets.

318707863.name: Good souvenir shopping
318707863.author: a TripAdvisor user
318707863.reviewBody: Good place to shop some souvenirs and tipical mexican handycraft. Need to compare between stands to achieve best quality/price.

317786905.name: Nice market
317786905.author: a TripAdvisor user
317786905.reviewBody: This is a nice little market. Had plenty of vendors with high quality talivera. Had a great time walking around this market. The only problem is the vendors do very little bargaining.

313560126.name: Too touristy with prices far too high for what is on sale ... better arts markets in the Poblano countryside!
313560126.author: a TripAdvisor user
313560126.reviewBody: Too touristy with prices far too high for what is on sale ... better arts markets in the Poblano countryside!

312658590.name: Look but don\'t buy!!
312658590.author: a TripAdvisor user
312658590.reviewBody: TYhe advice here is the same I give for any other tourist market selling souvenirs around the world: look but don\'t buy. The reason is simple: prices are 2 or even 3 times higher than in the same stores in less populated alleys just around the corner. So I suggest you see here the kind of souvenirs you wanan buy but then you look for stores in nearby markets that are not along the typical tourist tracks of the city. Just ask residents and they\'ll tell you haw to get to the nearby marked that opens several days a week just beyond the avenida 5 de mayo, where you csan find the same stuff for 70% less.

310747001.name: Mexican art everywhere!
310747001.author: a TripAdvisor user
310747001.reviewBody: As soon as you walk, you feel so Mexican because of all the good stuff you see, you just want to buy everything either to wear, give, or just collect. \nAt night you can find women selling "esquites", "elotes", "atole", and "tamales".  Soooo gooooood!

305523477.name: Decent local standard fair
305523477.author: a TripAdvisor user
305523477.reviewBody: Be sure to comparisoion shop. Go up the street towrard the acrual stores and tell tyem what you eant and they will find it for you and give you a discount if your bargain or buy more than one piece. Got a lovely talvera mirror!

302880987.name: Bargain and buy
302880987.author: a TripAdvisor user
302880987.reviewBody: Some great  handicrafts are to be had from this small but lively market. Negotiate a good price and the buyer and seller will both be happy.

298501910.name: nice place to visit and do some typical artefacts shopping
298501910.author: a TripAdvisor user
298501910.reviewBody: this place is the typical art crafts made in this state , and also you can take a look to the barrio del artista wich is a place to ssee a lot of good paints and art

295426155.name: AMAZING, but do your research about the actual prices
295426155.author: a TripAdvisor user
295426155.reviewBody: I\'m from Mexico, so I know what kind of prices to expect when it comes to materials.\nIt\'s beautiful and most of it is hand made in Mexico, so we were willing to spend some good amount of money in Talavera and other items. However, I asked for the price of 1 item in two of the shops and the prices were incredibly different, whilst the materials were the same and the quality of the work was really similar. Then they came to say that the tiny little bit of silver was the reason why it was expensive, because Silver "is so expensive" I mean... Taxco isn\'t far away, and I\'ve bought silver artworks in other places in Mexico, and I\'m pretty sure it isn\'t.. Do your research with a local person if possible :)

291289354.name: Nice and small
291289354.author: a TripAdvisor user
291289354.reviewBody: It is a very small mercado and all the shops offer the same products. But it\'s located close to Zocalo/ centro and it\'s a nice walk to explore the area.\n

290740257.name: Typical Artesania Market
290740257.author: a TripAdvisor user
290740257.reviewBody: An average artesania market. The problem with these places is that basically everyone sells the same stuff, and the stuff is not of great quality. Pretty good for cheap souvenirs, not a great place for typical artesania - that is, handmade quality crafts made by locals. Worth checking out, though, for suitcase-stuffers.

288944531.name: Tourist trap
288944531.author: a TripAdvisor user
288944531.reviewBody: While this souvenir shopping area is quite central, clean and organized, it offered little other than convention Mexican  knickknacks.  FIne it that`s what you want, but you`re not likely to find anything unusual or any high-quality local artesania here

288357863.name: Mercado of negotiations.
288357863.author: a TripAdvisor user
288357863.reviewBody: I love mercados.  Be careful in this market,  Almost everyone has the same thing.  Dont buy at the first market but ask several for the price of the \u00edtem you want then buy it from the cheapest.  You wont like to find the same thing that you bought cheaper.  And everything is negotiable.

286458655.name: Market visit
286458655.author: a TripAdvisor user
286458655.reviewBody: Lovely artisan market for tile and gifts for home. Very easy to navigate and vendors are not aggressive.

284384181.name: Definitely for the tourist
284384181.author: a TripAdvisor user
284384181.reviewBody: But there is much to see and for those looking for souveniers or a small remembrance to take home, this is a good source and was very close to our hotel.

282454520.name: handicraft market
282454520.author: a TripAdvisor user
282454520.reviewBody: nothing  special , market stalls with the same handicrafts you find everywhere \nwe thought that the TALAVERAS stores in the streets around were much more interesting

280380845.name: Nice market with the usual stuff
280380845.author: a TripAdvisor user
280380845.reviewBody: Pleasant market conveniently located.  A lot of tourist junk, but if you take some time a dig a bit, there are treasures to be found.  Also check out the talavera dealers in the surrounding shops

279604065.name: Last minute souvenir HELP
279604065.author: a TripAdvisor user
279604065.reviewBody: I like the part to challenge myself to see which store gives me the best deal by bargaining. (I am sorry, store-owners!\ud83d\ude01). Most of stores carry similar items, for souvenirs.  A little tourist trap, but if you are visiting to Puebla, you should go. (Watch your bag, though)

277835058.name: Great food and souvenirs.
277835058.author: a TripAdvisor user
277835058.reviewBody: Around the market there are famous small hole-in-the-wall restaurants with fantastic food. The best mole poblano in the world. Try everything!\nAlso, there are cheap and great quality souvenirs, including alebrijes.  Puebla is the capital of talavera, the quality and selection of it is the best in Mexico.

270486856.name: Great finds for souvenirs!
270486856.author: a TripAdvisor user
270486856.reviewBody: Take time to walk around, haggle for prices, then decide to buy. There are also small cafes nearby where you can get a taste of local Mexican foods.

267706818.name: An Excelent Way to Spen an Afternoon!
267706818.author: a TripAdvisor user
267706818.reviewBody: I have been visiting El Parian for years. There are many unique little stalls selling absoutely beautiful Mexican handiworks. On your next trip to Puebla --- spend a few hours here browsing, you\'ll not be sorry you did!!!

267175495.name: Mexican and Puebla\'s crafts
267175495.author: a TripAdvisor user
267175495.reviewBody: It\'s not a very big area, but is full of  small business where you can find a lot of crafts and souvenirs mainly from Puebla, but also of Mexico.\nI can tell you that the Talavera is one of the typical clay hand made artifacts where you can get of course not paying the price they ask at the first time you have to ask for less and you can get it.

257017587.name: Good Tourist Market
257017587.author: a TripAdvisor user
257017587.reviewBody: Be careful with the prices... I recommend that once you see something you like don\'t buy it on the first place, walk away and as you are walking away they will give you the lowest price and now you know if you want to pay that or not.

256036973.name: Lovely market in a beautiful setting
256036973.author: a TripAdvisor user
256036973.reviewBody: Two rows of shops lining a pretty square. Bargain hard. Everything should be at least 50 percent off the quoted price.

253396723.name: All; the Mexican shops you\'ve ever wanted to see >
253396723.author: a TripAdvisor user
253396723.reviewBody: Shop after shop in one small area .Look for the REAL talavera tile ,etc great stuff . A lot of kitch but worth the look see for the occasional treasure

244366831.name: lovely market
244366831.author: a TripAdvisor user
244366831.reviewBody: it may not be a very large market but its like a maze where you see shop upon shop of artifacts clothes vegetables fruit clothes and what have you. easy to get lost unless you have a very good sense of direction or a guide with you. bargain hard.

240283341.name: Mexican  artesanial handcraft
240283341.author: a TripAdvisor user
240283341.reviewBody: Offering a great choice of ceramics, textile works, onyx and more as souvenirs from Puebla. Each store more or less offering the same, but to get the real quality you have to take your time. Don\u00b4t pay the price they ask for at first, you are able to get some really nice discounts.

240205459.name: Charming
240205459.author: a TripAdvisor user
240205459.reviewBody: Loveable and cute place for souvenir and artesania shopping. Stalls full with anything you like typical from Puebla. People are very charming and helpful! Don\'t forget to buy you hand made blouse girls!

239132258.name: Lots and lots of pots
239132258.author: a TripAdvisor user
239132258.reviewBody: We were overwhelmed by the display of Talavera ceramics, boxes of camotes, and striped textile work. It was good fun at first and we saw lots of lovely things at prices much lower than you\'d ever see in England. But we were overwhelmed by the choice and each stall sold basically the same thing as the one before.

230649382.name: A small but nice market
230649382.author: a TripAdvisor user
230649382.reviewBody: The many small but packed shops offer a great selection of souvenirs from the Puebla area. Worth taking a 5-10 min walk from the Zocola to have a look.

225996094.name: Complex of Small Shops
225996094.author: a TripAdvisor user
225996094.reviewBody: Based upon our experiences, one has to be patient and selective when it comes to quality as there is a fair amount of inferior merchandise.  But treasures are there to be found!

220942310.name: A small but cute handy craft market mainly centered on Puebla pottery known as talavera.
220942310.author: a TripAdvisor user
220942310.reviewBody: The market is small and really only well stocked on talavera pottery but it is traditional and fun within easy walking distance fro the center

214327886.name: Fun but low quality
214327886.author: a TripAdvisor user
214327886.reviewBody: It was fun to browse through this open-air market, but the items here were very low quality. I found much nicer pieces of talavera for comprable prices near the museo de arte religiosa and Santa Clara Church.

212936784.name: Good and cheap, but be ready to hassle.
212936784.author: a TripAdvisor user
212936784.reviewBody: Great finds if you are patient and don\'t rush into buying everything from the first vendor you see. Look around and you will find a good deal for sure.

202601035.name: Need a tourist soyvenir?
202601035.author: a TripAdvisor user
202601035.reviewBody: While this could be just what you are looking for, it was not my cup of tea. Outdoor market stalls, many purveying similar merchandise, are aimed unapologetically at the tourists.

198986291.name: souvenirs
198986291.author: a TripAdvisor user
198986291.reviewBody: Souvenir haven, most of the souvenirs you can find elsewhere in Puebla. Nothing special however its a nice place to shop if you are in the market for souvenirs.

197546916.name: Fabulous Talavera
197546916.author: a TripAdvisor user
197546916.reviewBody: We so enjoyed visiting this area in Puebla.  I love Talavera, so it was a real treat for me.  Bought a few small pieces to bring home!

193349918.name: Good shopping experience
193349918.author: a TripAdvisor user
193349918.reviewBody: Nice handicrafts and clothing articles.  Lot of variety and very affordable. There are also nice cafes and restaurants in the area.

190986240.name: Nothing Special
190986240.author: a TripAdvisor user
190986240.reviewBody: Having traveled in many parts of Mexico this market sells mass produced items that are either copies or purely made for the tourist trade. If you are looking for a cheap souvenir then this may be the place to go, but otherwise if you\'ve been to other more authentic markets in smaller towns or villages, you might prefer to take a pass.

186707368.name: Touristy, but fun!
186707368.author: a TripAdvisor user
186707368.reviewBody: I generally don\'t like to hit the touristy places. I\'m the type of traveler who much prefers to immerse myself in the culture of where I\u2019m visiting by hanging out with the locals, eating the food they eat in the way that they prepare it, instead of in the uninspiring version tailored to finicky tourist\u2019s taste buds. I like to visit the places the locals hang out, to see how they spend their off time, instead of joining a bunch of other tourists being herded to the \u201ctourist trap\u201d shopping venues where the prices are jacked up ten-fold in contrast to the off-the-beaten-path venues. However, having said that\u2026 if you go to Parian in Puebla, you really can get a taste of the culture and food, since the locals seem to like to hang out there, too! The food really is authentic; and if you feel the prices are too high, just move down a couple of blocks. In addition, the local scene is not far away. Only a few blocks away is Los Sapos, where\u2014 yes, I admit, is a tourist trap during the day\u2014 but at night, the place is ALIVE and hopping with the locals at all the bars along the Los Sapos strip (which are closed during the day, but all open at night). I know, because I used to live in Puebla and dated a young Poblano. And this was one of our favorite places to hang out on a Friday or Saturday night. Get ready to let your hair down and dance and go crazy! (Just be careful with your valuables. Better not to bring them!)

175601275.name: Ceramica talavera
175601275.author: a TripAdvisor user
175601275.reviewBody: Very nice place to buy the typical ceramica talavera. This is a very special tupe of clay where the people from Puebla build eveything you can imagine. They are beatiful and rare and worth the cost.

161325719.name: best place to buy handcraft items.
161325719.author: a TripAdvisor user
161325719.reviewBody: whenever I visit Puebla this is one of the must place to visit b/c it offers items that are from all over Mexico at reasonable prices. Don\'t ever settle on the first price given and do shop around before settle on buying. Some items look like a typical souvenir items but if you do looking around you can find a hidden gem at great price!

160475771.name: Parian flea market
160475771.author: a TripAdvisor user
